English: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,
Kanjobal: Ayin ton Pablo in, awtebil in oc chekbejok Cristo Jesús, yujtol axca tu' max el yin c'ul Dios. Ajun juẍtak Sóstenes wetok,

English: To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be holy, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ–their Lord and ours:
Kanjobal: cax chi co tz'ibentok jun carta ti' ayex, ex yiglesiaxa Dios bay conob Corinto. Yet exxa Dios, yujtol ayexxa oc yin Cristo Jesús. A Dios awtenej ex oc yetok, jun lajan e yawtelay oc yetok jantak eb tzanc'al baytal chi yal ba bay Cham Jajawil Jesucristo, Cham tol Yajawil c'apax eb jetok.

English: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Tx'oxokabc'al co Mam Dios, c'al Cham Jajawil Jesucristo watx'c'ulalil, c'al junc'ulalil ayex bay tu'.

English: I always thank God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al tiempo chi wal yuj diosalil bay Dios e yuj, yujtol tx'oxbilxa is watx'c'ulal ayex yuj Cristo Jesús.

English: For in him you have been enriched in every way–in all your speaking and in all your knowledge–
Kanjobal: Xiwilxa is watx'c'ulal Dios mayal tx'ox ayex yin Cristo. Yuj tu', tz'akan max yak' e yalil is k'anej; yetok c'apaxok, tz'akan max yun yak'on nachaj el e yuj.

English: because our testimony about Christ was confirmed in you.
Kanjobal: Xan a yin e beybal chi txecloj elok, tol yel a k'anej Cristo chi jalilok.

English: Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed.
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, lanan e makon jay c'ual is jayubal Cham Jajawil Jesucristo. C'am junok sabal Dios chi yak' palta ayex tinani'.

English: He will keep you strong to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Ok yak'c'al Jesucristo tec'anil e nabal, masantac'al ok yal jay jun lajub c'ual tu', yet watx' c'am jabok tzet yin bay moj e tzulay yet ok jay Cham.

English: God, who has called you into fellowship with his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, is faithful.
Kanjobal: A Dios chic'al yun masanil tzet chi yala'. A Cham max on awten oc yetok, yet watx' ay jalon jet yetok Cham is C'ajol, a ton Cham Jajawil Jesucristo.

English: I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another so that there may be no divisions among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind and thought.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chin tewi ayex, axcaokab tol a Cham Jajawil Jesucristo chi tewi ayex, junxanejokab che yut e nabal e masanil bay tu'. Man comonok che pojil e ba xol eb juẍtak, eb janab bay tu', palta tol axcaokab junxanej animail che yut e ba, c'al e nabal; cax jun lajanokab chaon e c'ul masanil tzetak yetal.

English: My brothers, some from Chloe's household have informed me that there are quarrels among you.
Kanjobal: Chi waltok juntzan ti' ayex ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, yujtol max wab e k'umal yuj eb is familia Cloé, tolab lanan pitzc'oj aj owal e xol bay tu'.

English: What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas ”; still another, “I follow Christ.”
Kanjobal: Tx'ok tx'okxac'al e k'anjab junjun ex chi wabtok. Ilab tol ay ex lananxa e yalon aj axca ti': Ayin ti' yet in Pablo, quex chi. Ay ex xin: Ayin ti' yet in Apolos, quex chi. Ay ex pax xin: Ayin ti' yet in Pedro, quex chi. Ay ex xin: Ayin ti' yet in Cristo, quex chi.

English: Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized into the name of Paul?
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tom pojquiẍtak yayji Cristo che na'? ¿Ma ayin max in cam yin curus e yuj che na'? Tokwal c'apax yin in bi ayin Pablo in ti', max ex ak'lay bautizar.

English: I am thankful that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,
Kanjobal: Yuj wal dios, yujtol man xiwilok ex max ex wak' bautizar bay tu', ti' asannej juẍtak Crispo yetok juẍtak Gayo max wak' bautizar.

English: so no one can say that you were baptized into my name.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, c'am chi je' e yaloni, tol yin in bi ak'bil excan bautizar.

English: (Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don't remember if I baptized anyone else.)
Kanjobal: A… toch'okta' tol wak'nak c'apaxcan bautizar Estéfanas yetokc'al eb cajan yetok. Asan eb tu' bian; c'amxa junokxa ak'bil bautizar wuj chi wut in naontok.

English: For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel–not with words of human wisdom, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.
Kanjobal: Manwalnak ak'oj bautizar tu' wopiso yuj Cristo, palta a aloj el k'anejal yet colbanilej. Manak yetok k'anejal jelanilal walnak jun abix tu', yet watx' aokab camichal Cristo yin curus miman yelapnok yul sat eb chi abxalwi tu'.

English: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
Kanjobal: A yabixal camichal Cristo yin te curus, c'am yelapnok yul sat eb anima chi c'ayic'ok. A pax yul co sat ayon lanan co colchaj ti', yipalil Dios yayji yabixal tu'.

English: For it is written: “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise; the intelligence of the intelligent I will frustrate.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi yal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': A is jelanil eb jelan, ok wak' c'ayajok, c'al yetok is yaj nabalil eb aj nabal, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Where is the wise man? Where is the scholar? Where is the philosopher of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, tok ay jabok yopiso eb jelan, yetok eb meẍtol. C'am c'apax yopiso eb jelan yin teyelejbail. Tx'oxnakxa Dios tol a jelanil yulyibank'inal ti', c'am jabok yelapnok.

English: For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.
Kanjobal: Yuj jelanil Dios xan max el yin is c'ul, tol c'am chi ojtaknelay el Cham yuj eb yet yulyibank'inal ti' yuj is jelanil eb. Palta max el yin c'ul Cham tol ayon chi jaoc Cham yin co c'ul, chon colchaj yuj jun k'anejal yet colbanilej, tol c'am yelapnok yul sat anima tu'.

English: Jews demand miraculous signs and Greeks look for wisdom,
Kanjobal: A eb wet israelal, chi yochej eb chi yil is milagro Dios. A pax eb griego xin, a jelanilal chi yochej eb.

English: but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,
Kanjobal: Axa ayon xin, a yabixal is camichal Cristo yin te curus chi jalilok. A eb wet conob tu', yob yali chi yab eb. Ac'ala' c'apax eb man israelok, c'am yelapnok jun abix ti' yul sat eb.

English: but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
Kanjobal: Palta a yul co sat mac on awtebil onxa yuj Dios ti xin, caxc'al israel on, ma maon israelok, jojtak, tol ayoc yipalil c'al jelanil Dios yin Cristo.

English: For the foolishness of God is wiser than man's wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than man's strength.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max yak' Dios cam Cristo yin curus, xan axca tol c'am nabal Dios naon anima. Palta a yin camichal tu' max tx'oxk'abnej el Cham, tol ec'ban jelanil Cham yintak jelanil eb anima. Ac'ala' chi naon eb tol c'am yipal Dios, palta max tx'ox Dios tol ec'ban yipal yiban yipalil anima.

English: Brothers, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, yowalil chi nachaj el juj, tzetbil jayji mac on awtebil on yuj Dios. Yujtol jaywannej eb jelan yul sat anima chi yawtej oc Dios yetok, jaywannej eb yajaw, jaywannej mac miman yelapnok max yawtej oc Dios yetok.

English: But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb c'am nabal yul sat anima yulyibank'inal ti', a eb chi siq'uil Dios, yuj yilay el q'uixwil eb jelan naoni. Yetok eb c'am yelapnok jabok yul sat anima, a eb chi siq'uil Cham yuj yilay el q'uixwil eb miman yelapnok naoni.

English: He chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things–and the things that are not–to nullify the things that are,
Kanjobal: A mac c'am jabok yopiso yul sat anima, c'al mac intaknebil elok, a eb tu' chi siq'uil Dios. Tix ton chi yut tx'oxon el Dios ti', tol a mac miman yelapnok yul sat anima, c'am jabok yelapnok yul sat Cham.

English: so that no one may boast before him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', c'am junok mactxel chi je' maynen ba satak Dios.

English: It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God–that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.
Kanjobal: Palta a wal caw Cham max on junanencan yetok Cristo Jesús, cax max yak'on jelanil Cristo co jelanilok. Yuj Cristo xan watx' on yul sat Dios. Yuj c'apaxok, xan max on yioc yetok. Yetok c'apaxok, yuj Cristo xan, colchajnak onxa elok.

English: Therefore, as it is written: “Let him who boasts boast in the Lord.”
Kanjobal: Tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un axca ti': Man yujok tzetbil jayji, xan chi jak' tzalojbok co c'ul; palta chi jak' tzalojbok co c'ul yuj tzetbil yayji Cham Jajawil, ẍi tx'an.

English: For I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers, that our forefathers were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chi wochej che yojtaknej elok, tzet yunnak eb jichmam yet payxa, yet tzakan oc eb yintak Moisés. Masanil eb max beytoj yalan jun asun, cax masanil eb ec'naktok eb nan a' mar.

English: They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea.
Kanjobal: Axca tol ak'bil bautizar eb yuj jun asun tu', yetok yuj a' mar tu'. Axca tol ocnak eb yetok Moisés yet jun tiempoal tu'.

English: They all ate the same spiritual food
Kanjobal: Masanil eb, max lo eb jun loj axca tol yin esalil ak'bil bay eb yuj Dios.

English: and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, masanil eb yuc'nak eb jun a' aej, axca tol yin esalil ak'bil bay eb yuj Dios. Sat ch'en elnaktek a' aej tu'. A jun ch'en tu', a Cristo chi tx'oxtek.

English: Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered over the desert.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al axca tu' yunnak eb, palta ac'ala' xiwil eb man watx'ok yul sat Dios. Yuj tu' xan sakleminak max yuncantok is mimanil eb bay takin tx'otx' bay ec'nak eb tu'.

English: Now these things occurred as examples to keep us from setting our hearts on evil things as they did.
Kanjobal: A tzet jaynak yiban eb tu', co tx'oxbanilok yayji, yet watx' manchak jochej oc tzet man watx'ok, axca yutnak ba eb tu'.

English: Do not be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written: “The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in pagan revelry.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', c'am chi je' jalon co ba bay tzet chi al-lay oc diosal, axca yutnak ba juntzan eb xol eb tu'. A tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, a tx'an chi alontek yabixal eb. Chi yal tx'an axca ti': Max ay chotjab eb, max low eb c'al yuq'uen a' eb. Lajwi tu', max aj bulnaj eb canalwi, c'al yunen eb yobtakil satak is diosal tu', ẍi tx'an Un tu'.

English: We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did–and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died.
Kanjobal: Manchak c'apax on toj yin ajmulal, yujtol axca tu' yutnak ba juntzan eb tu'. Yuj tu' xan junnej c'u max yun camay latz'naj 23,000 eb.

English: We should not test the Lord, as some of them did–and were killed by snakes.
Kanjobal: Manchak jak' porobal Cham Jajawil axca yutnak ba juntzan eb tu'. Yuj tu' xan lajwinak el eb yuj juntzan no labaj.

English: And do not grumble, as some of them did–and were killed by the destroying angel.
Kanjobal: Man comonok chon alxi aj yin Cham Jajawil, axca yutnak ba juntzan eb tu'. Yuj tu' xan lajwinak el eb yuj jun ángel ay yopiso mak'wi cam anima.

English: These things happened to them as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the fulfillment of the ages has come.
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al tzet jaynak yiban eb jichmam tu', co tx'oxbanilok yayji. Tz'ibbilcan yabixal yul tx'an Un, yet watx' chi jojtaknej elok tol ay is may ta chi oc co yobtakil. Yujtol ayon ti', lajub tiempoalxa bay ayon ec'ok.

English: So, if you think you are standing firm, be careful that you don't fall!
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a mac tec'an waay naoni, camokab yak'on cuenta ba, yujtol ay is may chi etax el is nabal.

English: No temptation has seized you except what is common to man. And God is faithful; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, he will also provide a way out so that you can stand up under it.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al porobalil chi jay jiban, lajanc'al yetok porobalil chi jay yiban masanil anima. Palta chic'al yun Dios bay chi yala', man ok on is cha' ak'lay porobal yin junok tzet yetal tol c'am chi techaj juj. A yet chi jay junok porobal tu', a Cham chi colwaji, yin tzetbil chi jut co colon co ba bay, yet watx' chi techaj juj.

English: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin ex in camc'ulnebil, caw che yiel e ba bay junok tzet chi al-lay oc diosal.

English: I speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.
Kanjobal: Chi waltok juntzan ti' ayex tol ayxa e jelanil. Chi cam e naobtanen sic'libil ta yel chi wala'.

English: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ?
Kanjobal: A jun is vaso Dios chi jal yuj diosalil yuj, a chi tx'oxoni, tol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo yujtol jujc'al, xan max el is chiq'uil. Ac'ala' c'apax ixim pan chi pojlay ec' co xol, chi tx'ox c'apax el ixim, tol junxanej ton jayji yetok Cham, yujtol jujc'al, xan max ak'lay cam is mimanil.

English: Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all partake of the one loaf.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al xiwil on, junnej ixim pan tu' chi co lo' co masanil. Yuj tu' xan axca ton jun pan tu', jun ch'an, cayon c'apax tu', yujtol axca tol junxanej mimanil Cristo jayji co masanil.

English: Consider the people of Israel: Do not those who eat the sacrifices participate in the altar?
Kanjobal: Naek jabok wetok tzet chi yut ba eb wet israelal. A eb chi chion tzet chi yak' yin xajanbalil, junxanej yayji oc eb yetok Dios, Cham chi chaon xajanbalej tu'.

English: Do I mean then that a sacrifice offered to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?
Kanjobal: Man lananok waloni tol ay yelapnok tzet chi al-lay oc diosal tu', ac'ala' c'apax tzet chi ak'lay yin xajanbalil tu', man lananok waloni tol ay yelapnok.

English: No, but the sacrifices of pagans are offered to demons, not to God, and I do not want you to be participants with demons.
Kanjobal: Palta tix tzet chi yochej in c'ul chi wal ti'. A yet chi yak'on eb man israelok is xajanbal, manak bay Dios chi yak' eb, palta tol a bay eb espíritu yob chi yak' eb is xajanbal tu'. Chi wochej c'am junok ex che yaoc e ba yetok eb espíritu yob tu'.

English: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you cannot have a part in both the Lord's table and the table of demons.
Kanjobal: C'am chi je' comonc'al chi juc'balnej is vaso Cham Jajawil, ta chi juc'balnej pax is vaso eb espíritu yob tu'. Yetok c'apaxok, c'am chi je' comonc'al chi co lo' ixim pan chi eltek ayon yiban meẍa Cham Jajawil, ta chi co chi' pax tzet chi batxbalay ajtok yiban meẍa yet k'in eb espíritu yob tu'.

English: Are we trying to arouse the Lord's jealousy? Are we stronger than he?
Kanjobal: ¿Ma chi jochej chi jitek yowal c'ul Cham Jajawil jiban? ¿Xin ta yel chi lajoc jipal yintak Cham?

English: “Everything is permissible”–but not everything is beneficial. “Everything is permissible”–but not everything is constructive.
Kanjobal: Tekan ayex che yal axca ti' tinani': Bekan jayji junen masanil tzet yetal, tekan quex chi. Yel toni, palta man mojok junen masanil tzet yetal. Yel ton xin, chi je' junen masanil tzetak yetal, palta man masanilok tzetak yetal tu' chi ak'on tec'anil co nabal.

English: Nobody should seek his own good, but the good of others.
Kanjobal: Man mojok tol asan co watx'il yul jet chi co saya'. Yowalil chi co saya' tzetbil chi jut jak'on tec'anil juntzanokxa eb.

English: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience,
Kanjobal: A tinani', tzanc'al tzet chibejal chi txonlay txonbal, chi je' e manon e chi'. Manchak e k'anlej bay chi ca tita, yet watx' manchak etax el nabal eb chi abeni.

English: for, “The earth is the Lord's, and everything in it.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Cham Jajawil ay yet tx'otx' tx'otx' ti', c'al masanil tzet yetal ibil aj yuj tx'otx', c'al eb cajyom bay.

English: If some unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok man creyenteok chex awten low yetok bay yatut. Ta chi yochej e c'ul chex toji, chic'al je' e loon tzet chi yak' ayex. Man e k'anlej bay, bay chi ca tit tzet chi yetxbaj eltek e satak tu', yet watx' manchak etax el nabal eb chi abeni.

English: But if anyone says to you, “This has been offered in sacrifice,” then do not eat it, both for the sake of the man who told you and for conscience' sake –
Kanjobal: Palta ta ay junok mac chi alon ayex axca ti xin: A no chibej chi yak' nak ti' e chi', max ak'lay no' yin xajanbalil, ta ẍi ayex, manchak e chi', yujtol a mac chi alon ayex tu', ay is may chi etax el is nabal e yuj ta che chi'.

English: the other man's conscience, I mean, not yours. For why should my freedom be judged by another's conscience?
Kanjobal: Chi waltok juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' man e yujok chi somchaj eb c'amto tec'anil is nabal. Palta tekan ayex ok e yal axca ti' tinani': Ayon ti', chic'al je' co chion masanil tzet yetal. Yuj tu', ¿tzet yuj xan chon is beyc'ulnej eb chi xiw chion chibej tu'?

English: If I take part in the meal with thankfulness, why am I denounced because of something I thank God for?
Kanjobal: Ta chi jal yuj diosalil bay Dios yuj no chibej tu', cax chi co chion no', c'am mac ay yalon yet yalon tzet yob jin, quex chi mi.

English: So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.
Kanjobal: Palta chi waltok ayex, caxc'al chon lowi, ma chi juc'a', ma tzanc'al tzet yetal junokxa chi el juneni, junokabi yet watx' chi txecloj el is watx'ilal Dios.

English: Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews, Greeks or the church of God–
Kanjobal: Caxc'al israel junok mactxel, ma caxc'al man israelok, caw c'am chi je' jak'on etax el nabal eb. Yetok c'apax eb jet creyenteal, maj je' jak'on etax el nabal eb.

English: even as I try to please everybody in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chi wak'lej wak'on tzaloj c'ul eb wet animail yin masanil tzet chi el wuneni. Manak tzet chi oc in watx'ilok chin saya', palta a tzet chi oc watx'ilok juntzanokxa anima chin saya', yet watx' talaj ay eb chi colchajcan elok.

English: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', beybalnejek in beybal, axca chi wut c'apax in beybalnen beybal Cristo.

English: I praise you for remembering me in everything and for holding to the teachings, just as I passed them on to you.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chex wal watx'il, yujtol naan inc'al e yuj masanil tiempo, c'al yuj lanan e beybalnen juntzan cuybej walnakcan ayex.

English: Now I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.
Kanjobal: Palta chi wochej che yojtaknej elok, tol a Cristo ayoc is yajawilok junjun winak, axca tol is jolom yayji ocok. Axa nak yichamil ix ix, a nak ayoc is yajawilok ix, axca Dios, yajawil Cristo yayji.

English: Every man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac winakil ayaj k'oxil yet chi txajli, ma yet chi yalon el k'anej Dios, ac'al oc chi yak' q'uixwan ba.

English: And every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head–it is just as though her head were shaved.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax eb ix ix tol c'am aj k'oxil yet chi txajli ma yet chi yalon el k'anej Dios, chi yak' q'uixwan eb jolom, axca tol tzukbil el jolom eb tu'.

English: If a woman does not cover her head, she should have her hair cut off; and if it is a disgrace for a woman to have her hair cut or shaved off, she should cover her head.
Kanjobal: Ta ay eb c'am chi yal c'ul chi yaj k'oxil, tzukokab el eb jolom tu xin. Ta chi q'uixwi eb tzukon el jolom, yaokab aj eb is k'oxil.

English: A man ought not to cover his head, since he is the image and glory of God; but the woman is the glory of man.
Kanjobal: A ayon winak on ti', man mojok chi jaaj co k'oxil, yujtol axca tol yechel Dios jayji, tx'oxomal el is mimanbilal Cham jayji. Axa eb ix ix, tx'oxomalok el is mimanbilal nak winak yayji eb ix.

English: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man;
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet max watx'nen Dios nak babel winak, man yinok ix ix elnaktek nak winak tu'. A ix ix tu' a yin nak winak tu' elnaktek ix.

English: neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.
Kanjobal: A ix ix tu', watx'nebil ix yuj yoc ix yetbiok nak winak. Man yujok watx'ilok ix, xan max watx'ji nak winak tu'.

English: For this reason, and because of the angels, the woman ought to have a sign of authority on her head.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan moj yaon aj eb ix k'oxil is jolom, yuj tx'oxk'abnen el eb ix, tol ayoc eb ix yalan yikbej yichamil. Moj axca tu' chi yut ba eb ix, yuj t'anan c'apax oc eb ángel jin.

English: In the Lord, however, woman is not independent of man, nor is man independent of woman.
Kanjobal: Palta chi yochej Cham Jajawil tol ayokab yelapnok eb ix yul co sat ayon winak on ti', cax chi yochen c'apaxok tol ayokab jelapnok yul sat eb ix c'apaxok.

English: For as woman came from man, so also man is born of woman. But everything comes from God.
Kanjobal: Yel toni, a yin nak babel winak tu' elnaktek ix babel ix, palta a tinani', a yin eb ix ix chon pitzc'oj elok. Palta masanil, ac'al ton Dios max naoni.

English: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?
Kanjobal: Beyc'ulnejek el sic'libil ayex caw, ¿moj mi chi txajli junok ix bay Dios, ta c'am tzet ayaj yin is jolom?

English: Does not the very nature of things teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace to him,
Kanjobal: Jojtak co masanil tol q'uixwil, ta jokan xil co jolom axca xil jolom eb ix.

English: but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For long hair is given to her as a covering.
Kanjobal: Watx' yili eb ix ix, yujtol jokan tel xil jolom eb. A xil jolom eb ix tu' ayoc is k'oxilok.

English: If anyone wants to be contentious about this, we have no other practice–nor do the churches of God.
Kanjobal: Ta ayex chi tit e yowal yuj juntzan cuybanilej ti', yowalil chi nachaj el e yuj, tol ayon ti', c'am chi co cha' junokxa tx'ok beybalej. Ac'ala' c'apax eb creyente bay junjun yiglesia Dios, c'am chi cha eb junokxa tx'ok beybalej.

English: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzanxa tzet ok waltok ayex. Palta majto je' ex walon watx'il, yujtol ayex aytoc'al e paltail. Yujtol a yet che wajban e ba bay tu', c'am jabok watx'ilal che cha', toc'al chex etaxcan el yuj.

English: In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a jun ti' ok babjok walontok ayex. Chi wabej tol a ab yet che wajban e ba yin e culto, ay ab pojlejbail e xol. A chi wut in naoni, tekan yel juntzan chi wab tu'.

English: No doubt there have to be differences among you to show which of you have God's approval.
Kanjobal: (¡Tekan yowalil ok ex pojchajc'alta'a, yet watx' chi txecloj elok, mac caw yel creyente!)

English: When you come together, it is not the Lord's Supper you eat,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a yet che wajban e ba, manak cena Cham Jajawil jun che lo' tu'.

English: for as you eat, each of you goes ahead without waiting for anybody else. One remains hungry, another gets drunk.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet chi oc yorail cena tu', comonxac'al che lo' e yet junjun ex yin ayman. Yuj tu', ay ex c'amxa che yi' e yet, cax chi tit e wajil. Ay ex xin, chex uc'wixac'al aj an yuj.

English: Don't you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and humiliate those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you for this? Certainly not!
Kanjobal: ¿Tom c'am e yatut bay watx' chex low junjun ex? A yet che yunen axca tu', a eb e yet creyenteal che yintaknej elok, palta yiglesia Dios yayji eb e yetok. A eb caytu' chi yut axca tu', c'am tzet chi lo' eb e yetok. Yuj tu', q'uixwil eb che yielok. ¿Xin ta chi je' ex walon watx'il yuj jun e beybal tu' che na'? Caw wal maj je' bian.

English: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you: The Lord Jesus, on the night he was betrayed, took bread,
Kanjobal: A juntzan cuybanil yuj tzet chi yun chalay cena walnakcan ayex, a Cham Jajawil ak'nejcan ayin. A ton juntzan ok waltok ayex ti'. A yet jun ak'bal yet max alay oc Cham Jajawil Jesús yul k'ab eb t'inanta' yak'on camok, a yet manto michchajok, max yion aj jun ixim pan.

English: and when he had given thanks, he broke it and said, “This is my body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of me.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max lajwi yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios, max bijon ay ixim pan tu'. Axa yalon bay eb is cuywom axca ti': A jun ti', a ton in mimanil ok ak'lay e yuj. Loek ixim xin, yuj in e naontek, ẍi.

English: In the same way, after supper he took the cup, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of me.”
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' caytu' max yut yion c'apax aj jun vaso, yet max lajwi low eb. Max yalon c'apax bay eb axca ti': A tzet ayay yul jun vaso ti' tx'oxbanil jun is cab trato Dios. Yuj in chiq'uil xan ok yun jun is trato ti'. A yet che yuq'uen jun ti' junjuntak el, naek intek, ẍi Jesucristo bay eb.

English: For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until he comes.
Kanjobal: Yujtol junjun el chi co lo jun pan ti', c'al juc'balnen jun vaso ti', a camichal Cham Jajawil chi co tx'oxk'abnej elok, masantac'al chi yal jay Cham.

English: Therefore, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ta ay mac man watx'ok chi yut loon jun pan Cham Jajawil ti', c'al yuc'balnen jun vaso Cham ti', chi oc is mul yin mimanil Cham Jajawil, c'al yin is chiq'uil Cham.

English: A man ought to examine himself before he eats of the bread and drinks of the cup.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a yet c'amto chi co lo' ixim pan tu', c'al yet c'amto chi juc'balnej jun vaso tu', yowalil chi co beyc'ulnej co ba junjun on yul jet.

English: For anyone who eats and drinks without recognizing the body of the Lord eats and drinks judgment on himself.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet chi co looni c'al juq'uen jun ti', ta c'am chi cam co naon is mimanil Cham Jajawil, chi jitek yailal jiban.

English: That is why many among you are weak and sick, and a number of you have fallen asleep.
Kanjobal: Yuj juntzan ti', xan xiwil eb ya'ay e xol, c'al mac tz'ontak, cax xiwil mac chi cami.

English: But if we judged ourselves, we would not come under judgment.
Kanjobal: Palta ta chi co beyc'ulnej co ba junjun on, c'amxa chon beyc'ulnelay yuj Cham Jajawil.

English: When we are judged by the Lord, we are being disciplined so that we will not be condemned with the world.
Kanjobal: A yet chon beyc'ulnen Cham Jajawil, chi yaoc Cham co yailal, yet watx' manxa ok on tokcan bay jun miman yailal yetok eb yet yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: So then, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for each other.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, a yet che wajban oc e ba e loon Cena tu', che yechbanelej e ba, yet watx' junnejc'al e loon e masanil.

English: If anyone is hungry, he should eat at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.
Kanjobal: Ta ayex ay e wajil, lowanekcan bay e yatut, yet watx' c'am chi jay yailal e yiban yuj Dios, yujc'al tzet che yut e ba bay e wajanil tu'. Axa juntzanxa tzet tol man watx'ok bey e xol xin, okxa in watx'nej oc yet ok ex tok wiloni.

English: Now about spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chi wochej che yojtaknej elok, tzetak opisoal chi yak' Cham Espíritu Santo ayon junjun on.

English: You know that when you were pagans, somehow or other you were influenced and led astray to mute idols.
Kanjobal: E yojtak, tol a yet mayexto creyenteok, max quex ikbelaytok bay tzet chi al-lay oc diosal. Chex ayi, chex aji e sayon ec' juntzan c'am chi je' k'anjab tu'.

English: Therefore I tell you that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus be cursed,” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi wochej che yojtaknej c'apax el jun ti'. Ta ay junok mac chi alon axca ti': Titokab yowal c'ul Dios yiban Jesús, ta ẍi, a jun chi alon axca tu', c'amoc Yespíritu Dios yetok yet chi yaloni. Ta ay mac chi alon pax axca ti': A Jesús, Wajawil yayji, ta ẍi, asan yuj Cham Espíritu Santo chi je' yalon axca tu'.

English: There are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit.
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', tx'ok tx'okc'al opiso max co cha' junjun on, palta junnej mac chi ak'on ayon, a ton Cham Espíritu.

English: There are different kinds of service, but the same Lord.
Kanjobal: Tx'ok tx'okc'al jak'wi serbil junjun on, palta junnej mac chi jak' serbil co masanil, a ton Cham Jajawil.

English: There are different kinds of working, but the same God works all of them in all men.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, tx'ok tx'okc'al co mulnajil junjun on. Palta ac'al oc Dios chi oc jetok junjun on yin tzet chi jun tu'.

English: Now to each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for the common good.
Kanjobal: Chi ak'lay jopiso junjun on yuj co watx'ilok co masanil, yet chi txecloj elok tol ayoc Yespíritu jin.

English: To one there is given through the Spirit the message of wisdom, to another the message of knowledge by means of the same Spirit,
Kanjobal: Ilab tol yuj Cham Espíritu tu', xan ay mac chi je' yalon el is jelanil Dios, ay c'apax mac chi nachaj el cuywaji, ac'al ton yuj Cham Espíritu tu'.

English: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by that one Spirit,
Kanjobal: Yuj Cham xan ay wal mac chi yawal oc c'ul yin Dios. Ac'ala' yuj Cham, xan ay mac chi ak'lay yipalil yak'oncan watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay.

English: to another miraculous powers, to another prophecy, to another distinguishing between spirits, to another speaking in different kinds of tongues, and to still another the interpretation of tongues.
Kanjobal: Ay mac chi ak'lay yipalil tx'oxon el milagro yuj Cham. Ay mac xin, a aloj el k'anej Dios chi ak'i yun yuj. Ay eb chi ak'lay yojtaknej elok, ta a Espíritu Dios ayoc yetok junok mactxel, ma a espíritu yob xin. Ay mac a jeon k'anjab yin juntzanokxa tx'ok tiejal chi ak'lay yun yuj. Ay mac xin, a yoc ajtial yin juntzan tiejlak tu', a' chi ak'lay yun yuj.

English: All these are the work of one and the same Spirit, and he gives them to each one, just as he determines.
Kanjobal: Xiwil tzet chi ak'lay junej, palta junnej Cham Espíritu chi ak'on junej. Tx'ok tx'okc'al tzet chi yak' ayon junjun on, atac'ala' tzet chi el yin c'ul Cham yak' junej.

English: The body is a unit, though it is made up of many parts; and though all its parts are many, they form one body. So it is with Christ.
Kanjobal: A co mimanil ti', caxc'al xiwil yoc bulan yetbeyom yin, palta junnej mimanilejal yayji. Axca ton yoc bulan yetbeyom co mimanil ti', axca tu' joc c'apax bulan yin Cristo. Axca tol is mimanil Cristo jayji co masanil.

English: For we were all baptized by one Spirit into one body–whether Jews or Greeks, slave or free–and we were all given the one Spirit to drink.
Kanjobal: Yujtol co masanil, caxc'al israel on, caxc'al c'amak, junnej jayji co masanil. Caxc'al mosejal jayji bay junok mactxel, caxc'al jet co ba, palta junnej jayji. Yujtol a yet max on ak'lay bautizar, junxanej max juncan yetok Cristo. Asan yuj Cham Yespíritu Dios, xan axca tol junnej mimanilej jayji, yujtol max ak'lay cajay Cham jin co masanil.

English: Now the body is not made up of one part but of many.
Kanjobal: Ilab co mimanil ti' tinani'. Xiwil yetbeyom bulan oc yin, cax man junnejok.

English: If the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason cease to be part of the body.
Kanjobal: K'inalok chi je' yalon wakan axca ti': Ayin ti', yuj mayin k'abejok, xan mayin yetbeyomok jun mimanilej ti', k'inalok ta ẍi. Caxc'al chi yal axca tu', palta yetbeyom in mimanil ti'c'alta' yayji.

English: And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason cease to be part of the body.
Kanjobal: K'inalok a junok in txiquin ti' chi je' yalon axca ti': Ayin ti', yuj mayin bak' satejok, yuj tu' xan mayin yetbeyomok jun mimanilej ti', k'inalok ta ẍi. Caxc'al chi yal axca tu', palta yetbeyom in mimanil ti'c'alta' yayji.

English: If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta bak' satejc'al el in mimanil ti', ¿tzet laj chi wut waben paxok? K'inalok ta txiquinejc'al el in mimanil ti', ¿tzet laj chi wut in suk'ten pax jab junok tzet yetal?

English: But in fact God has arranged the parts in the body, every one of them, just as he wanted them to be.
Kanjobal: Palta a Dios max watx'nen junjun yetbeyom co mimanil axca max yun yel yin c'ul watx'neni.

English: If they were all one part, where would the body be?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta junxanej chi yutcan aj ba masanil, ¿baytal ayoc mimanilej tu' chi yal tu'?

English: As it is, there are many parts, but one body.
Kanjobal: Jojtak tol xiwil yetbeyom co mimanil ti', palta junnej yayji masanil.

English: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I don't need you!” And the head cannot say to the feet, “I don't need you!”
Kanjobal: A co bak' sat ti', c'am chi je' yalon bay co k'ab, tol c'am yopiso co k'ab ti' yuj. Ac'ala' c'apax co jolom, maj je' yalon bay jakan tol c'am yopiso jakan tu' yuj.

English: On the contrary, those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable,
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan yetbeyom co mimanil ti' axca tol c'am wal yelapnok, palta titol a juntzan tu' yel ay yopiso juj.

English: and the parts that we think are less honorable we treat with special honor. And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty,
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax juntzan yetbeyom co mimanil ti', axca tol c'am yelapnok, a ton juntzan tu' caw chi co ya'ilnej. A juntzan man watx'ok yili, chi co makchej elok, yuj co tx'oxk'abnen elok tol ay ton yelapnok yul co sat.

English: while our presentable parts need no special treatment. But God has combined the members of the body and has given greater honor to the parts that lacked it,
Kanjobal: Axa juntzan watx' yili xin, man yowalilok chi makchelay elok. Axca ton ti' max yun yel yin c'ul Dios watx'nen co mimanil ti', yet watx' a juntzan yetbeyom tol c'am yelapnok, a juntzan tu' caw ay yelapnok yul co sat.

English: so that there should be no division in the body, but that its parts should have equal concern for each other.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' maj je' caklen aj ba yin co mimanil ti'. A ti' yet, tol moj col-len ba junjun.

English: If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored, every part rejoices with it.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok yetbeyom co mimanil ti' chi yab yail ma chi yasji, jun lajanxac'al yaben yail masanil yetok jun tu'. Ta ay pax junok chi al-lay watx'il xin, jun lajan c'apax tzaloj masanil yetok jun tu'.

English: Now you are the body of Christ, and each one of you is a part of it.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a ayon ti', axca tol mimanil Cristo jayji. Junjun on axca tol yetbeyom is mimanil, caytu' jayji oc yin.

English: And in the church God has appointed first of all apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then workers of miracles, also those having gifts of healing, those able to help others, those with gifts of administration, and those speaking in different kinds of tongues.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ayon max yak' Dios jopiso xol iglesia. Yin babelal, ayon chekbej Cristo jayji. Yet is cab, ayon yalomal el k'anej Dios jayji. Yet is yox, ayon meẍtol jayji. Yetok c'apaxok, ayon chi co tx'oxil milagro. Ayon chi je' jak'on watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay. Ayon chi je' co colwaji. Ayon watx' jak'wi cuenta. Ayon xin, chi je' co k'anjab yin juntzanokxa tx'ok tiejal.

English: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Do all work miracles?
Kanjobal: Palta mayon chekbejok Cristo co masanil. Man co masanilok ay jopiso jalon el k'anej Dios. Mayon meẍtolok co masanil. C'am chi je' co tx'oxon el milagro co masanil.

English: Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues ? Do all interpret?
Kanjobal: Man co masanilok chi je' jak'on watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay. Man co masanilok chi je' co k'anjab yin juntzanokxa tx'ok tiejal. Yetok c'apaxok, man co masanilok chi je' joc ajtial yin juntzan tx'ok tiejal tu'.

English: But eagerly desire the greater gifts. And now I will show you the most excellent way.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ochejek wal juntzan opiso xiwil watx'il chi yak' Dios. Palta ayto wal junxa beybalej yelxac'al watx' ok waltek ayex.

English: If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta jelan on co k'anjab yin masanil ti' eb anima, c'al yin is ti' eb ángel, palta ta c'am pax co camc'ulal, lajan onc'al mi axca junok tambor toc'al chi tinxi. Ma xin, axca juntzan ch'en patxquiẍtak, toc'al chi tzinxi yetbeyom son, cayon mi tu'.

English: If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al ak'bil jopiso jalon el k'anej Dios, caxc'al caw chi nachaj el juj masanil tzet c'amto mac ojtakneni, caxc'al jojtak masanil tzet ay yulyibank'inal ti', caxc'al caw chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios sic'libil, xan chon tzakay jion el junok tzalan bay is lugar, palta ta c'am pax co camc'ulal, caw c'am jabok jopiso.

English: If I give all I possess to the poor and surrender my body to the flames, but have not love, I gain nothing.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al chi co sa' masanil tzet ay ayon bay eb meba', caxc'al inye con chi, chon ak'lay camok, cax chi ak'lay tz'a co mimanil ti', palta ta c'am co camc'ulal, nabac'al chi jetnej co c'ul, c'am jabok q'uex pak ok co cha'.

English: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.
Kanjobal: Ok waltek tzet chi jut co beybal, ta yel wali ay co camc'ulal. Caw ayc'al co mimanc'ulal yin eb jet animail, cax chi co tx'oxon c'apax co watx'c'ulal bay eb. Man comonok chi chichon oc co c'ul yin junok mac xiwil tzet ay. C'am chi co maynej co ba, cax chi jion can co ba.

English: It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.
Kanjobal: Ta caw yel ay co camc'ulal, c'am chi jiel q'uixwil junok mactxel. Chi jochej tol man asannejok on ay jalon jet. Manokab c'unok tit jowal. C'am chi co na' jion ec' co pak bay junok mactxel.

English: Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth.
Kanjobal: C'am chon tzaloj yuj junok tzet man watx'ok chi el yunen junok mactxel. Asan juntzan tzet yetal caw yel chon tzaloj yetok.

English: It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.
Kanjobal: Ta yel ay co camc'ulal, okc'al jak' techaj masanil tzet yetal. Chi jaoc yin co c'ul tol watx'c'al tzet chi el yunen eb jet animail. Chi jaoc eb yipok co c'ul. Tzanc'al junok tzet yetal chi jay jiban, tec'anc'al chi jut co ba bay.

English: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will cease; where there are tongues, they will be stilled; where there is knowledge, it will pass away.
Kanjobal: A jun camc'ulal ti', c'am bak'in ok lajwok. Ay jun tiempoal ok jayok, yet tol manxa yowalilok tol aytowal mac ok yak' Dios yopiso yalon el is k'anej. A yet jun tiempoal tu', manxa yowalilok tol aytowal mac ok k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal. Yetok c'apaxok, c'amxa yopiso co jelanil yet tu'.

English: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,
Kanjobal: Yujtol man tz'akanok co jelanil tinani', yetok c'apaxok man tz'akanok chi jut jalon el k'anej Dios tinani'.

English: but when perfection comes, the imperfect disappears.
Kanjobal: Palta xin, ay jun tz'akan. A yet ok jay jun tu', ato yet tu' ok lajwok yopiso masanil juntzan man tz'akanok chi jun ti'.

English: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I put childish ways behind me.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ayin ti' tinani', a yet unin into, axcac'al k'anjab unin in k'anjabi. Max in na juntzan tzet chi na' eb unin, yujtol lajan in nabal yetok eb. A tinani xin, icham winak inxa. Yuj tu' xan mayal in bekcan beybal uninal tu'. Axca in ton yet unin into tu', axca on ton tu' co masanil tinani'.

English: Now we see but a poor reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a tinani', c'am wal chi nachaj el yet Dios juj. Axca jilon oc co sat yul junok ch'en ch'en jopopi, k'ektaninak yili co sat, axca tu' jayji. Palta a yet jun tiempoal tu', ok nachaj el masanil tzetak yetal yet Dios juj, axca chon yut yojtaknen el Cham.

English: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.
Kanjobal: A tinani', chi jaoc Dios yin co c'ul, cax chi jaon c'apax oc yipok co c'ul. Chi co camc'ulnen c'apax eb jet animail. A oxeb chi jun ti', ayc'al yopiso masanil tiempo, palta a camc'ulal, ec'ban yelapnok yintak cabxa ti' yul sat Dios.

English: Follow the way of love and eagerly desire spiritual gifts, especially the gift of prophecy.
Kanjobal: Ak'ek e yip e camc'ulnelen e ba junjun ex. Cax ochejek wal juntzan opiso chi yak' Cham Yespíritu Dios ayex. Ay wal jun opiso yelxac'al watx', a ton jun aloj el k'anej Dios.

English: For anyone who speaks in a tongue does not speak to men but to God. Indeed, no one understands him; he utters mysteries with his spirit.
Kanjobal: Ay mactxel chi je' k'anjab yin juntzan tx'ok tiejal. A yet lanan yalon eb junok tzet yetal yin tx'ok tiejal tu', a bay Dios lanan k'anjab eb, manak bay anima, yujtol c'am mac chi aben tzet chi yal eb tu'. A Cham Yespíritu Dios chi ak'on yal eb juntzan tzet yetal tol c'am mac ojtaknej.

English: But everyone who prophesies speaks to men for their strengthening, encouragement and comfort.
Kanjobal: Palta a mac chi alon el k'anej Dios, a bay eb chi abeni, a tu' chi k'anjabi, yet watx' chi yi' eb is tec'anil, yet chi iptzelay eb, cax chi mimanc'ulnelay eb.

English: He who speaks in a tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.
Kanjobal: A mac chi k'anjab yin juntzan tx'ok tiejal, asanc'al chi yi' can tec'anil tx'oklil; palta axa eb chi alon el k'anej Dios xin, a eb creyente chi yi' can tec'anil yuj eb.

English: I would like every one of you to speak in tongues, but I would rather have you prophesy. He who prophesies is greater than one who speaks in tongues, unless he interprets, so that the church may be edified.
Kanjobal: Chi yochej in c'ul chi je' e yuj e k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal e masanil. Palta yelxac'al chi yochej in c'ul tol a k'anej Dios che yalilok, yujtol a aloj el k'anej Dios miman yelapnok yintak pax juntzan tx'ok tiejal tu'. Ay ton c'apax yopiso juntzan tx'ok tiejal tu', ta ay mac chi je' yoc ajtial yin tzet chi yal elapnok, yet watx' chi aj can nabal eb creyente yuj.

English: Now, brothers, if I come to you and speak in tongues, what good will I be to you, unless I bring you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or word of instruction?
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, k'inalok ta ayin chin apni oc e xol tinani' cax chi walon juntzan tx'ok tiejal ¿tom ay jabok tzet ok e yican yin? Palta ta a tzet max yak' Dios chi wak' e yojtaknej elok, ma jelanilal, ma xin, a k'anej Dios chi wal ayex, ma junokxa cuybanilej, asan axca tu bian, ay watx'ilal chi je' e yabencanok.

English: Even in the case of lifeless things that make sounds, such as the flute or harp, how will anyone know what tune is being played unless there is a distinction in the notes?
Kanjobal: Jieltek co nabal yin juntzanok son tinani'. K'inalok ta chi xulay chirima, ma chi txal-lay pax junok arpa, ta toxac'al chi somlabi nuk', ¿xin ta chi jab tzet bital chi yaoc junjun?

English: Again, if the trumpet does not sound a clear call, who will get ready for battle?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok owal tinani', cax chi toj eb soldado. Chi xulay is cornetail eb, yet chi toj eb. Ta man yinok is bital yet owal chi yun xulayi, ¿xin ta chi watx'nej ba eb, cax chi toj eb?

English: So it is with you. Unless you speak intelligible words with your tongue, how will anyone know what you are saying? You will just be speaking into the air.
Kanjobal: Cayon tu xin, ta a k'anej c'am mac chi nachaj el yuj tzet chi yal elapnok, a chi jala', ¿tzet ok yun nachaj el yuj eb tzet chi jala'? Nabac'al chon k'anjab chi yal tu'.

English: Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world, yet none of them is without meaning.
Kanjobal: A tinani', xiwil makanil tiej ay yulyibank'inal ti'. Masanil tiejlak tu', ay yelapnok junjun.

English: If then I do not grasp the meaning of what someone is saying, I am a foreigner to the speaker, and he is a foreigner to me.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok mac chi k'anjabi, palta c'am chi jab pax tzet chi yala', axca tol tx'ok conobal on yul sat eb axca tu'. Yetok c'apaxok, axca tol tx'ok conobal c'apax eb yul co sat, yujtol c'am chi jab tzet chi jal yetok eb.

English: So it is with you. Since you are eager to have spiritual gifts, try to excel in gifts that build up the church.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', wojtakxa tol che yochej juntzan opiso chi yak' Cham Yespíritu Dios ayex. Yuj tu' xan chi wal ayex, tol che yak' e yip, yet watx' a jun opiso caw wal watx' che cha', yet watx' ok je' e yak'on tec'anil nabal eb e yet creyenteal.

English: For this reason anyone who speaks in a tongue should pray that he may interpret what he says.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ta ay mac chi k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal, yowalil chi k'an is jelanil bay Dios, yet watx' chi je' yalon el tzet chi yal elapnok tzet chi yal tu'.

English: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.
Kanjobal: K'inalok chin txajli yin junok tx'ok tiejal tinani'. Ac'al wanimail chi txajli, palta in nabal, c'am mi chi nachaj el jabok yuj tzet chi wal tu'.

English: So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my mind; I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my mind.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ¿tzet watx' chi jun che na'? Manokab asannejok yetok janimail chon txajli. Yowalil chon txajli c'apax yetok co nabal, yet watx' chi nachaj el juj. Yetok c'apaxok, a yet chon bitni, manokab asannejok yetok janimail chon bitni. Yowalil chon bitni c'apax yetok co nabal, yet watx' chi nachaj el juj.

English: If you are praising God with your spirit, how can one who finds himself among those who do not understand say “Amen” to your thanksgiving, since he does not know what you are saying?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok ex che yal e watx' k'anej bay Dios tinani', yin tx'ok tiejal. Ac'al ton yetok e yanimail chex k'anjabi. Axa pax mac ayic' e yetok xin, maj nachaj el yuj eb tzet che yal tu'. Yuj tu', a yet che yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios, maj je' yalon eb yunokabi, man ẍiok eb.

English: You may be giving thanks well enough, but the other man is not edified.
Kanjobal: Tekan watx' e aloj yuj diosalil che yal yin txajil tu', palta c'am junok chi yi' can yip nabal yuj.

English: I thank God that I speak in tongues more than all of you.
Kanjobal: Yuj wal dios bay co Mam Dios, yujtol xiwil tx'ok tiejal chi je' wuj e yintak e masanil.

English: But in the church I would rather speak five intelligible words to instruct others than ten thousand words in a tongue.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet chi co wajban co ba yin culto, watx' tol a e ti' chi wal yet chex in cuyoni. Yujtol caxc'al o belannej k'anej Cham chi wal yin e ti', palta ec'ban tzet che yabcan ocok, yintak pax ta 10,000 k'anej c'am chi nachaj el e yuj chi wala'.

English: Brothers, stop thinking like children. In regard to evil be infants, but in your thinking be adults.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, manokab axcaok nabal unin, manokab axcaok tu' che yut e nabal yin juntzan ti'. Axa e beybal xin, matawal axca unin tol c'am bay chi yun eb junok tzet man watx'ok, mata caytu' che yut e ba, cax caw tec'an che yut e nabal, yujtol may ex uninok.

English: In the Law it is written: “Through men of strange tongues and through the lips of foreigners I will speak to this people, but even then they will not listen to me,” says the Lord.
Kanjobal: Tz'ib yayjican yul ley Dios axca ti': Ayin ti', ok in k'anjab bay jun conob ti' yin tx'ok k'anejal, c'al yin is ti' eb tx'ok conobal, palta majc'alta' cha yab eb, ẍi Cham Jajawil.

English: Tongues, then, are a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers; prophecy, however, is for believers, not for unbelievers.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a juntzan tx'ok tiejal chi al-lay tu', tx'oxbanilc'al yayji bay eb man creyenteok, cax man tx'oxbanilok yayji bay eb creyentexa. A pax yal-lay el k'anej Dios tu xin, tx'oxbanil ton yayji bay eb creyente jun tu', cax man tx'oxbanilok bay eb man creyenteok.

English: So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in tongues, and some who do not understand or some unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta a yet che wajban e ba e masanil ayex creyente ex ti' bay tu' tinani', cax e masanil chex k'anjab aj yin tx'ok tiejal, ta chi oc apnok junok man creyenteok e xol, tol man yojtakok tzetbil yoc beybalil jun jet ti', tekan ok yal axca ti': Axca wal tol loco eb, ẍi mi.

English: But if an unbeliever or someone who does not understand comes in while everybody is prophesying, he will be convinced by all that he is a sinner and will be judged by all,
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta ac'al k'anej Dios che yalil e masanil, cax chi ocapnok junok man creyenteok tu', caxc'al man yojtakok tzetbil yoc beybalil jun jet ti', ok nachaj el yuj, tol yobtakwom toni. Ok beyc'ulnej ba, yet ok yaben tzet ok e yal junjun ex.

English: and the secrets of his heart will be laid bare. So he will fall down and worship God, exclaiming, “God is really among you!”
Kanjobal: Caytu' ok yun txecloj el tzet ay yin is nabal. Yuj tu' ok ay jajanok, cax ok yalon ba bay Dios, cax ok yalon axca ti': Yel toni, caw wal ayoc Dios e yetok, ẍi mi.

English: What then shall we say, brothers? When you come together, everyone has a hymn, or a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue or an interpretation. All of these must be done for the strengthening of the church.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, ok waltok ayex tzet ok e yut e ba yet che wajban e ba yin culto. Matawal ay ex chex bitni, ay ex che yak' junok cuybanilej, ay ex che yal tzet chi yak' Dios e yojtaknej elok, ay ex chex k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal, cax ay ex c'apax che yal tzet chi al-lay yin tx'ok tiejal tu'. Matawal yelc'ulal tol chi aj can e nabal yuj masanil tzet che yun tu'.

English: If anyone speaks in a tongue, two–or at the most three–should speak, one at a time, and someone must interpret.
Kanjobal: Ta ay ex chex k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal, k'okbilokab cawanok ma oxwanok ex chex k'anjabi. Cax junjunalokab e yalon e yet. Yetok c'apaxok, yowalilokab ay junok ex chi je' e yalon tzet chi al-lay yin tx'ok tiejal tu'.

English: If there is no interpreter, the speaker should keep quiet in the church and speak to himself and God.
Kanjobal: Ta c'am mac chi nachaj el yuj tzet chi yal elapnok xin, manchak ex k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal yet che wajban e ba tu'. Watx' munilc'al chex txajli bay Dios yul e c'ul.

English: Two or three prophets should speak, and the others should weigh carefully what is said.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax ex che yal k'anej Dios, k'okbilokab cawanok, ma oxwanok ex chex k'anjabi. Axa e masanil xin, chi cam wal e yacban e txiquin bay is k'anej Dios chi al-lay ayex tu'.

English: And if a revelation comes to someone who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok ex lanan e yalon k'anej Dios e nan e xol, cax ay junokxa chi ak'lay yal junokxa tzet yetal yuj Dios, yowalil chex oc wanaj mac ex txel lanan e k'anjab tu', cax chi yalon junxa tu' yet.

English: For you can all prophesy in turn so that everyone may be instructed and encouraged.
Kanjobal: Ta axca tu', a jantak ex chi ak'lay e yalil k'anej Dios, yin junjunal chi je' e yalon e yet, yet watx' jun lajan e yioncan e cuybanil c'al e tec'anil e masanil.

English: The spirits of prophets are subject to the control of prophets.
Kanjobal: A mac ex chi ak'lay e yalil k'anej Dios, chi je' e mitx'on waay e ba yin e k'anjabi, yet watx' yin junjunal che yal e yet.

English: For God is not a God of disorder but of peace. As in all the congregations of the saints,
Kanjobal: Ta toxac'al chon wekeki yet chi jalon tu', manak Dios chi ak'on jun axca tu'. Yujtol chi yochej Dios tol yin bayc'al ijanil chi jun masanil tzet yetal. A beybal eb yet-xa Dios bay junjun iglesia, tol tz'inc'al ẍi eb ix ix.

English: women should remain silent in the churches. They are not allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the Law says.
Kanjobal: Xan cayokab ex tu', tz'inc'alokab ẍi eb ix bay che wajbaj e ba, yujtol c'am chi chalay k'anjab eb ix bay culto. Yikemokab chi yut ba eb ix, yujtol axca tu' yalon ley Dios.

English: If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in the church.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok tzet yetal chi yochej eb ix chi k'anlej yabej, k'anlejokab eb ix bay yichamil bay na, yujtol manta' wal mojok ix k'anjab bay culto tu'.

English: Did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only people it has reached?
Kanjobal: Yowalil che natek, tol manak ayex max babji e yalon el k'anej Dios. Yetok c'apaxok, man asannejok ex max e cha' k'anej Dios tu'.

English: If anybody thinks he is a prophet or spiritually gifted, let him acknowledge that what I am writing to you is the Lord's command.
Kanjobal: Ta ayex che na', tol ay e yopiso e yalon el k'anej Dios, ma che na' tol chi mulnaj oc Cham Yespíritu Dios e yin, ojtaknejek elok, tol chekbanil Cham Jajawil juntzan chin tz'ibejtok ayex ti'.

English: If he ignores this, he himself will be ignored.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac c'am yelapnok juntzan chekbanil Cham Jajawil ti' yul sat xin, c'amokab c'apax yelapnok eb tu' yul e sat.

English: Therefore, my brothers, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, che yak' e yip yin jeon e yuj e yalon el k'anej Dios, cax man e tenoc wanaj eb chi k'anjab yin tx'ok tiejal.

English: But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.
Kanjobal: Unek masanil yin bayc'al ijanil c'al yin txolilal.

English: Now, brothers, I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you, which you received and on which you have taken your stand.
Kanjobal: A tinani' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chi wochej che natek jun k'anejal yet colbanilej max walcan ayex. A jun abix ti', chabilxa e yuj. Caw tec'an e waay yin tinani',

English: By this gospel you are saved, if you hold firmly to the word I preached to you. Otherwise, you have believed in vain.
Kanjobal: ta ayc'al oc e nabal yin jun abix max walcan ayex tu', ta yel wali max e yaoc e c'ul yin, ay e colbanil yuj.

English: For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance : that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
Kanjobal: A juntzan cuybanilej chabil wuj, a max babji walon ayex. Tol a Cristo max cam yuj co mul, axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,
Kanjobal: Max mukayi, palta max ictzonelay pax aj yet cabjial, axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: and that he appeared to Peter, and then to the Twelve.
Kanjobal: Max tx'oxaj ba bay Pedro. Catatu' max tx'oxon aj ba bay juntzanxa eb is chekbej.

English: After that, he appeared to more than five hundred of the brothers at the same time, most of whom are still living, though some have fallen asleep.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max tx'oxon aj ba bay ec'ban 500 eb jet creyenteal. Wajan ec' eb cax max yilon eb masanil. Xiwilto eb tu' iquis tinani', palta ay jaywan eb camnakxa.

English: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,
Kanjobal: Max tx'ox c'apax aj ba bay Jacobo, yetok bay masanil juntzanxa eb is chekbej Cham.

English: and last of all he appeared to me also, as to one abnormally born.
Kanjobal: Yintakilxac'al tu', max tx'oxon aj ba ayin, yujtol axca junok unin manto yaljubalok, cayin tu'. Yujtol lajubxac'al max quin oc is chekbejok.

English: For I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ayin ti', yaynakil wayji xol juntzanxa eb chekbej Jesucristo tu'. Toltax man in mojok wal-lay oc chekbejok yetok eb, yujtol etnebil eb yiglesia Dios wuj yetok yailal.

English: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not without effect. No, I worked harder than all of them–yet not I, but the grace of God that was with me.
Kanjobal: Axa tinani xin, asan yuj is watx'c'ulal Dios, xan ayin oc yin wopiso ti', palta man nabac'alok max tx'ox is watx'c'ulal tu' win, yujtol ec'ban in mulnajil yintak eb wet chekbejal masanil. Palta man in tx'oklilok chin mulnaji; a Dios chi mulnaj wetok yuj is watx'c'ulal.

English: Whether, then, it was I or they, this is what we preach, and this is what you believed.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', caxc'al ayin max wala', ma tol a juntzanxa eb chekbej Jesús max aloni, ac'al oc jun k'anejal yet colbanilej tu' chi jala'. A ton jun ti' che yaoc yin e c'ul.

English: But if it is preached that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?
Kanjobal: A jun k'anejal yet colbanilej chi jal ti', a chi alontek tol max ictzonelay pax aj Cristo xol eb camnak. Yuj tu', ¿tzet yuj xan ay ex che yal tinani', tol c'am chi je' yictzoj aj eb camnak?

English: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.
Kanjobal: Ta yel c'am chi je' yictzoj aj eb, axca e yalon tu', man mi ictzonebilok aj Cristo chi yal tu'.

English: And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is your faith.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta maj ictzonelay aj Cham, a jun k'anejal yet colbanilej chi jalil ti', c'am mi jabok yelapnok. Ta axca tu xin, nabac'al mi che yaoc yin e c'ul.

English: More than that, we are then found to be false witnesses about God, for we have testified about God that he raised Christ from the dead. But he did not raise him if in fact the dead are not raised.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, lek'ti' testigo on mi Dios, yujtol max jala', tol max ictzonelay aj Cristo yuj Dios. K'inalok ta c'am chi je' yictzoj aj eb camnak axca e yalon jaywanok ex tu', maj mi ictzonelay aj Cristo yuj Dios.

English: For if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised either.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ta c'am chi je' yictzoj aj eb camnak tu', tamwal c'apax mi max ictzonelay aj Cham.

English: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta maj ictzonelay aj Cham, nabac'al mi che yaoc e c'ul yin, yujtol aytoc'al mi oc e yobtakil e yiban.

English: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, junelnej mi camnak el eb creyente camnakxa.

English: If only for this life we have hope in Christ, we are to be pitied more than all men.
Kanjobal: Ta asan yuj jab co k'inal bay yulyibank'inal ti' xan chi jaoc Cristo yipok co c'ul, yelxac'al mi ok'bal on c'ul yintak masanil anima chi yal tu'.

English: But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.
Kanjobal: Akxa tinani', wal yel ictzonebil aj Cristo xol eb camnak. Axca junok babel sat awoj, caytu' max yun yictzonelay aj Cham co satak, yuj tx'oxk'abnen elok, tol ok on ictzonelay c'apax ajok.

English: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man.
Kanjobal: Asan yuj jun winak, a ton Adán, xan max titcan camich jiban co masanil. Ac'ala' c'apax asan yuj junxa winak, a ton Cristo xan ok ictzonelay aj eb maxax cami.

English: For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive.
Kanjobal: Masanil anima ok camok, yujtol yinatil Adán masanil. Axa co masanil tol yet onxa Cristo ti', ok on ictzonelay pax ajok.

English: But each in his own turn: Christ, the firstfruits; then, when he comes, those who belong to him.
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al yin is txolilal. Babel max ictzonelay aj Cristo. Axa yet ok jay Cham yet is cayelal, cax ok on ictzonelay aj ayon yet onxa Cham ti'.

English: Then the end will come, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father after he has destroyed all dominion, authority and power.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok tu', cax ok jay lajubal, cax ok ak'lay lajwok el masanil eb yajaw yuj Cristo, c'al eb ay yopiso, yetok masanil juntzan eb ay yikbej. Catatu bian, ok yacan oc yopiso yul k'ab Cham Dios Mamej.

English: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Cristo, yowalil ok oc reyal, masantac'al ok can masanil mac ajc'ul oc yin yalan yuj.

English: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax junxa tzet axca tol ajc'ul oc jin bay yulyibank'inal ti', a ton camich. A jun lajub ajc'ul ok lajwok yuj Cristo, a ton camich tu'.

English: For he “has put everything under his feet.” Now when it says that “everything” has been put under him, it is clear that this does not include God himself, who put everything under Christ.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max yacan oc Dios Mamej masanil tzetak yetal yul k'ab Cristo. Palta caxc'al ayoc masanil tzetak yetal yul is k'ab, axca ta' chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, c'am yoc Cham Dios Mamej xol juntzan tu', yujtol a Dios chi ak'on masanil tzetak yetal tu' yul is k'ab.

English: When he has done this, then the Son himself will be made subject to him who put everything under him, so that God may be all in all.
Kanjobal: A yet mayal yacan oc Cham masanil tzetak yetal yul k'ab is C'ajol tu', catatu' a wal caw Cham C'ajolej tu' ok yaoc ba yul k'ab is Mam, Cham beknej oc masanil tzetak yetal tu' yul is k'ab. Catatu bian, asanxanej Dios ok yajawbok yiban masanil.

English: Now if there is no resurrection, what will those do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptized for them?
Kanjobal: A tinani', ay eb chi ak'lay bautizar q'uexelok eb camnak, palta ta man ok ictzoj pax aj eb camnak tu', ¿tzet yuj xan ay eb chi ak'lay bautizar q'uexelok eb xin?

English: And as for us, why do we endanger ourselves every hour?
Kanjobal: Yetok on c'apaxok, ¿tzet yuj xan chi jak'c'al co ba yul k'ab camich masanil tiempo?

English: I die every day–I mean that, brothers–just as surely as I glory over you in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, junjunc'al c'u ijan chin mak'lay camok. Wal yel chi wal ayex, caw wal chin tzaloj e yuj, yujtol ayoc Cham Jajawil Jesucristo yin e c'ul wetok.

English: If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus for merely human reasons, what have I gained? If the dead are not raised, “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”
Kanjobal: A bay Efeso ti', axca tol max wak'lej owal yetok no chiwajwom no'. Ta asan yuj tzet yetal yetc'al yulyibank'inal ti', ¿tzet wal yuj max wetnej in c'ul axca tu'? Ta man ok ictzoj aj eb camnak, yel mi watx' chi jak' co nabal tinani'. K'inalok tatol man ok on ictzonelay ajok, lowokonek, juq'uek an, yujtol talaj a yet yecal chon cami.

English: Do not be misled: “Bad company corrupts good character.”
Kanjobal: Manchak e yak' e ba etnelay yuj junok lek'tial. Ta ay eb yob beybal chon ec' yetok, ok etax el co watx' beybal yuj eb.

English: Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God–I say this to your shame.
Kanjobal: Naek e ba sic'libil, cax watx'nejek oc e nabal. Manchakxa e yun tzet man watx'ok. Chi wal jun ti' yujtol ay ex c'amto wal che yojtaknej el Dios. A yuj e q'uixwilok, xan chi waltok.

English: But someone may ask, “How are the dead raised? With what kind of body will they come?”
Kanjobal: Tekan ay junok ex ok e k'anlej el ayin axca ti': A eb camnakxa chal tu', ¿tzet ok yun yictzonelay aj eb? ¿Tzetbil yili mimanil eb yet ok ictzonelay aj eb tu'? tekan quex chi.

English: How foolish! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies.
Kanjobal: Ta ayex che na axca tu', tita' tol c'amto e nabal xin. K'inalok junok tzanc'al tzet inatil tinani'. Ta c'am chi jawaytok yul tx'otx', ¿tzet ok yun yelol xe' yin comonc'al? A yet chi jawoni, axca tol chi cam chi jila'.

English: When you sow, you do not plant the body that will be, but just a seed, perhaps of wheat or of something else.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jawon jun inat tu', manak is txutxal chi jawaytok. Caxc'al trigo, ma junokxa tzanc'al tzet inatil chi jawa', asan bak' ma sat chi jawa'.

English: But God gives it a body as he has determined, and to each kind of seed he gives its own body.
Kanjobal: Axa Dios chi aon oc txutxal junjun inat tu' axca chi yochej c'ul, atac'ala' tzet inatil junjun.

English: All flesh is not the same: Men have one kind of flesh, animals have another, birds another and fish another.
Kanjobal: A masanil tzetak yetal yulyibank'inal ti', tx'ok tx'okc'al is mimanil junjun makan. Tx'ok yel co mimanil ayon anima on ti'. Tx'ok yel is mimanil no no' caneb yakan. Tx'ok pax yel is mimanil no tz'iquin. Ac'ala' tx'ok c'apax yel is mimanil no txay.

English: There are also heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies; but the splendor of the heavenly bodies is one kind, and the splendor of the earthly bodies is another.
Kanjobal: Ay satcanil mimanilej, ay c'apax sattx'otx'al mimanilej. A satcanil mimanilej tu', ay watx'ilal tx'ok yel yintak sattx'otx'al mimanilej.

English: The sun has one kind of splendor, the moon another and the stars another; and star differs from star in splendor.
Kanjobal: A juntzan tzet ay satcan tu', tx'ok tx'ok yel tzekekial junjun. Tx'ok yel tzekekial c'u, tx'ok yel tzekekial xajaw. Tx'ok c'apax yel tzekekial junjun waycan.

English: So will it be with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is sown is perishable, it is raised imperishable;
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' cayton tu' ok yun eb camnak yet ok ictzonelay aj eb. Chi mukay aytok jun co mimanil tol c'un k'a ti', axa yet ok ictzonelay aj tu', c'amxa oxlajon bak'in ok camok.

English: it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;
Kanjobal: A yet ok mukay co mimanil ti', c'am jabok watx'il yoqui, cax c'am yelapnok jabok. Axa yet ok ictzonelay aj xin, yelxac'al watx' ok yun co mimanil tu' cax mimanxa yelapnok.

English: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.
Kanjobal: A yet ok muklay co mimanil ti', naba chibejc'al yayji ocok. Axa jun co mimanil ok ictzonelay aj tu xin, yet-xa espíritu. Ay jun co mimanil naba chibejc'al ti', yuj tu' xan jojtak c'apaxok tol ay pax jun co mimanil yet-xa espíritu.

English: So it is written: “The first man Adam became a living being” ; the last Adam, a life-giving spirit.
Kanjobal: Caytu' tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un bay chi yal axca ti': A nak babel winak, a ton Adán, max iquisbi ajok, ẍi. Palta ay junxa mac tzunanxa max jayi, axca Adán tu' yayji; a junxa tu', espíritu ak'on k'inalej toni.

English: The spiritual did not come first, but the natural, and after that the spiritual.
Kanjobal: Manak jun co mimanil yet espíritu max babji yak'lay ayon. Palta tol a jun chibej mimanilej max babji yak'layi. Tzunanilto ok ak'lay co mimanil yet espíritu tu'.

English: The first man was of the dust of the earth, the second man from heaven.
Kanjobal: A nak babel winak, yin tx'otx' tx'otx' max tit nak. Yuj tu' xan yet yulyibank'inal ti' yayji nak. Axa jun winak yet is cab tu xin, yet satcan yayji.

English: As was the earthly man, so are those who are of the earth; and as is the man from heaven, so also are those who are of heaven.
Kanjobal: Axcac'al jun mimanilej tol tx'otx' tu', cayc'al tu' co mimanil ti', yet c'apax yulyibank'inal ti' yayji. Palta axca is mimanil Cham aj satcan tu', caytu' jun co satcanil mimanil ok co cha'.

English: And just as we have borne the likeness of the earthly man, so shall we bear the likeness of the man from heaven.
Kanjobal: A tinani', lajan co mimanil ti' yetok jun tx'otx' mimanilej tu'. Axa yet jun tiempoal tu', lajanxa ok yun co mimanil yetok yet Cham aj satcan.

English: I declare to you, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chi wochej c'apax chi waltok junxa ti' ayex. A co mimanil ti', c'am chi je' yapni bay ayic' Dios. A co mimanil ti', cambejal yayji, yuj tu' c'am chi je' chaon k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed–
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun tzet c'am mac ojtaknen yul yet. Chi wochej che yojtaknej el tinani'. Man co masanilok ayon creyente on ti' ok on camok, palta co masanil ok q'uexponelay co mimanil ti'.

English: in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.
Kanjobal: A jun tu' yin aymanil ok ujok. Yin junnej mutz'satil ok yun jayi, yet ok xulay ch'en lajub trompeta. A yet ok xulay ch'en trompeta tu', cax ok ictzoj aj eb creyente camnak. Axa yet mayal ictzoj aj eb tu', c'amxa oxlajon bak'in ok cam eb. Axa ayon iquis onto yet tu xin, toxac'al ok q'uexponelaycan el co mimanil ti'.

English: For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a co mimanil ti', c'un yetaxtok. Yuj tu' xan yowalil ok co cha' jun co mimanil c'am bak'in ok etaxtok tu'. A co mimanil ti', cambejal yayji. Yuj tu' xan yowalil ok co cha' jun co mimanil tol c'amxa bak'in ok cam tu'.

English: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”
Kanjobal: A yet ok co chaon junxa co mimanil tu', catatu' bian ok yunen el jun tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un bay chi yal axca ti': A camich ok can yalan, yuj yipal Dios,

English: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”
Kanjobal: xan a tinani', tx'oxokabtek camich tu' yipalil yin yak'on c'ayil anima. Tx'oxokabtek camich tu' yikbej yin c'aywajwomal, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.
Kanjobal: Yuj co yobtakil, xan ay yipalil camich tu' on yak'on camok. A ley Dios max ak'oncan yikbej co yobtakil tu' co cam yuj.

English: But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Palta yuj wal dios bay co Mam Dios, yujtol chi occ'al Jesucristo is C'ajol jetok, xan chi cancan camich yalan juj.

English: Therefore, my dear brothers, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab camc'ulnebil, caw tec'anc'al che yut e ba. E yak'ta' cabc'ulal. Yinokab masanil e c'ul chex mulnajc'al yin yet Cham Jajawil yujtol e yojtakxa, tol a co mulnajil yin yet Cham manc'al nabaok.

English: Now about the collection for God's people: Do what I told the Galatian churches to do.
Kanjobal: A tinani' ok waltok e yab yuj jun ofrenda lanan yilay aj co xol ti', cax ok alaytok bay eb jet creyenteal. A juntzan chekbanil ok waltok ayex ti', albilxa wuj bay juntzan iglesia bay yul yet Galacia. Yuj tu', axcaokab yunnak eb tu', cayokab tu' che yun c'apax ayex ti'.

English: On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with his income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will have to be made.
Kanjobal: A yet junjun domingo, tx'ok che yican el e yofrenda, atac'ala' jantak che yi' junjun ex, cax che wajban ec'ok, yet watx' manxa yowalilok tol atoc'al yet chin apni, cax che yion aj e yofrenda tu'.

English: Then, when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Che siq'uil jaywanok eb ok in chektok bay Jerusalén. Asan chin apni cax chin tz'iben el is carta eb bay ok waltok tol ay yopiso eb. Ac'al ton oc eb ok iontok e yofrenda tu' bay eb aj Jerusalén.

English: If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me.
Kanjobal: A yet ok in apnok oc ayex tu', catatu' ok wiloni, ta ayin caw chin toj bay Jerusalén tu'. Ta chin toji, chi toj eb wetok.

English: After I go through Macedonia, I will come to you–for I will be going through Macedonia.
Kanjobal: A yet ok ex tok wiloni, yowalil ok in ec' cab oxebok c'u yul yet Macedonia. Catatu bian cax ok in apnok oc ayex tu'.

English: Perhaps I will stay with you awhile, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me on my journey, wherever I go.
Kanjobal: Talaj c'uxan chin ayji ec' e yetok junok tiempoal, tekan a tu' ayin ec'ok cax ok ec' nabilk'inal; axa yet ok in tok bay juntzanokxa lugar xin, ok ex colwajc'al wetok yin in viaje.

English: I do not want to see you now and make only a passing visit; I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.
Kanjobal: C'am chi wochej tol amanc'uanxac'al ok ex ec' wilcanok. Chi wochej wal chin ec' junok tiempoal e yetok, ta chi el yin c'ul Cham Jajawil.

English: But I will stay on at Ephesus until Pentecost,
Kanjobal: Palta ayinto ec' bay conob Efeso ti', cax ok ec' k'in Pentecostés.

English: because a great door for effective work has opened to me, and there are many who oppose me.
Kanjobal: Yujtol watx'c'al chaon ba in mulnaj yin yet Cham Jajawil cayti' chi wila'. Caxc'al xiwil mac chi chichon oc c'ul win, palta bekanc'al in mulnaji.

English: If Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is carrying on the work of the Lord, just as I am.
Kanjobal: Ta ok apnok oc Timoteo ayex tu', ya'ilnejek, yet watx' c'amokab tzet chi na', cax chi ayji ec' e yetok yin tzalojc'ulalil, yujtol chi mulnaj c'apax yin yet Cham Jajawil axca in ti'.

English: No one, then, should refuse to accept him. Send him on his way in peace so that he may return to me. I am expecting him along with the brothers.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', c'am junok ex chi je' e yintaknen el nak bay tu'. A ti' e yet, tol chex colwaj bay nak, yet watx' chi tit nak yin tzalojc'ulalil. Ti lanan wechbanen jay nak yetok juntzanxa eb juẍtak ok tit yetok.

English: Now about our brother Apollos: I strongly urged him to go to you with the brothers. He was quite unwilling to go now, but he will go when he has the opportunity.
Kanjobal: Xiwil max in oc tean yin juẍtak Apolos yujtol wochwan wal chex toj il-lay yuj yetok eb juẍtak, palta maj yal c'ul max quex toj yil yet jun tiempoal ti'. Ato ab yet ay is colanil, cax ok ex tok yiloni.

English: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be men of courage; be strong.
Kanjobal: Makwajanekc'al. Tec'anokabc'al che yut e yaon oc e c'ul yin Cham Jajawil. Manchak ex xiw jabok. Caw che tec'baj e ba junjun ex.

English: Do everything in love.
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al tzet che yunej, unek yin camc'ulalil.

English: You know that the household of Stephanas were the first converts in Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the service of the saints. I urge you, brothers,
Kanjobal: A tinani' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, e yojtak tol a Estéfanas yetok masanil eb cajan yetok bay yatut, a eb babel creyente bay yul yet Acaya tu'. A eb tu', caw wal chi yak' serbil eb eb creyente yin masanil c'ul.

English: to submit to such as these and to everyone who joins in the work, and labors at it.
Kanjobal: Chin tewi ayex, tol che yikej tzet chi yal eb, cax che yiken c'apax bay juntzanxa eb jun lajan yak'on serbil Cham Jajawil yetok eb, yujtol caw wal chi colwaj eb cax chi mulnaj eb yin yet Cham Jajawil.

English: I was glad when Stephanas, Fortunatus and Achaicus arrived, because they have supplied what was lacking from you.
Kanjobal: Caw chin tzaloj tinani', yujtol max jayoc Estéfanas, yetok Fortunato c'al Acayco ayin cayti'. A eb ti', caw wal chi colwaj eb wetok. Axca tol e q'uexel yayji eb yin colwaj wetok. Ilab tol c'am chi je' e jayi.

English: For they refreshed my spirit and yours also. Such men deserve recognition.
Kanjobal: Axca wal max yun yion can yip e nabal yuj eb bay tu', caytu' max yun c'apax yion yip in nabal yuj eb cayti', xan matawal ay yelapnok eb yul e sat. Ta ay juntzanokxa mactxel axca eb ti', ayokab c'apax yelapnok eb yul e sat.

English: The churches in the province of Asia send you greetings. Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly in the Lord, and so does the church that meets at their house.
Kanjobal: A eb juẍtak c'al eb janab bay junjun iglesia yul yet Asia ti', chi yatok eb cawil e c'ul e masanil bay tu'. Yetok c'apax Aquila c'al Priscila, c'al eb creyente chi wajbaj ba yak'on culto bay yatut eb, chi yatok eb cawil e c'ul yin bi Cham Jajawil.

English: All the brothers here send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb hermano cayti', chi yatok eb cawil e c'ul. A yet che yil-len e ba, che yak'lej cawil e c'ul yin camc'ulalil, yujtol yet exxa Dios.

English: I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand.
Kanjobal: A jun cawil c'ulej chin tz'ibejtok ti', ayin caw Pablo in ti', chin tz'ibejtok.

English: If anyone does not love the Lord–a curse be on him. Come, O Lord !
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok mac c'am chi camc'ulnen Cham Jajawil Jesucristo, titokab yowal c'ul Dios yiban. Ach Jajawil, matawal chach jay yin ayman.

English: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
Kanjobal: Tx'oxokab Cham Jajawil Jesucristo is watx'c'ulal ayex bay tu'.

English: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.
Kanjobal: Chex in camc'ulnej e masanil yin Cristo Jesús.

English: When I came to you, brothers, I did not come with eloquence or superior wisdom as I proclaimed to you the testimony about God.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, a yet max ec' walon el k'anej Dios e nan e xol tu', man jelanok max wut in ba ayex. Manak juntzan mimek k'anej chi yak'balnej eb jelan max ec' wal ayex.

English: For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.
Kanjobal: A yet max quin ec' ayex tu', c'am junokxa tzet yetal max wochej max wojtaknej elok, palta asan yabixal Jesucristo max ec' walil ayex, tol max cam yin curus.

English: I came to you in weakness and fear, and with much trembling.
Kanjobal: A yet max in ec' ayex tu', c'am welapnok jabok yul sat junok anima, chin luklon yuj xiwilal.
