Kanjobal: Chin txajli c'ualil c'al ak'balil oj. A yet chin txajli junjuntak el, oj wali chi walon yuj diosalil bay Dios. A yin Cham, tojol chi wut in nabal yin wak'on serbil, axca max yun yak'on serbil eb wichmam.

English: Recalling your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.
Kanjobal: A yet chin naontek a cusc'ulal, caw chi wochej chi wiloc en junelxa, yet watx' chi ajwal can in tzalojc'ulal.

English: I have been reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.
Kanjobal: Wojtak wali, tol yelc'ulal wal chaoc Cham Jajawil yin a c'ul. A a txutx ixnam Loida, babel yanak oc is c'ul yin, c'al a txutx Eunice. Wojtak tol axca ton max yut yaon oc eb c'ul yin Cham Jajawil tu', caytu' chot aon c'apax oc a c'ul yin Cham ach ti'.

English: For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
Kanjobal: Xan chi waltok ayach tinani', tol chak' ep elon opiso max yaoc Dios eban yet max in batxban ajtok in k'ab yiban a jolom.

English: For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but a spirit of power, of love and of self-discipline.
Kanjobal: A Dios, manak xiwc'ulal max yak' ayon. Palta tol a wal caw yipalil max yak'a', yet watx' tec'an co waayi. Max yak' co camc'ulnelej co ba. Max yak' c'apax jak'on cuenta co ba yul jet.

English: So do not be ashamed to testify about our Lord, or ashamed of me his prisoner. But join with me in suffering for the gospel, by the power of God,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', manchak ach q'uixwi alon el yabixal Cham Jajawil. Yetok c'apaxok, manchak ach q'uixwi, yujtol preso wayji yuj Cham. Manchak ach xiw elon yail yuj k'anejal yet colbanilej, yujtol lanan yak'on Dios yipalil ayach wetok.

English: who has saved us and called us to a holy life–not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,
Kanjobal: Colbil on el yuj Dios, cax awtebil on c'apax el yuj, yet watx' watx'c'al chi jut co beybal. Man yujok jabok tzet watx' max el juneni xan max on colchaji, palta yujtol axca ti' max el yin c'ul Dios chi juncan elok, c'al yuj is camc'ulal jin, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús. Ayxac'alta' camc'ulal Dios jin yet c'amto chi tz'unchaj yulyibank'inal.

English: but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who has destroyed death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.
Kanjobal: Ato yet max ulic' co Colomal Jesucristo, ato yet tu' max txecloj el is watx'c'ulal Dios jin. A Jesucristo max ak'on lajwok el yipalil camich. A k'anejal yet colbanilej max txeclonen elok tol a Cham chi ak'on co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: And of this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.
Kanjobal: Max yak' Dios wopiso walon el k'anejal yet colbanilej, cax max quin yaon oc chekbejok Jesucristo, yuj chin ec' cuywajok.

English: That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet I am not ashamed, because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him for that day.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi wil juntzan yailal chi jay wiban ti'; palta c'am jabok chin q'uixwi, yujtol caw wojtak Cham ayoc yipok in c'ul. Wojtak tol ay yipalil Cham taynen tzet max yak' ayin, masantac'al chi jay c'ual jayubal Cristo.

English: What you heard from me, keep as the pattern of sound teaching, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Ya'ilnej jun acaw cuybanilej max abcan ayin. Aokab wal ayc'al oc yichbanilok cuybanilej ok ak'a', yujtol ay wal oc Dios yin co c'ul, c'al yuj camc'ulal ak'bil ayon yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo.

English: Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you–guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
Kanjobal: Taynej juntzan cuybanilej max alay oc yul a k'ab yuj Dios yetok colwal Cham Espíritu Santo, Cham cajanxa ec' jin junjun on.

English: You know that everyone in the province of Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
Kanjobal: Ojtakxa tol bekbil inxa can in tx'oklil yuj masanil eb creyente yul yet Asia. Ajun Figelo yetok Hermógenes yetok eb beknej in can tu'.

English: May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.
Kanjobal: Ok'okab c'ul Cham Jajawil yin eb cajan yetok Onesíforo bay yatut, yujtol tx'ial elc'al max ul yak' mimanil in c'ul. Caxc'al preso wayji palta maj q'uixwok quin ul yiloni.

English: On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al jay bay conob Roma ti', cax max c'oli in saylay ec' yuj, masantac'al max yal wilchaj yuj.

English: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! You know very well in how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.
Kanjobal: Ok'okab c'ul Cham Jajawil yin Onesíforo tu' yetok eb ayic' yetok bay yatut yet ok jay c'ual jayubal Cristo. Ojtak ach ti' tol caw xiwil is watx'c'ulal Onesíforo tu' jin bay conob Efeso bay ayach ec' tu'.

English: You then, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ach tol axca in c'ajol ach, tec'baj a ba yuj watx'c'ulalil Dios chi yak' ayon, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús.

English: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable men who will also be qualified to teach others.
Kanjobal: A juntzan cuybanilej max ab walon nan xol xiwil eb creyente etok, abenejcan oc yul k'ab eb yikem, eb chi je' cuywaj nan xol yet creyenteal.

English: Endure hardship with us like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axca junok soldado tol caw watx', axcaokab tu' chot ak'on techaj yailal chela', yuj lanan ak'on serbil Jesucristo.

English: No one serving as a soldier gets involved in civilian affairs–he wants to please his commanding officer.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok soldado ayoc yin yopiso tinani', maj je' comonc'al ok tok yin junokxa comon mulnajil, yujtol asan jun yajaw chi je' yak'on serbil.

English: Similarly, if anyone competes as an athlete, he does not receive the victor's crown unless he competes according to the rules.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok winak ayoc yin junok sakach tinani', caw wal chi yochej chi yak' ganar, palta ta c'am chi yikej axca wal yalon leyal jun sakach tu', maj je' chaon is paktzil.

English: The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.
Kanjobal: Ilab c'apax eb mulnajwom tinani'. A eb, moj chaon yet yin babelal yin sat awoj.

English: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.
Kanjobal: A juntzan chi waltok ayach ti', chi cam a beyc'ulnen sic'libil, cax ok yak'on Cham Jajawil nachaj el oj masanil.

English: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David. This is my gospel,
Kanjobal: Natek Jesucristo, Cham yinatil David, Cham max ictzonelay aj xol eb camnak. A ton jun ti' k'anejal yet colbanilej chi walilok.

English: for which I am suffering even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But God's word is not chained.
Kanjobal: Yujc'al chi walil jun ti', xan lanan waben yail tinani'. Toltax c'alan in yetok cadena, axca wal tol miman in mul yul sat ley, palta a k'anej Dios man c'alanok yetok cadena axca in c'al-lay ti'.

English: Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzanxa eb sic'bilxa el yuj Dios, chi wochej ok cha' eb watx'il jetok. Yuj tu' xan chi wak' techaj jantakc'al tzet chi jay wiban, yet watx' chi cha' c'apax eb is colbanil miman yelapnok. Jun chi ak'lay ayon yin junelnej, yuj junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús.

English: Here is a trustworthy saying: If we died with him, we will also live with him;
Kanjobal: A juntzan k'anej ok waltok ayach ti', caw yel. Ta camnak on yetok Cham, ok on iquisbokc'al ec' yetok yin junelnej.

English: if we endure, we will also reign with him. If we disown him, he will also disown us;
Kanjobal: Ta chi jak' techaj yail yetok Cham, ok jak' yajawilal yetok. Ta chi jiel Cham jin, ok on yi' c'apax el Cham yin.

English: if we are faithless, he will remain faithful, for he cannot disown himself.
Kanjobal: Ta ayon c'am chi yun tzet chi jala', palta a Cham chic'al yun tzet chi yala'. Yujtol c'am chi je' q'uexon Cham is ti' yin tzet chi yala'.

English: Keep reminding them of these things. Warn them before God against quarreling about words; it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.
Kanjobal: Jek na' eb creyente bay tu' juntzan chi waltok ayach ti'. Satak Dios chal bay eb, tol man comonok chi teyelej ba eb yin k'anej. Nabac'al chi yetnej ba eb yin. A eb chi aben teyelen ba eb, toc'al chi somchajcan el c'ul eb yuj eb.

English: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a workman who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.
Kanjobal: Caw chak' ep a mulnaj yin yet Dios, yet watx' chi yil eb tol watx' a mulnajil, cax caw watx'c'al chot alon el k'anej Dios acaw yel. Ta chon axca chi wal ti', c'am tzet yuj xan ok ach q'uixwok aj satak Dios.

English: Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.
Kanjobal: Man a cha' ab tzet chi yal eb comonc'al chi k'anjabi, eb c'am yelapnok tzet chi yala'. Yuj is comon k'anej eb tu', xan chi texac'al toj eb xol tzet man watx'ok.

English: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
Kanjobal: Axca wal junok yax k'ayil chi el lebebok, caytu' chi yun yel lebebok juntzan comon k'anej chi yal eb tu'. Caytu' yutnak ba Himeneo yetok Fileto.

English: who have wandered away from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, and they destroy the faith of some.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max bekcan eb jun cuybej acaw yel, cax chi tz'ak yalon eb tol mayal ictzoj aj eb camnak. Axca tu' chi ec' somtok eb tzet ayoc yin c'ul jaywanokxa.

English: Nevertheless, God's solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”
Kanjobal: Palta a jun yanak ay Dios yich, caw ay yip. Axca junok yich na c'am jabok chi bili, caytu' jun tu'. Ayoc jun sello yin, tol chi yal axca ti': Yojtak Cham Jajawil eb yetc'alta' yayji, ẍi. Cax chi yal c'apax axca ti': Tzanc'al mac chi yaloc ba yetok Cham Jajawil, yowalil chi bekcan masanil yobtakil, ẍi jun sello tu'.

English: In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for noble purposes and some for ignoble.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok miman na xiwil mitx'k'abej yul. Ay laj ch'en mitx'k'abej. Ay laj oro yetok plata, caw ay yopiso. Palta ay pax te mitx'k'abej, c'al tx'otx' mitx'k'abej. A cabxa makan tu' comon mitx'k'abejc'al.

English: If a man cleanses himself from the latter, he will be an instrument for noble purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work.
Kanjobal: Axca juntzan mitx'k'abej tu', cayon ton tu'. Ta chi co bekcan masanil yobtakil, caw miman jelapnok satak Cham Jajawil. Asan Cham ayon yet. Ay jopiso yuj Cham, yujtol tzanc'al tzet opiso miman yelapnok chi yochej c'ul Cham watx'xa jayji yet chi junej.

English: Flee the evil desires of youth, and pursue righteousness, faith, love and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
Kanjobal: Besil a ba yin juntzan tzet chi yochej oc eb et ach'ejal. Ocan yin tojolal, yin camc'ulal, yin junc'ulal, c'al yin aon oc a c'ul yin Cham Jajawil axca chi yut ba eb c'am jabok is paltail satak Cham, yet chi yalon ba eb bay.

English: Don't have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels.
Kanjobal: Ay eb comonc'al chi teyelej aj ba, palta nabac'al toni. C'am jabok yelapnok tzet chi yal eb. Pojil a ba xol eb. Ojtakxa tol owalxa chi yun lajwi aj tzet chi yal eb tu'.

English: And the Lord's servant must not quarrel; instead, he must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful.
Kanjobal: A mac chi ak'on serbil Cham Jajawil, c'am chi je' tol comonc'al chi yatok ba xol owal. Yowalil manso chi yut ba eb bay masanil anima. Yowalil watx' chi yut cuywaj ba eb, cax miman c'apax chi yut eb c'ul.

English: Those who oppose him he must gently instruct, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, watx'c'ulalokabc'al chi yut yalon eb bay eb chi tit yowal. Yamita ok ak'lay na ba c'ul eb yuj Dios, cax ok yojtaknen el eb jun cuybej acaw yel.

English: and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, who has taken them captive to do his will.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb tu', axca tol mitx'bil tzakay eb yuj nak diablo, yet watx' chi yun eb tzet chi yochej nak, palta ta chi na ba c'ul eb, ok colchaj eb yul k'ab nak diablo tu'.

English: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days.
Kanjobal: Yowalil chi jojtaknej elok, tol a yet manto jay jun lajub c'ual, ay wal jun tiempoal ok jayok tol caw ay is may.

English: People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,
Kanjobal: Ilab tol ay anima ok camc'ulnej ba tx'oklil. Asan yin ch'en tumin ok yaoc eb nabal. Ok luesnej ba eb, ok yi' can ba eb. Comonc'al ok buchwaj eb. Manxa ok yikej eb tzet ok yal is mam c'al is txutx. Manxa ok yal eb yuj diosalil yuj tzet ok cha'. Junelnej wal man watx'ok ok yut eb beybal.

English: without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,
Kanjobal: C'am jabok camc'ulal eb, c'am bay ok ok' c'ul eb yin junokxa mactxel. Ok wajwok k'anej eb. Maj je' mitx'on tzakay eb is mimanil. Axca wal junok no no' caw ow, caytu' ok yut ba eb. Ok oc eb ajc'ulal yin masanil tzet watx'.

English: treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God–
Kanjobal: A yet ok jay jun tiempoal tu', ok naaj eb k'anej yin yamigo. Maj xiw eb yunen tzet man watx'ok. Ok tz'ak yaloc ba eb jelanil. Asan yin tzet ok yochej oc eb yetok is mimanil bay ok yaoc eb is nabal. Axa yin Dios xin, c'am jabok is camc'ulal eb.

English: having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with them.
Kanjobal: Ok tz'ak yal eb axca ti': A yin Dios chi jaoc co nabal, ẍi eb. Palta a beybal eb ok tx'oxk'abnen elok tol manak Dios ayoc yetok eb. Manchak a junanej a ba yetok eb, a ti et, tol chach el xol eb.

English: They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over weak-willed women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,
Kanjobal: A xol eb chi wal ti', ay eb ewantakc'al chi oc yulak na, cax chi yetnen eb eb ix ix c'am is nabal, eb ix etaxnakxa el is nabal yuj tzet man watx'ok. A eb ix tu', xiwil tzet man watx'ok chi yochej oc eb.

English: always learning but never able to acknowledge the truth.
Kanjobal: Chi tz'ak cuywok ba eb ix masanil tiempo; palta c'am bak'in ok yojtaknej el eb ix jun cuybej acaw yel.

English: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these men oppose the truth–men of depraved minds, who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.
Kanjobal: Axca max yun yak'len Janes yetok Jambres tenon oc waan Moisés, axca tu' chi yun tenon oc waan eb anima tu' cuybej acaw yel. Toxa ton max etax el is nabal eb. C'amxa chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Dios.

English: But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, their folly will be clear to everyone.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb tu', man ok uj yuj eb, yujtol ok txecloj el eb satak masanil anima, tol c'am nabal eb. Axca max yun txecloj el eb max yak'lej tenon oc wanaj Moisés, cayton tu' ok yun txecloj el eb.

English: You, however, know all about my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,
Kanjobal: Palta ach ti' ojtak ton in cuybanil, c'al in beybal, c'al tzet chi wut in nabal. Max ela' tzetbil chi wut waon oc in c'ul yin Cham Jajawil. Max el c'apax in mimanc'ulal c'al in camc'ulal.

English: persecutions, sufferings–what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra, the persecutions I endured. Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, max el in tec'anil xol tzet chi alay oc wiban, c'al juntzanokxa tzet chi wab yail. Ojtakxa tol caw wal max quin etax yet max quin ec' bay conob Antioquía, yetok bay conob Iconio c'al bay Listra. Xiwil yailal ec' wilnak bay juntzan conob tu'; palta colnak in el Cham Jajawil yul is k'ab masanil.

English: In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi yochej tol watx' chi yut beybal, yujtol chi junanej ba yetok Cristo Jesús, wal yel ay tzet ok alay oc yiban yuj eb yet animail.

English: while evil men and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.
Kanjobal: Axa eb man watx'ok beybal xin, c'al eb etnem anima, ok texac'al tojcan eb xol tzet man watx'ok. Etnewom eb, cax etnebil c'apax eb.

English: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it,
Kanjobal: Axa ach xin, tec'anc'al chot aon oc a nabal yin juntzan cuybej cuybilxa oj, juntzan ojtak mac cuynej ach can yin.

English: and how from infancy you have known the holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Yintaxc'al a yaliẍal max c'oli a cuyon tx'an is libro Dios. Tx'an chi ak'on jelanbok co nabal, yet watx' chon colchaji, yet chi jaon oc co c'ul yin Cristo Jesús.

English: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,
Kanjobal: A Dios max ak'on tz'ibelay tx'an Un bay aycan is k'anej. Watx' tx'an yin con is cuyoni c'al yin con is tenchaneni. Chi watx'ji oc co nabal yuj. Chon is cuy tx'an, tzet chi jut co jichlonen oc co beybal.

English: so that the man of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' yopiso tx'an, yet watx' tz'akan chi nachaj el juj, c'al jeon juj junen juntzan yochwan Dios ayon tol yet onxa ti'.

English: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:
Kanjobal: A yet ok jay Cham Jajawil Jesucristo yet cayelal, ok texac'al oc Cham yin reyal, cax ok beyc'ulnen Cham masanil eb anima camnakxa, c'al eb iquisto. Yuj tu' xan satak wal Dios c'al satak Cham Jajawil Jesucristo chi cam walontok ayach

English: Preach the Word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage–with great patience and careful instruction.
Kanjobal: tol chalil k'anej Dios xol anima. Caxc'al chi yochej eb chi yabej, caxc'al c'am chi yochej eb chi yabej, palta alilok. Cha tenchanej eb yin tzet man watx'ok, cha jek oc nabal eb. Miman chot a c'ul yin eb, cha cuy c'apax eb yin k'anej Dios.

English: For the time will come when men will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay jun tiempoal ok jayok, xan ay mactxel majxa cha' al-lay cuybej acaw yel bay. Asanxanej comon k'anej ok yochej eb ok yabej. Yuj tu', xiwil cuywajwom ok wajbajtek eb; palta juntzan cuywajwom tu', toc'al ok tz'ak yal eb juntzanok comon k'anej, axca chi yochej anima tu'.

English: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', majxa yacbaj eb txiquin yin cuybej acaw yel, asan yin comon abix ok yaoc eb nabal.

English: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.
Kanjobal: Palta ach ti', tec'anc'al chot a nabal. Ak'c'al techaj yailal chi jay eban. Alc'al el k'anejal yet colbanilej nan xol anima. Mulnajan sic'libil, yet watx' c'am tzet chi majax aj yin opiso tu'.

English: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time has come for my departure.
Kanjobal: Axa ayin ti xin, lananxa jay tiempoal in cami. Axca vino chi seclay ay yin ofrendail, caytu' ok wunej.

English: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.
Kanjobal: Axca junok mac chi oc yin junok anejbail, axca tu' max wut in ba in mulnaj yin yet Dios. A tinani xin, mayal yi ba wopiso yin watx'il. Max in ya'ilnej masanil tiempo juntzan cuybej max jaoc yin co c'ul.

English: Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day–and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing.
Kanjobal: A tinani', c'ubanxa ec' in paktzebal, yujtol tojolc'al max wut in beybal. A yet jun c'ual tu' ok in cha' in paktzil tu' bay Cham Jajawil, Cham Juez tojol. Man asannejok in ok in cha' paktzil tu', palta ok cha' c'apax eb chi ochen chi jay Cham yet is cayelal yet.

English: Do your best to come to me quickly,
Kanjobal: Chi wochej chak' ep a sayon tzet chi yun a tit yin ayman.

English: for Demas, because he loved this world, has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max quin beklaycan yuj Demas in tx'oklil. Max toj bay Tesalónica, yujtol asan tzet yetal ay yulyibank'inal ti' chi yochej. A juẍtak Crescente, a bay Galacia max toji. A pax juẍtak Tito xin, a bay Dalmacia max toji.

English: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.
Kanjobal: Ti asan Lucas ayic' wetok. A yet chach tita, chi ec' e' Marcos etok, yujtol caw chi oc yopiso nak wuj mulnaj yin yet Cham Jajawil.

English: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
Kanjobal: Max in chektok juẍtak Tíquico bay Efeso.

English: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, and my scrolls, especially the parchments.
Kanjobal: A yet chach tita, elokab yin a c'ul chi ec' e' jun jokan pichilej max in bekcan bay Troas bay yatut Carpo, yetok juntzan in libro c'al juntzan wun yelxac'al watx' tol yowalil chi tita.

English: Alexander the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done.
Kanjobal: A nak Alejandro, nak tenom ch'en, caw yob chi yut ba nak ayin, palta ok paktzej Cham Jajawil yunben nak tu'.

English: You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.
Kanjobal: Ilc'al a ba bay nak ach ti', yujtol chi yak' nak ajc'ulal yin jun abix chi jalilok.

English: At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them.
Kanjobal: A yet max wal in ba yet babelal satak cham yajaw bay Roma, c'am junok mac max oc wetok. Maxc'al quin is bekcan eb in tx'oklil. Matawal c'am chi tit yowal c'ul Dios yin eb yuj tzet max yun eb tu'.

English: But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. And I was delivered from the lion's mouth.
Kanjobal: Palta max oc Cham Jajawil wetok. Max colwaj Cham wetok. Yuj tu' xan max je' waloncan el k'anejal yet colbanilej. Maxc'al yab eb man israelok masanil. A junel axca wal tol max in michchaj yuj junok no coj, cax ijan max in is chiaytok no', palta max in col-lay el yul ti' no' yuj Cham Jajawil.

English: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Kanjobal: Ok in is colil Cham yul k'ab masanil tzet man watx'ok. Watx' ok in yut c'uban aj Cham, yet watx' ok in apnok yul is k'ab bay satcan. Mimanokabc'al yelapnok Cham yin tojbalk'inal. Yunokabi.

English: Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
Kanjobal: Chak' cawil c'ul janab Prisca yetok juẍtak Aquila, yetokc'al eb cajan yetok Onesíforo bay yatut.

English: Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick in Miletus.
Kanjobal: A juẍtak Erasto max can bay Corinto. Axa juẍtak Trófimo xin, a bay Mileto max wak'canok, yujtol ya'ay.

English: Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers.
Kanjobal: Chach nanon a tita, yak'ban wal c'amto chi oc nabilk'inal. Chi yatok nak juẍtak Eubulo cawil a c'ul. Ilab c'apax juẍtak Pudente, yetok juẍtak Lino, c'al janab Claudia, c'al masanil eb creyente, chi ya c'apaxtok eb cawil a c'ul.

English: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.
Kanjobal: Ayokab oc Cham Jajawil Jesucristo etok. Yak'okabc'al Dios is watx'c'ulal ayex.

English: The elder, To my dear friend Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
Kanjobal: Ayin ton anciano in chin tz'ibejtok jun in carta ti' ayach, ach wuẍtak Gayo. Chach in camc'ulnej yin masanil in c'ul.

English: Dear friend, I pray that you may enjoy good health and that all may go well with you, even as your soul is getting along well.
Kanjobal: Ach wuẍtak camc'ulnebil, wojtak tol caw wal tec'an yak'on a nabal satak Dios. Chin txajli bay Dios oj, yet watx', watx'okabc'al chi ec' oj yin masanil tzet yetal, cax watx'okabc'al a c'ul, axca yak'on a nabal tu'.

English: It gave me great joy to have some brothers come and tell about your faithfulness to the truth and how you continue to walk in the truth.
Kanjobal: A yet max ul yalon ec' eb juẍtak tzetbil ayji ocok, caw wal max tzaloj aj in c'ul cayti', yujtol max yal eb tol caw wal ayoc a nabal yin cuybej acaw yel, cax asan ab jun cuybej yel ti' cha beybalnej.

English: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.
Kanjobal: A yet chi wabeni tol a eb max cha' Cristo wuj, ac'ala' beybalnen eb cuybej acaw yel, xan chin tzaloji. C'am junokxa tzet bay yel chi tzaloj in c'ul axca tu', yujtol axca tol wuninal yayji oc eb.

English: Dear friend, you are faithful in what you are doing for the brothers, even though they are strangers to you.
Kanjobal: Ach wuẍtak camc'ulnebil, watx' ton lanan oten a nabal bay tu' chi wabej. Chach ab colwaj bay eb juẍtak, c'al bay eb janab, caxc'al man ojtakok eb, palta cayab tu' chot a c'ul yin eb.

English: They have told the church about your love. You will do well to send them on their way in a manner worthy of God.
Kanjobal: Ay eb max alon satak iglesia ti', tol yel toni, tol ay a camc'ulal bay tu'. Matawal chach colwajc'al bay eb, yet ay bay chi toj eb ec'jabok. Moj axcac'al tu' chot colwaj a ba bay eb, yujtol caytu' chi yochej Dios.

English: It was for the sake of the Name that they went out, receiving no help from the pagans.
Kanjobal: A eb tu', asan yuj yak'on serbil eb Jesucristo, xan chi ec' eb. C'am jabok tzet yetal chi cha' eb bay eb man creyenteok.

English: We ought therefore to show hospitality to such men so that we may work together for the truth.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan co cuenta co colwaj bay eb. Ta chon colwaj bay eb, axca tol ayon jun lanan co mulnaj yetok eb, yet lanan yec' eb yalon el cuybej acaw yel.

English: I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first, will have nothing to do with us.
Kanjobal: Max in tz'ibejtok jun in carta ayex, mac ex che wajbaj e ba bay tu', palta axac'al Diótrefes chi yochej chex ikban bay tu'. A tzet chi jal ayon ti', c'am jabok yelapnok yul sat nak.

English: So if I come, I will call attention to what he is doing, gossiping maliciously about us. Not satisfied with that, he refuses to welcome the brothers. He also stops those who want to do so and puts them out of the church.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a yet ok in apnok ayex tu', cax ok walon tzet is mul nak, yujtol chi ec' naaj nak k'anej ayex jin. Man asannejok juntzan tu' chi yal nak, palta c'am chi cha' pax nak eb juẍtak chi apni ayex tu'. Ilab ta ayex che yochej che cha' eb, chi tit yowal nak e yin, toltax chex yuktej el nak xol iglesia tu'.

English: Dear friend, do not imitate what is evil but what is good. Anyone who does what is good is from God. Anyone who does what is evil has not seen God.
Kanjobal: Ach wuẍtak camc'ulnebil, manchak a beybalnej beybal eb man watx'ok is beybal. Asan beybal eb watx' cha beybalnej. Ta watx' chi jut co ba, tita' tol yet onxa Dios chi yal tu'. Palta a pax mac man watx'ok chi yut ba, man ojtakbilok Dios yuj.

English: Demetrius is well spoken of by everyone–and even by the truth itself. We also speak well of him, and you know that our testimony is true.
Kanjobal: Axa pax juẍtak Demetrio, watx' ab yul sat eb masanil, yujtol miman txequel tol lanan yiken jun cuybej a caw yel. Ilab on ti' c'apaxok, watx' nak yul co sat. E yojtak tol yel tzet chi jala'.

English: I have much to write you, but I do not want to do so with pen and ink.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al tzet yetal chi wochej chi waltok ayach, palta maj in tz'ibejtok yul jun in carta ti'.

English: I hope to see you soon, and we will talk face to face. Peace to you. The friends here send their greetings. Greet the friends there by name.
Kanjobal: Yujtol chin na', tol chok wal je' ach toj wiloni, cax ato yet tu' chin watx' alnejcan juntzanxa tzet yetal tu' ayach. Ayokab a junc'ulal bay tu'. Chi yatok eb creyente cayti' cawil a c'ul. Ti chi ja c'apaxtok cawil c'ul eb creyente bay tu'.

English: In my former book, Theophilus, I wrote about all that Jesus began to do and to teach
Kanjobal: Ayin ton Lucas in chin tz'iblitok ayach, ach Teófilo. Ayxa jun tx'an babel un tz'ibbilxatok wuj ayach, bay max waltok jantak tzet max el yunen Jesús, c'al jantak tzet max yak' cuylayok, yecheltaxc'al max chaon el yich Cham cuywaji,

English: until the day he was taken up to heaven, after giving instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
Kanjobal: masantac'al yet max jay c'ual paxaj satcan. A yet c'amto chi paxi, max yaloncan juntzan chekbanilej bay eb is chekbej, eb sic'bil el yuj atac'ala' max yun yikbelay yuj Cham Espíritu Santo.

English: After his suffering, he showed himself to these men and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God.
Kanjobal: A yet maxax ec'lej yin camich, tx'ial elc'al maxto tx'oxaj ba bay eb is chekbej tu'. Cawinakto c'u max tx'ox ba bay eb, tol yel max ictzonelay ajok. Max yaloncan bay eb, tol chi occan Dios Yajawil cayti'.

English: On one occasion, while he was eating with them, he gave them this command: “Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift my Father promised, which you have heard me speak about.
Kanjobal: A yet junel yet lanan low yetok eb is chekbej tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Cananek bay conob Jerusalén ti'. Echbanejek jun tzet albilcan ayex yuj Dios, yet max yak'oncan is ti', axca max wut walon ayex.

English: For John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.”
Kanjobal: Yel toni, a Juan max ak'wi bautizar yetok aej, palta a yet jayeb c'u, ok ak'lay Cham Espíritu Santo ayex, cax ok ex ak'lay bautizar yuj, ẍi Jesús.

English: So when they met together, they asked him, “Lord, are you at this time going to restore the kingdom to Israel?”
Kanjobal: A yet wajantoc'al ec' eb cuywom yetok Jesús max k'anlen el eb bay: —Mamin, ¿ami tinani' ok a col eb jet conob israel, yet watx' munilc'al chi jaoc co yajawil yul jet? ẍi eb bay.

English: He said to them: “It is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Maj ak'lay e yojtaknej el c'ual, c'al is tiempoal yet ok uj jun tu', yujtol a jun tiempoal tu', asan co Mam Dios ay yalon yet yin.

English: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
Kanjobal: Palta ok yak' Dios yipalil ayex, yet ok e chaon Cham Espíritu Santo junjun ex. Ok lajwok tu', axa e yak'on testigoal win bay Jerusalén ti', yetok bay masanil makbej Judea ti', c'al yulak yet Samaria, masantac'al bay chi lajwican apnok yulyibank'inal ti' ok e yaloncan elok, ẍi bay eb.

English: After he said this, he was taken up before their very eyes, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan ti', axa yilay ajtok satcan tu'. T'anan wal ajtok eb yin, cax max c'ayxac'al toj xol jun asun. Majxa yil eb yin.

English: They were looking intently up into the sky as he was going, when suddenly two men dressed in white stood beside them.
Kanjobal: T'ananto ajtok eb satcan yet max paxaj Jesús, axa yilon eb, lecanxa oc cawan ángel c'atan eb, axca yili anima. Sak lubinakxac'al yili pichil eb.

English: “Men of Galilee,” they said, “why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti' bay eb: —Ex aj Galileail winak, ¿tzet xan t'anan exc'al ajtok satcan? A Jesús ti', max ilay aj e xol, cax max paxaj satcan, axca wal max yun e yilon toj ti', caytu' ok yun jay paxok, ẍi eb bay eb.

English: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the hill called the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day's walk from the city.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu xin, axa paxaytek eb is cuywom bay tzalan Olivo tu', cax max meltzojtek eb bay Jerusalén. A jun tzalan tu', ay mi nanok legua xol ba yetok Jerusalén.

English: When they arrived, they went upstairs to the room where they were staying. Those present were Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew; James son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al jay eb bay yul conob tu', max ajtok eb bay jun cuarto ayajtok can bay ay is posada Pedro, yetok Jacobo, Juan, Andrés c'al Felipe, Tomás, Bartolomé, Mateo, Jacobo yuninal Alfeo, yetok Simón, jun partido ba yetok eb cananista yet yalantok, ajun c'apax Judas yuẍtak Jacobo. Junnej ay is posada eb masanil bay tu'.

English: They all joined together constantly in prayer, along with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al c'u chi wajbaj ba eb masanil, yuj txajli eb bay Dios. Ay eb ix chi txajli yetok eb. Ajun María is txutx Jesús yetok eb. Ajun c'apax eb yuẍtak Jesús tu'.

English: In those days Peter stood up among the believers (a group numbering about a hundred and twenty)
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ay mi junok 120 eb creyente wajan ocok. Axa yaj wan Pedro nan xol eb tu', max yalon axca ti':

English: and said, “Brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through the mouth of David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus–
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, yowalil ton max yun tzet albilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, yujtol a Cham Espíritu Santo ak'nejcan tz'ibej David yuj Judas, nak tx'oxwajwom bay eb mitx'wajwom yin Jesús.

English: he was one of our number and shared in this ministry.”
Kanjobal: A Judas tu' ayoc co tz'akilok yet yalantok, cax junnej jopiso yetok.

English: (With the reward he got for his wickedness, Judas bought a field; there he fell headlong, his body burst open and all his intestines spilled out.
Kanjobal: Palta max cha' tumin yin jun tzet yob max el yuneni, cax max manlay jun tx'otx' yetok ch'en tumin tu'. A bay tu' max titc'ay pitxnajok, axa yeltek secnaj yul c'ul tu'.

English: Everyone in Jerusalem heard about this, so they called that field in their language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)
Kanjobal: A eb aj Jerusalén ti', pilan max yab eb k'umal jun ti'. Yuj tu xin, xan max yak' eb yik jun tx'otx' tu' Acéldama yin is ti' eb. Chi yal elapnok, Tx'otx'al Chiq'uil Anima.

English: “For,” said Peter, “it is written in the book of Psalms, “ ‘May his place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in it,’ and, “ ‘May another take his place of leadership.’
Kanjobal: Axca tu' max yunej yujtol chi yal axca ti' yul tx'an Libro Salmos: Canokab is cajlobal yin tz'inanil. C'amokab mac chi cajay bay, ẍi. Chi yalon c'apax axca ti': Tx'okxaokab mactxel chi ioncan is yopiso, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Therefore it is necessary to choose one of the men who have been with us the whole time the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, co sic' junok mac chi oc q'uexelok nak, cax chi jaon oc yopiso yalon elok tol yel max ictzoj aj Jesús. A jun mactxel ok co siq'uil tu', yowalil a junok jetbeyomc'alta' co ba yetok, yet max con ec' yetok Cham Jajawil Jesús. A jun mactxel tu', a junok ac'al jun jetok, yettaxc'al max ak'lay bautizar Jesús yuj Juan, masantac'al max ilay paxaj satcan, ẍi Pedro bay eb.

English: beginning from John's baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection.” beginning from John's baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ay cawan winak max satnej oc eb, a ton José chi yik c'apax Barsabás, ac'al oc chi ikon c'apax Justo, yetok Matías.

English: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know everyone's heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max txajli eb masanil, max yalon eb yin is txaj tu' axca ti': Mamin, ojtakxa tzetbil yili co nabal on co masanil. Yuj tu xin, xan tx'ox ayon, mac junok ok a siq'uil xol cawan ti',

English: to take over this apostolic ministry, which Judas left to go where he belongs.”
Kanjobal: yet watx' chi oc yopiso cax chi oc chekbejok Jesucristo. Yujtol max ilay el Judas yin yopiso yuj is yobtakil, cax max tojcan bay jun lugar bay moj toji, ẍi eb.

English: Then they cast lots, and the lot fell to Matthias; so he was added to the eleven apostles.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max alay oc suerte yin eb cawanil. Max txecloj eltek yuj jun suerte tu' tol a Matías max occan yiban. Axa yoccan tz'akilok eb usluc'wan chekbej Jesucristo tu'.

English: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak bay conob Cesarea chi yik Cornelio. A jun winak tu', yajawil jun bulan eb soldado chi yik Aj Italia.

English: He and all his family were devout and God-fearing; he gave generously to those in need and prayed to God regularly.
Kanjobal: Caw wal ayoc Dios yin c'ul jun winak tu'. Ay is xiwc'ulal bay Dios, yetok masanil is familia. Xiwilc'al tzet chi el saon bay eb meba' xol eb israel. Caw wal chi yiajtek c'ulok txajli bay Dios.

English: One day at about three in the afternoon he had a vision. He distinctly saw an angel of God, who came to him and said, “Cornelius!”
Kanjobal: A yet junel, axca wayich max yut yilon jun tzet yetal yet jantak mi a las tres yet lajwi chuman. Ay jun yángel Dios max jayoc bay jun cuarto bay ayic' tu'. Max yalon bay axca ti': Cornelio, ẍi bay.

English: Cornelius stared at him in fear. “What is it, Lord?” he asked. The angel answered, “Your prayers and gifts to the poor have come up as a memorial offering before God.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc t'anan Cornelio tu' yin, caw wal max xiw yuj. ¿Tzet ẍi, Mamin? ẍi bay. Axa yalon bay axca ti': Mayal yab Dios a txaj. Mayal c'apax yil a sabal bay eb meba'. Maj tok c'ayc'ulal juntzan ti' yuj Cham.

English: Now send men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon who is called Peter.
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, chektok jaywanok winak bay Jope, cax chi toj yion eb Simón, nak chi yik Pedro.

English: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
Kanjobal: A tu' ayic' bay yatut nak chi ikon c'apax Simón, nak watx'nem tz'um. A yatut nak tu' a tu' ay bay ti a' mar, ẍi jun ángel tu' bay.

English: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier who was one of his attendants.
Kanjobal: Lajwi toj jun ángel tu xin, max yawtentek cawan eb is moso, yetok jun soldado yak'omal serbil. A jun soldado tu', asan yin Dios ayoc nabal.

English: He told them everything that had happened and sent them to Joppa.
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al tzet max al-lay bay yuj jun ángel tu', pilanc'al max yal bay eb. Lajwi tu' max cheklaytok eb yuj bay conob Jope.

English: About noon the following day as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray.
Kanjobal: Yewial tu xin, yet chumanxa c'u, lananxa yapni oc eb cawilal Jope tu', cax max ajtok Pedro txajlok yiban pananil yatut Simón tu'.

English: He became hungry and wanted something to eat, and while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.
Kanjobal: Yet ayxa ajtok bay tu', max c'oli tit is wajil, cax max k'anon low ba, palta yak'ban chi watx'nelay is lobej, ay tzet max ak'i yil axca junok wayichej.

English: He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.
Kanjobal: Cax jakan satcan max yila'. Ay jun tzet axca junok miman sábana max ulaytek. Ayc'al oc pixil canebal txiquin, max ayol bay pananil yiban te na bay ayajtok Pedro tu'.

English: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals, as well as reptiles of the earth and birds of the air.
Kanjobal: A yul jun axca sábana tu' ayoctok masanil makan no no' caneb yakan, no labaj, c'al no' chi ec' jenenok.

English: Then a voice told him, “Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.”
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yayol t'ununok xin, max yaben Pedro tu' yoc jay belan k'anej ti': Pedro, ajan wanok. Ak' cam juntzan no ti', cax cha chioni, ẍi.

English: “Surely not, Lord!” Peter replied. “I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Pedro tu' axca ti': C'amak Mamin, yujtol c'amto junelok chin lo' ma chin chi' junok comon tzet yetal, c'al junok tzet ay yowalil yuj ley Moisés, ẍi.

English: The voice spoke to him a second time, “Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal junelxa axca ti': A tzet chi yal Dios tol c'am yowalil, manchak ak' yowalil ach ti', ẍi.

English: This happened three times, and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven.
Kanjobal: Oxel max yun jun tu'. Max lajwi tu xin, max ilay paxaj jun axca sábana tu' satcan.

English: While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon's house was and stopped at the gate.
Kanjobal: Lananto naon Pedro tzet yayji juntzan max ak'i yil tu', max jayoc eb chekbej Cornelio ti' na. Lanan k'anlen eb bay ay yatut Simón tu', yet max titc'al eb yulak be.

English: They called out, asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc eb xin, max k'anlen eb axca ti': —¿A mi cayti' ayic' Simón, nak chi yik c'apax Pedro? ẍi eb.

English: While Peter was still thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Simon, three men are looking for you.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala'toc'al naobtanen Pedro tzet yayji juntzan max ak'i yil tu', cax max yalon Cham Espíritu Santo bay axca ti': Ay oxwan winak chach k'anlen ec'ok.

English: So get up and go downstairs. Do not hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them.”
Kanjobal: Ajan wanok, cax chach aytok. Asi' yetok eb. Aoc yin a c'ul a toj yetok eb, yujtol ayin max in chektek eb, ẍi bay.

English: Peter went down and said to the men, “I'm the one you're looking for. Why have you come?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max ayol bay ayic' eb chekbej Cornelio tu', cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ton chin e k'anlej ec'ok, xan tix in ti'. ¿Tzet ẍi e chekbanil ayin, xan chex jayi? ẍi bay eb.

English: The men replied, “We have come from Cornelius the centurion. He is a righteous and God-fearing man, who is respected by all the Jewish people. A holy angel told him to have you come to his house so that he could hear what you have to say.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb axca ti': —Ay jun cham chi yik Cornelio, yajawil eb soldado. Caw wal watx' is beybal cham. Chi xiw cham bay Dios. Watx' cham yul sat masanil eb et israelal. Ay is camc'ulal eb yin. Ay jun yángel Dios max alon bay cham, tol chi chektek cham is chekbej yet chach ul yitok, cax chach toj bay na, yet watx' chi yabcan oc tzet ok al bay, ẍi eb bay Pedro tu'.

English: Then Peter invited the men into the house to be his guests. The next day Peter started out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa went along.
Kanjobal: Axa yilay oc eb yul na yuj Pedro tu'. A tu' max way eb, axa yet junxa c'ual, max toj yetok eb, max toj c'apax jaywan creyente aj Jope yetok eb.

English: The following day he arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
Kanjobal: Yewialxa tu', max apni oc eb bay conob Cesarea. Echbanebil yapni eb yuj Cornelio tu'. Wajanxa ec' jantak eb yican, c'al jantak eb yamigo.

English: As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni Pedro bay tu', max eltek Cornelio tu' chaoni, cax max ay jajnaj satak, max yion ay ba bay Pedro tu'.

English: But Peter made him get up. “Stand up,” he said, “I am only a man myself.”
Kanjobal: Palta axa Pedro max quetzon aj wanok, max yalon bay axca ti': —Ajan wanok yujtol jet animail co ba, ẍi Pedro bay.

English: Talking with him, Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people.
Kanjobal: Lanan k'anjab eb max octok eb yul na. Axa yilon Pedro xiwil eb wajanxa ec'ok.

English: He said to them: “You are well aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with a Gentile or visit him. But God has shown me that I should not call any man impure or unclean.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb axca ti': —E yojtak, tol ayon israel on ti', ay leyal tol c'am chi je' co junanej co ba yetok junok tx'ok conobal. Ay leyal tol c'am chi je' chon oc yul yatut, palta max yak' Dios wojtaknej elok, tol c'am chi je' waloni ta ay junok mac tol c'am chi je' chin junanej in ba yetok.

English: So when I was sent for, I came without raising any objection. May I ask why you sent for me?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan c'am tzet max wal yet max quin bet e yak'on titok. A tinani xin, chi wochej chi wabej, ¿tzet yuj xan max quin bet e yak' titok? ẍi bay eb.

English: Cornelius answered: “Four days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cornelio tu' bay axca ti': —Yab mi wal axca hora ti' yet oxji, lanan woc yin c'ajbanc'ulal. Lanan in txajli yul watut ti' yet tz'eyanxa c'u, cax ay jun mac max tx'oxaj ba ayin, caw wal chi tzekeki pichil.

English: and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor.
Kanjobal: Max yal ayin axca ti': Cornelio, max yab Dios a txaj, cax max naontek juntzan a sabal chak' bay eb meba'.

English: Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.’
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, chektok jaywanok winak bay conob Jope, cax chi toj yiontek eb cham Simón, cham chi ikon Pedro. A tu' ayic' cham bay yatut nak chi ikon c'apax Simón, nak watx'nem tz'um. A yatut nak tu' a tu' ay bay ti a' mar, ẍi ayin.

English: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, axa in chekontok eb in chekbej tu' ach toj sayon ec'ok. Yuj wal dios ayach, max ekej a tita. A tinani', ayon ec' co masanil satak co Mam Dios yet watx' chi jab masanil tzet max chek Cham Jajawil al ayon, ẍi bay.

English: Then Peter began to speak: “I now realize how true it is that God does not show favoritism
Kanjobal: Axa chaon el Pedro yich k'anjab nan xol eb axca ti': —A tinani', wojtak tol wal yel, lajan yelapnok masanil anima yul sat Dios.

English: but accepts men from every nation who fear him and do what is right.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac ay yelapnok Dios yul sat, caxc'al man israelok, caw chi tzaloj yetok eb, asan tanej watx' is beybal eb.

English: You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, telling the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.
Kanjobal: A Dios ak'nejcan is k'anej ayon israel on ti'. Yalnakcan ayon, tol ay junc'ulal yetok Cham yuj Jesucristo, Cham tol Jajawil co masanil.

English: You know what has happened throughout Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached–
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', e yojtakxa tzet max el yunen Dios bay co lugar ayon israel on ti'. A bay Galilea elnakcan yich, yet max lajwi yalon el Juan k'anej Dios, c'al yak'wi bautizar anima.

English: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power, and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil, because God was with him.
Kanjobal: E yojtak, tol a Dios yak'nak Cham Espíritu Santo bay Jesús aj Nazaret, cax yak'nak c'apax ikbej bay. E yojtak c'apaxok tol colwajnak Jesús bay eb anima. Masanilc'al mac chi etax yuj nak diablo, pilan max watx'jican eb yuj. Max je' yunen masanil juntzan tu', yujtol ayoc Dios yetok.

English: “We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a tree,
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', chi jak' co ba testigoal yin masanil tzet max el yunen bay Judea yetok bay conob Jerusalén; caw wal max jila'. Max lajwi tu', max locban aj eb jet israelal yin curus. Caytu' max yun yak'on cam eb.

English: but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet yox c'ual tu', max yictzonej aj Dios, xan yuj is yipalil Cham max tx'oxaj ba ayon.

English: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen–by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
Kanjobal: Palta man masanilok anima bay max tx'oxaj ba. Asan ayon max tx'oxaj ba, yujtol atax payxa, sic'bil on el yuj joc is testigook. Cax max onto low yetok yet mayal ictzonelay aj xol eb camnak tu'.

English: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead.
Kanjobal: Max yalcan ayon, tol yowalil chi ec' jalil yabixal bay eb anima, tol a Dios ak'nej yopiso beyc'ulnen masanil anima, eb iquis, c'al eb camnak.

English: All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
Kanjobal: Yet payxa, ayokto max yaloncan el eb chekbej Dios yabixal Jesús. Yalnakcan junjun eb, tol masanilc'al mac ok yaoc c'ul yin, ok ak'laycan lajwok yobtakil eb yuj, ẍi Pedro bay eb.

English: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all who heard the message.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan k'anjab Pedro tu', cax max ayol Cham Espíritu Santo yiban masanil eb chi abxalwi tu'.

English: The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb creyente israel ajun yetok Pedro tu', yujtol max yak' c'apax Dios Yespíritu bay eb man israelok.

English: For they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God. Then Peter said,
Kanjobal: Max yab eb tol tx'ok tx'ok tiejal chi yal eb, cax max yaben c'apax eb yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: “Can anyone keep these people from being baptized with water? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon Pedro axca ti': —¿Chi mi wal je' tenlay oc wanaj eb ti', cax c'am chi yak' bautizar ba eb? Palta ilab tol max ak'lay Cham Espíritu Santo bay eb axca max yun yak'lay ayon, ẍi.

English: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for a few days.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Pedro tol chi ak'lay bautizar eb yin bi Jesucristo. Lajwi yak'lay bautizar eb tu', cax max yalon eb bay, tol chi can jayebok c'u yetok eb.

English: The apostles and the brothers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
Kanjobal: Max yaben eb chekbej Jesús c'al eb creyente aj Judea is k'umal tol ay eb man israelok max yaoc c'ul yin k'anej Dios.

English: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers criticized him
Kanjobal: Xan a yet max apni oc Pedro bay Jerusalén junelxa, max al-lay bay yuj juntzan eb creyente aj israel, tol man watx'ok max yut ba.

English: and said, “You went into the house of uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
Kanjobal: Max yal eb bay axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan max ach bet k'anjab yetok eb man israelok, cax max ach low yetok eb? ẍi eb bay.

English: Peter began and explained everything to them precisely as it had happened:
Kanjobal: Axa chaon el Pedro yich yalon bay eb masanil tzet max uj tu'. Max yalon axca ti':

English: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision. I saw something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to where I was.
Kanjobal: —Ayin ec' bay conob Jope. Lanan wal in txajli yet jun c'ual, axca wayichej max wut wilon yayol jun axca mimek sábana bay satcan. Ayoc pixbanil canebal txiquin, cax max ayol t'ununok bay ayin ec' tu'.

English: I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds of the air.
Kanjobal: Max in oc t'anan yin, yet watx' chi wila' tzet ayoctok yul. Axa max wiloni, ay juntzan no no' caneb yakan ayoctok. Ay no' ay is may. Ay labaj, ay c'apax juntzan no' chi ec' jenenok.

English: Then I heard a voice telling me, ‘Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.’
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa waben yoc jay belan k'anej axca ti': Pedro, ajan wanok, ak' cam juntzan no' ti', cax cha chioni, ẍi.

English: “I replied, ‘Surely not, Lord! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
Kanjobal: Max in tak'wi axca ti': C'amak Mamin, yujtol c'amto junelok chin lo' ma chin chi' junok comon tzet yetal, c'al junok tzet yetal ay yowalil yuj ley Moisés, quin chi bay.

English: “The voice spoke from heaven a second time, ‘Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon aytek bay satcan tu' junelxa ayin axca ti': A tzet chi yal Dios tol c'am yowalil, manchak ak' yowalil ach ti', ẍi.

English: This happened three times, and then it was all pulled up to heaven again.
Kanjobal: Oxel max yun jun tu'. Max lajwi tu', axa yilay paxaj jun axca sábana tu' satcan.

English: “Right then three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max apni oc oxwan winak bay te na bay ayin ec' tu'. A oxwan winak tu', a bay Cesarea petoj eb, max quin bet sayon ec' eb bay conob Jope.

English: The Spirit told me to have no hesitation about going with them. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man's house.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Yespíritu Dios ayin axca ti': Asi' yetok eb. Aoc yin a c'ul a toj yetok eb, ẍi. Max toj c'apax wakwan juẍtak ti' wetok. A yet max on apni oc on xin, max on oc yul yatut jun winak tu'.

English: He told us how he had seen an angel appear in his house and say, ‘Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ayon tu', tol ay jun ángel max yila' lecan oc yul yatut. Max ab yalon bay axca ti': Chektok jaywanok winak bay conob Jope, tokokab yi eb Simón, cham chi yik c'apax Pedro.

English: He will bring you a message through which you and all your household will be saved.’
Kanjobal: A ok ul aloncan jun abix ayach, yuj tzet watx' ok yun a colchaj yetok a familia, ẍi ab jun ángel tu' bay.

English: “As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came on them as he had come on us at the beginning.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max in chaon el yich in k'anjab nan xol eb, max ayol Cham Espíritu Santo yiban eb, axca max yun yayol jiban yet babelal.

English: Then I remembered what the Lord had said: ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
Kanjobal: Axa in naontek tzet albilcan yuj Cham Jajawil tu', yet max yaloncan axca ti': Yel toni, a Juan, aej max yak'balnej yak'wi bautizar, palta ayex ti', ok ak'lay Cham Espíritu Santo ayex, axca tol ok ex ak'lay bautizar yuj, ẍi.

English: So if God gave them the same gift as he gave us, who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to think that I could oppose God?”
Kanjobal: Max yak' Dios Yespíritu bay eb, axca max yut yak'on ayon, yet max jaon oc Cham Jajawil Jesucristo yin co c'ul. Yuj tu', ¿tom ok je' in tenon oc wanaj tzet chi el yuneni? ẍi Pedro tu' bay eb.

English: When they heard this, they had no further objections and praised God, saying, “So then, God has granted even the Gentiles repentance unto life.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yaben eb creyente aj Jerusalén tu' juntzan ti', c'amxa tzet max yal eb. Asanxanej tol max yal eb watx' k'anej bay Dios. Max yalon eb axca ti': —Toltax eb man israelok, ay eb max ak'lay na ba c'ul yuj Dios, yet watx' chi cha eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal jetok, ẍi eb.

English: Now those who had been scattered by the persecution in connection with Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus and Antioch, telling the message only to Jews.
Kanjobal: Atax yet max k'okch'ennelay cam Esteban cax max el yich yilon eb creyente yailal masanil. Yuj tu xin, max saklem toj eb elok. Ay eb max apni masantac'al bay Fenicia, yetok bay Chipre, c'al bay Antioquía. Cax max c'oli yaloncan el eb k'anejal yet colbanilej bay eb yet israelal bay max ca yapni oc eb, palta c'am tzet max yalcan el eb bay eb man israelok.

English: Some of them, however, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also, telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jaywan eb creyente aj Chipre yetok jaywan eb aj Cirene max apnioc bay Antioquía. Max yaloncan el eb yabixal Cham Jajawil Jesucristo nan xol eb man israelok bay tu'.

English: The Lord's hand was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
Kanjobal: Max oc Cham Jajawil yetok eb creyente tu', yuj tu' xan xiwil eb anima max q'uex is beybal, cax max yaon oc eb c'ul yin Cham Jajawil.

English: News of this reached the ears of the church at Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
Kanjobal: Max yab eb creyente aj Jerusalén k'umal jun tu', xan max chektok eb Bernabé bay Antioquía tu'.

English: When he arrived and saw the evidence of the grace of God, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts.
Kanjobal: A yet max apniocok, max yiloni, xiwil watx'c'ulal Dios max yak' yiban eb tu'. Yuj tu', caw wal max yi' is tzalojc'ulal yin eb, max c'oli yiptzelay eb masanil yuj. Max yalon bay eb, tol caw wal tec'anc'al chi yut ba eb, cax chi yaonc'al oc eb c'ul yin Cham Jajawil.

English: He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut cuywaj ba Bernabé tu' bay eb, yujtol watx' is nabal. Ayoc cham yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo. Caw chi yaoc c'ul yin Cristo, yuj tu' xan xiwil eb aj conob tu' max yaoc c'ul yin Cham Jajawil yuj.

English: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max toj Bernabé tu' bay conob Tarso, yuj toj sayon ec' Saulo bay tu'. Yet max ilchaj yuj, max yiontok bay conob Antioquía.

English: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch.
Kanjobal: Jun abil max ayji ec' eb yetok eb creyente bay tu'. Xiwil mac max cuy eb. A bay jun conob tu' max babji yak'lay yik eb creyente Cristiano.

English: During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ay jaywan eb chi yak'balnej Dios yin yal-lay el is k'anej. A bay Jerusalén petoj eb, max apni oc eb bay Antioquía tu'.

English: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world. (This happened during the reign of Claudius.)
Kanjobal: Ay jun yetbeyom eb chi yik Agabo, max aj wan nan xol eb creyente tu', max ak'lay yal yuj Yespíritu Dios axca ti': —Ay jun miman wajil ok jay yiban masanil yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi cham Agabo. (A tzet max yal tu' max yun yet ayoc Claudio yin yajawilal.)

English: The disciples, each according to his ability, decided to provide help for the brothers living in Judea.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max el wal yin c'ul eb creyente aj Antioquía colwajtok bay eb creyente aj Judea, atac'ala' jantak chi tzakay junjun yak'oni.

English: This they did, sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.
Kanjobal: Xan caytu' max yut yaontok eb yofrenda tu' bay eb anciano aj Judea. A ton Bernabé yetok Saulo max iontok jun ofrenda tu'.

English: It was about this time that King Herod arrested some who belonged to the church, intending to persecute them.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', max chail yich cham rey Herodes yetnen eb creyente.

English: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.
Kanjobal: Max yak'on cham tzoc'lay el jolom Jacobo, is yuẍtak Juan.

English: When he saw that this pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This happened during the Feast of Unleavened Bread.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon cham rey tu', tol max cha c'ul eb israel jun tu', axa yak'on mitx'lay Pedro. A yet jun is k'in eb israel, yet chi loon eb ixim pan c'am yich, a yet tu' max mitx'layi.

English: After arresting him, he put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al michchaji, max alay oc yul preso, waklajonwan soldado max tayneni. Cantakwan eb chi taynen junjun el. A naon Herodes tol a yet chi lajwi k'in Pascua, cax chi tx'oxlay eltek Pedro nan xol anima, cax chi beyc'ulnelayi.

English: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was earnestly praying to God for him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan caw wal taynebil Pedro yul preso tu'. Cac'al ti' txajli eb creyente yin masanil is c'ul yuj Pedro.

English: The night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries stood guard at the entrance.
Kanjobal: A yet jun ak'bal yet t'inanxa yilay eltek Pedro satak conob yuj Herodes tu', chi way Pedro nan xol cawan eb soldado, c'anani yayji yetok cab cadena. Ay c'apax oc taynemal ti' preso tu'.

English: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up. “Quick, get up!” he said, and the chains fell off Peter's wrists.
Kanjobal: Palta ayman max jayoc jun yángel Cham Jajawil. Pilan max sakbi yul preso tu' yuj. Axa tenon tz'eyil c'ul Pedro tu', max tenon el is wayan. Lajwi tu' max yalon bay axca ti': Ajan wan yin ayman, ẍi bay. Toxac'al max yak' elc'ay jolnaj ba ch'en cadena ayoc yin k'ab Pedro tu'.

English: Then the angel said to him, “Put on your clothes and sandals.” And Peter did so. “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me,” the angel told him.
Kanjobal: Max yalon jun ángel tu' bay axca ti': Cawxanej oc a c'alil, cax chaon oc a xanab, ẍi bay. Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay junelxa axca ti': Aoc a jokan pichil, cax chach tzakloj wintak, ẍi bay.

English: Peter followed him out of the prison, but he had no idea that what the angel was doing was really happening; he thought he was seeing a vision.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc tzakan yintak tu', max eltek yul jun cuarto bay ayoctok tu'. A naoni, tol chi wayichli, man yojtakok ta yel wali tol lanan yeltek.

English: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city. It opened for them by itself, and they went through it. When they had walked the length of one street, suddenly the angel left him.
Kanjobal: Max eq'ueltek eb bay cab lugar bay ayic' eb soldado taynen preso tu', cax max elol eb bay jun ch'en puerta bay cawilalxa ti' calle. A jun ch'en puerta tu', munilc'al max jak ba bay eb, max eltek eb. A yet max lajwi yec'tok eb bay junxa calle, cax max beklaycan Pedro tu' tx'oklil yuj jun ángel tu'.

English: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I know without a doubt that the Lord sent his angel and rescued me from Herod's clutches and from everything the Jewish people were anticipating.”
Kanjobal: Axa yilontek Pedro tu', tol caw wal yel. Yuj tu' xan max yal axca ti': A tinani', chi nachaj el wuj, tol caw yel max chektek Cham Jajawil jun yángel quin ul colon el yul k'ab Herodes, c'al yuj in colchaj c'apax el yalan jantak tzet chi yochej eb wet israelal chi yaoc wiban, ẍi.

English: When this had dawned on him, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered and were praying.
Kanjobal: Lananto naobtanen juntzan tu', max apni oc bay yatut María, is txutx Juan, nak chi yik c'apax Marcos. Xiwil mac wajan ec' txajlok bay jun na tu' yuj Pedro.

English: Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer the door.
Kanjobal: A yet max c'oxc'on octok bay babel puerta ti' calle, ay jun k'opoj ix chi yik Rode max eltek tak'wok.

English: When she recognized Peter's voice, she was so overjoyed she ran back without opening it and exclaimed, “Peter is at the door!”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yaben ix tol a Pedro, maj jak ix puerta tu'. Caw wal max tzaloj aj ix sic'libil, cax max yak'on ix yanej paxoc yul na yin ayman. Max yalon ix bay eb wajan ec' tu', tol a Pedro chi c'oxc'on octek ti' puerta.

English: “You're out of your mind,” they told her. When she kept insisting that it was so, they said, “It must be his angel.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb bay ix axca ti': —Tekan ay a yabil chabil, ẍi eb bay ix. Palta max tec'baj ba ix yaloni, tol wal yel a ton Pedro tu' ayic'ok, axa yalon eb axca ti': —Manak Pedro tu'. Tekan a jun ángel chi tayneni, tekan a' chi jayi, ẍi eb bay ix.

English: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
Kanjobal: Palta Pedro, ac'ala'c'al c'oxc'on octok bay puerta tu'. Axa yet max jakon eb, max yilon eb, tol a Pedro tu' ayic'ok. Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb yuj.

English: Peter motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and described how the Lord had brought him out of prison. “Tell James and the brothers about this,” he said, and then he left for another place.
Kanjobal: Max yak'on Pedro yechel yetok k'ab bay eb, yet watx' chi numay eb. Lajwi tu' max yalon bay eb tzetbil max yun yilay eltek yuj Cham Jajawil yul preso tu', max yalon c'apax bay eb axca ti': —Che yal juntzan ti' bay Jacobo, c'al bay juntzanxa eb juẍtak, ẍi. Lajwi tu xin, max el xol eb. Axa toj bay junxa lugar.

English: In the morning, there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.
Kanjobal: Axa max k'inibi aj junxa c'ual, axac'al chi yal eb soldado, yujtol maj nachaj el yuj eb, bay max ca toj Pedro tu'.

English: After Herod had a thorough search made for him and did not find him, he cross-examined the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there a while.
Kanjobal: Axa Herodes xin, caw wal max yak' saylay ec' sic'libil; palta majc'al ilchaj yuj eb saywajwom tu'. Catatu' max k'anlen el bay eb soldado tu', tzet max yun yel yet lanan taynen eb tu'. Lajwi tu xin, max chekon yak'lay cam eb. Lajwi tu', max el Herodes yul yet Judea, cax max toj cajay bay conob Cesarea.

English: He had been quarreling with the people of Tyre and Sidon; they now joined together and sought an audience with him. Having secured the support of Blastus, a trusted personal servant of the king, they asked for peace, because they depended on the king's country for their food supply.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, caw wal chi tit yowal cham rey Herodes yin eb anima aj Tiro c'al yin eb aj Sidón. Yuj tu xin, xan max lajtinej el ba eb, tzet watx' chi toj yut yalon ba eb bay cham. Max monten eb jun winak chi yik Blasto, nak sat yak'omal serbil cham rey tu'. Axa nak max yak'balnej eb, max bet k'anon nak mimanc'ulal bay cham rey tu' yin eb. Max k'an eb mimanc'ulal yujtol a bay conob cham rey tu' chi tit masanil tzet chi lo eb.

English: On the appointed day Herod, wearing his royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham rey tu' tzet c'ual chi jayoc eb satak cham. Yet jun c'ual max k'okcan cham tu', max yaoc cham juntzan is pichil caw wal watx', axca yet masanil eb rey chi yaocok. Lajwi tu' max ay chotan cham yul junok is trono, max c'oli k'anjab eltek cham bay eb anima tu'.

English: They shouted, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man.”
Kanjobal: Yet max lajwi yaben eb k'anjab cham, max yalon eb axca ti': A jun mac chi k'anjab eltek tu', man animaok, palta a junok eb dios chi k'anjabi, ẍi eb.

English: Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.
Kanjobal: Yet wal jun bek tu', max ak'laycan yabok ay yuj jun yángel Cham Jajawil, cax max oc is patzil, yujtol maj yala', tol asan co Mam Dios miman yelapnok. Catatu bian, max camajok.

English: But the word of God continued to increase and spread.
Kanjobal: Palta a k'anej Cham Jajawil xin, max saklemc'altok xol anima. Pilanc'al max al-lay el bay junjun lugar.

English: When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission, they returned from Jerusalem, taking with them John, also called Mark.
Kanjobal: A yet max xew yion ba tzet chi yun Bernabé yetok Saulo bay Jerusalén, max toj eb, cax max yiontok eb Juan yetok, nak chi yik Marcos, axa meltzoj eb bay Antioquía tu'.

English: In the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch) and Saul.
Kanjobal: A xol eb creyente aj conob Antioquía, ay juntzan eb chi yak' Dios yalil is k'anej, ay c'apax juntzan eb meẍtol: a ton Bernabé, yetok Simón, cham chi yik Niger, yetok Lucio aj conob Cirene, yetok Saulo. A c'apax jun Manaén, cham junnej ch'ibnak yetok Herodes, cham ayoc yajawil bay Galilea.

English: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
Kanjobal: A yet junel, lanan yoc culto satak Cham Jajawil, cax ay c'apax oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal, max yalon Cham Espíritu Santo bay eb wajan ec' tu' axca ti': Che siq'uil Bernabé yetok Saulo, cax ok oc eb yin mulnajil bay chi wawtej oc eb, ẍi bay eb.

English: So after they had fasted and prayed, they placed their hands on them and sent them off.
Kanjobal: Max yak'on eb c'ajbanc'ulal, c'al txajli eb. Lajwi tu xin, max yaon ajtok eb k'ab yiban jolom Bernabé yetok Saulo, axa cheklaytok eb yuj eb tu'.

English: The two of them, sent on their way by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.
Kanjobal: Chekbiltok Bernabé yetok Saulo yuj Cham Espíritu Santo, xan max toj eb bay conob Seleucia. A tu' max oc eb yul jun barco, yuj toj eb bay Chipre.

English: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. John was with them as their helper.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay conob Salamina, max ec' yalcan el eb k'anej Dios yulak nail culto eb yet israelal bay tu'. Ajun Juan Marcos chi colwaj yetok eb.

English: They traveled through the whole island until they came to Paphos. There they met a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max toj eb, max k'axponej eb Chipre tu', cax max apni eb bay conob Pafos. A tu' max yil-lej el ba eb yetok jun nak israel, chi yik Bar-jesús. A jun winak tu', chi yaloc ba tol tz'akan c'ul. Chi tz'ak yala' tol a Dios chi ak'on yalil is k'anej.

English: who was an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, an intelligent man, sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.
Kanjobal: A jun winak tu', junnej ay yetok cham Sergio Paulo, cham yajaw bay Chipre tu'. Caw wal jelan nabal cham Sergio tu'. Max yawtejtek cham Bernabé yetok Saulo, yujtol chi yochej cham chi yab k'anej Dios bay eb.

English: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.
Kanjobal: Palta nak chi yal tol tz'akan c'ul tu xin, chi yik c'apax Elimas, max teyelej ba yetok eb, yujtol maj yochej nak max yaoc Sergio tu' c'ul yin k'anej Dios.

English: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked straight at Elymas and said,
Kanjobal: Axa Saulo chi ikon c'apax Pablo, tol ayoc yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo, cax max oc t'anan yin nak Elimas tu',

English: “You are a child of the devil and an enemy of everything that is right! You are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery. Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord?
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay nak axca ti': —Ach ti', caw wal chak' a nabal etnen anima. Caw wal a nabal. C'ajol ach nak diablo. Ajc'ul ach oc yin masanil tzet yetal watx'. Axa k'anej Cham Jajawil, yelc'al elok. Yuj tu xin, ¿tzet yuj xan c'am cha bekcan etneni?

English: Now the hand of the Lord is against you. You are going to be blind, and for a time you will be unable to see the light of the sun.” Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ay tzet ok jay eban yuj Cham Jajawil. Ok yak' c'ayil a sat junok tiempoal. Tamwal yakan c'u, majxa je' elon jabok, ẍi Pablo tu' bay. Yet wal jun bek tu', max c'ayil sat nak. C'amxa jabok tzet chi je' yiloni. Axa yec' matxatxok sayon ec' junok mac chi quetzon bey tu'.

English: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was amazed at the teaching about the Lord.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon cham yajaw bay Chipre tu' jun ti', max yaon oc cham c'ul yin Dios. Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul cham yet max yaben juntzan cuybanil Cham Jajawil.

English: From Paphos, Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Max el eb bay conob Pafos tu', max oc Pablo yul jun barco yetok eb ajun yetok, axa yapni eb bay conob Perge yul yet Panfilia. Axa Juan Marcos xin, max beklaycan eb yuj, cax max meltzoj bay Jerusalén.

English: From Perga they went on to Pisidian Antioch. On the Sabbath they entered the synagogue and sat down.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max el eb bay Perge tu', axa toj eb bay conob Antioquía yul yet Pisidia tu'. A yet c'ual xewilal max oc eb yul nail culto eb yet israelal eb, max ay chotjab eb yul tu'.

English: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue rulers sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have a message of encouragement for the people, please speak.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yawtelay ley Moisés yetok juntzan tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios payxa, max yak'on eb yajawil nail culto tu' yal jun winak bay Pablo, c'al bay Bernabé axca ti': —Ex wet conob, ta ay junok tzet yetal che yochej che yak' cuy eb anima, chi je' e yalon tinani', ẍi bay eb.

English: Standing up, Paul motioned with his hand and said: “Men of Israel and you Gentiles who worship God, listen to me!
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan Pablo tu', max yak'on yechel yetok is k'ab, yet watx' chi cam yaben eb. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ex wet israelal, c'al ex ay e xiwc'ulal bay Dios, abek.

English: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers; he made the people prosper during their stay in Egypt, with mighty power he led them out of that country,
Kanjobal: A co Diosal ayon israel on ti', a' sic'nakcan el eb jichmam. A yet ayic' eb nan xol eb tx'ok conobal bay Egipto, a' ak'nej ch'ib bisil eb, max occan eb mimek conobal. Lajwi tu', max yion eltek eb bay Egipto tu' yetok is yipalil.

English: he endured their conduct for about forty years in the desert,
Kanjobal: Cawinak abil max ak'layc'al techaj beybal eb yuj Dios bay tz'inan tx'otx'.

English: he overthrew seven nations in Canaan and gave their land to his people as their inheritance.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, max yak' c'ayil ukeb conobal anima yul yet Canaán, cax max yak'can tx'otx' eb max c'aylay el tu' bay eb jichmam.

English: All this took about 450 years. “After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.
Kanjobal: A yin masanil juntzan ti' max ec' 450 abil. Lajwi tu' max yaon oc Dios juntzan eb juez yuj yak'wi cuenta eb masantac'al yul is tiempoal Samuel is chekbej.

English: Then the people asked for a king, and he gave them Saul son of Kish, of the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max k'anon eb junok is reyal bay Dios, yet watx' a' chi ak'on cuenta eb. Yuj tu' xan max yak' Dios cham Saúl reyalok eb. A Saúl tu', c'ajol jun cham chi ikon Cis, yinatil Benjamín. Cawinak abil ocnak reyalok eb,

English: After removing Saul, he made David their king. He testified concerning him: ‘I have found David son of Jesse a man after my own heart; he will do everything I want him to do.’
Kanjobal: Max ilay el yin yopiso yuj Dios, axa David max occan q'uexelok, cham mac yalnaktek Dios axca ti': Max ilchaj David wuj, nak c'ajol Isaí. A jun winak ti', caw wal chin tzaloj yetok. Ok yun masanil tzet chi yochej in c'ul, ẍi.

English: “From this man's descendants God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as he promised.
Kanjobal: A jun yinatil David tu' chi yik Jesús, a' chekbiltek co Colomalok ayon israel on ti' yuj Dios, axcata' max yut yak'oncan is ti'.

English: Before the coming of Jesus, John preached repentance and baptism to all the people of Israel.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi chail yich mulnaj Jesús, cax max yalon el Juan nan xol eb jet israelal, tol yowalil chi na ba eb, cax chi yak'on bautizar ba eb.

English: As John was completing his work, he said: ‘Who do you think I am? I am not that one. No, but he is coming after me, whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa yajapnok tiempoal yoc wanaj yopiso Juan tu', max yalon axca ti': A e naoni tol Cristo in, titol c'amak paxok. Palta ay jun Cham tzakan jay wintak tol miman yelapnok, toltax man in mojok woc yak'omalok serbil Cham tu', toltax in xuyon el xanab, tutun man in mojok, ẍi.

English: “Brothers, children of Abraham, and you God-fearing Gentiles, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.
Kanjobal: Ex wet animail, ex yinatil Abraham wetok, c'al ex man israelok ay e xiwc'ulal bay Dios, a jun k'anejal yet colbanilej ti', e yet wetok.

English: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.
Kanjobal: Palta eb aj Jerusalén, yetok eb yajawil eb, c'am chi nachaj el yuj eb, tatol co Colomal yayji Jesús. Junjunc'al c'ual xewilal, cac'al ti' yaben eb yabixal tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios, palta majc'al nachaj el yuj eb. Yuj tu' xan a yet max yaon oc eb camich yiban Jesús, max yak'on eb yun tzet tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: Though they found no proper ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
Kanjobal: C'am jabok yobtakil max ilchaj el yin Jesús yuj eb, xan man mojok yak'lay camok, palta max occ'al tean eb yin Pilato k'anon camich yiban.

English: When they had carried out all that was written about him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a tomb.
Kanjobal: Pilan max yak' eb yun axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Lajwi tu', cax yion aytek eb is mimanil Cham yin curus, axa bet yaon octok eb yul jun ch'en ch'en tu'.

English: But God raised him from the dead,
Kanjobal: Palta max ictzonelay aj yuj Dios xol eb camnak.

English: and for many days he was seen by those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now his witnesses to our people.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', tx'ial c'ualto ec'nak yetok eb is cuywom, eb titnak yetok bay Galilea cax jaynak eb yetok bay Jerusalén yet c'amto chi cami. A eb tu', lanan yalon el eb yabixal nan xol anima tinani'.

English: “We tell you the good news: What God promised our fathers
Kanjobal: Ayon ti' lanan jalon c'apax ayex jun watx' abix ti', tol max yun yuj Dios co satak bay max yak' is ti' bay eb jichmam.
