English: Amazed and perplexed, they asked one another, “What does this mean?”
Kanjobal: Toc'al max c'ayaj c'ul eb masanil. Max somchaj el c'ul eb, max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzetlaj yayji juntzan ti'? ẍixac'al eb.

English: Some, however, made fun of them and said, “They have had too much wine. ”
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzanxa eb xin, tol chi buchwaj eb, cax chi yalon eb axca ti': —A juntzan eb ti', uq'uem an eb, ẍi eb.

English: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice and addressed the crowd: “Fellow Jews and all of you who live in Jerusalem, let me explain this to you; listen carefully to what I say.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan max aj wan Pedro yetok eb usluc'wan yet chekbejal. Max k'anjab nan xol conob yin ipejal axca ti': Ex aj Judeail winak, c'al jantak ex ayex ec' bay conob Jerusalén ti', ti chi wak' e yojtaknej el tzet yayji jun ti'. Acbajek e txiquin bay tzet ok wal ayex.

English: These men are not drunk, as you suppose. It's only nine in the morning!
Kanjobal: ¿Tom che na' tol uq'uem an on? C'amak. Ilab tol tolto chi aj c'u.

English: No, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:
Kanjobal: Palta a jun tzet chi uj ti' max yalcan Joel, jun is chekbej Dios yet payxa, ayokto max yaloncan yabixal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, yet max yaloncan axca ti':

English: “ ‘In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, your old men will dream dreams.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Dios axca ti': A yet ok jay lajub tiempoal, ok waoc Wespíritu yin masanil anima. Ok yal eb e c'ajol c'al eb e cutz'in in k'anej. A eb ach'ej ay tzet ok tx'oxlay yil eb, c'al eb icham winak ok in k'anjab bay eb yin wayichejal.

English: Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.
Kanjobal: A yet juntzan c'ual tu', ok wacan oc Wespíritu yin eb nak in chekbej c'al yin eb ix in chekbej, cax ok yalon el eb in k'anej.

English: I will show wonders in the heaven above and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and billows of smoke.
Kanjobal: Ok in tx'ox juntzan tzet yetal bay satcan, ok c'ayaj c'ul anima yiloni, yetok c'apax bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok in tx'ox c'apax juntzan tzet chi tx'oxon el wipalil. A ton chic', k'ak'ej, c'al miman mub axca asun.

English: The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.
Kanjobal: A c'u ok k'ekbok, axa xajaw axcaxac'al chic' ok yuncan elok, ẍi Cham Jajawil. A juntzan ti' ok yun yet c'amto chi jay jun c'ual yet yowal c'ul Cham. A jun c'ual tu', caw wal miman yelapnok, cax ok c'ayaj c'ul anima yuj.

English: And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
Kanjobal: Axa masanil mac chi yal ba bay Cham Jajawil, ok colchaj el eb, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: “Men of Israel, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders and signs, which God did among you through him, as you yourselves know.
Kanjobal: Ex wet israelal, acbajek e txiquin bay juntzan ok wal ayex ti'. Max tx'oxk'abnej el Dios yopiso Jesús aj Nazaret ayex, yet max el yunen juntzan milagro, juntzan tzet yetal c'am bay chi jila', yetok juntzanxa tzet chi tx'oxon el is yipalil. A juntzan ti' max el yunen Dios yetok Cham. E yojtakxa juntzan ti' ayex ti'.

English: This man was handed over to you by God's set purpose and foreknowledge; and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to the cross.
Kanjobal: Palta a Cham max alaycan oc yul e k'ab, yujtol axca tu' max el yin c'ul Dios. Nabilxa yuj Dios yettax payxa, tzet ok jayoc yiban Cham. Ayex ti', max e k'anbalnej eb yobtakwom, yet max e yak'on mitx'layok cax max e locban aj yin curus. Caytu' max e yut e yak'on camok.

English: But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.
Kanjobal: Palta max ictzonelay aj yuj Dios cax max elcan yikbej yailal camich yiban yujtol junelnej c'am yalon yet camich tu' yin.

English: David said about him: “ ‘I saw the Lord always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
Kanjobal: A cham rey David, yalnakcan yabixal Jesús, tol ok ictzonelayc'alta' ajok, xan max yalcan axca ti': Wojtak tol ayc'al oc Cham Wajawil wetok. Yujtol ayic' Cham bay in watx' k'ab, xan c'am chi somchaj el in c'ul.

English: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will live in hope,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan caw chi tzaloj in c'ul, cax chin bitni yin tzalojc'ulal. C'am tzet chin na' yuj in mimanil ti', yujtol chach waoc yipok in c'ul.

English: because you will not abandon me to the grave, nor will you let your Holy One see decay.
Kanjobal: Yujtol man ok a bekcan wanimail xol eb camnak, tamwal ok a cha' k'atok in mimanil ti', ayin tol sic'bil in el oj ti'.

English: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.’
Kanjobal: Max ak' wojtaknej el beal k'inalej. Ok in ak' tzalojbok yet ayin ec' etok, ẍi David tu' yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: “Brothers, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and his tomb is here to this day.
Kanjobal: Ex wet conob, caw miman txequel tzet max yun yelcan apnok jichmam David tu'. Jojtak, tol camnak, cax mukaynak c'apaxok. A is mukbanil bay mukan tu' ac'ala' txequel tinani'.

English: But he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him on oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne.
Kanjobal: Palta a David tu', chekbej Dios yayji. Yojtak tol caw yel, ak'bil ton can ti' Dios bay, tol a Cham Cristo t'inan yelcan yinatilok, cax chi occan reyalil is q'uexelok.

English: Seeing what was ahead, he spoke of the resurrection of the Christ, that he was not abandoned to the grave, nor did his body see decay.
Kanjobal: Ayokto max yojtaknen el David tu', tzet ok eloc Cham Cristo. Yuj tu' xan yalnakcanok, tol t'inan yictzonelay aj Cham. Yalnakcanok tol man ok beklaycan yuj Dios xol eb camnak, cax man ok chalay k'atok is mimanil c'apaxok.

English: God has raised this Jesus to life, and we are all witnesses of the fact.
Kanjobal: A Jesús, a Dios max ictzonen ajok. Co masanil, chi jak' co ba testigoal yin jun ti', yujtol max jila'.

English: Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, max ilay paxaj satcan yuj yipalil Dios. Max yak' co Mam Dios Yespíritu bay, axcata' max yut yak'oncan is ti'. A Jesús max aontek jun che yil ti', c'al che yab ti'.

English: For David did not ascend to heaven, and yet he said, “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand
Kanjobal: A cham David, maj tok satcan yetok is mimanil, palta max yalcan axca ti': Max yal Dios Jajawil bay Cham Wajawil axca ti': Ayan chotan bay in watx' k'ab ti',

English: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.” ’
Kanjobal: masantac'al ok wacan oc eb ajc'ul oc en batxlubok akan, ẍi Dios, ẍi David tu'.

English: “Therefore let all Israel be assured of this: God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
Kanjobal: A Jesús ti', max e curusnej, palta chi wochej che yojtaknej el sic'libil e masanil ex wet israelal, tol a' co Yajawil yuj Dios, a' ay yopiso yin Cristoal, ẍi Pedro tu'.

English: When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb wajan ec' bay tu' juntzan ti', caw wal max oc pitz'an yail yin c'ul eb, max yalon eb bay Pedro yetok bay juntzanxa eb chekbej Jesucristo axca ti': —Ex jet conob, ¿tzet watx' chi jun tinani'? ẍi eb bay eb.

English: Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Pedro bay eb axca ti': —Naek e ba, cax che yak'on bautizar e ba junjun ex yin bi Jesucristo, yet watx' chi ilaycan el e yobtakil. Catatu bian, cax ok cajban oc Dios Yespíritu e yin junjun ex.

English: The promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off–for all whom the Lord our God will call.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol caytu' max yut yak'oncan is ti' ayex c'al ayon, c'al bay eb e yuninal, yetok masanil bay jantak eb cajan bay najat, yujtol a Cham Jajawil co Diosal, chi yak' Yespíritu bay masanil mac chi yawtej oc Cham yetok, ẍi Pedro bay eb.

English: With many other words he warned them; and he pleaded with them, “Save yourselves from this corrupt generation.”
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al tzet yetal max yal bay eb, c'al yin yak'on na ba c'ul eb. —¡Colek e ba bay jun yailal ok jay yiban eb jet animail yobtakwom! ẍi Pedro tu' bay eb.

English: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ay eb max yaoc yin c'ul, tzet max yal Pedro tu', xan max yak' bautizar ba eb. A eb max oc creyenteal yet jun c'ual tu', ay mi oxebok mil eb.

English: They devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and to the fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max yaoc eb c'ul yin juntzan cuybanilej max yak' eb chekbej Jesús. Junxanej max yut eb nabal masanil. Chi wajbanc'al ba eb. Chi loon eb ixim pan, ixim nabaniltek Cham Jajawil, cax chi txajlic'al eb.

English: Everyone was filled with awe, and many wonders and miraculous signs were done by the apostles.
Kanjobal: A eb chekbej Jesús, xiwil milagro max yun eb, yuj tx'oxon el eb yipalil Dios. Yuj tu xin, max xiwaj eb anima masanil.

English: All the believers were together and had everything in common.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb max yaoc c'ul yin Cristo, junxanej max yut ba eb. Junxanej c'apax max yut eb is tzetak yetal.

English: Selling their possessions and goods, they gave to anyone as he had need.
Kanjobal: Aylaj eb chi txonil is tx'otx', c'al juntzanokxa tzet ay eb, cax chi pojon ec' eb is tojol tu' xolak eb, atac'ala' is cawxinakil junjun eb.

English: Every day they continued to meet together in the temple courts. They broke bread in their homes and ate together with glad and sincere hearts,
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al c'u, cayc'al ti' wajban ba eb bay yamak'il templo Dios. Chi wajbaj c'apax ba eb bay nalak, cax chi pojon ec' eb is pan xol. Junxanej loj chi yun eb yuj tzalojc'ulal. Caw chi aj can junc'ulal xol eb.

English: praising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.
Kanjobal: Cax chi yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios. Caw wal chi tzaloj masanil anima yetok eb. Cayc'al ti' max yun yak'lay ch'ib bisil iglesia yuj Cham Jajawil junjun c'u, yuj eb lananc'al colchaji.

English: When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples and, after encouraging them, said good-by and set out for Macedonia.
Kanjobal: A yet mayal lajwi jun uchlejbail tu', cax max yak'on Pablo wajbaj oc ba eb creyente, yuj yiptzencan eb. Lajwi tu', max tak'li bay eb, axa toj yul yet Macedonia tu'.

English: He traveled through that area, speaking many words of encouragement to the people, and finally arrived in Greece,
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc bay tu', pilan max ec' yil eb creyente bay junjun conob, axa yec' yalaycan oc nabal eb yuj tu'. Lajwi tu' max toj bay Grecia.

English: where he stayed three months. Because the Jews made a plot against him just as he was about to sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia.
Kanjobal: Oxeb xajaw max ayji ec' bay tu'. Chi yochej chi oc yul barco cax chi toj bay Siria, axa max yabeni, ay eb yet israelal chi ochen chi mitx'oni. Yuj tu xin, xan max na' tol watx' chi meltzoj pax bay Macedonia junelxa.

English: He was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, Timothy also, and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia.
Kanjobal: A yet max toji, ay juntzan eb creyente max toj yetok, a ton Sópater, c'ajol Pirro cham aj Berea, Aristarco, c'al Segundo aj Tesalónica, yetok Gayo aj Derbe, c'al Timoteo. Ay c'apax cawan eb aj Asia max toj yetok, a ton Tíquico yetok Trófimo.

English: These men went on ahead and waited for us at Troas.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay conob Filipos, max can Pablo yuj eb bay tu', max babji toj eb bay conob Troas. Ata tu' max on yechbanen eb.

English: But we sailed from Philippi after the Feast of Unleavened Bread, and five days later joined the others at Troas, where we stayed seven days.
Kanjobal: Axa ayon ti xin, a bay conob Filipos max jechbanej jilon jun k'in, yet chi lolay ixim pan c'am yich. Lajwic'al yec' jun k'in tu', max on toj yul barco. Oyeb c'u max on bey yiban a' mar, catatu' bian, max on apni bay conob Troas. A ta tu' max jil-lej co ba yetok eb max babji toj co satak tu'. Ukeb c'u max on ec' bay tu'.

English: On the first day of the week we came together to break bread. Paul spoke to the people and, because he intended to leave the next day, kept on talking until midnight.
Kanjobal: Axa yet domingo, max co wajban oc co ba yetok eb creyente masanil, yuj co loon ixim pan, yet nabaniltek Cham Jajawil. A Pablo max ak'on cuybanil eb creyente. Tutun tol t'inanxa chi toj yet yecal, xan xiwil tzet max yalcan bay eb, masantac'al max chumay ak'bal.

English: There were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting.
Kanjobal: A yul jun cuarto yiban, a tu' max co wajbaj co ba. Xiwil tzektebal eb max yaocok.

English: Seated in a window was a young man named Eutychus, who was sinking into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on. When he was sound asleep, he fell to the ground from the third story and was picked up dead.
Kanjobal: Ay jun nak ach'ej chi yik Eutico. Chotan eltok nak ti wentena. Chi nojxi nak wayi, yujtol miman yutnak Pablo yakan is mensaje. Max tojxac'al chememok wayan yiban nak sic'libil, axa yel pitxnaj nak tu'. Ata bay yet is yox piso max tit nak. Camnakxa nak yet max ul sic'lay aj wan nak.

English: Paul went down, threw himself on the young man and put his arms around him. “Don't be alarmed,” he said. “He's alive!”
Kanjobal: Max ayol Pablo xin, axa yay paknaj yiban tu', cax max lak'lay aj nak yuj. Axa yalon bay eb creyente axca ti': —Manchak ex oc il. Mayal ictzoj aj nak, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he went upstairs again and broke bread and ate. After talking until daylight, he left.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max on ajtok yul cuarto tu' yetok Pablo junelxa. Axa pojon ec' ixim pan co xol tu', max co loon ixim. Xiwiltoc'al tzet max yal Pablo tu', masantac'al max sakbi ajok. Lajwi tu' cax max toji.

English: The people took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted.
Kanjobal: A nak ach'ej max ictzoj aj tu xin, max ilaytok nak bay yatut. Caw wal chi tzaloj eb, yujtol max ictzoj aj nak.

English: We went on ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos, where we were going to take Paul aboard. He had made this arrangement because he was going there on foot.
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', max on oc yul barco, max on toj bay conob Asón. A tu' max jechbanej yapni Pablo, axca max jut jalon yetok, yujtol yakan max yaocok max toji.

English: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni Pablo ayon bay conob Asón tu', max oc yul barco jetok, axa co toj yetok bay conob Mitilene tu'.

English: The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Kios. The day after that we crossed over to Samos, and on the following day arrived at Miletus.
Kanjobal: Max ton toj xin, axa yet junxa c'ual max on ec' cawilal conob Quío. Axa yet junxa c'ual, max on apni bay junxa conob chi yik Samos ayay ti a' mar tu'. Yet junxa c'ual max on toj paxok, catatu max on apnioc bay conob Mileto.

English: Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in the province of Asia, for he was in a hurry to reach Jerusalem, if possible, by the day of Pentecost.
Kanjobal: Maj yal c'ul Pablo max on ec' bay conob Efeso, yujtol max yochej yin aymanil chon ec' bay Asia tu', yet watx' chon tzakay japni jilon k'in Pentecostés bay Jerusalén.

English: From Miletus, Paul sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church.
Kanjobal: A yet max on apni bay conob Mileto, max yaontok Pablo is chekbej bay eb yancianoal iglesia bay Efeso, yuj bet yawtelay eb.

English: When they arrived, he said to them: “You know how I lived the whole time I was with you, from the first day I came into the province of Asia.
Kanjobal: A yet max jay eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti': Ayex ti', e yojtakxa in beybal yettaxc'al max in ulic' bay Asia ti'.

English: I served the Lord with great humility and with tears, although I was severely tested by the plots of the Jews.
Kanjobal: Ayinc'al oc wak'on serbil Cham Jajawil yin ayilal. Ay bay max in ok' sic'libil yuj pitalil anima. Xiwil el max in ak'lay porobal yuj juntzan tzet man watx'ok max yaoc eb wet israelal wiban.

English: You know that I have not hesitated to preach anything that would be helpful to you but have taught you publicly and from house to house.
Kanjobal: Palta ti wal e yojtak, maj in bek walon juntzan cuybanilej watx' ayex, tol e watx'ilalok chi yun yelocok. Pilan max wal k'anej Dios ayex satak conob, c'al bay e yatut.

English: I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus.
Kanjobal: Max wal bay eb wet israelal, c'al bay eb man israelok, tol yowalil chi na ba eb satak Dios, cax chi yaon oc eb c'ul yin Cham Jajawil Jesucristo.

English: “And now, compelled by the Spirit, I am going to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ok in tok bay Jerusalén, yujtol chin ilaytok yuj Cham Espíritu Santo. Man wojtakok tzet ok jay wiban bay tu'.

English: I only know that in every city the Holy Spirit warns me that prison and hardships are facing me.
Kanjobal: Palta wojtak, a bay junjun conob bay chin eq'ui, chi yal Cham ayin, tol yowalil ok in oc preso bay tu', cax xiwil ab yailal ok wila'.

English: However, I consider my life worth nothing to me, if only I may finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me–the task of testifying to the gospel of God's grace.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am chin oc il yuj juntzan tu'. Caxc'al chin cam yuj, palta c'am yelapnok jun camich tu' yul in sat. Asantanej wal chi wak' lajwok jun in mulnajil mitx'bil oc ti' yin tzalojc'ulal, cax chi lajwi wopiso yak'nak Cham Jajawil Jesús ayin, jun opiso yin aloj el k'anejal yet colbanilej yuj is watx'c'ulal Dios.

English: “Now I know that none of you among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom will ever see me again.
Kanjobal: Ec'nak in wal ayex, tzet chi yun e yoc yul k'ab Dios. A tinani', wojtak, tol c'amxa bak'in ok jil-lej co ba cay ti'.

English: Therefore, I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of all men.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a tinani' chi walcanok, tol c'amxa walon wet yin is c'aynakilal junok mactxel.

English: For I have not hesitated to proclaim to you the whole will of God.
Kanjobal: Yujtol pilan albil cuybej Dios ayex wuj. C'am junok tzet max in c'ubaj el ayex.

English: Keep watch over yourselves and all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers. Be shepherds of the church of God, which he bought with his own blood.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, taynejekc'al e ba, cax che taynen eb creyente masanil, yujtol ak'bil e yopiso yuj Cham Espíritu Santo e yilon yiglesia Cham Jajawil, eb max man yetok is chiq'uil yet max cam jujc'al.

English: I know that after I leave, savage wolves will come in among you and will not spare the flock.
Kanjobal: Yujtol wojtak, tol a yet ok in tok, ay juntzan eb ok jay ayex. Ok yak'lej eb ex yuchon saklemok, axca chi yut yak'on c'ayil no ok no calnel.

English: Even from your own number men will arise and distort the truth in order to draw away disciples after them.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax e xol ayex ti', ay juntzan eb ok txecloj ajok, cax ok yak'on eb juntzan lek'tial, yuj yak'on eb c'ul eb creyente, yet watx' chi oc eb yetok eb.

English: So be on your guard! Remember that for three years I never stopped warning each of you night and day with tears.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, taynejekc'al e ba. Naektek, tol oxeb abil cac'al ti' ex in cuyon junjun ex, c'ualil c'al k'ekbintakil. Toltax ay bay chin ok'i chex in cuyoni.

English: “Now I commit you to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, ex wuẍtak, chex wabenejcan oc yul k'ab Dios. A ok ex taynen yetok is k'anej. A is k'anej tu', caw wal max tx'ox watx'c'ulalil ayon; ay yipalil is k'anej tu' yak'on co tec'anil, c'al yak'on co satak, yujtol ayxa jalon jet yetok eb sic'bilxa el yuj.

English: I have not coveted anyone's silver or gold or clothing.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', c'am bay max wochej oc tumin, tamwal pichil junok anima.

English: You yourselves know that these hands of mine have supplied my own needs and the needs of my companions.
Kanjobal: Ilab e yojtak, caw chin mulnaj yetok in k'ab, yuj tzet chi oc yopiso wuj, c'al tzet chi oc yopiso yuj eb ajun wetok.

English: In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max in tx'ox ayex, tol yowalil chi jilc'al co mulnajil, yet watx' chi je' co colwaj bay eb chi cawxi elok. Yowalil chi co natek tzet yalnak Cham Jajawil Jesús junel axca ti': Watx' yet eb chi saoni, yintak eb chi chaon sabalej tu', ẍi Cham, ẍi Pablo bay eb anciano tu'.

English: When he had said this, he knelt down with all of them and prayed.
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon Pablo juntzan ti', max ay jajanok, axa txajli yetok eb masanil tu'.

English: They all wept as they embraced him and kissed him.
Kanjobal: Lajwi txajli eb xin, cax max jichchaj c'ul eb yok' masanil. Yin junjunal chi oc lak'an eb yin Pablo tu', max tz'ubon el eb is ti'.

English: What grieved them most was his statement that they would never see his face again. Then they accompanied him to the ship.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max cus eb sic'libil, yujtol max yal bay eb tol c'amxa bak'in ok yil-lej ba eb yetok. A yet max toj Pablo tu', max bet alaycan yuj eb masantac'al bay max oc yul barco.

English: After we had torn ourselves away from them, we put out to sea and sailed straight to Cos. The next day we went to Rhodes and from there to Patara.
Kanjobal: Max can eb creyente tu' juj xin, max on oc yul barco, t'inan max on apni bay conob Cos. Axa yet junxa c'ual, max on toji, axa japni on bay conob Rodas. Lajwi tu', max con toj pax junelxa, max on apni on bay conob Pátara.

English: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, went on board and set sail.
Kanjobal: A tu' max on oc yul jun barco lananxa toj bay Fenicia, max on toj bian.

English: After sighting Cyprus and passing to the south of it, we sailed on to Syria. We landed at Tyre, where our ship was to unload its cargo.
Kanjobal: Lananxa co bey yiban a' xin, max jilontok bay co q'uexan k'ab jun sutan tx'otx' nan a' mar, chi yik Chipre. Lajwi tu', max on apni bay conob Tiro bay yul yet Siria, yujtol a tu' chi ec' cancan yikatz te barco tu' bay tu'.

English: Finding the disciples there, we stayed with them seven days. Through the Spirit they urged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: A yet max on eltek yul te barco tu', ay eb creyente max jil yin. Ukeb c'u max on ec' yetok eb bay tu'. Ikbabil eb yuj Cham Espíritu max yalon eb bay Pablo axca ti': —Matawal c'am chach toj bay Jerusalén tu', ẍi eb bay.

English: But when our time was up, we left and continued on our way. All the disciples and their wives and children accompanied us out of the city, and there on the beach we knelt to pray.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi ukeb c'u tu xin, max on toji. Max on bet yak'can eb creyente masanil yetokc'al yistzil c'al yuninal, tiel conob. A tu' max on ay jajan ti a' mar txajlok yetok eb.

English: After saying good-by to each other, we went aboard the ship, and they returned home.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max co tak'elencan co ba yetok eb, max on occantok yul barco, axa meltzojcan eb bay yatut tu'.

English: We continued our voyage from Tyre and landed at Ptolemais, where we greeted the brothers and stayed with them for a day.
Kanjobal: A yet max on el bay conob Tiro tu', max on apni bay conob Tolemaida. A tu' max con elcantek yul barco bay tu', max on can yetok eb creyente jun c'u bay tu'.

English: Leaving the next day, we reached Caesarea and stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist, one of the Seven.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, max on toji, axa japni bay conob Cesarea. A bay yatut Felipe max on apni, cham yalomal el k'anejal yet colbanilej, tol max oc c'apax diáconoal bay Jerusalén yetok wakwanxa eb.

English: He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied.
Kanjobal: Ay canwan cutz'in Felipe tu' c'amto yetbi, k'opojto eb. Chi yalil eb k'anej Dios.

English: After we had been there a number of days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
Kanjobal: Yak'ban ayon ec' jayeb c'u bay tu', max jay jun cham chi yik Agabo, petoj cham bay yul yet Judea. Yalomal c'apax el k'anej Dios yayji cham.

English: Coming over to us, he took Paul's belt, tied his own hands and feet with it and said, “The Holy Spirit says, ‘In this way the Jews of Jerusalem will bind the owner of this belt and will hand him over to the Gentiles.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max jayoc cham k'anjab jetok. A yet lanan co k'anjab yetok tu', max yion el c'alil Pablo, ac'al oc max c'al is k'ab c'al yakan yetok an c'alilej tu'. Lajwi tu', max yalon axca ti': —A Cham Espíritu Santo chi alon axca ti': Caytu' ok yun c'al-lay ay cham ay yet jun c'alilej ti' yuj eb israel bay Jerusalén. Ok lajwok tu', cax ok yaon oc eb yul k'ab eb man israelok, ẍi Cham Espíritu Santo, ẍi cham Agabo.

English: When we heard this, we and the people there pleaded with Paul not to go up to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: A yet max jaben yetok eb aj Cesarea tzet chi yal cham tu', max on oc tean yin Pablo, tol c'am chi toj bay Jerusalén tu'.

English: Then Paul answered, “Why are you weeping and breaking my heart? I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal ayon axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chex ok'i cax chin e tx'emon cus axca ti'? Tok ay yelapnok yul in sat ta chin c'al-lay ay yuj eb. Caxc'al chin is mak' cam eb bay Jerusalén tu' yuj Cham Jajawil Jesús, ok wak' in ba bay eb, ẍi ayon.

English: When he would not be dissuaded, we gave up and said, “The Lord's will be done.”
Kanjobal: Tutun maj tenchaj ay juj xin, xan yilxa mi, con chi. Max jalon axca ti': —Yunokab bay chi el yin c'ul Cham Jajawil xin, con chi.

English: After this, we got ready and went up to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, cax max co watx'nej co ba, max on toj bay Jerusalén.

English: Some of the disciples from Caesarea accompanied us and brought us to the home of Mnason, where we were to stay. He was a man from Cyprus and one of the early disciples.
Kanjobal: Ay jaywan eb creyente aj Cesarea tu' max toj jetok, max toj c'apax jun cham aj Chipre ayxatax yoc yin creyenteal jetok, chi yik Mnasón. A yet ok on apnok bay Jerusalén, a bay yatut cham t'inan japniok jak' co posada.

English: When we arrived at Jerusalem, the brothers received us warmly.
Kanjobal: A yet max on apni oc bay Jerusalén, max on is cha' apnok eb creyente yin tzalojc'ulalil.

English: The next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James, and all the elders were present.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, max on toj yetok Pablo bay yatut Jacobo. Wajanxa ec' eb anciano bay tu', max on apni ocok.

English: Paul greeted them and reported in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.
Kanjobal: Max yak'on Pablo cawil c'ul eb. Max yal bay eb masanil tzet max el yunen Dios yetok, nan xol eb man israelok.

English: When they heard this, they praised God. Then they said to Paul: “You see, brother, how many thousands of Jews have believed, and all of them are zealous for the law.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb juntzan tu', max yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios. Lajwi tu', max yalon eb bay Pablo tu' axca ti': —Watx' ton wuẍtak, palta ojtak, tol xiwil milal eb jet israelal max yaoc Cristo yin is c'ul. Chi yal eb masanil, tol yowalil chi jikej juntzan ley Moisés.

English: They have been informed that you teach all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to turn away from Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs.
Kanjobal: Max yab eb k'umal, tol ach ec'nak ach cuywaj xol masanil eb jet israelal aytok xol eb man israelok, tolab max al bay eb tu', tol manchakxa yikej eb ley Moisés tu'. Tolab max al bay eb, tol manchakxa yak' circuncidar eb yuninal, manchakxa beybalnej eb co beybal ayon israel on ti'.

English: What shall we do? They will certainly hear that you have come,
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet ok jut tinani'? Yujtol ok yabc'alta' eb tol max ach jayi.

English: so do what we tell you. There are four men with us who have made a vow.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ikej tzet ok jal ayach ti xin. Ay canwan winak co xol ayxa is trato yetok Dios. Yowalil chi yak' eb yun is trato tu'.

English: Take these men, join in their purification rites and pay their expenses, so that they can have their heads shaved. Then everybody will know there is no truth in these reports about you, but that you yourself are living in obedience to the law.
Kanjobal: Itok eb etok, cax chi toj a watx'nen a ba yetok eb axca yalon ley Moisés. Cha tojlanej gasto eb chi yak'balnej manon juntzan xajanbal. Chi lajwi tu', cax chi yak'on tzuklay el ba eb canwanil. Ta caytu' chot axca tu', ok yil eb anima masanil, tol a tzet max al-lay en max yab eb tu', lek'tial toni, cax ok yilon eb bian, tol chekej ley Moisés tu'.

English: As for the Gentile believers, we have written to them our decision that they should abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality.”
Kanjobal: A pax bay eb man israelok maxax yaoc c'ul yin Cristo xin, tz'ibbilxa tok co carta bay eb, tol man yowalilok chi yikej eb juntzan tu'. Asan jayeb chekbanilej ti' max jaltok bay eb, tol manchak chi' eb no chibej chi ak'lay yin xajanbalil bay juntzan tzet chi al-lay oc diosal. Manchak chi' eb chic'. Manchak chi' eb no no' chi sut'lay camok. Manchak beybalnej eb ajmulal. Caytu' max jut jalontok bay eb, ẍi eb anciano tu' bay Pablo.

English: The next day Paul took the men and purified himself along with them. Then he went to the temple to give notice of the date when the days of purification would end and the offering would be made for each of them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual max ilaytok eb canwanil yuj Pablo tu', max watx'nen ba yetok eb nak, axca yalon ley Moisés tu'. Lajwi tu', max oc yul templo Dios yuj yalon bay eb sacerdote, tzet c'ual chi lajwi tiempoal watx'nen ba eb, yet chi yak'on junjun eb yofrenda bay Dios.

English: When the seven days were nearly over, some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul at the temple. They stirred up the whole crowd and seized him,
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa lajwi yukeb c'ual tu xin, ay jaywan eb israel aj Asia max iloni tol ayic' Pablo yul templo Dios. Axa yuchon aj somnaj eb eb anima tu', yuj tit yowal eb. Axa mitx'on eb Pablo tu'.

English: shouting, “Men of Israel, help us! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against our people and our law and this place. And besides, he has brought Greeks into the temple area and defiled this holy place.”
Kanjobal: Caw yip eb yalon axca ti': Ex jet israelal, colwajanek. A ton jun winak ti' chi ec' cuyon anima bay junjun lugar. Yob chi yal nak jin ayon israel on ti'. Yob chi yal nak yin ley Moisés c'al yin templo Dios ti'. A tinani', comonc'al max yi octok nak jaywan eb griego yul templo Dios ti'. A jun na ti', asan Dios ay yet, palta mayal etax el yuj nak yul sat Dios, ẍi eb.

English: (They had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul and assumed that Paul had brought him into the temple area.)
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut k'anjab ba eb axca tu', yujtol max yil eb, tol junejc'al chi ec' Trófimo yetok Pablo tu' yul conob. A Trófimo tu', griego, cax aj Efeso. A naon eb, tol max yi octok Pablo tu' yul templo Dios tu' yetok.

English: The whole city was aroused, and the people came running from all directions. Seizing Paul, they dragged him from the temple, and immediately the gates were shut.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max tit yowal masanil conob, cax max wajban oc ba eb, max bet tzicon eltek eb Pablo yul templo Dios tu', cax k'oklay eltek yina yuj eb. Ayman max makchej eb puerta bay.

English: While they were trying to kill him, news reached the commander of the Roman troops that the whole city of Jerusalem was in an uproar.
Kanjobal: Lananxa yochen eb tol ok mak' camok, axa bet yal-lay bay cham coronel, tol lanan yaj uchnaj conob yuj tit yowal.

English: He at once took some officers and soldiers and ran down to the crowd. When the rioters saw the commander and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ayman max toj cham yetok is soldado, c'al juntzanxa yet yajawilal. Yanej eb toj bay lanan wajban oc ba anima tu'. A yet max yilontok eb anima tu', tol lanan yapni oc cham coronel yetok is soldado masanil, max bekon mak'on eb Pablo tu'.

English: The commander came up and arrested him and ordered him to be bound with two chains. Then he asked who he was and what he had done.
Kanjobal: Max apnic'al oc cham coronel tu xin, cax max mitx'ontek cham Pablo tu', cax yak'on cham alay oc cab cadena yin. Lajwi tu' max k'anlen cham bay eb anima tu' axca ti': —¿Mactxel jun winak ti'? ¿Tzet mul nak che yila'? ẍi bay eb.

English: Some in the crowd shouted one thing and some another, and since the commander could not get at the truth because of the uproar, he ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks.
Kanjobal: Palta max aj bulnaj eb anima tu' yaloni, cax tx'ok tx'okc'al tzet chi yal junjun eb. C'amxa chi yab cham tzet chi yal eb, yujtol toxanej chi wekeki eb. Yuj tu xin, xan max yak' cham ilaytok Pablo tu' bay cuartel.

English: When Paul reached the steps, the violence of the mob was so great he had to be carried by the soldiers.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay k'ochal chon ajtok janic' yet chon ajapnok ti' cuartel tu', max batxlay aj Pablo tu' yuj eb soldado, yujtol max yochej eb anima tu' max mak' cam bay tu'.

English: The crowd that followed kept shouting, “Away with him!”
Kanjobal: Yujtol masanil eb tzakan oc yintak, chi el yaw eb, cax chi yalon eb axca ti': Camokab nak ayman, ẍixac'al eb.

English: As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the barracks, he asked the commander, “May I say something to you?” “Do you speak Greek?” he replied.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yion octok eb Pablo tu' yul cuartel, max yalon bay cham coronel tu' axca ti': —¿Chi mi je' in k'anjab jabok etok? ẍi bay cham. Axa yalon cham bay axca ti': —¿Tom chi je' alon griego?

English: “Aren't you the Egyptian who started a revolt and led four thousand terrorists out into the desert some time ago?”
Kanjobal: Mantok tol aj Egipto ach. A chi wut in naoni tol ach inej el yich jun owal yin cham yajaw yet payxa, cax max eon bey caneb mil eb nak mak'om cam anima bay jun tz'inan tx'otx', ẍi cham bay.

English: Paul answered, “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no ordinary city. Please let me speak to the people.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pablo tu' bay cham axca ti': —C'amak. Ayin ti' israel in. A bay jun miman conob Tarso, yul yet Cilicia, a tu' aljinak in. Ac'al chi wal ayach, ¿c'am mi chin a cha' k'anjab jay belanok bay eb anima? ẍi.

English: Having received the commander's permission, Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the crowd. When they were all silent, he said to them in Aramaic:
Kanjobal: —K'anjaban xin, ẍi cham bay. Axa yeltek lecan Pablo tu' bay sat k'ochal ti' cuartel tu', max yion aj k'ab can, yuj yak'on yechel yet watx' chi numay anima tu'. Max ay numnaj eb xin, axa k'anjab eltek nan xol eb tu' yin is ti' eb, a ton hebreo, axca ti':

English: “Brothers and fathers, listen now to my defense.”
Kanjobal: Ex wet conob, c'al ex mamin ichamtak winak, abek tzet chi wut walon in ba, ẍi eltek.

English: When they heard him speak to them in Aramaic, they became very quiet. Then Paul said:
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb tol hebreo chi yala', max texac'al numay eb, cax max yalon cham bay eb axca ti':

English: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. Under Gamaliel I was thoroughly trained in the law of our fathers and was just as zealous for God as any of you are today.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', israel in c'apax e yetok. A tu' aljinak in bay conob Tarso, yul yet Cilicia, palta a bay Jerusalén ti' max in ch'ibi. In meẍtolben cham Gamaliel. Max quin is cuy cham yin ley eb co mam jichmam sic'libil. Caw wal chi wak' serbil Dios yin masanil in c'ul, axca ton che yut e ba e masanil ti' tinani'.

English: I persecuted the followers of this Way to their death, arresting both men and women and throwing them into prison,
Kanjobal: A yet yalantok, max wetnej eb chi yaoc c'ul yin Jesucristo. Ay bay max in mitx'tek eb. Caxc'al winak, ma ix, asantanej chi michchaji, pilan chi watok eb preso. Toltax ay bay max wak' cam eb.

English: as also the high priest and all the Council can testify. I even obtained letters from them to their brothers in Damascus, and went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.
Kanjobal: A cham sat sacerdote, yetok eb yajaw masanil, chi je' yalon eb tol yel chi wala'. Yujtol a eb ak'nej carta ayin, yuj in toj wion eb jet israelal bay conob Damasco. Max in toj Damasco tu' yuj in sayon ec' eb creyente. Wochej max bet in c'altek eb, cax chi wiontek eb bay Jerusalén ti', cax chi alay oc yailal eb.

English: “About noon as I came near Damascus, suddenly a bright light from heaven flashed around me.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max in toj bet wiontek eb. Palta a yet lanan wapni oc cawilal conob Damasco tu', tekan chuman wal c'u, ay jun sakk'inal max tit jopnaj satcan cax max low win. Caw wal ow chaw yakan.

English: I fell to the ground and heard a voice say to me, ‘Saul! Saul! Why do you persecute me?’
Kanjobal: Max in ayc'ay telnaj sat tx'otx' yuj. Axa wabeni, max oc jay belan k'anej axca ti' ayin: Saulo, Saulo, ¿tzet yuj xan chin oktej ec'ok? ẍi ayin.

English: “ ‘Who are you, Lord?’ I asked. “ ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are persecuting,’ he replied.
Kanjobal: ¿Mac ach txel, Mamin? quin chi bay. Ayin ton Jesús, aj Nazaret in. Lanan in okten ec'ok, ẍi ayin.

English: My companions saw the light, but they did not understand the voice of him who was speaking to me.
Kanjobal: A eb max toj wetok max yil eb jun miman sakk'inal tu', caw wal max xiw eb, palta maj yab eb yoc jay belan k'anej max al-lay ayin tu'.

English: “ ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ I asked. “ ‘Get up,’ the Lord said, ‘and go into Damascus. There you will be told all that you have been assigned to do.’
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max walon bay axca ti': ¿Tzet chi yochej a c'ul chi wun xin, Mamin? quin chi bay. Ajan wanok, cax chach toj bay Damasco. A tu' ok al-lay ayach, tzet yowalil ok onej, ẍi Cham Jajawil tu' ayin.

English: My companions led me by the hand into Damascus, because the brilliance of the light had blinded me.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am jabok chi je' wilon yuj yowal yakan jun sakk'inal tu'. Axa eb ajun wetok tu' max in quetzon apnok bay Damasco.

English: “A man named Ananias came to see me. He was a devout observer of the law and highly respected by all the Jews living there.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak bay Damasco tu' chi yik Ananías. Caw wal yelc'ulal wal tol yikem bay ley Moisés. Caw wal watx' is beybal yul sat masanil eb jet israelal bay Damasco tu'.

English: He stood beside me and said, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ And at that very moment I was able to see him.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc ayin, max yalon axca ti': Wuẍtak Saulo, jakchajokab can a sat ti', ẍi ayin. Ayc'alman max jakchajcan in sat ti', cax max wilon oc yin.

English: “Then he said: ‘The God of our fathers has chosen you to know his will and to see the Righteous One and to hear words from his mouth.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ayin axca ti': A Cham co Diosal, ac'al ton oc Cham tu' Diosal eb jichmam, a Cham sic'nej ach elok, yet watx' chojtaknej elok tzet chi yochej Cham en. Yuj c'apax tol chi yochej Cham tol chel yin Jesús, Cham tojol, c'al yuj chaben yul is nuk' tzet t'inan yalon ayach.

English: You will be his witness to all men of what you have seen and heard.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ok al yabixal Jesús yab masanil anima. Ok al tzet max ela', cax ok alon tzet max abej.

English: And now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized and wash your sins away, calling on his name.’
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chechbanej tinani xin? Ajan wanok. Ak' bautizar a ba. Al a ba bay Jesucristo, yet watx' chi tancan a yobtakil eban, ẍi Ananías tu' ayin.

English: “When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying at the temple, I fell into a trance
Kanjobal: A yet max in jayoc bay Jerusalén ti', max in toj txajlok bay templo Dios. Palta a yet lanan in txajli tu', axca wal tol max in wayichli.

English: and saw the Lord speaking. ‘Quick!’ he said to me. ‘Leave Jerusalem immediately, because they will not accept your testimony about me.’
Kanjobal: Max wil yin Cham Jajawil, cax yalon Cham ayin axca ti': Caw wal chak' ep el bay Jerusalén ti', yujtol man ok cha eb yab wabixal ok al bay eb, ẍi ayin.

English: “ ‘Lord,’ I replied, ‘these men know that I went from one synagogue to another to imprison and beat those who believe in you.
Kanjobal: Axa walon bay Cham axca ti': Mamin, yojtakxa eb, tol max in ec' yulak junjun nail culto eb wet israelal, yuj ec' in sayon eltek eb maxax yaoc c'ul en. Pilanc'al max in mitx' eb, cax max waon oc eb preso, max in mak'on c'apax eb.

English: And when the blood of your martyr Stephen was shed, I stood there giving my approval and guarding the clothes of those who were killing him.’
Kanjobal: A yet max k'okch'ennelay Esteban, jun yalomal el abixal, ayin jun max in taynej pichil eb yet lanan k'okch'ennen eb tu', quin chi bay Cham Jajawil tu'.

English: “Then the Lord said to me, ‘Go; I will send you far away to the Gentiles.’ ”
Kanjobal: Palta max yalon pax ayin axca ti': Asi', yujtol najat ok ach in chektok, a ta bay xol eb man israelok, a ta tu' ok ach tok, ẍi Cham Jajawil tu' ayin, ẍi Pablo tu' bay eb.

English: The crowd listened to Paul until he said this. Then they raised their voices and shouted, “Rid the earth of him! He's not fit to live!”
Kanjobal: Asannej juntzan ti' max makc'al yab eb anima tu' yin tzetc'al chi yal Pablo tu' bay eb. Lajwi tu xin, max chaon el eb yich yaj yaw yin ipejal axca ti': —Camokab nak. ¿Tzetto wal yuj xan iquis nak? ẍi eb.

English: As they were shouting and throwing off their cloaks and flinging dust into the air,
Kanjobal: Caw max aj uchnaj eb tit yowal. Chi tzicobtanej eb is pichil. Chi wotzaj eb pokok cax chi tiẍon aj eb can, yujtol caw wal chi tit yowal eb yin Pablo tu'.

English: the commander ordered Paul to be taken into the barracks. He directed that he be flogged and questioned in order to find out why the people were shouting at him like this.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon cham coronel tu' axca tu', max yak' cham ilay octok Pablo tu' yul cuartel. Max chekon cham tol chi mak'layi, yet watx' chi yalajok tzet yuj xan chi aj weknaj eb anima tu', cax chi tit yowal eb yin.

English: As they stretched him out to flog him, Paul said to the centurion standing there, “Is it legal for you to flog a Roman citizen who hasn't even been found guilty?”
Kanjobal: A yet mayal c'alchaj Pablo tu' yuj eb, yuj ok mak'layok xan max yalon cham bay jun cham capitán ayic' bay tu' axca ti': —¿Tom wal ay leyal comonc'al chin e mak' xin? Ti pax aj Roma in, cax c'am jabok in mul chi txecloj elok, ẍi bay.

English: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commander and reported it. “What are you going to do?” he asked. “This man is a Roman citizen.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham capitán tzet max yal tu', max bet yalon bay cham coronel tu' axca ti': —Caw wal ay is may jun chi el onen ti'. Aj Roma ab Pablo tu' yala', ẍi bay cham.

English: The commander went to Paul and asked, “Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?” “Yes, I am,” he answered.
Kanjobal: Ayman max toj k'anlej cham coronel tu' bay Pablo tu' axca ti': —¿Tom yel aj Roma ach? ẍi bay. —Yel toni, aj Roma in, ẍi bay cham.

English: Then the commander said, “I had to pay a big price for my citizenship.” “But I was born a citizen,” Paul replied.
Kanjobal: —Cay in c'apax tu', palta caw wal miman tumin max wak'a', yet max in manon oc in ba aj Romail, ẍi cham bay. —Axa in ayin ti xin, romano in yintaxc'alta' waljubal, ẍi Pablo tu' bay cham.

English: Those who were about to question him withdrew immediately. The commander himself was alarmed when he realized that he had put Paul, a Roman citizen, in chains.
Kanjobal: Axa yel besesok eb soldado ijan max mak'on tu' c'atan, axa beklaycan yuj eb tu'. A yet max yaben cham coronel tol aj Roma Pablo tu', caw wal max xiwaj cham, yujtol comonc'al max yak' c'al-layok.

English: The next day, since the commander wanted to find out exactly why Paul was being accused by the Jews, he released him and ordered the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin to assemble. Then he brought Paul and had him stand before them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, max yochen cham coronel tu' max yabej tzet yuj xan max ak'lay queja Pablo tu' yuj eb israel. Yuj tu xan max yiel cham ch'en cadena ayoc yin. Lajwi tu', max yak'on cham wajbaj oc ba eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al masanil eb sat yajaw xol eb israel tu'. Max ilay eltek Pablo tu' yuj cham yul cuartel, axa yak'on cham bay eb tu'.

English: Paul looked straight at the Sanhedrin and said, “My brothers, I have fulfilled my duty to God in all good conscience to this day.”
Kanjobal: Axa yec' t'ananok Pablo tu' xol eb sat yajaw tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ex wet conob, watx'c'al yayji yikbomal in nabal satak Dios, xan c'am tzet chin na', masantac'al yet jun c'u ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: At this the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth.
Kanjobal: Max yalon cham sat sacerdote chi yik Ananías bay eb ayic' cawilal Pablo tu', tol chi mak'tok eb ti'.

English: Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! You sit there to judge me according to the law, yet you yourself violate the law by commanding that I be struck!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pablo bay Ananías axca ti': —A Dios ok ach mak'onok, yujtol cab sat ach. Chotan ach ay quin a beyc'ulnen axca yalon ley Moisés, palta ilab chin a chek mak'layok, man pax cayok tu' yalon ley tu', ẍi bay.

English: Those who were standing near Paul said, “You dare to insult God's high priest?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon juntzan eb ayic' bay tu', axca ti': —¿Tom chach buchwaj wal yin cham sat sacerdote yayji yuj Dios? ẍi eb bay.

English: Paul replied, “Brothers, I did not realize that he was the high priest; for it is written: ‘Do not speak evil about the ruler of your people.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pablo tu' axca ti': —Ex wet conob, man wojtakok tatol sat sacerdote cham ti'. A yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok chi yal axca ti': Manchak e yal yobal k'anej yin cham yajawil e conob, ẍi tx'an, ẍi Pablo.

English: Then Paul, knowing that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees, called out in the Sanhedrin, “My brothers, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee. I stand on trial because of my hope in the resurrection of the dead.”
Kanjobal: Axa max yiloni, titol saduceo nan eb sat yajaw tu', axa nanxa eb xin, fariseo eb. Yuj tu xin, xan caw yip yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ex wet conob, ayin ti' fariseo in, fariseo c'apax in mam. Lanan in beyc'ulnelayi yujtol chi waoc yin in c'ul tol ok ictzoj aj eb camnak, ẍi bay eb.

English: When he said this, a dispute broke out between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon axca tu', axa teyelen aj ba eb yet fariseoal yetok eb saduceo tu'. Max pojchajtok eb, cab bulanxa max eloc eb.

English: (The Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, and that there are neither angels nor spirits, but the Pharisees acknowledge them all.)
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi yal eb saduceo tu', tol man ok ictzoj aj eb camnak. Chi yalon c'apax eb tol c'am ángel, tamwal espíritu. Axa eb fariseo chi aloni, tol ay ton juntzan tu'.

English: There was a great uproar, and some of the teachers of the law who were Pharisees stood up and argued vigorously. “We find nothing wrong with this man,” they said. “What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?”
Kanjobal: Axa yaj bulnaj eb yel yaw masanil tu'. Ay juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yetbeyom ba yetok eb fariseo tu', max aj bulnaj eb yalon axca ti': —C'am jabok yobtakil chi el yunen Pablo ti'. Yamita xin ay junok espíritu ma junok ángel max k'anjab bay, ẍi eb.

English: The dispute became so violent that the commander was afraid Paul would be torn to pieces by them. He ordered the troops to go down and take him away from them by force and bring him into the barracks.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max texac'al caklen aj ba eb sic'libil. Caw wal max xiwaj cham coronel yuj eb. A naon cham tol lanan coc' tzilnelaytok Pablo tu' yuj eb. Yuj tu' xan max yawtejtek cham eb is soldado, yuj toj ilay el Pablo xol eb. Lajwi tu', max yiontok eb bay cuartel junelxa.

English: The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said, “Take courage! As you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet ak'balil xin, max ul tx'oxon ec' ba Cham Jajawil bay Pablo tu', max yalon axca ti': Pablo, manchak ach oc il. Axca max ot alon el wabixal bay Jerusalén ti', caytu' ok ot alon el bay Roma, ẍi Cham bay.

English: The next morning the Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max k'inibi aj xin, ay jaywan eb israel max wajbaj oc ba. Max lajtinen el ba eb, tol chi mak' cam eb Pablo. Max yalon eb axca ti': —Masantac'al chi cam Pablo ti' juj, cax ok on lowok, c'al juq'uen a'. Ta c'am chi jak' yun tzet chi jal ti', caxc'al chi yatek Dios yailal jiban, ẍi eb.

English: More than forty men were involved in this plot.
Kanjobal: Ec'ban 40 bisil eb max alon axca tu'.

English: They went to the chief priests and elders and said, “We have taken a solemn oath not to eat anything until we have killed Paul.
Kanjobal: Axa toj eb satak eb yajawil eb sacerdote tu' c'al eb ichamtak winak ay yopiso chekon eb israel, max yalon eb bay eb axca ti': —Max jak' co ti', tol man ok on lowok, masantac'al chi yal cam Pablo juj. Max co k'anontek yailal jiban bay Dios, ta c'am chi jak' yun tzet max jal tu'.

English: Now then, you and the Sanhedrin petition the commander to bring him before you on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about his case. We are ready to kill him before he gets here.”
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, che k'an ayex ti' yetok juntzanxa eb sat yajaw bay cham coronel, tol chi yitek cham jun Pablo tu' ayex yecal. Che yal bay cham, tol ayto wal tzet che yochej che yab bay Pablo tu'. Ayonxa, watx'xa pax jayji co makon bay chi ca jayoc tu', ẍi eb israel tu'.

English: But when the son of Paul's sister heard of this plot, he went into the barracks and told Paul.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun nak yune' yanab Pablo max aben k'umal tzet max lajtinej el eb. Yuj tu xin, max toj bay cuartel tu', max bet yalon yab Pablo.

English: Then Paul called one of the centurions and said, “Take this young man to the commander; he has something to tell him.”
Kanjobal: Max yabc'al Pablo axca tu', cax max yawten jun cham capitán, axa yalon bay cham axca ti': —Itok jun nak ach'ej ti' bay cham coronel. Ay tzet chi yochej nak chi toj yal bay cham, ẍi bay.

English: So he took him to the commander. The centurion said, “Paul, the prisoner, sent for me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yiontok cham capitán tu' nak bay cham coronel tu'. Lajwic'al yapni oc eb, max yalon cham capitán bay cham axca ti': —A nak ayoc preso chi yik Pablo, max in awteni, cax max k'anon nak ayin, yuj wiontek jun nak ach'ej ti' ayach. Tolab ay tzet chi yochej nak chi yal ayach, ẍi cham capitán tu'.

English: The commander took the young man by the hand, drew him aside and asked, “What is it you want to tell me?”
Kanjobal: Axa nic'lay nak yuj cham coronel tu', max jitzon el ba eb tx'oklil, max yalon bay nak. —¿Tzet chochej chal ayin? ẍi cham bay nak.

English: He said: “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul before the Sanhedrin tomorrow on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about him.
Kanjobal: Max yalon nak axca ti': —Ay eb israel max lajtinej el ba. Tolab ok k'an eb ayach, cax chaontok Pablo satak eb sat yajaw yecal, cax ab ok tz'ak yalon eb ayach tol ayto wal tzet ok k'anlej el eb bay.

English: Don't give in to them, because more than forty of them are waiting in ambush for him. They have taken an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him. They are ready now, waiting for your consent to their request.”
Kanjobal: Palta man a cha abej. Yujtol ec'ban 40 bey eb ok c'ubaj el ba, cax ok mak'on cam eb yul be yala'. Tolab max yak' eb is ti', tol man ok low eb, masantac'al chi cam Pablo tu' yuj eb. Toltax max k'antek eb yailal yiban bay Dios, ta c'am chi yak' eb yun jun tzet max lajtinej eb yunen tu'. A tinani', watx'xa yayji eb. Lanan makon yab eb, ta chi toj Pablo tu' satak eb sat yajaw tu', ẍi nak ach'ej tu'.

English: The commander dismissed the young man and cautioned him, “Don't tell anyone that you have reported this to me.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max yalon cham bay nak axca ti': —C'am junok mac bay chalilok yuj max ul al jun ti' ayin, ẍi cham bay nak. Axa cheklay pax nak yuj cham tu'.

English: Then he called two of his centurions and ordered them, “Get ready a detachment of two hundred soldiers, seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen to go to Caesarea at nine tonight.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max yawtentek cham coronel tu' cawan capitán, max yalon cham bay eb axca ti': —Che chek watx'nej ba 200 eb comon soldado yetok 70 eb ok aj yiban chej, c'al 200 eb ok yi' is lanza, yujtol ok tok eb bay conob Cesarea yet a las nueve yet ak'balil.

English: Provide mounts for Paul so that he may be taken safely to Governor Felix.”
Kanjobal: Cax che yaon aj tz'um no chej bay ok aj Pablo, yujtol yowalil ok e yitok satak cham Félix, yujtol a yajaw yayji. Jelanc'al che yut e ba, ayta tzet ok on Pablo tu' yulak be, ẍi cham coronel tu' bay eb.

English: He wrote a letter as follows:
Kanjobal: Max yatok cham jun carta bay Félix tu', max yal jun carta tu' axca ti':

English: Claudius Lysias, To His Excellency, Governor Felix: Greetings.
Kanjobal: Ayin Claudio Lisias in, chin tz'ibejtok jun carta ti' ayach mamin yajaw Félix. Ti chi watok cawil a c'ul.

English: This man was seized by the Jews and they were about to kill him, but I came with my troops and rescued him, for I had learned that he is a Roman citizen.
Kanjobal: Chi watok jun winak chi yik Pablo ayach. A eb israel max mitx'oni. Ijan wal max mak' cam eb, palta ayin max in colil nak yetok eb soldado, yujtol max wabej tol aj Roma nak.

English: I wanted to know why they were accusing him, so I brought him to their Sanhedrin.
Kanjobal: Max wochej max wab tzet yuj xan max ak'lay queja nak yuj eb israel tu'. Yuj tu xin, max wak' tit nak satak eb sat yajawil eb.

English: I found that the accusation had to do with questions about their law, but there was no charge against him that deserved death or imprisonment.
Kanjobal: Axa max wabeni, tolab yuj ley eb, xan chi yak' queja eb, palta man is mojok mak'lay camok, tamwal moj yoc preso.

English: When I was informed of a plot to be carried out against the man, I sent him to you at once. I also ordered his accusers to present to you their case against him.
Kanjobal: Palta max wabej, tol ay eb israel max lajtinej el ba yin, tol ok mak' cam eb. Yuj tu' xan chi watok nak ayach. Max wal bay eb chi ak'on queja nak tu', tol chi je' toj eb ayach, cax chi toj yalon eb, tzet wal is nabal eb yin nak. Asan janic' ti' chi waltok ayach; xa jil co ba, ẍitok yul is carta tu'.

English: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul with them during the night and brought him as far as Antipatris.
Kanjobal: A eb soldado max iontok Pablo tu', ak'balil max yitok eb axca max yun yal-lay bay eb, max toj eb yetok bay conob Antípatris.

English: The next day they let the cavalry go on with him, while they returned to the barracks.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, max meltzoj eb comon soldado tu' bay is cuartel. A pax eb ayaj yiban chej xin, max tojcan eb yetok Pablo tu'.

English: When the cavalry arrived in Caesarea, they delivered the letter to the governor and handed Paul over to him.
Kanjobal: Max apnic'al eb bay conob Cesarea tu', max yak'on eb tx'an carta ibil oc yuj eb tu' bay cham yajaw, max yak'on c'apax eb Pablo bay cham.

English: The governor read the letter and asked what province he was from. Learning that he was from Cilicia,
Kanjobal: Lajwi yilon cham tx'an carta tu', max k'anlen el cham bay Pablo tu' tzet conobal bay cajan. Max yaben oc cham tol aj Cilicia.

English: he said, “I will hear your case when your accusers get here.” Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod's palace.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham bay tu' axca ti': —Jayokab eb chach ak'on queja tu' bel. Catatu bian, ok waben tzet ok ot alon a ba, ẍi cham bay. Lajwi tu', max yak'on cham taynelay bay is miman na cham rey Herodes.

English: Five days later the high priest Ananias went down to Caesarea with some of the elders and a lawyer named Tertullus, and they brought their charges against Paul before the governor.
Kanjobal: Oyebxa c'ual yapni Pablo bay Cesarea, max apni c'apax oc cham Ananías, cham sat sacerdote. Ajun jaywan eb cham ichamtak winak ay yopiso yetok, yetok jun cham licenciado chi yik Tértulo. Max apni oc eb satak Félix tu', yuj bet yak'on queja eb Pablo.

English: When Paul was called in, Tertullus presented his case before Felix: “We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation.
Kanjobal: A yet max jayoc Pablo tu', max c'oli yaon oc Tértulo tu' queja yiban. Max yalon bay cham Félix tu' axca ti': —Yuj wal dios ayach mamin yajaw. Oj xan c'amc'al owal co xol. Watx'c'al ak'on cuenta masanil tzet ayoc yalan ekbej, yujtol jelan ach.

English: Everywhere and in every way, most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this with profound gratitude.
Kanjobal: ¡E…! yelxac'al watx' ach mamin Félix. A bay junjun lugar chi txecloj elok, tol watx'c'al tzet chi el a watx'neni. Yuj wal dios ayach.

English: But in order not to weary you further, I would request that you be kind enough to hear us briefly.
Kanjobal: Palta yet watx' man mimanok a tiempo chi jiec'ok, ¿c'am mi chi el yin a c'ul abenxac'al jay belan k'anej chi jochej chi jal ayach?

English: “We have found this man to be a troublemaker, stirring up riots among the Jews all over the world. He is a ringleader of the Nazarene sect
Kanjobal: A nak Pablo ti', caw wal chon yetnej nak. Ijanxa c'am chi techaj nak juj. Pilan chi ec' nak uchoj aj owal xol eb jet israelal bay junjun lugar. Yajaw yayji nak yin jun q'uexan religión, a ton eb chi yaoc c'ul yin jun nak aj Nazaret.

English: and even tried to desecrate the temple; so we seized him.
Kanjobal: Max yak'lej nak yion octok eb man israelok yul templo, yet watx' chi etax el templo tu' yul sat Dios. Yuj tu xin, max co mitx' nak.

English: By examining him yourself you will be able to learn the truth about all these charges we are bringing against him.”
Kanjobal: Ach ti' chi je' a k'anlen ab bay Pablo ti'. Catatu bian, cax ok ojtaknen elok, tol yel, cax man toc'alok chi jalaj yiban, ẍi Tértulo tu'.

English: The Jews joined in the accusation, asserting that these things were true.
Kanjobal: —Caw wal yel chi yal Tértulo ti', ẍi eb israel ajun yetok tu'.

English: When the governor motioned for him to speak, Paul replied: “I know that for a number of years you have been a judge over this nation; so I gladly make my defense.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, axa cham yajaw tu' max yak'biltok is k'ab bay Pablo tu' yet chi yalon yet. Axa yalon axca ti': —Ach ti', mamin yajaw, wojtak tol tx'ialxa yabilal juez ach bay jun nación ti'. Yuj tu' caw wal chin tzaloji, chi walon in ba ayach.

English: You can easily verify that no more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
Kanjobal: Chi je' ojtaknencan el juntzan tzet ok wal ayach ti', tol yel. Lajcawebixto ch'an c'u wapni bay Jerusalén, yuj bet wion ay in ba bay Dios.

English: My accusers did not find me arguing with anyone at the temple, or stirring up a crowd in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city.
Kanjobal: C'am junok anima chin teyelej in ba yetok. C'am c'apax junok lugar bay max ec' wuchaj somnaj anima. Tamwal yul templo Dios, tamwal yul nail culto eb wet israelal, tamwal bay junok lugar bay Jerusalén tu'. C'am wal jabok in mul max ilchaj yuj eb.

English: And they cannot prove to you the charges they are now making against me.
Kanjobal: A eb nak chin ak'on queja ti', c'am jabok tzet chi tx'ox oc eb nak, ta yel juntzan chi yalaj eb nak win ti'.

English: However, I admit that I worship the God of our fathers as a follower of the Way, which they call a sect. I believe everything that agrees with the Law and that is written in the Prophets,
Kanjobal: Yel toni, a Dios bay yalnak ba eb wichmam, a' chi wak' serbil, atac'ala' jun cuybanilej, a ton jun tu' chi yal eb nak ti' q'uexan religional. Palta ayin ti', chi waoc in c'ul yin masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan yul ley Moisés, c'al jantak tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios.

English: and I have the same hope in God as these men, that there will be a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked.
Kanjobal: Caw wal chi waoc Dios yipok in c'ul, tol ok ictzonelay aj eb camnak masanil, eb watx' is nabal c'al eb yob is nabal. Cay c'apax tu' naon eb nak ti'.

English: So I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan caw wal chin beyc'ulnej tzet chi yal yikbomal in nabal, yet watx' manchak oc in yobtakil yul sat Dios, c'al bay eb wet animail.

English: “After an absence of several years, I came to Jerusalem to bring my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings.
Kanjobal: Ay xam jayebok abil c'am inxa ec' bay Jerusalén. Yuj tu' xan max in apni pax oc junelxa, yuj in colwaj bay eb meba', c'al wak'on jabok in sabal bay Dios.

English: I was ceremonially clean when they found me in the temple courts doing this. There was no crowd with me, nor was I involved in any disturbance.
Kanjobal: Yul templo Dios ayin octok yuj wak'on in sabal tu'. Toxa mayal in watx'nej in ba tu', axca yalon co ley. Jaywannej anima ayoctok wetok, cax c'am mactxel bulan ec'ok, c'amc'al owal chi el wuneni. Palta a ton yet tu' max in mitx'lay yuj juntzan eb israel aj Asia.

English: But there are some Jews from the province of Asia, who ought to be here before you and bring charges if they have anything against me.
Kanjobal: Ta ay wal in mul max yil eb, titokab eb a satak ti', ulokab yal eb tzet in mul tu'. Moj wal tol a eb max jayi.

English: Or these who are here should state what crime they found in me when I stood before the Sanhedrin–
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, yalokab eb chin ak'on queja ti', ta ay in mul max ilchaj el yuj eb sat yajaw eb wet israelal, yet max quin is beyc'ulnen eb.

English: unless it was this one thing I shouted as I stood in their presence: ‘It is concerning the resurrection of the dead that I am on trial before you today.’ ”
Kanjobal: Asan ta yujtol a yet ayin ec' satak eb yajaw tu xin, cax max walon yin ipejal bay eb axca ti': Lanan in beyc'ulnelayi, yujtol chi waoc yin in c'ul, tol ok ictzonelay aj eb camnak, quin chi bay eb, talaj yuj jab tu', ẍi Pablo bay Félix tu'.

English: Then Felix, who was well acquainted with the Way, adjourned the proceedings. “When Lysias the commander comes,” he said, “I will decide your case.”
Kanjobal: A Félix tu', yojtak wal is cuybanil eb creyente sic'libil. Yuj tu' xan a yet max yaben cham juntzan axca tu', max yalon axca ti': —Jayokab cham coronel Lisias, cax ok yalon cham ayin, tzet yayji oc jun e yowal ti'. Canokab axca tu' bel, ẍi bay.

English: He ordered the centurion to keep Paul under guard but to give him some freedom and permit his friends to take care of his needs.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon cham bay cham capitán, tol ac'ala'okab taynelay Pablo tu'. Palta bekanokab yayji jabok, cax chi je k'anjab yetok eb yamigo, c'al yak'laycan serbil jabok yuj eb.

English: Several days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla, who was a Jewess. He sent for Paul and listened to him as he spoke about faith in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Cab oxebxa semana tu xin, max jayoc cham Félix bay Cesarea tu' junelxa. Ajun yistzil cham yetok, Drusila bi xal, israel xal. Axa yawten cham Pablo tu', yuj yaben bay tzet chi jut jaon oc co c'ul yin Jesucristo.

English: As Paul discoursed on righteousness, self-control and the judgment to come, Felix was afraid and said, “That's enough for now! You may leave. When I find it convenient, I will send for you.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Pablo tu' bay cham, tol yowalil watx' chi jut co beybal, cax chi co mitx'on oc wanaj co ba yin yobtakil. Max yalon c'apaxok, tol ok beyc'ulnelay masanil anima. A yet max yaben cham axca tu', max xiwaj cham, max yalon cham bay Pablo tu' axca ti': —A tinani xin, k'okbilxa, paxan bela. Ta ay bay colan in, ok ach wawten junelxa, ẍi bay.

English: At the same time he was hoping that Paul would offer him a bribe, so he sent for him frequently and talked with him.
Kanjobal: A cham Félix tu', yochej cham tol chi yak' Pablo jabok tumin bay yin ewantakil, cax chi bekon elok. Yuj tu' xan tx'ial elc'al max yawtej k'anjab yetok.

English: When two years had passed, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, but because Felix wanted to grant a favor to the Jews, he left Paul in prison.
Kanjobal: Yin cab abil cac'al tu' chi yut ba yetok Pablo tu'. Lajwi tu xin, max el cham yin yopiso. Axa cham Porcio Festo max occan q'uexelok. A yet max el Félix tu' yin yopiso, toc'al max cancan Pablo yul preso yuj, yet watx' chi ochelay Félix tu' yuj eb aj israel.

English: Three days after arriving in the province, Festus went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem,
Kanjobal: Axa yapni oc cham Festo tu' bay conob Cesarea tu' yuj chaon yopiso yin yoccan yin yajawil. Cabjiixto chaon cham yopiso tu', max toj cham bay Jerusalén.

English: where the chief priests and Jewish leaders appeared before him and presented the charges against Paul.
Kanjobal: Axa jayoc eb yajawil eb sacerdote bay cham tu' yetok juntzanxa eb ay yopiso, yuj ul yak'lay queja Pablo yuj eb.

English: They urgently requested Festus, as a favor to them, to have Paul transferred to Jerusalem, for they were preparing an ambush to kill him along the way.
Kanjobal: Max k'an eb bay Festo tu', tol chi ilaytek Pablo bay Jerusalén tu'. Max yal eb axca tu', yujtol yochwan eb tol a yul be chi mak' cam eb.

English: Festus answered, “Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.
Kanjobal: Palta max yal cham bay eb axca ti': —Preso yayji Pablo bay Cesarea tinani'. Ato yet jayeb c'u chin apni bay tu'.

English: Let some of your leaders come with me and press charges against the man there, if he has done anything wrong.”
Kanjobal: Ato yet tu' chi je' toj eb e yajawil bay Cesarea tu' wetok. Tatol ay mul Pablo tu', chi je' toj yalon eb bay tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: After spending eight or ten days with them, he went down to Caesarea, and the next day he convened the court and ordered that Paul be brought before him.
Kanjobal: Ay mi waxakebok c'u ma lajonebok c'u ayic' Festo tu' bay Jerusalén. Lajwi tu', axa paxay bay Cesarea. Axa yet junxa c'ual, max oc bay is despacho bay chi watx'nej ay owal. Max bet yak'on awtelay Pablo.

English: When Paul appeared, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing many serious charges against him, which they could not prove.
Kanjobal: A yet max octok Pablo tu' satak, max oc oyan eb israel max tit bay Jerusalén tu' yin. Xiwil tzet yetal mimek yelapnok max tz'ak naaj eb yin, palta c'am wal jabok tzet chi tx'oxoc eb tatol yel chi yal eb.

English: Then Paul made his defense: “I have done nothing wrong against the law of the Jews or against the temple or against Caesar.”
Kanjobal: Maxto lajwi yalon eb yet xin, cax max yalon ba Pablo axca ti': —C'am in mul chi oc in tenon tzet chi yal tx'an ley eb wet israelal. C'am in mul chi oc yin templo Dios. Tamwal c'apax bay cham yajaw bay Roma, c'am in mul chi oc bay cham, ẍi.

English: Festus, wishing to do the Jews a favor, said to Paul, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and stand trial before me there on these charges?”
Kanjobal: Palta tutun chi yochej Festo watx' chi can yul sat eb israel, yuj tu' xan max k'anlej bay Pablo axca ti': —¿Chi mi yochej a c'ul chach toj bay Jerusalén, yet watx' a ta tu' chach in beyc'ulnej? ẍi cham bay.

English: Paul answered: “I am now standing before Caesar's court, where I ought to be tried. I have not done any wrong to the Jews, as you yourself know very well.
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi Pablo tu' bay axca ti': —Satak despacho cham yajaw aj Roma moj chin apni. Asan bay tu' chi je' in beyc'ulnelayi. Ojtak wali tol caw wal c'am in mul chi oc bay eb israel ti'.

English: If, however, I am guilty of doing anything deserving death, I do not refuse to die. But if the charges brought against me by these Jews are not true, no one has the right to hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar!”
Kanjobal: Tatol ay junok in mul tol moj chin cam yuj, camok inabi. Palta ta c'am pax in mul chi txecloj el yuj eb israel ti', c'am junok mac chi je' quin yaon oc yul k'ab eb. Chin k'antok in ba bay cham yajaw bay Roma. A cham ok naon tzet ok wunej, ẍi Pablo tu' bay.

English: After Festus had conferred with his council, he declared: “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you will go!”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anjab Festo tu' yetok juntzan eb yet yajawil chi ak'onc'al is nabal. Lajwi tu', max yalon bay Pablo tu' axca ti': —Ti wal ach cha k'antok a ba satak cham yajaw bay Roma. Yuj tu xin, ok ach watok, ẍi bay.

English: A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus.
Kanjobal: Ay xam jayebok c'u tu', catatu' max apni oc cham rey Agripa yetok xal Berenice bay Cesarea tu', yuj ul eb k'anjab yetok Festo, yujtol max cha' yopiso.

English: Since they were spending many days there, Festus discussed Paul's case with the king. He said: “There is a man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.
Kanjobal: Tx'ialc'al c'ual max ayji ec' eb. Ay jun c'ual max yaltek Festo tu' bay cham rey tu' tzet yayji oc Pablo. Axa yalontek axca ti': —A yet max el Félix yin yopiso, ay jun winak chi yik Pablo aycan oc preso yuj.

English: When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned.
Kanjobal: A yet max in betic' Jerusalén, max jayoc eb yajawil eb sacerdote ayin, yetok eb ichamtak winak ay yopiso, max c'oli yak'on queja eb Pablo tu' ayin. Yochej eb tol max wak' orden yet chi cami.

English: “I told them that it is not the Roman custom to hand over any man before he has faced his accusers and has had an opportunity to defend himself against their charges.
Kanjobal: Axa walon bay eb axca ti': Palta a yalon co ley ayon aj Roma on ti', c'am chi je' tol comonc'al chi ak'lay cam junok mactxel. Yowalil chi yil-lej oc eb sat yetok eb chi ak'on queja eb tu' satak juez, cax chi colon ba eb, quin chi bay eb aj Jerusalén tu'.

English: When they came here with me, I did not delay the case, but convened the court the next day and ordered the man to be brought in.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a yet max jayoc eb cayti', maj in cha' mayjok tiempo. Yewial tu', max in octok chotan yul in despacho bay chin watx'nej el owal. Axa wak'on bet tit Pablo tu'.

English: When his accusers got up to speak, they did not charge him with any of the crimes I had expected.
Kanjobal: A in naoni, tol miman mi is mul. Palta axa eb chi ak'on queja tu', c'am tzet max yaoc eb yiban axca max wut in naon tu'.

English: Instead, they had some points of dispute with him about their own religion and about a dead man named Jesus who Paul claimed was alive.
Kanjobal: Asan janic' max yal eb, tol ay tzet yob chi yal yin is religión eb. Max yalontek eb yuj jun nak chi yik Jesús tol camnakxa. Palta axa ab Pablo tu' chi aloni tol iquis paxok. Asan yuj juntzan tu' xan chi yak' queja eb.

English: I was at a loss how to investigate such matters; so I asked if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem and stand trial there on these charges.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', maj nachaj wuj tzet chi wut in watx'nen ay eb. Yuj tu' xan max in k'anlej el bay Pablo tu' axca ti': ¿Chi mi yochej a c'ul chach toj bay Jerusalén, yet watx' a ta tu' chach in beyc'ulnej? quin chi bay.

English: When Paul made his appeal to be held over for the Emperor's decision, I ordered him held until I could send him to Caesar.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ayin axca ti': Chin k'antok in ba satak cham yajaw bay Roma. A cham ok naonok tzet ok wunej, ẍi Pablo tu' ayin. Yuj tu xin, ayinxa max wala' tol chi can preso jabokxa tiempoal, masantac'al chi watok bay cham yajaw tu', ẍi Festo tu'.

English: Then Agrippa said to Festus, “I would like to hear this man myself.” He replied, “Tomorrow you will hear him.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yaben cham rey Agripa juntzan tu xin, axa yalon cham bay Festo tu' axca ti': —Chi wochej chi wab c'apax tzet ẍi Pablo tu' ayin ti', ẍi bay. —Ta axca tu', yecalto ok ab tzet ẍi, ẍi Festo tu' bay.

English: The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience room with the high ranking officers and the leading men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual max jayoc cham rey Agripa tu' yetok xal Berenice. Ayxa may yili eb yetok is pichil, max ocapnok eb yul bay chi watx'ji yayji owal tu' yetok eb yajawil eb soldado, c'al juntzan eb mimek winak mimanbil yuj conob. Axa chekon Festo toj tit Pablo tu'.

English: Festus said: “King Agrippa, and all who are present with us, you see this man! The whole Jewish community has petitioned me about him in Jerusalem and here in Caesarea, shouting that he ought not to live any longer.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max yalon axca ti': —Mamin rey Agripa, c'al jantak ex max e wajbaj e ba jetok ti', tix Pablo ti'. Xiwil eb israel max alon yuj, tolab ay is mul. Max yal eb ayin bay Jerusalén, cax chi yalon c'apax eb ayin bay Cesarea ti'. Caw wal chi aj yaw eb k'anonc'al camich yiban.

English: I found he had done nothing deserving of death, but because he made his appeal to the Emperor I decided to send him to Rome.
Kanjobal: Palta chin na' ayin ti', c'am junok is mul moj cam yuj. Mayal k'antok ba nak satak cham Augusto, yajaw bay Roma, yet watx' chi na' cham tzet chi yunej. Yuj tu xin, chin na' tol ok watok.

English: But I have nothing definite to write to His Majesty about him. Therefore I have brought him before all of you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that as a result of this investigation I may have something to write.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am tzet watx' in tz'ibentok yin bay cham yajaw tu'. Yuj tu xin, xan chi witek a satak ti', mamin rey Agripa, c'al e satak e masanil. A tinani', k'anlejek e yab bay, ta c'uxan ay junok is mul chi ilchaj el e yuj, cax chin tz'ibentok bay cham yajaw tu'.

English: For I think it is unreasonable to send on a prisoner without specifying the charges against him.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol man yetc'ulalok chi wabej, ta ay junok mac chi watok preso, palta c'am chin tz'ibej paxtok is mul, ẍi Festo tu'.

English: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You have permission to speak for yourself.” So Paul motioned with his hand and began his defense:
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Agripa bay Pablo tu' axca ti': —Chi je' chal a ba tinani xin, ẍi bay. Axa yion aj Pablo tu' k'ab, max chaon el yich yalon axca ti':

English: “King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate to stand before you today as I make my defense against all the accusations of the Jews,
Kanjobal: Ach mamin rey Agripa, xiwil chin tzaloji, yujtol cha cha' walon in ba ayach. Chi wochej chi wiel masanil tzet max yaoc eb wet israelal ti' wiban.

English: and especially so because you are well acquainted with all the Jewish customs and controversies. Therefore, I beg you to listen to me patiently.
Kanjobal: Yel toni watx' chi wal ayach, yujtol ojtakxa co ley ayon israel on ti'. Ojtakxa tzet bay chi co teyelej co ba. Yuj tu xin, chin k'an ayach tol miman wal chot a c'ul win, cax chaben tzet ok wala'.

English: “The Jews all know the way I have lived ever since I was a child, from the beginning of my life in my own country, and also in Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Yojtak masanil eb wet israelal tzetbil yili in beybal yet max in titc'al oc yaliẍal bay in conob, c'al bay Jerusalén.

English: They have known me for a long time and can testify, if they are willing, that according to the strictest sect of our religion, I lived as a Pharisee.
Kanjobal: Ta chi yochej eb chi yala', chi je' yalon eb tol fariseo in yintax wach'ejal. A eb fariseo tu', caw wal yikem eb yin beybalnen juntzan tzet chi cheklay co beybalnej yuj co religión.

English: And now it is because of my hope in what God has promised our fathers that I am on trial today.
Kanjobal: Axa pax tinani', chi c'oli quin yak'on queja eb, yujc'al tol chi waoc yipok in c'ul, tol ok yak' ictzoj aj Dios eb camnak, axca wal max yut yak'oncan is ti' bay eb jichmam.

English: This is the promise our twelve tribes are hoping to see fulfilled as they earnestly serve God day and night. O king, it is because of this hope that the Jews are accusing me.
Kanjobal: A lajcaweb bulan eb jet israelal, echbanebil yunen el tzet yalnakcan Dios yuj eb masanil. Yuj tu xin, chi yiajtek eb c'ulok yak'on serbil Dios c'ualil c'al ak'balil. Mamin rey Agripa, yujc'al wal tol ayin oc wechbanen yunen el jun tu', xan chin yak' queja eb israel ti' tinani'.

English: Why should any of you consider it incredible that God raises the dead?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan c'am che yaoc yin e c'ul tol chi ictzonelay aj eb camnak yuj Dios?

English: “I too was convinced that I ought to do all that was possible to oppose the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
Kanjobal: A in naon yet yalantok, tol xiwil tzet t'inan wunen yuj wajc'ulal yin eb yet-xa Jesús aj Nazaret. A in naoni, tol watx' chi wut in ba.

English: And that is just what I did in Jerusalem. On the authority of the chief priests I put many of the saints in prison, and when they were put to death, I cast my vote against them.
Kanjobal: Cay tu' wutnak in ba bay Jerusalén. Ocnak wopiso yuj eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yuj tu' xiwil eb creyente wanak oc preso. Ayin jun chi wal wet yet chi mak'lay cam eb.

English: Many a time I went from one synagogue to another to have them punished, and I tried to force them to blaspheme. In my obsession against them, I even went to foreign cities to persecute them.
Kanjobal: Tx'ial elc'al etnebil eb wuj, yet watx' c'amxa chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Jesús. Cac'al tu' ec' utbil eb wuj bay junjun nail culto eb wet israelal. Caw wal chi chichon in c'ul yin eb. Toltax betnak in ec' bay juntzanxa tx'ok conobal najat, yujc'al bet wetnen eb.

English: “On one of these journeys I was going to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests.
Kanjobal: Yuj in chichonc'ulal tu', xan max in toj bay conob Damasco yet junel. Max ak'lay wikbej yuj eb yajawil eb sacerdote, cax max in cheklaytok yuj eb.

English: About noon, O king, as I was on the road, I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, blazing around me and my companions.
