English: with burnt offerings and sin offerings you were not pleased.
Kanjobal: Tokwal ay no no' cha k'an yet chi tz'a yin xajanbalil, tamwal ofrenda yet chi tancan el mulej.

English: Then I said, ‘Here I am–it is written about me in the scroll– I have come to do your will, O God.’ ”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max wala': Tix in chin jay ti' ach in Diosal, yet watx' chi wun ochwan, axca ta tz'ibelaycan wabixal yul tx'an Un, quin chi, ẍi Cristo.

English: First he said, “Sacrifices and offerings, burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not desire, nor were you pleased with them” (although the law required them to be made).
Kanjobal: A yet babelal max yala', tol c'am chi yochej Dios juntzan xajanbal tu', juntzan no no' chi ak'lay bay tu', c'al juntzan no' chi yak' tz'a eb yuj yion el is yobtakil tu', tamwal chi tzaloj c'ul yetok. Caytu' max yut yaloni, caxc'al chi yal yul ley tol chi ak'lay juntzan tu' bay Dios.

English: Then he said, “Here I am, I have come to do your will.” He sets aside the first to establish the second.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu' max yalon pax Cristo axca ti': Tix in ti' ach in Diosal, yet watx' chi wun ochwan, ẍi. Chi yal elapnok, tol ok ul yak' lajwok yopiso juntzan xajanbal tu', yuj yak'on junxa xajanbal q'uexelok.

English: And by that will, we have been made holy through the sacrifice of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Jesucristo max yak' acaw is mimanil yin xajanbalil yin junelnej, axca chi yochej c'ul Dios, xan a yuj jun xajanbal tu', chon can yin watx'il yul sat Cham.

English: Day after day every priest stands and performs his religious duties; again and again he offers the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb sacerdote, waan aj eb yin watx'nen eb yopiso junjun c'u. Cac'al ti' yak'on eb juntzan xajanbal tol c'am chi je' yion el co yobtakil.

English: But when this priest had offered for all time one sacrifice for sins, he sat down at the right hand of God.
Kanjobal: A pax Jesucristo xin, junch'an xajanbal yak'nak yuj co yobtakil yin junelnej. Lajwi tu', max toj ay chotan bay watx' k'ab Dios.

English: Since that time he waits for his enemies to be made his footstool,
Kanjobal: A tu' lanan yechbaneni, masantac'al chi can eb ajc'ul oc yin, yalan yuj Dios.

English: because by one sacrifice he has made perfect forever those who are being made holy.
Kanjobal: Yuj jun xajanbal yak'nak tu', xan tz'aknajnak on el yin tojbalk'inal, yujtol max ilay el masanil co yobtakil jin yuj.

English: The Holy Spirit also testifies to us about this. First he says:
Kanjobal: Chi yak' ba Cham Espíritu Santo testigoal ayon yin juntzan ti', yujtol chi yal yin babelal axca ti':

English: “This is the covenant I will make with them after that time, says the Lord. I will put my laws in their hearts, and I will write them on their minds.”
Kanjobal: Tix ok wut in trato yetok eb yinatil israel yet yajtok tu': ayin wal caw Yajaw in chi wala' tol ok waoc juntzan in chekbanil yin yanimail eb, axca tol ok in tz'ibejcan oc yin nabal eb, ẍi.

English: Then he adds: “Their sins and lawless acts I will remember no more.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon jun tu', cax max yalon pax axca ti': C'amxa bak'in ok in natek is mul eb c'al is yobtakil eb, ẍi.

English: And where these have been forgiven, there is no longer any sacrifice for sin.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a yet mayal ak'lay lajwok co yobtakil, manxa yowalilok chi jak' junokxa xajanbal yuj co yobtakil tu'.

English: Therefore, brothers, since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, manchak on xiw joctok bay jun lugar asan Dios ay yet, yujtol yuj chiq'uil Jesucristo chi je' joctok.

English: by a new and living way opened for us through the curtain, that is, his body,
Kanjobal: Chi je' co toj yul jun ac' be, a ton jun yet k'inalej max jakcan Cham ayon, yet max ay nic'naj an cortina. A an cortina tu', chi tx'oxtek is mimanil Cristo.

English: and since we have a great priest over the house of God,
Kanjobal: Ay jun co sacerdote miman yayji ocok ayon yuninal onxa Dios ti'.

English: let us draw near to God with a sincere heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', co jitzektok co ba bay Cham yin masanil co c'ul. Jaek oc Cham yin co c'ul sic'libil, yujtol sakbinebilxa janimail yuj, yet watx' c'amxa xiwc'ulalil ayoc yin yikbomal co nabal yuj co yobtakil, cax sakbinebilxa co mimanil yetok jun acaw sak aej.

English: Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for he who promised is faithful.
Kanjobal: Tec'an chi jut jaon oc yipok co c'ul jun co cuybanil chabil juj. C'amokab co cabc'ulalil, yujtol a Dios, ok yunc'alta' is ti' yak'nakcan ayon.

English: And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds.
Kanjobal: Co say tzet chi jut jiptzelen co ba, yet watx' chi aj can co camc'ulal, cax chi watx'jic'al oc co beybal.

English: Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another–and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
Kanjobal: Manchak co bekay co wajban co ba, axca beybal juntzan eb co xol. Yowalil chi jiptzelejek co ba. Jak'ek jip, yujtol lanan jilon juntzan yechel chi tx'oxon tol toxa chi jay c'ual jayubal Cham Jajawil.

English: If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left,
Kanjobal: A tinani', jojtakxa jun cuybej caw yel. Yuj tu', ta ac'ala' jaon oc co nabal junen yobtakil, c'am junokxa xajanbal chi je' cam yuj co yobtakil junelxa.

English: but only a fearful expectation of judgment and of raging fire that will consume the enemies of God.
Kanjobal: Ta axca tu', asanxanej jun yailal ay is may chi jechbanej chi yal tu', c'al k'ak' k'ak' chi nilxi, moj wal caw chon xiw yuj. A k'ak' k'ak' tu' ok ak'on lajwok el eb ajc'ul oc yin Dios.

English: Anyone who rejected the law of Moses died without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac c'am chi iken ley Moisés, cax ta ay pax cawanok ma oxwanok testigo chi ilon tol c'am chi yikej, tojol cami, yin c'amxac'al yabenc'ulal.

English: How much more severely do you think a man deserves to be punished who has trampled the Son of God under foot, who has treated as an unholy thing the blood of the covenant that sanctified him, and who has insulted the Spirit of grace?
Kanjobal: Akxa tinani', ta chi jintaknejcan el Cham C'ajol Dios, ta c'am yelapnok chiq'uil Cham yul co sat, ta chi jiel q'uixwil Cham Yespíritu Dios chon camc'ulneni, ¿jantakto ec'ban yailal moj co chaon yintak eb maj iken ley Moisés tu'? Yujtol yuj is chiq'uil Cristo tu', xan yunnak trato Dios jetok. Yuj xan yet onxa Dios tinani'.

English: For we know him who said, “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” and again, “The Lord will judge his people.”
Kanjobal: Jojtak tol axca ti' yaloncan Cham Jajawil: Ayin ay walon wet waon oc is yailal eb. Ayin ok wiec' pak bay eb, ẍi. Cax yalnak c'apax axca ti': A Cham Yajaw ok beyc'ulnej is conob, ẍi.

English: It is a dreadful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
Kanjobal: Caw wal ayxa is may ta chon ayc'ay yul k'ab Cham Dios iquis.

English: Remember those earlier days after you had received the light, when you stood your ground in a great contest in the face of suffering.
Kanjobal: Palta naektek yet yalantok, yet max e chaon sakk'inal yin e yanimail yin babelal. Caw tec'an e waay nan xol yailal, caw max e yak' e yip.

English: Sometimes you were publicly exposed to insult and persecution; at other times you stood side by side with those who were so treated.
Kanjobal: Ilab tol ay ex max ex buchlayi, ay ex max ex etnelay satak conob. Ay ex xin, ya yoc max e yab yet max e yilon yoc yailal eb tu'. Jun lajan e yaben yailal yetok eb.

English: You sympathized with those in prison and joyfully accepted the confiscation of your property, because you knew that you yourselves had better and lasting possessions.
Kanjobal: Caw ok'nak e c'ul yin eb ocnak preso. Yin tzalojc'ulal max techaj e yuj yet max ilay ec' e tzetak yetal, yujtol max e natek tol a ayon ti' ay co tzetak yetal satcan tol ec'ban watx'il, cax tol c'am chi lajwi.

English: So do not throw away your confidence; it will be richly rewarded.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', manchak e bekay tec'anil e waay tu'. Yujtol yuj, xan ok e cha' mimek paktzebal.

English: You need to persevere so that when you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised.
Kanjobal: Yowalil che tec'baj e ba, yet watx' ok je' e yunen masanil tzet chi cha' c'ul Dios, cax ok e chaon tzet yak'nak is ti' yak'on ayon.

English: For in just a very little while, “He who is coming will come and will not delay.
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi yal yul tx'an Un axca ti': Janic'xanej wali, cax chi jay Cham yowalil ok jayok, man ok ec' tiempoal jayi.

English: But my righteous one will live by faith. And if he shrinks back, I will not be pleased with him.”
Kanjobal: A mac watx' yul in sat, ok ayjokc'al ec'ok yujtol chin yac'al oc eb yin is c'ul; palta ta chi meltzoj eb yintak, maj inxa tzaloj yetok eb, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: But we are not of those who shrink back and are destroyed, but of those who believe and are saved.
Kanjobal: Palta ayon ti', mayonnak chon meltzoj jintak, axca eb chi meltzoj yintak tu', cax chi c'aycan el eb junelnej. Yujtol ayon ti', chi jac'al oc yin co c'ul, yuj tu' chon colchaji.

English: Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jaon oc junok tzet yetal yin co c'ul, chi yal elapnok tol caw chi jaoc yipok co c'ul tol ok co cha' tzet lanan jechbaneni, cax tol jojtak sic'libil, tol a juntzan tzet manchak jiloc yin, ay ton ec'ok.

English: This is what the ancients were commended for.
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, ocnak eb watx'il satak Dios, yujtol yanak oc eb c'ul yin Cham.

English: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, xan jojtak tol asan yetok is k'anej max watx'nej Cham yulyibank'inal ti', c'al juntzan tzet chi ec' satcan. A juntzan tzet chi jil tinani', man yinok tzet txequel tinani' max tita.

English: By faith Abel offered God a better sacrifice than Cain did. By faith he was commended as a righteous man, when God spoke well of his offerings. And by faith he still speaks, even though he is dead.
Kanjobal: A Abel, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a is xajanbal yak'nak bay, ec'ban watx'il yintak yet Caín, xan yalnak Dios tol watx' Abel tu' yul sat; yuj tu' max cha' is xajanbal. Caxc'al camnakxa Abel tu', palta axca tol ac'ala' k'anjab ayon, yujtol yanak oc yin c'ul.

English: By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death; he could not be found, because God had taken him away. For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.
Kanjobal: A Enoc, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul; yuj tu' xan max ilaytok yuj Dios yin yiquisal. Majxa ilchajok, yujtol max ilaytok yuj Dios. Chi yaltek yabixal yul tx'an Un, tol a yet c'amto chi ilaytok tu', max tzaloj Dios yetok.

English: And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, c'am chi je' tzaloj jetok. Yujtol a mac chi jay bay Dios, yowalil chi yaoc yin c'ul, tol ay ton Dios. Cax chi yaon c'apax oc yin c'ul, tol chi paktzej Cham bay eb chi yochej chi jayoc bay.

English: By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that comes by faith.
Kanjobal: A Noé, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet max yalon Dios bay tol ok jay tzet c'amto chi il-layi, caw wal max xiwi, xan max yikej watx'nen jun arca bay ok col ba yetok is yuninal yetok yetbi eb. Yuj jun tu' xan max lowcan camich yiban masanil anima. Max yalon Dios tol watx' Noé tu' yul sat, asan yuj max yaoc c'ul yin.

English: By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even though he did not know where he was going.
Kanjobal: A Abraham, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet max awtelay yuj Cham max yikej, cax max toj bay jun lugar yak'nak Cham is sataknej. Caxc'al man yojtakok bay chi toji, palta max bekcan is tx'otx'al cax max toji.

English: By faith he made his home in the promised land like a stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise.
Kanjobal: Yujtol yanak oc yin c'ul, xan ec'lejnak cajan bay jun lugar yak'nak Dios is ti' yak'on bay tu'. Mantiado max oc is yatutok. Axca tu' yutnak c'apax ba Isaac yetok Jacob, yujtol ay yalon yet eb chaon jun tzet yak'nak Dios ti' yak'oni.

English: For he was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
Kanjobal: A Abraham tu', chi yechbanej jun conob cimiento yich ayayok. A Dios max naon watx'jubal jun conob tu', cax max watx'neni.

English: By faith Abraham, even though he was past age–and Sarah herself was barren–was enabled to become a father because he considered him faithful who had made the promise.
Kanjobal: A xal Sara, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu', caxc'al man uniwomixok, palta maxto ak'lay yip yet ixnamxa, maxto jay yune'. Yuj tu', ay jun yune' maxto alji, yujtol yanak oc yin c'ul, tol a Cham yak'nak ti' bay, chic'al yun bay chi yala'.

English: And so from this one man, and he as good as dead, came descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and as countless as the sand on the seashore.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', caxc'al caw ichamxa Abraham tu' sic'libil, palta xiwil max yun beytok yinatil axca wal bisil waycan, ma axca bisil yarenail ti a' mar, c'amxa chi bischaji.

English: All these people were still living by faith when they died. They did not receive the things promised; they only saw them and welcomed them from a distance. And they admitted that they were aliens and strangers on earth.
Kanjobal: A junjun mac max waltek yabixal ti', c'amto chi cha' tzet yak'nak Dios ti' yak'on bay eb, cax max cam eb, palta yanak oc eb yin c'ul. Yuj tu', axca tol yilnaktok eb yin juntzan tzetak yetal tu' najat, caw chi tzaloj eb yuj. Axca ton ti' yutnak yak'on ba eb testigoal tol a yulyibank'inal ti' man is conobok eb, palta tol toc'al ec'jabwom yayji eb yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: People who say such things show that they are looking for a country of their own.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb chi alon axca ti', chi tx'oxk'abnej el eb sic'libil tol lanan sayon ec' eb junok conob tol yet eb yayji.

English: If they had been thinking of the country they had left, they would have had opportunity to return.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ac'ala' naontok eb is tx'otx'al bay max ca tita, tekan max je' meltzojtok eb bay tu'.

English: Instead, they were longing for a better country–a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.
Kanjobal: Palta yochejnak eb junokxa is conob yelxac'al watx', a ton jun conob bay satcan. Yuj tu', a Dios c'am chi q'uixwi aj yet chi yalon oc eb is Diosalok, yujtol watx'xa yayji jun is conob eb tu' yuj.

English: By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac as a sacrifice. He who had received the promises was about to sacrifice his one and only son,
Kanjobal: A Abraham, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet max ak'lay porobal yuj Dios, max yitok Isaac, cax t'inan bet yak'on yin xajanbalil yaloni. Caxc'al yak'nak Dios is ti' yuj Isaac tu', palta bekanxa c'ul Abraham tu' yak'on jun c'otan is c'ajol yin xajanbalil.

English: even though God had said to him, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”
Kanjobal: Yalnakxa Dios bay Abraham tu' axca ti': A yin nak Isaac, a tu' ok beyc'altok enatil, ẍi bay.

English: Abraham reasoned that God could raise the dead, and figuratively speaking, he did receive Isaac back from death.
Kanjobal: A Abraham tu', max na' wal sic'libil tol chic'al je' yuj Dios yictzonen aj eb camnak. Yuj tu' chi je' jaloni, axca tol ictzojnak aj Isaac tu', cax axca tol max ak'lay bay Abraham tu' junelxa.

English: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to their future.
Kanjobal: A Isaac, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan yin ayokto max yaloncanok, tzetak watx'ilal t'inan chaon Jacob yetok Esaú.

English: By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of Joseph's sons, and worshiped as he leaned on the top of his staff.
Kanjobal: A Jacob, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet toxa chi cami, max yaloncan tzetak watx'ilal t'inan chaon junjun eb yuninal José. Maxto yak' ayilal bay Dios, max ay nojan yiban jolom is k'okoch.

English: By faith Joseph, when his end was near, spoke about the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt and gave instructions about his bones.
Kanjobal: A José, yanak oc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet toxa chi cami, max yaloncanok tol t'inan ok el eb israel bay Egipto. Max yalon c'apax canok, tzet yowalil ok yut eb is bakil.

English: By faith Moses' parents hid him for three months after he was born, because they saw he was no ordinary child, and they were not afraid of the king's edict.
Kanjobal: A eb is mam c'al is txutx Moisés, yanak oc eb Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet max alji Moisés tu', max yeban el eb oxeb xajaw, yujtol max yil eb, tol caw wal watx' yili. Maj xiw eb bay jun is ley cham rey, chi aloni tol chi ak'lay cam eb winak unin chi alji.

English: By faith Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be known as the son of Pharaoh's daughter.
Kanjobal: A Moisés tu', yanak c'apax oc Dios yin is c'ul. Yuj tu' xan a yet icham winakxa, c'amxa chi yochej chi al-lay oc yuneok ix cutz'in cham reyal Egipto.

English: He chose to be mistreated along with the people of God rather than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a short time.
Kanjobal: Maj yochej max yak' tzalojbok c'ul yin yobtakil, yujtol a tzalojc'ulal tu' chi eq'uelok. A ti yet, tol max cha c'ul yaben yail yetok eb conob Dios.

English: He regarded disgrace for the sake of Christ as of greater value than the treasures of Egypt, because he was looking ahead to his reward.
Kanjobal: Max naon c'apaxok, tol caxc'al chi yab yail buchlay yuj Cristo, palta watx' yet. A masanil beyomal Egipto tu', c'am yelapnok yul sat, yujtol yanaktok is nabal yin is paktzebal ok yak' Dios.

English: By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the king's anger; he persevered because he saw him who is invisible.
Kanjobal: Max yaoc c'ul yin Dios. Yuj tu' xan max el bay Egipto tu'. Maj xiw jabok yuj yowal c'ul cham rey tu'. Caw tec'an max yut is nabal, axca tol chi yiloc yin Cham c'am chi je' jilon oc yin, a ton Dios.

English: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn would not touch the firstborn of Israel.
Kanjobal: A Moisés tu', yujtol max yaoc Dios yin c'ul, xan max yikej chaon el yich jun k'in chi yik Pascua. Yalnak bay eb yet israelal, tol chi txij oc eb chic' yinlak is puerta, yet watx' c'am chi mak'lay cam eb is babel unin eb yuj jun ángel ay yopiso yin mak'oj cam anima.

English: By faith the people passed through the Red Sea as on dry land; but when the Egyptians tried to do so, they were drowned.
Kanjobal: A eb israel tu', yanak oc eb Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan max ec'tok eb nan a' chi yik Cakyin Mar, axca co bey bay c'am aej. A yet max yochej eb aj Egipto max ec'tok axca eb tu', max jik'bi eb yuj a'.

English: By faith the walls of Jericho fell, after the people had marched around them for seven days.
Kanjobal: Yuj max yaoc eb jichmam Dios yin c'ul, xan a yet max xew yoyon ba eb ukeb c'u yinlak murallail conob Jericó, max ayc'ay bulnaj yuj eb.

English: By faith the prostitute Rahab, because she welcomed the spies, was not killed with those who were disobedient.
Kanjobal: A ix Rahab, ix ajmul ix, max yaoc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan maj cam ix yetok eb pit max yut ba, yujtol watx' max yut chaon ix eb israel max beytzen jun conob tu'.

English: And what more shall I say? I do not have time to tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel and the prophets,
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al tzet yetal chi je' walontok ayex. Palta c'amxa tiempo walontek yabixal Gedeón, Barac, Sansón, Jefté, David, Samuel, c'al eb chekbej Dios.

English: who through faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, and gained what was promised; who shut the mouths of lions,
Kanjobal: A eb max in txoltek bi ti', max yaoc eb c'ul yin Dios. Yuj tu', ay eb yak'nak ayc'ay juntzan nacionlak, yet yak'len eb owal yetok eb. Ay eb watx'c'al yutnak yak'on yajawilal. Ay eb max cha' yalben Dios. Ay eb max makchej ti' no coj.

English: quenched the fury of the flames, and escaped the edge of the sword; whose weakness was turned to strength; and who became powerful in battle and routed foreign armies.
Kanjobal: Ay eb max yak' tan mimek k'ak'ej. Ay eb max colchaj el yet t'inanxa cam eb yetok espada. Ay eb c'am yip, max ak'lay yip eb. Max ak'lay c'apax yip eb yak'wi owal. Yuj tu' xan a eb soldado max yak'lej owal yetok eb, max can eb yalan.

English: Women received back their dead, raised to life again. Others were tortured and refused to be released, so that they might gain a better resurrection.
Kanjobal: Ay eb ix ix max ictzoj aj is camnak, max chaon eb junelxa yin yiquisal. Palta ay juntzanxa eb, camnak yuj juntzanok yailal ocnak yiban eb. Bekan c'ul eb yaben yail, yet watx' chi yi eb ictzojbail, cax chi chaon eb jun is k'inal ec'ban watx'il.

English: Some faced jeers and flogging, while still others were chained and put in prison.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb yabnak yail buchlayi, c'al mak'layi. Toltax max c'al-lay ay eb yetok cadena, max oc eb preso.

English: They were stoned; they were sawed in two; they were put to death by the sword. They went about in sheepskins and goatskins, destitute, persecuted and mistreated–
Kanjobal: Ay eb tol max k'okch'ennelay camok. Ay eb tol max c'uplay ay nan yetok serrucho. Ay eb caw max ak'lay porobal sic'libil. Ay eb max cam yuj espada. Ay eb chi elic'ok yuj colon ba. Asanxanej tz'umal calnel c'al tz'umal chiwo chi yaoc eb is pichilok. Max yil eb mebil. Xiwil yailal max el yilon eb, max etax eb.

English: the world was not worthy of them. They wandered in deserts and mountains, and in caves and holes in the ground.
Kanjobal: Man mojok eb aj yulyibank'inal ti' yec' juntzan anima watx' ti' xol eb. Xiwil tz'inan tx'otx', c'al tzalanlak bay max ec' cajan eb. Max cajaylej eb yulak na ch'en c'al yulak xab olan.

English: These were all commended for their faith, yet none of them received what had been promised.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb ti', max al-lay eb watx'il yuj Dios, yujtol max yaoc eb c'ul yin. Caxc'al watx' eb, palta majto cha eb tzet yak'nak Dios is ti' yak'on bay eb.

English: God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay jun tzet yetal ec'ban watx'il nabilxa yuj Dios jin. Yuj tu' xan majtoc'al yi ba tzet nabil yuj Cham yin eb tu' tx'oklil. Masantac'al chon is junanej Cham yetok eb tu', catatu' ok yion ba.

English: Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles, and let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us.
Kanjobal: Xiwil ton mac tx'oxnak el ba tol max ya ton oc c'ul yin Dios. A eb yanak oc yin c'ul tu', axca tol oyan oc eb jinlak tinani'. Ayon lananxa jak'on jip axca eb chi yak' yanej. Yuj tu', yowalil chi jiek el jiban juntzan axca ikatz ikbil aj juj, yujtol yuj juntzan tu' xan yob co beyi. Yetok c'apaxok, yowalil chi co bekekcan yobtakil, yujtol a yobtakil tu', lajan axca tzet chi toj bac'an xol jakan, cax chon aj telnaj yuj. Yowalil tec'an chi jut co ba jak'on jip, axca eb chi yak' yanej tu'.

English: Let us fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy set before him endured the cross, scorning its shame, and sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
Kanjobal: Jaek oc co nabal yin Jesús, Cham chi ak'on jaon oc co c'ul yin. Yuj Cham xan tz'akaki chi jut c'apax jaon oc yin co c'ul. Max yab yail Cham yin curus. C'am yelapnok ta q'uixwiltak max yun cami, yujtol yojtak Cham tol a yet ok lajwok yaben yail tu', caw tzalojc'ulal yet. A tinani', chotan ay Cham bay is watx' k'ab Dios.

English: Consider him who endured such opposition from sinful men, so that you will not grow weary and lose heart.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', naektek beybal Jesús, tzet max yut yak'on techajok, yet max yaben yail yuj eb yobtakwom. Ta che natek, man ok ex c'unbok ajok, tamwal ok somchaj el e c'ul.

English: In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al tec'an che yut e yajc'ulnen e ba yetok yobtakil, palta c'amto chex cam yuj.

English: And you have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons: “My son, do not make light of the Lord's discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you,
Kanjobal: Tekan mayal toj c'ayc'ulal e yuj tzet yalnakcan Dios ayon, yet max yaon oc co nabal, yujtol yuninal onxa. Chi yalcan yul tx'an Un axca ti': Ach in c'ajol, manchak entaknej el is tenchebal Cham Jajawil. Manchak cabax aj a c'ul yet chach yak'on cuenta.

English: because the Lord disciplines those he loves, and he punishes everyone he accepts as a son.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a mac ay is camc'ulal Cham yin, chi yak' cuenta, cax chi yaon oc yailal tzanc'al mac chi chaoc yuninalok, ẍi yul tx'an.

English: Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as sons. For what son is not disciplined by his father?
Kanjobal: Yowalil chi jak' techaj juntzan yailal chi yal ti', yujtol yuninal on, xan caytu' chon yutej. ¿Xin ta ay junok uninalej c'am chi ak'lay cuenta yuj is mam?

English: If you are not disciplined (and everyone undergoes discipline), then you are illegitimate children and not true sons.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta c'am chon yak' cuenta axca chi yut yak'on cuenta yuninal masanil, mayon yuninalok chi yal tu', axca mi mitz' unin on yul sat.

English: Moreover, we have all had human fathers who disciplined us and we respected them for it. How much more should we submit to the Father of our spirits and live!
Kanjobal: A yet max con yak'on cuenta eb co mam yulyibank'inal ti', maj jintaknej el is cuenta eb tu'. Yuj tu', yelokab yikem chi jut co ba bay co Mam bay satcan, yet watx' ok co cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Our fathers disciplined us for a little while as they thought best; but God disciplines us for our good, that we may share in his holiness.
Kanjobal: A co mam junjun on bay yulyibank'inal ti', max con yak' cuenta eb jabok tiempoal axca max yochej c'ul. Palta a Dios, chon yak' cuenta yuj co watx'ilok, yet chi watx'ji oc co nabal axca is nabal.

English: No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.
Kanjobal: Yel toni, a yet chi alay oc co yailal tu', c'am junok on chon tzaloj yuj co yailal tu' yin aymanil, palta ta chi watx'ji oc co nabal yuj, c'ojanc'ulal chon jichloj oc yuj, cax chi jay co junc'ulal.

English: Therefore, strengthen your feeble arms and weak knees.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ayex axca tol c'amxa yip e k'ab, ma axca tol sicbinak el e yakan, tec'bajek e ba xol yailal.

English: “Make level paths for your feet,” so that the lame may not be disabled, but rather healed.
Kanjobal: Iek beybalej watx' c'al tojol, yet watx' man ok etaxxac'al el eb axca tol coxan yakan, palta tol ok tec'baj ba eb.

English: Make every effort to live in peace with all men and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord.
Kanjobal: Ak'ek e yip e yayji yin junc'ulal yetok masanil anima. Ak'ek c'apax e yip yet watx' watx' che yut e beybal, yujtol a eb man watx'ok is beybal maj yil eb yin Cham Jajawil.

English: See to it that no one misses the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.
Kanjobal: Xe yilc'al e ba, talaj ay mac e xol c'amxa chi yochej chi cha' is colwal Dios, yuj tu' xan chi pitzc'oj aj yobc'ulalil e xol, cax xiwil ex chex etax el yuj. A jun yobc'ulalil e xol tu', lajan axca junok te te' c'a' sat chi yak'a'.

English: See that no one is sexually immoral, or is godless like Esau, who for a single meal sold his inheritance rights as the oldest son.
Kanjobal: C'amokab junok ex che yut e ba ajmulal. C'amokab ex che yintaknej el tzet yetal yet Dios, axca yutnak ba Esaú. A Esaú tu', yin junnej lojal max q'uextok is satak t'inan chaon bay is mam yuj babel c'ajolejal.

English: Afterward, as you know, when he wanted to inherit this blessing, he was rejected. He could bring about no change of mind, though he sought the blessing with tears.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol yintakilto paxok, max yochento max ak'lay pax yet yuj is mam, palta c'amxa tzet max ak'lay bay. Caxc'almi xiwil max ok'i, palta c'amxa chi je' q'uexon tzet yetal max yun tu'.

English: You have not come to a mountain that can be touched and that is burning with fire; to darkness, gloom and storm;
Kanjobal: A on ti', man lajanok chi jun axca eb jet conob israel yet payxa. Yujtol a eb tu', max betic' bay jun tzalan chi je' jilon oc yin bay ay jun k'ak' nilnon yaji, a ton Sinaí. A bay tu' caw wal k'ekk'olinak, cax max ec' jun cak xuchum cak'ek'.

English: to a trumpet blast or to such a voice speaking words that those who heard it begged that no further word be spoken to them,
Kanjobal: Yabnak eb yok' jun trompeta. Yabnak c'apax eb yoc yul nuk' Dios, yet max k'anjab bay eb. A eb max aben k'anjab tu', max oc tean eb yin Moisés, tol manchakxa k'anjab Dios bay eb.

English: because they could not bear what was commanded: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol maj techaj yaben eb jun chekbanil ti': Ta ay junok chi jitzxac'altek ba bay yichlak witz ti', caxc'al no', yowalil chi k'okch'ennelay camok, ma xin tol chi teklay cam yetok lanza, ẍi.

English: The sight was so terrifying that Moses said, “I am trembling with fear.”
Kanjobal: Caw max xiw eb yet max yilon eb juntzan tu'. Toltax a Moisés yalnak axca ti': Caw chin luklon yuj xiwilal, ẍi.

English: But you have come to Mount Zion, to the heavenly Jerusalem, the city of the living God. You have come to thousands upon thousands of angels in joyful assembly,
Kanjobal: Palta ayon ti', manak bay jun tzalan tu' aytok co nabal. Yujtol a bay tzalan Sión, a ton is conob Cham Dios iquis, a tu' chi toj co nabal. A jun conob tu', a ton Jerusalén ay bay satcan,

English: to the church of the firstborn, whose names are written in heaven. You have come to God, the judge of all men, to the spirits of righteous men made perfect,
Kanjobal: bay manxa jantakok ángel chi waj ba, yet chi yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios. A tu' wajan c'apax ec' eb yuninalxa Dios, eb tz'ibbilxa bi bay satcan. A bay tu' ayic' Dios, Cham Juezal masanil anima. A tu' ayic' yanimail eb watx' yutnak is beybal, eb tol watx'jinakxa el yuj Dios.

English: to Jesus the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks a better word than the blood of Abel.
Kanjobal: A c'apax tu' ayic' Jesús, Cham chi ak'on yunel jun is cab trato Dios. A chiq'uil Jesús, axca tol txijbiltok jiban, a' chi ion el co yobtakil jin. A is chiq'uil tu', axca tol chi k'an mimanc'ulal jin, man axcaok is chiq'uil Abel tol max k'an paktzebal.

English: See to it that you do not refuse him who speaks. If they did not escape when they refused him who warned them on earth, how much less will we, if we turn away from him who warns us from heaven?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' jilekc'al co ba, yet watx' manchak jintaknejek el Cham chi k'anjab ayon tu'. A eb max intaknen el Dios yet payxa, yet max tenchelay eb yuj bay yulyibank'inal ti', majxa uj yel eb bay yailal. Akxam wal ayon ti', majc'alta' uj jel bay yailal, ta chi jintaknej el Cham chi k'anjab aytek satcan ayon.

English: At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, “Once more I will shake not only the earth but also the heavens.”
Kanjobal: A yet max k'anjab yet payxa tu', caw bilnak tx'otx' tx'otx' ti' yuj yoc yul is nuk'. Palta tinani', chi yal axca ti': Junelxanej, man asannejok tx'otx' tx'otx' ti' ok wak' bilok, palta ok wak' c'apax bil satcan, ẍi.

English: The words “once more” indicate the removing of what can be shaken–that is, created things–so that what cannot be shaken may remain.
Kanjobal: A jun chi yal junelxanej tu', chi yal elapnok tol a masanil tzet watx'nebil yuj, ok yak' bilok, cax ok yak'on lajwok elok. Axa pax juntzan c'am chi je' bil xin, ok can yin junelnej.

English: Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us be thankful, and so worship God acceptably with reverence and awe,
Kanjobal: Ay jalon jet yin bay yajaw yayji Dios; a jun tu' c'am chi je' yak'lay bilok. Yuj tu', jalek yuj diosalil bay Dios; jiek ay co ba bay axca chi cha c'ul. Xiwokonek bay,

English: for our “God is a consuming fire.”
Kanjobal: yujtol a co Diosal, lajan axca junok k'ak' k'ak' chi lajwi masanil yuj.

English: Keep on loving each other as brothers.
Kanjobal: Manchak co bekek co camc'ulnelen co ba, yujtol juẍtak co ba, janab co ba.

English: Do not forget to entertain strangers, for by so doing some people have entertained angels without knowing it.
Kanjobal: Co naektek tol bekanokab yel posada juj bay eb chi ec' ayon. Ay eb axca tu' yutnak ba, yak'nak eb posada eb ángel yin man yojtakok tatol ángel eb.

English: Remember those in prison as if you were their fellow prisoners, and those who are mistreated as if you yourselves were suffering.
Kanjobal: Co naektek eb jet creyenteal ayoc preso, axcaokab tol ayon oc preso yetok eb. Co naek c'apaxtek eb chi ilon yailal, axcaok tol ayon jun chi jab yail yetok eb.

English: Marriage should be honored by all, and the marriage bed kept pure, for God will judge the adulterer and all the sexually immoral.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jilen co ba yetok jetbi junjun on, ayokab yelapnok jun ilejbail tu' yul co sat. Asanokab yin jetbi tu' chi jaoc co nabal junjun on, yujtol a mac chi yaoc mul yul k'ab yistzil ma yul k'ab yichamil, ok beyc'ulnelay eb yuj Dios, c'al eb tol manto yetbiok ba cax chi mulji, ok beyc'ulnelay c'apax eb yuj Dios.

English: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, “Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.”
Kanjobal: Manokab asannejok ch'en tumin chi jil co naobtanej c'al co sayoni. Jak'ek tzaloj co c'ul yetok tzet ay ayon, yujtol yalnak Dios axca ti': C'am bak'in ok ex in bekcanok, tamwal ok ex wak'can e tx'oklil, ẍi.

English: So we say with confidence, “The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', c'am chon xiw jalon axca chi yal yul tx'an Un: Chi colwaj Cham Jajawil wetok, xan c'am chin xiwi. Tok ay tzet chi je' quin yuten eb anima, ẍi.

English: Remember your leaders, who spoke the word of God to you. Consider the outcome of their way of life and imitate their faith.
Kanjobal: Naektek eb ec'nak e nan e xol ex yak'on cuenta, a ton eb yalomal el k'anej Dios ayex. Naektek tzet max yun yeloc beybal eb e nan e xol. Axca max yut yaon oc eb c'ul yin Dios, cayokab tu' che yut c'apax e ba.

English: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
Kanjobal: A Jesucristo, ac'ala' Cham yet payxa, yetok tinani', c'al yet yajtok tu'.

English: Do not be carried away by all kinds of strange teachings. It is good for our hearts to be strengthened by grace, not by ceremonial foods, which are of no value to those who eat them.
Kanjobal: Manchak e yak' e ba etnelay yuj juntzanokxa tx'ok cuybanilejal chi ali. Caw watx' ta chi ak'lay tec'anil co nabal yuj watx'c'ulal Dios chi tx'ox ayon. Axa pax juntzan comon chekbanilej yuj tzet chi co lo' xin, c'am jabok yopiso watx'nen oc nabal eb chi beybalneni.

English: We have an altar from which those who minister at the tabernacle have no right to eat.
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', tx'ok yel jun co xajanbal. A eb sacerdote chi ak'on serbil Dios yul is templo, c'am yalon yet eb chion jun xajanbal ti'.

English: The high priest carries the blood of animals into the Most Holy Place as a sin offering, but the bodies are burned outside the camp.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a cham sat sacerdote chi ion octok chiq'uil no no' bay jun lugar asan Dios ay yet yin ofrendail yet chi yion el yobtakil. Axa tiel conob, ata tu' chi tz'a mimanil no no' tu'.

English: And so Jesus also suffered outside the city gate to make the people holy through his own blood.
Kanjobal: Axca ton tu' max yut yaben Jesús yail, yet max cam tiel conob, yet watx' a is chiq'uil chi ion el yobtakil anima.

English: Let us, then, go to him outside the camp, bearing the disgrace he bore.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', elokonektok axca bay max ilay eltok Jesús bay tiel conob tu', chi yal elapnok, jun lajanokab jintaknelay el yetok.

English: For here we do not have an enduring city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.
Kanjobal: Yujtol manak bay yulyibank'inal ti' ay co conob yin junelnej. Palta ay jun co conob tolto ok jayok. A ton jun tu' lanan jechbaneni.

English: Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise–the fruit of lips that confess his name.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', jalekc'al watx' k'anej bay Dios yuj Jesucristo. A watx' k'anej chi jal bay Dios, a ton juntzan tu' co xajanbal bay.

English: And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased.
Kanjobal: Manchak toj c'ayc'ulal juj junen watx'il, c'al co colwaj bay eb jet animail. Yujtol a juntzan ti', co xajanbal c'apax bay Dios, cax caw chi tzaloj Cham yetok.

English: Obey your leaders and submit to their authority. They keep watch over you as men who must give an account. Obey them so that their work will be a joy, not a burden, for that would be of no advantage to you.
Kanjobal: Ikejek tzet chi yal eb chex ak'on cuenta. Bekek oc e ba yul k'ab eb. Yujtol a eb chi taynenc'al e yanimail. Yojtak eb tol ok yak' eb cuenta bay Dios. Watx'okab che yut e ba, yet watx' chi tzaloj eb yilon jun mulnajil tu', cax c'am chi cusaj c'ul eb. Ta chi cusaj c'ul eb e yuj, man watx'ok e yet.

English: Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience and desire to live honorably in every way.
Kanjobal: Txajlanek wuj, yujtol wojtak tol watx' yayji yikbomal in nabal, yujtol chi wochej tol caw watx'c'al chi wut in beybal.

English: I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to you soon.
Kanjobal: Chin tewi ayex tol caw chex txajli wuj, yet watx' chi je' wapni ayex junelxa yin ayman.

English: May the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the sheep,
Kanjobal: A Dios ak'om junc'ulal, a' ak'nej ictzoj aj Cham Jajawil Jesucristo xol eb camnak. A Jesucristo, Jilomal yayji Cham tol miman yelapnok. Yuj is chiq'uil Cham, xan max yun jun is trato Dios tol c'am bak'in chi lajwi.

English: equip you with everything good for doing his will, and may he work in us what is pleasing to him, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Kanjobal: Chi wochej tol chi watx'ji wal oc e nabal yuj Dios, yet watx', watx'c'al che yut e ba, cax a tzet chi cha' c'ul Cham che yunej. Chi wochej c'apax tol yujokab Jesucristo, xan watx'okab on yul sat, yet watx' chi tzaloj Cham jetok. Mimanokabc'al yelapnok Cham yin tojbalk'inal. Yunokabi.

English: Brothers, I urge you to bear with my word of exhortation, for I have written you only a short letter.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chin tewi ayex, miman che yut e c'ul yuj juntzan k'anej chi waltok ayex ti'. Txench'an tzet chi waltok ayex yul jun in carta ti'.

English: I want you to know that our brother Timothy has been released. If he arrives soon, I will come with him to see you.
Kanjobal: Chi waltok e yabej tol mayal bekchaj juẍtak Timoteo. Ta ok jay cayti' yin aymanil, ok in tok yetok, yuj ex toj wiloni.

English: Greet all your leaders and all God's people. Those from Italy send you their greetings.
Kanjobal: Chi watok cawil c'ul junjun eb chex ikban bay tu', cax chi waon c'apaxtok cawil e c'ul e masanil ex yet exxa Dios wetok. Yetok eb aj Italia, ti' chi ya c'apaxtok eb cawil e c'ul.

English: Grace be with you all.
Kanjobal: Yak'okab Dios is watx'c'ulal ayex e masanil bay tu'.

English: We must pay more careful attention, therefore, to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', yowalil chi jaoc co nabal yin juntzan cuybej abbilxa juj. Ta c'amak, ay is may jab jabil ok on c'aycantok.

English: For if the message spoken by angels was binding, and every violation and disobedience received its just punishment,
Kanjobal: A is k'anej Dios yalnakcan bay eb ángel payxa, toltac'a max yunej. Ay eb max oc is yobtakil, cax max tenon eb tzet chi yala'. Yuj tu', max alay oc is yailal eb axca wal is mojalil.

English: how shall we escape if we ignore such a great salvation? This salvation, which was first announced by the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard him.
Kanjobal: Ta max alay oc yailal eb tu', ¿tzet wal ok jut co colon co ba ayon ti', ta chi jiel co nabal yin co colbanil caw miman yelapnok ti'? A wal Cham Jajawil babel alnej yabixal co colbanil ti'. Axa eb max abeni, tx'oxnak el eb, tol yel jun abix ti', cax max yalon eb ayon.

English: God also testified to it by signs, wonders and various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his will.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax Dios, yak'nak ba testigoal yin jun abix ti'. Tx'oxnak juntzan milagro, c'al juntzan tzet chi c'ayaj co c'ul yuj yet chi jiloni, yet watx' chi tx'oxk'abnej elok tol miman yelapnok jun abix ti'. Ilab c'apax Cham is Yespíritu, chi yak' c'apax ba Cham testigoal yin, yujtol chi yak' Cham jopiso junjun on, atac'ala' tzet opisoal chi yal c'ul Cham chi yak' ayon.

English: It is not to angels that he has subjected the world to come, about which we are speaking.
Kanjobal: Ti wal chi waltek yuj junxa yulyibank'inal tolto ok jayok. A jun yulyibank'inal tu', man yulok k'ab eb ángel ok yak' Dios.

English: But there is a place where someone has testified: “What is man that you are mindful of him, the son of man that you care for him?
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yul tx'an Un, ay bay chi yal axca ti': ¿Tzet jelapnok ayon anima on ti', xan chon a natek, cax nanon yec' a c'ul yuj co watx'ilok?

English: You made him a little lower than the angels; you crowned him with glory and honor
Kanjobal: Yaynakil janic'ok yintak eb ángel max con ot a watx'neni. Palta ach max ak' mimanbilal c'al mayk'ak'al ayon. Max ak' jikbej yiban onben.

English: and put everything under his feet.” In putting everything under him, God left nothing that is not subject to him. Yet at present we do not see everything subject to him.
Kanjobal: Max acan oc masanil tzet yetal watx'nebil oj yul co k'ab, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'. Yuj tu', a yet max yaon oc Dios masanil tzetak yetal yul co k'ab, c'am junok tzet yetal tol maj yak' ayon. Asan tol a tinani', c'amto chi jila' ta masanil ayoc yul co k'ab.

English: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, now crowned with glory and honor because he suffered death, so that by the grace of God he might taste death for everyone.
Kanjobal: Palta chi jiloc yin Jesús, Cham max utlay yaynakil janic' tiempoal yintak eb ángel yuj Dios, yet max oc animail. Yuj watx'c'ulal Dios, xan max el yin c'ul cam Jesús jujc'al co masanil. Axa tinani' xin, caw ec'ban watx'il max utlay Cham, cax miman yelapnok Cham, yujtol max yab yail camich.

English: In bringing many sons to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the author of their salvation perfect through suffering.
Kanjobal: Watx'nebil masanil tzetak yetal yuj Dios, yet watx' chi txecloj elok tol miman yelapnok Cham. Max cha' c'ul Cham tol a eb is yuninal, ay yalon yet eb bay is tzekekial. Yuj tu' xan moj tol chi tz'aknaj el Jesús yuj yaben yail, yujtol a Cham max tz'unon yich co colbanil.

English: Both the one who makes men holy and those who are made holy are of the same family. So Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers.
Kanjobal: Ayon max on oc yetok Dios, junnej co Mam yetok Cham max on aon oc yetok tu', a ton Cham C'ajol Dios. Yuj tu', c'am chi q'uixwi Cham on yalon oc yuẍtakok, ma yanabok.

English: He says, “I will declare your name to my brothers; in the presence of the congregation I will sing your praises.”
Kanjobal: Axca tu' yalon bay is Mam yul tx'an Un: Ok walcan el abixal bay eb wuẍtak, bay eb wanab. A yet ok wajon ba eb, ok ach in bitnej xol eb, ẍi.

English: And again, “I will put my trust in him.” And again he says, “Here am I, and the children God has given me.”
Kanjobal: Yalnak c'apax axca ti': A Dios ok waoc yipok in c'ul, ẍi. Max yalon c'apax junelxa: Tix in ti' yetok eb wuninal max yak' Dios ayin, ẍi Cristo yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: Since the children have flesh and blood, he too shared in their humanity so that by his death he might destroy him who holds the power of death–that is, the devil–
Kanjobal: Ayon chon oc yuninalok Dios yetok Cristo, cambejal yayji co mimanil ti'. Yuj tu' xan yowalil max oc c'apax mimanil Jesús cambejal axca co mimanil ti', xan a yet max cam Cham, max yak' lajwok jun ayoc yikbej on yak'on camok, a ton nak diablo.

English: and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by their fear of death.
Kanjobal: A yet yalantok, axca tol mosejal jayji bay nak diablo tu', yujtol chon xiw co cami; palta a Jesús colnej on el tinani'.

English: For surely it is not angels he helps, but Abraham's descendants.
Kanjobal: Wal yel, man yujok ul colon el eb ángel xan max ulic'ok, palta juj ayon yinatil Abraham on ti'.

English: For this reason he had to be made like his brothers in every way, in order that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, and that he might make atonement for the sins of the people.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', yowalil lajan max utlay axca ayon uẍtakej on ti', yet watx' chi ok' c'ul jin, cax tojol chi yut yaon oc co ti' bay Dios, c'al yuj yak'on ba yin xajanbalil yuj yion el co yobtakil jin.

English: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.
Kanjobal: Cax tutun acaw Cham max yab yail yet max ak'lay porobal Cham, xan a tinani' chi je' yoc Cham jetok yet chon ak'lay porobal c'apaxok.

English: Therefore, holy brothers, who share in the heavenly calling, fix your thoughts on Jesus, the apostle and high priest whom we confess.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, ex tol yet exxa Dios wetok, yujtol awtebil on oc yuj joc yetok, jaek wal oc co nabal yin Cristo Jesús, yujtol a' chekbiltek ayon yuj Dios. Jesús sat sacerdote yayji, atac'ala' yalon co cuybanil chabil juj ti'.

English: He was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all God's house.
Kanjobal: A Cham, yikemc'al bay Cham ak'nej yopiso, axca yikemal Moisés xol masanil eb yuninal Dios yetok.

English: Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.
Kanjobal: A junok watx'nem na, ec'ban yintak junok na chi watx'nej tu'. Axca tu' ec'ban Jesús yintak Moisés tu'.

English: For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.
Kanjobal: Junjun na yowalil ay mactxel chi watx'neni, palta a Dios watx'nenej masanil tzetak yetal.

English: Moses was faithful as a servant in all God's house, testifying to what would be said in the future.
Kanjobal: A Moisés tu', yikemc'al yutnak ba yin yak'wi serbil nan xol eb yuninal Dios yetok. Ayokto max yak'oncan ba testigoal yin juntzan tzet tolto t'inan yalon Dios.

English: But Christ is faithful as a son over God's house. And we are his house, if we hold on to our courage and the hope of which we boast.
Kanjobal: Palta a Cristo, yikem c'apax yutnak ba, C'ajol ton Dios Cham. A Cham ayoc Yajawilal yiban eb yet uninalej ba yetok. Ta tec'an chi jut jaon oc co c'ul yin, cax chon tzaloj yin Cham ayoc yipok co c'ul, titol yuninal on Dios chi yal tu'.

English: So, as the Holy Spirit says: “Today, if you hear his voice,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', axca ta' yalon Cham Espíritu Santo yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok: Ta che yab tzet chi wal tinani',

English: do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion, during the time of testing in the desert,
Kanjobal: manchak e pitnej e ba axca max yut ba eb e yichmam yin tenomtakil bay tz'inan tx'otx' bay max in yak' porobal eb.

English: where your fathers tested and tried me and for forty years saw what I did.
Kanjobal: A yet tu' max in yak' wal porobal eb e yichmam tu', ti' pax max yil eb juntzan wunben c'ayubtak yin cawinak abil.

English: That is why I was angry with that generation, and I said, ‘Their hearts are always going astray, and they have not known my ways.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' caw ow inc'al bay eb. Max walon axca ti': A juntzan anima ti' tx'okc'al bay ayoc is nabal eb, maj yojtaknej el eb in c'ulbal, quin chi.

English: So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ”
Kanjobal: Yuj wal tu', yetok wowal max wak'on in ti' bay eb tol man ok oc eb bay ok wak' xew eb, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: See to it, brothers, that none of you has a sinful, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, xe yilc'al e ba, yet watx' c'amokab junok ex che pitnej e ba, cax che yak'on cabc'ulal xan che yiel e c'ul yin Cham Dios iquis.

English: But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called Today, so that none of you may be hardened by sin's deceitfulness.
Kanjobal: Yak'ban ayto jabokxa tiempo, iptzelejek e ba junjun c'u, yet watx' c'amokab ex chex etnelay yuj tzet man watx'ok, cax chex pitbi el yuj.

English: We have come to share in Christ if we hold firmly till the end the confidence we had at first.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ta tec'anc'al co waay masantac'al yet lajubal, yin tzet janak oc yipok co c'ul yettax yichbanil, ay jalon jet yetok Cristo.

English: As has just been said: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol axca ti' tz'ibelaycanok: Ta che yab tzet chi wal tinani', manchak e pitnej e ba, axca max yut ba eb e yichmam yin tenomtakil, ẍi bay tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those Moses led out of Egypt?
Kanjobal: ¿Mactxel eb abnej k'anej Dios che na'? ¿Mactxel eb tenomtak yutnak ba bay tu'? A ton masanil eb ibil eltek yuj Moisés bay Egipto.

English: And with whom was he angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the desert?
Kanjobal: ¿Mactxel eb titnak yowal Dios yin, yin cawinak abil tu' che na'? A yin eb yob yutnak ba bay, eb max camcan bay tz'inan tx'otx' tu'.

English: And to whom did God swear that they would never enter his rest if not to those who disobeyed?
Kanjobal: A ton eb bay yak'nak Dios is ti' tol man ok oc eb xew yetok. A ton eb man yikemok yutnak ba bay tu'.

English: So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', chi jojtaknej elok, tol majc'al oc eb xew yetok, yujtol maj yaoc eb c'ul yin.

English: Therefore, since the promise of entering his rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.
Kanjobal: Yak'nakcan Dios is ti', tol chi je' joc xew yetok. Yuj tu', jilekc'al co ba sic'libil, yet watx' c'amokab junok on tol c'am chon oc xew yetok.

English: For we also have had the gospel preached to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because those who heard did not combine it with faith.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max al-lay c'apax k'anejal yet colbanilej ayon, axca max yun yal-lay bay eb jichmam tu'; palta nabac'al max yab eb, yujtol maj yaoc eb yin c'ul.

English: Now we who have believed enter that rest, just as God has said, “So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ” And yet his work has been finished since the creation of the world.
Kanjobal: Palta ayon ti', ok on oc xew yetok yujtol chi jaoc co c'ul yin. Yalnak Dios yuj eb jichmam tu' axca ti': Yuj wal tu' yetok wowal max wak'on in ti' bay eb tol man ok oc eb bay ok wak' xew eb, ẍi. Palta lajwinakxa mulnajil Dios yettax max lajwi watx'nen yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: For somewhere he has spoken about the seventh day in these words: “And on the seventh day God rested from all his work.”
Kanjobal: Ay bay chi yalcan yuj jun yet is suk c'ual yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, chi yalon axca ti': A yet is suk c'ual xin, max xew Dios yin masanil is mulnajil, ẍi.

English: And again in the passage above he says, “They shall never enter my rest.”
Kanjobal: Cax chi yalon c'apaxok: Man ok oc eb bay ok wak' xew eb, ẍi.

English: It still remains that some will enter that rest, and those who formerly had the gospel preached to them did not go in, because of their disobedience.
Kanjobal: A eb tu', babel abnej jun k'anejal yet colbanilej; palta maj oc eb xew yetok Dios, yujtol man yikemok yutnak ba eb. Palta yowalil ay mac ok oc xew axcac'alta' yaloncan tu'.

English: Therefore God again set a certain day, calling it Today, when a long time later he spoke through David, as was said before: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ay jun tiempoal k'okbilcan yuj Dios, a ton jun tiempoal tu' tinani'. Payxatax yalnakcan Dios yuj jun xewilal tu', cax max yak'on yal David axca max wala', yet chi yalon axca ti': Ta che yab tzet chi wal tinani', manchak e pitnej e ba bay, ẍi.

English: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta max oc eb jet israelal bay xewilal tu' yuj Josué, majxam yaltek Dios junokxa tiempoal.

English: There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God;
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ay wal jun co xewilal ok yak' Dios ayon yet onxa ti'.

English: for anyone who enters God's rest also rests from his own work, just as God did from his.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet ok on xew yetok Dios, chon xew yin co mulnajil, axca max yun xew Cham yin is mulnajil.

English: Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will fall by following their example of disobedience.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', jak'ek jip joc bay jun xewilal tu', yet watx' c'am junok on chi jut co ba axca yutnak ba eb maj iken tu'.

English: For the word of God is living and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a is k'anej Dios iquis, chic'al je' yuj masanil. Lajan is k'anej tu', axca junok ch'en espada el yayji ye ca paq'uil. Yujtol chi jeklay octok yin co nabal c'al yin janimail. Chi tx'ox tzet chi co na' junjun on, c'al tzet chi jochej.

English: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of him to whom we must give account.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mac chi je' c'uban el ba yul sat Dios. Caw miman txequel masanil tzetak yetal yul sat Cham. A bay Cham ok jak' masanil co cuenta.

English: Therefore, since we have a great high priest who has gone through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to the faith we profess.
Kanjobal: Ay jun co sat sacerdote tol miman yelapnok, a ton Jesús, Cham is C'ajol Dios. Paxnak aj Cham satcan, bay is watx' k'ab Dios. Yuj tu', jiekc'al bey co cuybanil.

English: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are–yet was without sin.
Kanjobal: A jun co sat sacerdote tu', yojtak chi ok' c'ul jin yuj c'am co tec'anil, yujtol max yak'lej nak diablo yikban Cham yin masanil yobtakil axca on ti'; asan xin, c'am junelok max oc is yobtakil.

English: Let us then approach the throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', manchak on xiw japni oc satak Dios bay chi txecloj el is watx'c'ulal. A tu' chi tx'ox is c'ulbal ayon, c'al is watx'c'ulal, mawal yet cawxinak on elok.

English: Every high priest is selected from among men and is appointed to represent them in matters related to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins.
Kanjobal: A junjun co sat sacerdote ayon israel on ti', a co xol sic'bil elok. Ak'bil yopiso eb yaon oc co ti' bay Dios, cax chi ak'wi ofrenda c'al xajanbal eb yuj co yobtakil.

English: He is able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and are going astray, since he himself is subject to weakness.
Kanjobal: Lajan eb jetok, yujtol c'am c'apax tec'anil eb axca on ayon ti'. Yuj tu' xan chi je' yuj eb, tol miman chi yut eb c'ul yin eb c'am chi nachaj el yuj, c'al yin eb chi ayc'ay yin junok paltail.

English: This is why he has to offer sacrifices for his own sins, as well as for the sins of the people.
Kanjobal: A eb sat sacerdote, naba anima eb, yuj tu' xan yowalil chi yak' c'apax eb xajanbal yuj is yobtakil, axca chi yut yak'on eb yuj co yobtakil.

English: No one takes this honor upon himself; he must be called by God, just as Aaron was.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mac chi je' comonc'al chi yaoc ba yin jun opiso tu'. Asan eb awtebil yuj Dios chi je' yoc yin, axca yunnak Aarón yet max awtelay yuj Dios yet payxa.

English: So Christ also did not take upon himself the glory of becoming a high priest. But God said to him, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father. ”
Kanjobal: Ilab c'apax Cristo, maj yaoc ba yul yet yin sat sacerdoteal, palta tol a Dios anej oc yopiso. Axca tu' max yun yalon bay axca ti': Ach ton ti', in C'ajol ach. Ayin max ach wak' iquisbok tinani', ẍi.

English: And he says in another place, “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax junxa lugar bay yalnak c'apax can yul tx'an Un tu' axca ti': Ach ton sacerdote ach yin tojbalk'inal, axca yopiso Melquisedec, ẍi Dios bay.

English: During the days of Jesus' life on earth, he offered up prayers and petitions with loud cries and tears to the one who could save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission.
Kanjobal: A yet ayic' Jesús bay yulyibank'inal ti', chi txajli, chi k'anon tzetak yetal bay Dios. Caw yip chi txajli, toltax max ok'i. Axa Dios tol ay is yipalil colon el yul k'ab camich, yabnak is txaj Jesús, yujtol yaynakil yutnak ba bay.

English: Although he was a son, he learned obedience from what he suffered
Kanjobal: Caxc'al C'ajol Dios Cham, palta yuj juntzan yailal ec'nak el yiban tu', xan max nachaj el yuj tzet yelapnok ikemal.

English: and, once made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him
Kanjobal: Axa yet max tz'aknaj el xin, max ak'lay yopiso yak'on colbanilej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal bay masanil eb chi iken tzet chi yala'.

English: and was designated by God to be high priest in the order of Melchizedek.
Kanjobal: Xan a Dios ak'nej yopiso yin sat sacerdoteal, axca yopiso Melquisedec yet payxa.

English: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because you are slow to learn.
Kanjobal: Xiwilto tzet chi wochej chi waltok ayex yuj jun ti', palta pural ok nachaj el e yuj, yujtol lanan e pitbi elok.

English: In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's word all over again. You need milk, not solid food!
Kanjobal: Ilab ayxa tiempoal e yaon oc yin e c'ul. Moj wal tol cuywajwom exxa tinani', palta ac'ala' babel cuyoj e yabnak, yowalil ac'ala' chi al-lay ayex. Manto tec'anok e waayi, lajan extoc'al axca junok aq'uiẍ unin chito txutxwi, c'amto jabok tzet chi lo'.

English: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.
Kanjobal: A juntzan cuybej tu', axcac'al leche, cac'al tu'. Yuj tu' xan a eb ac'ala' juntzan tu' chi yochej chi yabc'al, axca tol aq'uiẍ uninc'al eb. A juntzan cuybej chi alon tzet chi jut co watx'nen oc co beybal, c'am chi nachaj el yuj eb.

English: But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.
Kanjobal: A cuybej ya nachaj elok, lajan axca tzet chi lo' icham anima. Yuj tu' xan, asan eb tec'anxa is nabal chi cuyon juntzan tu'. Yojtakxa eb chi nailok, baytet ay watx', baytet ay tzet man watx'ok.

English: Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,
Kanjobal: A tinani' xin, tonek co satak, yet watx' chi tec'anbi co nabal. Canokab juntzan babel cuybej yin Cristo jabnak tu'. Manchakxa co cuyubtanejek juntzan babel cuybanil ok waltek ti', axca cuybanil chi aloni tol chi co na co ba yin juntzan tzet chi iontek camich jiban, cax chi yaloni tol chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios;

English: instruction about baptisms, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.
Kanjobal: axca cuybanil chi alon yuj bautismo, c'al yalay oc k'abej yiban co jolom, yet chi oc jopiso; axca cuybanil chi aloni tol ok on ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, c'al cuybanil chi alontek yailal eb anima yin junelnej. A juntzan cuybanilej ti' yetzanxa jaben tinani'.

English: And God permitting, we will do so.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ay wal junxa makan cuybanilej ok co cuyu', ta chi el yin c'ul Dios.

English: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, who have shared in the Holy Spirit,
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', axca tol tzektanebilxa co nabal. Chabilxa jun sabal Dios caw watx' juj, ay jalon jet yin Cham Espíritu Santo.

English: who have tasted the goodness of the word of God and the powers of the coming age,
Kanjobal: Jojtakxa is watx' abix Dios. Jojtakxa is yipalil ok tx'ox yet jun tiempoal tolto ok jayok.

English: if they fall away, to be brought back to repentance, because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting him to public disgrace.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ta chi jiel co nabal yin Cristo, ¿tzet ok yun co meltzoj oc junelxa, cax chi co naon pax co ba? Yujtol a yet chi jion el co nabal tu', chi yal elapnok axca wal tol ayon lanan co locban pax aj Cham C'ajol Dios yin curus junelxa. Lanan jion el is q'uixwil satak anima.

English: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God.
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', lajan on axca tx'otx' tx'otx'. A yet chi yak'on nab, chi yuc' tan tx'otx' a'. Ay tx'otx' caw watx' yawojal chi yak' bay mac chi mulnaj sat. Yuj tu' chi tx'ox Dios is watx'c'ulal yiban tx'otx' tu'.

English: But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.
Kanjobal: Palta ay tx'otx' tx'otx' q'uixc'al chi yak'a', c'al comon ac'un; c'am jabok yopiso. Yuj tu', ok jay yowal c'ul Dios yiban, cax ok tz'aok.

English: Even though we speak like this, dear friends, we are confident of better things in your case–things that accompany salvation.
Kanjobal: Palta ex co camc'ulnebil, caxc'al max jaltok juntzan ti' ayex, chi jaoc yipok co c'ul, tol lanan e chaon watx'c'ulal Dios. Yuj tu', jojtak tol ayxa e colbanil.

English: God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Dios bayc'al ijan chi yutej. Man ok tok c'ayc'ulal tzet max el e yunen yuj. Man ok tok e camc'ulal max e tx'ox bay, yin c'ayc'ulal yuj, yet max ex colwaj bay eb yet-xa Dios jetok. Ac'ala'to e colwaj tinani' c'apaxok.

English: We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure.
Kanjobal: Palta chi jochej tol junjun ex, tol caytu' che yut e ba masanil tiempo, yet watx' tz'akaki ok e yut e chaon pax tzet che yechbanej.

English: We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.
Kanjobal: Chi jochej tol man isajok che yut e ba yin yet Dios. Beybalnejek is beybal eb caw chi yaoc c'ul yin, eb caw tec'an chi yut ba. A eb chi beybalnen axca chi wal ti', chi yi eb juntzan tzet yak'nak Dios is ti' yak'oni.

English: When God made his promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for him to swear by, he swore by himself,
Kanjobal: A yet max yak'on Dios is ti' bay Abraham yet payxa, c'am junokxa mac max loctek, ac'al bi Cham max loctek, yujtol c'am junokxa mac ec'ban yintak Cham.

English: saying, “I will surely bless you and give you many descendants.”
Kanjobal: Max yal bay Abraham tu' axca ti': Wal yel, ok wak' miman in watx'c'ulal eban, ok wiwal aj can enatil, ẍi bay.

English: And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.
Kanjobal: A Abraham tu', mimanc'al chi yut c'ul yechbaneni. Yuj tu', max cha' tzet yak'nak Dios ti' yak'on bay.

English: Men swear by someone greater than themselves, and the oath confirms what is said and puts an end to all argument.
Kanjobal: A yet chi co loctek bi junokxa mactxel, asan junok mac yelxac'al miman yelapnok jintak chi co loctek bi. A yet chi jalon tzet yetal tol yel, chi ton co loctek bi junokxa mactxel, yet watx' c'amc'al tzet chi jal yetok.

English: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of his purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, he confirmed it with an oath.
Kanjobal: Xan caytu' yutnak Dios yak'on is ti', cax ac'al oc max loctek is bi, yujtol chi yochej chi tx'ox jila', tol yel ok co cha' tzet yak'nak is ti' yak'on ayon, cax c'am chi q'uex is ti'.

English: God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged.
Kanjobal: Yak'nak Dios is ti', cax max locban is bi, yuj tu', a tzet yalnakcanok, c'am bak'in tol man ok yunej, yujtol a Dios, c'am chi je' yak'on lek'tial. A tzet yalnakcanok, chi jaoc yipok co c'ul, yujtol janak oc co ba yul k'ab yuj on is coloni. Lanan jechbanen tzet ok yak' ayon, cax ayoc yipok co c'ul.

English: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi jaoc yipok co c'ul, xan tec'anxa waay co nabal tinani'. Lajanxa axca junok barco watx' mitx'lay tzakay yuj is mitx'banil ayaytok yul a'. A jun ayoc yipok co c'ul tu', watx'xa yayji octok yintak oc an makil nan templo Dios bay satcan,

English: where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.
Kanjobal: bay babel ocnaktok Jesús co satak, yuj jakon ayon. Axca tu' max yun yoc sat sacerdoteal yin tojbalk'inal, axca yopiso Melquisedec.

English: This Melchizedek was king of Salem and priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the defeat of the kings and blessed him,
Kanjobal: A Melquisedec, reyal conob Salem yet payxa, cax sacerdote bay Dios Cham Axac'al Ocok. A yet junel, betnak ec' Abraham yak'lej owal yetok juntzanxa rey, max bet ayc'ay eb yuj. A yet max meltzoji, max bet chalay yul be yuj Melquisedec. Max k'anon watx'c'ulal Dios yiban Abraham tu'.

English: and Abraham gave him a tenth of everything. First, his name means “king of righteousness”; then also, “king of Salem” means “king of peace.”
Kanjobal: Max yak' Abraham tu' is diezmo bay Melquisedec yin tzet max bet yi' bay owal tu'. A Melquisedec, chi yal elapnok, rey tojol beybal. Reyal c'apax conob Salem yayji. Salem, chi yal elapnok, junc'ulal. Yuj tu', xan chi yik c'apax Melquisedec tu', reyal junc'ulal.

English: Without father or mother, without genealogy, without beginning of days or end of life, like the Son of God he remains a priest forever.
Kanjobal: Man ojtakbilok mactxel is mam c'al is txutx, tamwal is yichmam. C'am tzet chi yaltek yuj yaljubal, tamwal yuj is camichal. Yuj tu', yenel Cham C'ajol Dios yayji, Cham sacerdote yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Just think how great he was: Even the patriarch Abraham gave him a tenth of the plunder!
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, nachajokab el e yuj, tol miman yelapnok Melquisedec tu', yujtol max yak' jichmam Abraham is diezmoal tzet max yi yin owal tu' bay.

English: Now the law requires the descendants of Levi who become priests to collect a tenth from the people–that is, their brothers–even though their brothers are descended from Abraham.
Kanjobal: Chi yal yul ley Moisés, tol a eb sacerdote yinatil Leví, ay yalon yet chaon is diezmo eb yet conob. Caxc'al yinatil Abraham eb yetok eb, palta yowalilc'alta' chi yak' eb.

English: This man, however, did not trace his descent from Levi, yet he collected a tenth from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.
Kanjobal: A Melquisedec tu', caxc'al man yinatilok Leví tu', palta chanak is diezmo Abraham, cham mac bay yak'nak Dios is ti', cax max k'anoncan watx'c'ulal Dios yiban Abraham tu'.

English: And without doubt the lesser person is blessed by the greater.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol a mac chi k'anon watx'c'ulal Dios yiban junokxa mactxel, wal yel miman yelapnok yintak jun mac chi k'antek watx'c'ulalil Dios yin.

English: In the one case, the tenth is collected by men who die; but in the other case, by him who is declared to be living.
Kanjobal: A tinani', a eb chi chaon diezmo eb jet conob, naba anima eb, cambejal yayji eb; palta chi yal tx'an Un, tol a Melquisedec, axca tol iquisto.

English: One might even say that Levi, who collects the tenth, paid the tenth through Abraham,
Kanjobal: A Leví chi chaon diezmo eb jet conob yet payxa, palta chi je' jaloni, tol ajun Leví tu' max yak' c'apax is diezmo bay Melquisedec yet max yak'on Abraham tu' yet.

English: because when Melchizedek met Abraham, Levi was still in the body of his ancestor.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet max bet chaon Melquisedec Abraham tu', c'amto chi alji Leví, palta ayoc yin mimanil Abraham tu', yujtol is yichmam.

English: If perfection could have been attained through the Levitical priesthood (for on the basis of it the law was given to the people), why was there still need for another priest to come–one in the order of Melchizedek, not in the order of Aaron?
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, max cha eb ley Moisés yul k'ab eb sacerdote yinatil Aarón, tol titnak yin Leví. K'inalok ta yuj eb chi je' watx'ji oc eb conob satak Dios, ta axca tu', ¿tzetto wal yuj max oc junxa sacerdote axca Melquisedec, cax man axcaok Aarón?

English: For when there is a change of the priesthood, there must also be a change of the law.
Kanjobal: Tatol chi q'uexlay eb sacerdote, yowalil chi q'uexlay c'apax ley Moisés.

English: He of whom these things are said belonged to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar.
Kanjobal: A jun mac lanan yal-lay ti', a ton Cham Jajawil. A Cham Jajawil ti', man yinatilok Leví Cham. Tx'ok junxa tribual eb israel ay yinatil Cham. A xol junxa tribu tu', c'am junok sacerdote xol.

English: For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol a Cham Jajawil, yinatil Judá Cham; palta c'am tzet yalnakcan Moisés ta ay junok eb yinatil Judá chi je' yoc yin sacerdoteal.

English: And what we have said is even more clear if another priest like Melchizedek appears,
Kanjobal: Caw watx' nachaj el juntzan ti' juj, yujtol a junxa sacerdote max jay tu', a ton Cham Jajawil, lajan yopiso axca Melquisedec.

English: one who has become a priest not on the basis of a regulation as to his ancestry but on the basis of the power of an indestructible life.
Kanjobal: Max oc Cristo yin sat sacerdoteal yujtol c'am bak'in ok lajwok is k'inal, man yujok yinatil albil yuj ley.

English: For it is declared: “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol yalnak Dios bay axca ti': Sacerdote ach yin tojbalk'inal, axca yopiso Melquisedec, ẍi Dios bay.

English: The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a jun ley yet yalantok tu', lajwinakxa yopiso, yujtol c'am is yipalil, nabac'al ay.

English: (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.
Kanjobal: C'am junok tzet max watx'ji yuj jun ley Moisés tu', palta ay junxa yelxac'al watx' max occan is q'uexelok, a ton jun ayoc yipok co c'ul. Yuj jun tu', chi je' co jitzon oc co ba c'atan Dios.

English: And it was not without an oath! Others became priests without any oath,
Kanjobal: A yet max watx'nencan yayji Dios jun ti', max loctek Cham is bi.

English: but he became a priest with an oath when God said to him: “The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: ‘You are a priest forever.’ ”
Kanjobal: A yet max oc eb sacerdote yin yopiso yet payxa, maj loclaytek is bi Dios; palta a yet max oc Jesús yin sacerdoteal, max loctek Cham is bi, yujtol tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un axca ti': Max yak' Cham Jajawil is ti' cax c'am bak'in ok q'uexa'. Yalnak Cham axca ti': Sacerdote ach yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Dios, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Because of this oath, Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' a junxa is trato max yak' tu', ec'ban watx'il yintak jun yak'nak yet babelal. A Jesús chi ak'on yunel jun trato tu'.

English: Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office;
Kanjobal: Xiwil mac ec'lejnak yin sacerdoteal. C'am junok eb chi je' yayjic'al ec' yin jun opiso tu' masanil tiempo, yujtol chi cam eb.

English: but because Jesus lives forever, he has a permanent priesthood.
Kanjobal: Axa pax Jesús xin, c'amxa bak'in ok camok. Yuj tu', ayc'al oc yin sacerdoteal yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Therefore he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a mac chi alay oc yul k'ab Dios yuj, chi je' chaon is colbanil tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal yuj, yujtol iquisc'al Cham yin tojbalk'inal, cax chi tewi bay Dios juj.

English: Such a high priest meets our need–one who is holy, blameless, pure, set apart from sinners, exalted above the heavens.
Kanjobal: A wal jun sat sacerdote ti', caw ay yopiso juj. Watx' Cham. C'am jabok is paltail ayoc yin. C'am yobtakil yin. Man lajanok beybal axca eb yobtakwom. Yel miman yelapnok yintak masanil bay satcan.

English: Unlike the other high priests, he does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when he offered himself.
Kanjobal: Man lajanok axca eb sat sacerdote yinatil Aarón, yujtol a eb tu', yowalil chi yak' eb xajanbal junjun c'u. Babel chi yak'can eb yuj is yobtakil, catatu' chi yak'on eb yuj yobtakil eb yet animail. A pax Jesús xin, junel ch'an yak'nak ba yin xajanbalil yuj co yobtakil, yet max yak' ba bay camich.

English: For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever.
Kanjobal: A eb ocnak yin sat sacerdoteal yuj ley Moisés, anima ton eb, ay is paltail eb; palta a yet max lajwi yopiso jun ley tu', munilc'al max loctek Dios is bi, cax max yaon oc yopiso junxa sat sacerdote, a ton is C'ajol, Cham tol tz'akaki yin watx'il yin tojbalk'inal.

English: The point of what we are saying is this: We do have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,
Kanjobal: A ton jun ti' chi wochej chi nachaj el e yuj, tol axca tu' yayji oc jun co sat sacerdote. A tinani', chotan ay bay watx' k'ab Dios bay is despacho bay satcan.

English: and who serves in the sanctuary, the true tabernacle set up by the Lord, not by man.
Kanjobal: Lanan yak'on yopiso bay yul acaw templo Dios, jun munilc'al watx'nebil yuj Cham Jajawil tu'; man animaok max watx'neni.

English: Every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices, and so it was necessary for this one also to have something to offer.
Kanjobal: Junjun eb sat sacerdote ayoc yopiso eb yak'wi ofrenda c'al xajanbal. Yuj tu' yowalil c'apax ay tzet chi yak' Jesucristo yin xajanbalil.

English: If he were on earth, he would not be a priest, for there are already men who offer the gifts prescribed by the law.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ayc'al ec' yulyibank'inal ti' tinani', c'am mi yopiso yin sacerdoteal, yujtol aytoc'al eb sacerdote, cax chi ak'wi c'apax ofrenda eb axca chi yal ley Moisés.

English: They serve at a sanctuary that is a copy and shadow of what is in heaven. This is why Moses was warned when he was about to build the tabernacle: “See to it that you make everything according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yopiso eb tu', yenelc'al tzet ay satcan. Jojtak tol enelejc'al yayji, yujtol a yet c'amto chi watx'nej Moisés jun cajlub Dios, max yalon Dios bay axca ti': Chi cam wal eloni, tol lajan wal chi yun a watx'nen masanil axca yayji yechel max in tx'ox ayach bay jolom witz ti', ẍi bay.

English: But the ministry Jesus has received is as superior to theirs as the covenant of which he is mediator is superior to the old one, and it is founded on better promises.
Kanjobal: Palta a jun co sat sacerdote tinani', yelxac'al ec'ban watx'il yopiso yintak yet eb tu', yujtol a' chi ak'on yunel jun is trato Dios yak'nak ayon. A jun is trato tu', ec'ban watx'il yintak jun babel trato, yujtol tz'unbil ay yiban yalben Dios yelxac'al watx'.

English: For if there had been nothing wrong with that first covenant, no place would have been sought for another.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta c'am junok tzet chi yak' palta yin jun is babel trato tu', man xam yowalilok max yak' jun yet is cab trato ti'.

English: But God found fault with the people and said: “The time is coming, declares the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.
Kanjobal: Palta max yil Dios tol yob yutnak ba eb anima tu'. Yuj tu' xan chi yal yul tx'an Un axca ti': Axca wal ti' yalon Cham Jajawil: Ok ajapnok jun c'ual cax ok in watx'nej junok yet is cab trato yetok eb yinatil Israel, c'al yetok eb yinatil Judá.

English: It will not be like the covenant I made with their forefathers when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they did not remain faithful to my covenant, and I turned away from them, declares the Lord.
Kanjobal: A jun trato tu', man lajanok yetok jun max in watx'nej yetok yichmam eb, yet max wion eltek eb bay Egipto. Axca tol ocnak in q'uetzan yin k'ab eb, max wion eltek eb. Ayin wal caw Yajaw in chi wala' tol a eb tu' maj yikej eb in trato max in watx'nej yetok eb, yuj tu' xan max in bekcan eb tx'oklil.

English: This is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put my laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.
Kanjobal: Tix ok wut in trato yetok eb yinatil Israel yet yajtok tu'. Ayin wal caw Yajaw in chi wala' tol ok waoc juntzan in chekbanil yin is nabal eb, axca tol ok in tz'ibejcan oc yin yanimail eb. Ayin ok in oc is Diosalok eb, axa eb ok oc in conobok.

English: No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest.
Kanjobal: C'amxa junok ok yal bay yet conob: Ojtaknej el Cham Jajawil, man ẍiok. Yujtol ayin wal caw Yajaw in chi wala' tol masanil eb ok in ojtaknen elok, caxc'al unin, caxc'al icham anima.

English: For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.”
