Kanjobal: Ok wak' tancan is mul eb. C'amxa bak'in ok in natek is yobtakil eb, ẍi Cham Jajawil, ẍi yul tx'an Un.

English: By calling this covenant “new,” he has made the first one obsolete; and what is obsolete and aging will soon disappear.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalontek Dios yuj jun is cab trato ti', lanan tx'oxk'abneni tol ichamxa jun is babel trato. K'inalok ay junok tzet chi ichambi tinani', chi lajwi yopiso. Ta chi lajwi yopiso, chi c'ay c'apax elok.

English: Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and also an earthly sanctuary.
Kanjobal: A jun babel trato, ay juntzan chekbanil chi yala' yuj tzet chi yun yoc eb anima yin ayilal bay is templo Dios bay sat tx'otx' ti'.

English: A tabernacle was set up. In its first room were the lampstand, the table and the consecrated bread; this was called the Holy Place.
Kanjobal: Tix max yun watx'ji jun cajlobal Dios ti'. A jun babel lugar bay chi babji yocapnok eb sacerdote chi yik yet Dios. Ay jun batxlub candil bay tu'. Ay jun meẍa, yetok juntzan ixim pan chi ak'lay bay Dios.

English: Behind the second curtain was a room called the Most Holy Place,
Kanjobal: Axa yintak oc jun an yet is cab makil nan, a tu' ay junxa lugar tol asan Dios ay yet.

English: which had the golden altar of incense and the gold-covered ark of the covenant. This ark contained the gold jar of manna, Aaron's staff that had budded, and the stone tablets of the covenant.
Kanjobal: Ay jun net bay tu', oroc'al elok. A tu' chi tz'a tzet suk'uk'i jab. A tu' ay c'apax octok caẍail is trato Dios, ayoc oro yinlak masanil. Yul caẍa tu' ayaytok jun xij oro bay ayaytok maná. Ayaytok te' is k'okoch cham Aarón max wolji. Ay c'apax aytok ch'en chemte' ch'en bay tz'ibbilcan oc is trato Dios.

English: Above the ark were the cherubim of the Glory, overshadowing the atonement cover. But we cannot discuss these things in detail now.
Kanjobal: Ayajtok juntzan yechel querubín yiban jun caẍa tu', yet watx' chi txecloj elok tol ayic' Dios bay tu'. Jenantok xic' juntzan tu' yiban bay chi ak'lay xajanbal yuj tancan yobtakil eb jet conob. K'okbil juntzan ti' chi waltok ayex, yuj tzetbil yili juntzan tu'.

English: When everything had been arranged like this, the priests entered regularly into the outer room to carry on their ministry.
Kanjobal: A yet chito oc yopiso juntzan tu', junjunc'al c'u chi octok eb sacerdote bay jun lugar bay chi babji yocapnok eb tu', cax chi bet yak'on serbil eb Dios bay tu'.

English: But only the high priest entered the inner room, and that only once a year, and never without blood, which he offered for himself and for the sins the people had committed in ignorance.
Kanjobal: Palta a bay junxa lugar yintak oc jun bay chi babji yocapnok eb tu xin, asan jun sat sacerdote chi octok. Asan junel chi octok yet junjun abil. A yet chi octok tu', yowalil ay chiq'uil no' ibil oc yuj, yuj yak'on yin xajanbalil yuj is yobtakil, c'al yuj yobtakil eb jet conob chi yun yin man naanok.

English: The Holy Spirit was showing by this that the way into the Most Holy Place had not yet been disclosed as long as the first tabernacle was still standing.
Kanjobal: Axca tu', chi yak' Cham Espíritu Santo nachaj el juj tol a yet chito oc yopiso jun lugar bay chi babji yocapnok eb tu', makanto jun lugar asan Dios ay yet tu'.

English: This is an illustration for the present time, indicating that the gifts and sacrifices being offered were not able to clear the conscience of the worshiper.
Kanjobal: A juntzan tu', tx'oxbanilejc'al yayji ayon yet jun tiempoal ti'. A juntzan ofrenda, c'al juntzan xajanbal chi ak'lay bay Dios, c'am chi je' yak'on xew yikbomal nabal eb chi ak'on tu'.

English: They are only a matter of food and drink and various ceremonial washings–external regulations applying until the time of the new order.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a juntzan chekbanil tu', asan yuj tzet chi loji, c'al yuj tzet chi uc'layi, chi yaltek. Chi yal c'apaxtek yuj tx'ajbanilal el tzetak yetal. A juntzan chekbanil tu', yetc'al mimanil eb yayji. Max oc yopiso juntzan chekbanil tu' yuj eb, masantac'al max yal q'uexlay yuj Dios.

English: When Christ came as high priest of the good things that are already here, he went through the greater and more perfect tabernacle that is not man-made, that is to say, not a part of this creation.
Kanjobal: Palta ulnakxa ec' Cristo tinani'. Yuj tu' xan, axa ayoc co sat sacerdoteok. Caw wal watx' juntzan tzet ak'bilcan yuj ayon, yujtol a is templo Dios bay chi ak'wi serbil tu', caw wal watx', c'am is tacnakil. A jun lugar tu', man animaok max watx'neni, yujtol manak sat tx'otx' ti' ay.

English: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but he entered the Most Holy Place once for all by his own blood, having obtained eternal redemption.
Kanjobal: Ocnakxatok Cristo bay jun lugar asan Dios ay yet tu'. Man chiq'uilok junok ach'ej chiwo, tamwal chiq'uil junok ach'ej wacax yak'nak yin xajanbalil, palta a wal caw is chiq'uil Cham yak'nak yin xajanbalil. Yuj tu', asan yin junel max occantok satak Dios, cax watx'nejnakcan co colbanil tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so that they are outwardly clean.
Kanjobal: A chiq'uil no toro c'al chiq'uil no chiwo, yetokc'al tanil no k'opoj wacax chi tz'a'i, chi txijlaytok yiban eb anima man watx'ok atac'ala' ley. Caytu' chi utlay eb, yet watx' watx' eb satak ley tu', palta asanc'al yin is mimanil eb.

English: How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself unblemished to God, cleanse our consciences from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God!
Kanjobal: Ta axca tu' yopiso chiq'uil no no' tu', akxam wal chiq'uil Cristo. Yuj Cham Espíritu tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, yak'nak ba Cristo yin xajanbalil bay Dios, axca junok xajanbal c'am jabok is tacnakil. Yuj tu', a is chiq'uil tu' chi ak'on xew yikbomal co nabal, yin tzet c'am watx'il chi iontek camich jiban. Yuj tu xin, a tinani', chi je' jak'on serbil Cham Dios iquis.

English: For this reason Christ is the mediator of a new covenant, that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance–now that he has died as a ransom to set them free from the sins committed under the first covenant.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a Jesucristo chi ak'on yi ba jun is cab trato tu'. A yet max cam Cham, max yak' lajwok Cham yobtakil eb ayic' yalan jun babel trato, yet watx' a ayon awtebil on yuj Dios, chi je' jion tzet max yak' ti' yak'on ayon, a ton co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: In the case of a will, it is necessary to prove the death of the one who made it,
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet ay junok yunal, yowalil chi txecloji ta camnakxa jun max watx'nencan tu', yet watx' chi je' yoc yopiso jun un tu'.

English: because a will is in force only when somebody has died; it never takes effect while the one who made it is living.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a junok yunal, c'am chi je' yoc yopiso ta iquisto ec' jun mac max watx'nencan tu'. Ato yet chi cami, catatu' chi oc yopiso.

English: This is why even the first covenant was not put into effect without blood.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', axca tu' yunnak jun babel trato tu'. A yet max oc yopiso, ay chic' max eli.

English: When Moses had proclaimed every commandment of the law to all the people, he took the blood of calves, together with water, scarlet wool and branches of hyssop, and sprinkled the scroll and all the people.
Kanjobal: Max yawtej aj Moisés masanil chekbanil ley yab eb jichmam. Lajwi tu', max yion aj janic' no cak lana, yetok jun liman k'ab te hisopo. Max laon aytok xol chiq'uil no ach'ej wacax, yetok xol chiq'uil no ach'ej chiwo calan yetok aej, max tzicontok yiban tx'an ley, c'al yiban anima.

English: He said, “This is the blood of the covenant, which God has commanded you to keep.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon nan xol eb axca ti': A jun chic' ti', a' chi ak'on yunel is trato Dios max yak' jetok, ẍi.

English: In the same way, he sprinkled with the blood both the tabernacle and everything used in its ceremonies.
Kanjobal: Max txij c'apax ay Moisés tu' chic' tu' yiban is cajlobal Dios, c'al yiban juntzan mitx'k'ab chi k'anabax yet chi oc ayilal.

English: In fact, the law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.
Kanjobal: Chi je' jaloni tol atac'ala' yalon ley tu', ijanxac'al chi sakbinelay masanil tzetak yetal yetok chic'. Yetok c'apaxok, c'am junok mac chi je' yelcan yobtakil, ta c'am chic' chi pul yuj is yobtakil tu'.

English: It was necessary, then, for the copies of the heavenly things to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
Kanjobal: Yowalil yak'nak eb juntzan xajanbal yuj sakbinelay juntzan tzetak yetal tu'. Palta a juntzan tu', yenelc'al tzet ay satcan. Axa tzet ay satcan tu', yowalil chi sakbinelay yuj jun xajanbal caw ec'ban yintak juntzan tu'.

English: For Christ did not enter a man-made sanctuary that was only a copy of the true one; he entered heaven itself, now to appear for us in God's presence.
Kanjobal: Yujtol manak yul jun templo watx'nebil yuj anima bay max octok Cristo, yujtol a jun tu', yenelc'al jun acaw templo Dios. A bay satcan, a tu' max octok. A tinani', ayic' satak Dios yuj tewi juj.

English: Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, the way the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood that is not his own.
Kanjobal: A cham sat sacerdote, junjunc'al abil cax chi octok cham bay jun lugar asan Dios ay yet, yuj yak'on chic' yin xajanbalil, palta manak is chiq'uil max yak' yin xajanbalil. Axa Cristo, man xiwilok el max cam yin xajanbalil.

English: Then Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. But now he has appeared once for all at the end of the ages to do away with sin by the sacrifice of himself.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta man asannej junelok max yak' ba Cristo yin xajanbalil, tx'ialxam el chi cam yecheltaxc'al max watx'ji yulyibank'inal ti'. Palta a yet lajub tiempoal ti', asanixto junel yulic'ok. A wal caw Cham yak'nak ba yin xajanbalil yuj yion el co yobtakil.

English: Just as man is destined to die once, and after that to face judgment,
Kanjobal: Masanil anima yowalil chi cam junel. Chi lajwi tu', chi beyc'ulnelay eb.

English: so Christ was sacrificed once to take away the sins of many people; and he will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are waiting for him.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax Cristo, junel ch'an ak'bil cam yin xajanbalil, yet watx' xiwil on chi ilay el co yobtakil yuj. A yet ok jay Cham yet is cayelal, manxa yujok ul yion el co yobtakil xan ok jayok, palta yuj on ul colon el ayon lanan jechbanen jay tu'.

English: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, To the twelve tribes scattered among the nations: Greetings.
Kanjobal: Ayin ton Santiago in, yak'omal serbil Dios wayji, yak'omal c'apax serbil Cham Jajawil Jesucristo wayji. Chi watok cawil e c'ul e lajcaweb makanil, ex wet israelal, ex tol sakleminak e yayji ec' bay junjun conob.

English: Consider it pure joy, my brothers, whenever you face trials of many kinds,
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, a yet chi jayoc tzanc'al tzet porobalil e yiban, ak'ek wal tzalojbok e c'ul sic'libil.

English: because you know that the testing of your faith develops perseverance.
Kanjobal: Ay wal bay chon ak'lay porobal, yet watx' chi txecloj elok tatol yel asannej wal yin Dios chi jaoc co c'ul. Jojtak wali, tol a ton yuj tu' chi ji' co tec'anil.

English: Perseverance must finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, caw wal tol che ya wal oc e c'ul yin Dios, yet watx' ok watx'jokc'al oc e nabal. Tatol caytu' che yut caktu', watx' ex ton wal satak Dios. C'am jabok palta ayex.

English: If any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to him.
Kanjobal: Tatol ayon manto tz'akanok co jelanil xin, co k'an bay Dios. Ok ak'lay ayon, yujtol ok yak' Cham ayon co masanil yin masanil is c'ul, tatol chi co k'an bay. Man ok on tzulay yuj.

English: But when he asks, he must believe and not doubt, because he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind.
Kanjobal: A yet chi co k'anon co jelanil, yowalil tol chi jaoc yin co c'ul tol ok co cha'. Manchak jak' cabc'ulal yet chi co k'anoni. A eb tol chi yak' cabc'ulal yin Dios, lajan eb axca wal a' mar tol chi aj pomnaj sat yuj cak'ek', cax tol chi meltzojtakbi sat.

English: That man should not think he will receive anything from the Lord;
Kanjobal: Tatol ay ex caytu' che yut e ba caktu', man e na' tol ay jabok tzet ok e cha' bay Cham.

English: he is a double-minded man, unstable in all he does.
Kanjobal: A mac chi yak' cabc'ulal, man tec'anok waay nabal yin tzanc'al tzet chi yunej.

English: The brother in humble circumstances ought to take pride in his high position.
Kanjobal: Mac ex tol meba' ex ch'an, tzalojanek, yujtol ay e yelapnok yul sat Dios.

English: But the one who is rich should take pride in his low position, because he will pass away like a wild flower.
Kanjobal: A pax ex tol beyom ex xin, tzalojanek yujtol a Dios chi ak'on nachaj el e yuj, tol yaynakil ex, yujtol lajan wal ok yuncan el eb beyom axca xumaquil an ac'un.

English: For the sun rises with scorching heat and withers the plant; its blossom falls and its beauty is destroyed. In the same way, the rich man will fade away even while he goes about his business.
Kanjobal: A yet chi aj can c'u, chi takay bulnaj yuj yowal k'ak', cax junnej bek chi pukil xumaquil, cax manxa watx'ok yili. Axca wal chi yun takil xumaquil an ac'un tu', cay wal tu' ok yun lajwok ay eb beyom tu', yet lanan wajban eb is tumin.

English: Blessed is the man who perseveres under trial, because when he has stood the test, he will receive the crown of life that God has promised to those who love him.
Kanjobal: Tatol chi techaj juj yet chon ak'lay porobal, caw wal watx' jet. A yet chi xew jak'lay porobal tu', ok co cha' is pak, a ton k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A ton jun tu' altebilcan yuj Dios bay eb chi camc'ulneni.

English: When tempted, no one should say, “God is tempting me.” For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone;
Kanjobal: A yet chon ikbelay junen junok yobtakil, manchak co na' tol a Dios chon ikbani, yujtol c'am chi je' yikbelay Dios yin yunen yobtakil. C'am c'apax junok mactxel chi yikbaj Cham yin yunen yobtakil.

English: but each one is tempted when, by his own evil desire, he is dragged away and enticed.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a tzet chi jiloc co c'ulok yin chon ikbani. A ton juntzan tu' chon montencantok yin yobtakil.

English: Then, after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is full-grown, gives birth to death.
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi junen juntzan tzet yetal chi jiloc co c'ulok yin tu', chi occan co yobtakil. A ton yet tu' chi etaxcan el co nabal yuj co yobtakil tu'. Yujc'al wal tu' bian, chon tojcan bay camich.

English: Don't be deceived, my dear brothers.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, c'al ex wanab camc'ulnebil wuj, manchak e yak' c'aytok e ba.

English: Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.
Kanjobal: A bay Dios chi tit masanil tzet yetal watx', tol toc'al chi sa' ayon. A ton Cham max watx'nen juntzan satcanil tzektebal. Caxc'al mi tol chi q'uexlabi yili eb, cax chi oc ewan yin, palta man cayok tu' Dios. C'am bay chi q'uexlabi nabal Cham.

English: He chose to give us birth through the word of truth, that we might be a kind of firstfruits of all he created.
Kanjobal: Chon yi aj wan Cham yuninalok, yin yak'balnen is k'anej tol caw wal yel, yujtol axca tu' max el yin c'ul max on yutej, yet watx' aj babel on satak masanil tzet yetal max yesnej ajok.

English: My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, c'al ex wanab camc'ulnebil wuj, naektek juntzan chi wal ti'. Acbajek e txiquin e yabeni. Man comonok che yal junok tzet yetal yin aymanil. Manokab c'apax comonok chi tit e yowal.

English: for man's anger does not bring about the righteous life that God desires.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet chi tit jowal, man yochwanok Dios chi junej.

English: Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, bekekcan masanil yobtakil, c'al beybalej man watx'ok yet yalantok. Chaek wal yin mansoc'ulalil is k'anej Dios, jun tol abilxa oc jin, yujtol chi je' co colchajcan el yuj.

English: Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.
Kanjobal: Jikejek tzet chi yal k'anej Dios tu xin. Manokab toc'alok chi jabic'ok. Tatol toc'al chi jabic'ok, ayonc'al oc chi jetnej co ba.

English: Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like a man who looks at his face in a mirror
Kanjobal: Ay mac chi aben k'anej Dios, palta c'am chi yikej pax eb, lajan wal eb axca junok mactxel chi yil sat yul junok espejo.

English: and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like.
Kanjobal: Chic'al lajwi yilon sat tu', cax chi toji; yin aymanil chi toj c'ayc'ulal yuj, tzetbil yili sat.

English: But the man who looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, and continues to do this, not forgetting what he has heard, but doing it–he will be blessed in what he does.
Kanjobal: Ay jun ley tol caw tz'akaki. A ton chi ak'on co bekbanilal. Tatol chi cam co cuyoni, cax c'am chi toj c'ayc'ulal juj tzet chi yala', cax chi co beybalneni, tatol caytu' chi junej, ok jak' tzalojbok co c'ul yin masanil tzet chi junej.

English: If anyone considers himself religious and yet does not keep a tight rein on his tongue, he deceives himself and his religion is worthless.
Kanjobal: Tatol chi co na' tol ayon oc yin jun acaw ak'oj serbil Dios, palta c'am chi co mitx' pax tzakay co ti' yin tzet chi jala', ayonc'al oc chi jetnej co ba cax nabac'al ton wal chi jala' tol ayon oc yin jun acaw ak'oj serbil Dios.

English: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.
Kanjobal: Tatol ay eb unin tol c'amxa is mam c'al is txutx, c'al eb ix tol camnakxa yichamil, cax ayoc eb yin yailal, yowalil chi toj jil eb, cax chon colwaj bay eb. Yetok c'apaxok, chi co pojil co ba xol masanil yobtakil bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Tatol chi jun juntzan ti', tita' wal tol yel chi jak' serbil co Mam Dios chi yal tu'.

English: My brothers, as believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ, don't show favoritism.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, tatol wal yel chi ja wal oc Cham Jajawil Jesucristo yin co c'ul, Cham tol miman yelapnok, yowalil lajanokabc'al chi jut co c'ul yin anima masanil.

English: Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in shabby clothes also comes in.
Kanjobal: K'inalok tinani', ay junok beyom chi ocapnok bay chi co wajbaj co ba, ayoc oro col k'abej yuj, c'al pichilej ayxa may tojol ayoc yuj, cax chi oc pax apnok junok meba', tol yaynakil pichilejch'an ayoc yuj.

English: If you show special attention to the man wearing fine clothes and say, “Here's a good seat for you,” but say to the poor man, “You stand there” or “Sit on the floor by my feet,”
Kanjobal: K'inalok tol asannej yetok jun ayoc pichilej ayxa may tojol yuj tu' chon tzaloj yetok, cax chi jalon bay: Ayan chotan bay puch watx' ti', con chi bay, cax chi jalon bay jun meba' tu' axca ti': Watx' oc lecan bay tu'; ta c'amak xin, ayan chotan bay wakantak ti', ta con chi bay.

English: have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?
Kanjobal: Tatol caytu' chi jut axca tu', chi yal elapnok tol ay mactxel ay yelapnok yul co sat, cax ay mactxel tol c'am yelapnok yul co sat. Lanan co beyc'ulnewi yin man watx'ok chi yal tu'.

English: Listen, my dear brothers: Has not God chosen those who are poor in the eyes of the world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised those who love him?
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab camc'ulnebil wuj, abek. A eb meba' yul sat eb ay bay yulyibank'inal ti', a ton eb chi sic'laycan el yuj Dios, yet watx' chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Cham. Axca ton tu' max yun beyomnelaycan eb yuj Dios, yujtol ok yican eb satak xol eb ayoc yul k'ab Cham, jun satakej max yalcantek, tol ok yak' bay eb tol chi camc'ulneni.

English: But you have insulted the poor. Is it not the rich who are exploiting you? Are they not the ones who are dragging you into court?
Kanjobal: Axa pax ex tol c'am yelapnok eb meba' yul e sat, naek. ¿Mactxel eb chon etneni, cax chon iontok satak yajaw? A ton eb beyom.

English: Are they not the ones who are slandering the noble name of him to whom you belong?
Kanjobal: A ton eb tu' chi buchon is bi Cristo Cham bay ayonxa oc ti', ti pax tol caw miman yelapnok jun biej tu'.

English: If you really keep the royal law found in Scripture, “Love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing right.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun is ley Cham co Reyal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok tol chi yal axca ti': Che ya'ilnej eb e yet animail, axca che yut e ya'ilnen e ba junjun ex, ẍi. Tatol chi jikej bay chi yal jun ley tu', watx' chi jut co ba chi yal tu'.

English: But if you show favoritism, you sin and are convicted by the law as lawbreakers.
Kanjobal: Palta tatol man lajanok chi jut co camc'ulnen anima masanil, yob chi jut co ba. Ac'al oc jun ley tu' chi aloni, tol yob chi jut co ba.

English: For whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok tzet yetal chi cheklay jun yuj jun ley tu', cax c'am chi jun paxok, yujc'al ch'an jun tu' xan chi titcan bulnaj masanil ley tu' jiban.

English: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not murder.” If you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a lawbreaker.
Kanjobal: Max yalcan Dios axca ti': Manchak e yaoc e mul yul k'ab e yetbi junjun ex. Manchak e mak' cam e yet animail, ẍi. A ton Dios max aloncan cabil. Yuj tu xin, caxc'al tol c'am chon mulji, palta tatol chi jak' cam junok jet animail, chi yal elapnok xin, tol mayal co ten tzet chi yal jun ley tu'.

English: Speak and act as those who are going to be judged by the law that gives freedom,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan watx'okabc'al chi jut k'anjab co ba, watx'okab chi jut co beybal. Yujtol ok on beyc'ulnelay yuj jun ley chi ak'on co bekbanilal.

English: because judgment without mercy will be shown to anyone who has not been merciful. Mercy triumphs over judgment!
Kanjobal: Tatol c'am chi ok' co c'ul yin eb jet animail, man ok ok' c'apax c'ul Dios jin, yet ok on beyc'ulnenok, palta tatol chi ok' co c'ul yin eb jet animail xin, ok ok' c'apax c'ul Cham jin yet c'ual beyc'ulal tu'.

English: What good is it, my brothers, if a man claims to have faith but has no deeds? Can such faith save him?
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, tatol chi jala' tol chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, cax c'am pax chi jun tzet yetal watx', toc'al chi jal chi yal tu'. Ta cac'al tu' chi jut jaon oc co c'ul yin Dios, tok mi wal chon colchaj yuj che na'.

English: Suppose a brother or sister is without clothes and daily food.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok juẍtak, ma junok janab tol meba'ch'an, c'am is pichil, cax c'am c'apax lobej,

English: If one of you says to him, “Go, I wish you well; keep warm and well fed,” but does nothing about his physical needs, what good is it?
Kanjobal: cax chi jalon bay axca ti': Xel a ba xin, manchak ach oc il, k'aẍnan, lowan, ta con chi bay, palta c'am pax jabok tzet chi jak' bay yuj is cawxinakil tu', ¿xin ta watx' axca tu'?

English: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan ta chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, cax c'am pax tzet yetal watx' chi junej, nabac'al ton wal chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios chi yal tu'.

English: But someone will say, “You have faith; I have deeds.” Show me your faith without deeds, and I will show you my faith by what I do.
Kanjobal: Tekan ay mactxel ok alon axca ti': Ach ti', asannej wal chaoc a c'ul yin Dios. Axa pax ayin ti' xin, a watx' unbenal chi el wuneni, ẍi. Palta chi wal ayin ti', tol c'am mactxel chi je' tx'oxk'abnen elok, ta yel wali, ayoc Dios yin c'ul, tatol c'am tzet yetal watx' chi yunej. Ay mactxel xin, tol a yin is watx' unbenal chi txecloj elok, tol yel wali, ayoc Dios yin c'ul.

English: You believe that there is one God. Good! Even the demons believe that–and shudder.
Kanjobal: Ay mactxel chi yaoc yin c'ul, tol junnej Dios; watx' ton tzet chi na' tu'. Ac'ala' eb espíritu yob chi ya c'apax oc eb jun tu' yin c'ul, cax chi bilaj eb yuj xiwilal yuj.

English: You foolish man, do you want evidence that faith without deeds is useless ?
Kanjobal: Ay jaywan ex, axca wal tol c'am e nabal, nachajokab el juntzan ti' e yuj xin. Tatol chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios jaloni, cax c'am tzet yetal watx' chi junej, c'am jabok yelapnok chi yal tu'.

English: Was not our ancestor Abraham considered righteous for what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?
Kanjobal: A cham jichmam Abraham yet payxa, max yitok is c'ajol Isaac, yuj yak'on tz'a yin xajanbalil naoni, yujtol caytu' max yun yalon Dios bay. Yuj wal tzet max yun Abraham tu xin, xan watx' ton cham satak Dios.

English: You see that his faith and his actions were working together, and his faith was made complete by what he did.
Kanjobal: Co naek xin, tol max yaoc Abraham is c'ul yin Dios, yuj tu' xan max je' yiken tzet max ak'lay yunej. Ato wal yet max yun cham jun tu', max txeclojcan el sic'libil tol ay ton wal oc Dios yin c'ul.

English: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,” and he was called God's friend.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun yunencan el tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, bay chi yal axca ti': Axa yaon oc Abraham yin c'ul, tzet max yal Dios bay, xan watx' max cancan yul sat Cham, ẍi. Ac'ala', yalon c'apax canok, tol a Abraham, yamigo ba yetok Dios.

English: You see that a person is justified by what he does and not by faith alone.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, nachajokab el jun ti' e yuj, tol watx' on satak Dios yuj tzet watx' chi junej, mannejc'alnak yuj chi jaoc co c'ul yin.

English: In the same way, was not even Rahab the prostitute considered righteous for what she did when she gave lodging to the spies and sent them off in a different direction?
Kanjobal: Cay c'apax tu' max yun jun ix ix chi yik Rahab yet payxa, ajmul ix ton ix, palta ak'bil posada eb chekbej eb israel yuj ix. Ac'al oc ix max chekon meltzoj eb bay junxa be, yet watx' c'am chi michchaj eb. Yuj jun is watx'c'ulal ix tu' bay eb, xan max al-lay ix watx'il yuj Dios.

English: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead.
Kanjobal: Axca wal junok mimanilej camnakxa, yuj c'amxa yanimail, cayton tu' jayji ocok, tatol toc'al chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, cax c'am pax tzet yetal watx' chi junej.

English: Not many of you should presume to be teachers, my brothers, because you know that we who teach will be judged more strictly.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, manokab xiwilok ex che yaoc e ba meẍtolal, yujtol e yojtak, tol ayon meẍtol on ti', ok cam co beyc'ulnelay yuj Dios.

English: We all stumble in many ways. If anyone is never at fault in what he says, he is a perfect man, able to keep his whole body in check.
Kanjobal: Yujtol co masanil, caw coc'takc'al chi oc co yobtakil. Tatol c'am bay chon ayc'ay yin tzet chi jala', watx' on ton wal satak Dios chi yal tu', cax chi je' co mitx'on oc wanaj co mimanil masanil.

English: When we put bits into the mouths of horses to make them obey us, we can turn the whole animal.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jaon oc freno junok no chej, yujc'al ton ch'en freno tu', xan yikemc'al no' bay chi ji' beyok.

English: Or take ships as an example. Although they are so large and are driven by strong winds, they are steered by a very small rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok te barco, caxc'al caw miman te', cax chi low tinnaj cak'ek' yin te', palta asannej wal yuj is yaliẍ tx'umbanil, xan yalc'al bay chi je' yilay bey yuj nak chi tx'umon tu'.

English: Likewise the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes great boasts. Consider what a great forest is set on fire by a small spark.
Kanjobal: Axca ton tu' yayji co ti'. Yaliẍ wal ch'an, palta a caw wal tol chi maynej ba yin tzet mimek chi je' yuneni. K'inalok ay junok tz'it k'ak' chi ayc'ay bay junok k'aktelak, manxa jantakok te' chi tz'atok yuj.

English: The tongue also is a fire, a world of evil among the parts of the body. It corrupts the whole person, sets the whole course of his life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell.
Kanjobal: Caytu' yayji co k'anej, lajan wal yetok k'ak'ej. Masanil yobtakil bay yulyibank'inal ti' chi je' yuj. Yetbeyom co mimanil yayji co ti' ti'. Ac'al oc chi iontok co mimanil yin yobtakil yin masanil co k'inal. Axca tol a bay k'ak'al infierno chi tit k'anej axca k'ak'ej chi jala'.

English: All kinds of animals, birds, reptiles and creatures of the sea are being tamed and have been tamed by man,
Kanjobal: A junjun makan no no', no tz'iquin, no labaj, c'al no noal a' mar, chic'al ton wal je' mansonelay no', max tzakay wal eb anima mansoneni.

English: but no man can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.
Kanjobal: Axa pax on ayon anima on ti', c'am wal junok on chi je' co mansonen co ti'. Caw yob, c'am mactxel chi tzakay mitx'on waayok. Lajan axca labaj ay venenoal, tol chi cam eb anima yuj.

English: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse men, who have been made in God's likeness.
Kanjobal: A yetok co ti' chi jal watx' k'anej bay Cham Jajawil, a ton co Mam Dios, ac'al pax oc yetok, chi co k'antek yowal c'ul Dios yiban eb jet animail, tol watx'nebil yuj Cham axca yayji oc Cham tu'.

English: Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers, this should not be.
Kanjobal: Ac'al oc co ti' chi jak'balnej yin jalon watx' k'anej bay Dios, ac'al oc chi jak'balnej pax yin bajwal. Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, man mojok tol chi co beybalnej axca tu'.

English: Can both fresh water and salt water flow from the same spring?
Kanjobal: Tok chi ajol a' aej watx', c'al a' aej c'achi' bay junnej nuk' aej.

English: My brothers, can a fig tree bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? Neither can a salt spring produce fresh water.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, k'inalok ta ay junok moc'an te higo, tokwal ok je' tol sat olivoxa ok yak' te'. Ma junok moc'an uva xin, tokwal ok je' tol higoxa sat an ok yak'a'. C'am junok nuk'a' chi ajol aej c'achi' c'al watx' aej bay.

English: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show it by his good life, by deeds done in the humility that comes from wisdom.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok ex jelan ex, chi nachaj el junok tzet yetal e yuj, yowalil tol watx' che yut e beybal xin. Che tx'oxk'abnej el e jelanil tu' yin e yunen masanil tzet yetal yin man maynejbailok.

English: But if you harbor bitter envy and selfish ambition in your hearts, do not boast about it or deny the truth.
Kanjobal: Palta tatol toc'al chi tit e yowal, cax asannejc'al e yet che yochej, che yochej tol asan ex che yala', ta axca tu', man e yaloc e ba jelanilal. Ta caytu' che yut e ba, miman txequel tol lanan e yak'on lek'tial yin e yalon oc e ba jelanilal tu'.

English: Such “wisdom” does not come down from heaven but is earthly, unspiritual, of the devil.
Kanjobal: Tatol caytu' che yut e ba, manak bay Dios chi tit jun e jelanilal tu xin, titol yet sat tx'otx' ti', yet eb comon anima. A jun e jelanilal tu', yet nak diablo chi yal tu'.

English: For where you have envy and selfish ambition, there you find disorder and every evil practice.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb tol axac'al yet chi yochej, cax chi yochen axac'al chi aloni, a ton bay tu' chi jay somc'ulal yuj eb xin, cax xiwil juntzanxa yobtakil chi oqui.

English: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.
Kanjobal: A pax jun jelanil chi tit bay Dios xin, man cayok tu' yoqui. Tatol ayoc jun jelanil tu' jin, watx' onc'al yul sat Dios, junc'ulalxac'al ayon yetok jet animail. Manso on, pakaki on yin tzanc'al tzet chi junej. Chi ok' co c'ul yin eb jet animail. Watx'c'al chi jut co c'ul bay eb. C'am chi jut co ba yin cabc'ulaltak bay eb, man cabsatok chi jut c'apax co ba.

English: Peacemakers who sow in peace raise a harvest of righteousness.
Kanjobal: Ta asan junc'ulal chi ji' can, ok co cha' paktzil co watx' beybal tu', yuj chi ji' can junc'ulal tu'.

English: What causes fights and quarrels among you? Don't they come from your desires that battle within you?
Kanjobal: ¿E yojtak mi wali, bay chi ca titoc juntzan owal, c'al caklejbail ay e xol? Tokwal manak bay juntzan yob ochwanilej chi yak' owal e yin, chi tita'.

English: You want something but don't get it. You kill and covet, but you cannot have what you want. You quarrel and fight. You do not have, because you do not ask God.
Kanjobal: Che yochej wal oc junok tzet yetal, palta c'am chi ak'lay pax ayex. Yujc'al tu', xan ayex ok ex mak'wok cam anima. Caw ayoc yin e c'ul e yochen oc tzetak yetal, palta majc'al ak'lay ayex, yujc'al wal tu' xan che lajoc e yak'lenc'al owal. C'am chi ak'lay ayex, yujtol c'am che k'an bay Dios.

English: When you ask, you do not receive, because you ask with wrong motives, that you may spend what you get on your pleasures.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al mi tol che k'ana', palta majc'alta' ak'lay ayex, yujtol tx'ok yoc e nabal, xan che k'ana'. A e naoni, tol ok ak'lay ayex, cax ok e yak'on e nabal yin juntzan tzet che k'an tu'.

English: You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world is hatred toward God? Anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.
Kanjobal: Ayex lajan ex wal axca junok ix ajmul ix, caywal tu' e yili yul sat Dios. ¿Tom man e yojtakok xin, tol a yet chi co camc'ulnen yulyibank'inal ti', chon occan ajc'ulal yin Dios? Yuj tu', tzanc'al mactxel chi yochej watx' yak'on yetok yulyibank'inal ti', chi occan ajc'ulal yin Dios.

English: Or do you think Scripture says without reason that the spirit he caused to live in us envies intensely?
Kanjobal: ¿Tom che na' xin, tol c'amc'al jabok tzet chi yal elapnok is k'anej Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok tol chi yal axca ti': A ton Dios max cajban can oc Cham Espíritu Santo jin, cax chi yochen Yespíritu tu' tol yet on yin junelnej, ẍi?

English: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan caw miman is watx'c'ulalil Dios chi yak' ayon, yujtol chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu' axca ti': A Dios chi tenic' is nabal eb mimek winak chi yut ba, axa bay eb yaynakil chi yut ba xin, a is watx'c'ulal Cham chi yak' bay eb, ẍi.

English: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', yikemokab chi jut co ba bay Dios, cax tec'anc'alokab chi jut co ba bay nak diablo, cax ok el ayon.

English: Come near to God and he will come near to you. Wash your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
Kanjobal: Co jitzek oc co ba c'atan Dios, cax ok jitzontek ba Cham co c'atan. Watx'nejek oc e beybal, ex tol yob e beybal. Watx'nejek oc e nabal mac ex tol chi cabax aj e c'ul.

English: Grieve, mourn and wail. Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom.
Kanjobal: Ocanek yin cusc'ulal, jichchajokab e c'ul e yok' sic'libil. Meltzojokab oc e tze' yin ok'il. Meltzojokabcan oc e tzalojc'ulal yin cusc'ulalil.

English: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.
Kanjobal: Iek ay e ba satak Cham Jajawil, catatu bian, ok ex ilay aj can yuj Cham.

English: Brothers, do not slander one another. Anyone who speaks against his brother or judges him speaks against the law and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, but sitting in judgment on it.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, manchak e yal-lej e k'umal. A mactxel chi yal k'umal junok yet creyenteal, ma chi beyc'ulnej, chi yal elapnok, tol a ley Dios lanan yalon k'umal, c'al beyc'ulneni. Tatol chi co beyc'ulnej ley Dios xin, man ipanok co beybalnen tzet chi yala', palta lanan wal jaon oc co ba yin juezalil chi yal tu'.

English: There is only one Lawgiver and Judge, the one who is able to save and destroy. But you–who are you to judge your neighbor?
Kanjobal: Palta junnej mactxel max watx'nen ley, cax junnej juez, a ton Cham chi je' con coloni, cax chi je' c'apax c'ayil masanil anima yuj. Yuj tu xin, xan ¿tom ay e yalon e yet e beyc'ulnen e yet animail?

English: Now listen, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money.”
Kanjobal: Abek xin, ex tol lanan e yalon cakti': A tinani', ma yecal, ok on tok bay junok conob, jun abil ok on ayjok bay tu'. Ok jaon oc co txon, cax ok jion co tumin, quex chi.

English: Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes.
Kanjobal: Palta man pax jojtakok tzet ayon yet yecal tu', yujtol a co k'inal, junnejch'an bek chi c'ay aj bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Lajan wal axca xob tx'otx', junch'an bek txequel yaj wacacok, cax chi c'ay pax ajok.

English: Instead, you ought to say, “If it is the Lord's will, we will live and do this or that.”
Kanjobal: Yelxac'al watx' ta caytu' chi jut k'anjab co ba axca ti': Ta chi el yin c'ul Cham Jajawil, cax tatol iquis onto ec'ok, ok jun jun ti', c'al jun tu', quex chiokabi.

English: As it is, you boast and brag. All such boasting is evil.
Kanjobal: Akxa tinani', ay ex maynejbail che yunej yet caytu' che yut k'anjab e ba axca tu'. Masanilc'al mactxel chi k'anjab yin maynejbail axca tu xin, man watx'ok chi yut ba eb satak Dios.

English: Anyone, then, who knows the good he ought to do and doesn't do it, sins.
Kanjobal: Tatol jojtak wal tzet chi yochej c'ul Dios chi junej, palta c'am chi jun paxok, ipan wal yoc co yobtakil bay.

English: Now listen, you rich people, weep and wail because of the misery that is coming upon you.
Kanjobal: Abek ex beyom. Elokab wek'ek'ok e yaw e yok' tinani', yujtol ay mimek yailal chi bey jay e satak.

English: Your wealth has rotted, and moths have eaten your clothes.
Kanjobal: Lananxa k'atok e beyomal. A e pichil bulan ec'ok, olquiẍtakxac'al yuj no no'.

English: Your gold and silver are corroded. Their corrosion will testify against you and eat your flesh like fire. You have hoarded wealth in the last days.
Kanjobal: Cay c'apax tu' e tumin, caxc'al mi oro ch'en, ma plata ch'en, k'uxtakxa. A k'uxtakil ch'en tu' chi tx'oxon el e yobtakil. Axca wal chi yun tz'a junok tzet yetal yuj k'ak'ej, cay wal tu' ok yuncan el e mimanil yuj ch'en. Toxa chi jay lajub tiempo; axa pax ayex ti', asan e wajban e beyomal che yunej.

English: Look! The wages you failed to pay the workmen who mowed your fields are crying out against you. The cries of the harvesters have reached the ears of the Lord Almighty.
Kanjobal: Toc'al chi ul sa' eb e majan c'u ayex, tokwal che tojlanej c'u eb, toc'al che yetnej eb. Chi aj yaw eb bay Dios tinani', cax chi yalon aj eb e mul. Max ablay tzet max yal eb yuj Cham Yajaw yin Masanil.

English: You have lived on earth in luxury and self-indulgence. You have fattened yourselves in the day of slaughter.
Kanjobal: Watx' max ec' yulyibank'inal ti' e yuj ayex ti', nojnak wal el yul e yatut yuj masanil tzet yetal ay ayex. Toc'al chi etax el e yuj. Lajan ex axca junok wacax chi ak'lay serbil sic'libil, chi xew bak'echbi xin, cax chi ak'lay camok. Janic'xanej tiempoal che yak' e nabal.

English: You have condemned and murdered innocent men, who were not opposing you.
Kanjobal: Ayex wal max e yacantok yiban eb tol watx' is nabal, ay eb max e yak' camok, palta majc'al wal col ba eb ayex.

English: Be patient, then, brothers, until the Lord's coming. See how the farmer waits for the land to yield its valuable crop and how patient he is for the autumn and spring rains.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, miman che yut e c'ul; echbanejek masantac'al ok jay Cham Jajawil. Ilab eb mulnajwom tinani', chi yechbanej eb jay babel nab, c'al lajub nab. Mimanc'al chi yut eb c'ul yin yechbanen yelol yawoj.

English: You too, be patient and stand firm, because the Lord's coming is near.
Kanjobal: Axcaokab chi yut ba eb mulnajwom tu', cayokab tu' che yut e yechbanen jay Cham Jajawil. Tec'an che yut e ba, yujtol toxa wal chi jayi.

English: Don't grumble against each other, brothers, or you will be judged. The Judge is standing at the door!
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, manchak ex alxi e yin junjun ex, yet watx' man ok ex beyc'ulnelayok, yujtol toxa wal ok jay Cham ok on beyc'ulnenok.

English: Brothers, as an example of patience in the face of suffering, take the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, a eb max alon el k'anej Dios yet payxa, max techaj wal yuj eb yiklen oc yatakilal, cax max yak'on eb mimanc'ulal. Yuj tu xin, techajokab e yuj axca eb tu'.

English: As you know, we consider blessed those who have persevered. You have heard of Job's perseverance and have seen what the Lord finally brought about. The Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
Kanjobal: Jojtak wali, tol a eb max techaj yuj tu', tzalojc'ulal ay eb tinani'. Ay bay max e yab yabixal cham Job, tol tec'an max yut ba cham yet max yaben cham yail. E yojtak c'apaxok, tzetbil max yun yeloc cham yinxa lajubal yuj Cham Jajawil. Max ok' c'ul Cham Jajawil tu' yin, cax max cusoc c'ul Cham yin.

English: Above all, my brothers, do not swear–not by heaven or by earth or by anything else. Let your “Yes” be yes, and your “No,” no, or you will be condemned.
Kanjobal: Palta ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, ay wal junxa tzet caw yowalil ok wal ayex. Man comonokc'al che loctek bi Dios Cham aj satcan, ma bi junokxa mactxel, ma junokxa tzet yetal bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Cayokab tu' chi yun e k'anjab axca ti xin: Tatol yel, Ja' quex chi. Tatol man yelok xin, C'amak quex chi. Cayokabc'al tu' che yut k'anjab e ba, yet watx' c'am tzet chi jayoc e yiban.

English: Is any one of you in trouble? He should pray. Is anyone happy? Let him sing songs of praise.
Kanjobal: Ta ayex lanan e yaben yail tinani', txajlanek. Ta ay ex pax ayex oc yin tzalojc'ulal xin, bitnejek junok e watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: Is any one of you sick? He should call the elders of the church to pray over him and anoint him with oil in the name of the Lord.
Kanjobal: Ta ay ex ya' ex ay, awtejek eb yancianoal iglesia. Axa ex anciano ex ti', txajlanek yuj eb. Che yaoncan oc aceite yin eb, yin bi Cham Jajawil.

English: And the prayer offered in faith will make the sick person well; the Lord will raise him up. If he has sinned, he will be forgiven.
Kanjobal: Tatol che yaoc yin e c'ul yet lanan e txajli yuj eb tu', ok ton colchajcan el eb xol is yailal. Axa Cham Jajawil ok ak'oncan jay c'ul eb. Ta ay junok yobtakil max el yunen eb, ok jolayc'ay yiban eb yuj Dios.

English: Therefore confess your sins to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. The prayer of a righteous man is powerful and effective.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, alek ajtek e yobtakil ayex junjun ex. Cax txajlanek e yuj junjun ex, yet watx' ok jay e c'ul. A eb watx' beybal, tol chi k'an juntzanok tzet yetal bay Dios yin masanil is c'ul, xiwilxa tzet yetal chi watx'jican el yuj is txaj eb tu'.

English: Elijah was a man just like us. He prayed earnestly that it would not rain, and it did not rain on the land for three and a half years.
Kanjobal: A yet max ec' cham Elías yet payxa, naba anima cham axca onc'al ti'. Yin masanil is c'ul max txajli, yet watx' c'amxa chi yak' nab. Nan is can abil wal majxa yak' nab bay jun lugar tu'.

English: Again he prayed, and the heavens gave rain, and the earth produced its crops.
Kanjobal: Atoc'al yet max k'anon nab yin txajil junelxa, catatu bian, max jay pax nab. Atowal yet tu' max yaxbi pax aj jun lugar tu' junelxa.

English: My brothers, if one of you should wander from the truth and someone should bring him back,
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, ta ay junok mactxel e nan e xol chi yican el ba yin is k'anej Dios, matawal ay junok ex che yaoc nabal eb, yet chi oc pax eb junelxa.

English: remember this: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of his way will save him from death and cover over a multitude of sins.
Kanjobal: Ojtaknejek el jun ti', ta ay eb chi yetnejtok beybal, cax che yaon oc nabal eb yuj watx'ji oc beybal eb tu', lanan wal e colon el yanimail eb yul k'ab camich. Yuj wal tu' xan ok ak'lay c'ay jantak yobtakil eb.

English: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto yulyibank'inal ti', ayxac'alta' ec' Cham chi yik K'anej Dios. A Cham tu', ayxa ec' yetok Dios, cax Dios toni.

English: He was with God in the beginning.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi chail Dios yich yesnen aj yulyibank'inal ti', ayxac'altac'a ec' Cham yetok.

English: Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.
Kanjobal: A Cham max yak'balnej Dios yesnen aj masanil tzet yetal; xan ta manak yuj Cham, c'am mi tzet max esnelay ajok.

English: In him was life, and that life was the light of men.
Kanjobal: A yuj Cham chi ji k'inalej co masanil. A Cham chi ak'on co k'inal tu', chi yak' c'apax sakk'inal bay janimail.

English: The light shines in the darkness, but the darkness has not understood it.
Kanjobal: A jun sakk'inal tu', sakk'inalc'al yayji nan xol k'ekk'inal. Palta c'am chi tan yuj k'ekk'inal tu'.

English: There came a man who was sent from God; his name was John.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak chekbiltek yuj Dios chi yik Juan.

English: He came as a witness to testify concerning that light, so that through him all men might believe.
Kanjobal: A ul yak'nak ba testigoal yin jun sakk'inal tu', yet watx' tzanc'al mactxel chi yaoc c'ul yin.

English: He himself was not the light; he came only as a witness to the light.
Kanjobal: Manak Juan tu' jun sakk'inal tu'. Toc'al ul yak'nak ba testigoal yin.

English: The true light that gives light to every man was coming into the world.
Kanjobal: A jun acaw yel sakk'inal yet Dios max jayoc bay yulyibank'inal ti', a' chi yak' sakk'inal yin janimail co masanil.

English: He was in the world, and though the world was made through him, the world did not recognize him.
Kanjobal: A Cham chi yik K'anej Dios tu', a ton ulnak ec' yulyibank'inal ti'. Watx'nebil c'apax yulyibank'inal ti' yuj, palta a yet ulnak aytek tu', maj nachaj el yuj eb anima tatol a'.

English: He came to that which was his own, but his own did not receive him.
Kanjobal: Ulnak ec' xol masanil tzet watx'nebil yuj, palta maj chalay Cham yuj eb yet conob.

English: Yet to all who received him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God–
Kanjobal: Palta tzanc'al mac max chaoni, a ton eb max yaoc c'ul yin, a' chi aloni tol ay yalon yet eb yoc yuninalok Dios.

English: children born not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband's will, but born of God.
Kanjobal: A yet chi oc eb yuninalok Dios, axca tol chi alji eb junelxa. Palta man axcaok chi yun yalji junok anima, man winakok chi cha c'ul xan chi alji eb, palta a Dios chi ion oc eb yuninalok.

English: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the One and Only, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.
Kanjobal: A Cham chi yik K'anej Dios tu', max oc yin animail. Ulnak ec' co xol ti' jun tiempoal. A Cham caw wal yel, miman watx'c'ulal Dios max ul tx'ox ayon. Max jil yin, caw wal miman yelapnok, yujtol asan ch'an jun c'otan C'ajol Dios tu', chekbiltek yuj is Mam.

English: John testifies concerning him. He cries out, saying, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.’ ”
Kanjobal: A Juan max alontek yabixal Cham, max yalon axca ti': A Cham tzunan wintak, axcata' walon ayex, tol ec'ban yopiso wintak, yujtol a yet c'amto chin alji, ayxac'alta' ec'ok, ẍi Juan.

English: From the fullness of his grace we have all received one blessing after another.
Kanjobal: A Cham tu', caw wal watx' is c'ul, yuj tu', tz'akakic'al chi tx'ox is watx'c'ulal ti' ayon.

English: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: A Moisés ak'nejcan ley Dios ayon; axa pax Jesucristo xin, a is watx'c'ulal Dios max tx'ox ayon, max yak'on c'apax jun cuybanilej caw wal yel.

English: No one has ever seen God, but God the One and Only,, who is at the Father's side, has made him known.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mactxel max ilon yin Dios junelok, palta a jun c'otan is C'ajol tu', tol Dios toni, a' max ul tx'oxon elok. A jun is C'ajol tu', junnejc'alta' ayic' yetok is Mam.

English: Now this was John's testimony when the Jews of Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him who he was.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ay juntzan eb israel aj conob Jerusalén, max chektok eb jaywan eb sacerdote yetok jaywanxa eb yinatil Leví bay Juan. Max bet k'anlen eb chekbej tu' axca ti': —¿Mac ach txel? ẍi eb.

English: He did not fail to confess, but confessed freely, “I am not the Christ. ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Juan tu' yin bayc'al ijanil; watx'c'al max yut yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ti', mayinnak Cristo in, ẍi bay eb.

English: They asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No.”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen eb bay junelxa tu': —¿Mac ach wal txel xin? ¿Ma ach Elías ach? ẍi eb bay. —C'amak, mayinnak, ẍi bay eb. —¿Ma ach chekbej ach Dios, echbanebil jay juj? ẍi eb bay. —C'amak, ẍi bay eb.

English: Finally they said, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen eb bay junelxa: —¿Mac ach wal txel xin? Al ayon mac ach txel, yujtol yowalil ok jal japni bay eb cheknejontek. Al ayon, ¿tzet ayji? ẍi eb bay.

English: John replied in the words of Isaiah the prophet, “I am the voice of one calling in the desert, ‘Make straight the way for the Lord.’ ”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ton albilcan wabixal yuj jun chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías payxa, yet max yalon axca ti': Ay jun mactxel bay tz'inan tx'otx' chi awji, cax chi yalon axca ti': T'inek junok is be Cham Yajaw, ẍicanok, ẍi Juan.

English: Now some Pharisees who had been sent
Kanjobal: A eb ulnak ec' bay Juan tu', a eb fariseo cheknej eb.

English: questioned him, “Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen c'apax el eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chak' bautizar anima, ta mayachnak Cristo ach, tamwal Elías ach, tamwal chekbej ach Dios, jun echbanebil jay juj? ẍi eb bay.

English: “I baptize with water,” John replied, “but among you stands one you do not know.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Juan tu' bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ti', chi wak' bautizar eb anima yul a', palta ay jun co xol, man e yojtakok.

English: He is the one who comes after me, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.”
Kanjobal: A jun tu', tzunan jay wintak, palta caw wal miman yelapnok wintak. Yuj tu', man in mojok wak'on serbil, tamwal in xuyon el tx'anil xanab yin yakan, ẍi Juan tu' bay eb.

English: This all happened at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
Kanjobal: A bay k'axepal ec' a' miman Jordán, bay jun lugar chi yik Betania, a tu' lanan yak'on bautizar Juan eb anima. A bay tu' max bet k'anlej el eb juntzan ti' bay.

English: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
Kanjobal: A yet junxa c'ual, max yilon Juan jay Jesús bay, xan max yal axca ti': —Ilek wali. A Cham lanan jay ti', axca yopiso junok calnel chi ak'lay yin xajanbal, caytu' yopiso yuj Dios, yujtol a' chi ul ion el co yobtakil co masanil bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: This is the one I meant when I said, ‘A man who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.’
Kanjobal: A ton Cham max wal yet max walon axca ti': A Cham tzunan jay wintak, palta ec'ban yopiso wintak, yujtol a yet c'amto chin alji, ayxac'alta' ec'ok, quin chi, max waloni.

English: I myself did not know him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was that he might be revealed to Israel.”
Kanjobal: Maj wojtaknej elok mactxel Cham tu', palta max quin jay ak'oj bautizar eb anima yul a', yet watx' ok ojtaknelay el Cham juj ayon israel on ti', ẍi Juan.

English: Then John gave this testimony: “I saw the Spirit come down from heaven as a dove and remain on him.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Juan tu' axca ti': Max wil yayol Cham Espíritu yiban axca junok paloma, axa yoccan yin tu'.

English: I would not have known him, except that the one who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is he who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’
Kanjobal: Mantota' wojtakok mactxel Cham chekbiltek yuj Dios tu', palta a Cham cheknej in wak'on bautizar eb anima yul a', a' max alon ayin axca ti': Ach ok el yayol Espíritu yiban jun mactxel, cax ok cancan yetok. A ton jun tu', a' ok aon oc Espíritu Santo yin anima, axca tol ok ak'lay bautizar eb yuj, ẍi ayin.

English: I have seen and I testify that this is the Son of God.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', max wil Cham tu'. Yuj tu' xan chi wak' testigoal in ba yin, tol C'ajol ton Dios Cham, ẍi Juan tu'.

English: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
Kanjobal: A wal yet yewial tu', ayic' Juan junelxa yetok cawan eb is cuywom.

English: When he saw Jesus passing by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
Kanjobal: Axa yilontok, lanan yec'jab Jesús, xan max yal axca ti': —Ilabi. A Cham chi ec' tu', axca yopiso junok calnel chi ak'lay yin xajanbal yuj anima, caytu' yopiso yuj Dios, ẍi.

English: When the two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb is cuywom Juan jun tu', max tzakloj eb yintak Jesús.

English: Turning around, Jesus saw them following and asked, “What do you want?” They said, “Rabbi” (which means Teacher), “where are you staying?”
Kanjobal: Axa meltzojtok acan Jesús yintak tu', max yiloni, tzakan oc eb yintak. —¿Tzet che saya'? ẍi Cham bay eb. —Meẍtol, ¿baytal cajan ach? ẍi eb bay.

English: “Come,” he replied, “and you will see.” So they went and saw where he was staying, and spent that day with him. It was about the tenth hour.
Kanjobal: —Sebaxek, ul ilek, ẍi bay eb. Axa toj eb yetok tu', max bet yilon eb bay cajan, cax max can eb yetok yet jun yayc'ualil tu', yujtol a las cuatroxa mi yet max apni eb yetok.

English: Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, was one of the two who heard what John had said and who had followed Jesus.
Kanjobal: A cawan eb tu', max yab eb tzet max yal Juan. Yuj tu' xan max oc eb cuywomok Jesús. Ay jun chi yik Andrés xol eb, yuẍtak ba yetok Simón Pedro.

English: The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and tell him, “We have found the Messiah” (that is, the Christ).
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al k'anjab Andrés tu' yetok Jesús, max toj sayon ec' jun yuẍtak tu'. Axa yet max ilchaj yuj, max yalon bay axca ti': —Max ilchaj oc Cham Mesías juj, ẍi bay. (Mesías chi yal elapnok Cristo, Cham Ak'bil Yopiso yuj Dios.)

English: And he brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which, when translated, is Peter ).
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', a' max iontok jun yuẍtak tu' bay Jesús. Max oc t'anan Jesús yin Simón tu', max yalon bay: —Simón, c'ajol Jonás, Cefasxa ok ekcan ajok, ẍi Jesús bay. (A Cefas chi yal elapnok, Pedro, ma ch'en.)

English: The next day Jesus decided to leave for Galilee. Finding Philip, he said to him, “Follow me.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, max na Jesús toj bay Galilea, max chalen ba yetok jun mac chi yik Felipe, cax max yalon bay: —Ec'anc'al cuywok wintak, ẍi bay.

English: Philip, like Andrew and Peter, was from the town of Bethsaida.
Kanjobal: A Felipe tu', aj conob Betsaida. Cay c'apax tu' Andrés yetok Pedro, junnejc'al conob eb.

English: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and about whom the prophets also wrote–Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
Kanjobal: Axa Felipe max bet sayon ec' jun chi yik Natanael. Maxc'al ilchaj yuj, max yalon bay axca ti': —Ay jun max ilchaj juj, a ton Cham tz'ibejnakcan Moisés yabixal yul ley. Tz'ibbil c'apax can yuj eb chekbej Dios yet payxa. A ton Jesús, c'ajol José, aj conob Nazaret, ẍi.

English: “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael asked. “Come and see,” said Philip.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Natanael tu' bay axca ti': —¿Tom ay junok watx'takil chi tit bay Nazaret xin? ẍi bay. —Sebach, ton jila', ẍi Felipe tu' bay.

English: When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said of him, “Here is a true Israelite, in whom there is nothing false.”
Kanjobal: Max yilontok Jesús, lanan jayoc Natanael bay, axa yalon yuj Natanael tu' axca ti': —A jun chi jay ti', caw wal israel ton yul sat Dios, c'am chi iwi aytek sat anima, ẍi Jesús.

English: “How do you know me?” Nathanael asked. Jesus answered, “I saw you while you were still under the fig tree before Philip called you.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'anlej Natanael tu' bay axca ti': —¿Tzet max quin ot ojtaknen el xin? ẍi. —Wojtak achxa yet c'amto chach yawtej jay Felipe, yet ay ach ec' yich jun te higo, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Then Nathanael declared, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.”
Kanjobal: —Meẍtol, yel ton wali C'ajol ach Dios. Co Reyal ach ayon conob Israel on ti', ẍi bay.

English: Jesus said, “You believe because I told you I saw you under the fig tree. You shall see greater things than that.”
Kanjobal: —¿Asannej mi yuj max wala' tol max ach wil yich te higo, yuj tu' xan chaoc a c'ul win? Palta ay juntzanxa tzet yetal ok wunej ok ela', tol yelxac'al miman yelapnok, ẍi bay.

English: He then added, “I tell you the truth, you shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Jesús bay eb ayic' yetok tu' axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, ok e yila', tol jakan satcan, axa eb yángel Dios ok e yil paxaj eb c'al yayol eb wiban, ayin tol Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: “I tell you the truth, the man who does not enter the sheep pen by the gate, but climbs in by some other way, is a thief and a robber.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús axca ti': Wal yel chi wal ayex, k'inalok ay junok corral calnel bay chi octok junok winak tinani', ta manak bay is ti' jun corral tu' chi ca yoctok, palta tx'ok bay chi ca yoctok, elk'om ton jun axca tu'.

English: The man who enters by the gate is the shepherd of his sheep.
Kanjobal: A pax mac a yul ti' corral chi octok xin, a ton nak yilomal no tu'.

English: The watchman opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
Kanjobal: A nak waynem corral, a chi jakon ti' corral bay nak ilom calnel. Yojtak no calnel yilomal. Yojtak nak ilom calnel tu' bi junjun is calnel. A chi ion eltek no'.

English: When he has brought out all his own, he goes on ahead of them, and his sheep follow him because they know his voice.
Kanjobal: Chi xew yion eltek nak no' is calnel, cax chi babji satak no'. Chi oc tzakan no' yintak nak, yujtol yojtakxa no' yul is nuk'.

English: But they will never follow a stranger; in fact, they will run away from him because they do not recognize a strangers voice.”
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ay junokxa winak man k'aynakok no' yetok, man comonok chi oc tzakan no' yintak. Ta man k'aynakok no' yetok, chi el bulnaj no' bay, ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus used this figure of speech, but they did not understand what he was telling them.
Kanjobal: Max yaltek Cham jun abix ti' bay eb, palta maj nachaj el yuj eb tzet chi yal elapnok.

English: Therefore Jesus said again, “I tell you the truth, I am the gate for the sheep.
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon pax Jesús bay eb axca ti': Wal yel chi wal ayex, axca ti' corral bay chi ec' oc no calnel, cay in tu'.

English: All who ever came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
Kanjobal: Ay eb babel jaynak in satak, max tz'ak yaloc ba eb chekbejok Dios. Axca wal junok elk'om chi oc yul corral, cay wal tu' eb masanil, palta eb yet-xa Dios, maj yaoc eb c'ul yin eb.

English: I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved. He will come in and go out, and find pasture.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', lajan in axca junok ti' corral tu'. A eb a ayin chi ca yoqui, ok colchaj eb. Axca junok calnel chi octok, chi eltek yul is corral sayon low ba, caytu' ok yun eb.

English: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
Kanjobal: Ay eb axca junok elk'om chi jayi, chi yelk'anentok, cax chi yak'on camok. Axa in ayin ti', max in jay yuj ul wak'on k'inal eb, tol tz'akan yin watx'ilal.

English: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' lajan in axca junok ilom calnel caw wal watx', cax bekan c'ul cam q'uexelok no'.

English: The hired hand is not the shepherd who owns the sheep. So when he sees the wolf coming, he abandons the sheep and runs away. Then the wolf attacks the flock and scatters it.
Kanjobal: Ay bay toc'al chi manlay junok mac chi ilwi calnel, palta man wal acaw aj calnelok. A yet chi yilon jay no ok, ayman chi bekcan bulan no calnel tu' tx'oklil, cax chi eli yujtol man yetok no'. Chi lajwi tu' chi uchlaycan saklem no calnel tu' yuj no ok.

English: The man runs away because he is a hired hand and cares nothing for the sheep.
Kanjobal: A nak ilom calnel tu', chi el nak, yujtol asan yuj tojbil c'u nak xan chi ilwi calnel, man wal yujok tol ay yelapnok no' yul sat.

English: “I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me–
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', lajan in axca junok ilom calnel caw wal watx'. A eb wet, axca tol in calnel eb. Ojtakbil in yuj in Mam. Ac'ala' in, wojtak in Mam. Axca wal wojtaknen in ba yetok in Mam, caytu' wojtaknen in ba yetok eb wet-xa yayji. Ok wak' in ba cam q'uexelok eb wet tu'.

English: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father–and I lay down my life for the sheep. just as the Father knows me and I know the Father–and I lay down my life for the sheep.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzanxa eb tolto ok yaoc c'ul win, asan tol man jet conobok eb. Yowalil ok in wajbaj oc eb. Ok yiken eb ayin. Junxanej oyan ok yun eb wet tu' masanil, yujtol asannej in ok wil eb.

English: The reason my Father loves me is that I lay down my life–only to take it up again.
Kanjobal: Chi camel c'ul in Mam win, yujtol ok wak' in ba camok, cax ok wiquisnen pax aj in ba junelxa.

English: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have authority to lay it down and authority to take it up again. This command I received from my Father.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chi el yin in c'ul wak'on in ba camok. C'am mac chi je' in yak'on camok, ta c'am chi yal in c'ul. Ay wikbej wak'on in ba camok. Ay c'apax wikbej wiquisbi aj junelxa, yujtol caytu' max yut yak'oncan in Mam jun chekbanil ti' ayin, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At these words the Jews were again divided.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon juntzan ti', max teyelen aj ba eb aj Judea tu' yuj. Ca pojan max yut ba eb junelxa.

English: Many of them said, “He is demon-possessed and raving mad. Why listen to him?”
Kanjobal: Ay nan eb max alon axca ti': —¿Tzet xan che yab tzet chi yal jun winak ti'? Ilab tol ayoc espíritu yob yin. Chabil oybinak sat yuj, ẍi eb.

English: But others said, “These are not the sayings of a man possessed by a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
Kanjobal: Palta ay pax nanxa eb chi alon axca ti': —Ta a espíritu yob ayoc yin, ¿xin ta chi je' yalon axca ti'? ¿Tom chi je' jakon espíritu yob tu' sat junok mac c'am chi je' yilwi? ẍi nanxa eb tu'.

English: Then came the Feast of Dedication at Jerusalem. It was winter,
Kanjobal: A yet tu' tiempoalxa nabil k'inal, c'ual c'apax chalay k'inal templo Dios bay Jerusalén.

English: and Jesus was in the temple area walking in Solomon's Colonnade.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal yec'jab Jesús bay templo tu', bay jun tenta chi yik tenta Salomón.

English: The Jews gathered around him, saying, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
Kanjobal: Cax max oc oyan eb aj Judea ayic' bay tu' yin Cham, max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Bak'inc'al ok on a bekil yin cabc'ulal? Ta Cristo ach, bayc'al ijan chot alon ayon tinani', ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “I did tell you, but you do not believe. The miracles I do in my Father's name speak for me,
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi bay eb tu' axca ti': —Mayal wal ayex, palta c'am che yaoc yin e c'ul. A juntzan milagro chin tx'oxo', asan yuj yikbej in Mam xan chi je' wuj in tx'oxoni, cax a ton juntzan tu' chi tx'oxk'abnen elok mac in txel.

English: but you do not believe because you are not my sheep.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti', caw wal c'am chin e yaoc yin e c'ul, yujtol man wetok e yayji.

English: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
Kanjobal: A eb wet, chi yacbaj eb is txiquin ayin, cax wojtak eb ayin ti'. Axca no calnel chi oc tzakan yintak yilomal, caytu' chi yun tzakloj eb wintak.

English: I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one can snatch them out of my hand.
Kanjobal: Ayin chi wak' is k'inal eb, tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu' xan c'am bak'in ok c'ayil eb. C'am junok mactxel chi je' yion ec' eb yul in k'ab.

English: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all ; no one can snatch them out of my Father's hand.
Kanjobal: A in Mam, ec'ban yelapnok yintak masanil, a max ak'on eb ayin. C'am junok mactxel chi je' yion ec' eb yul k'ab in Mam.

English: I and the Father are one.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', junnej animail wayji yetok co Mam Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb aj Judea tu'.

English: Again the Jews picked up stones to stone him,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max sic'aj eb ch'en, cax max yochej eb max k'okch'ennen camok.

English: but Jesus said to them, “I have shown you many great miracles from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Jesús bay eb: —Xiwil tzet yetal watx' max el wunen yuj is yikbej in Mam e nan e xol. ¿Mactet junok tu' tol yuj xan che yochej chin e k'okch'ennej camok? ẍi bay eb.

English: “We are not stoning you for any of these,” replied the Jews, “but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.”
Kanjobal: —Man yujok junok watx' max el onen tu', xan chi jochej chach co k'ok camok, palta asan yuj cha buch Dios. Ach ti', comon anima ach, palta ilab chal pax oc a ba Diosal, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I have said you are gods’ ?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —A yul tx'an ley ayic' ayon, caytu' tz'ibelaycan ay axca ti': Max wala' tol dios ex ayex ti', ẍican Dios yul tx'an.

English: If he called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came–and the Scripture cannot be broken–
Kanjobal: Jojtak, a tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un tu', maj je' toc'al ok co tena'. A Dios alnejcan bay eb chanakcan is k'anej tu', tol dios eb.

English: what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world? Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God's Son’?
Kanjobal: Akxa ayin ti', a Dios sic'nej in elok, a' max in chekontek yulyibank'inal ti'. Yuj tu' ¿tzet xan che yala' tol chin buchwaj yin Dios, yet chi waloni tol C'ajol in Dios?

English: Do not believe me unless I do what my Father does.
Kanjobal: Ta manak tzet chi yun in Mam chi wunej, manchak e yaoc e c'ul win.

English: But if I do it, even though you do not believe me, believe the miracles, that you may know and understand that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”
Kanjobal: Palta ayin ti', lanan wunen tzet chi yun in Mam. Yuj tu' xan caxc'al mi c'am che yaoc e c'ul yin tzet chi wala', palta aek oc e c'ul win yuj juntzan tzet yetal chi wun tu'. Catatu' ok nachaj el e yuj, cax ok e yaon oc yin e c'ul tol ayoc co Mam Dios win, cax ayin c'apax oc yin, ẍi bay eb.

English: Again they tried to seize him, but he escaped their grasp.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan maxto yak'lej eb mitx'on junelxa, palta max col ba Cham yul k'ab eb.

English: Then Jesus went back across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing in the early days. Here he stayed
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max k'axpoj ec' yul a' miman Jordán, axa yayji ec' bay yak'nak bautizar Juan eb anima tu'.

English: and many people came to him. They said, “Though John never performed a miraculous sign, all that John said about this man was true.”
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max ul ilon Cham, cax chi yalon eb axca ti': —A cham Juan, c'am bay max tx'ox junok milagro, palta masanil tzet max yal yuj Jesús ti', yelc'al ton masanil, ẍi eb.

English: And in that place many believed in Jesus.
Kanjobal: Xiwil mactxel max yaoc c'ul yin Jesús bay jun lugar tu'.

English: Now a man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
Kanjobal: A bay jun aldea chi yik Betania, ay jun winak max yaban ayok, chi yik Lázaro. Ay cawan yanab jun winak tu', ay jun chi yik María, ay junxa chi yik Marta. Aj Betaniac'al el eb yoxwanil.

English: This Mary, whose brother Lazarus now lay sick, was the same one who poured perfume on the Lord and wiped his feet with her hair.
Kanjobal: (A ix María tu' anej oc yal suk'uk'i jab yin yakan Jesús Jajawil, cax joontak ix yetok is xil.) Caw wal ya'ay Lázaro tu'.

English: So the sisters sent word to Jesus, “Lord, the one you love is sick.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yatok eb ix anabejal tu' ti' bay Jesús, max yaltok eb ix axca ti': —Mamin, a nak camc'ulnebil oj, caw wal ya'ay nak tinani', ẍitok eb.

English: When he heard this, Jesus said, “This sickness will not end in death. No, it is for God's glory so that God's Son may be glorified through it.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús tzet max yaltok eb ix, max yalon axca ti': —A jun ilya' tu', maj cam nak yuj junelnej. Max michchaj nak yuj jun ilya' tu', yet watx' chi tx'oxk'abnej el ba is mayk'ak'al Dios, c'al yuj tx'oxk'abnelay el c'apax in mayk'ak'al ayin C'ajol in Dios ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
Kanjobal: Caw wal ay is camc'ulal Jesús yin Lázaro tu', c'al yin María yetok Marta.

English: Yet when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was two more days.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yaben tol caw wal ya'ay nak, maj tok yin ayman yiloni. Yinxa cabjial max toji.

English: Then he said to his disciples, “Let us go back to Judea.”
Kanjobal: A yet max ajapnok c'ual toj tu', max yalon bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Tonek bay yul yet Judea junelxa, ẍi bay eb.

English: “But Rabbi,” they said, “a short while ago the Jews tried to stone you, and yet you are going back there?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb bay tu': —Palta Mamin, jayebixto c'u yak'len eb aj Judea tu' ach k'okch'enneni. ¿Tom chochej chach toj pax junelxa bay tu' tinani'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours of daylight? A man who walks by day will not stumble, for he sees by this world's light.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Jojtak tol ay 12 hora yul junjun c'u. Ta yet c'ualil chon ec'jabi, man comonok chon telc'oji, yujtol sakk'inal.

English: It is when he walks by night that he stumbles, for he has no light.”
Kanjobal: Palta ta chon ec'jab yet ak'balil xin, comonc'al chon telc'oji, yujtol c'am sakk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: After he had said this, he went on to tell them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep; but I am going there to wake him up.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon paxtek yuj Lázaro: —A nak jamigo tu', tol chi way nak; palta ok tok in tenil wayan, ẍi bay eb.

English: His disciples replied, “Lord, if he sleeps, he will get better.”
Kanjobal: —Palta Mamin, tatol chi way nak, tekan ok jay c'ul chi yal tu', ẍi eb cuywom tu' bay.

English: Jesus had been speaking of his death, but his disciples thought he meant natural sleep.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon Jesús tol chi way Lázaro tu', a is camichal chi yala'; palta a naon eb xin, tol acaw wayan chi yunej.

English: So then he told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max watx' alnej junelxa bay eb axca ti': —Max cam nak Lázaro.

English: and for your sake I am glad I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
Kanjobal: Caw chin tzaloj tinani', yujtol c'am in ec' bay tu' yet max cami, yet watx' che ya wal oc e c'ul win. A tinani' tonek jila', ẍi bay eb.

English: Then Thomas (called Didymus) said to the rest of the disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with him.”
Kanjobal: Axa Tomás, nak Tioẍ jebil bi, max yal nak bay eb yet cuywomal tu' axca ti': —Tonek yetok Cham, toj jak'ek co ba cam yetok, ẍi bay eb.

English: On his arrival, Jesus found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni eb xin, max yaben eb tol oxjitax max mukay Lázaro tu'.

English: Bethany was less than two miles from Jerusalem,
Kanjobal: Cawilal Jerusalén ay conob Betania, axca mi nanok legua xol ba.

English: and many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them in the loss of their brother.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan xiwil eb aj Jerusalén max bet mimanc'ulnen María yetok Marta, yuj is nuej eb max cam tu'.

English: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed at home.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Marta tol lanan jay Jesús bay na eb, axa toj ix chaon tu'. A pax María xin, aycan ec' yul na.

English: “Lord,” Martha said to Jesus, “if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Marta bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin, ta ayach ec' cayti', majmi cam nak in nuej tu'.

English: But I know that even now God will give you whatever you ask.”
Kanjobal: Palta tinani', wojtak, tzanc'al tzet ok a k'an bay Dios, ok yak' ayach, ẍi ix bay.

English: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
Kanjobal: —A nak a nuej tu', ok ictzoj aj nak, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: Martha answered, “I know he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
Kanjobal: —Yel toni, wojtak. A yet lajub c'ual, yet ok ictzoj aj eb camnak masanil, cax ok ictzoj aj nak yetok eb, ẍi ix bay.

English: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will live, even though he dies;
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', ak'om in ictzoj aj camnak, aj k'inalej in c'apaxok. Tzanc'al mac chin yaoc yin is c'ul, caxc'al mi ok camok, palta ok ictzoj pax ajok.

English: and whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
Kanjobal: Masanil eb iquis tol chin yaoc yin is c'ul, c'am bak'in ok cam eb. ¿Chimi aoc jun ti' yin a c'ul? ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: “Yes, Lord,” she told him, “I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, who was to come into the world.”
Kanjobal: —Chi ton waoc yin in c'ul Mamin, tol ach ti' Cristo ach, C'ajol ach Dios. Ach ton ti' echbanebil a jay bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi ix bay.

English: And after she had said this, she went back and called her sister Mary aside. “The Teacher is here,” she said, “and is asking for you.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon ix Marta axca tu', max pax ix, max toj yawtej ix is nuej. Yin ewantakil max yal ix bay is nuej tu': —Mayal jay Cham Meẍtol, chach yawtej Cham, ẍi ix.

English: When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yaben María axca tu', max aj lemnajok, cax max toj bay ayic' Jesús,

English: Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
Kanjobal: tutun c'amto chi oc Cham xol conob tu'. A bay max bet chalay yuj Marta, a tu' ayto ec'ok.

English: When the Jews who had been with Mary in the house, comforting her, noticed how quickly she got up and went out, they followed her, supposing she was going to the tomb to mourn there.
Kanjobal: Palta ayic' eb aj Judea bay na yetok ix. Max ul mimanc'ulnelay ix yuj eb. Axa yet max yilon eb tol max aj lemnaj ix cax max toji, ayman max tzakloj eb yintak ix, yujtol a naon eb tol a bay mukan nak is nuej tu' chi toj ok'ok.

English: When Mary reached the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc ix bay ayic' Jesús, max ay jajan ix satak. Axa yalon ix bay axca ti': —Mamin, ta ayach ec' cayti' majmi cam nak in nuej, ẍi ix bay.

English: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who had come along with her also weeping, he was deeply moved in spirit and troubled.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús tol chi ok' ix, cax chi ok' pax eb aj Judea max tzakloj yintak ix tu', axa cus c'apax aj Cham yetok eb tu' sic'libil.

English: “Where have you laid him?” he asked. “Come and see, Lord,” they replied.
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen bay eb axca ti': —¿Baytal max e muk nak? ẍi bay eb. —Mamin, ton jila', ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus wept.
Kanjobal: Max ok' Jesús.

English: Then the Jews said, “See how he loved him!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb aj Judea ayic' yilon tu' axca ti': —Ilab wali, caw wal camc'ulnebil yuj Cham, ẍixac'al eb.

English: But some of them said, “Could not he who opened the eyes of the blind man have kept this man from dying?”
Kanjobal: Ay pax eb max alon axca ti': —Palta a Jesús ti', a' max jakon sat jun nak c'am chi je' yilwi. ¿Tom maj je' yak'on jay c'ul Lázaro ti', yet watx' c'am chi cami? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus, once more deeply moved, came to the tomb. It was a cave with a stone laid across the entrance.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max tit pitz'naj is cusc'ulal Jesús, cax max apni oc bay mukan nak. A yul jun ch'en olbil, a tu' ayoctok mimanil nak tu'. Patxancan oc junxa ch'en makilok.

English: “Take away the stone,” he said. “But, Lord,” said Martha, the sister of the dead man, “by this time there is a bad odor, for he has been there four days.”
Kanjobal: —Iek el ch'en makilej tu', ẍi Jesús. Max yalon Marta, ix yanab nak Lázaro tu' axca ti': —Palta Mamin, oxjitax max cam nak, tekan ayxa jabil nak tinani', ẍi ix bay.

English: Then Jesus said, “Did I not tell you that if you believed, you would see the glory of God?”
Kanjobal: —Mayal wal ayach, tatol chin aoc yin a c'ul, ok ton el mayk'ak'al Dios, ẍi bay ix.

English: So they took away the stone. Then Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank you that you have heard me.
Kanjobal: Catatu bian, max yion el eb makil bay ayoctok nak tu'. Max aj t'anan Jesús satcan, max yalon axca ti': —Mamin, yuj wal dios ayach, max ab tzet max wala'.

English: I knew that you always hear me, but I said this for the benefit of the people standing here, that they may believe that you sent me.”
Kanjobal: Wojtakxa tol masanil tiempo chabc'alta' tzet chi wala', palta a yuj jantak eb anima bulan ec' ti', xan chi wal juntzan ti' ayach, yet watx' ok yaoc eb yin c'ul tol ach cheknejintek, ẍi Jesús.

English: When he had said this, Jesus called in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon juntzan tu', cax max aj yaw yin ipejal axca ti': —¡Lázaro, elantek! ẍi.

English: The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with strips of linen, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, “Take off the grave clothes and let him go.”
