Kanjobal: Axa yeltek nak camnak tu'. Chulan oc juntzan k'apej yin yakan nak c'al yin is k'ab nak. Ay c'apax jun an xotan oc yalan is ti'. Max yal Jesús axca ti': —Xuyek el juntzan k'ap ayoc yin nak tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: Therefore many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, put their faith in him.
Kanjobal: Cax xiwil eb aj Judea ajun yetok María tu', max yil eb tzetc'al max yun Jesús. Yuj tu' xan xiwil eb max yaoc c'ul yin.

English: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzanxa eb max bet alon yab eb fariseo, tzetak max yi ba yuj.

English: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin. “What are we accomplishing?” they asked. “Here is this man performing many miraculous signs.
Kanjobal: Axa lajtinen el ba eb fariseo tu' yetok eb yajawil eb sacerdote c'al eb sat yajaw, cax yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet chi jut jun winak tu' che na'? Yujtol xiwil juntzan milagro lanan tx'oxon tinani'.

English: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and then the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”
Kanjobal: Ta toc'al ok jiloc nak tinani', masanil eb jet conob ok yaoc eb c'ul yin nak. Axa eb yajaw bay Roma, ok ul yuchay eb jun templo Dios ti', cax ok on yak'on lajwok eb yetok eb jet conob masanil, ẍi eb.

English: Then one of them, named Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, spoke up, “You know nothing at all!
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun chi yik Caifás xol eb. A jun tu' ayoc sat sacerdoteal yet jun abil tu'. A' max alon bay eb axca ti': —Ayex ti', caw wal c'am jabok tzet e yojtak.

English: You do not realize that it is better for you that one man die for the people than that the whole nation perish.”
Kanjobal: C'am chi nachaj el e yuj, tol yelmi watx' chon cani ta chi cam junok winak q'uexelok anima masanil. Ta caytu' chi yunej, c'am chi lajwi el eb jet conob masanil, ẍi Caifás tu'.

English: He did not say this on his own, but as high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the Jewish nation,
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yalon juntzan k'anej tu', man yulok yet max yala', palta yujtol sat sacerdote yayji yet jun abil tu', yuj tu' xan max ak'lay yal yuj Dios tol ok cam Jesús q'uexelok eb israel masanil.

English: and not only for that nation but also for the scattered children of God, to bring them together and make them one.
Kanjobal: Man asannejok yuj eb israel tu', xan max cami. Max cam c'apax yuj wajban oc jantak eb yuninal Dios sakleminak yayji bay yulyibank'inal ti', yet watx' junxanej chi yuncan eb.

English: So from that day on they plotted to take his life.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan, a yet jun c'ual tu', max chaon el eb yajaw yich sayoni, tzetbil ok yut eb yak'on cam Jesús.

English: Therefore Jesus no longer moved about publicly among the Jews. Instead he withdrew to a region near the desert, to a village called Ephraim, where he stayed with his disciples.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan c'amxa chi ec' Jesús nan xol eb aj Judea tu'. Axa yel bay jun lugar tu', cax max toj bay jun conob chi yik Efraín, bay tilak el jun tz'inan tx'otx'. Ata tu' max apni oc yetok eb is cuywom.

English: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, many went up from the country to Jerusalem for their ceremonial cleansing before the Passover.
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa jay tiempoal jun is k'in eb israel chi yik Pascua, xiwil eb najat petoj, max jayoc eb bay Jerusalén. C'amto chi oc k'in tu' yet max apni oc eb, yet watx' chi watx'nej ba eb axca ta' is beybalil.

English: They kept looking for Jesus, and as they stood in the temple area they asked one another, “What do you think? Isn't he coming to the Feast at all?”
Kanjobal: A yet ayic' eb bay tu', caw wal max saylay ec' Jesús yuj eb. Ay eb max alon yul yamak'il templo Dios axca ti': —¿Tzet ẍi e c'ul? ¿Okmi jay Jesús tu' bay k'in ti', ma maj jay che na'? ẍi eb.

English: But the chief priests and Pharisees had given orders that if anyone found out where Jesus was, he should report it so that they might arrest him.
Kanjobal: Axa yion eltek eb fariseo c'al eb yajawil eb sacerdote tu' jun k'anej tol chi yal axca ti': Ta ay bay che yil yin Jesús, chi ul e yal ayon, ẍi. Caytu' max yun saklemil k'anej yuj eb, yujtol max yochej wal eb max yaoc preso.

English: Six days before the Passover, Jesus arrived at Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.
Kanjobal: Obixokto yoc k'in Pascua bay Jerusalén, max apni oc Jesús bay Betania bay cajan Lázaro, nak max ictzoj aj yuj Jesús.

English: Here a dinner was given in Jesus' honor. Martha served, while Lazarus was among those reclining at the table with him.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc Jesús, max oc jun miman loj yuj eb yuj Cham. A Lázaro tu' max low yetok eb. Axa Marta chi iwi eltek loj.

English: Then Mary took about a pint of pure nard, an expensive perfume; she poured it on Jesus' feet and wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
Kanjobal: A pax ix María xin, max yitek nan litro ambal suk'uk'i jab, chi yik nardo. A jun ambal tu', caw wal can is tojol. Max jayc'al ix bay Jesús cax secon oc ix yin yakan Cham. Lajwic'al tu', max joontak ix yetok is xil. Jun bek max nojil yul jun na tu' yuj jabil.

English: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was later to betray him, objected,
Kanjobal: Ay jun is cuywom Jesús chi yik Judas Iscariote, nak t'inan yaon oc Cham yul k'ab camich. A' max alon axca ti':

English: “Why wasn't this perfume sold and the money given to the poor? It was worth a year's wages. ”
Kanjobal: —A jun ambal suk'uk'i jab ti', aymi junok 300 denario is tojol. Matawal tol max co txonilok, cax chi jak'on tojol bay eb meba', ẍi, chi tz'ak yaloni.

English: He did not say this because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief; as keeper of the money bag, he used to help himself to what was put into it.
Kanjobal: Palta toc'al chi tz'ak yala', man yelok chi yala', ta a eb meba' tu' chi na'. Palta yujtol c'ubom tumin yayji, yuj tu' xan a' max ochen max tz'ak c'ubaj is tojol tu', cax chi yioncan el jabok yet yin ch'en, yujtol toc'alta' elk'om nak.

English: “Leave her alone,” Jesus replied. “It was intended that she should save this perfume for the day of my burial.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay nak axca ti': —Bek a tzuon ix, yujtol a jun yal suk'uk'i jab ti', max c'ubaj ec' ix, yuj in bonlay yet c'ual in mukbanil.

English: You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me.”
Kanjobal: A eb meba' tu', ayc'al ec' eb e yetok. A pax ayin ti xin, man tojbalk'inalok ayin ec' e yetok, ẍi bay nak.

English: Meanwhile a large crowd of Jews found out that Jesus was there and came, not only because of him but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb israel max abeni tol ayic' Jesús bay Betania, xan max toj eb yila'. Man asannejok Cham chi yochej eb chi yila', palta chi yochej c'apax eb chi yil yin Lázaro, yujtol max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak yuj Jesús.

English: So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well,
Kanjobal: Yuj yictzojbail Lázaro tu', xan xiwil eb israel max yaoc c'ul yin Jesús. C'amxa chi yaoc eb c'ul yin eb sacerdote. Yuj tu' xan max lajtinej el ba eb yajawil eb sacerdote, cax chi yochen eb chi mak' cam Lázaro tu' c'apaxok.

English: for on account of him many of the Jews were going over to Jesus and putting their faith in him. for on account of him many of the Jews were going over to Jesus and putting their faith in him.
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max jay bay Jerusalén yuj k'in Pascua. Axa yet junxa c'ual max yaben eb tol lanan yapni oc Jesús bay tu'.

English: They took palm branches and went out to meet him, shouting, “Hosanna! ” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Blessed is the King of Israel!”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xiwil eb chi ion el xaklak an palma. Chi yiontok eb, cax chi toj eb chaon Jesús. Max aj yaw eb yin ipejal, chi yalon eb axca ti': —Yuj wal dios. Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil ti'. Jalek watx' k'anej bay Cham co Reyal ayon israel on ti', ẍi eb.

English: Jesus found a young donkey and sat upon it, as it is written,
Kanjobal: Max ilchaj jun no burro yuj Jesús, max aj yiban no' axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un bay chi yal axca ti':

English: “Do not be afraid, O Daughter of Zion; see, your king is coming, seated on a donkey's colt.”
Kanjobal: Ex aj Sión, manchak ex xiwi. Ilab wal jay e Reyal e xol. Ayaj yiban jun no yune' burro, ẍi tx'an Un tu'.

English: At first his disciples did not understand all this. Only after Jesus was glorified did they realize that these things had been written about him and that they had done these things to him.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'u tu', maj nachaj el juntzan ti' yuj eb cuywom Jesús. Ato yet max ilay paxaj Jesús satcan, cax max naontek eb, tol a yabixal Jesús tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un tu', axcac'al tu' max yun yeloc yuj eb.

English: Now the crowd that was with him when he called Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to spread the word.
Kanjobal: A eb ayic' yetok Jesús, yet max yawten eltek Lázaro bay mukan yet max ictzoj ajok, max yalil eb tzet max yil eb tu'.

English: Many people, because they had heard that he had given this miraculous sign, went out to meet him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max toj eb anima tu' chaon Jesús, yujtol max yab eb yabixal jun milagro max uji.

English: So the Pharisees said to one another, “See, this is getting us nowhere. Look how the whole world has gone after him!”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb fariseo axca ti': —A tinani' c'amxa tzet watx' chi junej. Ilab wal masanil anima chi oc yetok, ẍi eb.

English: Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the Feast.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb griego max apni bay Jerusalén bay k'in tu', yuj yalon ba eb bay Dios.

English: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, with a request. “Sir,” they said, “we would like to see Jesus.”
Kanjobal: A eb tu', max jayoc eb bay Felipe aj Betsaida, bay yul yet Galilea, max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Mamin, chi jochej chi jil yin Jesús, ẍi eb.

English: Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.
Kanjobal: Max toj Felipe yalon bay Andrés, cax max toj eb cawanil yalon bay Jesús.

English: Jesus replied, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ti', Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, a tinani' lanan jay yorail txecloj elok, tol yel miman welapnok.

English: I tell you the truth, unless a kernel of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains only a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, k'inalok ay junok ixim bak' trigo chi can yiban tx'otx', toc'al chi can caktu'. Ta chi muklayi, axca tol chi cami, palta chi aj pax ulok, mimanxa bak' chi yak'a'.

English: The man who loves his life will lose it, while the man who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
Kanjobal: A mac asannej wal is k'inal ay yelapnok yul sat, ok lajwokcan el is k'inal tu'. A pax mac c'am yelapnok is k'inal yul sat bay yulyibank'inal ti xin, a ton eb tu' ok cha k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Whoever serves me must follow me; and where I am, my servant also will be. My Father will honor the one who serves me.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi ochen chin ak'on serbil, tzaklojokab wintak, yet watx' a bay ayin ec'ok, a tu' chi ayji c'apax ec'ok. Ta ay mac chin ak'on serbil, a in Mam ok paktzen bay eb, cax miman ok yun yeloc eb.

English: “Now my heart is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this hour’? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour.
Kanjobal: A tinani', caw wal chi oc pitz'an cusc'ulal win, palta, ¿tzet ok wut waloni? ¿Tom ok wal bay Dios axca ti': Mamin, col in el yul k'ab jun yailal ok jay wiban ti', xin ta quin chi? Yuj ton jun ti' xan ayintek yuj.

English: Father, glorify your name!” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.”
Kanjobal: Mamin, txeclojokab elok tol miman elapnok, ẍi Jesús. Lajwi tu xin, max yaben eb yoc jun k'anej satcan, tol max yal axca ti': Mayal in tx'oxo' tol miman welapnok. A tinani' xin, ok in tx'ox junelxa, ẍi jun k'anej tu'.

English: The crowd that was there and heard it said it had thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him.
Kanjobal: Axa eb anima ayic' bay tu', max yab eb jun tu'; yuj tu' xan ay eb max alon axca ti': —Tekan c'u jun max bil tu', ẍi eb. Ay eb xin: —Tekan ángel junok max k'anjab aytek bay Jesús ti', ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said, “This voice was for your benefit, not mine.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max yal Jesús bay eb: —Man wujok, xan max al-lay aytek juntzan ti', palta e yuj xan max al-layi.

English: Now is the time for judgment on this world; now the prince of this world will be driven out.
Kanjobal: A tinani', a eb ay bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok beyc'ulnelay eb, cax ok in k'okon el jun yajaw bay yulyibank'inal ti' yin yopiso.

English: But I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all men to myself.”
Kanjobal: A pax ayin ti xin, a yet ok in ilay aj bay sat tx'otx' ti', ok witek masanil anima ayin, ẍi Jesús.

English: He said this to show the kind of death he was going to die.
Kanjobal: Max yal axca tu', yuj tx'oxon elok tzetbil ok yun cami.

English: The crowd spoke up, “We have heard from the Law that the Christ will remain forever, so how can you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb anima bay axca ti': —A yul tx'an ley ayic' ayon, a tu' max jabej tol a Cham Cristo, ayc'al ec' yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu', ¿tzet xan chala' tol a jun Chekbiltek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, yowalil ok ilay ajok? ¿Mactxel jun Chekbiltek yuj Dios chal tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Then Jesus told them, “You are going to have the light just a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, before darkness overtakes you. The man who walks in the dark does not know where he is going.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ayin chi wak' sakk'inal bay e yanimail, ayin ec' e nan e xol tinani', palta jabxanej tiempoal ayin ec'ok. Caw wal che watx'nej e beybal, yak'ban wal tol ayinto ec' jayebokxa c'ual e yetok. Ta c'amak, ok somchaj el e c'ul. Axca wal junok mac chi bey xol k'ekk'inal, c'am chi je' yilon bay chi ca toji, caytu' ok yun e yelocok.

English: Put your trust in the light while you have it, so that you may become sons of light.” When he had finished speaking, Jesus left and hid himself from them.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', aj sakk'inal in. Yuj tu' xan aek oc e c'ul win, yak'ban wal tol ayinto ec' e yetok, cax chi wak'on sakk'inal bay e yanimail yin junelnej, ẍi Jesús bay eb. Lajwic'al yalon juntzan ti', max eli, max c'uban el ba bay eb.

English: Even after Jesus had done all these miraculous signs in their presence, they still would not believe in him.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al xiwil milagro max tx'ox Jesús bay eb, palta tokwal yuj tu' chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Cham.

English: This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet: “Lord, who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
Kanjobal: Cay ton tu' max yun yeloc tzet albilcan yuj Isaías, is chekbej Dios, yet max yaloncan axca ti': Mamin, ¿mactxel max yaoc c'ul yin k'anej max al-layi? ¿Mactxel max nachaj el mulnajbal Cham Jajawil yuj? ẍican Isaías tu' yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: For this reason they could not believe, because, as Isaiah says elsewhere:
Kanjobal: Xan majc'alta' je' yaon oc eb yin c'ul. Ilab tol albil pax yuj Isaías junelxa axca ti':

English: “He has blinded their eyes and deadened their hearts, so they can neither see with their eyes, nor understand with their hearts, nor turn–and I would heal them.”
Kanjobal: Axca tol a Dios chi makchen sat eb, chi watx' ak'nej pitbok eb, yet watx' axca tol c'am chi ilwi eb, cax c'am chi nachaj el yuj eb, yet watx' c'am chi meltzojtek eb bay Cham cax chi col-lay eb yuj Cham, ẍi.

English: Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus' glory and spoke about him.
Kanjobal: Yalnakcan Isaías juntzan ti', yujtol yilnak is mayk'ak'al Jesús, xan a ton yabixal ti' albilcan yuj.

English: Yet at the same time many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they would not confess their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue;
Kanjobal: Caxc'al albilcan axca tu', palta ay eb israel max yaoc c'ul yin Jesús. Toltax eb yajaw, xiwil eb max yaoc yin c'ul. Asan tol c'am chi tx'oxil ba eb, yujtol chi xiw eb bay eb fariseo, yujtol talaj chi uktelay eltek eb yul nail is culto eb yuj eb.

English: for they loved praise from men more than praise from God.
Kanjobal: Chi yut ba eb caktu', yujtol chi yochej eb tol miman yelapnok eb yul sat anima. C'am chi na eb tatol ay yelapnok eb yul sat Dios.

English: Then Jesus cried out, “When a man believes in me, he does not believe in me only, but in the one who sent me.
Kanjobal: Axa Jesús xin, yin ipejal max k'anjab eltek xol anima axca ti': A eb chi yaoc c'ul win, man asannejok win chi yaoc eb c'ul. Chi ya c'apax oc eb c'ul yin Cham cheknejintek.

English: When he looks at me, he sees the one who sent me.
Kanjobal: A eb chin iloni, lanan c'apax yilon eb Cham cheknejintek tu'.

English: I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', max in jay ul wak'on sakk'inal bay eb anima bay yulyibank'inal ti', yet watx' a eb chi yaoc c'ul win, c'amxa k'ekk'inal yin yanimail eb.

English: “As for the person who hears my words but does not keep them, I do not judge him. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save it.
Kanjobal: A eb chi aben in k'anej, ta c'am chi yikej eb, mayinnak ok waoc yailal eb, yujtol man yujok waon oc yailal anima xan max in jay bay yulyibank'inal ti', palta yuj wak'on colchaj eb, xan max in jayi.

English: There is a judge for the one who rejects me and does not accept my words; that very word which I spoke will condemn him at the last day.
Kanjobal: A eb c'am welapnok yul sat, eb c'am chi iken in k'anej, ayxa mac ok aon oc yailal eb, a ton in k'anej chi wal ti'. A in k'anej ti' ok aon oc yailal eb yet lajub c'ual.

English: For I did not speak of my own accord, but the Father who sent me commanded me what to say and how to say it.
Kanjobal: Yujtol man yulok wet chin k'anjabi, a in Mam cheknejintek, a' ak'nej is chekbanil ayin tzet chi ul wala'.

English: I know that his command leads to eternal life. So whatever I say is just what the Father has told me to say.”
Kanjobal: Wojtak, yuj is chekbanil tu', xan chi je' chaoncan eb anima is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu', axca max yun yalon in Mam ayin, caytu' chi wut walon c'apaxok, ẍi Jesús.

English: It was just before the Passover Feast. Jesus knew that the time had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he now showed them the full extent of his love.
Kanjobal: Yecalokxac'al k'in Pascua, max yojtaknej el Jesús, tol max jay tiempoal bekoncan yulyibank'inal ti', cax chi paxaj bay co Mam Dios. A eb yet-xa ayic' yulyibank'inal ti', caw wal camc'ulnebil eb yuj. A tinani', ok tx'oxo' tol jantakxa wal is camc'ulal yin eb.

English: The evening meal was being served, and the devil had already prompted Judas Iscariot, son of Simon, to betray Jesus.
Kanjobal: Toxa max oc nak diablo yin is nabal Judas, c'ajol Simón Iscariote, yuj yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab camich, palta a Cham yojtak tol a bay Dios titnak, cax ac'ala' bay ok paxajok. Yojtak tol a co Mam Dios max ak'on masanil ikbejlak yul is k'ab. Yuj tu' xan a yet lanan low Cham yetok eb is cuywom, max aj wan, max yion el an is jokan pichil, cax max pixon oc jun toalla yin is nan.

English: Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God; Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God; so he got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yaon ay aej yul jun palangana. Axa tx'ajon el yakan eb is cuywom tu', max joon tak yetok an toalla tu'.

English: He came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
Kanjobal: Axa yet ijan toxa ok tx'ajil yakan Simón Pedro max yalon Pedro tu' bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿tom ijan cha tx'ajil wakan ti' aloni? ẍi bay.

English: Jesus replied, “You do not realize now what I am doing, but later you will understand.”
Kanjobal: —A tinani', c'am chi nachaj el oj tzet yetal jun chi wun ti', palta c'ojanc'ulal ok nachaj el oj, ẍi Cham bay.

English: “No,” said Peter, “you shall never wash my feet.” Jesus answered, “Unless I wash you, you have no part with me.”
Kanjobal: —C'am oxlajon bak'in tol ach ok a tx'ajil wakan ti', ẍi Pedro tu' bay. —Ta c'am chak' in tx'ajil xin, c'am alon et wetok, ẍi Cham.

English: “Then, Lord,” Simon Peter replied, “not just my feet but my hands and my head as well!”
Kanjobal: —Ta caytu xin Mamin, manokab asannejok wakan ti' cha tx'aja', tx'aj c'apax in k'ab ti' c'al in jolom, ẍi Pedro tu'.

English: Jesus answered, “A person who has had a bath needs only to wash his feet; his whole body is clean. And you are clean, though not every one of you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham axca ti': —K'inalok ay junok mac tolto max achinwi, manxa yowalilok chi tx'ajlay is mimanil masanil. Asanxanej yakan chi tx'ajlayi, yujtol a is mimanil sakxa yayji. Ayex ti', axca junok mayal achinwi tu', caytu' e yayji, yujtol toxa mayal watx'ji e nabal. Palta man e masanilok max watx'ji e nabal, ẍi Jesús.

English: For he knew who was going to betray him, and that was why he said not every one was clean.
Kanjobal: Yojtakxa mactxel jun ok aon oc yul k'ab camich. Yuj tu' xan max yal axca ti': Man e masanilok max watx'ji e nabal, ẍi.

English: When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and returned to his place. “Do you understand what I have done for you?” he asked them.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi tx'ajon yakan eb tu', axa yaon pax oc an is jokan pichil tu' junelxa. Axa yay chotan yetok eb tu', max yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —¿Chimi nachaj el e yuj, tzet yuj xan caytu' chex wutej?

English: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chin e yaloc e Meẍtolok, cax chin e yalon oc e Yajawilok. Yel ton che yala'.

English: Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another's feet.
Kanjobal: E Meẍtol in toni, e Yajawil in toni, palta ilab max in tx'ajil e yakan ti'. Yuj tu', moj wal caytu' che yut e ba c'apaxok.

English: I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.
Kanjobal: Max in tx'ox jun ti' ayex yet watx' axca chex wut ti', caytu' che yut e ba c'apaxok.

English: I tell you the truth, no servant is greater than his master, nor is a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'am junok mosejal ec'ban yintak is patrón. Cay c'apax tu' eb chekbej, c'am junok mac ec'ban yintak mac chi chekon eb tu'.

English: Now that you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
Kanjobal: Ta chi nachaj el juntzan ti' e yuj, cax che yikeni, caw wal watx' e yet.

English: “I am not referring to all of you; I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill the scripture: ‘He who shares my bread has lifted up his heel against me.’
Kanjobal: —Man e yujok e masanil, xan chi wal axca ti', yujtol wojtak mac ex sic'bil exxa el wuj. Palta yowalil ok yunc'alta' tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un bay chi yal axca ti': A jun chi low wetok, a' max oc ajc'ulal win, ẍi tx'an.

English: “I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe that I am He.
Kanjobal: Ayokto chi waloncan juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' a yet ok jayoc wiban, cax ok e yaon wal oc e c'ul win, tol ayin ton Cristo in.

English: I tell you the truth, whoever accepts anyone I send accepts me; and whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac chi chaon eb in chekbej, ayin ton chin is cha eb. A eb chin chaon tu', chi cha' c'apax eb Cham cheknejintek, ẍi Jesús.

English: After he had said this, Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified, “I tell you the truth, one of you is going to betray me.”
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan ti', max oc pitz'an cusc'ulal yin, xan max yal axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a e xol ay jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich, ẍi bay eb.

English: His disciples stared at one another, at a loss to know which of them he meant.
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli yil-len oc ba eb cuywom tu', yujtol man yojtakok eb mac jun chi yal tu'.

English: One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining next to him.
Kanjobal: Ay jun camc'ulnebil yuj Jesús sic'libil, chotan ay is tz'eyil yet lanan low eb tu'.

English: Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, “Ask him which one he means.”
Kanjobal: Max yak'on Simón Pedro yechel bay, yet watx' chi k'anlej bay Jesús, mactxel jun chi yal tu'.

English: Leaning back against Jesus, he asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan max jitzxac'al oc ba c'atan Cham, max k'anlen bay: —Mamin, ¿mactxel jun chal tu' tinani'? ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus answered, “It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it in the dish.” Then, dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, son of Simon.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A mac bay ok wak' jabok ti' pan ok in la' xol vinagre, a ton jun tu', ẍi. Max lajwi yalon Jesús axca tu xin, axa laon jab pan tu', max yak'on bay Judas, is c'ajol Simón Iscariote.

English: As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him. “What you are about to do, do quickly,” Jesus told him,
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al chaon Judas jab pan tu', cax max oc Satanás yin, axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A tzet max a nabalnej el oneni, chic'al ala', cax chak'on yun yin ayman, ẍi bay.

English: but no one at the meal understood why Jesus said this to him.
Kanjobal: A eb chi low yin meẍa tu' yetok, c'am junok eb max nachaj el yuj, tzet yuj xan caytu' chi yal bay.

English: Since Judas had charge of the money, some thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the Feast, or to give something to the poor.
Kanjobal: A Judas tu' c'ubom tumin yayji xol eb, yuj tu' xan ay mac max naoni, tol chi cheklaytok manon junok tzet yetal bay k'in tu', ma xin, a jabok tumin tu' chi cheklay toj yak' bay eb meba' naon eb.

English: As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.
Kanjobal: A Judas tu xin, max lajwic'al loon jab pan tu', max el xol eb, yet k'ekbintakilxa.

English: When he was gone, Jesus said, “Now is the Son of Man glorified and God is glorified in him.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max eltok Judas tu', max yalon Jesús axca ti': —A tinani', ok tx'oxk'abnelay elok, tol caw wal miman welapnok ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', cax ok in tx'oxk'abnej c'apax elok, tol miman yelapnok Dios.

English: If God is glorified in him, God will glorify the Son in himself, and will glorify him at once.
Kanjobal: Ta chin tx'oxk'abnej elok, tol miman yelapnok Dios, ok tx'oxk'abnej el Cham tol miman c'apax welapnok cax yin aymanil ok tx'ox Cham.

English: “My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so I tell you now: Where I am going, you cannot come.
Kanjobal: Ex in camc'ulnebil, txenxanej tiempoal ayin ec' e yetok. Axca max yun walon bay eb aj Judea, axca tu' chi yun walon c'apax ayex: Ok in e sayic'ok, palta majto je' e yapni bay ok in apnok tu'.

English: “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.
Kanjobal: Ay junxa ac' chekbanil ok walcan ayex tinani', tol che camc'ulnelej e ba junjun ex. Axca chex wut in camc'ulneni, cayokab tu' che yut e camc'ulnen c'apax e ba.

English: By this all men will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.”
Kanjobal: Ta che camc'ulnelej e ba junjun ex, ok yojtaknej el masanil eb anima, tol yel toni in cuywom ex, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Simon Peter asked him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus replied, “Where I am going, you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Simón Pedro tu' bay: —Mamin, ¿baytal ok ach tok xin? ẍi bay. —A bay ok in apnok, majto je' e toj wetok tinani'. C'ojanc'ulalto ok je' e toj wetok bay tu', ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Peter asked, “Lord, why can't I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”
Kanjobal: —Palta Mamin, ¿tzet xan c'am chi je' in toj etok yin ayman tinani xin? Caw bekan in c'ul wak'lay cam oj, ẍi Pedro tu' bay.

English: Then Jesus answered, “Will you really lay down your life for me? I tell you the truth, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times!
Kanjobal: —¿Yel mi bekan a c'ul ak'lay cam wuj? Wal yel chi wal ayach, oxelxa quin eon el en, cax ok ok' no caẍlan yet jun ak'bal ti', ok aloni tol mayin ojtakok, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “Do not let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God ; trust also in me.
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Manchak somchaj el e c'ul. Aek oc e c'ul yin Dios, cax che yaon c'apax oc e c'ul win.

English: In my Father's house are many rooms; if it were not so, I would have told you. I am going there to prepare a place for you.
Kanjobal: A bay yatut in Mam, xiwil lugar bay watx' chon cajayi. K'inalok ta c'am bay, mayalxam wal ayex. A tinani xin, toj in watx'nej e lugar bay ok ex apnok ocok.

English: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me that you also may be where I am.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok in watx'nen e lugar tu', cax ok in jay pax junelxa, axa ex ul wiontok wetok tu', yet watx' a bay ayin ec' tu', a tu' ok ex ayjok ec' wetok.

English: You know the way to the place where I am going.”
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', e yojtakxa bay chin toji, e yojtak c'apax beal bay chin toj tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don't know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Tomás bay axca ti': —Mamin, man jojtakok bay ok ach tok tu', ¿tzet ok jut jojtaknen el jun be tu'? ẍi.

English: Jesus answered, “I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A jun be chi wal ti', ayin toni. Asan in chi je' ex wiontok bay ayic' co Mam Dios. Ayin ton yelc'al tzet chi wala', cax ayin ton aj k'inalej in.

English: If you really knew me, you would know my Father as well. From now on, you do know him and have seen him.”
Kanjobal: Matawal chin e yojtaknej elok. Ta chin e yojtaknej elok, ok e yojtaknej c'apax el in Mam, a pax tinani' xin, e yojtakxa in Mam tu', yujtol toxa max e yil yin, ẍi bay eb.

English: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father and that will be enough for us.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Felipe bay axca ti': —Mamin, tx'ox a Mam tu' jila', cax k'okbilc'alnaj tu', ẍi.

English: Jesus answered: “Don't you know me, Philip, even after I have been among you such a long time? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Jesús bay axca ti': —Felipe, mimanxa tiempo ayin ec' e yetok. ¿Tom c'amto chojtaknej el mac in txel xin? A eb chin iloni, lanan yilon eb yin co Mam Dios. Yuj tu', ¿tzet yuj xan chal ayin: Tx'ox a Mam tu' jila', cachi?

English: Don't you believe that I am in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words I say to you are not just my own. Rather, it is the Father, living in me, who is doing his work.
Kanjobal: ¿Tom c'am chaoc yin a c'ul, tol ayin oc yin co Mam Dios, cax ay pax oc Cham win? A tzet chi wala', man yulok wet chi waloni, palta tol a co Mam Dios ayoc win tu', a' chi ak'on wunej.

English: Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me; or at least believe on the evidence of the miracles themselves.
Kanjobal: Aek oc yin e c'ul tol ayin oc yin co Mam Dios, cax ay pax oc win. Ta c'am che yaoc e c'ul win yuj tzet chi wal ti', aek oc e c'ul win yuj juntzan milagro chin tx'oxo'.

English: I tell you the truth, anyone who has faith in me will do what I have been doing. He will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac chin yaoc yin is c'ul, ok yun eb juntzan chi wunej. Toltax ay juntzan tzet ec'ban ok el yunen eb yintak juntzan ti', yujtol ok in paxaj bay ayic' co Mam Dios.

English: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Son may bring glory to the Father.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al tzet ok e k'an bay Dios yujtol wet ex, ok in watx'nej el ayex. Ok in watx'nej el ayin ti', tol C'ajol in Dios, yet watx' ok in tx'oxk'abnej elok, tol caw wal miman yelapnok co Mam Dios.

English: You may ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al tzet ok e k'an ayin yujtol wet ex, ok in watx'nej el ayex.

English: “If you love me, you will obey what I command.
Kanjobal: Ta chi camil e c'ul win, ikejek in chekbanil.

English: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Counselor to be with you forever–
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' ok in k'an bay co Mam Dios, cax ok chekontek junxa mac ok colwaj e yetok, a ton Yespíritu tol yel chi yala'. A' ok ayjokc'al ec' e yetok yin tojbalk'inal.

English: the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will be in you.
Kanjobal: A eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', maj je' chaon eb jun tu', yujtol c'am chi je' yilon oc eb yin, xan man yojtakok eb. A pax ayex ti xin, e yojtakxa Yespíritu tu', yujtol ayic' e yetok, a' ok ayjok ec' e yin.

English: I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', maj ex in bekcan e tx'oklil, ok in jay pax ayex junelxa.

English: Before long, the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.
Kanjobal: Txenxanej tiempo, catatu' bian, manxa ok in yil eb aj yulyibank'inal ti'. A pax ex ayex ti xin, ok in e yila'. Yujtol iquis inc'al yin tojbalk'inal, yuj tu' xan iquis ex c'apax yin tojbalk'inal.

English: On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual tu' ok nachaj el e yuj, tol ayin oc yin in Mam, cax ayoc Cham win. Ok nachaj c'apax el e yuj, tol ayex oc win, cax ayin pax oc e yin.

English: Whoever has my commands and obeys them, he is the one who loves me. He who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love him and show myself to him.”
Kanjobal: A mac chi aben in chekbanil, cax chi yiken paxok, a ton eb tu' chi camil c'ul win. A eb chi camil c'ul win, a ton in Mam ok camc'ulnen eb. Yetok c'apaxok, ok in camc'ulnej eb, cax ok in tx'oxon in ba bay eb, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “But, Lord, why do you intend to show yourself to us and not to the world?”
Kanjobal: Ay junxa mac chi yik c'apax Judas, manak Judas Iscariote, a' max alon bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, ¿tzet xan asan ayon ok a tx'ox a ba? ¿Tzet xan man ok a tx'ox a ba bay eb yet yulyibank'inal ti'? ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus replied, “If anyone loves me, he will obey my teaching. My Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham axca ti': —A mac chin camc'ulneni, chi yikej tzet chi wala'. Xan axa in Mam chi camc'ulnen pax eb, cax ok on cajay yetok eb.

English: He who does not love me will not obey my teaching. These words you hear are not my own; they belong to the Father who sent me.
Kanjobal: A pax eb c'am chin camc'ulneni, c'am chi yikej eb tzet chi wala'. A juntzan k'anej chi wal ayex ti', man wetok, yet co Mam Dios, Cham cheknejintek.

English: “All this I have spoken while still with you.
Kanjobal: Chi walcan juntzan ti' ayex, yak'ban wal tol ayinto ec' e yetok.

English: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and will remind you of everything I have said to you.
Kanjobal: A co Mam Dios ok chekontek Yespíritu ayex in q'uexelok. A' ok colwaj e yetok, ok ex cuy yin masanil tzet yetal. Ok jek e na jantak tzet albilcan ayex wuj.

English: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, chi wak'can junc'ulal ayex. A caw in junc'ulal chi wak'can ayex. Man axcaok junc'ulal chi yak' eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', man cayoktu' wet chi wak'can ayex. Manchak e yak' somchaj e c'ul, cax c'am chex xiwi.

English: “You heard me say, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.
Kanjobal: Toxa mayal wal e yabej, tol ok in paxok, palta ok in jay pax ayex. Ta yel wali chin e camc'ulnej, ta axca tu', moj wal chex tzaloji yet che yabeni tol ok in paxaj bay co Mam Dios, yujtol ec'ban Cham wintak.

English: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it does happen you will believe.
Kanjobal: Ayokto chi waloncan juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx', a yet ok yunen tzet chi wal ti', cax ok in e yaon wal oc yin e c'ul.

English: I will not speak with you much longer, for the prince of this world is coming. He has no hold on me,
Kanjobal: Manxa mimanok tzet chi walcan ayex, yujtol lanan jay nak yajaw yulyibank'inal ti'. A nak tu' c'am yalon yet win.

English: but the world must learn that I love the Father and that I do exactly what my Father has commanded me. “Come now; let us leave.
Kanjobal: Palta axcac'alta' tu' ok yunej, yet watx' ok yojtaknej el eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', tol ay in camc'ulal yin co Mam Dios cax chi wikej masanil is chekbanil max yak' ayin. A tinani xin, ajanek wanok, tonek, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Ayin chin is tx'ox jun acaw uva. Axa jun winak chi ilwi uva tu', a in Mam chi tx'oxtek.

English: He cuts off every branch in me that bears no fruit, while every branch that does bear fruit he prunes so that it will be even more fruitful.
Kanjobal: Ta ay an k'ablak c'am chi satni, a' ayoc yion elok. Ta ay an k'ablak watx' satni, a' ayoc yion el is takinal, yet watx' chi texac'al satni. Axca chi yut watx'nen el nak an tu', caytu' chi yut watx'nen el in Mam eb chi ayji oc win.

English: You are already clean because of the word I have spoken to you.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', toxa max watx'ji oc e nabal yuj juntzan cuybanilej albilcan ayex wuj ti'.

English: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me.
Kanjobal: Ayjanekc'al oc win. Ayinxa ok in ayjokc'al ec' e yin. Axca junok k'ab an chi el yin is txutxal, c'amxa chi je' satni, cay c'apax tu' che yunej, ta c'am chex ayjic'al ec' win.

English: “I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', axca txutxal uva, cayin tu'. Ayexxa xin, axca k'ablak ex. A mac ayc'al oc win, ayin c'apax oc yin, a jun tu' xiwil tzet watx' chi txecloj el yin axca junok te' xiwil sat chi yak'a'. Ta c'am in oc e yin, c'am jabok tzet chi je' e yuj e tx'oklil.

English: If anyone does not remain in me, he is like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.
Kanjobal: A pax eb c'am chi ayjic'al ec' win xin, lajan ok yun yeloc eb axca junok k'abej chi ilay el yin is txutxal; chi takajok, chi lajwi tu', chi wajlay ajok, cax chi tz'a'i.

English: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be given you.
Kanjobal: Ta chex ayjic'al ec' win, cax ayc'al oc e c'ul yin in k'anej, k'anek tzet chi yochej e c'ul, cax ok ak'lay ayex.

English: This is to my Father's glory, that you bear much fruit, showing yourselves to be my disciples.
Kanjobal: Ta xiwil tzet watx' chi txecloj el e yin, cayton tu' ok e yut e tx'oxk'abnen elok tol miman yelapnok in Mam. Cay c'apax tu' ok e yut e tx'oxk'abnen elok tol in cuywom ex.

English: “As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you. Now remain in my love.
Kanjobal: Axca chin yut camc'ulnen co Mam Dios, caytu' chex wut in camc'ulnen c'apaxok. Yuj tu' xan ayjanekc'al ec' yin in camc'ulal ti'.

English: If you obey my commands, you will remain in my love, just as I have obeyed my Father's commands and remain in his love.
Kanjobal: Ta che yikej in chekbanil, ok ex ayjokc'al ec' yin in camc'ulal ti', yujtol caytu' wak'on yetok in Mam; chi wikej is chekbanil, yuj tu' xan ayinc'al ec' yin is camc'ulal.

English: I have told you this so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.
Kanjobal: Chi walcan juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' axcaokab in tzaloji, cayokab tu' e tzaloj c'apaxok, cax chi tz'aknajxac'al el e tzalojc'ulal.

English: My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ay jun in chekbanil ok wak'can ayex, tol che camc'ulnelej e ba axca chex wut in camc'ulneni.

English: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok mac chi yak' ba cam yuj junok yamigo, c'am junokxa mac ec'ban is camc'ulal yintak jun mactxel tu'.

English: You are my friends if you do what I command.
Kanjobal: Ta che yikej in chekbanil, wamigo ex toni.

English: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master's business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.
Kanjobal: A tinani', chi wal ayex tol manxa mosejalok e yayji ayin, yujtol a junok mosejal, man yojtakok tzet chi yun is patrón. Palta a tinani', wamigo ex, yujtol masanilc'al tzet max yal in Mam ayin, maxc'al walil ayex.

English: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit–fruit that will last. Then the Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
Kanjobal: Mayexnak max quin e siq'uilok, palta tol ayin max ex in siq'uilok. Max waon oc e yopiso yin e yunenc'al wochwan, xan a tzet che yun tu' chi ayjic'al ec' yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu' xan jantakc'al tzet ok e k'an bay co Mam Dios ok yak' ayex yujtol wet ex.

English: This is my command: Love each other.
Kanjobal: A ton jun chekbanil ti' chi wak'can ayex, tol che camc'ulnelej e ba.

English: “If the world hates you, keep in mind that it hated me first.
Kanjobal: Ta chi chichon oc c'ul eb yet yulyibank'inal ti' e yin, ojtaknejek elok tol a win max babji chichonbi oc c'ul eb.

English: If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is, you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world. That is why the world hates you.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta yet ex yulyibank'inal ti' yetok eb, tekan chex camc'ulnej eb; palta mayexxa yetok yulyibank'inal ti', yujtol toxa max ex in siq'uil xol eb. Yuj tu' xan chi chichon oc c'ul eb e yin, yujtol manxa e yetbiok e ba yetok eb.

English: Remember the words I spoke to you: ‘No servant is greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also. If they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours also.
Kanjobal: Caw wal che natek jun k'anej max wal ayex ti': C'am junok mosejal ec'ban yintak is patrón, quin chi ayex. Axca max yun yoc eb ajc'ulal win, caytu' ok yun c'apax yoc eb ajc'ulal e yin. Ta max yikej eb tzet max wal ayin ti', ok yikej c'apax eb tzet ok e yala'.

English: They will treat you this way because of my name, for they do not know the One who sent me.
Kanjobal: Wujc'al ok e yab yail masanil juntzan ti' yuj eb, yujtol man yojtakok eb Cham cheknejintek.

English: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin. Now, however, they have no excuse for their sin.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta maj ul wal bay eb, c'am mi is mul eb, palta tinani', c'amxa bay watx' chi col ba eb yuj is mul.

English: He who hates me hates my Father as well.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a mac chi chichon oc c'ul win, chi chichon c'apax oc c'ul yin in Mam.

English: If I had not done among them what no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen these miracles, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.
Kanjobal: A juntzan milagro max in tx'ox xol eb, c'am junokxa chi je' yunen axca tu'. K'inalok ta c'am milagro tu' max in tx'oxo', c'am mi is mul eb. A pax tinani xin, caxc'al mi max yil eb juntzan tu', palta ac'ala'c'al chichon oc c'ul eb win c'al yin in Mam.

English: But this is to fulfill what is written in their Law: ‘They hated me without reason.’
Kanjobal: Palta cac'alta' tu' ok yun yunen el juntzan ti', yet watx' chi yun tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an ley bay chi tz'ak yaoc eb is c'ul, bay chi yal axca ti': Max chichon oc c'ul eb win, palta c'am in mul bay eb, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: “When the Counselor comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father, he will testify about me.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun ok tit bay co Mam Dios, a ton Cham Espíritu tol yel chi yala'. Ok jayok cax ok colwaj e yetok. Ok tok in chektek ayin ti'. A jun tu' ok yak' testigoal ba win.

English: And you also must testify, for you have been with me from the beginning.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' ex c'apaxok, ok e yak' c'apax e ba testigoal win, yujtol ayexc'al jun wetok yettaxc'al max el yich in mulnajil ti'.

English: “All this I have told you so that you will not go astray.
Kanjobal: Chi walcan juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' c'am chi somchaj el e c'ul.

English: They will put you out of the synagogue; in fact, a time is coming when anyone who kills you will think he is offering a service to God.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ok ex yuktej eltek eb jet israelal yul nail is culto eb. Toltax ok jay jun tiempoal tzanxac'al mac ok ex ak'on camok, a ok yut naon eb, tol a Dios lanan yak'on serbil eb.

English: They will do such things because they have not known the Father or me.
Kanjobal: Ok yun eb axca tu', yujtol man yojtakok eb in Mam, cax mayin yojtakok c'apax eb.

English: I have told you this, so that when the time comes you will remember that I warned you. I did not tell you this at first because I was with you.
Kanjobal: Chi walcan juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' a yet ok jay juntzan tiempoal tu', ok e natek tol albilcan ayex wuj. Maj wal juntzan ti' ayex yet yalantok, yujtol ayinto ec' e yetok yet tu'.

English: “Now I am going to him who sent me, yet none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
Kanjobal: Axa tinani xin, ok in pax bay Cham max in chekontek; palta c'am junok ex che k'anlej el ayin, bay ok in tok.

English: Because I have said these things, you are filled with grief.
Kanjobal: A ti' e yet, tol caw wal chex cusaj yuj juntzan chi wal ti'.

English: But I tell you the truth: It is for your good that I am going away. Unless I go away, the Counselor will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.
Kanjobal: Palta wal yel chi wal ayex, a yuj ok in tok, xan caw wal watx' e yet. Ta c'am chin toji, c'am chi jay jun t'inan colwaj e yetok tu', palta a yet ok in tok, ok in chektek Cham ayex.

English: When he comes, he will convict the world of guilt in regard to sin and righteousness and judgment:
Kanjobal: A yet ok jayok, ok yak' yojtaknej el eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', tol yobtakwom eb. Ok yak' yojtaknej el eb, tol watx'c'al max wut in ba, cax ok yak' c'apax yojtaknej el eb, tol ok beyc'ulnelay eb yuj Dios.

English: in regard to sin, because men do not believe in me;
Kanjobal: Ok yak' yojtaknej el eb tol yobtakwom eb, a ton yuj c'am chin yaoc eb yin is c'ul.

English: in regard to righteousness, because I am going to the Father, where you can see me no longer;
Kanjobal: Ok yak' yojtaknej el eb, tol watx'c'al max wut in ba, yujtol ok in pax bay ayic' co Mam Dios. C'amxa bay ok e yil win cayti'.

English: and in regard to judgment, because the prince of this world now stands condemned.
Kanjobal: Ok yak' c'apax yojtaknej el eb, tol ok beyc'ulnelay eb yuj Dios, yujtol mayal beyc'ulnelay jun yajaw bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: “I have much more to say to you, more than you can now bear.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al tzet yetal chi yochej in c'ul chi wal ayex, palta majto nachaj el e yuj tinani'.

English: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak on his own; he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is yet to come.
Kanjobal: A to yet ok jay Yespíritu Dios tol yel chi yala', catatu' ok nachaj el e yuj, yujtol man munilok ok yal yul yet. A masanil tzet ok al-lay bay, a ok yala'. Ok yal c'apax e yab tzet tolto ok jayok.

English: He will bring glory to me by taking from what is mine and making it known to you.
Kanjobal: A' ok tx'oxk'abnen elok, tol miman welapnok. Masanilc'al tzet ok wal bay, ok yal ayex.

English: All that belongs to the Father is mine. That is why I said the Spirit will take from what is mine and make it known to you.
Kanjobal: Wetc'al yayji masanilc'al tzet ay bay co Mam Dios. Yuj tu', chi wal ayex, masanilc'al tzet ok wal bay, ok yal ayex.

English: “In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me.”
Kanjobal: Junxanej bek che yil oc win, axa yet junxa bek manxa ok e yil win, palta ok in e yil yet cabej oxej, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Some of his disciples said to one another, “What does he mean by saying, ‘In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me,’ and ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon axca tu xin, axa c'oli yalubtanen jaywan eb is cuywom axca ti': —¿Tzetlaj chi yal elapnok juntzan chi yal ayon ti'? Ilab tol max yala': Yet jun bek manxa ok e yil win, a pax ato yet cabej oxej ok in e yila', ilab ẍi. Chi yalon c'apaxok: Yujtol ok in paxaj bay co Mam Dios, ẍi ayon.

English: They kept asking, “What does he mean by ‘a little while’? We don't understand what he is saying.”
Kanjobal: A jun chi yal, yet jun bek tu', ¿tzetlaj wal chi yal elapnok tinani'? Caw wal c'am chi nachaj el juj, tzet chi yala', ẍi eb.

English: Jesus saw that they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, “Are you asking one another what I meant when I said, ‘In a little while you will see me no more, and then after a little while you will see me’?
Kanjobal: Max yojtaknej el Jesús tol chi yochej eb chi k'anlej bay, tzet chi yal elapnok tzet max yal tu'. Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Mayal wal ayex: Yet junxa bek, manxa ok e yil win, a pax ato yet cabej oxej ok in e yila', quin chi ayex. ¿Tom a ton juntzan max wal ayex tu' che yalubtanej e xol?

English: I tell you the truth, you will weep and mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief will turn to joy.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, ok ex cusok, ok ex ok'ok, axa eb yet yulyibank'inal ti xin, ok tzaloj eb. Ok ex ton cusok, palta a jun e cusc'ulal tu', tzalojc'ulalxa ok yutaj ba.

English: A woman giving birth to a child has pain because her time has come; but when her baby is born she forgets the anguish because of her joy that a child is born into the world.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok ix ix tinani', lanan yalji yune'. Ya' ton chi yabej, yujtol lanan yec' ya', palta a yet mayal jay yune' tu', tok naanto yailal tu' yuj; a ti yet, caw wal chi tzaloji, yujtol mayal jay jun unin yuj bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: So with you: Now is your time of grief, but I will see you again and you will rejoice, and no one will take away your joy.
Kanjobal: Axca ton junok ix tu', caytu' ok e yunej. Chex ton cus tinani', palta a yet ok ex wilon yet junelxa tu', caw wal ok ex tzaloj pax ajok. Axa jun e tzalojc'ulal tu', c'am mac ok je' yion ec' ayex.

English: In that day you will no longer ask me anything. I tell you the truth, my Father will give you whatever you ask in my name.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual tu', c'amxa tzet ok e k'anlej el ayin. Wal yel chi wal ayex, masanilc'al tzet ok e k'an bay co Mam Dios, ok yak' ayex yujtol wet ex.

English: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, and your joy will be complete.
Kanjobal: A tinani', c'amto tzet che k'an bay Dios yin in bi. K'anek, ok e cha'. Ok ak'lay ayex, yet watx' ok tz'aknaj el e tzalojc'ulal.

English: “Though I have been speaking figuratively, a time is coming when I will no longer use this kind of language but will tell you plainly about my Father.
Kanjobal: Yin q'uexan abix max yun walon juntzan cuybanilej ti' ayex; palta ay jun tiempoal ok jayok tol manxa cayok tu' ok wut walon axca tu', yujtol tojolxa ok wut walon yabixal co Mam Dios ayex.

English: In that day you will ask in my name. I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf.
Kanjobal: A ton yet ok jay jun c'ual tu', ok e k'an tzet che yochej yujtol wet ex. Man lananok walon ayex, tol ayin ok in k'an tzetak yetal bay co Mam Dios e yuj.

English: No, the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
Kanjobal: Ilab tol acaw Cham chi camil c'ul e yin, yujtol chin e camc'ulnej, cax che yaon ton oc yin e c'ul tol a bay Cham titnak in.

English: I came from the Father and entered the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
Kanjobal: Yel, a bay co Mam Dios titnak in, cax max in jay bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Axa tinani xin, ok in bekcan yulyibank'inal ti', cax ok in paxaj bay ayic' Cham, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then Jesus' disciples said, “Now you are speaking clearly and without figures of speech.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb is cuywom tu' bay: —A tinani', watx'xa max ot alon ayon. Manxa q'uexan abixok max ot alon ayon axca yet junel.

English: Now we can see that you know all things and that you do not even need to have anyone ask you questions. This makes us believe that you came from God.”
Kanjobal: A tinani', jojtak tol ojtak masanil tzet yetal. Man yowalilok chi co k'anlej el ayach, cax ok alon ayon. Yuj tu' xan chi jaoc yin co c'ul tol a bay Dios titnak ach, ẍi eb bay.

English: “You believe at last!” Jesus answered.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Jesús bay eb axca ti': —¿Chimi e yaoc e c'ul win tinani'?

English: “But a time is coming, and has come, when you will be scattered, each to his own home. You will leave me all alone. Yet I am not alone, for my Father is with me.
Kanjobal: Palta lananxa jay tiempoal e saklemcantok. Tx'ok tx'okxac'al bay ok ex tojcan junjun ex. Axa in e bekoncan in tx'oklil tu'; palta man in tx'oklilok ok in canok, ayic' co Mam Dios wetok.

English: “I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.”
Kanjobal: Max wal masanil juntzan ti' ayex, yet watx' chex can yin junc'ulalil wuj. A bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok ton e yil yail, palta tec'bajek e ba, yujtol a eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', mayal can eb yalan wuj, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: After Jesus said this, he looked toward heaven and prayed: “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may glorify you.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan tu', max aj t'anan bay satcan. Axa yalon axca ti': Mamin, mayal jay tiempoal a tx'oxk'abnen elok, tol miman welapnok ayin a C'ajol in ti', cax ok in tx'oxk'abnen c'apax elok, tol caw wal miman elapnok,

English: For you granted him authority over all people that he might give eternal life to all those you have given him.
Kanjobal: yujtol ach ak'nej wikbej yiban masanil anima, yet watx' chi je' wak'on k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal bay eb max ak' ayin.

English: Now this is eternal life: that they may know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
Kanjobal: A k'inalej yin tojbalk'inal, chi yal elapnok tol chach yojtaknej el eb anima, ach jun c'otan acaw Dios, c'al in yojtaknen el eb, ayin Jesucristo in, tol chekbilintek oj.

English: I have brought you glory on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
Kanjobal: A yet ayin ec' bay yulyibank'inal ti', max in tx'oxk'abnej elok tol caw miman elapnok. A jun mulnajil ak'bilcan wun oj ti', mayal yi ba wuj.

English: And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.
Kanjobal: A yet manto esnelay aj yulyibank'inal ti', ayinxac'alta' ec' etok bay xol co watx'ilal. Axa tinani xin Mamin, cha' in paxaj etok bay xol co watx'ilal tu', axcac'alta' wayji ec' etok.

English: “I have revealed you to those whom you gave me out of the world. They were yours; you gave them to me and they have obeyed your word.
Kanjobal: A eb max a siq'uiltek xol eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', cax max ak'on eb ayin, max wak' yojtaknej el eb tzetbil wal yoc a nabal. A eb max ak' ayin tu', toc'alta' etc'alta' eb. Max yikej eb a k'anej.

English: Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.
Kanjobal: A tinani', masanilc'al tzet ak'bil oj ayin, yojtak eb tol a ayach max tita.

English: For I gave them the words you gave me and they accepted them. They knew with certainty that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
Kanjobal: A wal a k'anej ak'bil ayin tu', a maxc'al wal bay eb, cax max yaon oc eb yin c'ul. Yuj tu' xan yojtak eb tol yel toni a ayach max in tita. Chi yaoc eb yin c'ul, tol ach cheknejintek.

English: I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, for they are yours.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, chin txajli yuj eb. Axa eb yet yulyibank'inal ti xin, c'am chin txajli yuj eb. Asannej eb max ak' ayin, asan eb tu' chin txajli yuj, yujtol et-xa eb.

English: All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to me through them.
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al eb wet, et-xa c'apax eb. Ac'ala' c'apax eb et, wet-xa c'apax yayji eb etok. A ton eb tu' chi tx'oxk'abnen elok tol caw miman welapnok.

English: I will remain in the world no longer, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by the power of your name–the name you gave me–so that they may be one as we are one.
Kanjobal: Txenxanej tiempoal ayin ec' yulyibank'inal ti', axa in paxaj etok tu'. A pax eb ti xin, okto can eb jabokxa bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Mamin, caw wal watx' a nabal. Taynej eb yetok ekbej, a ton jun ekbej max ak' ayin, yet watx' junxanejokab nabal eb axca wak'on etok.

English: While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe by that name you gave me. None has been lost except the one doomed to destruction so that Scripture would be fulfilled.
Kanjobal: A yet ayin ec' yetok eb bay yulyibank'inal ti', max in taynej eb yetok ekbej max ak' ayin. Yuj tu xan c'am junok eb max c'ayilok, palta asannej nak t'inanc'alta' c'ayilok, yet watx' chi yun tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un.

English: “I am coming to you now, but I say these things while I am still in the world, so that they may have the full measure of my joy within them.
Kanjobal: Ok in pax ayach. Yak'ban wal ayinto ec' jabokxa bay yulyibank'inal ti', chi walcan juntzan ti', yet watx' axcaokab in tzaloj ti', cayokab tu' chi yun tzaloj aj eb yin sic'libil.

English: I have given them your word and the world has hated them, for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world.
Kanjobal: Mayal wal a k'anej bay eb, palta a eb anima yet yulyibank'inal ti', caw wal chi chichon oc c'ul eb yin eb, yujtol manxa yetok yulyibank'inal eb yetok eb. Axca in ton c'apaxok, mayin yetok yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.
Kanjobal: Man lananok walon ayach, tol cheil eb yulyibank'inal ti' yin aymanil, palta tol chin k'an ayach, tol cha taynej eb, yet watx' c'am eb chi etax el yuj nak yelxac'al yob.

English: They are not of the world, even as I am not of it.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' mayin yetok yulyibank'inal ti'. Ac'ala' c'apax eb, man yetok yulyibank'inal ti eb.

English: Sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.
Kanjobal: Cha pojcan el eb, yuj yoccan eb etok, yuj a k'anej tol yel chi yala'.

English: As you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.
Kanjobal: Axca max in ot a chekontek xol anima bay yulyibank'inal ti', axca ton tu' max wut in chekon c'apax tok eb xol anima tu'.

English: For them I sanctify myself, that they too may be truly sanctified.
Kanjobal: Yuj watx'ilok eb, xan chi wak' in ba ayach, yet watx' chi oc eb etok sic'libil.

English: “My prayer is not for them alone. I pray also for those who will believe in me through their message,
Kanjobal: Man asannejok yuj eb chin txajli; palta chin txajli c'apax yuj eb tolto ok yaoc c'ul win yuj tzetak ok yal eb in chekbej ti'.

English: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.
Kanjobal: Chin k'an ayach xin, tol junxanejokab chi yun nabal eb masanil. Mamin, junnej wayji etok, junnej c'apax ayji wetok. Matawal axca jayji ti', cayokab tu' chi yun eb, junxanej chi yun eb jetok. Axca tu xin, ok yaoc eb anima yet yulyibank'inal ti' yin c'ul, tol ach cheknejintek.

English: I have given them the glory that you gave me, that they may be one as we are one:
Kanjobal: A a watx'ilal ak'bilcan ayin, a max wak' bay eb, yet watx' junxanej chi yuncan nabal eb, axca wayji etok.

English: I in them and you in me. May they be brought to complete unity to let the world know that you sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', ay in oc yin eb, achxa, ayach oc win, yet watx' junxanej ok yun nabal eb. Catatu' ok nachaj el yuj eb anima bay yulyibank'inal ti', tol ach cheknejintek. Ok yil eb tol axca chin ot a camc'ulneni, axca tu' chot a camc'ulnen c'apax eb ti'.

English: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, and to see my glory, the glory you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.
Kanjobal: Mamin, a eb max ak' ayin tu', chi wochej tol a bay ok in ayjok ec'ok, a tu' chi ayji c'apax ec' eb wetok, yet watx' ok yil eb watx'ilal ak'bil oj ayin. Yujtol camc'ulnebil inxa oj yettax c'amto chi tz'unchaj yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: “Righteous Father, though the world does not know you, I know you, and they know that you have sent me.
Kanjobal: Mamin, tojol ton a nabal. A eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', man ach yojtakok eb. A pax in ayin ti', wojtak ach. Axa pax eb ti xin, yojtakxa eb, tol ach cheknejintek.

English: I have made you known to them, and will continue to make you known in order that the love you have for me may be in them and that I myself may be in them.”
Kanjobal: Ayin max wak' yojtaknej el eb tzetbil yoc a nabal. Toltax ok wak'c'al yojtaknej el eb, yet watx' axca chin ot a camc'ulneni, axcaokab tu' chot a camc'ulnen c'apax eb. Axa in cajayc'al ec' yin eb tu', ẍi Jesús bay co Mam Dios yin txaj.

English: When he had finished praying, Jesus left with his disciples and crossed the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was an olive grove, and he and his disciples went into it.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan ti', axa toj yetok eb is cuywom tu'. Max toj eb bay k'axepal jun a' aej chi yik Cedrón bay xol juntzan awbejal te'. A tu' max apni oc eb.

English: Now Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, because Jesus had often met there with his disciples.
Kanjobal: Axa Judas, nak t'inan yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab camich, yojtak nak jun lugar tu', yujtol xiwil el max bet Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay tu'.

English: So Judas came to the grove, guiding a detachment of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and Pharisees. They were carrying torches, lanterns and weapons.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max toj nak bay tu', yetok jun bulan soldado, c'al juntzan eb taynemal templo Dios max cheklaytok yuj eb yajawil eb sacerdote. Ajun eb fariseo max chekontok eb. Tzekbil oc candil eb c'al taj eb, yetbi c'apax oc eb mitx'k'abil owal, cax max apni oc eb.

English: Jesus, knowing all that was going to happen to him, went out and asked them, “Who is it you want?”
Kanjobal: A Jesús xin, yojtakxa jantak tzet t'inan jayoc yiban. Yuj tu' xan max eltek ul chaon eb max apni oc tu', max k'anlen bay eb axca ti': —¿Mactxel che saya'? ẍi bay eb.

English: “Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “I am he,” Jesus said. (And Judas the traitor was standing there with them.)
Kanjobal: A Jesús aj Nazaret, a' chi co saya', ẍi eb bay. —Ayin toni, ẍi Cham bay eb. Ajun Judas yetok eb, nak lanan yaon oc Cham yul k'ab camich.

English: When Jesus said, “I am he,” they drew back and fell to the ground.
Kanjobal: Max lajwic'al yalon Cham bay eb axca tu', max toj tecton eb yintak, axa toj pac'naj eb tu'.

English: Again he asked them, “Who is it you want?” And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen Cham bay eb junelxa: —¿Mac wal txel che say xin? ẍi pax bay eb. —A Jesús aj Nazaret, a' chi co saya', ẍi eb bay junelxa.

English: “I told you that I am he,” Jesus answered. “If you are looking for me, then let these men go.”
Kanjobal: —Palta mayal wal ayex tol ayin toni. Ta ayin chin e sayic'ok, bekekcan el eb ayic' wetok ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: This happened so that the words he had spoken would be fulfilled: “I have not lost one of those you gave me.”
Kanjobal: Axca ton tu' max uj xin, yet watx' chi yun tzet max yal Jesús yuj eb is cuywom, yet max yalon axca ti': A eb max ak' ayin, c'am junok eb max c'aycan elok, ẍi.

English: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear. (The servant's name was Malchus.)
Kanjobal: Axa yion ajtek Simón Pedro yespada yul tz'umal tu', max tzoc'on oc yin jun nak chi yik Malco, nak is moso cham sat sacerdote. Axa is txiquin nak bay is watx' max el yuj.

English: Jesus commanded Peter, “Put your sword away! Shall I not drink the cup the Father has given me?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay Pedro tu' axca ti': —A aytok espada yul tz'umal. ¿Chimi a na' tol man ok wak' in ba yul k'ab jun yailal chi bek in Mam wiban ti'? ẍi bay.

English: Then the detachment of soldiers with its commander and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus. They bound him
Kanjobal: Max mitx'lay Jesús yuj eb soldado, c'al yuj is comandanteal eb, yetok eb taynemal templo tu', cax max c'alon eb.

English: and brought him first to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, cax max yiontok eb bay yatut Anás, cham ni' Caifás. A Caifás tu', sat sacerdote yayji yet jun abil tu'.

English: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it would be good if one man died for the people.
Kanjobal: A' ton alnej bay eb aj Judea tu', tol yowalil chi cam junok mactxel q'uexelok masanil anima.

English: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. Because this disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the high priest's courtyard,
Kanjobal: A yet max yiontok eb Jesús, tzakan oc Simón Pedro yintak, yetok junxa cuywom Jesús. A jun cuywom tu', yojtak ba yetok cham sat sacerdote, yuj tu' xan max octok yetok Jesús bay yamak'il yatut cham.

English: but Peter had to wait outside at the door. The other disciple, who was known to the high priest, came back, spoke to the girl on duty there and brought Peter in.
Kanjobal: Axa pax Pedro xin, max cancan ti puerta. Axa jun cuywom Jesús max elol bay lecancan oc Pedro tu', cax max yalon bay ix makom ti na tu', tol chi octek Pedro tu' yetok eb.

English: “You are not one of his disciples, are you?” the girl at the door asked Peter. He replied, “I am not.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ix makom ti' na tu' bay Pedro tu' axca ti': —Ach ti', tekan is cuywom ach jun winak max mitx'lay ti', ẍi ix bay Pedro tu'. —C'amak. Mayin is cuywomok, ẍi, max tz'ak yalon bay ix.

English: It was cold, and the servants and officials stood around a fire they had made to keep warm. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', tiempoal wal sic. Yuj tu' xan max yaoc eb moso cham sat sacerdote, yetok eb taynemal templo is k'ak' yetok tzak'ak', max oc lecjab eb k'aẍnok. Axa yoc c'apax lecan Pedro k'aẍnok yetok eb tu'.

English: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.
Kanjobal: Axa cham sat sacerdote max k'anlen el bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Mactak txel eb a cuywom? ¿Tzetak cuybanilej chak' cuy eb? ẍi bay.

English: “I have spoken openly to the world,” Jesus replied. “I always taught in synagogues or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A juntzan in cuybej ti' max walil xol masanil eb anima. Masanilc'al tiempo chi walil yulak nail culto, c'al yul is templo Dios, c'al bayc'al chi wajbaj ba eb jet israelal masanil. C'am junok tzet yetal max wal yin ewantakil.

English: Why question me? Ask those who heard me. Surely they know what I said.”
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan a' ayin cha k'anlej? K'anlej bay eb max aben walon el tu'. Yalokab eb ayach, tzetak ẍi juntzan in cuybej tu'. Ilab tol yojtakxa eb tzetak max walilok, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: When Jesus said this, one of the officials nearby struck him in the face. “Is this the way you answer the high priest?” he demanded.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yalon juntzan tu', cax max tzak'laytok sat Jesús yuj jun nak taynem templo Dios ayic' bay tu', cax max yalon nak bay axca ti': —¿Tzet xan caytu' chot tak'wok a ba bay cham sat sacerdote? ẍi bay Jesús.

English: “If I said something wrong,” Jesus replied, “testify as to what is wrong. But if I spoke the truth, why did you strike me?”
Kanjobal: —Ta ay tzet yob max wal max abej, ala' tzet yetal yob max wal tu'; palta ta watx'c'al max wut k'anjab in ba bay, ¿tzet xan comonc'al chin a mak'a'? ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Then Annas sent him, still bound, to Caiaphas the high priest.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max yak'on Anás tu' yilaytok bay Caifás, a ton cham sat sacerdote. C'alanc'al yuj eb nak yet max yiontok eb.

English: As Simon Peter stood warming himself, he was asked, “You are not one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it, saying, “I am not.”
Kanjobal: Lecanc'al oc Pedro k'aẍnok ti k'ak', xan max yal eb bay: —Ach ti', tekan tol cuywom ach Jesús tu', ẍi eb bay. Axa yion el yin tu', max yalon axca ti': —C'amak, mayin is cuywomok, ẍi, max tz'ak yaloni.

English: One of the high priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him, “Didn't I see you with him in the olive grove?”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', ay jun is moso cham sat sacerdote, ayto yuj ba yetok nak tzoc'bil el txiquin yuj Pedro tu'. A nak max alon bay Pedro tu' axca ti': —Ach ti', ¿tom mayachnak max wil ec' yetok Jesús bay xolak juntzan te awbejal te'? ẍi bay Pedro tu'.

English: Again Peter denied it, and at that moment a rooster began to crow.
Kanjobal: Max yion pax el Pedro tu' yin junelxa. Max lajwic'al yalon axca tu', max ok'aj no caẍlan.

English: Then the Jews led Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. By now it was early morning, and to avoid ceremonial uncleanness the Jews did not enter the palace; they wanted to be able to eat the Passover.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbi aj xin, cax max yion eltek eb Jesús yul yatut Caifás tu', cax max yiontok eb bay is despacho cham yajaw, palta maj oc eb yajaw bay Judea yul despacho tu', talaj chi etaxtok eb yul sat ley, cax c'amxa chi je' low eb yet k'in Pascua chi jay tu'.

English: So Pilate came out to them and asked, “What charges are you bringing against this man?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max eltek cham yajaw chi yik Pilato bay ti' is despacho tu'. Axa k'anjab cham nan xol eb tu' axca ti': —¿Tzet is mul jun winak chi ul e yak' ayin ti'? ẍi.

English: “If he were not a criminal,” they replied, “we would not have handed him over to you.”
Kanjobal: —Ta man yobok jun winak ti', maj je' comonc'al ok jitek ayach, ẍi eb.

English: Pilate said, “Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.” “But we have no right to execute anyone,” the Jews objected.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Pilato axca ti': —Iektok nak ayex ti', cax beyc'ulnejek ayex ti' bay tu' yin atac'ala' yalon e ley, ẍi bay eb. —A ayon israel on ti', c'am jikbej jak'on cam junok mactxel, ẍi eb bay.

English: This happened so that the words Jesus had spoken indicating the kind of death he was going to die would be fulfilled.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun yelcan apnok tzet maxax yal Jesús yin tzetbil ok yun cami.

English: Pilate then went back inside the palace, summoned Jesus and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
Kanjobal: Axa paxoc Pilato tu' yul is despacho, cax max awtelay octok Jesús tu' yuj. Axa k'anlen el bay axca ti': —¿Tom ach ti' Reyal ach eb israel? ẍi bay.

English: “Is that your own idea,” Jesus asked, “or did others talk to you about me?”
Kanjobal: —¿Yulc'al mi et chi tita, xan cha k'anlej el jun ti' ayin, ma ay mac max alon ayach? ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “Am I a Jew?” Pilate replied. “It was your people and your chief priests who handed you over to me. What is it you have done?”
Kanjobal: —¿Tom israel in chela'? A eb et conob c'al eb yajawil eb sacerdote, a eb max ach ul aon oc yul in k'ab. ¿Tzet max a say a mulnanej? ẍi bay Jesús.

English: Jesus said, “My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jews. But now my kingdom is from another place.”
Kanjobal: —Ayin ti', manak bay yulyibank'inal ti' rey in. K'inalok ta a bay yulyibank'inal ti' rey in, chimi aj wan eb wak'omal serbil yin owal, yet watx' c'am chin alay oc yul k'ab eb yajaw bay Judea tu', palta man yetok yulyibank'inal ti' yayji wikbej, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “You are a king, then!” said Pilate. Jesus answered, “You are right in saying I am a king. In fact, for this reason I was born, and for this I came into the world, to testify to the truth. Everyone on the side of truth listens to me.”
Kanjobal: —¿Tom wal yel rey ach xin? ẍi Pilato tu' bay. —A toni, rey in ton axca alon ti'. Yuj wal tu' xan max in alji. Ayin ti', chin ulic' yulyibank'inal ti', yuj ul walon tzet yetal caw yel. Masanilc'al eb yikem bay k'anej yel, chi yacbaj eb txiquin bay tzet chi wala', ẍi Jesús.

English: “What is truth?” Pilate asked. With this he went out again to the Jews and said, “I find no basis for a charge against him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pilato tu' bay axca ti': —A… ¿tzet yetal jun yel chak' binaj tu'? ẍi Pilato bay Jesús. Max lajwi yalon axca tu xin, axa yel paxtek ti' is despacho bay ayic' eb aj Judea tu', axa yalon eltek xol eb tu' axca ti': —A jun winak ti', c'am jabok mul chi wila'.

English: But it is your custom for me to release to you one prisoner at the time of the Passover. Do you want me to release ‘the king of the Jews’?”
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun e ley, tol a yet junjun k'in Pascua ti', che k'an bekchaj junok preso yayji, cax chi bekchaji. Yuj tu xin, ¿c'am mi wal chi yal e c'ul tol a jun e reyal ayex israel ex ti' chin bekil tinani'? ẍi bay eb.

English: They shouted back, “No, not him! Give us Barabbas!” Now Barabbas had taken part in a rebellion.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max aj yaw eb masanil, max yalon eb axca ti': —A jun winak ti', c'am chi jochej. Aokab Barrabás chi bekchaji, ẍi eb bay. Palta a Barrabás tu' a ton junok eb yob is nabal.

English: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
Kanjobal: Max yiontok Pilato tu' Jesús, max toj yak'on mak'layok.

English: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head. They clothed him in a purple robe
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max paltx'onen seyay eb soldado tu' jun q'uix, cax max yaon ajtok eb yin is jolom is coronaok, axa yaon oc eb jun moradotak pichilej yin tu'.

English: and went up to him again and again, saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!” And they struck him in the face.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max apni oc eb is c'atan, cax max c'oli tz'akon yalon eb axca ti' bay: —Tzalojan ach Reyal eb israel, ẍi eb bay. Lajwi tu', max tzak'ontok eb sat.

English: Once more Pilate came out and said to the Jews, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max el pax ul Pilato ti' is despacho bay ayic' eb aj Judea tu', max yalon pax eltek nan xol eb axca ti': Ilabi, ti chi wiiltek e yila', cax che yojtaknen elok tol c'am jabok is mul chi wila', ẍi bay eb.

English: When Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe, Pilate said to them, “Here is the man!”
Kanjobal: Catatu bian, max eltek Jesús ti' despacho tu'. Ayajtok jun q'uix tu' is coronaok yuj eb. Ayoc an moradotak pichilej tu' yuj. Axa yalon eltek Pilato nan xol eb axca ti': —Tix nak winak ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: As soon as the chief priests and their officials saw him, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify!” But Pilate answered, “You take him and crucify him. As for me, I find no basis for a charge against him.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilon eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetokc'al eb taynemal templo tol chi elol ti' despacho tu', axa yaj bulnaj eb yalon yin ipejal axca ti': —¡Curusnelayokabi! ẍixac'al eb. Axa yalon Pilato tu' bay eb axca ti': —Iektok ayex ti', cax che curusnen tu' e tx'oklil; axa ayin ti' xin, c'am wal jabok is mul chi wila', ẍi bay eb.

English: The Jews insisted, “We have a law, and according to that law he must die, because he claimed to be the Son of God.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yalon pax eb bay axca ti': —Ayon ti' ay co ley, cax atac'ala' yalon co ley tu', tol moj chi cami, yujtol max yaloc ba C'ajolok Dios, ẍi eb bay.

English: When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid,
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Pilato axca tu', caw wal max xiwajok.

English: and he went back inside the palace. “Where do you come from?” he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max paxoc yul is despacho tu' junelxa, cax max k'anlen el bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Baytal ta' titnak ach xin? ẍi bay. Palta maj tak'wok Jesús bay.

English: “Do you refuse to speak to me?” Pilate said. “Don't you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan c'am chach tak'wi ayin? ¿Tom man ojtakok tol ay wikbej ach in curusneni, cax ay c'apax wikbej ach in bekon elok? ẍi bay.

English: Jesus answered, “You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Jesús bay axca ti': —Yujtol a Dios ak'nej ekbej ti', ta c'amak, tamwal ay jabok alon et win. Yuj tu xan, a jun max in aon oc yul a k'ab, ec'ban mul entak, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: From then on, Pilate tried to set Jesus free, but the Jews kept shouting, “If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar.”
Kanjobal: Xewc'al yaben Pilato axca tu xin, axa naon tu' tzetbil chi yut bekon el Jesús; palta axa eb aj Judea tu', max aj pax bulnaj eb yalon yin ipejal axca ti': —Ta cha bekilok, ajc'ul ach yin cham yajaw bay Roma chi yal tu'. A jun ti' max yaloc ba reyal, palta tzanc'al mac chi alon axca tu', ajc'ul oc yin cham yajaw bay Roma tu', ẍi eb bay.

English: When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge's seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic is Gabbatha).
Kanjobal: Lajwi yaben Pilato axca tu', axa yak'on yilay eltek Jesús bay ayic' tu'; lajwi tu', axa yay chotan bay chi beyc'ulnelay mul eb anima tu'. A jun lugar tu', Gabata bi yin hebreo, chi yal elapnok, latz'bil ay ch'en.

English: It was the day of Preparation of Passover Week, about the sixth hour. “Here is your king,” Pilate said to the Jews.
Kanjobal: A yet max ay chotan tu', toxa chi chumay c'u. T'inanxa yoc k'in Pascua, cax max yalon eltek nan xol eb aj Judea tu' axca ti': —Ilabi, tix e reyal ti', ẍi eltek bay eb.

English: But they shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!” “Shall I crucify your king?” Pilate asked. “We have no king but Caesar,” the chief priests answered.
