Kanjobal: Palta max aj pax yaw eb yin ipejal junelxa axca ti': —¡Camokabi! ¡Curusnelayokabi! ẍixac'al eb. —¿Tom ok in curusnej e reyal ti' chi yal tu'? ẍi bay eb. Cax max tak'witok eb yajawil eb sacerdote axca ti': —Ayon ti', asan cham yajaw bay Roma ayoc co yajawilok, cax c'am junokxa, ẍi eb.

English: Finally Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified. So the soldiers took charge of Jesus.
Kanjobal: Tay bian, max alayxac'al oc Jesús yul k'ab eb, yuj toj curusnen eb. Yuj tu xin, xan max ilaytok yuj eb soldado.

English: Carrying his own cross, he went out to the place of the Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha).
Kanjobal: Axa Jesús xin, toxac'al max jolomxic'nejtok is curusal, max ilaytok bay jun lugar chi yik Gólgota yin hebreo, tol chi yal elapnok: Bakil Jolomej.

English: Here they crucified him, and with him two others–one on each side and Jesus in the middle.
Kanjobal: A tu' max yaoc eb Jesús yin curus. Ay cawanxa mac max curusnelay c'apax yetok Cham, jun bay junjun tz'eyil Cham, xan a nan xol curusal eb tu' max curusnelay Cham.

English: Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross. It read: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Kanjobal: Axa yak'on Pilato tz'ibelay oc jay belan k'anej jolomtak is curusal tol max yal axca ti': A ton Jesús aj Nazaret ti', is Reyal eb israel, ẍi.

English: Many of the Jews read this sign, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Aramaic, Latin and Greek.
Kanjobal: Ti conob ay jun lugar bay max bet curusnelay tu'. Yuj tu' xan xiwil eb israel max ilon tzet chi yal jay belan k'anej ayoc jolomtak is curusal tu'. Tz'ibbil oc yin is ti' eb, c'al yin is ti' eb griego, c'al yin latín, a ton is ti' eb aj Roma.

English: The chief priests of the Jews protested to Pilate, “Do not write ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that this man claimed to be king of the Jews.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb yajawil eb sacerdote bay Pilato axca ti': —Matawal manak jun k'anej Reyal eb israel max ak' tz'ibelay oc jolomtak te curus tu'. Watx' mi caytu' max ot a tz'iben oc axca ti': A nak ti', max yaloc ba nak reyalok eb israel, mata cachi, ẍi eb bay.

English: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
Kanjobal: —A jay belan k'anej max wak' tz'ibelay oc ti', canokab axca tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes, dividing them into four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi curusnen eb soldado tu' Jesús xin, axa yion aj eb is pichil tu'. Max pojon ec' eb. Caneb max eloc an yuj eb, xan junjunc'al liman yet junjun eb, palta an jokan pichil chi yac'alta' oc xin, junnejc'al yayji an, cax c'am tz'isil an.

English: “Let's not tear it,” they said to one another. “Let's decide by lot who will get it.” This happened that the scripture might be fulfilled which said, “They divided my garments among them and cast lots for my clothing.” So this is what the soldiers did.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb axca ti': —A jun ti' bian, manchak co niq'uektok an, cax chi co pojon ec' an jin. Watx' mi ta chi jaoc suerte yin an, yalc'al mac chi ioncan an, ẍi eb. Axca ton ti' max yun yunen el tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un, bay chi yal axca ti': A in pichil max pojcan ec' eb yin, a yin in jokan pichil max yak' eb suerte, ẍican yul tx'an Un tu'. Yuj tu' xan caytu' max yut eb soldado tu'.

English: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
Kanjobal: A cawilal bay curusnebil Jesús, a tu' ayic' is txutx, cax ajun jun is nuej yetok, yetok c'apax María yistzil Cleofas, c'al ix María aj Magdala.

English: When Jesus saw his mother there, and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, “Dear woman, here is your son,”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jun is cuywom Jesús ayic' c'atan is txutx tu', jun cuywom caw wal camc'ulnebil yuj. Max tit t'annaj Jesús yin eb, cax max yalon bay is txutx tu' axca ti': —Txutx, a jun mac ayic' etok ti', axca one' chot a c'ul yin, ẍi bay.

English: and to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay jun is cuywom tu' axca ti': —A in txutx ti', axcaokab a txutx chot a c'ul yin, ẍi bay. Yuj tu xin, xan a jun is cuywom tu' max ioncantok xal txutxej tu' yetok bay yatut, cax max ayji ec' xal yintak.

English: Later, knowing that all was now completed, and so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said, “I am thirsty.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, yojtakxa Jesús, tol toxa chi yi ba masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan yin. Yuj tu' xan max yal axca ti': —Caw wal chi tak in ti', ẍi. Max yal axca tu', yuj yunen el tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: A jar of wine vinegar was there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a stalk of the hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus' lips.
Kanjobal: Ay jun vaso vinagre ay pax ec' bay tu', max laon aytok eb jun tzet pososi xol. Axa yaon oc eb chon jun te hisopo max yaon ajtok eb yin ti' Jesús.

English: When he had received the drink, Jesus said, “It is finished.” With that, he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
Kanjobal: Max xew tz'ubon elok, max yalon axca ti': —Mayal yi ba masanil, ẍi. Lajwi tu xin, axa yay nojnaj tu', cax max yaoncan oc yanimail yul k'ab Dios, axa cam tu'.

English: Now it was the day of Preparation, and the next day was to be a special Sabbath. Because the Jews did not want the bodies left on the crosses during the Sabbath, they asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken down.
Kanjobal: Yecalokxa k'in Pascua yet jun c'u tu', c'ual c'apax xewilal. A eb yajaw bay Judea, c'am chi yochej eb chi can is mimanil eb oxwan tu' yin curus, yujtol a jun c'u lananxa jay tu', caw wal miman yelapnok yul sat eb israel. Yuj tu' xan max toj eb k'anon bay Pilato, ta chi yak' mak'lay poj bakil sat penec eb, yet watx' ayman chi aytek is mimanil eb yin curus tu'.

English: The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan max toj eb soldado, cax max mak'on poj eb bakil sat penec eb curusnebil yetok Jesús.

English: But when they came to Jesus and found that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
Kanjobal: Palta axa yet max apni oc eb yin Jesús xin, max yilon eb tol camnakxa. Yuj tu' xan majxa mak' poj eb bakil sat penec Cham.

English: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced Jesus' side with a spear, bringing a sudden flow of blood and water.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun soldado max tekon ajtok lanza yin tz'eyil c'ul Cham. Ayman max eltek chic' c'al aej.

English: The man who saw it has given testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, and he testifies so that you also may believe.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', caw wal max wil juntzan ti', yuj tu' xan chi wak' in ba testigoal yin, yet watx' che yaoc yin e c'ul ayex ti'. A juntzan tzet chin tz'ibejcan ti', caw yel. Ayin ti', wojtak tol caw yel chi wala'.

English: These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: “Not one of his bones will be broken,”
Kanjobal: Yuj yunen el tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un, xan caytu' max uji, yujtol chi yal yul tx'an axca ti': C'am junok is bakil ok k'ajcantok, ẍi.

English: and, as another scripture says, “They will look on the one they have pierced.”
Kanjobal: Chi yalon c'apax junxa ti' yul tx'an Un tu': A eb max tekon Cham, ok yiloc eb yin, ẍi.

English: Later, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jews. With Pilate's permission, he came and took the body away.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak chi yik José, aj conob Arimatea. A jun winak tu', is cuywom Jesús, asan tol cuywom yin ewantakil, yujtol caw wal chi xiwi, ta chi yabaj eb yajaw bay Judea. A' max jayoc k'anon bay Pilato, yuj yion aytek mimanil Jesús yin curus, cax chi mukoni. Max ak'lay yuj Pilato tu'; yuj tu' xan max bet yiaytek, cax max yiontok.

English: He was accompanied by Nicodemus, the man who earlier had visited Jesus at night. Nicodemus brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about seventy-five pounds.
Kanjobal: Max jay c'apax oc Nicodemo bay tu', yetbi oc oxeb arroba juntzan suk'uk'i jab chi yik mirra, soman yetok junxa chi yik áloes. A jun Nicodemo ti', a ton betnak ec' k'anjab yetok Jesús yet ak'balil.

English: Taking Jesus' body, the two of them wrapped it, with the spices, in strips of linen. This was in accordance with Jewish burial customs.
Kanjobal: Max yion aj eb mimanil Jesús, cax chulon oc eb juntzan mimek k'ap yin, max yaon c'apax oc eb juntzan suk'uk'i jab tu' yin, yujtol caytu' yoc beybal eb israel tu' mukon is camnak.

English: At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one had ever been laid.
Kanjobal: A cawilal bay max curusnelay Jesús, ay juntzan awbejal te'. A xol tu', a tu' ay jun ch'en olbil yul. C'amto junok camnak maxax oclejtok yul jun ch'en tu'.

English: Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.
Kanjobal: Yujtol junxanej bek chaon el yich c'ual xewilal eb israel, yuj tu' xan a yul jun ch'en tu' max bet yacan octok eb mimanil Jesús, yujtol cawil ay bay max cam tu'.

English: On the third day a wedding took place at Cana in Galilee. Jesus' mother was there,
Kanjobal: Cabjial lajwi jun tu', max oc jun nupayil bay conob Caná, bay yul yet Galilea. Max bet txutx Jesús bay jun nupayil tu'.

English: and Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
Kanjobal: Max bet c'apax ec' Jesús yetok eb is cuywom, yujtol awtebil eb.

English: When the wine was gone, Jesus' mother said to him, “They have no more wine.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi aj vino, yuj tu' xan max yal is txutx Jesús tu' bay axca ti': —Mayal lajwi is vino eb, ẍi.

English: “Dear woman, why do you involve me?” Jesus replied, “My time has not yet come.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús: —Txutx, ¿tzet yuj xan a ayin chala'? C'amto chi ajapnok tiempoal in tx'oxon el wipal xol anima, ẍi bay.

English: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon is txutx tu' bay eb chi ak'wi serbil tu' axca ti': —Che yikejc'al masanil tzet ok yal Jesús ayex, ẍi bay eb.

English: Nearby stood six stone water jars, the kind used by the Jews for ceremonial washing, each holding from twenty to thirty gallons.
Kanjobal: Ay wakeb ch'en k'uchbal yetc'alta' aej ayic' bay tu'. Chi mi toj oyebok, ma wakebok moc aej yul junjun. Netal ya' eb yet chi tx'ajil eb is tzetak yetal axcata' beybalej.

English: Jesus said to the servants, “Fill the jars with water”; so they filled them to the brim.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb chi ak'wi serbil tu' axca ti': —Ak'ek noj juntzan net ti' yetok aej, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he told them, “Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet.” They did so,
Kanjobal: Axa yet max noji, max yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —A tinani xin, letxek ajtek jabok, cax che yak'on bay nak chi ilon lojal nupayil ti', ẍi bay eb. Axa yak'on eb bay nak tu'.

English: and the master of the banquet tasted the water that had been turned into wine. He did not realize where it had come from, though the servants who had drawn the water knew. Then he called the bridegroom aside
Kanjobal: A yet max yablen nak yuq'ueni, mayal oc vinoal. Maj yojtaknej el nak baytal max ca tit jun vino tu', axa eb chi ak'wi serbil tu', yojtak eb, yujtol a eb max letxon ajtek. Axa nak chi ilon lojal nupayil tu' max awten nak chi nupay tu'.

English: and said, “Everyone brings out the choice wine first and then the cheaper wine after the guests have had too much to drink; but you have saved the best till now.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay nak axca ti': —A is beybal anima, a vino watx' yuq'ui, a chi yak' eb uc'lay yin babelal. A yet mimanxa an chi yuc' eb, catatu' chi ilay eltek vino ay wal chi yal yuq'ui, palta achxa ti', max a yanejcan jun vino watx' yuq'ui, cax tzunanxa cheiltek uc'layok, ẍi nak chi ak'on cuenta masanil tu'.

English: This, the first of his miraculous signs, Jesus performed in Cana of Galilee. He thus revealed his glory, and his disciples put their faith in him.
Kanjobal: A bay conob Caná, yul yet Galilea, a tu' max tx'ox Jesús jun milagro ti'. Babel milagro jun max tx'ox ti'. Cayton tu' max yut tx'oxon elok tol miman is mayk'ak'al, cax max yaon oc eb is cuywom c'ul yin Cham.

English: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother and brothers and his disciples. There they stayed for a few days.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu', max toj Jesús bay conob Capernaum. Max toj is txutx, c'al eb yuẍtak c'al eb is cuywom yetok. Max ayji ec' eb jayeb c'u bay tu'.

English: When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover, Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Lananxa jay jun is k'in eb israel chi yik Pascua. Yuj tu' xan max toj Jesús bay Jerusalén.

English: In the temple courts he found men selling cattle, sheep and doves, and others sitting at tables exchanging money.
Kanjobal: A yet tu' max octok yul yamak'il templo Dios. Axa max yiloni, ay eb chi txonwi wacax. Ay eb chi txonwi calnel. Ay eb chi txonwi paloma. Ay eb xin, q'uexoj tumin chi yunej.

English: So he made a whip out of cords, and drove all from the temple area, both sheep and cattle; he scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon axca tu', max watx'nen jun tx'an yuj yoc mak'balok, max yukten eltek eb masanil yul yamak'il templo Dios, yetokc'al no calnel tu', c'al no wacax. Max mak'on el tiẍnaj is tumin eb q'uexom tumin tu' sat meẍa. Max tenon c'apax aj pac'labok meẍa eb.

English: To those who sold doves he said, “Get these out of here! How dare you turn my Father's house into a market!”
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon bay eb chi txonon no paloma tu' axca ti': —Iek el juntzan tz'iquin ti'. Manchak e yut yatut in Mam ti' txonbalil, ẍi bay eb.

English: His disciples remembered that it is written: “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
Kanjobal: Axa naontek eb is cuywom tu' tzet albilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan bay chi yal axca ti': Caw pitz'an oc in c'ul in ya'ilnen a templo, ẍi.

English: Then the Jews demanded of him, “What miraculous sign can you show us to prove your authority to do all this?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb yajaw bay Judea tu' bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Tzet milagroal junok cha tx'ox ayon, yet watx' chi jojtaknej elok tol ay alon et onen juntzan ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and I will raise it again in three days.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Ta che yak' lajwok jun templo Dios ti', yin cabjial chi aj pax wuj junelxa, ẍi bay eb.

English: The Jews replied, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and you are going to raise it in three days?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb yajaw tu' bay junelxa axca ti': —A jun templo Dios ti', 46 abilxa c'oli watx'nelayi. ¿Xin ta chi watx'ji yin cabjial oj ach ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: But the temple he had spoken of was his body.
Kanjobal: A templo Dios chi yaltek naon eb, palta titol a is mimanil chi yal paxok.

English: After he was raised from the dead, his disciples recalled what he had said. Then they believed the Scripture and the words that Jesus had spoken.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a yet max ictzonelay aj xol eb camnak, max naontek eb is cuywom tzet max yala', cax max yaon oc eb yin c'ul tzet tz'ib yayjican yul tx'an Un tu', c'al tzet max yal Jesús bay eb.

English: Now while he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many people saw the miraculous signs he was doing and believed in his name.
Kanjobal: A yet ayic' Jesús bay Jerusalén yuj k'in Pascua tu', xiwil mac max yaoc c'ul yin Cham, yujtol max yil eb juntzan milagro max tx'oxo'.

English: But Jesus would not entrust himself to them, for he knew all men.
Kanjobal: Palta maj yaoc Cham eb yipok c'ul, yujtol yojtakxa Cham nabal masanil anima.

English: He did not need man's testimony about man, for he knew what was in a man.
Kanjobal: Man yowalilok ay mac chi alon bay Cham yuj tzet chi na junok mactxel, yujtol yojtak tzet chi ec' yul co c'ul junjun on.

English: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.
Kanjobal: Axa yet ayto sakbi yet domingo xin, max toj María aj Magdala bay ayoctok mimanil Jesús. Axa yilon yet max apni, elnakxa makil ch'en ch'en tu'.

English: So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have put him!”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan, max yak' yanej meltzoji, max jayoc bay Simón Pedro. Ayic' Pedro yetok jun cuywom camc'ulnebil tu'. Max yalon ix bay eb axca ti': —Mayal wal ilay eltek mimanil Cham Jajawil bay max alaycan octok. ¿Baytal laj max ilaytok? ẍi bay eb.

English: So Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb.
Kanjobal: Max yabc'al Pedro yetok junxa cuywom tu xin, max toj eb yilon bay ch'en ch'en tu'.

English: Both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
Kanjobal: Yanej eb toj cawanil; palta max cancan Pedro tu' yuj junxa tu', xan a jun tu' max babji yapni yin aymanil.

English: He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but did not go in.
Kanjobal: Max octok t'anan yul ch'en ch'en tu'. Axa yiloni, asanxanej an k'ap max chul-lay oc yin, lanancanok. Maj octok jun cuywom tu' yul ch'en.

English: Then Simon Peter, who was behind him, arrived and went into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there,
Kanjobal: Tzakan yapni oc Simón Pedro tu' yintak. Max apnic'al ocok, max octok yul ch'en ch'en tu', axa max yiloni, asanxanej an k'ap tu' lanancan ayok,

English: as well as the burial cloth that had been around Jesus' head. The cloth was folded up by itself, separate from the linen.
Kanjobal: c'al an tx'ambalej max oc pixan yin jolom Jesús, chulancan ay an, cax najat ta c'otancantok an.

English: Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max octok junxa cuywom max babji yapni oc tu'. Ato yet max yilon axca tu', max yaon oc yin c'ul.

English: (They still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.)
Kanjobal: Puralto max yaoc eb yin c'ul tol yel max ictzonelay aj Jesús, yujtol c'amto chi nachaj el yuj eb tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, tol ok ictzonelay pax aj Jesús xol eb camnak.

English: Then the disciples went back to their homes,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max pax eb cuywom tu' bay yatut.

English: but Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb
Kanjobal: A pax María aj Magdala tu xin, max cancan c'atan jun ch'en tu'. Maj octok ix yul ch'en. Toc'al max octok t'anan ix yul, cax chi ok' ix.

English: and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus' body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.
Kanjobal: Axa max yiloni, ayoctok cawan ángel yul ch'en tu', caw wal sak is pichil eb. Chotan ay eb bay max ec'lej mimanil Jesús, jun bay jolomtak, c'al junxa bay yakantak.

English: They asked her, “Woman, why are you crying?” “They have taken my Lord away,” she said, “and I don't know where they have put him.”
Kanjobal: Cax max k'anlen eltek eb bay ix axca ti': —Ach ix, ¿tzet yuj xan chach ok'i? ẍi eltek eb. —Chin ok'i, yujtol max ilay bey is mimanil Cham Wajawil cayti'. ¿Baytal wal mi max ilaytok? ẍi ix bay eb.

English: At this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.
Kanjobal: Ato wal xew yalon ix axca tu', max meltzojtok acan ix yintak, axa yilontek ix, ayic' Jesús. Palta maj yojtaknej el ix, tatol a Cham.

English: “Woman,” he said, “why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?” Thinking he was the gardener, she said, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'anlej el bay ix axca ti': —Ach ix, ¿tzet yuj xan chach ok'i? ¿Mac cha sayic'ok? ẍi bay ix. A naon ix, tol a nak ilom awbejal te' lecan ec' bay tu'. Yuj tu' xan max yal ix bay axca ti': —Ach mamin, ta ach max ul eiltek mimanil Jesús, al wal ayin bay max bet ak'canok, cax chi toj wioni, ẍi ix bay.

English: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, “Rabboni!” (which means Teacher).
Kanjobal: —¡María! ẍi Jesús bay ix. Yuj tu' xan max meltzojtok acan ix bay. Axa k'anjab aj ix yin hebreo tu' axca ti': —Raboni, ẍi ix. Chi yal elapnok. Meẍtol.

English: Jesus said, “Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet returned to the Father. Go instead to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am returning to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay ix axca ti': —Manchak quin a mitx'a', yujtol manto in ajtok bay ayic' in Mam; palta asi', al bay eb wuẍtak, c'al bay eb wanab masanil, tol ok in paxaj bay ayic' in Mam. A in Mam, e Mam c'apax wetok. A in Diosal, e Diosal c'apax wetok, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them that he had said these things to her.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max toj María tu' yal bay eb cuywom Jesús axca ti': —Caw wal max wil yin Cham Jajawil, ẍi ix bay eb. Cax max yalon c'apax ix bay eb tzetak max yal Cham.

English: On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
Kanjobal: Ac'ala'c'al ton yet jun domingoal tu' yet k'ekbintakil, max wajbaj ba eb cuywom Jesús. Caw wal makaki yayji puertail te na bay wajan ec' eb tu', yuj xiwc'ulalil eb bay eb yajaw bay Judea. Axa yilontek eb, waanxa oc Jesús nan xol eb, cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Junc'ulalokab ayex, ẍi bay eb.

English: After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max tx'oxon yul is k'ab bay eb tu', c'al tz'eyil bay max toj ch'en lanza. Axa yet max yilon eb cuywom tu' tol a Cham Jajawil, caw wal max tzaloj aj eb sic'libil.

English: Again Jesus said, “Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb junelxa axca ti': —Junc'ulalokab ayex. Axca max quin yut chekontek co Mam Dios, caytu' chex wut in chekon c'apaxtok, ẍi bay eb.

English: And with that he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon juntzan ti', axa xuontok cak'ek' yiban eb tu', cax max yalon axca ti': —Chaekcan Cham Espíritu Santo.

English: If you forgive anyone his sins, they are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac che yak' tan is yobtakil, ok yak' c'apax tan Dios is yobtakil tu'. Ta ay mac c'am che yak' tan yobtakil xin, ok canc'alta' is yobtakil tu' yiban, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.
Kanjobal: Ay jun yetbeyom eb cuywom Jesús chi yik Tomás, cax chi al-lay c'apax Tioẍ yin. C'amic' yetok eb yet max ec' Jesús yilon eb.

English: So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe it.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb yet cuywomal tu' bay axca ti': —Ayon ti', max jil yin Cham Jajawil, ẍi eb bay. —Ta c'am chi wil yechel ch'en lawuẍ yul is k'ab wal ayin caw, cax c'am chin jektok yiximal in k'ab yul yolanil ch'en tu', c'al in jekontok in k'ab bay is tz'eyil, maj waoc yin in c'ul, ẍi.

English: A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
Kanjobal: Ukubixi wal tu', max wajban pax oc ba eb bay yul te na tu' junelxa. Ayxa ec' Tomás tu' yetok eb yet tu'. Caw wal makaki yayji puertail jun na tu', axa max yilontek eb, lecanxa oc Jesús nan xol eb. Max yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Junc'ulalokab ayex, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', axa yalon bay Tomás tu' axca ti': —Ilab in k'ab ti'. Jektok yiximal a k'ab yul yolanil ti', cax cha jekontok c'apax a k'ab bay yolanil tz'eyil in c'ul ti'. Manchakxa ak' cabc'ulal, palta aoc a c'ul win, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max yalon Tomás tu' bay axca ti': —Ach Wajawil, ach in Diosal, ẍi bay.

English: Then Jesus told him, “Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Tomás, max aoc a c'ul win yujtol max in ela'. A eb man yowalilok chin iloni, cax chi yaon oc eb c'ul win, yelxac'al watx' yet eb, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus did many other miraculous signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al milagro max el yunen Jesús satak eb is cuywom tu', palta maj tz'ibelaycan yabixal masanil yul jun libro ti'.

English: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
Kanjobal: Max tz'ibelaycan juntzan ti', yet watx' che yaoc yin e c'ul, tol a Jesús, a ton Cristo Cham C'ajol Dios. Ta cay tu' ok e yut e yaon oc yin e c'ul, ok e cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal bay.

English: Afterward Jesus appeared again to his disciples, by the Sea of Tiberias. It happened this way:
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max tx'oxon aj ba Jesús bay eb is cuywom junelxa, yet ayic' eb ti a' mar Tiberias. Tix max yut tx'oxon aj ba bay eb ti'.

English: Simon Peter, Thomas (called Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were together.
Kanjobal: Junejc'al ayic' Simón Pedro yetok Tomás, nak chi yik Tioẍ, c'al Natanael aj Caná yul yet Galilea. Ay c'apax ec' eb c'ajol Zebedeo, yetok cawanxa yet cuywomal eb.

English: “I'm going out to fish,” Simon Peter told them, and they said, “We'll go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Simón Pedro bay eb axca ti': —Ok in tok txaylok, ẍi bay eb. —Ok on tok etok, ẍi eb bay. Axa toj eb tu'. Max oc eb yul jun barco, palta a yet jun ak'bal tu', c'am junok txay max yi' eb.

English: Early in the morning, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa sakbi, ayic' Jesús ti a' mar tu', palta eb cuywom, c'amc'al chi yiltek eb ta a Cham ayic' ti a' tu'.

English: He called out to them, “Friends, haven't you any fish?” “No,” they answered.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ex wet conob, ¿ay xam no' chi ajtek e yuj? ẍitok bay eb. —C'am tzet, tamwal junok, ẍi eb bay.

English: He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.
Kanjobal: —K'okek aytok e txim bay e watx' k'ab. A tu' ok e yi' e txay tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb. Max yikej eb axca max yut yalon Jesús. Axa yet max yak'len eb tok'on ajtek is txim tu xin, majxa ajtek yuj yalil no txay tu', yujtol caw wal max noj sic'libil.

English: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” As soon as Simon Peter heard him say, “It is the Lord,” he wrapped his outer garment around him (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the water.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jun cuywom camc'ulnebil yuj Jesús bay Pedro axca ti': —A ton Cham Jajawil tu', ẍi bay. Max yabc'al Simón Pedro axca tu', axa yaon oc is pichil tu', yujtol asan yul is pichil ayocok. Axa k'okon el ba yul barco tu', cax max el ti a'.

English: The other disciples followed in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about a hundred yards.
Kanjobal: Caneb tom tx'anil yel juntzanxa eb cuywom yiban a' yul jun te yaliẍ barco, tok'bil oc is txim eb, nojnak yuj no txay tu'.

English: When they landed, they saw a fire of burning coals there with fish on it, and some bread.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max eltek eb, max yilon eb tol ay jun k'ak' ayoc ti a' tu' naba tzak'ak'. Batxantok jun txay yiban tzak'ak', ay c'apax jayeb ixim pan bay tu'.

English: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish you have just caught.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Iektek jayc'onok no txay max e mitx' tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: Simon Peter climbed aboard and dragged the net ashore. It was full of large fish, 153, but even with so many the net was not torn.
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok Simón Pedro yul barco tu'. Max tok'on el tx'an txim tu' tiel a'. Nojnak tx'an yuj mimek txay, 153 no' yin masanil. Ti pax wal xiwil no', palta maj nic'chajtok tx'an txim tu' yuj yalil no'.

English: Jesus said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” None of the disciples dared ask him, “Who are you?” They knew it was the Lord.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Sebaxek lowok, ẍi bay eb. C'am junok eb cuywom tu' max k'anlen el bay axca ti': ¿Mac ach txel xin? man ẍiok eb, yujtol yojtakxa eb tol a ton Cham Jajawil.

English: Jesus came, took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
Kanjobal: Axa jitzontek ba Jesús c'atan eb tu', max yion aj ixim pan tu', max c'oli pojon ec' xol eb, cax max pojon c'apax ec' no txay tu'.

English: This was now the third time Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.
Kanjobal: Yet-xa yoxelal tx'oxon aj ba Jesús bay eb is cuywom ti', yettaxc'al max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak.

English: When they had finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you truly love me more than these?” “Yes, Lord,” he said, “you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Feed my lambs.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max lajwi low eb, max yalon Jesús bay Simón Pedro axca ti': —Simón, c'ajol Jonás, chin k'anlej ayach, ¿yelxac'al mi chin a camc'ulnej yintak juntzan ti'? ẍi bay. —A ton Mamin. Ojtakxa tol chach in camc'ulnej, ẍi Pedro tu' bay. —Ta axca tu xin, axcaokab junok ilom yune' calnel, cayokab tu' chot a cuyon eb wet-xa, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Again Jesus said, “Simon son of John, do you truly love me?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Take care of my sheep.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon juntzan ti', max yalon junelxa axca ti' bay: —Simón, c'ajol Jonás, ¿chi mi in a camc'ulnej? ẍi. —A ton Mamin. Ojtakxa, tol chach in camc'ulnej, ẍi Pedro tu' bay. —Ta axca tu xin, axcaokab junok ilom calnel, cayokab tu' chot ak'on cuenta eb wet-xa, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: The third time he said to him, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said, “Lord, you know all things; you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Feed my sheep.
Kanjobal: Max yalon pax yet yoxelal axca ti': —Simón, c'ajol Jonás, ¿chi mi in a camc'ulnej? ẍi bay. Axa cusaj c'ul Pedro tu bian, yujtol yoxelalxa k'anlen Jesús bay, ta chi camil c'ul yin, xan max yal bay axca ti': —Mamin, ojtakxa ta' masanil. Ojtak tol chach in camc'ulnej, ẍi bay. —Ta axca wal alon tu', axcaokab junok ilom calnel, axcaokab tu' chot a cuyon eb wet-xa yayji.

English: I tell you the truth, when you were younger you dressed yourself and went where you wanted; but when you are old you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayach, a yet ach'ej achto, munilc'al chaoc a pichil, cax chach tojc'al bay chi yal a c'ul chach toji; palta axa yet ok ach ichambok, ok el jaan a k'ab, cax tx'okxa mac ok c'alon a nan, cax ok ach ilaytok bay man ok yal a c'ul, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Jesus said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. Then he said to him, “Follow me!”
Kanjobal: Max yal axca ti', yuj tzetbil ok yun cam Pedro tu', cax ok tx'oxk'abnen elok tol caw miman yelapnok Dios. Lajwi tu', max yalon c'apax bay axca ti': —Ocan tzakan wintak, ẍi bay.

English: Peter turned and saw that the disciple whom Jesus loved was following them. (This was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and had said, “Lord, who is going to betray you?”)
Kanjobal: Axa toj t'annaj Pedro tu' yintak, max yiloni, tol a jun cuywom camc'ulnebil yuj Jesús tzakan oc yintak eb. (A ton jun max jitzxac'al oc ba c'atan Jesús yet lanan low eb yet toxa ok mitx'lay Cham, cax max k'anlen el bay axca ti': Mamin, ¿mactxel ok ach aon oc yul k'ab camich? ẍi.)

English: When Peter saw him, he asked, “Lord, what about him?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Pedro jun cuywom tu', max k'anlen bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin, a jun chi jay ti', ¿tzet ok on pax cami? ẍi bay.

English: Jesus answered, “If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? You must follow me.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay axca ti': —Ta chi yal in c'ul tol iquistoc'al jun ti' yet ok in jay junelxa, c'am alon et yin. Asan tol chach tzakloj wintak ach ti', ẍi bay Pedro tu'.

English: Because of this, the rumor spread among the brothers that this disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say that he would not die; he only said, “If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max el k'umal xol eb creyente tol man ok cam jun cuywom tu'; palta c'am tzet max yal Jesús ta maj camok. Asan tol max yal axca ti': Ta chi yal in c'ul iquistoc'al yet ok in jay junelxa, c'am alon et yin, ẍi.

English: This is the disciple who testifies to these things and who wrote them down. We know that his testimony is true.
Kanjobal: A ton jun is cuywom ti' chi yak' testigoal ba yin juntzan ti', cax max tz'iben c'apax canok. Ayon ti', jojtak, tol caw wal yel juntzan max tz'ibejcan ti'.

English: Jesus did many other things as well. If every one of them were written down, I suppose that even the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al juntzanxa tzet yetal max el yunen Jesús. K'inalok ta junjunal max yun tz'ibelaycan yabixal, a chi wut in naoni, c'am mi chi yab yulyibank'inal ti' bay chi ayji tx'an un bay chi tz'ibelaycan yabixal tu'.

English: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a member of the Jewish ruling council.
Kanjobal: Ay jun fariseo chi yik Nicodemo, yajaw yayji nan xol eb yet israelal, c'al nan xol eb yet yajawilal.

English: He came to Jesus at night and said, “Rabbi, we know you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the miraculous signs you are doing if God were not with him.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun k'ekbintakil max ulic' bay Jesús, max yalon axca ti': —Meẍtol, a yuj juntzan milagro cha tx'oxo', xan jojtak tol a Dios cheknej achtek yuj con ul a cuyoni. C'am junok mactxel chi je' yuj juntzan milagro tu', ta c'am chi oc Dios yetok, ẍi bay.

English: In reply Jesus declared, “I tell you the truth, no one can see the kingdom of God unless he is born again. ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayach, a mac manchak alji yet cayelal, maj je' yoc yul k'ab Dios, ẍi bay.

English: “How can a man be born when he is old?” Nicodemus asked. “Surely he cannot enter a second time into his mother's womb to be born!”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Nicodemo tu' bay axca ti': —A junok icham animaxa, ¿tzet wal chi yun yalji yet is cayelal? Tok okto je' yoc yin is txutx junelxa, cax chi alji paxok, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, no one can enter the kingdom of God unless he is born of water and the Spirit.
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayach, a mac c'am chi alji yuj aej, c'al yuj Yespíritu Dios, maj je' yoc yul k'ab Dios.

English: Flesh gives birth to flesh, but the Spirit gives birth to spirit.
Kanjobal: A mac yin anima chi alji, naba animac'al toni, palta a eb chi alji yuj Yespíritu Dios, espíritu chi yun yeloc eb.

English: You should not be surprised at my saying, ‘You must be born again.’
Kanjobal: Manchak c'ayaj a c'ul yujtol chi wala' tol yowalil chex alji yin k'inalej chi tit bay satcan.

English: The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you cannot tell where it comes from or where it is going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit.”
Kanjobal: A cak'ek' tzanc'al bay chi ca toji. Chi jab yec' mayayok, palta man jojtakok bay chi ca tita, tamwal bay chi ca toji. Axca ton cak'ek' tu', cayton tu' eb chi alji yuj Yespíritu Dios, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “How can this be?” Nicodemus asked.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzetbil ok yun juntzan ti' xin? ẍi bay.

English: “You are Israel's teacher,” said Jesus, “and do you not understand these things?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —¿Tom manto ojtakok juntzan ti'? Palta sat meẍtol ach pax xol eb jet israelal.

English: I tell you the truth, we speak of what we know, and we testify to what we have seen, but still you people do not accept our testimony.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayach, a tzet jojtak on, a chi jala'. A tzet chi jil on, a chi jal c'apaxok, palta ayex ti', c'am che cha' pax e yab tzet chi jal ayex.

English: I have spoken to you of earthly things and you do not believe; how then will you believe if I speak of heavenly things?
Kanjobal: Ta c'am che cha' e yab tzet chi wal ayex yuj tzetak yetal ay yulyibank'inal ti', ¿tom ok e cha' c'apax e yabej ta a tzetak yetal ay bay satcan chi waltek ayex?

English: No one has ever gone into heaven except the one who came from heaven–the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: C'amto junok mactxel maxax betajtok satcan. Axa in xin, a tu' titnak in, yujtol Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail.

English: Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the desert, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,
Kanjobal: Palta axca max yut locban aj Moisés jun yechel labaj bay tz'inan tx'otx', cay c'apax tu' ok yun waj locanok.

English: that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life.
Kanjobal: Ok in aj locanok, yet watx' a masanil mactxel chin aon oc yin is c'ul ok cha' eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: “For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
Kanjobal: Xiwil camc'ulal Dios yin anima bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Yuj tu', caxc'al jun in ch'an c'otan ayin is C'ajol in ti', palta max quin yatek, yet watx' a masanil mac chin aon oc yin is c'ul, c'am chi c'aycan el is k'inal eb, palta a ti yet eb, tol chi yican eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', C'ajol in ton Dios. Man yujok ul wak'on low yin anima, xan max quin yatek bay yulyibank'inal ti', palta yuj ul in colon el eb.

English: Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already because he has not believed in the name of God's one and only Son.
Kanjobal: A mac chin aon oc yin c'ul, manxa ok tok bay yailal, palta a eb c'am chin aon oc yin c'ul xin, ayxa yailal yiban eb, yujtol maj yaoc eb c'ul win, asan in pax ch'an C'ajol in Dios.

English: This is the verdict: Light has come into the world, but men loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', max quin ayol yulyibank'inal ti', yuj ul wak'on sakk'inal bay eb anima, palta ay eb c'am chi ochen jun sakk'inal ti'. Yuj tu' xan okc'al cancan yailal yiban eb. Asan k'ekk'inal chi yochej eb, yujtol asan yobtakil chi el yunen eb.

English: Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that his deeds will be exposed.
Kanjobal: A masanil eb chi unen yobtakil, maj yochej eb jun sakk'inal ti'. C'am chi yal c'ul eb chi cha', yujtol chi xiw eb ta chi txecloj el juntzan tzet man watx'ok chi el yunen eb tu'.

English: But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen plainly that what he has done has been done through God.”
Kanjobal: Palta a eb chi iken axca wal yalon jun cuybej acaw wal yel, chi cha eb jun sakk'inal ti', yet watx' chi txecloj elok, tol ayoc Dios yetok eb yin tzet chi yunej, ẍi Jesús bay Nicodemo tu'.

English: After this, Jesus and his disciples went out into the Judean countryside, where he spent some time with them, and baptized.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max el Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay Jerusalén, max toj eb yul makbej Judea, axa yayji ec' Cham jayeb c'u yetok eb bay tu'. Axa yak'lay bautizar eb anima yuj eb cuywom tu'.

English: Now John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water, and people were constantly coming to be baptized.
Kanjobal: Chi ak'wi c'apax bautizar Juan bay jun lugar chi yik Enón, bay cawilal Salim, yujtol xiwil aej bay tu'. Chi jayc'al eb anima bay, cax chi ak'lay bautizar eb yuj.

English: (This was before John was put in prison.)
Kanjobal: Yet c'amto chi alay oc Juan tu' yul preso, cax max yunenc'al juntzan tu'.

English: An argument developed between some of John's disciples and a certain Jew over the matter of ceremonial washing.
Kanjobal: Ay jaywan eb is cuywom Juan max teyelej ba yetok eb yet israelal, yuj tzet chi yut watx'nen ba eb anima atac'ala' yalon ley.

English: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan–the one you testified about–well, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.”
Kanjobal: Xan, max bet yal eb axca ti' bay Juan: —Meẍtol, a jun ec'lejnak etok bay k'axepaltok a' Jordán, jun max al ayon, a Cham tu' lanan yak'on bautizar eb anima tinani'. Xiwil eb lanan yapni bay, ẍi eb bay Juan tu'.

English: To this John replied, “A man can receive only what is given him from heaven.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —C'am junok mactxel comonc'al chi oc yopiso, ta manak Dios chi ak'on bay.

English: You yourselves can testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ but am sent ahead of him.’
Kanjobal: Ayex ti' max e yab waloni, tol mayinnak Cristo in. Ayin ti', toc'al babel chekbilintek is satak.

English: The bride belongs to the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom waits and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok nupayil chi oc tinani', a nak chi nupayi, chi yi nak ix t'inanc'alta' yioni. A yamigo nak ayic' yetok, chi yechbanej yaben k'anjab nak chi nupay tu'; a yet chi yabeni, caw wal chi tzaloji. Cayton tu' in tzaloj tinani', yujtol lanan yapni eb anima bay Jesús.

English: He must become greater; I must become less.
Kanjobal: Yowalil a Jesús chi texac'al aj can yopiso, axa in xin, c'ojanc'ulal chi aycan tananok wopiso, ẍi Juan bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: “The one who comes from above is above all; the one who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks as one from the earth. The one who comes from heaven is above all.
Kanjobal: A jun aynaktek satcan, yajaw yayji yiban masanil anima. Axa ayon aj yulyibank'inal on ti', anima onc'al el co masanil. Asan yet yulyibank'inal ti' chi jala'. Palta jun aynaktek satcan tu xin, Yajaw yayji jiban co masanil.

English: He testifies to what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.
Kanjobal: A tzet abbil yuj, yetok tzet ilbil yuj, a' chi yala', palta c'am wal mac chi chaon pax aben bay.

English: The man who has accepted it has certified that God is truthful.
Kanjobal: Ta ay eb chi chaon yab bay Cham, chi yak' testigoal ba eb yin, tol caw wal yel chi yal Dios.

English: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without limit.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Cham tu', a Dios cheknejtek. Yuj tu' xan a k'anej Dios chi yala'. Tz'akaki chi yun yak'on Dios Yespíritu bay Cham.

English: The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.
Kanjobal: C'ajol co Mam Dios Cham, caw wal camc'ulnebil yuj. Yuj tu' xan, a is Mam tu' anej oc masanil tzet yetal yul is k'ab.

English: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life, but whoever rejects the Son will not see life, for God's wrath remains on him.”
Kanjobal: A mac chi yaoc c'ul yin Cham C'ajol Dios tu', ay is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Palta a mac c'am chi yaoc c'ul yin Cham xin, maj cha eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A ti yet eb, tol aytek yowal c'ul Dios yiban eb.

English: The Pharisees heard that Jesus was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John,
Kanjobal: Max yaben aj eb fariseo k'umal tol ec'banxa bisil eb cuywom Jesús yintak eb yet Juan. Ec'ban c'apax eb max yak' bautizar.

English: although in fact it was not Jesus who baptized, but his disciples.
Kanjobal: Manak Jesús max ak'on bautizar eb, a eb is cuywom chi ak'wi bautizar.

English: When the Lord learned of this, he left Judea and went back once more to Galilee.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús tol max yabaj eb fariseo jun tu', max el bay Judea tu', cax max meltzoj bay Galilea.

English: Now he had to go through Samaria.
Kanjobal: Yowalil a yul yet Samaria chi ec' yet chi toj tu'.

English: So he came to a town in Samaria called Sychar, near the plot of ground Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
Kanjobal: A yet ay wal ec' Jesús yul yet Samaria tu', max apni oc bay jun conob chi yik Sicar. A bay tu' ay jun tx'otx' ak'bilcan yuj Jacob bay jun is c'ajol chi yik José.

English: Jacob's well was there, and Jesus, tired as he was from the journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
Kanjobal: A tu' ay jun uc'bala' jotbilcan yuj Jacob. Chuman mi c'u max apni oc Jesús ti a' uc'bala' tu'. Yujtol c'unbinakxa yuj beyil, xan max ay chotan ti a' tu'.

English: When a Samaritan woman came to draw water, Jesus said to her, “Will you give me a drink?”
Kanjobal: Axa eb cuywom xin, max toj eb man jabok lobej yet is chuman bay jun conob cawilal jun uc'bala' tu'. A yet ay tok eb tu', max jayoc jun ix ix aj Samaria ul yion ajtek ya'. Axa yalon Jesús bay ix axca ti': —Ak' jabok a' aej ti' wuq'uej, ẍi bay ix.

English: (His disciples had gone into the town to buy food.) (His disciples had gone into the town to buy food.)
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ix bay axca ti': —¿Tzet chi yal tu' oj, tol aj Samaria in, ix in paxoj, axa ach ti' israel ach cha k'anon pax aej oc' ayin? ẍi ix bay. Caytu' max yut k'anjab ba ix bay, yujtol a eb israel c'am chi chalej ba yak'on eb yetok eb aj Samaria tu'.

English: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that asks you for a drink, you would have asked him and he would have given you living water.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa yalon Jesús bay ix axca ti': —Chin k'an jabok aej wuc' ayach, palta man ojtakok mac in txel. Man ojtakok c'apax tzet chi yochej c'ul Dios chi yak'a'. K'inalok ta ojtak, chi mi a k'an ayin, cax chi wak'on jun a' aej chi ak'on k'inalej ayach, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: “Sir,” the woman said, “you have nothing to draw with and the well is deep. Where can you get this living water?
Kanjobal: Max yalon ix axca ti': —Mamin anima, tok ay a net chak' ion ajtek a'. Caw wal najat ayaytok a'. ¿Baytal ay a' chi ak'on k'inalej chal tu xin?

English: Are you greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, as did also his sons and his flocks and herds?”
Kanjobal: A jichmam Jacob, a a' ti' max yuc' yetokc'al yuninal c'al no no' jobbil yuj. A yet max cami max can jun uc'bala' ti' ayon. Tokwal yelxac'al miman elapnok yintak Jacob tu', ẍi ix bay.

English: Jesus answered, “Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay ix axca ti': —Tzanc'al mac chi uq'uen jun aej ti', chi tit is takintial junelxa.

English: but whoever drinks the water I give him will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give him will become in him a spring of water welling up to eternal life.”
Kanjobal: Palta a eb chi uq'uen jun aej chi wak'a', c'amxa bak'in chi tit is takintial eb junelxa. Yujtol a jun aej chi wak' tu' chi el yakan a', cayc'al ti' yaj wornaj a' bay yanimail eb, cax chi yak'on a' k'inal eb yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water so that I won't get thirsty and have to keep coming here to draw water.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon ix bay tu': —Mamin, ak' a' aej chal tu' ayin, yet watx' c'amxa oxlajon bak'in chi tit in takintial, cax manxa yowalilok chi ul wi' wet bay jun uc'bala' ti', ẍi ix bay.

English: He told her, “Go, call your husband and come back.”
Kanjobal: —Asi', cax cheontek echamil, cax chex jay e cawanil cayti', ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: “I have no husband,” she replied. Jesus said to her, “You are right when you say you have no husband.
Kanjobal: —C'am wichamil, ẍi ix bay. —Yel ton chala', c'am echamil tinani'.

English: The fact is, you have had five husbands, and the man you now have is not your husband. What you have just said is quite true.”
Kanjobal: Owan echamil max ec'lej. A nak bay ayach ec' tinani', man ton echamilok nak. Yuj tu' xan yel ton chala' tol c'am echamil, ẍi bay ix.

English: “Sir,” the woman said, “I can see that you are a prophet.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yaben ix tzet max yal Jesús bay, max yalon ix bay Cham: —Mamin anima, chekbej ach Dios chi wila'.

English: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, but you Jews claim that the place where we must worship is in Jerusalem.”
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, ayon aj Samaria on ti', a bay jun witz ti' chi ul yal ba eb bay Dios. A pax ayex israel ex ti xin, atac'al bay Jerusalén yowalil chi toj e yiay e ba bay Dios e yala', ẍi ix.

English: Jesus declared, “Believe me, woman, a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay ix ix tu' axca ti': —Txo ix, chaab tzet ok wal ayach. Ay jun tiempoal ok jayok tol manxanak bay jun tzalan ti' ok ul e yiay e ba bay co Mam Dios. Tamwal yowalil ok exto tok c'apax bay Jerusalén tu'.

English: You Samaritans worship what you do not know; we worship what we do know, for salvation is from the Jews.
Kanjobal: A ayex aj Samaria ex ti', che yiay e ba bay Dios e yaloni, palta man e yojtakok pax Dios. A pax ayon israel on ti', caw wal jojtak co Diosal bay chi jal co ba. A co xol ok eltek jun Colwajwom.

English: Yet a time is coming and has now come when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for they are the kind of worshipers the Father seeks.
Kanjobal: Ay eb tol a bay co Mam Dios chi yal ba yin yel. Mayal jay tiempoal yion ay ba eb yetok yanimail c'al yin yel. Yujtol cayton tu' chi yochej co Mam Dios chi yun yion ay ba eb anima bay.

English: God is spirit, and his worshipers must worship in spirit and in truth.”
Kanjobal: A Dios, Espíritu toni; yuj tu xin, ta ay mac chi yal ba bay, yowalil chi yal ba eb yetok wal yanimail c'al yin yel, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: The woman said, “I know that Messiah” (called Christ) “is coming. When he comes, he will explain everything to us.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon ix bay: —Ayin ti', wojtak tol ay jun Cham Mesías, a ton Cham Cristo ok jayok. A yet ok jay Cham tu', jichanc'al ok yut yalon masanil tzet yetal ayon, ẍi ix bay.

English: Then Jesus declared, “I who speak to you am he.”
Kanjobal: —Tokwal macto txel; ayin ton lanan in k'anjab etok ti', ẍi bay ix.

English: Just then his disciples returned and were surprised to find him talking with a woman. But no one asked, “What do you want?” or “Why are you talking with her?”
Kanjobal: A wal lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan tu', axa jayoc eb is cuywom tu'. Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb yet max yilon eb tol chi k'anjab Jesús yetok jun ix ix, palta c'am junok eb max k'anlen el bay tzet chi yochej c'ul chi k'anlej el bay ix, ma tzet chi yal yetok ix.

English: Then, leaving her water jar, the woman went back to the town and said to the people,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max bekoncan ix is moc ti a' tu', cax toj ix yalon yab eb anima yul conob tu' axca ti':

English: “Come, see a man who told me everything I ever did. Could this be the Christ ?”
Kanjobal: —Ay jun winak, pilan yojtak masanil tzet chi el wuneni. Mayal yaltek masanil. Tonek wetok, tonek jila'. ¿Manmilajnak Cristo ti'? ẍi ix bay eb.

English: They came out of the town and made their way toward him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max toj eb aj conob tu' bet yilon bay ayic' Jesús.

English: Meanwhile his disciples urged him, “Rabbi, eat something.”
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi jayoc eb anima tu' bay Cham, max yalon eb is cuywom tu' bay axca ti': —Mamin, lowan jabok, ẍi eb bay.

English: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Ay in lobej, palta man e yojtakok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then his disciples said to each other, “Could someone have brought him food?”
Kanjobal: A yuj tzet max yal tu', xan max c'oli k'anlen ec' eb xol: —¿Xin ta ay mac max ul ak'oncan is lobej? ẍi eb.

English: “My food,” said Jesus, “is to do the will of him who sent me and to finish his work.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu': —Caw wal chi wochej chi wun tzet chi yochej c'ul Cham cheknejintek. Wochwan chin watx'nej el is mulnajil max yaoc yul in k'ab. A yet chi wunen jun tu', axca tol a' chi oc in lobejok.

English: Do you not say, ‘Four months more and then the harvest’? I tell you, open your eyes and look at the fields! They are ripe for harvest.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', canebto xajaw, catatu' chi oc jooj trigo e yaloni, palta ayin chi wal ayex: Ilabi, mayal jay tiempoal jolayi. A yuj eb tolto ok in chaonok, xan chi wal axca tu'.

English: Even now the reaper draws his wages, even now he harvests the crop for eternal life, so that the sower and the reaper may be glad together.
Kanjobal: Ay eb ec'nakxa mulnaj xol eb, axca mac chi tzicwi ay trigo. Ay c'apax eb chi mulnaj xol eb axca tol joom trigo eb, yet watx' chi cha' eb anima ti' jun k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A eb chi mulnaj tu', ok cha' eb paktzil jun is mulnajil tu', yet watx' jun lajanc'al ok yun tzaloj eb masanil.

English: Thus the saying ‘One sows and another reaps’ is true.
Kanjobal: Xan yel ton ta' chi yal jun k'anej: Tx'ok eb chi tzicon ay trigo, tx'ok c'apax eb chi joon aj ixim, ẍi.

English: I sent you to reap what you have not worked for. Others have done the hard work, and you have reaped the benefits of their labor.”
Kanjobal: Chex in chektok mulnaj xol anima axca junok joom trigo. Palta mayexnak babel mulnajwom ex xol eb. Tx'ok eb babel mulnajwom xol eb axca junok tzicom ay trigo. Ayex ti', axca tol toxac'al ok e jo' tzet awbil yuj eb tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Many of the Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman's testimony, “He told me everything I ever did.”
Kanjobal: A bay jun conob yul yet Samaria tu', xiwil eb max yaoc c'ul yin Jesús, yujtol max yal jun ix tu' xol eb axca ti': Pilan yojtak tzet chi el wuneni, max yal ayin masanil, ẍi ix bay eb.

English: So when the Samaritans came to him, they urged him to stay with them, and he stayed two days.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max yal eb ta chi el yin c'ul Jesús chi can yetok eb yul is conob tu'. Yuj tu' xan max ayji ec' cab c'ual yetok eb.

English: And because of his words many more became believers.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al mac max yaoc c'ul yin Cham yet max yaben eb tzet max yal Cham.

English: They said to the woman, “We no longer believe just because of what you said; now we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this man really is the Savior of the world.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb bay ix ix tu': —A yet babelal, a yuj tzet max al ayon, xan max jaoc co c'ul yin Jesús. Axa tinani xin, a wal caw Cham max alon ayon. Yuj tu' xan max co watx' anejxac'al oc co c'ul yin tinani', caw wal jojtakxa sic'libil, tol a Cham ti', wal yel, a ton co Colomal co masanil ayon cajan on bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi eb bay ix.

English: After the two days he left for Galilee.
Kanjobal: Lajwi yec' cab c'u bay Samaria tu', max toj Jesús bay Galilea.

English: (Now Jesus himself had pointed out that a prophet has no honor in his own country.)
Kanjobal: Yalnakxata' can yuj Cham, tol c'am yelapnok junok chekbej Dios yul sat eb yet conob.

English: When he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him. They had seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, for they also had been there.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni bay Galilea tu', caw wal tzalojc'ulal max yun chalay apnok yuj anima, yujtol a yet max betic' eb iloj k'in Pascua bay Jerusalén, a tu' max yil eb tol xiwil tzet max bet yun Cham bay tu'.

English: Once more he visited Cana in Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. And there was a certain royal official whose son lay sick at Capernaum.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc Jesús bay jun conob chi yik Caná, bay yul yet Galilea tu', bay max q'uexpoj oc a' aej yin vinoal yuj. Axa bay junxa conob chi yik Capernaum, ay jun cham yajaw caw wal ya'ay jun is c'ajol.

English: When this man heard that Jesus had arrived in Galilee from Judea, he went to him and begged him to come and heal his son, who was close to death.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham anima tu' tol a Jesús petoj bay Judea, max apni bay Galilea tu', max bet tewok bay Cham, tol chi toj Cham yetok bay yatut, yuj toj yak'on jay c'ul is c'ajol ya'ay tu', yujtol ijan chi el c'ul nak.

English: “Unless you people see miraculous signs and wonders,” Jesus told him, “you will never believe.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Jesús bay cham anima tu' axca ti': —Ta c'am che yil juntzan milagro, tol chi tx'oxon el wikbej, tok che yaoc e c'ul win, ẍi bay.

English: The royal official said, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham yajaw tu' bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin, ton wal wetok yin ayman, yak'ban iquisto jun in c'ajol tu', ẍi bay.

English: Jesus replied, “You may go. Your son will live.” The man took Jesus at his word and departed.
Kanjobal: —Paxan. A nak a c'ajol tu' ok jay c'ul nak, ẍi bay cham. Max yaoc cham yin c'ul tzet max yal Jesús bay, axa meltzoj bay yatut tu'.

English: While he was still on the way, his servants met him with the news that his boy was living.
Kanjobal: Yulxa be max chalej ba yetok eb is moso. Max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Mayal jay c'ul a c'ajol tu', ẍi eb bay.

English: When he inquired as to the time when his son got better, they said to him, “The fever left him yesterday at the seventh hour.”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen bay eb axca ti': —¿Jantak hora max oc waan yilya' tu'? ẍi bay eb. —Ewitax yet tz'eymoj c'u max sicbi jun k'ak' tu' yin, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then the father realized that this was the exact time at which Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live.” So he and all his household believed.
Kanjobal: Axa naontek cham tu', tol wal tz'eymoj c'apax c'u max yalon Jesús bay axca ti': A nak a c'ajol tu', ok jaycan c'ul, ẍi. Yuj tu' xan max yaoc cham c'ul yin Jesús, c'al yetok eb ay bay yul yatut.

English: This was the second miraculous sign that Jesus performed, having come from Judea to Galilee.
Kanjobal: A ton jun yet is cab milagro tx'oxbanil el is yikbej ti'. A yet petoj bay Judea yet max apni bay Galilea max yunen jun ti'.

English: Some time later, Jesus went up to Jerusalem for a feast of the Jews.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa toj Jesús bay Jerusalén tu', max toj yilon jun k'in eb yet israelal.

English: Now there is in Jerusalem near the Sheep Gate a pool, which in Aramaic is called Bethesda and which is surrounded by five covered colonnades.
Kanjobal: A bay Jerusalén tu', ay jun aej pean ajok, Betesda bi yin is ti' eb israel. A cawilal puertail bay chi oc no calnel, a tu' ay jun aej tu'. A bay tilak jun aej tu', ay oyeb lanchu c'am yichlak.

English: Here a great number of disabled people used to lie–the blind, the lame, the paralyzed.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb ya'ay telan octok yulak juntzan lanchu tu'. Ay eb c'am chi je' yilwi. Ay eb c'am chi je' beyi. Ay c'apax eb sicbinak el is mimanil.

English: One who was there had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' ayic' jun winak 38 abilxa tol ya'c'al ay.

English: When Jesus saw him lying there and learned that he had been in this condition for a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to get well?”
Kanjobal: Max yilon Jesús tol telan ay sat tx'otx', cax max yojtaknen elok tol najatilxa tiempo caytu' yayji nak, xan max k'anlej bay nak axca ti': —¿Chi mi ochej chi jaycan a c'ul? ẍi bay nak.

English: “Sir,” the invalid replied, “I have no one to help me into the pool when the water is stirred. While I am trying to get in, someone else goes down ahead of me.”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi nak tu': —Matawal chi je' Mamin, palta a yet chi bilaj sat a' aej ti', c'am mac chi ok' c'ul win quin yaon aytok yul a'. Junjun el a yet chi wak'len in toj yul a', tx'okc'al mac chi babji yaytok in satak, ẍi nak bay Cham.

English: Then Jesus said to him, “Get up! Pick up your mat and walk.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay nak axca ti': —Ajan wanok, iaj a wayub, beyan, ẍi Cham bay nak.

English: At once the man was cured; he picked up his mat and walked. The day on which this took place was a Sabbath,
Kanjobal: Ayman max jaycan c'ul jun winak tu'. Max yion aj is wayub, max c'oli beyi. Asan tol c'ual xewilal yet tu'.

English: and so the Jews said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath; the law forbids you to carry your mat.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ay jaywan eb yajaw bay Judea max alon bay nak max jaycan c'ul tu' axca ti': —A tinani', c'ual wal xewilal. Caw wal c'am leyal ekon bey a wayub ti', ẍi eb bay nak.

English: But he replied, “The man who made me well said to me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’ ”
Kanjobal: —A Cham max ak'on jaycan in c'ul, a max alon ayin axca ti': Iaj a wayub, beyan, ẍi ayin, ẍi nak bay eb.

English: So they asked him, “Who is this fellow who told you to pick it up and walk?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'anlej eb bay nak axca ti': —¿Mactxel jun max alon ayach tol cheaj a wayub tu' cax chach beyi? ẍi eb bay nak.

English: The man who was healed had no idea who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.
Kanjobal: Palta man yojtakok nak mactxel max ak'on jaycan c'ul tu'. Yujtol xiwil anima ayic' bay tu', xan maj yil nak bay max k'okc'ay ba Jesús xol anima.

English: Later Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “See, you are well again. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.”
Kanjobal: Ato yet junelxa, max yil-len el ba Jesús yetok nak yul templo Dios, cax max yalon bay nak axca ti': —Ilabi. A tinani' watx'xa a c'ul. Manchakxa on yobtakil, yet watx' c'amxa chi jay junok yailal yel miman eban, ẍi bay nak.

English: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
Kanjobal: Axa toj nak yalon bay eb yajaw tu', tol a Jesús max ak'on jaycan is c'ul.

English: So, because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jews persecuted him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, caw wal max oc eb ajc'ulal yin Jesús, yujtol a yet c'ual xewilal max yun jun tu'.

English: Jesus said to them, “My Father is always at his work to this very day, and I, too, am working.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Jesús bay eb aj Judea tu' axca ti': —A in Mam, c'am bay chi oc wanaj mulnaji, yuj tu' xan ac'ala' in mulnaj c'apax ayin ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: For this reason the Jews tried all the harder to kill him; not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon Jesús axca tu', max yochejxac'al eb max yak' camok, man asannejok yuj maj yikej c'ual xewilal, palta yuj c'apax max lajbaj ba yetok Dios, yet max yalon oc Dios is Mamok.

English: Jesus gave them this answer: “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing by himself; he can do only what he sees his Father doing, because whatever the Father does the Son also does.
Kanjobal: Max yalon pax Jesús bay eb axca ti': Wal yel chi wal ayex, ayin C'ajol Dios in ti', c'am tzet chi je' wunen in tx'oklil. Asan tzet chi wil watx'nen in Mam, asan chi wunej. Masanil tzet chi yun in Mam tu', chi wun c'apax ayin ti'.

English: For the Father loves the Son and shows him all he does. Yes, to your amazement he will show him even greater things than these.
Kanjobal: Chin camc'ulnelay yuj in Mam. Masanil tzet chi el yuneni, chi tx'ox ayin. Ayto wal juntzanxa tzet ok tx'ox ayin, ok c'ayaj e c'ul yet ok e yiloni.

English: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son gives life to whom he is pleased to give it.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a in Mam chi je' yak'on ictzoj aj eb camnak, cax chi yak'on k'inal eb. Cayin c'apax tu' ayin C'ajolej in ti'. Ta ay eb chi wochej chi wak' is k'inal, chi wak'a'.

English: Moreover, the Father judges no one, but has entrusted all judgment to the Son,
Kanjobal: A in Mam, c'am junok anima chi beyc'ulnej, palta ayin C'ajolej in ti', ayin max yak'can wopiso in beyc'ulnen eb masanil.

English: that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father, who sent him.
Kanjobal: Max yak'can in Mam wopiso yet watx' lajan welapnok yetok in Mam yul sat masanil anima. Ta ay mac c'am welapnok yul sat, c'am c'apax yelapnok in Mam yul sat, yujtol a cheknejintek.

English: “I tell you the truth, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be condemned; he has crossed over from death to life.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac chi aben in k'anej, cax chi yaon oc c'ul yin Cham cheknejintek, a ton eb chi yican is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Majxa tok eb bay yailal, yujtol mayal colchajcan el eb yul k'ab camich, cax max chaoncan eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: I tell you the truth, a time is coming and has now come when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God and those who hear will live.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a tinani' mayal jay tiempoal yaben eb camnak yaj waw ayin C'ajol in Dios ti'. A eb chi ikeni, a ton eb tu' ok cha' is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: For as the Father has life in himself, so he has granted the Son to have life in himself.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a in Mam iquisc'alta' yul yet. Max yak' c'apax can jun ikbej tu' ayin, tol ay wiquisal yul wet.

English: And he has given him authority to judge because he is the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Max yak' c'apax can wikbej in beyc'ulnen masanil anima, yujtol ayin ton Chekbilintek yuj Cham xol eb jet animail.

English: “Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice
Kanjobal: Manchak c'ayaj e c'ul yuj juntzan tzet chi wal ayex ti', yujtol ay jun tiempoal yet yajtok tu' ok yab eb mukanxa yaj waw.

English: and come out–those who have done good will rise to live, and those who have done evil will rise to be condemned.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan eb tu'. A eb watx' tzet max ec' yun bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok ictzonelay aj eb, axa chaon eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal tu'. Axa eb yob max ec' yut ba xin, ok ictzonelay c'apax aj eb, palta ok tokcan eb bay yailal yin junelnej.

English: By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear, and my judgment is just, for I seek not to please myself but him who sent me.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', c'am junok tzet yetal chi je' wunen yul wet. Axca chi yut yalon in Mam ayin, caytu' chi yun in beyc'ulnewi. Bayc'al ijan chi yun in beyc'ulnewi, yujtol manak tzet chi cha in c'ul chin saya', palta a tzet chi cha c'ul Cham cheknejintek, a ton in Mam.

English: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not valid.
Kanjobal: Ta ayinc'al chi wak' testigoal in ba, yet chi waloni tol ay wikbej, c'am yelapnok tzet chi wal tu'.

English: There is another who testifies in my favor, and I know that his testimony about me is valid.
Kanjobal: Palta ay wal junxa chi yak' ba testigoal yin wikbej. A jun tu', wojtak tol caw yel chi yala'.

English: “You have sent to John and he has testified to the truth.
Kanjobal: A yet max bet e yak' k'anlelay el bay Juan tzet yikbej, yelc'al tzet max yal win tu'.

English: Not that I accept human testimony; but I mention it that you may be saved.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' c'am chi waoc yipok in c'ul tzet chi yal anima win. Toc'al chin jek e na' tzet max yal Juan ayex, yet watx' chex colchaji.

English: John was a lamp that burned and gave light, and you chose for a time to enjoy his light.
Kanjobal: A Juan tu', lajan axca junok tzektebal ow chaw yakan, yuj tu', max ex tzaloj jayeb c'u yetok.

English: “I have testimony weightier than that of John. For the very work that the Father has given me to finish, and which I am doing, testifies that the Father has sent me.
Kanjobal: Palta ay wal tzet ec'ban yelapnok yintak is k'anej Juan tu'; a' chi tx'oxk'abnen el wikbej. Yujtol a juntzan tzet yetal chi yak' in Mam wunej, a chi wunej. Caytu' chi yun txecloj elok tol a in Mam tu' cheknejintek.

English: And the Father who sent me has himself testified concerning me. You have never heard his voice nor seen his form,
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, a in Mam, Cham cheknejintek tu', chi yak' ba testigoal win. Ayex ti', c'am junelok max e yab yoc yul nuk' k'anjabi. C'am bay max e yil yin junelok.

English: nor does his word dwell in you, for you do not believe the one he sent.
Kanjobal: Maj e yaoc is k'anej yin e c'ul, yujtol maj e yaoc e c'ul win, ayin chekbilintek yuj ti'.

English: You diligently study the Scriptures because you think that by them you possess eternal life. These are the Scriptures that testify about me,
Kanjobal: Yelc'ulal ton che cuy tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, yujtol a e naoni, tol a tu' ok ilchaj e k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, palta caxc'al chi yaltek tx'an Un tu' wabixal,

English: yet you refuse to come to me to have life.
Kanjobal: c'am chi yal e c'ul chex jay pax ayin yet che cha e k'inal tu'.

English: “I do not accept praise from men,
Kanjobal: C'am yelapnok yul in sat watx'ilal chi yal eb anima win.

English: but I know you. I know that you do not have the love of God in your hearts.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', wojtak e nabal, c'am che camc'ulnej Dios.

English: I have come in my Father's name, and you do not accept me; but if someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', a in Mam cheknejintek, palta c'am chin e cha'. Ta ay junokxa mactxel chi jay yul yet, a jun tu' bian, ok e cha'.

English: How can you believe if you accept praise from one another, yet make no effort to obtain the praise that comes from the only God ?
Kanjobal: Ayexc'al oc che mimannej e ba junjun ex, cax c'am che yochej chex mimanbilnelay yuj Cham Dios acaw yel, xan tokwal ok je' in e yaon oc yin e c'ul.

English: “But do not think I will accuse you before the Father. Your accuser is Moses, on whom your hopes are set.
Kanjobal: Manchak e na' tol ayin ok walaj e yobtakil bay in Mam. Ay junxa ok alon aj e yobtakil bay, a ton Moisés, cham che tz'ak e yaoc yipok e c'ul.

English: If you believed Moses, you would believe me, for he wrote about me.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta che yaoc yin e c'ul tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj Moisés tu', chi mi e yaoc e c'ul win, yujtol wabixal max tz'ibejcanok.

English: But since you do not believe what he wrote, how are you going to believe what I say?”
Kanjobal: Ilab c'am che yaoc yin e c'ul tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj tu', xan ¿tzet wal ok e yut e yaon oc yin e c'ul yin tzet chi wala'? ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Some time after this, Jesus crossed to the far shore of the Sea of Galilee (that is, the Sea of Tiberias),
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max toj Jesús bay junxa k'axepal a' mar Galilea. Chi yik c'apax a' mar tu' Tiberias.

English: and a great crowd of people followed him because they saw the miraculous signs he had performed on the sick.
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max oc tzakan yintak, yuj max yil eb juntzan milagro max tx'oxo', yet max yak'on jaycan c'ul eb ya'ay.

English: Then Jesus went up on a mountainside and sat down with his disciples.
Kanjobal: A Jesús max toj yetok eb is cuywom bay jun tzalan, cax max ay chotan yetok eb bay tu'.

English: The Jewish Passover Feast was near.
Kanjobal: Toxa chi jay tiempoal is k'in Pascua eb yet israelal yet tu'.

English: When Jesus looked up and saw a great crowd coming toward him, he said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread for these people to eat?”
Kanjobal: Axa max yilon Jesús xiwil anima chi jayoc bay. Yuj tu' max yal bay Felipe axca ti': —¿Baytal laj ok co man low juntzan anima ti'? ẍi bay.

English: He asked this only to test him, for he already had in mind what he was going to do.
Kanjobal: Palta toc'al max k'anlej axca tu', yet watx' chi yabej tzettax chi yal Felipe tu' bay, yujtol yojtakxa Cham tzet ok yutej.

English: Philip answered him, “Eight months' wages would not buy enough bread for each one to have a bite!”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi Felipe tu' bay axca ti': —Caxc'al mi ay 200 denariook loj ayic' juj, tok ok yab xol eb, cax chi yion eb masanil jab jabok yet, ẍi.

English: Another of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, spoke up,
Kanjobal: Palta ay junxa cuywom Jesús chi yik Andrés, yuẍtak ba yetok Simón Pedro, a' max alon bay Jesús axca ti':

English: “Here is a boy with five small barley loaves and two small fish, but how far will they go among so many?”
Kanjobal: —Ay jun nak unin ayic' co xol ti', ay oyeb is pan cebada nak ibil, yetok cac'on is yaliẍ txay, palta tokwal ok yab jab ti' xol masanil anima. Ilab caw wal xiwil eb, ẍi bay Jesús.

English: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” There was plenty of grass in that place, and the men sat down, about five thousand of them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu': —Alek bay eb anima tu', tol chi ay chotan eb masanil, ẍi bay eb. Max yiken eb yay chotanok. Ay mi oyebok mil winak. A jun lugar bay ayic' eb tu', ay yac'unal.

English: Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were seated as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish.
Kanjobal: Max chaon ec' Jesús ixim pan tu', cax max yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios yuj ixim. Max pojon ec' xol eb is cuywom tu', axa eb max ec' pojon xol eb max ay chotan tu'. Cay c'apax tu' max yut no txay, yalc'al jantak max yochej c'ul eb.

English: When they had all had enough to eat, he said to his disciples, “Gather the pieces that are left over. Let nothing be wasted.”
Kanjobal: A yet max xew low eb sic'libil, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu' axca ti': —Siq'uek aj masanil ixim bijquiltakil maxto cani, yet watx' c'am jabok ixim chi etaxi, ẍi bay eb.

English: So they gathered them and filled twelve baskets with the pieces of the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi ec' yion aj eb ixim, lajcawebto motx max nojcan yuj sobrail ixim oyeb pan cebada tu'.

English: After the people saw the miraculous sign that Jesus did, they began to say, “Surely this is the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
Kanjobal: Masanil eb anima tu' max ilon jun milagro max tx'ox Jesús, yuj tu' xan max yal eb: —A ton jun chekbej Dios ti' echbanebil jay juj bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi eb.

English: Jesus, knowing that they intended to come and make him king by force, withdrew again to a mountain by himself.
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Jesús tol chi yochej eb chi mitx'a', cax chi yak'on pural eb yaon oc is reyalok; yuj tu' max el xol eb, axa toj tx'oklil bay jun tzalan tu' junelxa.

English: When evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa k'ekbi, max toj eb cuywom Jesús ti a' mar.

English: where they got into a boat and set off across the lake for Capernaum. By now it was dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.
Kanjobal: Max oc eb yul barco, max t'inlonen ec'tok ba eb bay conob Capernaum bay ti a' mar tu'. Caw wal k'ektaninakxa yet max toj eb. A pax Jesús xin, c'amto chi jay bay eb.

English: A strong wind was blowing and the waters grew rough.
Kanjobal: Ipan bey eb yiban a' tu', cax max tit jun miman cak'ek' caw wal ow. Axa yaj pomnaj a' mar tu' yuj jun miman cak'ek' tu'.

English: When they had rowed three or three and a half miles, they saw Jesus approaching the boat, walking on the water; and they were terrified.
Kanjobal: Ayxam nanok is cab leguaxa bay ay eb, max yilontek eb tol ipan yapni oc Jesús yintak eb. Toc'al chi bey yiban a'. Yuj tu', caw wal max xiwaj eb.

English: But he said to them, “It is I; don't be afraid.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': —Ayin toni, manchak ex xiwi, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then they were willing to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the shore where they were heading.
Kanjobal: Catatu' yin masanc'ulalil max chaon octok eb Cham yul barco yetok. Ayman max ec' apnok eb k'axepal a' mar bay lanan toj eb tu'.

English: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the opposite shore of the lake realized that only one boat had been there, and that Jesus had not entered it with his disciples, but that they had gone away alone.
Kanjobal: Ayc'al ec' eb anima max ak'lay low tu' yin yewial bay junxa k'axepal ec' a' mar. Axa naontek eb tol junch'an te barco k'axpojnak ec'ok. Max yil eb tol asan ch'an eb cuywom Jesús max toj yul te', cax maj octok Jesús yetok eb.

English: Then some boats from Tiberias landed near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzan te barco max tit bay conob Tiberias, cax max jayoc te' cawilal jun lugar bay max lolay ixim pan yet max yak'on Cham Jajawil yuj diosalil yuj ixim.

English: Once the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum in search of Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axa yilontek ba eb anima tu', c'amxa ec' Jesús yetok eb is cuywom xol eb. Axa yoc eb yul juntzan barco tu', cax max toj eb sayon ec' Cham bay conob Capernaum.

English: When they found him on the other side of the lake, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ec'apnok eb anima tu' k'axepal ec' a' mar tu xin, max ilchaj oc Jesús yuj eb. Axa k'anlen eb bay tu' axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿bak'ini max ach jay cayti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, you are looking for me, not because you saw miraculous signs but because you ate the loaves and had your fill.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, asan yuj max noj e c'ul yuj max wak' pan e lo', xan chin ul e sayic'ok. Man yujok tol max e yil juntzan milagro max in tx'oxo'.

English: Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. On him God the Father has placed his seal of approval.”
Kanjobal: Manokabnak tzet chi co lo' che yaoc e nabal e sayoni, yujtol toc'al chi lajwi ayok. Ay wal junxa tzet yetal axca tzet chi co lo' tu', palta c'am bak'in chi lajwi. A chi ak'on e k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu' xan aokab jun tu' che yiajtek e c'ulok e sayoni. Ayin ok wak' jun tu' ayex, yujtol Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail; max in tx'oxk'abnej c'apax el co Mam Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then they asked him, “What must we do to do the works God requires?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen eb bay tu': —¿Tzet chi yun jiken jun tzet chi yochej c'ul Dios chi jun tu xin? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “The work of God is this: to believe in the one he has sent.”
Kanjobal: Tix chi yut yochen Dios che yun ti': Chi yochej tol che yaoc e c'ul win, yujtol Chekbilintek yuj, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: So they asked him, “What miraculous sign then will you give that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
Kanjobal: Lajwi yaben eb jun tu', max k'anlen pax eb bay junelxa axca ti': —¿Tzet wal milagroal junok cha tx'ox ayon xin, cax chi jaon oc co c'ul en? ¿Tzet chi je' oj?

English: Our forefathers ate the manna in the desert; as it is written: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, ay jun milagro ilbil yuj eb yet payxa, yet max loon eb maná bay tz'inan tx'otx', axca yalon tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok: A' anejtek satcanil loj yuj loon eb, ẍi tx'an Un tu', ẍi eb bay Jesús.
