English: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, it is not Moses who has given you the bread from heaven, but it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Jesús bay eb: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, manak Moisés ak'nej jun satcanil loj tu' bay eb, palta a in Mam, a' chi aontek jun acaw loj chi tit satcan tu'.

English: For the bread of God is he who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun loj chi wal tol chi yak' Dios ti', a bay satcan max aytek. Ay eb bay yulyibank'inal ti' ok cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal yuj, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “Sir,” they said, “from now on give us this bread.”
Kanjobal: —Mamin, ak'c'al jun loj tu' ayon masanil tiempo, ẍi eb bay Cham.

English: Then Jesus declared, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will never go hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Ayin ton ti' axca wal loj wayji, yujtol ak'om in k'inalej. A eb chi jay ayin, c'amxa oxlajon bak'in ok tit is wajil eb. A eb chin yaoc yin is c'ul, c'amxa chi tit c'apax takintial eb.

English: But as I told you, you have seen me and still you do not believe.
Kanjobal: Palta axca ta' max yun walon ayex, caxc'al chin e yila', tok yuj tu' che yaoc e c'ul win.

English: All that the Father gives me will come to me, and whoever comes to me I will never drive away.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb chi yak' co Mam Dios ayin, ok jayoc eb ayin. A eb chi jayoc ayin tu', c'am junok eb man ok in cha'.

English: For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of him who sent me.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' max in tit satcan yuj ul wunen yochwan Cham cheknejintek. Man yujok ul wunen wochwan yul wet, xan max in tita.

English: And this is the will of him who sent me, that I shall lose none of all that he has given me, but raise them up at the last day.
Kanjobal: A in Mam cheknejintek, chi yochej c'ul tol c'am junok mac xol eb chi yak' ayin ti', ok c'aycan elok. Chi yochej tol ayin ok wak' ictzoj aj eb yet lajub c'ual.

English: For my Father's will is that everyone who looks to the Son and believes in him shall have eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', C'ajol in Dios; yuj tu', a masanil mac chin iloni, ta chin yaoc eb yin is c'ul, chi yochej in Mam chi cha'can eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Yuj tu' xan ayin ok wak' ictzoj pax aj eb yet lajub c'ual tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At this the Jews began to grumble about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben aj eb aj Judea juntzan tu', yob max yal eb yin, yujtol max yal Jesús jun ti': Ayin ton axca loj wayji, cax a bay satcan max in aytek, ẍi bay eb.

English: They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max yal eb axca ti': —Palta a nak ti', a ton nak Jesús, nak c'ajol José. Jojtak is mam c'al is txutx nak. Palta lanannaj yalon paxok tol a bay satcan max aytek yaloni, ẍi eb aj Judea tu'.

English: “Stop grumbling among yourselves,” Jesus answered.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Manchak in e yalubtanej.

English: “No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up at the last day.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mac toc'al chi yak' jay ba ayin, ta manak in Mam cheknejintek chi ion jayok. A eb chi jay ayin tu', ok wak' ictzoj aj eb yet lajub c'ual.

English: It is written in the Prophets: ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from him comes to me.
Kanjobal: Ay jun xol eb chekbej Dios tz'ibnejcan ay axca ti': Cax ok cuylay masanil anima yuj Dios, ẍicanok. Yuj tu', masanil mac chi yacbaj txiquin yaben tzet chi yal co Mam Dios, ta chi nachaj el yuj eb tzet chi yala', ok jay eb ayin.

English: No one has seen the Father except the one who is from God; only he has seen the Father.
Kanjobal: Man lananok waloni tatol ay junok mac max ilon yin co Mam Dios, palta ayin ti', a bay max in tita, cax asannej in wojtak yili.

English: I tell you the truth, he who believes has everlasting life.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac chin yaoc yin is c'ul, ay is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: I am the bread of life.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' axca tol loj in, yujtol ak'om in k'inalej.

English: Your forefathers ate the manna in the desert, yet they died.
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, lobil maná yuj eb bay tz'inan tx'otx', palta max cam eb masanil.

English: But here is the bread that comes down from heaven, which a man may eat and not die.
Kanjobal: A pax mac chi loon jun loj max aytek satcan tu xin, c'am oxlajon bak'in ok cam eb.

English: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ton max in aytek satcan tu', lajan in axca loj, yujtol ak'om in k'inalej. Yuj tu', a mac chi loon jun ti', iquisc'al eb yin tojbalk'inal. A jun lajan axca loj chi wak' lolay tu', a ton in chibejal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then the Jews began to argue sharply among themselves, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
Kanjobal: Axa teyelen aj ba eb aj Judea tu' yuj tzet max yal tu', cax chi yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet ok yut yak'on jun winak ti' is chibejal co chi' is naoni? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, ta c'am che chi' in chibejal ti', cax c'am che yuc' in chiq'uil ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', maj je' e chaon e k'inal.

English: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
Kanjobal: Palta tzanc'al mac ok chion in chibejal ti', cax ok yuq'uen c'apax in chiq'uil ti', ay is k'inal eb yin tojbalk'inal. Ayinc'al oc ok wak' ictzoj aj eb yet lajub c'ual.

English: For my flesh is real food and my blood is real drink.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a in chibejal ti', caw lajan axca loj, c'al in chiq'uil ti', lajan axca tzet chi uc'layi.

English: Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac ok chion in chibejal ti', cax ok yuq'uen c'apax in chiq'uil ti', chi ayjic'al ec' win, cax chin ayji c'apax ec' yin.

English: Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will live because of me.
Kanjobal: A co Mam Dios iquisc'al Cham yul yet, a Cham cheknejintek. Yuj Cham xan iquis in c'apaxok. Cay c'apax tu', a mac chi chion in chibejal ti', ok wak' is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: This is the bread that came down from heaven. Your forefathers ate manna and died, but he who feeds on this bread will live forever.”
Kanjobal: A jun axca loj max aytek satcan chi waltek ti', man lajanok axca maná, tol lobil yuj eb jichmam yet payxa. Mimanok tol max lo eb, palta ilab camnak pax eb. Palta a mac ok loon jun axca loj ti', ok cha eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: He said this while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
Kanjobal: A juntzan cuybanilej ti', a bay nail culto bay conob Capernaum, a tu' albil yuj.

English: On hearing it, many of his disciples said, “This is a hard teaching. Who can accept it?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb is cuywom juntzan k'anej tu', xiwil eb max alon axca ti': —Caw wal ya' yoc jun chi yal tu'. ¿Mac ok cha c'ul yabeni? ẍi eb.

English: Aware that his disciples were grumbling about this, Jesus said to them, “Does this offend you?
Kanjobal: Palta max yojtaknej el Jesús tzet yetal lanan yalon eb, yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —¿Tom chi somchaj el e nabal yuj juntzan k'anej chi wal ti'?

English: What if you see the Son of Man ascend to where he was before!
Kanjobal: Akxa tatol che yil in paxaj bay max in tita, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you are spirit and they are life.
Kanjobal: A Espíritu chi ak'on k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, axa co mimanil ti xin, c'amc'al bay chi oc tz'aanok. A juntzan k'anej chi wal ayex ti', wal yel yet Espíritu. Yuj tu' xan a chi je' yak'on e k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Yet there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus had known from the beginning which of them did not believe and who would betray him.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jaywan ex c'am chin e yaoc yin e c'ul, ẍi Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'. Caytu' max yut yalon Jesús bay eb axca tu', yujtol yojtakxa yet yichbanil mactak txel eb man t'inanok yaon oc c'ul yin. Yojtakxa c'apaxok mactxel jun t'inan yaon oc Cham yul k'ab camich.

English: He went on to say, “This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has enabled him.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax axca ti': —Yujtol ayex c'am che yaoc e c'ul win, yuj tu', max wal ayex, tol c'am junok mac toc'al chi yak' jay ba ayin, ta manak in Mam chi ion jayok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: From this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed him.
Kanjobal: Yettaxc'al tu xin, xiwil eb is cuywom tu' max meltzoj yintak junelxa. Majxac'al yal c'ul eb max tzakloj yintak Cham.

English: “You do not want to leave too, do you?” Jesus asked the Twelve.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max k'anlej Jesús bay eb lajcawan is chekbej axca ti': —¿A pax ex ayex ti', ma che yochej chex meltzoj e yintak c'apaxok? ẍi bay eb.

English: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
Kanjobal: Xan max tak'wi Simón Pedro tu' bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿mac wal junokxa ok on tok yetok? Yujtol a yin juntzan k'anej chal ayon ti', a tu' ay co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: We believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.”
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', toxa max ach jaoc yin co c'ul. Jojtak tol ach ti', Sic'bil ach el yuj Dios, ẍi Pedro bay.

English: Then Jesus replied, “Have I not chosen you, the Twelve? Yet one of you is a devil!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Ayex lajcawan ex ti', ayin max ex in sic'can elok, palta ay jun e xol tol chekbej diablo yayji, ẍi bay eb.

English: (He meant Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, who, though one of the Twelve, was later to betray him.)
Kanjobal: Yuj Judas c'ajol Simón Iscariote, xan cay tu' max yut yaloni, yujtol a Judas tu' t'inanc'alta' yalay oc Cham yul k'ab camich yuj, palta ti pax yet cuywomal ba yetok eb usluc'wanxa tu'.

English: After this, Jesus went around in Galilee, purposely staying away from Judea because the Jews there were waiting to take his life.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max c'oli yec'jab Jesús yulak yet Galilea; a pax yulak yet Judea xin, maj yal c'ul max eq'ui, yujtol a eb yajaw bay Judea tu', chi yochej eb chi yak' camok.

English: But when the Jewish Feast of Tabernacles was near,
Kanjobal: Palta c'uxanc'al tol lanan bey jay pax jun k'in eb israel chi yik k'inal Chinama.

English: Jesus' brothers said to him, “You ought to leave here and go to Judea, so that your disciples may see the miracles you do.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb yuẍtak Jesús bay axca ti': —Manchak ach ayji ec' cayti'. Asi' bay Judea, yet watx' chi yil c'apax eb a cuywom aj lugar bay tu' juntzan milagro cha tx'oxo'.

English: No one who wants to become a public figure acts in secret. Since you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok mac chi yochej c'ul chi ojtaknelay el yuj anima, manak bay ewantak chi yunej. Yuj tu', cayokab tu' chot a ba. Ta yel ay milagro chi el oneni, yowalil cha tx'oxil a ba satak anima, ẍi eb bay.

English: For even his own brothers did not believe in him.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max tz'ak yal eb yuẍtak tu' bay, toltax ajun eb c'am chi yaoc c'ul yin Cham.

English: Therefore Jesus told them, “The right time for me has not yet come; for you any time is right.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu' axca ti': —Manto c'ualok in tx'oxon el in ba. Axa ayex xin, tzanc'al mi tzet c'ual chi je' e naoni.

English: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me because I testify that what it does is evil.
Kanjobal: A eb e yet aj yulyibank'inal ti', c'am chi je' chichonbi oc c'ul eb e yin, palta ayin ti' chi chichonbi oc c'ul eb win, yujtol chin tx'oxocok tol yob tzet chi el yunen eb.

English: You go to the Feast. I am not yet going up to this Feast, because for me the right time has not yet come.”
Kanjobal: Asek e tx'oklil bay jun k'in tu' ayex ti'. Ayin ti', maj into tok, yujtol manto c'ualok in tx'oxon el in ba, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Having said this, he stayed in Galilee.
Kanjobal: Cax max canc'alta' bay Galilea tu' yet max lajwi yalon axca tu'.

English: However, after his brothers had left for the Feast, he went also, not publicly, but in secret.
Kanjobal: Axa yet mayal toj eb yuẍtak tu' bay jun k'in tu', max toj Jesús c'apaxok, palta yin ewantakil max yun yapni.

English: Now at the Feast the Jews were watching for him and asking, “Where is that man?”
Kanjobal: Caw wal max saylay ec' yuj eb yajaw bay Judea bay jun k'in tu': —¿Baytal laj ay jun winak tu'? ẍi eb, chi ec' eb.

English: Among the crowds there was widespread whispering about him. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others replied, “No, he deceives the people.”
Kanjobal: Xiwil tzet chi al-lay yin Cham xol anima. Ay eb chi aloni: Caw wal watx' jun winak ti', ẍi eb; palta ay pax eb chi aloni: C'amak, yob, chi ilay aytek sat eb anima yuj, ẍi eb.

English: But no one would say anything publicly about him for fear of the Jews.
Kanjobal: Ewantakil chi yal eb axca tu' yin sajwal tiejal, yujtol chi xiw eb, talaj chi yabaj eb yajaw bay Judea tu'.

English: Not until halfway through the Feast did Jesus go up to the temple courts and begin to teach.
Kanjobal: Nan wal ayoc jun k'in tu', cax max oc Jesús yul yamak'il templo Dios. Axa c'oli cuywaj xol anima tu'.

English: The Jews were amazed and asked, “How did this man get such learning without having studied?”
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb israel ayoctok yul tu' yabxalwi, cax max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet laj max yut yojtaknen el jun ti' juntzan chi yal ti', ti pax wal man cuywinakok? ẍixac'al eb.

English: Jesus answered, “My teaching is not my own. It comes from him who sent me.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —A juntzan cuybanilej chi wal ayex ti', man wetok, palta yet Cham max in chekontek.

English: If anyone chooses to do God's will, he will find out whether my teaching comes from God or whether I speak on my own.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi yal c'ul chi yun yochwan Dios, ok nachaj el yuj ta yet Dios juntzan cuybanilej chi wal ti', ma tol yulc'al wet chi waloni.

English: He who speaks on his own does so to gain honor for himself, but he who works for the honor of the one who sent him is a man of truth; there is nothing false about him.
Kanjobal: A mac tol yulc'al yet chi k'anjabi, chi yochej tol chi yi can ba, yet watx' mimanxac'al yelapnok naoni. Palta ayin ti', chi wochej tol a Cham max in chekontek, aokab Cham miman yelapnok yul e sat. Yuj tu' xan caw yel chi wala'. C'amc'al lek'tial chi wunej.

English: Has not Moses given you the law? Yet not one of you keeps the law. Why are you trying to kill me?”
Kanjobal: Ak'bilcan ley Dios ayex yuj Moisés, palta ilab c'am junok ex che yikej tzet chi yal jun ley tu'. ¿Tzet xan che yochej chin e yak' camok? ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “You are demon-possessed,” the crowd answered. “Who is trying to kill you?”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi eb anima bulan ec' tu' bay: —Ach ti' tekan ay junok espíritu yob ayoc en. ¿Mactxel junok chi ochen chach yak' cam tu' chela'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus said to them, “I did one miracle, and you are all astonished.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal pax bay eb: —Asan yuj jun tzet max el wunen yet c'ual xewilal, xan caw wal max c'ayaj e c'ul yuj.

English: Yet, because Moses gave you circumcision (though actually it did not come from Moses, but from the patriarchs), you circumcise a child on the Sabbath.
Kanjobal: Atax eb jichmam yet payxa, a eb inejcan el yich jun beybalej chi yik circuncisión. Axa Moisés alnejcanok tol yowalil chi co beybalnej jun tu'. Yuj tu', caxc'al c'ual xewilal, che yak' circuncidar eb unin chi alji.

English: Now if a child can be circumcised on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, why are you angry with me for healing the whole man on the Sabbath?
Kanjobal: Yet watx' c'am che ten tzet chi yal ley Moisés tu', xan che yak' circuncidar eb unin tu' yet c'ual xewilal. ¿Tzet yuj xan chi tit pax e yowal win, yuj max wak' jaycan c'ul nak winak tu' sic'libil yet c'ual xewilal?

English: Stop judging by mere appearances, and make a right judgment.”
Kanjobal: Manokab comonok chex beyc'ulnewi. Ta ay mac che beyc'ulnej, watx'okab che yut e beyc'ulneni, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At that point some of the people of Jerusalem began to ask, “Isn't this the man they are trying to kill?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ay jaywan eb aj Jerusalén max alon axca ti': —¿Manminak jun winak ti' chi saylay ec' yuj eb chi ochen chi ak'on camok?

English: Here he is, speaking publicly, and they are not saying a word to him. Have the authorities really concluded that he is the Christ ?
Kanjobal: Palta tix ayic' ti', lanan k'anjab co xol, c'amc'al tzet chi al-lay pax bay. ¿Chi mi na eb yajaw ti' tol a ton Cham Cristo?

English: But we know where this man is from; when the Christ comes, no one will know where he is from.”
Kanjobal: Palta man cayok tu' axca tu', yujtol yet ok jay Cham Cristo tu', c'am mac ojtaknen bay ok ca titocok, palta jun winak ti', jojtak baytal max ca tita, ẍi eb.

English: Then Jesus, still teaching in the temple courts, cried out, “Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. I am not here on my own, but he who sent me is true. You do not know him,
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús juntzan tu', lanan yak'on juntzan cuybanilej nan xol eb ayoctok yul yamak'il templo Dios, max yaliltek xol eb axca ti': —Yel toni, e yojtak in, cax e yojtak c'apax bay titnak in, palta man yulok wet max in jayi. A Cham acaw yel, a Cham max in chekontek, palta man e yojtakok Cham tu'.

English: but I know him because I am from him and he sent me.”
Kanjobal: A pax in xin, wojtak Cham, yujtol a tu' max in tita. A Cham cheknejintek, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At this they tried to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him, because his time had not yet come.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal yalon juntzan ti', ay eb max ochen max aon oc preso, palta c'am junok mac max oc lacnaj yin Cham, yujtol manto c'ualok cam Cham.

English: Still, many in the crowd put their faith in him. They said, “When the Christ comes, will he do more miraculous signs than this man?”
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb anima max yaoc c'ul yin, cax max yalon eb axca ti': —A yet ok jay Cham Cristo, ¿tom ec'ban milagro ok tx'ox yintak jun ti'? ẍi eb.

English: The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering such things about him. Then the chief priests and the Pharisees sent temple guards to arrest him.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb fariseo tzet chi yal eb anima yin Jesús, tol ajun eb yetok eb yajawil eb sacerdote, max chekontok eb policía taynemal templo, yuj toj tit Jesús preso yalon eb.

English: Jesus said, “I am with you for only a short time, and then I go to the one who sent me.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús axca ti': —Jayebxanej c'ual ayin ec' e yetok. Ok lajwok tu xin, ok in paxaj bay ay Cham max in chekontek.

English: You will look for me, but you will not find me; and where I am, you cannot come.”
Kanjobal: Ayex ti' okto in e sayic'ok, palta man ok inxa ilchaj e yuj, yujtol man ok je' e yapni bay ok in apnok tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: The Jews said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we cannot find him? Will he go where our people live scattered among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?
Kanjobal: Axa yalubtanen eb aj Judea tu' xol axca ti': —¿Baytal laj ok tok jun ti' xan chi yala' tol man ok ilchaj juj naoni? ¿A mi bay eb jet conob ayic' xol eb griego? Tekan chi yochej a tu' ok tok xol eb, cax chi toj cuywaj xol eb griego tu' naoni.

English: What did he mean when he said, ‘You will look for me, but you will not find me,’ and ‘Where I am, you cannot come’?”
Kanjobal: Ilab tol max yal ayon axca ti': Ayex ti', okto in e sayic'ok, palta man ok inxa ilchaj e yuj, yujtol man ok je' e yapni oc bay ok in apnok tu', ẍi ayon. ¿Tzet laj chi yal elapnok juntzan max yal ayon tu' tinani' xin? ẍi eb.

English: On the last and greatest day of the Feast, Jesus stood and said in a loud voice, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink.
Kanjobal: Axa jun c'ual yet lajub k'in, xiwil anima chi wajnaji. Yuj tu' xan ato yet lajub c'ual k'in tu' max aj wan Jesús nan xol eb, cax max yalon yin ipejal axca ti': —Ta ay ex ayex ti' caw wal che yochej Dios, axca tol ay e takintial yin, sebaxek ayin, cax che chaon tzet chi yochej e c'ul tu'.

English: Whoever believes in me, as the Scripture has said, streams of living water will flow from within him.”
Kanjobal: Ta ayex che yaoc e c'ul win, axca wal tol ay junok aej ok ajol nuk' yin e yanimail, cax ok el yakan. A ton jun tu' ok ak'on e k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, yujtol axca tu' yaloncan tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: By this he meant the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were later to receive. Up to that time the Spirit had not been given, since Jesus had not yet been glorified.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yalon axca tu', yujtol a eb chi yaoc c'ul yin Cham, chi cajbaj oc Cham Espíritu yin eb. A yet jun tiempoal tu', c'amto chi ak'lay Espíritu bay eb anima, yujtol manto paxaj Jesús bay satcan.

English: On hearing his words, some of the people said, “Surely this man is the Prophet.”
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yaben eb anima tu' tzet max yal Jesús, max yalon eb axca ti': —Wal yel, a ton jun chekbej Dios echbanebil jay juj ti', ẍi eb.

English: Others said, “He is the Christ.” Still others asked, “How can the Christ come from Galilee?
Kanjobal: Ay pax eb max aloni: —A jun ti', a ton Cham Cristo, ẍi eb. —A jun Cristo tu', ¿tom aj Galilea axca jun ti' che na'?

English: Does not the Scripture say that the Christ will come from David's family and from Bethlehem, the town where David lived?”
Kanjobal: Chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, tol a Cham Cristo tu', a bay conob Belén yowalil chi alji, bay ec'nak David yet payxa, yujtol yinatil David, ẍi juntzanxa eb tu'.

English: Thus the people were divided because of Jesus.
Kanjobal: Xan max teyelej ton aj ba eb anima tu' yujc'al Jesús.

English: Some wanted to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him.
Kanjobal: Ay jaywan eb max ochen max aon oc Cham preso, palta c'am junok mactxel max oc lacan yin Cham.

English: Finally the temple guards went back to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn't you bring him in?”
Kanjobal: Asan eb policía, eb taynemal templo Dios max apni oc tx'oklil bay eb fariseo, yetok bay eb yajawil eb sacerdote, tutun a eb tu' cheknej eb. Axa k'anlelay el bay eb tu': —¿Tzet yuj xan maj e yitek Jesús tu'? ẍi eb bay eb.

English: “No one ever spoke the way this man does,” the guards declared.
Kanjobal: —Yujtol c'am wal junok mac chi apni k'anjab axca jun tu', ẍi eb policía tu'.

English: “You mean he has deceived you also?” the Pharisees retorted.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb fariseo tu' bay eb axca ti': —¿Tom che yak' c'apax e ba etnelay ayex ti'?

English: “Has any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed in him?
Kanjobal: ¿Ay mi junok eb co yajawil ti' chi yaoc c'ul yin? Ac'ala' ayon fariseo on ti', c'am junok on chi jaoc co c'ul yin.

English: No! But this mob that knows nothing of the law–there is a curse on them.”
Kanjobal: Asan eb comon anima, eb man yojtakok jabok ley Moisés, asan eb chi yaoc c'ul yin, palta ay yowal c'ul Dios yiban eb tu', ẍi eb fariseo tu'.

English: Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus earlier and who was one of their own number, asked,
Kanjobal: Ay jun yet fariseoal eb tu' chi yik Nicodemo, jun betnak ec' k'anjab yetok Jesús yet yalantok. A jun tu' max alon bay eb axca ti':

English: “Does our law condemn anyone without first hearing him to find out what he is doing?”
Kanjobal: —A yalon co ley, tol c'am leyal chi jaoc yailal yiban junok mactxel, ta manchak jab bay tzet is mul, ẍi bay eb.

English: They replied, “Are you from Galilee, too? Look into it, and you will find that a prophet does not come out of Galilee.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal pax eb bay axca ti': —¿Tom aj Galilea ach yetok jun winak tu'? Il yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok; a tu' ok ela', tol c'am junok chekbej Dios chi tit bay Galilea, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then each went to his own home.
Kanjobal: Cax max paxcan junjun eb bay yatut.

English: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
Kanjobal: A pax Jesús xin, max tojcan bay tzalan Olivolak.

English: At dawn he appeared again in the temple courts, where all the people gathered around him, and he sat down to teach them.
Kanjobal: Ato yet max k'inibi aj yet junxa c'ual, max jay pax bay templo Dios junelxa. A yet max jay tu', masanil eb anima max jay c'atan. Max ay chotan Cham cuyon eb.

English: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought in a woman caught in adultery. They made her stand before the group
Kanjobal: Ay jun ix ix lanan wal mulji max michchaj elok, cax max yiontek eb fariseo c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés ix ix tu' satak Jesús, c'al satak eb ayic' abxalwok bay Cham.

English: and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of adultery.
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon eb bay Cham axca ti': —Meẍtol, a jun ix ti', lanan wal mulji yet max ilchaj elok.

English: In the Law Moses commanded us to stone such women. Now what do you say?”
Kanjobal: A ley Moisés chi aloni, tol a eb ix ix caytu' beybal axca ti', yowalil chi k'okch'ennelay cam eb. Axa ach ti', ¿tzet cachi? ẍi eb bay.

English: They were using this question as a trap, in order to have a basis for accusing him. But Jesus bent down and started to write on the ground with his finger.
Kanjobal: Palta toc'al max tz'ak k'anlej eb axca tu', yuj yak'lay porobal Cham yuj eb, yujtol max yochej eb chi yak' queja Cham. A Cham xin, toc'al max ay nojanok, cax max tz'ibli ay yetok yiximal k'ab sat tx'otx'.

English: When they kept on questioning him, he straightened up and said to them, “If any one of you is without sin, let him be the first to throw a stone at her.”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen wal el eb bay tu' axca ti': —¿Tzet wal chi yun jun ti xin? ẍi eb bay. Yuj tu', max aj wanok, cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ta ay junok ex c'am jabok e mul, aokab jun tu' chi babji k'okon oc ch'en ch'en yin ix, ẍi bay eb.

English: Again he stooped down and wrote on the ground.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon axca tu', max ay pax nojan junelxa, cax max tz'ibli ay junelxa sat tx'otx'.

English: At this, those who heard began to go away one at a time, the older ones first, until only Jesus was left, with the woman still standing there.
Kanjobal: A yet max xew yaben eb tzet max yal tu', max naon ba junjun eb, tol ay is mul eb. Yuj tu' xan junjunalxac'al max yun pax eb. A eb ichamtak winak max babji yeltok, cax tzakan yeltok eb ach'ej. Tx'oklilxac'al Jesús max can bay lecan oc ix ix tu'.

English: Jesus straightened up and asked her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one condemned you?”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max aj wan Jesús. Axa max yiloni, tx'oklilxac'al ix ix tu' lecancan ocok; max yalon bay ix axca ti': —Txo ix, ¿baytal ay eb chach ak'on queja tu'? ¿C'am mi junok eb max ak'on low en? ẍi bay ix.

English: “No one, sir,” she said. “Then neither do I condemn you,” Jesus declared. “Go now and leave your life of sin.”
Kanjobal: —C'amak Mamin, c'am junok, ẍi ix. —Tamwal in c'apaxok, maj wak' low en. Asi', manchakxa a say a mul junelxa, ẍi Jesús bay ix.))

English: When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús xol eb anima tu' axca ti': —Ayin ti', axca sakk'inal wayji xol eb jet animail bay yulyibank'inal ti'. A mac chi oc in cuywomok, ok wak' sakk'inal bay yanimail. Yuj jun sakk'inal tu', xan ok cha' eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Majxa ec'jab eb xol k'ekk'inal, ẍi Jesús.

English: The Pharisees challenged him, “Here you are, appearing as your own witness; your testimony is not valid.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb fariseo bay axca ti': —Ach ti', yulc'al et chaloni tol ay ekbej. Yuj tu' xan c'am yelapnok jab et chal tu', ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “Even if I testify on my own behalf, my testimony is valid, for I know where I came from and where I am going. But you have no idea where I come from or where I am going.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal pax Cham bay eb axca ti': —Caxc'al mi yulc'al wet chi waloni, tol ay wikbej; palta acaw yel chi wala', yujtol ayin ti' caw wal wojtak bay max in tita. Yetok c'apaxok, wojtak bay ok in tok. Ayex ti' man e yojtakok bay titnak in, tamwal bay ok in tok.

English: You judge by human standards; I pass judgment on no one.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti' toc'al che comon beyc'ulnej junok mactxel yin ayman. Ayin ti', c'am mac chin beyc'ulnej.

English: But if I do judge, my decisions are right, because I am not alone. I stand with the Father, who sent me.
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta ay mac chi wochej chin beyc'ulnej, bayc'al ijan chi wut in beyc'ulneni, yujtol man in tx'oklilok chin beyc'ulnewi. Ajun in Mam wetok, Cham cheknejintek.

English: In your own Law it is written that the testimony of two men is valid.
Kanjobal: A co ley ayic' yul co k'ab chi aloni, tatol ay cawanok testigo lajanc'al yaloni, yowalil chi co cha jab tzet chi yal eb.

English: I am one who testifies for myself; my other witness is the Father, who sent me.”
Kanjobal: Palta ilabi, ay cawan mac chi yak' ba testigoal win. Chi wak' in ba testigoal win; testigo c'apax in Mam wetok, Cham cheknejintek, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then they asked him, “Where is your father?” “You do not know me or my Father,” Jesus replied. “If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”
Kanjobal: —Palta, ¿baytal ay a Mam tu xin? ẍi eb bay. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ayex ti', man e yojtakok mac in txel. Man e yojtakok c'apax in Mam. K'inalok ta e yojtak mac in txel, e yojtak c'apax mi in Mam, ẍi bay eb.

English: He spoke these words while teaching in the temple area near the place where the offerings were put. Yet no one seized him, because his time had not yet come.
Kanjobal: A yul yamak'il templo Dios, bay cawilal chabal ofrenda, a tu' max yal Jesús juntzan ti'. A tu' max cuywaj xol anima. C'am junok mac max oc lacan yin, yujtol c'amto chi jay is c'ual cami.

English: Once more Jesus said to them, “I am going away, and you will look for me, and you will die in your sin. Where I go, you cannot come.”
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb junelxa: —Ok in tok ayin ti'. Okto in e sayic'ok, palta yin e yobtakil ok ex camok. Man ok je' tol comonc'al ok ex apnok bay ok in tok tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: This made the Jews ask, “Will he kill himself? Is that why he says, ‘Where I go, you cannot come’?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb yajaw bay Judea tu' axca ti': —Tekan tol ok yak' cam ba jun winak ti', xan chi yala' tol man ok je' japni bay ok apnok tu', ẍi eb.

English: But he continued, “You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon pax Jesús bay eb tu': —Ayex ti', aj sat tx'otx' ex, yujtol yet ex yulyibank'inal ti'. Ayin ti', mayin yetok yulyibank'inal ti', yujtol aj satcan in.

English: I told you that you would die in your sins; if you do not believe that I am the one I claim to be, you will indeed die in your sins.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max wal ayex tol yin e yobtakil ok ex camok. Ta c'am che yaoc yin e c'ul, tol ayin toni, yin e mul ok ex camok, ẍi bay eb.

English: “Who are you?” they asked. “Just what I have been claiming all along,” Jesus replied.
Kanjobal: —¿Mac ach wal txel xin? ẍi pax eb bay. Axa yalon tu': —Albilxa wuj ayex yettax yalantok mac in txel.

English: “I have much to say in judgment of you. But he who sent me is reliable, and what I have heard from him I tell the world.”
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al tzet chi je' walontek e yin c'al ex in beyc'ulneni. Palta a Cham cheknejintek, caw wal yel chi yala'. A tzet yalnak ayin, asan chi wala', ẍi bay eb.

English: They did not understand that he was telling them about his Father.
Kanjobal: Palta maj nachaj el yuj eb, ta a co Mam Dios chi yala'.

English: So Jesus said, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am the one I claim to be and that I do nothing on my own but speak just what the Father has taught me.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal pax bay eb axca ti': —Ato yet ok in e locban ajok, cax ok nachaj el e yuj, tol ayin ton Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail. Catatu' ok e yojtaknen elok, tol c'am tzet yulc'al wet chi wunej. Asan juntzan cuybanilej yalnak in Mam ayin, a' chi wala'.

English: The one who sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, for I always do what pleases him.”
Kanjobal: A Cham cheknejintek tu', a' ayoc wetok. A in Mam c'am chin is bekcan in tx'oklil, yujtol a tzet chi cha c'ul, a' chi wun masanil tiempo, ẍi bay eb.

English: Even as he spoke, many put their faith in him.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon juntzan ti', xiwil eb max yaoc c'ul yin.

English: To the Jews who had believed him, Jesus said, “If you hold to my teaching, you are really my disciples.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb israel max yaoc c'ul yin axca ti': —Ta ayc'al oc e nabal masanil tiempo yin tzet chi wala', a caw in cuywom ex ton sic'libil.

English: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
Kanjobal: Cax ok e yojtaknen el k'anej tol caw wal yel. Yuj jun k'anej yel tu', xan ok ex bekchajok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They answered him, “We are Abraham's descendants and have never been slaves of anyone. How can you say that we shall be set free?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon pax eb bay tu': —Ayon ti', yinatil on Abraham. C'am junelok chon oc mosook junok anima. Yuj tu xin, ¿tzet yuj xan chala' tol ok on bekchajok? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave to sin.
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, tzanc'al mac tol ac'ala' yunen yobtakil, caw wal ayoc eb mosook yobtakil tu'.

English: Now a slave has no permanent place in the family, but a son belongs to it forever.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok mac ayoc mosejal bay junok anima tinani', a jun mosejal tu', c'am chi je' cajay yetok jun anima tu' junelnej. Palta a junok is c'ajol junok anima tu', caw wal is c'ajol ton junelnej.

English: So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ta ayin chex wak' bekchaj can el yin e yobtakil, wal yel ok ex ton bekchajok, yujtol C'ajol in Dios.

English: I know you are Abraham's descendants. Yet you are ready to kill me, because you have no room for my word.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' wojtak toni, tol yinatil ex Abraham; palta ilab che yochej chin e yak' pax camok, yujtol a tzet chi wal ayex, c'am yelapnok yul e sat.

English: I am telling you what I have seen in the Father's presence, and you do what you have heard from your father. ”
Kanjobal: A tzet ilbil wuj bay in Mam, a' chi wal ayex. Ayex ti', tx'ok e mam. A yochwan e mam tu' che yunej, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “Abraham is our father,” they answered. “If you were Abraham's children,” said Jesus, “then you would do the things Abraham did.
Kanjobal: —Palta ayon ti', yinatil on Abraham, ẍi eb bay. —Matawal yel yinatil ex Abraham tu'. Ta yel yinatil ex, ami yunben che yunej.

English: As it is, you are determined to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God. Abraham did not do such things.
Kanjobal: Asan juntzan tzet yetal yel albil yuj Dios ayin, a' chi wal ayex, palta ijan che yochej pax chin e yak' camok. A Abraham tu', c'am junelok caytu' max yut ba.

English: You are doing the things your own father does.” “We are not illegitimate children,” they protested. “The only Father we have is God himself.”
Kanjobal: Axa ayex ti' xin, a tzet chi yun e mam, a' che yun yetok, ẍi Jesús bay eb. —Palta ayon ti', mayon mitz' winakok. Junnej co mam, a ton Dios, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love me, for I came from God and now am here. I have not come on my own; but he sent me.
Kanjobal: Matawal yel tol a Dios e mam. Ta yel a Dios e Mam, ay mi e camc'ulal win, yujtol a bay Dios max in tita, cax max in jay cayti'. Man toc'alok max in jay yul wet, a Dios max in chekontek.

English: Why is my language not clear to you? Because you are unable to hear what I say.
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan c'am chi nachaj el e yuj tzet chi wal ayex ti'? Tekan tol c'am chi yal e c'ul che cha e yab tzet chi wal ti'.

English: You belong to your father, the devil, and you want to carry out your father's desire. He was a murderer from the beginning, not holding to the truth, for there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks his native language, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
Kanjobal: A e mam ayex ti', a ton nak diablo, yuj tu' xan asan yin che yaoc e nabal. Asan tzet chi yochej nak che yunej. Mak'om cam animaxa nak yettax max esnelay yulyibank'inal ti'. C'am jabok yelapnok junok tzet yetal yel bay, yujtol c'am junok tzet yetal yel chi yala'. A yet chi yak'on junok lek'tial, a bay is nabal chi tita, yujtol caw wal lek'ti'. A' ay yet masanil lek'tial.

English: Yet because I tell the truth, you do not believe me!
Kanjobal: Axa ayin ti xin, caw wal yel juntzan tzet yetal chi wal ayex, palta c'am che cha' pax e yabej.

English: Can any of you prove me guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don't you believe me?
Kanjobal: ¿Mac junok ex chi je' e tx'oxon oc jabok in yobtakil? Caw wal yel juntzan chi wal ayex ti', yuj tu', ¿tzet xan c'am che cha pax e yabej?

English: He who belongs to God hears what God says. The reason you do not hear is that you do not belong to God.”
Kanjobal: A eb yet Dios, chi yacbaj eb is txiquin bay is k'anej, palta ayex ti', mayex yetok Dios. Yuj tu', c'am chi yal e c'ul che yacbaj e txiquin bay, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The Jews answered him, “Aren't we right in saying that you are a Samaritan and demon-possessed?”
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon pax eb aj Judea tu' bay axca ti': —Ila xin, yel chi jala'. Tekan tol aj Samaria ach. Tekan ay junok espíritu yob ayoc en, ẍi eb bay.

English: “I am not possessed by a demon,” said Jesus, “but I honor my Father and you dishonor me.
Kanjobal: —C'amak, c'am junok espíritu yob ayoc win. Tol lanan wion aj can in Mam. Toc'al chex buchwaj win ayex ti'.

English: I am not seeking glory for myself; but there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', c'am chi wochej tol mimanxac'al welapnok; palta ay jun mac chi aloni tol miman welapnok yul sat. A Cham tu' chi beyc'ulnen mac yel chi yala'.

English: I tell you the truth, if anyone keeps my word, he will never see death.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac chi iken tzet chi wala', c'am bak'in ok cam eb, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At this the Jews exclaimed, “Now we know that you are demon-possessed! Abraham died and so did the prophets, yet you say that if anyone keeps your word, he will never taste death.
Kanjobal: —A tinani', caw wal jojtak sic'libil tol ay junok espíritu yob ayoc en. A Abraham, yetokc'al eb chekbej Dios yet payxa, max cam eb masanil, cax chalon paxok: Ta ay mac chi iken tzet chi wala', c'am bak'in ok cam eb, cachito wal paxok.

English: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?”
Kanjobal: ¿Tom ec'ban ekbej yintak jichmam Abraham tu', c'al yintak eb chekbej Dios yet payxa? Palta ilabi, max cam pax eb tu'. ¿Mac ach txel a naon tinani'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “If I glorify myself, my glory means nothing. My Father, whom you claim as your God, is the one who glorifies me.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Ta yulc'al wet chi wiaj can in ba, c'am jabok welapnok, palta a in Mam chi aloni tol ay welapnok. A ton in Mam che yaloc e Diosalok.

English: Though you do not know him, I know him. If I said I did not, I would be a liar like you, but I do know him and keep his word.
Kanjobal: Palta mimanokc'al che yaloc Cham e Diosalok. Man e yojtakok Cham. A pax ayin ti xin, caw wal wojtak Dios. K'inalok ta chi wala' tol man wojtakok, lek'ti in mi axca ex tu'. Palta wal yel, wojtak Cham. A tzet chi yala', a' chi wikej.

English: Your father Abraham rejoiced at the thought of seeing my day; he saw it and was glad.”
Kanjobal: A jichmam Abraham, max tzaloj ajok, yujtol t'inan chi yil in jayi. Max ton yila', xan max yak' tzaloj c'ul, ẍi bay eb.

English: “You are not yet fifty years old,” the Jews said to him, “and you have seen Abraham!”
Kanjobal: —Achxa ti' tokwal ayachxa yin 50 abil, ¿tzet wal max yun elon yin cham Abraham? ẍi eb bay.

English: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus answered, “before Abraham was born, I am!”
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a yet c'amto chi alji Abraham tu', ayinxa ec' ayin ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At this, they picked up stones to stone him, but Jesus hid himself, slipping away from the temple grounds.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max c'oli sic'on aj eb ch'en, cax max yochen eb max k'okch'ennej camok. Max c'uban el ba Cham bay eb, cax max eltek yul templo Dios.

English: As he went along, he saw a man blind from birth.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junel, ayoc Jesús yin beyil yetok eb is cuywom, max yilon eb jun winak c'am chi je' yilwi yettaxc'alta' max alji.

English: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen eb cuywom tu' axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿tzetlaj yuj xan c'am chi je' yilwi jun winak ti' yintax yaljubal? ¿Ami eb mamej txutxej ay is mul, ma a nak ay is mul? ẍi eb bay Jesús.

English: “Neither this man nor his parents sinned,” said Jesus, “but this happened so that the work of God might be displayed in his life.
Kanjobal: —A jun winak ti', man yujok mul is mam ma is txutx, xan caytu' yayji, tamwal yuj c'apax is mul nak, palta tol chi yochej Dios chi tx'ox is mayk'ak'al yin nak, xan caytu' yayji.

English: As long as it is day, we must do the work of him who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.
Kanjobal: Yowalil chin watx'nej is mulnajil Cham max in chekontek, yak'ban ayto c'u. Yujtol a yet mayal toj c'u, c'amxa mac chi je' mulnaji.

English: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
Kanjobal: Yet ayinto ec' yulyibank'inal ti', axca sakk'inalok eb anima wayji, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Having said this, he spit on the ground, made some mud with the saliva, and put it on the man's eyes.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon juntzan ti', axa tzubli ay sat tx'otx' tu', cax max watx'nen jab tz'otz'ew yetok tzub tu'. Axa joonoc yin bak' sat nak c'am chi je' yilwi tu'.

English: “Go,” he told him, “wash in the Pool of Siloam” (this word means Sent). So the man went and washed, and came home seeing.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon bay nak: —Asi' bay a' najab pean ajok, a' chi yik Siloé. A tu' cha tx'ajil a sat tu', ẍi bay nak. (Siloé chi yal elapnok, Ibiltek.) Lajwic'al tu', max toj nak tx'ajon el sat bay a' tu'. Axa yet max meltzoji, chixa je' yilwi.

English: His neighbors and those who had formerly seen him begging asked, “Isn't this the same man who used to sit and beg?”
Kanjobal: Axa eb is vecino nak, c'al jantak eb max ilon nak yin k'anoj limosna, a eb max alon axca ti': —A jun winak ti', cochwal tol a jun chi ay chotan k'anoj limosna, ẍi eb.

English: Some claimed that he was. Others said, “No, he only looks like him.” But he himself insisted, “I am the man.”
Kanjobal: —A ton nak, ẍi juntzanxa. Palta ay juntzanxa chi alon paxok: —C'amak. Manak. Toc'al mi lajan yili jun ti' yetok nak c'am chi je' yilwi tu', ẍi eb. Axa yalon nak tu': —Ayin toni, ẍi bay eb.

English: “How then were your eyes opened?” they demanded.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet max yun jakchaj a sat tu xin? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “The man they call Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes. He told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see.”
Kanjobal: —A jun winak chi yik Jesús max ak'on jakchajcan in sat ti'. Max watx'nej jab tz'otz'ew, max joonoc yin in bak' sat ti'. Max lajwi tu' max yalon ayin axca ti': Asi' bay a' najab pean ajok, a' chi yik Siloé. A tu' cha tx'ajil a sat bay yul a', ẍi ayin. Axa bet in tx'ajon el in sat ti'. Caytu' max yun jakchajcanok, ẍi nak.

English: “Where is this man?” they asked him. “I don't know,” he said.
Kanjobal: —¿Baytal ay jun winak tu' tinani'? ẍi eb bay. —Man wojtakok, ẍi bay eb.

English: They brought to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max ilaytok nak yuj eb bay eb fariseo.

English: Now the day on which Jesus had made the mud and opened the man's eyes was a Sabbath.
Kanjobal: C'ual xewilal yet max jakchajcan sat nak yuj jab tz'otz'ew max watx'nej Jesús yetok is tzub.

English: Therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. “He put mud on my eyes,” the man replied, “and I washed, and now I see.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'anlej eb fariseo tu' bay nak axca ti': —¿Tzet wal max yun jakchaj a sat tu xin? ẍi eb. —A Jesús max joon oc jab tz'otz'ew yin in bak' sat ti'. Lajwi tu', max in tx'ajon elok. Yuj tu' xan watx'xa wilwi tinani', ẍi nak.

English: Some of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath.” But others asked, “How can a sinner do such miraculous signs?” So they were divided.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jaywan eb fariseo tu' bay nak axca ti': —A jun winak max jakon a sat tu', man yetok Dios, yujtol c'am chi yikej c'ual xewilal, ẍi eb. Palta ay jaywanxa eb max alon axca ti': —Man yobtakwomok Cham Jesús. A junok yobtakwom, ¿xin ta chi je' yuj tx'oxon juntzanok milagro axca juntzan chi tx'ox ti'? ẍi eb. Xan cab pojan max eloc eb anima tu'.

English: Finally they turned again to the blind man, “What have you to say about him? It was your eyes he opened.” The man replied, “He is a prophet.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'anlej eb junelxa bay nak chixa ilwi tu' axca ti': —Axa ach ach ti', ¿tzet cachi yuj Cham max jakon a sat tu'? ẍi eb bay nak. —Ayin ti', chekbej Dios yayji in naoni, ẍi nak.

English: The Jews still did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they sent for the man's parents.
Kanjobal: Palta eb yajaw bay Judea tu', maj cha eb yabej, tatol tolto max ilwi aj nak. A naon eb, tol chi ilwic'altac'a. Catatu bian, max yawten eb is mam c'al is txutx nak.

English: “Is this your son?” they asked. “Is this the one you say was born blind? How is it that now he can see?”
Kanjobal: Ata wal bay eb max k'anlej el eb axca ti': —¿A mi nak e yuninal c'am chi ilwi yintax yaljubal che yal ti'? ¿Tzet xan chixa ilwi pax nak xin? ẍi eb bay eb.

English: “We know he is our son,” the parents answered, “and we know he was born blind.
Kanjobal: —A ton nak, c'amc'alta' chi ilwi yintax yaljubal.

English: But how he can see now, or who opened his eyes, we don't know. Ask him. He is of age; he will speak for himself.”
Kanjobal: Palta man jojtakok tzet max yun jakchaj sat nak. Man c'apax jojtakok mac max jakoncan bay nak. Ilabi, ayxa yabilal nak. ¿Tzet xan manak bay nak che k'anlej e yabej? Ok je' yalon ayex, tzetbil wal max yun jakchajcan sat tu', ẍi eb.

English: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews, for already the Jews had decided that anyone who acknowledged that Jesus was the Christ would be put out of the synagogue.
Kanjobal: Cac'al tu' max yut yalon eb, yujtol caw wal chi xiw eb yuj eb yajaw xol eb aj Judea tu', yujtol toxa max yal eb yajaw tu' axca ti': Tatol ay mac ok alonok tol a Jesús, a ton Cham Cristo, ẍi, ok juktej eltok yul nail culto ti', ẍi eb.

English: That was why his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan asanc'al jab tu' max yal is mam c'al is txutx nak tu': Ilabi, ayxa yabilal nak, ¿tzet xan manak bay che k'anlej e yabej? ẍic'al eb.

English: A second time they summoned the man who had been blind. “Give glory to God, ” they said. “We know this man is a sinner.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max awtelay pax nak chixa ilwi tu' yuj eb junelxa, cax max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Caw wal yel chal satak Dios, yujtol jojtak, caw wal yobtakwom jun winak chala' tol a' max jakon a sat tu', ẍi eb bay nak.

English: He replied, “Whether he is a sinner or not, I don't know. One thing I do know. I was blind but now I see!”
Kanjobal: —Ayin ti', man wojtakok ta yobtakwom, ma c'amak. C'am chi je' waloni. Asan jun ti' wojtak, tol a yet yalantok, c'am chi je' wilwi jabok, axa tinani', chixa je' wilwi, ẍi nak.

English: Then they asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
Kanjobal: —Palta, ¿tzet wal max ach yut xin? ¿Tzet max yut jakon a sat ti'? ẍi eb bay nak.

English: He answered, “I have told you already and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his disciples, too?”
Kanjobal: —Mayal wal ayex tzet max yun jakchaj in sat ti', palta c'am che cha e yab tzet chi wala'. ¿Tzet xan che yochej chi wal pax ayex junelxa? ¿Tom che yochej chex oc is cuywomok c'apaxok? ẍi nak bay eb yajaw tu'.

English: Then they hurled insults at him and said, “You are this fellow's disciple! We are disciples of Moses!
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb juntzan ti', cax max buchwaj aj eb yin nak, max yalon eb axca ti': —Ach ti', is cuywom ach ton jun winak tu'. A pax ayon ti xin, is cuywom on Moisés.

English: We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this fellow, we don't even know where he comes from.”
Kanjobal: Jojtak tol max k'anjabcan Dios bay Moisés tu', palta a Jesús tu', man jojtakok mac ak'nej yikbej, ẍi eb.

English: The man answered, “Now that is remarkable! You don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.
Kanjobal: —¡E…! ¿tzet chi yal tu'? Ayex ti', che yala' tol man e yojtakok mac ak'nej yikbej, palta ilabi, max jakchaj pax can in sat ti' yuj.

English: We know that God does not listen to sinners. He listens to the godly man who does his will.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, caw wal c'am chi yab Dios is txaj eb yob is beybal. Asan eb chi yal ba bay, eb chi iken tzet chi yala', asan eb tu' chi ablay yet.

English: Nobody has ever heard of opening the eyes of a man born blind.
Kanjobal: Yettaxc'al yichbanil, c'amto junok chi jab k'umal tol chi jak sat junok mac c'am chi je' yilwi yintax yaljubal.

English: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta man chekbejok Dios Jesús tu', c'am mi jabok tzet chi je' yuj, ẍi nak bay eb.

English: To this they replied, “You were steeped in sin at birth; how dare you lecture us!” And they threw him out.
Kanjobal: —Ach ti', yin mulej aljinak ach, ¿tom chochej ach ok on a cuyu'? ẍi eb bay nak. Cax max ilay eltok nak yul nail culto tu' yuj eb, cax majxa chaoctok eb xol.

English: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when he found him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
Kanjobal: Axa max yaben Jesús tol max ilay eltek nak max jakchajcan sat tu' bay yul nail culto yuj eb, yuj tu' xan a yet max ilchaj yuj, max yalon bay nak axca ti': —¿Chim aoc a c'ul yin Cham Chekbiltek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail? ẍi bay nak.

English: “Who is he, sir?” the man asked. “Tell me so that I may believe in him.”
Kanjobal: —Mamin, al ayin mactxel jun tu', yet watx' chi waoc in c'ul yin, ẍi nak.

English: Jesus said, “You have now seen him; in fact, he is the one speaking with you.”
Kanjobal: —Maxax el yin. Ayin ton chin k'anjab etok ti', ẍi bay nak.

English: Then the man said, “Lord, I believe,” and he worshiped him.
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon Jesús axca tu xin, max bekon ay jajnaj ba nak satak Cham, cax max yalon nak bay axca ti': —Mamin, chi waoc in c'ul en, ẍi nak.

English: Jesus said, “For judgment I have come into this world, so that the blind will see and those who see will become blind.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay nak tu': —Yuj watx'ji el eb anima wuj, xan max in jay bay yulyibank'inal ti', yujtol ay eb c'am chi je' yilon yet Dios tinani', palta ok jakchaj sat eb tu' wuj. Ay nanxa eb, caw wal chi je' yilon yet Dios naoni, palta a eb tu', axca tol ok etax el sat eb wuj, ẍi Jesús.

English: Some Pharisees who were with him heard him say this and asked, “What? Are we blind too?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben jaywan eb fariseo ayic' bay tu' juntzan k'anej tu', max yalon eb bay axca ti': —¿Tom cha na' tol c'am chi je' jilon yet Dios? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin; but now that you claim you can see, your guilt remains.
Kanjobal: —Matawal chi nachaj el e yuj tol c'am chi je' e yilon yet Dios, c'am mi chi can e yobtakil e yiban. Palta yujtol che yala' tol chi je' e yilon yet Dios, xan chi can e yobtakil e yiban.

English: Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and a brother of James, To those who have been called, who are loved by God the Father and kept by Jesus Christ:
Kanjobal: Ayin Judas in ti', yak'omal in serbil Jesucristo. Wuẍtak in ba yetok Jacobo. Ti chin tz'ibejtok jun in carta ti' ayex ex awtebilxa yuj co Mam Dios. Camc'ulnebil ex yuj. Taynebil ex yuj Jesucristo.

English: Mercy, peace and love be yours in abundance.
Kanjobal: Mimanokab chi yun yok' c'ul Dios e yin. Mimanokab c'apax is junc'ulal, c'al is camc'ulal e yin bay tu'.

English: Dear friends, although I was very eager to write to you about the salvation we share, I felt I had to write and urge you to contend for the faith that was once for all entrusted to the saints.
Kanjobal: Ex in camc'ulnebil, max wochej aj waontok junok in carta ti' ayex, yuj walontok e yab yuj co colbanil. Palta axa tinani', ay wal jun tzet caw yowalil ok waltok ayex. Chin tewitok ayex, tol caw che yak' e yip, e ya'ilnen juntzan cuybanilej bay max jaoc co c'ul yin, yet watx' c'am chi somchajtok yobtakil xol. Yujtol a mac on, yet onxa Dios, a ayon ak'bilcan juntzan cuybanilej tu' yin junelnej.

English: For certain men whose condemnation was written about long ago have secretly slipped in among you. They are godless men, who change the grace of our God into a license for immorality and deny Jesus Christ our only Sovereign and Lord.
Kanjobal: Chi waltok juntzan ti' ayex, yujtol ayxa mactxel mayal oc co xol yin ewantakil. A eb tu', caw wal yob eb. Ilab tol chi yal eb axca ti': Colbil onxa yuj is watx'c'ulalil Dios. Yuj tu', chic'al je' junen tzanc'al tzet yobtakilal chi yochej co c'ul, ẍi eb. Asan Jesucristo chon ikbani, cax asannej Cham Jajawil, palta caw wal chi yintaknej el eb. A ton eb tu' tz'ibbilcan yabixal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan yet payxa, tol yowalil ok tokcan eb bay yailal.

English: Though you already know all this, I want to remind you that the Lord delivered his people out of Egypt, but later destroyed those who did not believe.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al e yojtakxa jun ok waltok ti', palta chi wochej che natek jabok wetok. A eb wet israelal payxa, colchajnak el eb masanil bay Egipto yuj Cham Jajawil. Palta lajwi tu', max c'aylay el eb maj yaoc c'ul yin Cham.

English: And the angels who did not keep their positions of authority but abandoned their own home–these he has kept in darkness, bound with everlasting chains for judgment on the great Day.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, naektek tzet yayji juntzan eb ángel, eb maj mayjok yin yopiso, palta tol max bekcan eb is cajlobal. A tinani', c'anani pixay eb yetok cadena yin tojbalk'inal. Preso yayji eb xol k'ekk'inal yuj Dios, masantac'al ok jay jun c'ual caw wal miman yelapnok, catatu' ok beyc'ulnelay eb.

English: In a similar way, Sodom and Gomorrah and the surrounding towns gave themselves up to sexual immorality and perversion. They serve as an example of those who suffer the punishment of eternal fire.
Kanjobal: Naek c'apaxtek tzet yunnak eb aj Sodoma, yetok eb aj Gomorra, c'al juntzanxa conoblak cawilal tu'. Tojnak eb yin ajmulal. Toltax muljinak eb yetok yet winakil. Axca eb ángel yob tu', cay c'apax tu' eb. Yak'banilok jay nabal masanil anima yayji eb tinani', yujtol lanan yaben eb yail xol k'ak' yin tojbalk'inal.

English: In the very same way, these dreamers pollute their own bodies, reject authority and slander celestial beings.
Kanjobal: Axa eb ayic' co xol ti' tinani', ac'al yobtakil chi yil naobtanej eb. Yuj tu' xan chi bektok ba eb xol. C'am yelapnok yikbej Cham Jajawil yul sat eb. Toc'al chi buchwaj eb yin juntzan eb tol caw miman yelapnok bay satcan.

English: But even the archangel Michael, when he was disputing with the devil about the body of Moses, did not dare to bring a slanderous accusation against him, but said, “The Lord rebuke you!”
Kanjobal: Chi co natek jun sat ángel chi yik Miguel. Yak'lejnak owal yetok nak diablo junel, yet max teyelen ba yetok, yujc'al mimanil Moisés. Caxc'al caw wal miman yikbej Miguel tu', palta maj tec'baj ba buchwaj yin nak diablo tu'. Maj yaloc is mul, palta cac'al tu' max yut yalon bay axca ti': Aokab Cham Jajawil chach tzuoni, ẍi bay.

English: Yet these men speak abusively against whatever they do not understand; and what things they do understand by instinct, like unreasoning animals–these are the very things that destroy them.
Kanjobal: Palta eb ti', comonc'al chi buchwaj eb yin junok tzet man yojtakok. A tzet yojtak eb, asanc'al axca tzet yojtakc'alta' no no' c'am is nabal; a yin juntzan tu' chi texac'al yak' etax el ba eb.

English: Woe to them! They have taken the way of Cain; they have rushed for profit into Balaam's error; they have been destroyed in Korah's rebellion.
Kanjobal: Caw wal ok'bal c'ul eb, yujtol lajan wal tzet chi beybalnej eb, axca tzet max beybalnej nak Caín. Yujc'al tumin xan chi yut ba eb axca yutnak ba Balaam. Axca yunnak Coré, tol ak'bil camok yujtol yak'lejnak owal yetok Dios, cac'apax tu' ok yun yak'lay cam eb yuj is tenomtakil.

English: These men are blemishes at your love feasts, eating with you without the slightest qualm–shepherds who feed only themselves. They are clouds without rain, blown along by the wind; autumn trees, without fruit and uprooted–twice dead.
Kanjobal: Q'uixwiltak yayji ec' eb e xol, yet che yak'on e waj loj, yuj e tx'oxk'abnen el e camc'ulal. Yujtol comonc'al chi oc eb low e xol, c'am jabok chi xiw eb. Axca wal junok ilom calnel ac'al chi yil ba, cay wal tu' eb. Axca junok takin asun toc'al chi ec' lananok yuj cak'ek', cay wal tu' eb. Lajan eb axca junok te te' c'am bay chi satni. Toc'al chi takajok, cax chi camilok. Chi lajwi tu', pilanc'al chi tok'lay ajtek yetok xe' masanil, cax chi texac'al camil yin junelnej.

English: They are wild waves of the sea, foaming up their shame; wandering stars, for whom blackest darkness has been reserved forever.
Kanjobal: Axca wal yipal yaj pomnaj sat a' mar, cay wal tu' eb, yujtol c'amxa chi tenchanej ba eb yin yobtakil. Axca wal sukuwal a' chi elcan tilak a', inej oc k'alem, cay wal tu' eb, yuj juntzan tzet q'uixwiltak chi yun tu'. K'inalok ay junok waycan chi c'aytok yin is be, caytu' eb. Yowalil ok apnok eb xol k'ekk'inal yin junelnej, cax ok ayjok ec' eb bay tu' yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied about these men: “See, the Lord is coming with thousands upon thousands of his holy ones
Kanjobal: A Enoc, cham yet suk inatilej yecheltaxc'al Adán, a Dios ak'nejcan yal cham yabixal eb ayic' co xol ti'. Max yalcan cham axca ti': Abek. A yet ok jay Cham Jajawil, xiwil milal eb yet-xa ok jay yetok.

English: to judge everyone, and to convict all the ungodly of all the ungodly acts they have done in the ungodly way, and of all the harsh words ungodly sinners have spoken against him.”
Kanjobal: Ato yet tu' ok beyc'ulnej masanil anima. Ok alay oc yailal eb yobtakwom yuj is yobtakil eb, c'al yuj is yob k'anej eb yin Cham Jajawil, yujtol man watx'ok is nabal eb, ẍican cham Enoc tu'.

English: These men are grumblers and faultfinders; they follow their own evil desires; they boast about themselves and flatter others for their own advantage.
Kanjobal: A eb ayic' co xol ti', owalc'al ay eb. Comonc'al chi yal eb yobtakil yin junokxa mactxel. Asan yin juntzan tzet chi yochej oc eb yetok is mimanil, asan yin tu' chi yaoc eb is nabal. Jelan ton chi yut ba eb k'anjabi. Tzanc'al mac chi yal eb watx'il, yujtol chi yochej eb chi yi' jabok tzet yin eb.

English: But, dear friends, remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ foretold.
Kanjobal: A pax ayex ti' ex in camc'ulnebil, naektek juntzan ok waltok ayex ti'. Atax yet payxa albilcan yuj eb chekbej Cham Jajawil Jesucristo axca ti':

English: They said to you, “In the last times there will be scoffers who will follow their own ungodly desires.”
Kanjobal: A yet lajubal tiempo, ay mac comonc'al ok buchwajok. Ok beybalnej eb juntzan yobtakil chi yochej ocok, ẍican eb.

English: These are the men who divide you, who follow mere natural instincts and do not have the Spirit.
Kanjobal: Ok pojchajtok eb yet-xa Dios yuj eb. Asan tzet chi yochej oc eb yetok is mimanil, a' chi yaoc eb is nabal yin. C'am oc Yespíritu Dios yin eb.

English: But you, dear friends, build yourselves up in your most holy faith and pray in the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti' ex in camc'ulnebil, tec'anokabc'al che yut e ba yin jun cuybanilej max e yaoc e c'ul yin, yujtol asan jun cuybanilej ti' yet Dios. Caw chex txajlic'al, yetok yipalil Espíritu Santo.

English: Keep yourselves in God's love as you wait for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to bring you to eternal life.
Kanjobal: Che yilc'al e ba, yet watx' c'am chex el yin is camc'ulal co Mam Dios. Jechbanejek jay jun c'ual yet ok texac'al txecloj aj watx'c'ulal Cham Jajawil Jesucristo jin, cax ok yak'on co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: Be merciful to those who doubt;
Kanjobal: Jaek oc nabal eb chi cabax aj c'ul, yet watx' chi tec'ban pax ba eb junelxa.

English: snatch others from the fire and save them; to others show mercy, mixed with fear–hating even the clothing stained by corrupted flesh.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax eb axca tol aytok xol k'ak'ej, co colek el eb. Axca tol lanan co tok'oncan eltek eb xol k'ak' tu'. Ay c'apax juntzanxa eb yowalil chi ok' co c'ul yin, palta xiwokonek yuj eb, yujtol ay is may chon etax el yuj is beybal eb. Co yajek el juntzan yob chi el yunen eb tu', axca chi jut co yajon el junok pichilej caw wal tz'iltak.

English: To him who is able to keep you from falling and to present you before his glorious presence without fault and with great joy– 25 to the only God our Savior be glory, majesty, power and authority, through Jesus Christ our Lord, before all ages, now and forevermore! Amen.
Kanjobal: Junnej Dios ay, a ton Cham co Colomal. Asannej ton Cham jelan. Chi je' yuj con is tayneni yet watx' a yet ok on yiontok satak, ok on apnok bay is watx'ilal yin c'am co paltail. Caw wal ok on tzaloj yet tu'. Yuj Cham Jajawil Jesucristo xan jalek tol a Dios caw miman is watx'ilal, caw miman yelapnok, caw ay is yikbej. Asan Cham Yajaw yin masanil. Cayton tu' yayji Cham yet c'amto chi watx'nej yulyibank'inal ti'. Ac'ala' Cham tinani'. Ac'ala' Cham yin tojbalk'inal. Yunokabi.

English: Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us,
Kanjobal: Ti chin tz'ibejtok jun un ti' ayach mamin Teófilo. Ay juntzan tzet yetal max uj co xol. A eb chi alon el k'anej Dios tinani', max yil eb juntzan tu' yet max chaon el yich. Max lajwi tu', max con is cuyon eb yin. Xiwil mac max jay yin nabal tz'ibencan yabixal juntzan tzet yetal max uj tu'.

English: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eyewitnesses and servants of the word. just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eyewitnesses and servants of the word.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', mamin Teófilo, mayal in cuy juntzan tu' yin c'ojanc'ulalil masanil. Yuj tu' max in na' tol watx' chin tz'ibejtok ayach yin txolilal,

English: so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.
Kanjobal: yet watx' chojtaknej elok, tol yel juntzan tzet yetal mayal a cuy tu'.

English: In the time of Herod king of Judea there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah; his wife Elizabeth was also a descendant of Aaron.
Kanjobal: A yet ayoc cham Herodes yin reyal bay yul yet Judea, ay jun sacerdote chi yik Zacarías, yetbi ba yetok jun makan eb sacerdote chi yik Abías. Elizabet bi yistzil cham tu'. Yinatil Aarón c'apax xal.

English: Both of them were upright in the sight of God, observing all the Lord's commandments and regulations blamelessly.
Kanjobal: Watx' beybal eb cawanil yul sat Dios. Yikem eb bay is chekbanil c'al bay is ley Cham Jajawil; yuj tu' xan c'am wal junok mac chi je' yaloni tol ay yobtakil eb.

English: But they had no children, because Elizabeth was barren; and they were both well along in years.
Kanjobal: C'am junok yuninal eb, yujtol man unewomixok xal. Yetok c'apaxok, icham animaxa eb cawanil.

English: Once when Zechariah's division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God,
Kanjobal: A yet junel, yet max ajapnok tiempoal yak'wi serbil Zacarías yetok jaywanxa eb yetbi,

English: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
Kanjobal: max yaoc eb suerte, axcac'alta' beybal eb junjun el. A yiban Zacarías max ayc'ayi. Yuj tu' xan max octok yul templo Cham Jajawil, yin bet yak'on tz'a incienso suk'uk'i jab.

English: And when the time for the burning of incense came, all the assembled worshipers were praying outside.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yak'on tz'a tu', aycan eb anima txajlok yina masanil.

English: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.
Kanjobal: A yet ayoctok tu', max ul tx'oxon ec' ba jun yángel Cham Jajawil bay Zacarías tu'. Max ulic' lecan bay jun pac' tz'eyil yaltaril incienso tu', bay yetc'ulal q'uexan k'ab Zacarías.

English: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and was gripped with fear.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon yin jun ángel tu', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul, max xiwcan aj yuj.

English: But the angel said to him: “Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to give him the name John.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jun ángel tu' bay axca ti': —Zacarías, manchak ach xiwi; mayal yab Dios a txaj. Yuj tu' xan, a etbi Elizabet, ok aljok jun is winak unin. Juan ok ak' yika'.

English: He will be a joy and delight to you, and many will rejoice because of his birth,
Kanjobal: Caw wal ok e' a tzalojc'ulal yin. Xiwil anima ok tzaloj aj yet ok yabeni tol mayal alji junok e yuninal.

English: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He is never to take wine or other fermented drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit even from birth.
Kanjobal: A jun unin tu', caw miman ok yun yeloc yul sat Cham Jajawil. Man ok yuc' vino, man ok yuc' an. Ayxa oc yalan yikbej Espíritu Santo yet ok aljok.

English: Many of the people of Israel will he bring back to the Lord their God.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb et israelal ok watx'nej oc ba yin Cham Jajawil Dios yuj jun a c'ajol tu'.

English: And he will go on before the Lord, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous–to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
Kanjobal: A Juan tu' ok babjok satak Cham Jajawil. Axca wal is nabal Elías, c'al is yikbej, caytu' ok yun is nabal c'al is yikbej c'apaxok. Yuj tu' xan ok yak' chalej ba nabal eb mamej yetok eb uninalej. A' ok q'uexon c'apax nabal eb tenomtak yul sat Dios, yet watx' chi watx'ji oc beybal eb. Axca ton tu' ok yut yak'on na ba c'ul eb anima, cax ok q'uexon eb is nabal, yet watx' ay eb watx'xa is nabal yet ok jay Cham Jajawil, ẍi jun ángel tu'.

English: Zechariah asked the angel, “How can I be sure of this? I am an old man and my wife is well along in years.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Zacarías tu' bay, axca ti': —¿Tzet ok wut wojtaknen elok tatol yel juntzan chal ti'? Yujtol ayin ti', caw wal icham inxa. Ixnamxa c'apax wetbi, ẍi.

English: The angel answered, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to tell you this good news.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jun ángel tu' bay: —Ayin ton Gabriel in, yak'omal in serbil Dios. Ayin max quin cheklaytek ul wal jun watx' abix ti' ayach.

English: And now you will be silent and not able to speak until the day this happens, because you did not believe my words, which will come true at their proper time.”
Kanjobal: Axa tinani', majxa je' a k'anjab jabok, masantac'al ok aljok jun onenal max wal tu'. Yujtol maj aoc yin a c'ul tzet max wal ti', xan caytu' ok onej. Ato yet ok ajapnok tiempoal, cax ok yunen jun ti', ẍi jun ángel tu'.

English: Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the temple.
Kanjobal: A eb anima chi echbanen yeltek Zacarías tu', max c'ayaj c'ul eb yujtol caw wal max mayji yul templo Dios.

English: When he came out, he could not speak to them. They realized he had seen a vision in the temple, for he kept making signs to them but remained unable to speak.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max elolok, majxa je' k'anjab bay eb. Max naon el eb conob tu' tol ay junok tzet yetal max tx'ox Dios bay. Yechelxac'al chi yak' yetok is k'ab, yujtol majxa je' k'anjabi.

English: When his time of service was completed, he returned home.
Kanjobal: Max ajapnok tiempoal lajwi yak'wi serbil xin, axa pax bay yatut tu'.

English: After this his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and for five months remained in seclusion.
Kanjobal: Manto payok tu', max oc unin yin Elizabet. Oyeb xajaw ayxac'al ec' xal bay yatut. Max c'oli naobtanen axca ti':

English: “The Lord has done this for me,” she said. “In these days he has shown his favor and taken away my disgrace among the people.”
Kanjobal: Yuj watx'c'ulal Cham Jajawil win, xan caytu' chi wunej, yet watx' c'amxa chi al-lay in k'umal yuj anima yujtol c'am wune', ẍi xal.

English: In the sixth month, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,
Kanjobal: Wakeb wal xajaw tu', max chekontek Dios cham ángel Gabriel bay conob Nazaret, yul yet Galilea.

English: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin's name was Mary.
Kanjobal: Max ulic' bay jun ix k'opoj, c'amtoc'al winak chi k'umej, chi yik María. A jun ix tu', ayxa is trato yetok jun winak chi yik José, yinatil rey David.

English: The angel went to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you.”
Kanjobal: Max octok jun ángel tu' bay ayic' ix, max yalon bay ix axca ti': —Tzalojan, ayoc Cham Jajawil Dios etok. Yelc'al miman is watx'c'ulal Cham max yak' ayach, ẍi.

English: Mary was greatly troubled at his words and wondered what kind of greeting this might be.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon oc ix yin jun ángel tu', max c'ayaj c'ul ix. Max naobtanen ix tzet max yal tu'.

English: But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, you have found favor with God.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon pax bay ix axca ti': —María, manchak ach xiwi, yujtol xiwil watx'c'ulal Dios max tx'ox ayach.

English: You will be with child and give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ok pitzc'oj aj jun winak unin en, cax ok ak' yik Jesús.

English: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David,
Kanjobal: Caw mimek winak ok yun yelocok. Ok binajok tol C'ajol Cham Axac'al Ocok. A Cham Dios Jajawil tu' ok aon oc e reyalok, cax ok occan q'uexelok cham rey David, cham is yichmam.

English: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever; his kingdom will never end.”
Kanjobal: A' ok oc e Yajawilok ayex israel ex ti' yin tojbalk'inal. C'am bak'in ok lajwok jun yopiso tu', ẍi jun ángel tu' bay ix:

English: “How will this be,” Mary asked the angel, “since I am a virgin?”
Kanjobal: —¿Palta tzet ok yun jeon jun chal tu'? Ayin ti' c'amto wetbi, ẍi ix bay.

English: The angel answered, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. So the holy one to be born will be called the Son of God.
Kanjobal: —A Cham Espíritu Santo ok jay eban. Axa yipalil Cham Axac'al Ocok ok ayol eban axca junok asun. Yuj tu' xan a jun unin ok aljok tu', yetc'al Dios yayji. Ok binajok tol C'ajol Dios.

English: Even Elizabeth your relative is going to have a child in her old age, and she who was said to be barren is in her sixth month.
Kanjobal: A ecan Elizabet, caw wal ixnamxa, palta ok aljok jun is winak unin. Chi yal eb anima tol c'am bak'in chi jay junok yune', palta wakebxa xajaw yoc unin yin xal tinani'.

English: For nothing is impossible with God.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol masanilc'al tzet yetal chi je' yuj Dios, ẍi jun ángel tu' bay ix.

English: “I am the Lord's servant,” Mary answered. “May it be to me as you have said.” Then the angel left her.
Kanjobal: —Chekbej Cham Jajawil wayji; yuj tu', yunokab axca max al tu', ẍi ix bay. Max lajwi tu', axa toj jun ángel tu'.

English: At that time Mary got ready and hurried to a town in the hill country of Judea,
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ayman max toj María bay jun conob bay siquilal tx'otx' yul makbej Judea.

English: where she entered Zechariah's home and greeted Elizabeth.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc ix bay yatut Zacarías, max yak'on ix cawil c'ul Elizabet.

English: When Elizabeth heard Mary's greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Elizabet k'anjab María tu', axa yaj jucnaj jun unin ayxa oc yin tu', cax max oc xal yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo.

English: In a loud voice she exclaimed: “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child you will bear!
Kanjobal: Axa yalon yin ipejal axca ti': —Ach ti', yel miman watx'c'ulal Dios max tx'ox ayach yintak masanil eb ix jet ixal. Miman c'apax watx'ilal ok al-lay yin jun one' ok aljok tu'.

English: But why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', c'am jabok welapnok, axa pax ach ti' xin, txutx ach Cham Jajawil, palta chach jay pax quin ul a k'umeni.

English: As soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
Kanjobal: A yet max waben a k'anjab yet max ach jayi, max aj jucnaj jun unin ayxa oc win ti', cochxac'al tol max tzaloj aj max wabej.

English: Blessed is she who has believed that what the Lord has said to her will be accomplished!”
Kanjobal: Ach ti', max aoc yin a c'ul tzet max yal Cham Jajawil ayach. Yuj tu' caw wal tzalojc'ulalil et, yujtol yowalil ok yunej, ẍi Elizabet tu'.

English: And Mary said: “My soul glorifies the Lord
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon María axca ti': Chi wal watx' k'anej bay Cham Jajawil yin masanil in c'ul.

English: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,
Kanjobal: Caw wal chi tzaloj in c'ul yin Dios co Colomal.

English: for he has been mindful of the humble state of his servant. From now on all generations will call me blessed,
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', yak'omal in serbil Dios, c'am welapnok jabok, palta max oc t'anan Cham win. Yuj tu', ok yal eb anima masanil tiempo tol watx' wet.

English: for the Mighty One has done great things for me– holy is his name.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Dios, Cham miman yikbej, xiwil watx'ilal max tx'ox ayin. Asanxanej oc Cham.

English: His mercy extends to those who fear him, from generation to generation.
Kanjobal: Masanil tiempo chi ok' is c'ul yin masanil mac chi xiw bay.

English: He has performed mighty deeds with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in their inmost thoughts.
Kanjobal: Max tx'oxilok tol caw miman yikbej, max can eb lues yalan yuj.

English: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.
Kanjobal: Max yican el eb yajaw yin yopiso, axa eb yaynakil max yiaj can.

English: He has filled the hungry with good things but has sent the rich away empty.
Kanjobal: Max yak' noj c'ul eb ay is wajil, axa bay eb beyom, c'am jabok tzet max yak' yet max chekon pax eb.

English: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering to be merciful
Kanjobal: Max oc jetok ayon israel on, is yak'omal on serbil ti'. Maj toj c'ayc'ulal yok' c'ul jin,

English: to Abraham and his descendants forever, even as he said to our fathers.”
Kanjobal: axca yaloncan bay eb jichmam, yujtol yak'nakcan is ti' bay Abraham yin junelnej, c'al ayon is yinatil on ti', ẍi María tu'.

English: Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.
Kanjobal: Oxeb mi xajaw max betic' María tu' bay Elizabet, axa meltzoj bay yatut junelxa tu'.

English: When it was time for Elizabeth to have her baby, she gave birth to a son.
Kanjobal: A yet max ajapnok tiempoal yalji yune' Elizabet, winak unin jun max alji.

English: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they shared her joy.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb cajan is cawilal, c'al eb yican, tol max tx'ox Cham Jajawil watx'c'ulal bay xal, max tzaloj aj eb yetok xal.

English: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to name him after his father Zechariah,
Kanjobal: Ukubixialxa yalji, max jay eb bay yatut Zacarías, yuj yalay oc jun yechelej chi yik circuncisión yin is mimanil jun unin tu'. Max yochej eb max yik Zacarías, yet watx' chi oc q'uexelok is mam tu'.

English: but his mother spoke up and said, “No! He is to be called John.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon xal txutxej tu' bay eb axca ti': —C'amak, Juan ok yika', ẍi xal bay eb.

English: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who has that name.”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' ok ak' yika'? Tokwal ay junok caytu' yoc bi e xol, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then they made signs to his father, to find out what he would like to name the child.
Kanjobal: Xan yin yechelejal max k'anlen eb bay is mam nak unin tu', tzet biejal chi yochej chi yik nak.

English: He asked for a writing tablet, and to everyone's astonishment he wrote, “His name is John.”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anon cham jabok tzet yetal bay chi tz'ibej ay tu', max tz'iben ayok: Juan chi yik jun unin ti', ẍi, max tz'iben ayok. Toxac'al max c'aycan aj c'ul eb masanil yet max yaben eb jun ti'.

English: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue was loosed, and he began to speak, praising God.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max jakchaj ti' Zacarías k'anjabi. Max yalon is watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: The neighbors were all filled with awe, and throughout the hill country of Judea people were talking about all these things.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul jantak eb cajan is cawilal. Max binaj jun ti' bay masanil siquilal tx'otx' yul yet Judea tu'.

English: Everyone who heard this wondered about it, asking, “What then is this child going to be?” For the Lord's hand was with him.
Kanjobal: A masanil eb max aben juntzan tu', caw wal chi naobtanej eb tzet wal yayji. Chi yalon eb axca ti': ¿Tzetlaj ok yun yeloc jun unin tu'? ẍi eb. Caytu' max yal eb yin, yujtol ayoc yipalil Cham Jajawil yin.

English: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
Kanjobal: A ton Zacarías is mam jun unin tu', caw wal ayoc yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo. Yuj tu' xan max ak'lay k'anjab aj yuj, max yalon axca ti':

English: “Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come and has redeemed his people.
Kanjobal: ¡Jalek watx' k'anej bay Cham Jajawil, Cham co Diosal ayon israel on ti', yujtol max jay ayon is conob on ti', yuj con ul colon elok!

English: He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David
Kanjobal: Max yatek jun co Colomal caw miman is yipalil. A nan xol eb yinatil David, cham yak'omal serbil, a tu' ok aljok.

English: (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago),
Kanjobal: Axca tu' max yut yaloncan Dios, yet max yak'balnen eb is chekbej yaloncan yet payxa, eb asan Dios aj cuenta yin.
