English: salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us–
Kanjobal: Atax yet tu' max yalcan Dios tol ok on is colil yul k'ab eb ajc'ul oc jin, c'al yul k'ab jantak eb chi chichon oc c'ul jin.

English: to show mercy to our fathers and to remember his holy covenant,
Kanjobal: Albil c'apax canok, tol ok ok' is c'ul yin eb jichmam. Man ok tok is trato c'ayc'ulal max yak' yetok eb, yujtol a jun is trato tu', asannej a' ay yet.

English: the oath he swore to our father Abraham:
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yak'oncan is ti' bay jichmam Abraham yet max locban is bi bay.

English: to rescue us from the hand of our enemies, and to enable us to serve him without fear
Kanjobal: Max yalcanok tol ok on is colil yul k'ab eb ajc'ul jin, yet watx' yin c'am bilc'ulalil chi jak' serbil Cham

English: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.
Kanjobal: yin tojolal, c'al asannejokab yin Cham chi jaoc co c'ul yin tojbalk'inal.

English: “And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him,
Kanjobal: Axa ach xin, ach in c'ajol, ok ach oc chekbejok Cham Dios Axac'al Ocok, yujtol ok ach babjok satak Cham Jajawil, cax ojc'al ok c'oli watx'nen eb anima is nabal, axca watx'ji junok be satak junok yajaw.

English: to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins,
Kanjobal: Ach ok ak' nachaj el juj tzet ok yun co colchaji, cax ok elcan co yobtakil jiban,

English: because of the tender mercy of our God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven
Kanjobal: yujtol camc'ulnebil on yuj co Diosal, caw wal chi ok' c'ul Cham jin. Axca yaj can c'u, cax chon is tzektaneni, axca tu' ok yun jay Cham chekbiltek yuj co Diosal.

English: to shine on those living in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the path of peace.”
Kanjobal: Axa tzektanen yanimail eb ayic' xol k'ekk'inal tu', eb lanan toj bay camich. A' ok tx'oxon c'apax ayon tzet ok jut co beybal, yet watx' junc'ulal chon ayji ec' yetok, ẍi cham Zacarías.

English: And the child grew and became strong in spirit; and he lived in the desert until he appeared publicly to Israel.
Kanjobal: A jun unin tu' max ch'ibc'al ajok, cax max jayc'al is nabal. Max betlej ec' cajan bay tz'inan tx'otx', masantac'al max ajapnok tiempoal tx'oxon aj ba bay eb yet israelal.

English: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them two by two ahead of him to every town and place where he was about to go.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi juntzan tu', max yaon oc Cham Jajawil juntzanxa eb is cuywom, 72 bey eb. Max chekon babjok eb. Catakwan max yun toj eb bay junjun conob, c'al bay junjun lugar bay t'inan ok ec' Cham Jajawil tu'.

English: He told them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi toj eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti': A eb jet animail, lajan wal eb axca ixim trigo tiempoalxa pol-layi. Wal yel caw wal xiwilto eb, palta jaywannej mac chi mulnaj xol eb. Yuj tu' xan txajlanek bay Cham aj mulnajil tu', yet watx' chi chektek mulnajwom ul yion aj eb.

English: Go! I am sending you out like lambs among wolves.
Kanjobal: Asek xin. Axca calnel chi toj xol no ok, caytu' chex wut waontok.

English: Do not take a purse or bag or sandals; and do not greet anyone on the road.
Kanjobal: Manchak e yi' e pa, e cartera, yetok e xanab. Manchak ex oc waan k'anjab yetok junok mactxel yulak be.

English: “When you enter a house, first say, ‘Peace to this house.’
Kanjobal: A yet chex apni oc bay junjun na, a cawil c'ul eb chi babji e yak'oni, che yalon bay eb axca ti': Ayokab junc'ulal yul e na ti', quex chi.

English: If a man of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; if not, it will return to you.
Kanjobal: Ta ay eb chi ochen junc'ulal bay tu', ok ak'lay bay eb axca ok e yut e yalon tu'. Ta ay mac c'am chi ocheni, maj yun axca che yut e yalon tu'.

English: Stay in that house, eating and drinking whatever they give you, for the worker deserves his wages. Do not move around from house to house.
Kanjobal: Asan bay junok na che yak' e posada. A tzet chi lo eb, che lo yetok eb, yujtol a mac chi mulnaji, moj chaon is tojol. Maj je' e txolwi na.

English: “When you enter a town and are welcomed, eat what is set before you.
Kanjobal: A yet chex apni bay junjun conob bay chex chalayi, tzanc'al tzet chi etxbelay eltek ayex, loek.

English: Heal the sick who are there and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God is near you.’
Kanjobal: Che yak'can watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay bay chex ec'c'al tu'. Toxa ok occan Dios yin Yajawil, quex chican bay eb.

English: But when you enter a town and are not welcomed, go into its streets and say,
Kanjobal: Palta ta ay junok conob bay man ok ex chalay xin, cax che yalon bay yulak is calleal axca ti':

English: ‘Even the dust of your town that sticks to our feet we wipe off against you. Yet be sure of this: The kingdom of God is near.’
Kanjobal: A pokokal jun e conob chi occan yin jakan ti', ti chi co tziccan el on, yuj co tx'oxk'abnen el tol c'amxa jalon jet e yin; palta nachajokab el e yuj, tol toxa ok occan Dios yin Yajawil, quex chican bay eb.

English: I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that town.
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, tol a yet ok jay jun c'ual beyc'ulal, yelxac'al miman yailal ok cha' eb tu' yintak eb aj Sodoma.

English: “Woe to you, Korazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
Kanjobal: ¡Ay a wal ayex ti', ex aj Corazín, caw wal ok'bal ex c'ul, c'al ex aj Betsaida, ok'bal ex c'apax c'ul! K'inalok ta a bay Tiro yetok bay Sidón max uj juntzan milagro max uj e xol ti', max mi yaoc eb el pichilej, c'al yay chotan eb xol tik'ak'il tan.

English: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.
Kanjobal: A yet ok jayoc jun c'ual beyc'ulal, yelxac'al miman yailal ok e cha' yintak eb aj Tiro c'al eb aj Sidón.

English: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to the skies? No, you will go down to the depths.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax ex aj Capernaum, che na' tol e moj e yilay can masantac'al chex ajapnok satcan, palta tol ok ex ilay ayok masantac'al ok ex ayapnok xol eb camnak, ẍi Jesús.

English: “He who listens to you listens to me; he who rejects you rejects me; but he who rejects me rejects him who sent me.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb is cuywom axca ti': A mac chi chaon aben ayex, chi yal elapnok tol a' ayin chi cha' yabej. Axa eb chex intaknen elok, chi yal elapnok tol ayin chin yintaknej el eb. A eb chin intaknencan el tu', chi yal elapnok tol a Cham cheknejintek, a' lanan c'apax yintaknen el eb, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The seventy-two returned with joy and said, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi meltzojtek eb 72 cuywom bay Jesús yin tzalojc'ulal, max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Mamin, toltax eb espíritu yob max yikej eb tzet max jal yet max jawten a bi, ẍi eb.

English: He replied, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Ayin ti', wilnak tzet max yun yaytek Satanás satcan, cax yaycan ul yulyibank'inal ti' axca junok rayo.

English: I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and to overcome all the power of the enemy; nothing will harm you.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' max wak' e yikbej, cax chi je' e yajtok waan yiban labaj, c'al yiban no alacrán. Wuj xan chi ayc'ay yipalil nak ajc'ul yalan e yuj, cax c'am junok tzet chex etneni.

English: However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
Kanjobal: Palta man yujok chi yikej eb espíritu yob ayex chex tzaloji, palta tzalojanek yujtol tz'ibxa yayji e bi bay satcan, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: At that time Jesus, full of joy through the Holy Spirit, said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this was your good pleasure.
Kanjobal: A yet jun bek tu', caw wal max tzaloj aj Jesús yuj Cham Espíritu Santo. Axa yalon axca ti': Mamin, Yajaw ach bay satcan c'al bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Chi wal watx' k'anej ayach, yujtol max ebaj el juntzan ti' bay eb jelan, c'al bay eb caw ay nabal yul sat eb yet animail, axa bay eb axca unin max ak' ojtaknelay elok. Caytu' max ot Mamin, yujtol axca tu' max yun chaon a c'ul, ẍi bay Dios.

English: “All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay eb anima ayic' tu' axca ti': Max yak'can in Mam masanil tzetak yetal yul in k'ab. C'am junok mactxel ojtaknej in ayin is C'ajol in ti', asan in Mam ojtaknej in. Yetok c'apaxok, c'am mac comonc'al chi ojtaknen el in Mam, axa in ayin is C'ajol in ti', wojtak, yetok c'apax eb mac bay chi yal in c'ul chi wak' ojtaknelay elok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he turned to his disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max ec' t'ananok xolak eb is cuywom. Max yalon bay eb tx'oklil axca ti': Caw wal watx' e yet, yujtol che yil jun tzet lanan e yilon ti'.

English: For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi wal ayex, xiwil eb chekbej Dios c'al eb rey yet payxa, max yochej eb max yil eb juntzan tzet che yil ti', palta maj yil eb. Yetok c'apaxok, max yochej eb max yab juntzan lanan e yaben ti', palta maj yab eb, ẍi Cham bay eb.

English: On one occasion an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. “Teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
Kanjobal: Axa max yun yet junel, ay jun cham meẍtol yin ley Moisés max aj lecanok. Max yochej max yak'lej yikban ayc'ay Jesús, xan max k'anlej bay axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿tzet yetal yowalil wal chi wunej, cax ok in chaon in k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal? ẍi bay Cham.

English: “What is written in the Law?” he replied. “How do you read it?”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet tz'ibbilcan yul ley Moisés chela'? ẍi Jesús bay cham.

English: He answered: “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind’; and, ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalon axca ti': —Camc'ulnejek Cham Jajawil co Diosal yin masanil e c'ul, yin masanil e yanimail, yetok masanil e yip, c'al yin masanil e nabal, cax che ya'ilnen e yet animail axca wal che yut e ya'ilnen e ba junjun ex, ẍi bay.

English: “You have answered correctly,” Jesus replied. “Do this and you will live.”
Kanjobal: —Watx' ton max ot aloni. Ta chekej juntzan ti', ok a cha' a k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay cham.

English: But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
Kanjobal: A cham tu', max yochej cham max colcan el ba yuj is k'anlebal tu', yuj tu' xan max yal pax bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Mac pax txel eb wet animail chi ali tu'? ẍi cham bay.

English: In reply Jesus said: “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, when he fell into the hands of robbers. They stripped him of his clothes, beat him and went away, leaving him half dead.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús axca ti': —A junel, ay jun winak lanan toj yul be chi tit bay Jerusalén, cax chi ay apnok bay Jericó. Lanan wal bey nak, cax max eltek juntzan elk'om yin nak, toltax max yiel eb pichil nak. Lajwi mak'lay nak yuj eb, cax max el eb. Jabxanej maj camcan nak yuj eb.

English: A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.
Kanjobal: C'uxan ay jun cham sacerdote max ec' yul jun be tu', toc'al max occan t'anan yin, max toji.

English: So too, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, ay jun cham yinatil Leví max ec' c'apax yul jun be tu'. Max oc c'apax can t'anan junxa tu' yin nak, cax toc'al max q'uexbenej ba, max toji.

English: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun nak aj Samaria lanan c'apax bey yul jun be tu', axa max yiloni, c'otan ay nak yul be tu', axa yok' c'ul yin nak.

English: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he put the man on his own donkey, took him to an inn and took care of him.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc c'atan nak, max yaon oc aceite yetok vino yanilok baytaklaj max yasjitok nak tu'. Max pichon yetok k'ap. Lajwi tu' xin, max lacon ajtok yiban is chej, max yicantok bay jun mesón. Max camc'ulnelay nak yuj sic'libil.

English: The next day he took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper. ‘Look after him,’ he said, ‘and when I return, I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, yet max toj nak aj Samaria tu', max yiajtek nak cab tumin, max yak'oncan nak bay cham aj mesón tu'. Max yaloncan nak bay cham axca ti': Watx' chot a taynen nak anima yasjinak ti' in k'ana'. Ta man ok yab jab tumin ti', okxa al ayin jantakto ok a c'aya', cax ok wak'on q'uexel a tumin yet ok in jay pax junelxa, ẍican nak, ẍi jun abix ti'.

English: “Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of robbers?”
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, ay jun chin k'anlej ayach. A nak max mak'lay yuj eb elk'om tu', ¿mac junok eb oxwan tu' caw yel yet animail nak cha na'? ẍi Jesús bay cham meẍtol yin ley Moisés tu'.

English: The expert in the law replied, “The one who had mercy on him.” Jesus told him, “Go and do likewise.”
Kanjobal: —A ton nak max ok' c'ul yin nak tu', ẍi cham bay. —A toni, yuj tu', asi', cax cha beybalnen axca nak tu', ẍi Jesús bay cham.

English: As Jesus and his disciples were on their way, he came to a village where a woman named Martha opened her home to him.
Kanjobal: Max tojc'al Jesús yul be tu', axa yapni bay jun aldea bay ay jun ix ix chi yik Marta tu'. Max cha' apnok ix Cham bay yatut.

English: She had a sister called Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet listening to what he said.
Kanjobal: Ay jun ix is nuej Marta tu' chi yik María. Max ay chotan ix tz'eyil yakan Cham, yuj yaben ix tzet chi yala'.

English: But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to him and asked, “Lord, don't you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me!”
Kanjobal: Palta axa Marta tu', caw wal witz'an yuj yilon ba, yuj tu' xan max jayoc ix bay Cham, max yalon ix bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿tom c'am chel jabok tol chi bekcan bulan ix in nuej ti' mulnajil ayin in tx'oklil? Al bay ix in k'ana', tol chi colwaj ix wetok, ẍi ix bay.

English: “Martha, Martha,” the Lord answered, “you are worried and upset about many things,
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham axca ti': —Marta, caw wal xiwil chach oc il, cax chak'on c'ay a nabal yuj xiwil tzet chon tu'.

English: but only one thing is needed. Mary has chosen what is better, and it will not be taken away from her.”
Kanjobal: Palta junnej tzet caw yowalil chi yi ba. A ton jun watx'ilal tu' chi yochej María ti'. Yuj tu' c'am junok mactxel ok je' yion ec' jun tu' bay, ẍi Cham bay ix.

English: One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”
Kanjobal: A yet junel max txajli Jesús. A yet max lajwi txajli, ay jun cuywom max alon bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿c'am mi chon a cuy yin txaj, axca max yut cuyon Juan eb is cuywom? ẍi bay.

English: He said to them, “When you pray, say: “ ‘Father, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —A yet chex txajli, cayti' che yut e yalon axca ti': Ach co Mam, mimanokab yelapnok a bi. Jayan ul ak'on Yajawilal cayti'.

English: Give us each day our daily bread.
Kanjobal: Ak' co lobej on yet junjun c'u, co k'ana'.

English: Forgive us our sins, for we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And lead us not into temptation. ’ ”
Kanjobal: Jo c'ay co yobtakil, axca chi jut co joon c'ay yobtakil eb ay tzet chon uteni. Manchak on a cha' ikbelaytok yin yobtakil, quex chi.

English: Then he said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and he goes to him at midnight and says, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
Kanjobal: Maxc'al lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan tu xin, max yalon pax axca ti': —K'inalok ay junok ex chi jayoc junok e yamigo ayex yet chuman ak'bal, chi ul yalon ayex axca ti': Ach wamigo, ay jun wamigo, ato wal jay ti', najat ta petoj. C'uxan c'am pax jabok tzet watx' wak'on lo' xan ak' in q'uex jabok tzet watx' wak' bay, ta ẍi chi jay ayex.

English: because a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him.’ because a friend of mine on a journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him.’
Kanjobal: K'inalok toc'al chex tak'wi pax eltok bay axca ti': Manchak in ul a teyej. Mayal waoc tz'utz'al in na ti'. Lananxa in way yetok eb wunin sat tx'at. Yuj tu' xan c'am chi je' waj wan wak'on tzet cha k'an ayin tu', k'inalok quex chi eltok bay.

English: I tell you, though he will not get up and give him the bread because he is his friend, yet because of the man's boldness he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
Kanjobal: Ayin chi wal ayex, ta che yak'a', man wal yujok tol e yamigo, xan chex aj wan e yak'on tzet chi k'an tu', palta yujtol chi awjic'al octok ayex, xan che yak' atac'ala' jantak chi oc yuj.

English: “So I say to you: Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi wal pax ayex: K'anek, cax ok yak'on Dios ayex. Sayek, cax ok ilchaj e yuj. Awjanek octok ti puerta, cax ok jaklay ayex.

English: For everyone who asks receives; he who seeks finds; and to him who knocks, the door will be opened.
Kanjobal: Yujtol tzanc'al mactxel chi k'anoni, chi cha'. Axa mac chi sayon ec'ok, chi ilchaj yuj. Axa mac chi awji octok ti puerta, chi jaklay bay.

English: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for a fish, will give him a snake instead?
Kanjobal: A ayex mamej ex ti', ta chi k'an e yuninal junok txay ayex, ¿xin ta a junok labaj che yak' bay?

English: Or if he asks for an egg, will give him a scorpion?
Kanjobal: Ta a junok jos chi k'an ayex, ¿xin ta a junok no alacrán che yak' bay?

English: If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
Kanjobal: A ayex ti', caxc'al yob ex, palta e yojtak che yak' tzet yetal watx' bay e yuninal. Akxa ta' wal co Mam ayic' bay satcan, chi yak' Cham Espíritu Santo bay eb chi k'anon bay, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Jesus was driving out a demon that was mute. When the demon left, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowd was amazed.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ay jun nak anima ayoc espíritu yob yin. C'am jabok chi je' k'anjab nak yuj. A Jesús max yiil jun espíritu yob tu' yin nak. A yet max el yin nak, max je' k'anjab aj nak, xan xiwil max c'ayaj c'ul eb anima yuj.

English: But some of them said, “By Beelzebub, the prince of demons, he is driving out demons.”
Kanjobal: Palta ay eb max alon axca ti': —A jun Jesús ti', chi ton je' yion el espíritu yob yin anima, yujtol a Beelzebú, a ton yajawil eb espíritu yob tu' ayoc yetok, ẍi eb.

English: Others tested him by asking for a sign from heaven.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb xin, tol max yochej eb max yak'lej yikban ayc'ay Jesús, xan max k'an eb yil junok milagro chi tx'oxoni tatol ayoc yikbej Dios yetok.

English: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them: “Any kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and a house divided against itself will fall.
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Cham tzet lanan naon eb, yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': K'inalok ay junok miman conob bay chi pojchaj eb yajaw, cax chi yak'len aj eb owal, chi lajwi ay jun conob tu'. K'inalok ay junok nail eb anima chi pojchaj yuj owal, chi lajwi ayok.

English: If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? I say this because you claim that I drive out demons by Beelzebub.
Kanjobal: Cayton c'apax tu' Satanás, ta chi pojchaj yetok eb yet espíritual yob tu', ¿xin ta chi mayji yikbej? Chi wal juntzan ti' ayex, yujtol ayin ti' che yala' tol yuj yikbej Beelzebú chi wioncan el eb yet espíritual yob.

English: Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your followers drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.
Kanjobal: Palta ta yel che yala', ¿mac pax ayoc yetok eb e cuywom yet chi yion el eb eb espíritu yob yin eb anima? Ilab xin, acaw wal eb e cuywom tu' chi tx'oxoni tol che yak' c'aytok e ba.

English: But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', a yikbej Dios chi wak'balnej cax chi wion el eb espíritu yob tu'. A ton yin jun ti' chi txecloj elok tol mayal chaoc Dios yak'on Yajawilal e xol.

English: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok winak caw wal ay yip. Ay is mitx'k'ab yet owal, yet watx' chi je' colon yatut. Tok subojxac'al yelk'anelaytok is tzetak yetal.

English: But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him, he takes away the armor in which the man trusted and divides up the spoils.
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta chi jayoc junokxa mactxel yel ec'ban yip yintak nak tu'. Ta chi ayc'ay nak aj na tu' yuj, chi yiic' masanil is mitx'k'ab nak ayoc yipok c'ul tu'. Chi lajwi tu', chi pojon ec' masanil is tzet yetal nak tu'.

English: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me, scatters.
Kanjobal: A eb manak wetok ayocok, ajc'ul oc eb win. A eb c'am chi colwaj wajban oc wetok, a ton eb chi ak'on saklemcantok.

English: “When an evil spirit comes out of a man, it goes through arid places seeking rest and does not find it. Then it says, ‘I will return to the house I left.’
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok espíritu yob chi el yin junok anima tinani'. Chi ec' bay lugarlak takin, yuj sayon ec' bay watx' chi xewi, palta c'am chi ilchaj bay watx' chi ayji, xan chi na' axca ti': Ok in meltzoj bay ec'nak in cajayok, ẍi.

English: When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi meltzoj tu xin, chi yilon oc jun anima tu', lajan axca junok na q'uisbil, caw wal watx' yili.

English: Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that man is worse than the first.”
Kanjobal: Xan chi toj yitek ukwanokxa yet espíritual yob, tol ec'banxa is yobtakil yintak, cax chi watx'nenxac'al oc cajan ba eb yin jun anima tu'. Yuj tu' xan yelxac'al yob chi yun yeloc jun anima tu' yintak yet babelal, ẍi Jesús.

English: As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out, “Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yalon Jesús juntzan tu', ay jun ix ix max awji aj xol eb anima: —Caw wal watx' yet ix ix ayach yune', ix max cach imtzeni, ẍi ix bay.

English: He replied, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús axca ti': —Yelxac'al ec'ban watx'il yet eb chi aben k'anej Dios cax chi yikeni, ẍi.

English: As the crowds increased, Jesus said, “This is a wicked generation. It asks for a miraculous sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah.
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max oc oyan yin Jesús, axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': A wal eb anima yet jun tiempoal ti', caw wal yob eb. Yuj tu' toc'al chi k'an eb junok milagro yila', junok chi tx'oxon yikbej Dios, palta asan jun milagro ok tx'oxlay yil eb, a ton junok axca jun max tx'ox Dios yin jun is chekbej chi yik Jonás.

English: For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so also will the Son of Man be to this generation.
Kanjobal: A Jonás tu' max tx'oxon el is mayk'ak'al Dios bay eb anima aj conob Nínive payxa. Axca Jonás tu', cayin ton tu' ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in tx'oxil mayk'ak'al Dios satak eb anima yet jun tiempoal ti'.

English: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them; for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon's wisdom, and now one greater than Solomon is here.
Kanjobal: Ilab c'apax jun xal yajaw bay Sur yet payxa. Caw wal najat titnak xal, max ulic' xal abxalwok bay cham Salomón, yujtol caw wal ay is jelanil cham. Tinani', ti' pax wal ec'ban in yintak Salomón tu', palta c'am chi ulic' anima abxalwok ayin. Yuj tu' xan ato yet ok jayoc jun c'ual yet ok ex beyc'ulnelayok, ok aj wan xal, cax ok yalon aj xal e yobtakil.

English: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and now one greater than Jonah is here.
Kanjobal: A yet max ec' yalon Jonás yabixal Dios bay eb aj Nínive, max na ba eb. Axa tinani', ti pax wal ec'ban in yintak Jonás tu', palta tok yuj tu' che na e ba. Yuj tu' xan ato yet ok jay jun c'ual yet ok ex beyc'ulnelayok, cax ok aj wan eb aj Nínive, ok yalon aj eb e yobtakil tu'.

English: “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a place where it will be hidden, or under a bowl. Instead he puts it on its stand, so that those who come in may see the light.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jaon oc co tzektebal, c'am bay chi co c'ubaj el bay man txequelok. C'am bay chi jaoctok yalan junok cajón, palta a yiban junok tzet yetal can batxan ajok, a tu' chi jajtok, yet watx' chi tzektanelay eb ayoctok yul na yuj.

English: Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eyes are good, your whole body also is full of light. But when they are bad, your body also is full of darkness.
Kanjobal: A co bak' sat, axca tol is tzektebal co mimanil yayji ocok. Yuj tu', ta junnej tzet bay ayoc co sat, sakk'inal on chi yal tu', cax watx'c'al tzet chi el junen yetok co mimanil. Palta ta ayex tx'ok tx'ok bay che yaoc e sat, chex cancan xol k'ekk'inal yuj.

English: See to it, then, that the light within you is not darkness.
Kanjobal: Che yilc'al e ba xin, yet watx' a e tzektebal, manchak q'uexpoj oc yin k'ekk'inalil.

English: Therefore, if your whole body is full of light, and no part of it dark, it will be completely lighted, as when the light of a lamp shines on you.”
Kanjobal: Ta sakk'inal yayji e mimanil masanil, ta c'am jabok k'ekk'inal ayex, sakk'inal ex toni. Axca junok tzektebal chex tzektaneni, axca tu' chi yun sakbi e nabal, ẍi Jesús.

English: When Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to eat with him; so he went in and reclined at the table.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan tu', ay jun cham fariseo max iontok Cham low bay yatut. Yuj tu', max toj ton bay na tu', max ay chotan low yetok cham.

English: But the Pharisee, noticing that Jesus did not first wash before the meal, was surprised.
Kanjobal: A cham fariseo tu', max c'ayaj c'ul cham yuj, yujtol maj tx'aj Jesús k'ab axca is beybal eb cham tx'ajon yet.

English: Then the Lord said to him, “Now then, you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham Jajawil tu' bay cham axca ti': —Ayex fariseo ex ti', lajan ex wal axca junok tol asan yinlak vaso c'al plato chi sakbanej, yujtol a e nabal, asan elk'an nabil e yuj, yetok tzet yetal man watx'ok.

English: You foolish people! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?
Kanjobal: Caw c'am e nabal, ¿tom man e yojtakok tol a jun mactxel watx'nenej juntzan tzet yetal chi jil ti', a' c'apax max watx'nen juntzan tzet yetal c'am chi jila'?

English: But give what is inside the dish to the poor, and everything will be clean for you.
Kanjobal: Aktam yetok e nabal che tx'ox e watx'il. Ta caytu' che yut axca tu', ok watx'jok aj e yanimail, c'al e nabal. Chi yal elapnok c'amxa tzet yob ayoc e yin.

English: “Woe to you Pharisees, because you give God a tenth of your mint, rue and all other kinds of garden herbs, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You should have practiced the latter without leaving the former undone.
Kanjobal: Ok'bal ex c'ul, ayex fariseo ex ti'. Che yak' wal diezmoal an alawen, yetok an ruda. Tz'akanxac'al che yak' diezmoal masanil itaj. Palta a e naoni tol man yowalilok watx' che yut e nabal, man yowalilok che camc'ulnej Dios. Matawal tol a juntzan ti' che beybalnej, cax c'am che bek e beybalnenc'alta' juntzan beybalnebilxa e yuj tu'.

English: “Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the most important seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.
Kanjobal: Ok'bal ex c'ul, ayex fariseo ex ti'. A bay nail e wajayil yin culto, asan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak che yochej chex ay chotanok. Yetok c'apax yet chex ec' yulak calle, che yochejxac'al chi yiay ba eb anima ayex.

English: “Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, which men walk over without knowing it.”
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al ex fariseo, caw ok'bal ex c'ul. Caw wal cabsat ex. Lajan ex axca bay mukan junok camnak manxa txequelok bay mukan. Chi ec' eb anima yiban, palta man yojtakok eb ta ay mac mukan bay chi ec' tec'ton eb tu', ẍi Jesús.

English: One of the experts in the law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us also.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi yalon Jesús jun tu', ay jun cham meẍtol yin ley Moisés max alon bay axca ti': —Meẍtol, a yet max alon juntzan ti', ayon ti' man watx'ok max jab c'apaxok, ẍi cham bay.

English: Jesus replied, “And you experts in the law, woe to you, because you load people down with burdens they can hardly carry, and you yourselves will not lift one finger to help them.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay: —Ok'bal ex c'apax c'ul ayex meẍtol ex yin ley Moisés ti'. A juntzan e chekbanil lajan wal axca junok ikatz c'am chi lacchaj jabok juj. Toc'al che bulbaj aj ikatz che yak'on yik eb anima, palta tamwal chex oc matxan e k'eoncan aj jabok yikatz eb tu'.

English: “Woe to you, because you build tombs for the prophets, and it was your forefathers who killed them.
Kanjobal: Caw wal ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol chi bet e ca watx'nej aj is mukbanil eb chekbej Dios yiban bay mukan eb mak'bil cam yuj eb e yichmam yet payxa.

English: So you testify that you approve of what your forefathers did; they killed the prophets, and you build their tombs.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a yet che yunen juntzan tu', lanan e tx'oxon elok tol watx' yutnak ba eb e yichmam e naoni. Yujtol a ton eb mak'nej cam eb chekbej Dios tu'; ayexxa chi bet e tz'ak e watx'nej aj is mukbanil eb yiban.

English: Because of this, God in his wisdom said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and others they will persecute.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max yalcan Dios yetok is jelanil axca ti': Ok in chektek juntzan eb ok alon el in k'anej e nan e xol, yetok juntzanxa eb in chekbej. Ay eb ok e mak' camok. Ay eb toc'al ok e yetnej yetok yailal, ẍi Dios.

English: Therefore this generation will be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed since the beginning of the world,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', masanil eb chekbej Dios mak'bilxa cam yecheltax c'al yel yich yulyibank'inal ti', ok ak'lay eb e cargonej mac ex ayex ec' yet jun tiempoal ti'.

English: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, this generation will be held responsible for it all.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb chekbej Dios mak'bilxa camok, yecheltaxc'al max mak'lay cam Abel, masantac'al yet max mak'lay cam Zacarías, jun ak'bil cam nan xol altar yetok templo Dios. Palta ayin chi wal ayex, masanil eb mak'bil cam tu', ok ak'lay eb e cargonej mac ex ayex ec' yet jun tiempoal ti'.

English: “Woe to you experts in the law, because you have taken away the key to knowledge. You yourselves have not entered, and you have hindered those who were entering.”
Kanjobal: Ok'bal ex c'ul ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yujtol munilc'al max e tz'ak e yaoc e yopiso e jakon nabal eb anima yetok k'anej Dios, palta ilab c'am che ya pax oc e nabal yin k'anej Cham. Axa eb chi yochej chi yaoc c'ul yin, c'am che cha' c'apax yaoc eb c'ul yin, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When Jesus left there, the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to oppose him fiercely and to besiege him with questions,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan ti', axa tit yowal eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés tu', yetok eb fariseo tu' yin Cham. Xiwil juntzan tzet yetal max tz'ak k'anlej el eb bay Cham.

English: waiting to catch him in something he might say.
Kanjobal: Max yechbanej eb yabej, ta ay tzet yob ok yut yaloni, cax chi yak'on queja eb yaloni.

English: Meanwhile, when a crowd of many thousands had gathered, so that they were trampling on one another, Jesus began to speak first to his disciples, saying: “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, xiwil milal bisil eb anima max waj ba bay Jesús. Chi tec'lejxac'al tok ba anima yujtol toxanej chi witz'itz'i, axa yalon Jesús yin babelal bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Che yilc'al e ba yuj yich pan eb fariseo, a ton is cabsatil eb.

English: There is nothing concealed that will not be disclosed, or hidden that will not be made known.
Kanjobal: Yujtol masanil jantak tzet makan ay tinani', ok txecloj ajok. Yetok jantak tzet ewanc'uan yayji, ok ak'lay ojtaknelay elok.

English: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed from the roofs.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', masanil tzet max e yal yin ewantakil, ok yab eb anima masanil. Yetok masanil tzet max e saj alnej yul txiquinej, ok al-lay el xol anima yulak calle.

English: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do no more.
Kanjobal: Axa ayex ti' ex wamigo, chi wal ayex, manchak ex xiw bay eb chi je' yak'on cam e mimanil ti', yujtol a yet chi xew e cam yuj eb, c'am junokxa tzet chi je' el yunen eb e yin.

English: But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear him who, after the killing of the body, has power to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him.
Kanjobal: Palta ok wal ayex bay moj chex xiwi. A bay Dios, a tu' chex xiwi, Cham tol chi xew e yak'lay cam yuj, ay pax is yikbej ex yaontok bay infierno. A ton bay Cham tu' moj wal chex xiwi.

English: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.
Kanjobal: Ilab no coq'uiẍ tz'iquin tinani', c'am yelapnok no'. Chi txonlay oc'on no' yin cab centavo, palta ilbilc'al no' masanil yuj Dios.

English: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Don't be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti' caw wal miman e yelapnok yintak no'. Toltax e xil, bisbil masanil yuj Cham. Yuj tu', manchak ex xiwi.

English: “I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge him before the angels of God.
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, tzanc'al mac c'am chi q'uixwi yalon satak yet animail tol wet, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok waloc eb wetok satak eb yángel Dios.

English: But he who disowns me before men will be disowned before the angels of God.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb chi alon satak yet animail tol man wetok, ok wal c'apax satak eb yángel Dios tol man wetok eb.

English: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi alon junok tzet yetal win, chito je' yak'lay tan is yobtakil tu'; palta a mac chi buchon Cham Espíritu Santo, a jun tu bian, c'amxa chi ak'lay tan is yobtakil tu' yiban.

English: “When you are brought before synagogues, rulers and authorities, do not worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say,
Kanjobal: A yet ok ex ilaytok bay nail wajayil eb jet israelal, ma yet ok ex ilaytok satak eb juez, c'al eb yajaw, manchak ex oc il yuj tzet ok e yut e paktzen eb. Manchak ex oc il yuj tzet ok e yala'.

English: for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet ok jay tiempoal e yalon tu', a Cham Espíritu Santo ok ak'on tzet watx' ok e yala', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Someone in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
Kanjobal: A xol eb anima tu', ay jun mactxel max alon bay Jesús axca ti': —Meẍtol, al bay jun wuẍtak, tol chi yak' jabok wet yin jantak tzet max can yuj co mam on, ẍi bay Jesús.

English: Jesus replied, “Man, who appointed me a judge or an arbiter between you?”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Cham bay axca ti': —Ach anima, ¿mac max ak'on wopiso woc e juezalok, cax chex in watx'nen elok? ẍi Cham bay.

English: Then he said to them, “Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; a man's life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yalon bay eb anima tu' axca ti': —Chi cam e yiloni, cax che taynenc'al e ba, yet watx' c'am junok tzet yetal comonc'al che yochej ocok. Man yujok tol xiwil tzet ay ayon, xan tzalojc'ulal jet bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: And he told them this parable: “The ground of a certain rich man produced a good crop.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al lajwi tu', axa yalontek jun abix ti' bay eb: A junel, ay jun winak caw wal beyom. Xiwil sat is yawoj max el sat is tx'otx'.

English: He thought to himself, ‘What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max na' axca ti': ¿Tzetlaj ok wutej, yujtol c'amxa bay watx' ok in wajbaj sat wawoj ok wi' ti'? ẍi jun winak tu'.

English: “Then he said, ‘This is what I'll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max naon pax nak axca ti': ¡A…, tix ok wut ti'! Ok wuchay juntzan in c'una ti', cax ok in watx'nen juntzanokxa mimek ok wutej. A tu' ok in wajbaj sat wawoj ti', c'al masanil tzet ay ayin.

English: And I'll say to myself, “You have plenty of good things laid up for many years. Take life easy; eat, drink and be merry.” ’
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok tu', cax ok in naon axca ti': A tinani', xiwil tzet max in wajbaj, caw miman tiempo ok in k'anbalnej. Yuj tu', chi je' chin xew tinani'; chi je' chin lowi, c'al wuq'uena', jantakc'al chi wochej. Chi je' wak'on tzalojbok in c'ul, quin chi ok waloni, ẍi nak.

English: “But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?’
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Dios bay nak axca ti': Ach ti', caw wal c'am jabok a nabal. Yet-xac'al jun ak'bal ti', ok ach camok; axa pax jantak tzet ok a wajbaj aj tu', ¿mac ok ion can cha na'? ẍi Dios bay nak.

English: “This is how it will be with anyone who stores up things for himself but is not rich toward God.”
Kanjobal: Axca ton jun winak tu', cayton tu' ok yun yeloc eb lanan wajban is beyomal yuj yoc yetok tx'oklil, ta c'am pax tzet lanan wajban eb yin yet Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then Jesus said to his disciples: “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Chi wal ayex xin, manchak ex oc il yuj tzet chi yun yec' tiempo e yuj cayti', yuj tzet che lo'. Manchak ex oc c'apax il yuj e pichil.

English: Life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.
Kanjobal: A Dios chi ak'on co cawil. Akxata' tzet ok co lo', ¿xin ta man ok yak'a'? A' max ak'on co mimanil ti', akxata' co pichil, ¿xin ta man ok yak' che na'?

English: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap, they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!
Kanjobal: Ilab no joj tinani', c'am yawoj no', c'am jabok tzet chi jatx'aj no', cax chi wajban no'. C'am is c'una no', c'am bay watx' chi c'ubaj no' jabok tzet yetal; palta a Dios chi ak'on masanil tzet chi lo no'. Ayex ti', caw miman e yelapnok yintak no' yul sat Cham.

English: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?
Kanjobal: ¿Ma ay junok ex chi je' e yaon oc nanokxa vara tz'akil e tel yujc'al chex oc il?

English: Since you cannot do this very little thing, why do you worry about the rest?
Kanjobal: Xan ta c'am chi je' e watx'nen juntzan c'am yelapnok ti', ¿tzet yuj xan chex oc il yuj juntzanokxa tzet yetal xin?

English: “Consider how the lilies grow. They do not labor or spin. Yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.
Kanjobal: Iek e nabal yin tzet chi yun ch'ib an xumaquil ac'un tinani'. A an xumac tu', c'am chi mulnaj an, tamwal chi tx'alwi c'apax an; palta chi wal ayex, a cham rey Salomón, caxc'al xiwil watx'il yili cham yetok is pichil, palta majc'alta' apnok yili cham axca an xumac tu'.

English: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today, and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith!
Kanjobal: A an xumac tu', watx' yili an tinani', palta yecal, chi tz'a an yul horno. Caxc'al cac'al tu' chi yun lajwinaj el an, palta a Dios chi ak'on watx'il yili an tu'. Akxam ayex ti', ok yak'c'alta' e pichil. Palta ijan tol txennejc'al pax e yaon oc e c'ul yin Cham.

English: And do not set your heart on what you will eat or drink; do not worry about it.
Kanjobal: Manchak ec' yiban e naon xin. Manchak ex oc il yuj tzet che lo', c'al yuj tzet che yuq'uej.

English: For the pagan world runs after all such things, and your Father knows that you need them.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb man ojtaknenok Dios, asan yin juntzan tu' bay ayoc nabal eb; palta yojtakxa co Mam Dios tol chi oc c'apax yopiso juntzan tu' e yuj.

English: But seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ak'ek e yip e watx'nen oc e ba yul k'ab Dios. Ta che yut caktu', ok ak'lay masanil juntzan ti' ayex.

English: “Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti' axca tol in calnel ex. Manchak ex xiwi. Jaywannej ex toni, palta a co Mam Dios chex ion oc yul is k'ab, yujtol axca tu' max yun yel yin c'ul.

English: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will not be exhausted, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.
Kanjobal: Txonekcan el masanil tzet ayex, cax che saontok tojol xol eb meba'. Axca ton tu' ok e yut e watx'nen caẍail e tumin c'am bak'in chi ichambi. A ta satcan ok wajnaj juntzan axca e beyomal tu'. A juntzan tu', c'am bak'in ok lajwok. C'am junok elk'om ok je' yapni yelk'anen bay tu'. Yetok c'apaxok, c'am c'apax no ij ok oc yin bay tu'.

English: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
Kanjobal: Yujtol, a bay chi co wajbaj co beyomal, a tu' chi ja c'apaxtok co nabal.

English: “Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,
Kanjobal: Makwajanek, axca wal junok mosejal ayoc is pichil, tzekbil pax is tzektebal yuj makon jay is patrón.

English: like men waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay juntzanok mosejal lanan yechbanen jay is patrón aytok bay junok k'in nupayil. A yet chi jay bay na, cax chi awji octok, watx'xac'al yayji eb jakon yin aymanil. Axca chi yut yechbanen eb mosejal is patrón tu', caytu' che yut e ba ayex ti'.

English: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes. I tell you the truth, he will dress himself to serve, will have them recline at the table and will come and wait on them.
Kanjobal: A eb mosejal c'amto chi wayajok cax chi jay is patrón tu', caw wal watx' yet eb. Wal yel chi wal ayex, a wal caw cham patronej tu', ayman ok q'uexil ba, axa chotban ay eb is moso tu' lowok, cax ok yak'on serbil cham eb.

English: It will be good for those servants whose master finds them ready, even if he comes in the second or third watch of the night.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al chuman ak'bal, ma yet toxa chi sakbi, cax chi jayi, ta c'amto chi way eb is moso tu' chi jayi, caw wal watx' yet eb.

English: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.
Kanjobal: Nachajokab el jun abix ti' e yuj. K'inalok ay junok elk'om chi oc elk'an yul yatut junok anima. Matawal yojtak jantak hora chi jay jun elk'om tu', toc'alta' chi maka', cax c'am chi chaoctok elk'an bay yatut tu'.

English: You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', cayexokab tu'. Makwajanek, talaj yet man naanok el e yuj chin jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: Peter asked, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everyone?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max k'anlej Pedro bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, ¿asannej mi ayon bay max al jun abix ti', ma yuj masanil anima ti' xan max ala'? ẍi.

English: The Lord answered, “Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu' axca ti': K'inalok ay junok patrón tinani'. Ta ay junok is moso yikem cax jelan paxok, a ton jun tu' chi yaoc cham yikbej yiban eb masanil, yuj taynelay eb, c'al yuj yak'lay low eb junjuntak el. Palta ¿mactet junok eb mosejal tu' yikem che na'?

English: It will be good for that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns.
Kanjobal: A ton nak lanan mulnaj axca wal chi yochej c'ul is patrón tu' yet ok jayok. Caw wal watx' yet jun mosejal tu'.

English: I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, ok yaoc cham nak mosejal tu', yajawilal yiban jantak tzet ay yul is k'ab.

English: But suppose the servant says to himself, ‘My master is taking a long time in coming,’ and he then begins to beat the menservants and maidservants and to eat and drink and get drunk.
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta a' chi yut naon jun mosejal tu' tol mantoc'al ok jay is patrón tu', cax chi c'oli mak'ontaj eb yet mosejal, c'al eb ix criadaejal, cax asanc'al loj chi yunej, c'al uq'uej an.

English: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of. He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers.
Kanjobal: A yet c'ual man echbanebilok yuj, cax ok jay is patrón nak mosejal tu'; a ton yet tu' ok jayoc tzac'naj cham, junelnej wal man yojtakok nak ta a yet jun bek tu' chi jayi. Axa yak'lay yailal nak sic'libil yuj cham tu', cax ok yaoncantok cham nak bay ayic' juntzan eb maj yaoc c'ul yin Dios.

English: “That servant who knows his master's will and does not get ready or does not do what his master wants will be beaten with many blows.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok mosejal yojtak tzet chi yochej c'ul is patrón chi watx'nej, palta c'am chi yak' yip, cax c'am chi yikej tzet chi yal is patrón tu'. A jun mosejal tu', caw wal miman yailal ok cha'.

English: But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta ay junokxa mosejal man yojtakok, cax chi watx'nen juntzan tzet yetal tol moj yikon tz'um yuj. A jun tu', txennej tz'um ok yika'. A eb miman tzet ak'bil bay, miman tzet ok k'anlay el bay eb. Yetok eb miman tzet abenebilcan bay, yowalil miman tzet ok yak' c'apax eb.

English: “I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' max quin jay yuj ul waon oc jun k'ak'ej bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Matawal lananxa culxi tinani'.

English: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is completed!
Kanjobal: Ay wal jun miman yailal ok jay wiban, axca tol ok in ak'lay bautizar yuj. Caw wal ay jun in miman cusc'ulal tinani' masantac'al ok yunel jun tu'.

English: Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but division.
Kanjobal: ¿Ma yuj ul wak'on junc'ulal yulyibank'inal ti' xan max quin jay e naoni? Wal yel c'amak. Palta yuj yak'len aj eb anima owal in yailok, xan max in jayi.

English: From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other, three against two and two against three.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay owanok anima bay jun na, oxwan ajc'ul oc yin cawan, axa cawan ajc'ul oc yin oxwan. Cay wal tu' ok e yun yet jun tiempoal lanan jay ti'.

English: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
Kanjobal: Ay eb mamej ok yak'lej owal yetok eb is c'ajol. Yetok c'apaxok, ay eb txutxej ok yak'lej owal yetok eb ix yune'. Ay eb xal alibej ok yak'lej owal yetok is yalib, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: He said to the crowd: “When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, ‘It's going to rain,’ and it does.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Jesús juntzanxa ti' bay eb anima tu': A yet che yiloni, tol chi tit asun bay yayub c'u, jun bek che yala': Ok jay nab, quex chi. Yel ton che yala', chi jay nab.

English: And when the south wind blows, you say, ‘It's going to be hot,’ and it is.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax yet chi tit cak'ek' bay sur, che yal c'apax axca ti': A tinani', ok yak' k'ak', quex chi. Yelc'al che yala', chi yak' k'ak'.

English: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky. How is it that you don't know how to interpret this present time?
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti' caw wal cabsat ex. Jelan ex ton e naon el tzet chi jayoc yuj juntzan che yilaj satcan tu', c'al sat tx'otx' ti', palta, ¿tzet xan pax c'am chi nachaj el e yuj tzet chi yal elapnok juntzan yechel chi tx'oxon tzet lanan yunen Dios?

English: “Why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuj xan man munilok che beyc'ulnej tzet yetal watx' yul sat Dios?

English: As you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, try hard to be reconciled to him on the way, or he may drag you off to the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok mactxel chex iontok satak cham alcal. Aokab yet lanan e toj yul be yetok, cax che yak'on e yip e watx'nen ay yetok, yet watx' c'amxa chex yitok satak cham tu'. Yujtol ta mayal ex apni satak alcal tu', chex yaoc cham yul k'ab eb policía, axa ex yiontok eb preso tu'.

English: I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny. ”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, tol man ok ex beklay elok, masantac'al tol tz'akan che yak'can e multa masanil, ẍi Jesús.

English: Now there were some present at that time who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ay juntzan eb max jayoc bay Jesús. Max yalontek eb yabixal tzetbil max yun yak'lay cam juntzan eb aj Galilea yuj Pilato, yet lanan yak'on eb juntzan is xajanbal bay Dios.

English: Jesus answered, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered this way?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu' axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' max utlay eb aj Galilea tu' che na'? ¿Yuj mi tol yelxac'al yob is beybal eb yintak eb yet conob tu'?

English: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.
Kanjobal: Ayin chi wal ayex, c'amak. Palta ayex ti', ta c'am che na e ba yin e yobtakil, e masanil ok ex cam c'apaxok.

English: Or those eighteen who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them–do you think they were more guilty than all the others living in Jerusalem?
Kanjobal: Naektek eb waxaklajonwan max cam bay Siloé, yet max ayc'ay te na miman is tel yiban eb. ¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' max yun eb che na'? ¿Yuj mi tol caw wal yob is beybal eb yintak eb yet aj Jerusalénal eb tu'?

English: I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you too will all perish.”
Kanjobal: Ayin chi wal ayex, c'amak. Palta ayex ti', ta c'am che na e ba yin e yobtakil, ok ex cam e masanil c'apaxok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then he told this parable: “A man had a fig tree, planted in his vineyard, and he went to look for fruit on it, but did not find any.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalontek Jesús jun abix ti' bay eb: A junel, ay jun winak ay jun te higo awbil yuj sat is tx'otx'. Axa toj yilon tu' ta ay sat te'. Palta axa yet max apni ocok, tokc'al ay junok sat te' max ilchaj yuj.

English: So he said to the man who took care of the vineyard, ‘For three years now I've been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and haven't found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up the soil?’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay nak chi mulnaj sat is tx'otx' tu' axca ti': Ilab oxebxa abilc'al c'oli ul wilon jun te' ti'. C'amc'al junok sat chi wila'. Yuj tu', tzoc'ajok. Nabac'al makbil el tx'otx' ti' yuj, ẍi bay nak.

English: “ ‘Sir,’ the man replied, ‘leave it alone for one more year, and I'll dig around it and fertilize it.
Kanjobal: Palta max yal nak ilom mulnajil tu' bay cham axca ti': Patrón, mata wal c'amto chi co tzoc'aj te' yet jun abil ti'. Ac'al wal chi wak'lej in t'ocon c'unbok tx'otx' yich, cax ok waon oc yabonoal.

English: If it bears fruit next year, fine! If not, then cut it down.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ta ok satnok, watx' chi yal tu'. Ta c'am chi satni xin, axa co tzoc'on aj axca alon tu', ẍi nak bay, ẍi jun abix tu', ẍi Jesús.

English: On a Sabbath Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues,
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual xewilal, max octok Jesús yul nail wajayil eb yet israelal yin culto. Axa c'oli cuywaj nan xol eb tu'.

English: and a woman was there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.
Kanjobal: Ay jun ix ix ayic' bay tu', 18 abilxa yac'al ay yuj jun espíritu yob. Max coxloj ix yuj, max aycan nojan ix. C'amxa chi jichloj aj lecan ix.

English: When Jesus saw her, he called her forward and said to her, “Woman, you are set free from your infirmity.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús tol ayic' ix, axa yawtentek Cham ix is c'atan tu', max yalon Cham bay ix axca ti': —Ach ix, ti wal chach watx'ji yin jun a yailal ti', ẍi bay ix.

English: Then he put his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max matxban oc k'ab yiban ix. Yet jun bek tu', max jichlojcan nan ix. Max c'oli yalon ix is watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: Indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, the synagogue ruler said to the people, “There are six days for work. So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath.”
Kanjobal: A cham yajaw nail wajayil tu', max tit yowal cham, yujtol a yet c'ual xewilal max watx'jican ix yuj Jesús, xan max yal bay eb anima wajan ec' tu' axca ti': —Wakebnej c'u moj co mulnaj yul semana. A yin wakeb c'ual tu', tzanc'al tzet c'ual chi je' ul e yak'on yak'lay watx'jokcan e c'ul yin e yailal, palta man mojok chi ak'laycan watx'jok e c'ul yet c'ual xewilal ti', ẍi cham bay eb masanil.

English: The Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn't each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham Jajawil bay cham tu' axca ti': —A ex ti', caw wal cabsat ex. Ta ay junok e wacax, ma junok e burro c'alan yet c'ual xewilal, ¿tom c'am che xuyilok, cax chi toj e yak'on yuc'a'?

English: Then should not this woman, a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?”
Kanjobal: A pax jun ix ix ti', yinatil Abraham ix; 18 abilxa michchaj ix yuj Satanás, axca wal tol c'alan ix yuj. ¿Tom man mojok colchajcan el ix yin is yailal yet c'ual xewilal ti' cha na'? ẍi bay.

English: When he said this, all his opponents were humiliated, but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon axca tu', masanil eb ajc'ul oc yin Cham, max q'uixwi aj eb; palta masanil eb anima xin, caw wal max tzaloj eb yilon juntzan tzet c'ayubtak chi el yunen Cham.

English: Then Jesus asked, “What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon c'apax Jesús axca ti': ¿Tzetbil chi yun ch'ib bisil eb anima chi oc yul k'ab Dios che na'? Ok waltek jun abix ti' e yabej.

English: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air perched in its branches.”
Kanjobal: A chi yun ch'ib bisil eb anima tu', lajan eb axca junok inat mostaza chi yaw junok anima sat is tx'otx'. A jun inat tu', chi ajolok, chi ch'ibi. Lajan chi yun yucay axca te te' mimektak. A no tz'iquin, chi ton je' way no' xol is k'ab an, ẍi Cham.

English: Again he asked, “What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Jesús junxa ti': Ok waltek junxa abix ti' ayex, tzetbil chi yun ch'ib is bisil eb anima chi oc yul k'ab Dios.

English: It is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into a large amount of flour until it worked all through the dough.”
Kanjobal: A jun tu', lajan axca jabok yich pan chi yatok junok ix xol oxebok echbal harina. Echc'al chi pajbitok ixim yuj jab yich pan tu', ẍi Jesús.

English: Then Jesus went through the towns and villages, teaching as he made his way to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: A Jesús ac'ala' max beytoj yul beal Jerusalén. Ay juntzan conoblak, c'al juntzan aldealak bay chi ec' cuywajok.

English: Someone asked him, “Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?” He said to them,
Kanjobal: Axa yet junel, ay jun mactxel max k'anlen bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿jaywannej mi eb ok colchajok? ẍi bay Cham. Max yalon Cham bay:

English: “Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.
Kanjobal: —Ak'ek e yip e yoc bay jun axca yaliẍ puerta, yujtol chi wal ayex, xiwil eb chi yak'lej yoqui, palta maj je' yoc eb.

English: Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you will stand outside knocking and pleading, ‘Sir, open the door for us.’ “But he will answer, ‘I don't know you or where you come from.’
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Dios, lajan axca junok aj na chi makchej yatut. Ok lajwok tu', axa ayex chex can lecan ti' na tu', okto e yak'lej e yawji octok axca ti': Mamin, jakon octok etok, quex chito wali. Man ex wojtakok, tamwal bay cajan ex, ẍi eltek, yet ok tak'wok.

English: “Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.’
Kanjobal: Palta ilab lownak on etok, cuywinak on yul calle oj, quex chi, ok e yalon bay.

English: “But he will reply, ‘I don't know you or where you come from. Away from me, all you evildoers!’
Kanjobal: Palta ok ex tak'welay yuj axca ti': Mayal wal ayex tol may ex wojtakok, tamwal bay ayex. Elanek e masanil ex che yun yobtakil, ẍi ayex.

English: “There will be weeping there, and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' caw wal ok jichchaj e c'ul e yok'i. Yuj ok e yila' tol ayic' Abraham, Isaac, yetok Jacob c'al masanil eb chekbej Dios ayoc yul k'ab, xan ayex paxok, yina ayex canok.

English: People will come from east and west and north and south, and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God.
Kanjobal: Ay eb ok tit bay junjun lugar, ay eb ok tit bay chi ajol c'u, c'al bay chi tojcan c'u, ay eb ok tit bay norte c'al bay sur, cax ok ay chotan eb low yin meẍa bay ayoc Dios Yajawil.

English: Indeed there are those who are last who will be first, and first who will be last.”
Kanjobal: Ay mac c'amxac'al jabok yelapnok co xol tinani'; palta a yet jun tiempoal tu', a eb ti', caw miman yelapnok bay tu'. Ay pax mac caw wal miman yelapnok co xol tinani'; palta a yet jun tiempoal tu', ay pax eb c'amxa jabok yelok apnok bay tu', ẍi Jesús.

English: At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him, “Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you.”
Kanjobal: Ac'al oc yet jun c'ual tu' max jayoc juntzan eb fariseo, axa yalon eb bay Jesús axca ti': —Asi', elan bay jun lugar ti', yujtol chi yochej Herodes chach yak' camok, ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “Go tell that fox, ‘I will drive out demons and heal people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —A jun winak tu', lajan axca no wax, tok ay yelapnok. Asek cax ok e yalon bay tol a tinani' c'al yecal cabej chi wiil eb espíritu yob yin anima, cax chi wak'on c'apax watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay. Axa yet chi lajwi tu', chin lajonxac'al in mulnajil ti', ẍi Jesús, quex chi bay.

English: In any case, I must keep going today and tomorrow and the next day–for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem!
Kanjobal: Palta ayin ti', ok in tokc'al yul in be tinani', c'al yecal cabej, yujtol yowalil asan bay Jerusalén chon ak'lay cam ayon chekbej on Dios ti'.

English: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!
Kanjobal: A wal ayex ti' ex aj Jerusalén, che mak' wal cam eb chekbej Dios. Axa juntzanxa eb chekbiltek yuj Dios e xol, che k'okch'ennej eb. Xiwilxa el max wochej max quex wawtejtek ayin, axca junok no caẍlan chi k'uttejtek yune', cax chi mojoni, palta maj yal e c'ul.

English: Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”
Kanjobal: Abek. A jun e conob ti', ok tz'inayok. Chi wal ayex, c'amxa bay ok e yil win, masantac'al yet ok e yalon axca ti': Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil, quex chi, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: One Sabbath, when Jesus went to eat in the house of a prominent Pharisee, he was being carefully watched.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual xewilal max betic' Jesús low bay yatut jun sat fariseo. C'uxan ay pax juntzanxa eb yet fariseoal chi makon ilonok.

English: There in front of him was a man suffering from dropsy.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak ayic' satak Cham bay tu', malnak aj yuj jun ilya'.

English: Jesus asked the Pharisees and experts in the law, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés tu', c'al bay eb fariseo axca ti': —¿Ay mi leyal chi jak' watx'jok c'ul junok ya'ay yet c'ual xewilal, ma c'amak? ẍi bay eb.

English: But they remained silent. So taking hold of the man, he healed him and sent him away.
Kanjobal: Palta tz'inxac'al, ẍi eb. Axa yoc mitx'an Jesús yin nak ya'ay tu', max yak'on jaycan c'ul nak. Max yalon bay nak tol chi paxi.

English: Then he asked them, “If one of you has a son or an ox that falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not immediately pull him out?”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al lajwi tu', axa yalon bay eb fariseo tu' axca ti': —K'inalok ay junok ex ay junok e yuninal, ma xin ay junok e wacax chi toj yul junok xab olan yet c'ual xewilal, ¿xin ta c'am chi toj e yiajtek yin aymanil? ẍi bay eb.

English: And they had nothing to say.
Kanjobal: Palta majxa nachaj paktzen eb jabok bay.

English: When he noticed how the guests picked the places of honor at the table, he told them this parable:
Kanjobal: Max yilon Jesús, tzet max yut ba eb awtebil low yetok bay jun loj tu', tol a bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak, a tu' chi ay chotan eb. Yuj tu' max yal bay eb axca ti':

English: “When someone invites you to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, for a person more distinguished than you may have been invited.
Kanjobal: —Ta ay bay chex awtelay bay junok k'in nupayil, manchak ex ay chotan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak. C'uxan talaj chi apni oc junokxa awtebil, tol caw miman yelapnok e yintak.

English: If so, the host who invited both of you will come and say to you, ‘Give this man your seat.’ Then, humiliated, you will have to take the least important place.
Kanjobal: Axa talaj yalon cham awtenej ex tu' ayex axca ti': Elanek yul juntzan ẍila ti', cax che yak'on bay eb cham ti', ẍi talaj e yutelayi. Yuj tu', yowalil axa xol eb c'am jabok yelapnok chex apni ocok. Caw wal chi el e q'uixwil.

English: But when you are invited, take the lowest place, so that when your host comes, he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up to a better place.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all your fellow guests.
Kanjobal: A yet chex awtelay tu xin, watx' a xol eb c'am yelapnok chex apni oc chotanok, yet watx' a yet chi jayoc cham awtenej ex tu', chi yal ayex axca ti': Ex wamigo, ayanek chotan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak tu', ẍi, ok yalon ayex. Axca tu' bian, caw wal miman e yelapnok yul sat eb ayoc e yetok yin meẍa tu'.

English: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi yiaj can ba, ok ilay ayok, c'amxa jabok yelapnok ok yun yelcan apnok. Palta eb chi yiay ba, a eb ok ilay aj can, a ton eb miman ok yun yelapnok, ẍi Jesús.

English: Then Jesus said to his host, “When you give a luncheon or dinner, do not invite your friends, your brothers or relatives, or your rich neighbors; if you do, they may invite you back and so you will be repaid.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yalon bay nak awtenej tu' axca ti': —A yet cha watx'nen mimanok loj, manchak awtej eb watx' ak'on yetok. Manchak awtej c'apax eb a mam c'al oẍtak, eb ecan yetok eb beyom cajan a cawilal. Yujtol a eb tu', ok ach yawtej pax eb low yetok. Axa a chaon pax q'uexel et tu'.

English: But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
Kanjobal: Palta a yet cha chaon junok a k'in, asan eb meba' chawtej low etok, eb man tz'akanok is mimanil, axca eb c'am chi je' beyi, c'al eb c'am chi je' yilwi.

English: and you will be blessed. Although they cannot repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”
Kanjobal: Ta caytu' ok ot axca tu', caw wal watx' et chi yal tu', yujtol a eb tu', c'am jabok q'uexel ok je' yak'on eb ayach, palta a yet ok ach ictzoj yetok eb watx' is beybal, cax ok a chaon paktzil, ẍi Jesús bay nak.

English: When one of those at the table with him heard this, he said to Jesus, “Blessed is the man who will eat at the feast in the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben jun nak ayoc yin meẍa tu' is k'anej Jesús, max yalon nak bay axca ti': —Caw wal watx' yet eb ok loon pan bay ayoc Dios yin Yajawil, ẍi nak bay.

English: Jesus replied: “A certain man was preparing a great banquet and invited many guests.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús junxa abix ti': —A junel, ay jun winak max watx'nej jun miman loj cax xiwil anima max yawtej low yetok.

English: At the time of the banquet he sent his servant to tell those who had been invited, ‘Come, for everything is now ready.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ajapnok yorail yoc jun loj tu', max chekontok jun is moso toj yalon bay eb awtebil yuj tu' axca ti': Asek. Mayal apni yorail yoc loj, mayal watx'ji, ẍi bay eb.

English: “But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said, ‘I have just bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please excuse me.’
Kanjobal: Palta junjunc'al eb, max yal eb tol maj je' toj eb. Max yal nak babel axca ti': Tol ay jun in tx'otx' tolto max in mana', xan yowalil chi toj wila'. Chak' mimanc'ulal win, maj in tok, ẍi.

English: “Another said, ‘I have just bought five yoke of oxen, and I'm on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon junxa axca ti': Tol ay o mojan in mulnajwom wacax max in mana'. Yowalil ok tok wak' porobal no', tzetbil mulnaj no'. Matawal chak' mimanc'ulal win, ẍi nak.

English: “Still another said, ‘I just got married, so I can't come.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax junxa axca ti': Tolto max oc wetbi. Yuj tu' xan maj je' in toji, ẍi.

English: “The servant came back and reported this to his master. Then the owner of the house became angry and ordered his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind and the lame.’
Kanjobal: A yet max jay nak mosejal tu', max yal nak masanil tzetc'al max yut tak'wok ba eb bay. Yuj tu' xan caw wal max tit yowal cham patronej tu'. Max yalon cham bay jun is moso tu' axca ti': Asi' yin aymanil yulak calle, c'al yulak beal jun conob ti'. Chi toj eontek eb meba', eb man tz'akanok is mimanil, eb c'am chi je' beyi, c'al eb c'am chi je' yilwi, ẍi cham bay.

English: “ ‘Sir,’ the servant said, ‘what you ordered has been done, but there is still room.’
Kanjobal: Max xew betic' jun mosejal tu', max yalon bay is patrón tu' axca ti': Mamin, ti mayal bet wi eb max al tu', palta colantoc'al, ẍi bay cham.

English: “Then the master told his servant, ‘Go out to the roads and country lanes and make them come in, so that my house will be full.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon is patrón tu' bay axca ti' junelxa: A tinani', asi' bay juntzanokxa calle, c'al bay juntzanokxa be. Chi toj ak'on pural eb anima tita', yet watx' ok noj na ti' yuj eb.

English: I tell you, not one of those men who were invited will get a taste of my banquet.’ ”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayach, c'am junok eb babel awtebil wuj tu' ok je' low bay jun miman loj chi wak' ti', ẍi cham patrón tu'. Caytu' yalon jun abix ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and turning to them he said:
Kanjobal: A yet junel, xiwil anima tzakan yintak Jesús, xan max meltzojtok acan bay eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti':

English: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, his wife and children, his brothers and sisters–yes, even his own life–he cannot be my disciple.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi jay ayin, palta yelxac'al miman yelapnok is mam c'al is txutx wintak naoni, ma yetbi, ma yuninal, ma yuẍtak, ma yanab, c'al is k'inal, ta caytu' naon axca tu', maj je' yec'c'al cuywok wintak.

English: And anyone who does not carry his cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
Kanjobal: A eb c'am chi yal c'ul chi beybalnej in beybal, c'al yaben yail wuj axca ok wun yin te curus, maj je' yec'c'al eb cuywok wintak.

English: “Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok ex che yochej che watx'nej junok e yatut, mimantak che yochej che yutej. A yet c'amto che mitx' oc e watx'neni, ¿xin ta c'am chi cam e naon yin babelal jantak tumin chi lajwi yin; catatu' che yiloni ta chi yab e tumin yin yion ba?

English: For if he lays the foundation and is not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule him,
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi cam e naon yin babelal, asannej mi yich chi aycanok, cax c'am chi yi ba e yuj. Axa eb chi iloni tol c'am chi yi ba, chex al-lay yuj eb.

English: saying, ‘This fellow began to build and was not able to finish.’
Kanjobal: Chi yalon eb e yin axca ti': A jun winak ti', max tz'ak chaoc watx'nennaj jab yatut, palta majc'al yi ba yuj, ẍimi eb.

English: “Or suppose a king is about to go to war against another king. Will he not first sit down and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok rey, chi toj yak'lej owal yetok junokxa yet reyal, palta asan pax ch'an 10,000 is soldado chi yitok yetok. Axa junxa tu', ay pax 20,000 yet ibil. A yet c'amto chi toj jun txennej yet tu', ¿xin ta c'am chi cam naon sic'libil ta ok tzakay yetok eb is soldado tu'?

English: If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace.
Kanjobal: Ta maj tzakay chi yab xin, chi yatok is chekbej bay junxa rey tu' yet najatto ay, tol chi k'anlej tzetbil chi yun tan jun owal tu'.

English: In the same way, any of you who does not give up everything he has cannot be my disciple.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, tzanc'al mac ex txel c'am chi yal e c'ul che bekcan tzetak yetal ayex, maj je' e yec'c'al cuywok wintak.

English: “Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?
Kanjobal: A atz'am atz'am watx' ay yopiso atz'am, palta k'inalok ta chi c'ay is c'achial, ¿tzetto wal ok yun c'achibi paxok?

English: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile; it is thrown out. “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
Kanjobal: C'amxa yopiso. Caxc'al chi alay ay sat tx'otx', caxc'al chi toj somilok abono, tutun c'amxa yopiso. Toxac'al chi k'oklay elok. A juntzan max e yab ti', naobtanejek sic'libil, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Now the tax collectors and “sinners” were all gathering around to hear him.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb tekom el tojlabal, yetok juntzanxa eb yob is beybal satak anima, max jayoc eb bay Jesús abxalwok.

English: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law muttered, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max tit yowal eb fariseo c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, max yalon eb axca ti': —A jun winak ti', chic'al cha' jay eb yob is beybal c'atan. Ilab chi low yetok eb, ẍi eb.

English: Then Jesus told them this parable:
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Jesús jun abix tx'oxbanil el cuybanilej bay eb:

English: “Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep and loses one of them. Does he not leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost sheep until he finds it?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok winak e xol, ay junok 100 is calnel. Ta chi c'aytok junok, chi yacan nak no' 99 etbiej tu' bay is lobal tu', cax chi toj nak sayon ec' no' max c'aytok tu', masantac'al chi yal yilchaj yuj.

English: And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi ilchaj no', chi lacontek, chi tit yin tzalojc'ulal.

English: and goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi jay bay yatut, chi wajban oc eb is yamigo, c'al eb cajan is cawilal, cax chi yalon bay eb axca ti': Tzalojanek wetok; mayal ilchaj jun in calnel max c'aylejtok, ẍi bay eb.

English: I tell you that in the same way there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay c'apax junok 99 anima, watx' is nabal naoni, cax man yowalilok chi na ba c'ul eb yin is yobtakil naoni, c'am mac chi tzaloj satcan yuj eb. Palta chi wal ayex, ta ay junok mactxel yob is beybal chi na ba yin is yobtakil, ay mimek tzalojc'ulal yuj jun chi na ba c'ul tu' satcan.

English: “Or suppose a woman has ten silver coins and loses one. Does she not light a lamp, sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok ix, ay lajonebok ch'en is tumin. Ta chi c'aytok junok yuj, chi yaoc is tzektebal, cax chi q'uison yin c'ojanc'ulalil yul yatut. Chi c'oli sayoni, masantac'al chi yal yilchaj yuj.

English: And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Rejoice with me; I have found my lost coin.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi ilchaj yuj, chi yawtej eb is yamigo, c'al eb cajan is cawilal cax chi yalon bay eb axca ti': Tzalojanek wetok, mayal ilchaj jun in tumin max c'aylejtok, ẍi bay eb.

English: In the same way, I tell you, there is rejoicing in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
Kanjobal: Xan chi wal ayex, ta ay junok mactxel yob is beybal chi na ba c'ul yin is yobtakil tu', caw wal chi tzaloj eb yángel Dios yuj, ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus continued: “There was a man who had two sons.
Kanjobal: Max yal c'apaxtek Jesús jun abix ti': Ay ab jun winak ay cawan is c'ajol.

English: The younger one said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of the estate.’ So he divided his property between them.
Kanjobal: Max ab yal nak tzunan unin bay is mam axca ti': Mam, ak' in satak t'inan ta' wioni, ẍi ab nak. Axa pojon ec' cham mamej tu' is tzetak yetal xol eb cawanil.

English: “Not long after that, the younger son got together all he had, set off for a distant country and there squandered his wealth in wild living.
Kanjobal: Jayebixto c'u tu', axa txononcan el nak tzunan unin tu' masanil tzet max ak'lay bay yuj is mam tu'. Axa toj nak bay jun conob caw wal najat tu'. A yet max apni nak bay jun conob tu', max toj nak yin yobtakil, amanc'uan max lajwi el is tumin nak.

English: After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.
Kanjobal: C'uxan wal lajwi el is tumin nak tu', max jay jun miman wajil bay jun conob bay ayic'ok. C'amxa tzet chi lo nak.

English: So he went and hired himself out to a citizen of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
Kanjobal: Axa toj nak k'anon is mulnajil bay jun cham aj conob bay tu', cax max ak'lay is mulnajil nak. Max cheklaytok iloj txitam yuj cham bay jun is c'ultak.

English: He longed to fill his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
Kanjobal: Tx'okxa chi tit wajil nak bay tu'. Chi yochejxac'al nak chi lo jabok tzet chi lo no txitam tu', palta c'am mac chi ak'on jabok yet.

English: “When he came to his senses, he said, ‘How many of my father's hired men have food to spare, and here I am starving to death!
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian, max naon ba c'ul nak axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' chi wut in ba? Manxam jantakok eb majan in mam tinani'. Chi yak' sobra tzet chi lo' eb, axa ayin paxok, lanan wak'on cam in ba yuj wajil cayti'.

English: I will set out and go back to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
Kanjobal: Yel mi watx' ok in pax bay in mam tu', cax ok walon bay axca ti': Mam, caw wal max oc in mul bay Dios, cax max oc c'apax in mul ayach.

English: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; make me like one of your hired men.’
Kanjobal: Manxa in mojok chin aloc a c'ajolok. Ut in axca junok eb a mulnajwom ti', quin chi ok walon bay.

English: So he got up and went to his father. “But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion for him; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him.
Kanjobal: Axa meltzoj nak bay yatut is mam tu'. A yet najattoc'al chi tita', max il-laytok yin yuj cham mamej tu'. Caw wal max ok' is c'ul cham yin, xan max toj cham chaoni. Yanej cham toji, max apnic'al oc cham c'atan, max lak'ontek cham, axa tz'ubon el cham is ti' tu' yuj camc'ulal.

English: “The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son. ’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon nak bay is mam tu' axca ti': Mam, caw wal max oc in mul bay Dios, cax max oc c'apax in mul ayach. A tinani' manxa in mojok chin aloc a c'ajolok, ẍi nak bay is mam tu'.

English: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham mamej tu' bay eb nak mosejal axca ti': Asek yin aymanil. Iektek an pichilej caw wal watx', cax che yaon oc an yin jun in c'ajol ti'. Che yaoc is colk'ab nak, cax che yaon oc is xanab nak.

English: Bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let's have a feast and celebrate.
Kanjobal: Chi lajwi tu', chi toj e yion no wacax caw wal bak'ech, cax che yak'on cam no'. Tol ok co watx'nej wal junok miman loj, cax ok co chaon junok miman k'in.

English: For this son of mine was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ So they began to celebrate.
