Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun in c'ajol ti', tol camnakxa ta' waloni, palta a tinani', axca tol max ictzoj pax ajok. Max c'aylejcantok, palta mayal jay paxok, ẍi cham mamej tu'. Axa yaon oc eb jun miman k'in tu'.

English: “Meanwhile, the older son was in the field. When he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.
Kanjobal: Axa nak babel winak xin, aytok nak mulnajil. Axa yet max jayoc nak cawilal na tu', max yaben nak, tol ayoc son, lanan yoc canal.

English: So he called one of the servants and asked him what was going on.
Kanjobal: Xan max yawtejtok nak jun majan is mam c'atan. Max k'anlen el nak bay: ¿Tzet yuj xan ayoc jun k'in ti'? ẍi nak bay.

English: ‘Your brother has come,’ he replied, ‘and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.’
Kanjobal: Ax pax yuj nak oẍtak max jayi. Max chekon a mam yak'lay cam no' ach'ej bak'ech wacax, yujtol a nak oẍtak tu', c'am tzet max on nak. Watx' c'ul yet max jayi, ẍi nak majan tu' bay nak.

English: “The older brother became angry and refused to go in. So his father went out and pleaded with him.
Kanjobal: Axa tit yowal nak sic'libil tu'. Majxa yal c'ul nak max oc yul na. Max eltek cham mamej, cax max bet tewok cham bay tol chi oc nak yul na.

English: But he answered his father, ‘Look! All these years I've been slaving for you and never disobeyed your orders. Yet you never gave me even a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.
Kanjobal: Palta max yal nak bay is mam tu' axca ti': Ojtak, mimanxa tiempoc'al ach wak'on serbil. C'am junelok c'am chi wikej bay chala'. Tok yuj tu' cax ayxa bay chak' junok in chiwo in chi' yetok eb wamigo yin junok in k'in.

English: But when this son of yours who has squandered your property with prostitutes comes home, you kill the fattened calf for him!’
Kanjobal: Palta a jun a c'ajol ti', max bet yak'can lajwok el a tumin yin yobtakil yetok eb ix ajmul ix. Axalaj yet chi jay nak, cax chak'on yak'lay cam no wacax caw bak'ech, ẍi nak bay is mam tu'.

English: “ ‘My son,’ the father said, ‘you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham mamej tu' bay nak axca ti': C'ajol, ach ti' ayachc'alta' ec' wetok masanil tiempo. A masanil tzet ay ayin, etc'alta' yayji wetok.

English: But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ ”
Kanjobal: Palta tinani', moj yoc jun k'in ti', cax chon tzaloji, yujtol a jun oẍtak ti', tol camnakxa ta' waloni; axa pax tinani', axca tol max ictzojajok. C'aylejnak ton tok, palta mayal jay pax ocok, ẍi is mam nak tu' bay, ẍi jun abix ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus told his disciples: “There was a rich man whose manager was accused of wasting his possessions.
Kanjobal: Max yaltek Jesús jun abix ti' bay eb is cuywom: A ab junel, ay ab jun cham patronej caw wal beyom. Ay ab jun is mayordomo cham. Axa max yabentek cham patronej tu', lanan lajwi el is tzetak yetal cham yuj nak.

English: So he called him in and asked him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you cannot be manager any longer.’
Kanjobal: Axa yawten cham nak is mayordomo tu', max yalon cham bay nak axca ti': Ay tzet chi wabaj en, xan a in mulnajil chi wak' el ti', yowalil chak'can ayin, yujtol ok ach wiel yin opiso ti', ẍi cham.

English: “The manager said to himself, ‘What shall I do now? My master is taking away my job. I'm not strong enough to dig, and I'm ashamed to beg–
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli naon nak mayordomo tu' axca ti': ¿Tzet ok wun tinani'? Ilab tol ok in yiil in patrón yin wopiso ti', palta c'am chi je' pax wuj junokxa mulnajil. Chin q'uixwi pax wec' k'anoj limosna tilak yatut anima.

English: I know what I'll do so that, when I lose my job here, people will welcome me into their houses.’
Kanjobal: A…, mayal tit yul in c'ul tzet ok wunej, caxc'al c'am in mulnajil, palta ayc'alta' eb ok in chaon bay yatut, ẍi nak.

English: “So he called in each one of his master's debtors. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
Kanjobal: Max c'oli yawten eb ay is jec bay is patrón tu' yin junjunal. Max k'anlen bay nak babel max jay axca ti': ¿Jantak a jec bay in patrón? ẍi nak bay.

English: “ ‘Eight hundred gallons of olive oil,’ he replied. “The manager told him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and make it four hundred.’
Kanjobal: 100 barril aceite comer in jec bay, ẍi nak. Ta caytu' a jec aceite tu xin, tix jun is valeal a jec ti'. Ayan chotan yin ayman. Cha watx'nen junokxa, asan 50 chot a tz'ibencan oc yin, ẍi nak mayordomo tu' bay.

English: “Then he asked the second, ‘And how much do you owe?’ “ ‘A thousand bushels of wheat,’ he replied. “He told him, ‘Take your bill and make it eight hundred.’
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu', max k'anlen bay junxa: A pax ach, ach ti', ¿jantak a jec? ẍi nak bay. Ayin ti', 100 quintal in jec trigo bay cham, ẍi junxa tu'. Ta caytu xin, tix is valeal a jec tu'. 80 quintalnej cha tz'ibej oc yin, ẍi nak bay.

English: “The master commended the dishonest manager because he had acted shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the people of the light.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham patronej tu', tol jelan jun mayordomo tu' yin elk'an, xan a eb yet yulyibank'inal ti', yelxac'al wal jelan chi yut ba eb yintak eb ayxa sakk'inalil Dios yin.

English: I tell you, use worldly wealth to gain friends for yourselves, so that when it is gone, you will be welcomed into eternal dwellings.
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, a ch'en tumin, c'unc'al k'anabax ch'en yin yobtakil, palta a beyomalil yinokab watx'ilal che k'anbalnej, yet watx' ay eb ok e yamigonej e ba yetok. Ta caytu' che yut axca tu', a yet ok lajwok yoc yopiso jun ch'en tumin tu' e yuj, ay eb ok chaon e yapni bay ay jun e yatut yin junelnej.

English: “Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with much, and whoever is dishonest with very little will also be dishonest with much.
Kanjobal: A mac watx' chi yut ba yetok jabok tzet yetal chi ak'lay bay, ac'ala' watx' ok yut ba ta miman chi ak'lay bay. A pax mac man watx'ok chi yut ba yetok jabok tzet chi ak'lay bay xin, ac'ala' man watx'ok ok yut ba ta miman chi ak'lay bay.

English: So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?
Kanjobal: Xan ta man watx'ok che yut e ba yetok beyomal bay yulyibank'inal ti', ¿xin ta chi ak'laycan jun acaw beyomal ayex?

English: And if you have not been trustworthy with someone else's property, who will give you property of your own?
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta man watx'ok che yut e ba yetok tzet man e yetok, ¿xin ta chi ak'laycan juntzan tzet yetal caw wal e yet ayex?

English: “No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.”
Kanjobal: C'am junok mactxel chi je' jun lajanc'al yak'on serbil cawanok patrón. Yujtol chi mi yajc'ulnej ba yetok junok, cax chi camc'ulnen ba yetok junokxa. Ay mi junok ay yelapnok yul sat, axa junokxa, c'am mi yelapnok yul sat. Yuj tu' xan c'am chi je' tol jun lajan co camc'ulnen jak'on serbil Dios c'al co camc'ulnen ch'en tumin, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were sneering at Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yaben eb fariseo tzetak max yal Jesús, max buchwaj eb yin Cham, tutun asan pax yin tumin ayoc nabal eb.

English: He said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of men, but God knows your hearts. What is highly valued among men is detestable in God's sight.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': Ayex ti', asan satak eb anima watx' che yut e ba, palta yojtak Dios tzetbil yili e yanimail. A juntzan tzet miman yelapnok yul sat anima, c'am chi cha' c'ul Dios.

English: “The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since that time, the good news of the kingdom of God is being preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.
Kanjobal: A ley Moisés c'al tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios payxa, ocnak yopiso masantac'al yet jaynak Juan, cham ak'om bautismo. Axa tinani' xin, yettaxc'al max jay Juan tu', max el yich yal-lay el watx' abix, yin tzetbil chi yun yoc eb anima yul k'ab Dios. Yuj tu', chi yak' eb yip masanil yoc yul k'ab.

English: It is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the least stroke of a pen to drop out of the Law.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al a satcan c'al sat tx'otx' ti', ok lajwok ec'ok, a pax jun ley tu' tamwal junok is letrail tol man ok yun tzet chi yala'.

English: “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok winak chi pojlej ba yetok yetbi, cax chi yion junokxa ix, mul chi yun jun winak tu' axca tu'. Ac'ala' junok winak chi ion junok ix ix pojlejnak ba yetok yichamil, mul chi yun c'apaxok.

English: “There was a rich man who was dressed in purple and fine linen and lived in luxury every day.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ay jun winak caw wal beyom. A pichilej caw wal can tojol chi yaocok. Watx'c'al tzet chi lo' junjun c'u.

English: At his gate was laid a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores
Kanjobal: Ay pax jun winak chi yik Lázaro, caw wal meba'. Ay juntzan mimek yabil ayiltek yin. Asanc'al ti yatut jun beyom tu' chi bet ay chotanok.

English: and longing to eat what fell from the rich man's table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.
Kanjobal: Chi c'oli yochen octok c'ajil loj chi ayc'ay yalan is meẍa jun beyom tu'. Axa juntzan no tx'i chi jayocok, chi ul lek'on no' sat juntzan yabil ayiltek yin tu'.

English: “The time came when the beggar died and the angels carried him to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried.
Kanjobal: Max jay c'ual cam nak xin, max ul ilaytok pixan nak yuj eb ángel. Max apni oc nak c'atan Abraham. Ac'ala' max jay c'apax c'ual cam jun beyom tu'. Axa mukay tu'.

English: In hell, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus by his side.
Kanjobal: Palta a is pixan, a tu' max apni bay ay is pixan eb camnak. Axa yet lanan yaben yail bay max apni tu', max aj t'ananok, najattac'al max yiltok yin Abraham, c'al Lázaro tol ayic' yetok.

English: So he called to him, ‘Father Abraham, have pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.’
Kanjobal: Axa yaj yaw tu', max yalon axca ti': Mamin Abraham, c'am mi chi ok'tek a c'ul win. Cha chektek Lázaro ayin in k'ana'. Matawal chi laaytok junok yiximal k'ab yul a', cax chi ul yaon oc jabok yin txam wak' ti', yujtol c'am chi techaj waben yail xol k'ak' ti', ẍi cham.

English: “But Abraham replied, ‘Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, while Lazarus received bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in agony.
Kanjobal: Axa yalontek Abraham tu' bay cham axca ti': Ach anima, natek tol caw wal watx' max ec' yulyibank'inal oj, a pax Lázaro ti xin, caw c'am jabok watx'il max ec' yila'. Axa tinani', lanan chaon mimanil is c'ul cayti'. Achxa lanan aben yail tinani'.

English: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been fixed, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.’
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ay wal jun miman xab olan aycan co nan co xol etok. Yuj tu', caxc'al ay eb ayic' cayti' chi yochej chi toj ayex tu', c'am chi je' k'axpoj ec' eb. Yetok ex c'apaxok, c'am chi je' e k'axpoj ec'tek cayti', ẍi Abraham tu'.

English: “He answered, ‘Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my father's house,
Kanjobal: Ta caytu xin, mamin Abraham, c'am mi chi je' cha chektok Lázaro tu' bay yatut in mam,

English: for I have five brothers. Let him warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.’
Kanjobal: bay ayic' owan wuẍtak. Chi toj yalon yab eb, yet watx' c'am chi jay eb wetok xol yailal bay ayin ec' ti', ẍi cham.

English: “Abraham replied, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets; let them listen to them.’
Kanjobal: Palta a eb oẍtak tu', ayic' tzet max tz'ibejcan Moisés, c'al tzet max tz'ibejcan eb chekbej Dios bay eb. Yacbajokab eb txiquin bay k'anej tz'ibbilcan tu', ẍi Abraham.

English: “ ‘No, father Abraham,’ he said, ‘but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
Kanjobal: Yel ton mamin Abraham, palta ta chi yil eb yictzoj aj junok mactxel xol eb camnak, ok na ba eb yin is yobtakil, ẍi cham.

English: “He said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi yacbaj eb txiquin yin tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj Moisés tu', c'al tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios, caxc'al ay junok mactxel chi ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, majc'alta' yaoc eb yin c'ul, ẍi Abraham bay cham, ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus said to his disciples: “Things that cause people to sin are bound to come, but woe to that person through whom they come.
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Yowalil chi jay juntzan tzet yetal chi on yetax el co nabal, palta ok'bal wal c'ul eb chi ak'on etax el nabal eb yet animail.

English: It would be better for him to be thrown into the sea with a millstone tied around his neck than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac ijan chi etnen el nabal junok uninto, yel mi watx' chi pixlay oc t'unan junok ch'en yet molino yin is nuk' jun tu', cax chi k'oklay aytok yul a' mar, yet watx' manchak yetnej el is nabal jun uninto tu'.

English: So watch yourselves. “If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he repents, forgive him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ilekc'al e ba. Ta ay junok e yet animail chi oc is mul ayex, che tenchanej yin is yobtakil tu'. Ta chi na ba c'ul, che yak' mimanc'ulal yin.

English: If he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times comes back to you and says, ‘I repent,’ forgive him.”
Kanjobal: Caxc'al chi oc is mul ayex ukelok chi ec' c'u, ta chi ul k'an mimanc'ulal yukelal ayex, Majxa wun junelxa, ta ẍi, yowalil che yak' mimanc'ulal, ẍi Jesús.

English: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
Kanjobal: Max yal eb chekbej Cham Jajawil bay axca ti': —Colwajan jetok yet watx' caw wal chi jaoc Dios yin co c'ul, ẍi eb.

English: He replied, “If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it will obey you.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu' axca ti': —Ta yel che yaoc Dios yin e c'ul, caxc'al jab ch'an che yut e yaon oc yin e c'ul, axca junok bak' mostaza, ok je' e yalon bay junok mimek te' ti' tol chi yocajtek ba yetokc'al xe', cax chi yawon aytok ba yul a' mar, cax ok yiken bay ok e yala'.

English: “Suppose one of you had a servant plowing or looking after the sheep. Would he say to the servant when he comes in from the field, ‘Come along now and sit down to eat’?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok on ay junok co moso chon ak'on serbil. K'inalok ayic' mulnaj ayon, ma xin iloj calnel ayic'ok, axa yet chi jay paxok: Ocan, ayan chotanok, lowan, ¿xin ta con chi bay?

English: Would he not rather say, ‘Prepare my supper, get yourself ready and wait on me while I eat and drink; after that you may eat and drink’?
Kanjobal: Palta chi mi jala': Cha balaj k'ab a camiẍ, cax cha watx'nen tzet ok in lo', cax cha batxon eltek tzet ok in lo' tu'. Okto lajwok tu' cax ok ach lowok, tekan con chi bay.

English: Would he thank the servant because he did what he was told to do?
Kanjobal: ¿Xin ta chi jal pax yuj diosalil bay jun co moso tu', yuj max yikej yunen tzet max jal tu'? Tekan c'amak.

English: So you also, when you have done everything you were told to do, should say, ‘We are unworthy servants; we have only done our duty.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axca ton junok mosejal tu', cayex ton tu' ayex ti'. A yet mayal xew e yiken masanil tzet chi cheklay e yikej yuj Dios, moj wal che yal axca ti': Ayon ti', caxc'al yak'omal on serbil Dios, caw wal c'am jelapnok jabok, yujtol asan tzet co cuenta juneni, a' max junej, moj wal quex chi, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Now on his way to Jerusalem, Jesus traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.
Kanjobal: A yet lananc'al toj Jesús yul beal Jerusalén, max eq'uel Cham bay is mojon Samaria yetok Galilea.

English: As he was going into a village, ten men who had leprosy met him. They stood at a distance
Kanjobal: A yet max apni bay jun aldea, ay lajonwan winak ayic' yul be. Ya'ay eb yuj lepra, xan maj jayoc eb c'atan Cham.

English: and called out in a loud voice, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us!”
Kanjobal: Max aj yaw eb yin ipejal axca ti': —Mamin Jesús, c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul jin, ẍi eb.

English: When he saw them, he said, “Go, show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went, they were cleansed.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús yin eb nak, max yalon axca ti': —Asek, tx'oxek e ba bay eb sacerdote, ẍi bay eb nak. Lanan wal bey eb toji, max el yilya' eb lajonwanil yin.

English: One of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.
Kanjobal: Ay jun xol eb max yila' tol max el yilya' tu' yin, max meltzoj yin aymanil. Max yalon is watx' k'anej bay Dios yin ipejal.

English: He threw himself at Jesus' feet and thanked him–and he was a Samaritan.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc bay yakantak Jesús, axa yay jajnaj tu' sat tx'otx', max yalon yuj diosal bay Cham. A nak max meltzoj tu', aj Samaria nak.

English: Jesus asked, “Were not all ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb ayic' bay tu' axca ti': —¿Tom man lajonwanok eb max elcan ilya' yin? A pax balonwanxa eb tu', ¿baytal-laj ay eb?

English: Was no one found to return and give praise to God except this foreigner?”
Kanjobal: Ti asan wal ch'an jun nak tx'ok conobal ti' max meltzoj ul yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then he said to him, “Rise and go; your faith has made you well.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay nak axca ti': —Ajan wanok, paxan. Ti mayal elcan ilya' en yujtol max aoc a c'ul yin Dios, ẍi bay nak.

English: Once, having been asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, Jesus replied, “The kingdom of God does not come with your careful observation,
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb fariseo max k'anlen bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Bak'in ok jay tiempo yet ok oc Dios co Yajawilok? ẍi eb bay. —A yet ok oc Dios yin Yajawil, c'am chi je' jilon oc yin.

English: nor will people say, ‘Here it is,’ or ‘There it is,’ because the kingdom of God is within you.”
Kanjobal: Maj je' jalon axca ti': Tix ayic' cayti', ma tix ayic' bay tu', man con chiok, yujtol a yin janimail chi yak' Dios yajawilal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then he said to his disciples, “The time is coming when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon Cham bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Ay wal jun tiempoal ok jayok, cax ok e yalon axca ti': Matawal chi jay jun chekbiltek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail junelxa, caxc'al junok c'u, quex chi, ok e yaloni. Palta man ok in jayok.

English: Men will tell you, ‘There he is!’ or ‘Here he is!’ Do not go running off after them.
Kanjobal: Ay eb ok alon ayex axca ti': Tix cayti', ma, tix ayic' bay tu', ẍi eb, ok tz'ak yalon eb. Quex toj ta wali. Quex tzakloj ta yintak eb.

English: For the Son of Man in his day will be like the lightning, which flashes and lights up the sky from one end to the other.
Kanjobal: Yujtol axca wal yet chi aj jopnaj junok rayo caw miman txequel, caytu' ok yun in jay yet jun c'ual, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
Kanjobal: Palta a tinani', yowalil ok wab yail sic'libil. Ok in intaknelay el yuj eb anima yet jun tiempoal ti'.

English: “Just as it was in the days of Noah, so also will it be in the days of the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Axa yet ok in jay paxok, axca wal tzet max uj yul tiempoal Noé, cay wal tu' tzet ok uj yet ok in jayok.

English: People were eating, drinking, marrying and being given in marriage up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb anima yet jun tiempoal tu', max low eb, max yuq'uen a' eb. Ay laj eb tol max oc yetbi. Ay eb max yatok cutz'in alibejal. Tok chi na eb ta ay tzet ok jay yiban eb. Cac'al tu' max yun eb, masantac'al yet max jay c'ual yoctok Noé yul te arca. Axa max jay jun owal aej mukwajwom, cax max cam eb masanil.

English: “It was the same in the days of Lot. People were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax yul tiempoal cham Lot. Tok ay c'apax tzet chi na eb anima. Max low c'apax eb, c'al yuq'uen a' eb, max manji eb, max txonji eb, max awalwi eb, max watx'nen eb yatut.

English: But the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max el Lot bay conob Sodoma tu', axa yayol k'ak'ej yetok azufre ayoc k'ak'al, xan max cam anima masanil yuj.

English: “It will be just like this on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
Kanjobal: Axca wal tzet max uj yet jun tiempoal tu', caytu' ok uj yet jun c'ual yet ok in jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: On that day no one who is on the roof of his house, with his goods inside, should go down to get them. Likewise, no one in the field should go back for anything.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual tu', a mac ayajtok yiban pananil yatut, caxc'al ay is tzetak yetal aycan yul na tu', manchakxa aytek ul yioni. Yetok eb aytok bay is mulnajil, manchakxa toj eb bay yatut.

English: Remember Lot's wife!
Kanjobal: Naektek tzet onnak xal yistzil Lot.

English: Whoever tries to keep his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.
Kanjobal: A eb c'am chi yochej chi cami, chi bekil eb jun k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A pax eb chi bekc'ulok cam wuj xin, a ton eb tu' ok ion k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, k'inalok ay cawanok mactxel chi way sat is tx'at yet jun ak'bal tu', jun ok ilaytok, jun ok canok.

English: Two women will be grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left.”
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay cawanok ix lanan cawni, jun ok ilaytok, jun ok canok, ẍi Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: “Where, Lord?” they asked. He replied, “Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb juntzan tu', max k'anlen eb bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿baytal ok uj axca tu'? ẍi eb. —Tzanc'al bay telancan junok mimanilej camnakxa, a tu' chi waj ba no ostoc, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then Jesus told his disciples a parable to show them that they should always pray and not give up.
Kanjobal: Max yaltek Jesús jun abix bay eb is cuywom, yuj yalon yab eb tol watx' chi txajlic'al eb masanil tiempo, cax c'am chi ispay yuj eb.

English: He said: “In a certain town there was a judge who neither feared God nor cared about men.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': A junel, ay jun cham juez bay jun conob. C'am Dios yul sat cham, c'am c'apax yet animail yul sat.

English: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, ‘Grant me justice against my adversary.’
Kanjobal: A bay jun conob tu', ay jun xal ix camnakxa yichamil. Junjunc'al c'u chi ulic' xal satak cham tu'. Chi ul yalon xal axca ti': Ay wal jun anima ayoc c'ul win. ¿C'am mi chon a watx'nej el yetok? ẍi xal.

English: “For some time he refused. But finally he said to himself, ‘Even though I don't fear God or care about men,
Kanjobal: Palta c'amc'al chi yal c'ul cham chi watx'nej el jun owal tu'. Yuj tu' xan cac'al ti' waxi ec' xal. Palta c'ojanc'ulal max na cham axca ti': Ayin ti' c'am yelapnok Dios yul in sat. C'am c'apax yelapnok junok anima ayin.

English: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will see that she gets justice, so that she won't eventually wear me out with her coming!’ ”
Kanjobal: Palta a jun xal ix ti', junjunc'al c'u cayc'al ti' yulic' xal ayin. Yuj tu', ok in watx'nej yayji jun is yowal xal tu'. Ta c'amak, majxa talaj techaj xal wuj, ta ac'ala' jay xal ayin, ẍi cham.

English: And the Lord said, “Listen to what the unjust judge says.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut naon cham juez yob is nabal tu'.

English: And will not God bring about justice for his chosen ones, who cry out to him day and night? Will he keep putting them off?
Kanjobal: A eb sic'bil el yuj Dios chi yal ba eb bay Cham c'ualil c'al ak'balil, ¿man mi ok watx'nej el Cham bay eb? ¿Xin ta pural ok watx'nej el Cham tzet chi yochej eb tu'?

English: I tell you, he will see that they get justice, and quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, ok watx'nelay el eb yuj yin aymanil. Palta a yet ok in jay junelxa, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ¿ayc'al mi mactxel chi yaocc'al c'ul yin Dios yet tu'? ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: To some who were confident of their own righteousness and looked down on everybody else, Jesus told this parable:
Kanjobal: A junxa abix ti', max yaltek Jesús bay juntzan eb watx' is beybal yalonnaji. A eb tu', c'am watx'il juntzanokxa anima yul sat eb. Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay eb axca ti':

English: “Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
Kanjobal: Ay cawan winak max bet txajlok bay templo Dios. Fariseo jun, tekom el tojlabal junxa.

English: The Pharisee stood up and prayed about himself: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other men–robbers, evildoers, adulterers–or even like this tax collector.
Kanjobal: A jun fariseo tu', lecan ajok max txajli axca ti': Ach in Diosal, chi wal yuj diosal ayach yujtol ayin ti', may in lajanok axca juntzanokxa anima. A eb anima tu', caw wal elk'om eb, man watx'ok beybal eb, chi mulji eb. Yetok c'apax jun nak tekom el tojlabal ti', yuj wal dios yujtol may in lajanok yetok nak.

English: I fast twice a week and give a tenth of all I get.’
Kanjobal: Yujtol ayin ti', cayel chin oc yin c'ajbanc'ulal junjun semana. Yetok c'apaxok, chi wak' diezmoal masanil tzet chi wi', ẍi, chi tz'ak yalon bay Dios.

English: “But the tax collector stood at a distance. He would not even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, ‘God, have mercy on me, a sinner.’
Kanjobal: A jun tekom el tojlabal tu', najatta lecantek. Caw wal chi xiw c'ul, tok max aj t'anan jabok satcan. Toc'al max mak' txam is c'ul yuj cusc'ulal, max yaloni: Ach in Diosal, c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul win jabok yujtol caw wal yobtakwom in sic'libil, ẍi bay Dios.

English: “I tell you that this man, rather than the other, went home justified before God. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex, a jun tekom el tojlabal tu', yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max al-lay watx'il yuj Dios, yet c'amto chi pax bay yatut. Axa jun fariseo tu xin, maj yal Dios tatol watx' yul sat Cham. Yujtol a mac chi yiaj can ba, chi ilay ayok. Axa mac chi yiay ba, chi ilay aj can, ẍi Jesús.

English: People were also bringing babies to Jesus to have him touch them. When the disciples saw this, they rebuked them.
Kanjobal: Ay mac max ion jay juntzan unin bay Jesús, yuj yaon ajtok Cham k'ab yiban eb; palta a yet max yilon eb cuywom axca tu', axa tenon oc wanaj eb tu', eb chi ion jay eb unin.

English: But Jesus called the children to him and said, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu' axca ti': —Chaek jay eb unin ayin. Man e tenoc wanaj eb, yujtol asan eb lajan nabal axca eb unin ti', asan eb ay yalon yet yoc yul k'ab Dios.

English: I tell you the truth, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a eb c'am chi cha Dios is yajawilok axca chaon junok unin, c'am bak'in ok oc eb yul is k'ab, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: A certain ruler asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
Kanjobal: Ay jun yajaw max k'anlej bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin Meẍtol watx', chin k'anlej ayach: ¿Tzet yetal yowalil chi wunej, cax chin chaon k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal? ẍi nak bay.

English: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus answered. “No one is good–except God alone.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yuj xan chin al watx'il? Jun ch'an mactxel watx', asan Dios.

English: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”
Kanjobal: Ojtakxa juntzan chekbanil chi alon axca ti': Manchak aoc a mul yul k'ab etbi. Manchak a mak' cam et animail. Manchak ach elk'ani. Manchak a naaj k'anej yin et animail. Ayokab yelapnok a mam c'al a txutx yul a sat, ẍi juntzan chekbanil, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “All these I have kept since I was a boy,” he said.
Kanjobal: —Chixa wikej masanil juntzan chekbanil tu' yet max in titoc yin uninal, ẍi nak bay.

English: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
Kanjobal: —Palta junto wal a tz'aknaj elok, xan asi', txoncan el masanil tzet ay ayach, cax cha pojontok tojol tu' xol eb meba'; catatu' bian ok a chaon a beyomal bay satcan. Chi lajwi tu xin, chach jay pax ayin junelxa, cax chach ec'c'al cuywok wintak, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: When he heard this, he became very sad, because he was a man of great wealth.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben nak juntzan tu', caw wal max cusaj c'ul nak, yujtol caw wal beyom sic'libil.

English: Jesus looked at him and said, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús tol max cusaj nak, axa yalon axca ti': —A wal eb beyom ti', ta ok oc eb yul k'ab Dios, ya puralil ok yun yoc eb.

English: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok no camello tinani', ¿xin ta chi eq'uel no' yul yixal junok acuẍa? Caytu' eb beyom, ta ok oc eb bay ok yak' Dios yajawil, caw wal ya puralil ok yun yoc eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: Those who heard this asked, “Who then can be saved?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb max aben juntzan k'anej tu' axca ti': —Ta caytu' axca tu xin, ¿mac wal txel ok je' colchaji? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “What is impossible with men is possible with God.”
Kanjobal: —A juntzan c'am chi je' yuj anima, chi je' yuj Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Peter said to him, “We have left all we had to follow you!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, ayon ti', max co bekcan masanil co tzetak yetal, cax max on ec'c'al cuywok entak, ẍi.

English: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus said to them, “no one who has left home or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a eb chi bekcan yatut, ma yistzil, ma is mam, ma is txutx, ma yuẍtak, ma yanab, ma yuninal, yujtol asan Cham Dios Yajaw chi yochej eb chi yak' serbil,

English: will fail to receive many times as much in this age and, in the age to come, eternal life.”
Kanjobal: yelxac'al miman ok yun chaon eb yet jun tiempoal ti'. Axa yet jun tiempoal ok jay yajtok tu', ata tu' ok cha eb is k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Jesus took the Twelve aside and told them, “We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.
Kanjobal: Axa yawten Jesús eb is cuywom lajcawanil tu' tx'oklil. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': A tinani', ti lanan jajektok bay Jerusalén. Ata tu' ok yunel masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios payxa, yet max yaloncan el eb wabixal ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti',

English: He will be handed over to the Gentiles. They will mock him, insult him, spit on him, flog him and kill him.
Kanjobal: cax ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb man israelok. Ok in is buchon eb. Ok yalon eb tzet yetal yob win, cax ok tzublok oc eb win.

English: On the third day he will rise again.”
Kanjobal: Ok in mak'lay pax yuj eb. Ok lajwok tu', cax ok in yak'on cam eb, palta a yet cabjial tu', ok in ictzonelay pax ajok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The disciples did not understand any of this. Its meaning was hidden from them, and they did not know what he was talking about.
Kanjobal: Palta maj nachaj el jabok yuj eb. Man yojtakok eb jabok tzet chi yal elapnok juntzan max yal tu', xan maj nachaj el yuj eb.

English: As Jesus approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yapni oc Jesús bay conob Jericó, ay jun nak c'am chi je' yilwi, chotan ay ti be. Lanan k'anon sabal bay anima chi ec' yul be tu'.

English: When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.
Kanjobal: Max yaben nak tol xiwil anima chi bil bey yul be tu'. Axa k'anlen nak yab tu', tzet yuj xiwil eb chi beyi.

English: They told him, “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”
Kanjobal: Axa yal-lay bay nak, tol a Jesús aj Nazaret chi ec' tu'.

English: He called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max aj yaw yin ipejal axca ti': —Jesús, ach yinatil David, ¿c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul win? ẍi nak bay.

English: Those who led the way rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Kanjobal: Axa eb babel satak Cham max tenchanen nak, yet watx' chi tz'inji, palta tol max aj can yel yaw nak: —Ach yinatil David, ¿c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul win? ẍi.

English: Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,
Kanjobal: Axa yoc wanaj Jesús, max yak'on bet tit nak. Max lajwi jayoc nak c'atan Cham, max k'anlen bay nak axca ti':

English: “What do you want me to do for you?” “Lord, I want to see,” he replied.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet chochej chach wutej? ẍi bay nak. —Mamin, chi wochej cha jak in sat ti', ẍi nak bay Cham.

English: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has healed you.”
Kanjobal: —Jakchajokab can a sat. Ti mayal watx'ji, yujtol max aoc a c'ul win, ẍi Jesús bay nak.

English: Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they also praised God.
Kanjobal: Yet wal jun bek tu', max jakchaj sat nak. Yuj tu xin, max tzakloj nak yintak Cham. Max yalon nak watx' k'anej bay Dios. Yetok c'apax masanil eb max ilon jun tu', max yal eb is watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc Jesús bay conob Jericó, cax max ec'jab yul conob tu'.

English: A man was there by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector and was wealthy.
Kanjobal: Ay jun anima beyom bay tu', chi yik Zaqueo. Sat tekom el tojlabal yayji bay jun conob tu'.

English: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but being a short man he could not, because of the crowd.
Kanjobal: Axa Zaqueo tu', caw wal chi yochejc'al chi yil yin Jesús, tzetbil wal yili, palta c'amc'al chi je' yiloni, yujtol xiwil anima oyan oc yin Cham yet chi beyi, yetok c'apaxok, yuj yaliẍ tel Zaqueo tu'.

English: So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore-fig tree to see him, since Jesus was coming that way.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max k'ok babjok ba, yak'on yip. Axa yajtok xol k'ab jun te sicómoro ti be tu', yuj yilon yin Jesús yet chi ec' yich jun te' tu'.

English: When Jesus reached the spot, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, come down immediately. I must stay at your house today.”
Kanjobal: A yet max eq'uel Cham yich te te' tu', max ajtok t'anan Cham yin, max yalon Cham bay axca ti': —Zaqueo, ayantek ayman, yujtol a bay atut ok in apnok wak' in posada, ẍi ajtok bay.

English: So he came down at once and welcomed him gladly.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al yab Zaqueo tu', max aytek lemnaj yin ayman, max chaon apnok yin tzalojc'ulalil bay yatut.

English: All the people saw this and began to mutter, “He has gone to be the guest of a ‘sinner.’ ”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb anima axca tu', xiwil tzet chi yal eb yin Jesús, yujtol max apni oc yak' posada bay yatut jun yob is beybal.

English: But Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord! Here and now I give half of my possessions to the poor, and if I have cheated anybody out of anything, I will pay back four times the amount.”
Kanjobal: Axa yaj lecan Zaqueo tu', max yalon bay Cham Jajawil axca ti': —A tinani' Mamin, jantak tzet ay ayin, nanc'al ok wiayok. Axca wet ok canok, caytu' yet eb meba' ok wak'a'. Ta ay eb max wetnej, ta ay eb max welk'anej is tumin, canebxa ok wut wak'on q'uexel bay eb, ẍi.

English: Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A tinani', mayal cha eb aj na ti' is colbanil, yujtol wal yel, yinatil c'apax Abraham jun winak ti'.

English: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save what was lost.”
Kanjobal: Ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', max quin jay yuj in sayon eb c'aynaktok, cax chin coloncan el eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: While they were listening to this, he went on to tell them a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and the people thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear at once.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yaben eb tzet chi yal Jesús, ay jun abix max yaltek bay eb. Yujtol lanan yapni oc eb cawilal Jerusalén, cax chi naon eb tol a Dios toxa chi occan yajawilal bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: He said: “A man of noble birth went to a distant country to have himself appointed king and then to return.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': A yet junel, ay jun winak max toj bay jun conob najat yuj toj chaon yopiso, yuj yoc yajawilal bay is conob bay cajan.

English: So he called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas. ‘Put this money to work,’ he said, ‘until I come back.’
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi toji, max yawten lajonwan eb is moso. Ay juntzan ch'en tumin mimek sat max yak'can bay junjun eb. Lajanc'al bisil ch'en max yak'can bay eb. Axa yaloncan bay eb axca ti': Ak'ek negocio yetok juntzan ch'en tumin ti', masantac'al chin jayi, cax che yak'on ch'en ayin junelxa, ẍican bay eb. Lajwic'al tu', axa toj tu'.

English: “But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him to say, ‘We don't want this man to be our king.’
Kanjobal: Palta a eb yet conob, caw wal chi chichon oc c'ul eb yin. Yuj tu' xan tzakan toj cawan oxwan is chekbej eb yintak, max bet yalon eb bay eb chi aon oc yopiso cham tu' axca ti': A jun winak tu', caw wal c'am chi yal co c'ul chi oc co yajawilok bay co conob, ẍi eb.

English: “He was made king, however, and returned home. Then he sent for the servants to whom he had given the money, in order to find out what they had gained with it.
Kanjobal: Palta max ak'layc'alta' yopiso yoc yajawilal. Max lajwi tu', max jayoc bay is conob. Axa yawten eb is moso bay max yak'can ch'en tumin tu', yuj yaben ocok jantakxa yune' ch'en mayal yi' junjun eb.

English: “The first one came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has earned ten more.’
Kanjobal: Xan max jayoc jun babel moso, max yalon axca ti': Patrón, a ch'en a tumin max ak'can ayin, lajoneb yune' ch'en max yi', ẍi bay cham.

English: “ ‘Well done, my good servant!’ his master replied. ‘Because you have been trustworthy in a very small matter, take charge of ten cities.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham bay tu': Watx' xin. Ach ti' caw wal watx' ach ayin. Caxc'al txench'an max wak'can ayach, palta watx'c'al max ot a nabal yetok. Yuj tu' xan ti chi waoc opiso yin yajawilal yiban lajonebok conob, ẍi bay.

English: “The second came and said, ‘Sir, your mina has earned five more.’
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max jayoc junxa mosejal. Max yalon bay is patrón tu' axca ti': Patrón, a ch'en a tumin max ak'can ayin, oyebxa bisil yune' ch'en max yi', ẍi bay.

English: “His master answered, ‘You take charge of five cities.’
Kanjobal: Xan max yal c'apax cham patronej tu' bay axca ti': Watx' xin. Ach ti' ok wak' opiso oc yajawilal yiban oyeb conob, ẍi cham bay.

English: “Then another servant came and said, ‘Sir, here is your mina; I have kept it laid away in a piece of cloth.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu' max jayoc junxa. Max yalon bay is patrón axca ti': Patrón, tix ch'en a tumin ti'. C'uban ch'en wuj yul jun in tx'ambal,

English: I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You take out what you did not put in and reap what you did not sow.’
Kanjobal: yujtol wojtak, caw wal ch'aan ach. Yujtol ach ti', toxac'al cha cha' tzet chi yi' junokxa anima. Toxac'al cha wajaj bay tzet mayachnak max awa', ẍi bay cham.

English: “His master replied, ‘I will judge you by your own words, you wicked servant! You knew, did you, that I am a hard man, taking out what I did not put in, and reaping what I did not sow?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham bay axca ti': Ach ti', mosejal ach toni, palta yob ach. Yuj juntzan max al ti', xan ok ach in beyc'ulnej. Ilab, ojtakxa tol ch'aan in. Toxac'al chin cha' tzet yetal chi yi' junok anima. Chin wajaj bay mayinnak max quin awwi.

English: Why then didn't you put my money on deposit, so that when I came back, I could have collected it with interest?’
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuj maj apaxtok ch'en majanil bay junokxa mactxel, yet watx' chi yi' ch'en jabok yuca'? K'inalok ta max atok ch'en majanil, yet max in jayi max in chaon yuca' ch'en, ẍi cham bay.

English: “Then he said to those standing by, ‘Take his mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.’
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay eb junej ayic' yetok tu' axca ti': Iek ec' ch'en bay nak. Che yak'on ch'en bay nak ay lajoneb bisil yune' ch'en yet max yi', ẍi bay eb.

English: “ ‘Sir,’ they said, ‘he already has ten!’
Kanjobal: Palta patrón, a nak chal tol chi ak'lay ch'en bay nak tu', ayxa lajoneb yune' ch'en yet nak, ẍi eb bay cham.

English: “He replied, ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but as for the one who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.
Kanjobal: Palta chi wal ayex, a mac ayxa yet, ok ak'lay nanokxa bay. Axa mac c'am yet, ok ilay ec' jabok tzet ayxa bay.

English: But those enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them–bring them here and kill them in front of me.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa eb ajc'ul oc win, eb max ochen tol maj in oc yin wopiso ti', chi toj e yi eb, chi lajwi jay eb, che yak'on cam eb in satak, ẍi cham patronej tu', ẍi Jesús.

English: After Jesus had said this, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon Jesús jun abix tu', max chaon be toj bay Jerusalén yetok eb is cuywom.

English: As he approached Bethphage and Bethany at the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, saying to them,
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb cawilal conob Betfagé yetok Betania, bay yich tzalan Olivo, max chekon babjok cawan eb is cuywom.

English: “Go to the village ahead of you, and as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi toj eb, cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Asek bay jun aldea co cawilal ti'. Ay jun no burro ok ilchaj e yuj bay tu', c'alan no'. C'amto junok mac chi aj yiban no'. Che xuyil no', cax che yiontek no' ayin.

English: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ tell him, ‘The Lord needs it.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi alon ayex axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj xan che xuyil no'? ta ẍi, tix che yut tak'wok e ba ti': Tol ay ok oc no' yuj Cham Jajawil, quex chi bay, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Those who were sent ahead went and found it just as he had told them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa toj eb cuywom tu'. Max ilchaj yuj eb, axcac'al max yun yal-lay bay eb yuj Jesús.

English: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan xuyon el eb no burro tu', max jayoc yajaw no', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che xuyil no'? ẍi bay eb.

English: They replied, “The Lord needs it.”
Kanjobal: —Tol ay ok oc no' yuj Cham Jajawil, ẍi eb.

English: They brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt and put Jesus on it.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yiontek eb no' bay Jesús. Ay eb anima max ya ajtok is pichil tz'amok no', cax max alay ajtok Jesús yiban no' yuj eb.

English: As he went along, people spread their cloaks on the road.
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa beyi, max c'oli litx'ban ay eb is pichil yulak be bay t'inan yeq'uel Cham.

English: When he came near the place where the road goes down the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began joyfully to praise God in loud voices for all the miracles they had seen:
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa yapni oc bay pitxanil tzalan Olivo tu', max aj yaw masanil eb is cuywom yin ipejal yuj tzalojc'ulal. Max c'oli yalon eb is watx' k'anej bay Dios yuj juntzan milagro max yil eb.

English: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Jalek watx' k'anej bay Cham co Reyal max cheklaytek yuj Cham Jajawil. Caw wal ay junc'ulal satcan, mimanbilokab co Diosal, ẍi eb.

English: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzan eb fariseo ayoc xol anima tu'. Max yal eb bay Cham axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿tzet yuj c'am cha tenchanej juntzan a cuywom ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: “I tell you,” he replied, “if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Chi wal ayex, ta chi tz'inji ay eb, cax c'amxa mac chi aj yaw, axa ch'en ch'en ti' ok aj yaw, ẍi bay eb.

English: As he approached Jerusalem and saw the city, he wept over it
Kanjobal: A yet max yilontok Jesús conob Jerusalén, yet max apni oc is cawilal, caw wal max ok' yuj.

English: and said, “If you, even you, had only known on this day what would bring you peace–but now it is hidden from your eyes.
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon axca ti': A wal yet jun c'u ti' ex aj conob, aktam wal tol max nachaj e yuj tzetbil che yut e chaon junc'ulal Dios. Palta a tinani', c'amxa chi je' nachaj el e yuj, yujtol ebebilxa el ayex.

English: The days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you and encircle you and hem you in on every side.
Kanjobal: Xan ay wal jun tiempoal ok jayok, axa eb ajc'ul yin jun conob ti', ok corralnej aj eb. Ok oymoj eb yinlak, axa yak'on eb owal yin tu'.

English: They will dash you to the ground, you and the children within your walls. They will not leave one stone on another, because you did not recognize the time of God's coming to you.”
Kanjobal: Pilan ok mak'ay bulan eb jun conob ti', sat tx'otx'. Ok mak'on cam eb eb anima. A ch'en ch'en latz'bil yin nail bay jun conob ti' ok ec' bulnaj ch'en masanil. Caytu' ok yuncan elok, yujtol a yet jun tiempoal ti', max yochej Dios max tx'ox watx'c'ulal ayex, palta maj nachaj el e yuj, ẍi Jesús.

English: Then he entered the temple area and began driving out those who were selling.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max octok Jesús yul templo Dios. Max yukten eltek eb chi txonji.

English: “It is written,” he said to them, “ ‘My house will be a house of prayer’; but you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Yalnakcan Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': A in templo ti', yetc'al txaj yayji, ẍicanok, palta ayex ti', axcaxac'al junok nach'en bay chi c'ubaj el ba eb elk'om, caytu' che yutej, ẍi bay eb.

English: Every day he was teaching at the temple. But the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the leaders among the people were trying to kill him.
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al c'u max betic' Jesús cuywaj bay yul templo Dios tu'. Axa eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb yajaw conob tu', max say eb tzet chi yut yak'on cam eb.

English: Yet they could not find any way to do it, because all the people hung on his words.
Kanjobal: Palta maj nachaj tzet chi yut eb, yujtol ay wal oc c'ul masanil anima yabxalwi bay.

English: In those days Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken of the entire Roman world.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', a cham Augusto, cham yajaw bay Roma max aloni tol chi ilay aj is bisil masanil anima yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: (This was the first census that took place while Quirinius was governor of Syria.)
Kanjobal: Babelto yilay aj bisil eb junel tu'. A yet ayoc cham Cirenio gobernadoral bay jun lugar chi yik Siria, max ilay aj bisilej tu'.

English: And everyone went to his own town to register.
Kanjobal: Masanil anima max betic' bay is conob yuj bet tz'iben ba.

English: So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to Bethlehem the town of David, because he belonged to the house and line of David.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max betic' José bay Belén yul yet Judea, petoj bay Nazaret yul yet Galilea. A bay max bet tu', a tu' aljinak cham rey David payxa; yujtol yinatil David José tu', xan yowalil a tu' max bet tz'ibej ba.

English: He went there to register with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him and was expecting a child.
Kanjobal: Max betic' yetok María. Watx'xa yayji trato eb, yobixxa ix.

English: While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born,
Kanjobal: A yet ayic' eb bay Belén tu', max jay tiempoal yalji jun unin tu',

English: and she gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
Kanjobal: xan a ta bay tu' max alji nak is babel unin ix. Max chuloc yul balej. Max lajwi tu', cax max telban ay ix jun unin tu' yul jucubal sacate no chej, yujtol c'amxa bay colan bay max ayji eb bay jun mesón ay bay tu'.

English: And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night.
Kanjobal: A bay cawilal conob Belén tu', ay juntzan ilom calnel chi taynej is calnel yet ak'balil bay jun ac'al.

English: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
Kanjobal: Jacẍic'al max tx'oxaj ba jun yángel Cham Jajawil bay eb, max ay c'apax ul jopnaj tzekekial Cham Jajawil tu' yiban eb. Caw wal max xiw eb yuj.

English: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jun ángel tu' bay eb axca ti': Manchak ex xiwi, yujtol watx' abix jun chi ul wal ayex, caw wal ok tzaloj aj masanil anima yuj.

English: Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is Christ the Lord.
Kanjobal: A bay Belén, bay is conob David, a tu' max alji jun e Colomal tinani', a ton Cham Cristo, Cham Jajawil.

English: This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger.”
Kanjobal: Axca ti' ok yun nachaj el e yuj tol a': Ok e yil yin tol ayoc is bal, telan ay yul jucubal sacate no chej, ẍi jun ángel tu'.

English: Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,
Kanjobal: Jacẍic'al max tx'ox c'apax aj ba junxa miman bulan ángel petoj bay satcan yetok jun babel max tx'oxaj ba tu'. Axa yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios axca ti':

English: “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to men on whom his favor rests.”
Kanjobal: ¡Jalek watx' k'anej bay Dios aj satcan! ¡Ayokab junc'ulal yetok eb anima bay max tx'ox is watx'c'ulal bay yulyibank'inal ti'! ẍi eb.

English: When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let's go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has told us about.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa paxaj eb ángel bay satcan tu'. Axa c'oli yalon eb waynem calnel tu' axca ti': —Tonek bay Belén, toj jilek jun tzet max uj tu', a ton juntzan max yak' Cham Jajawil al-lay ayon, ẍi eb.

English: So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.
Kanjobal: Axa toj eb yin aymanil tu'. Max ilchaj María yetok José yuj eb, max yilon eb yin jun unin tu' yul jucubal sacate no chej.

English: When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about this child,
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb yin jun unin tu', pilan max yal eb tzet yetal max al-lay yin, yuj jun ángel max ulic' tu'.

English: and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb max aben juntzan tu', max c'ayaj c'ul eb masanil yabeni.

English: But Mary treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart.
Kanjobal: Axa pax María xin, toc'al chi c'ubajcan masanil juntzan tu' yul is c'ul, cax chi naobtaneni.

English: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa pax eb waynem calnel tu'. Max yalon eb is watx' k'anej bay Dios. Max yalon eb yuj diosalil bay, yuj tzet max bet yab eb, c'al yuj tzet max bet yil eb, yujtol axcac'al max yun yal-lay bay eb, caytu' max uji.

English: On the eighth day, when it was time to circumcise him, he was named Jesus, the name the angel had given him before he had been conceived.
Kanjobal: Ukubixial yalji jun unin tu', max alay oc jun yechelej chi yik circuncisión yin is mimanil, cax max yak'on eb yik Jesús. A ton jun biej ti' yalnakcan cham ángel bay María, yet manto oc jun unin tu' yin.

English: When the time of their purification according to the Law of Moses had been completed, Joseph and Mary took him to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
Kanjobal: A is beybal eb israel, yowalil ay jun tiempoal chi sakbanej ba eb ix chi alji yune', axca yalon ley Moisés. Yuj tu' xan a yet max lajwi tiempoal sakbanen ba María, max yiontok eb jun unin tu' bay Jerusalén. Max bet yak'on eb bay Cham Jajawil.

English: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male is to be consecrated to the Lord” ),
Kanjobal: Max yun eb axca tu', yujtol caytu' tz'ibelaycan yul ley Cham Jajawil axca ti': A junjun winak unin chi babji yalji, yet Cham Jajawil yayji, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: and to offer a sacrifice in keeping with what is said in the Law of the Lord: “a pair of doves or two young pigeons.”
Kanjobal: Yuj c'apax yak'on eb is xajanbal, xan max bet eb. Axca ti' yalon leyal xajanbal: Yowalil cac'onok no paloma, ma cac'onok no cuajte', ẍi.

English: Now there was a man in Jerusalem called Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ayic' jun cham anima chi yik Simeón bay Jerusalén tu'. Caw wal watx' is beybal cham, asan bay Dios chi yal ba. Echbanebilc'al jay tiempoal yuj, yet ok colchaj eb yet israelal. Ayoc cham yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo.

English: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
Kanjobal: A' ak'nej nachaj el yuj, tol majto camok masantac'al ok yilcan oc yin Cristo, Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil.

English: Moved by the Spirit, he went into the temple courts. When the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what the custom of the Law required,
Kanjobal: A yet max ilaytek nene' Jesús bay templo Dios yuj José c'al is txutx, yuj yiken eb axca yaloncan yul ley, max ikbelaytok cham Simeón tu' bay templo Dios yuj Cham Espíritu Santo,

English: Simeon took him in his arms and praised God, saying:
Kanjobal: axa chaon ec' cham Simeón tu' jun unin tu', max batxon ajok. Axa yalon watx' k'anej bay Dios yuj axca ti':

English: “Sovereign Lord, as you have promised, you now dismiss your servant in peace.
Kanjobal: Mamin, a tinani', chixa je' in cam yin junc'ulal, ayin a chekbej in ti', yujtol mayal wal yun axca max ot ak'oncan a ti' ayin.

English: For my eyes have seen your salvation,
Kanjobal: Ti wal mayal wilcan oc yin jun Colwajwom ti'.

English: which you have prepared in the sight of all people,
Kanjobal: A ton jun ti' max ak' yopiso satak masanil anima bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: a light for revelation to the Gentiles and for glory to your people Israel.”
Kanjobal: A' ok ak'on sakk'inal bay yanimail eb man israelok, axa ayon a conob Israel on ti xin, caw miman ok yun jeloc yuj, ẍi cham Simeón tu'.

English: The child's father and mother marveled at what was said about him.
Kanjobal: Axa José yetok is txutx Jesús max c'ayaj c'ul eb yaben tzet max yal cham yin nak unin tu'.

English: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother: “This child is destined to cause the falling and rising of many in Israel, and to be a sign that will be spoken against,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max k'anon cham watx'c'ulal Dios yiban eb. Max yalon bay María, txutx Jesús axca ti': —Ilabi, a jun unin ti', txequelxa yayji tol xiwil eb jet israelal ok somchaj el c'ul yuj; palta xiwil c'apax eb ok watx'nej is beybal yuj. A' ok tx'oxonok tzetbil chi yun colchaj eb, palta xiwil eb ok intaknenelok.

English: so that the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed. And a sword will pierce your own soul too.”
Kanjobal: Caytu' ok yun txecloj elok, tzet chi na' junjun anima. A pax ach ti xin, ay jun c'ual ok oc pitz'an cusc'ulal yin a c'ul yuj; axca wal espada ok teklay oc en ok abej, ẍi cham Simeón tu' bay María.

English: There was also a prophetess, Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old; she had lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jun xal ix chekbej Dios ayic' bay tu' chi yik Ana. Cutz'in jun cham chi yik Fanuel, yinatil Aser. Caw wal ixnamxa xal. Max oclej yetbi yet caw unin ixto. Ukebnej abil yilejnak ba xal yetok yichamil tu', cax max cam cham.

English: and then was a widow until she was eighty-four. She never left the temple but worshiped night and day, fasting and praying.
Kanjobal: A yet tu', 84 abilxa can xal tx'oklil. Ac'al bay templo Dios ayc'al ec' xal, c'ualil c'al ak'balil, cac'al ti' yak'on serbil xal Cham Jajawil. Chi yak' xal c'ajbanc'ulal, cax chi txajli xal.

English: Coming up to them at that very moment, she gave thanks to God and spoke about the child to all who were looking forward to the redemption of Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc xal c'atan José yetok María yet jun bek tu'. Max yalon xal yuj diosalil bay Dios. Max lajwi tu', max c'oli yalon el xal yabixal Jesús xol jantak eb chi echbanen jay tiempoal colchaj el conob Jerusalén tu'.

English: When Joseph and Mary had done everything required by the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth.
Kanjobal: A yet max xew yiken eb axca yalon ley Cham Jajawil yuj eb unin chi alji, axa pax eb bay conob Nazaret tu' junelxa, bay yul yet Galilea.

English: And the child grew and became strong; he was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.
Kanjobal: Axa jun unin tu xin, yelc'ulal ch'ibi. Chi yionc'al el yip c'al jelanil. Max yak'onc'al Dios watx'c'ulal bay.

English: Every year his parents went to Jerusalem for the Feast of the Passover.
Kanjobal: Junjun abil chi betic' is mam c'al is txutx Jesús bay Jerusalén, yuj bet eb iloj k'in Pascua.

English: When he was twelve years old, they went up to the Feast, according to the custom.
Kanjobal: Lajcawebxa abil k'inal Jesús, ajun max bet yetok eb iloj k'in tu', axca yalon ley.

English: After the Feast was over, while his parents were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but they were unaware of it.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al k'in tu', cax max meltzoj eb. Axa Jesús xin, max cancan bay Jerusalén, palta man yojtakok is txutx c'al José tu' tatol max cani.

English: Thinking he was in their company, they traveled on for a day. Then they began looking for him among their relatives and friends.
Kanjobal: A naon eb, tol max tzakloj yintak eb anima max meltzoj c'apaxok, xan a yet yayc'ualil max sayic' eb xol yican c'al xol yamigo eb.

English: When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am mac max ilchaj yuj eb. Yuj tu' xan max meltzoj pax eb yintak junelxa, cax max bet sayon ec' eb nak bay Jerusalén tu'.

English: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
Kanjobal: Cabjialxa tu', max ilchaj nak yuj eb yul yamak'il templo Dios. Chotan ay nan xol eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Chi abxalwi bay eb, cax chi yak'on c'apax k'anlebal bay eb.

English: Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and his answers.
Kanjobal: Toxac'al chi c'ayaj c'ul eb chi abxalwi yin tzet chi yal Jesús, yujtol caw wal yojtak sic'libil, watx'c'al chi yut tak'wok ba bay eb.

English: When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon José c'al is txutx tu' tol a tu' ayoctok, caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb yuj. Yuj tu' xan max yal is txutx tu' bay axca ti': —Ach wune', ¿tzet yuj xan caytu' chon otej? Caw wal chin oc il oj, c'al a mam ti'. Xiwil chach co sayic'ok, ẍi xal bay.

English: “Why were you searching for me?” he asked. “Didn't you know I had to be in my Father's house?”
Kanjobal: —Palta, ¿tzet yuj xan chin e sayic'ok? ¿Tom man e yojtakok tol a bay yatut in Mam yowalil chin ayji? ẍi bay eb.

English: But they did not understand what he was saying to them.
Kanjobal: Palta maj nachaj el yuj eb tzet max yal bay eb tu'.

English: Then he went down to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. But his mother treasured all these things in her heart.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa pax yetok eb bay Nazaret tu'. Yikemc'al max yut ba bay eb axcac'alta' is beybal. Max c'ubaj xal txutxej tu' juntzan ti' yul is c'ul, max c'oli naobtaneni.

English: And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
Kanjobal: Axa Jesús xin, ac'ala' ch'ibajok, c'al yaj can is nabal. Caw wal chi tzaloj Dios yetok, caw c'apax chi tzaloj eb anima yetok.

English: One day as he was teaching the people in the temple courts and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, together with the elders, came up to him.
Kanjobal: Ay jun c'ual max cuywaj Jesús xol eb anima yul yamak'il templo Dios. Max c'oli yalon el k'anejal yet colbanilej bay eb. Axa eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb ichamtak winak ay yopiso, max jayoc eb bay.

English: “Tell us by what authority you are doing these things,” they said. “Who gave you this authority?”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Al ayon xin tzet ekbej, yuj tu' xan max on juntzan tu' ewi. ¿Mactxel ak'nej ekbej tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “I will also ask you a question. Tell me,
Kanjobal: —Ayin ti', ok in k'anlej c'apax junok tzet yetal ayex. Alek ayin.

English: John's baptism–was it from heaven, or from men?”
Kanjobal: ¿Mac ak'nej yikbej Juan, xan max yak' bautizar anima? ¿Dios mi, ma anima? ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Why didn't you believe him?’
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli yalubtanen eb is xol tu' yuj tzet max yal tu'. Max yalon eb axca ti': ¿Tzet chi jut jalon bay? Ta chi jala' tol a Dios ak'nej yikbej Juan tu', ok mi yal ayon axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj xan c'am che ya pax oc yin e c'ul xin? ẍi mi.

English: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, because they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
Kanjobal: Palta ta chi jala', tol a anima ak'nej yikbej tu', ok tit yowal masanil anima jin, cax ok on is k'okch'ennen cam eb, yujtol a Juan tu', chekbej Dios yayji yul sat eb masanil, ẍi eb.

English: So they answered, “We don't know where it was from.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max yal eb tol man yojtakok eb mactxel ak'nej yikbej Juan tu'.

English: Jesus said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon pax Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Ta caytu xin, maj c'apax wal ayex mac ak'nej wikbej wunen juntzan tu', ẍi.

English: He went on to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, rented it to some farmers and went away for a long time.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yalontek Jesús jun abix ti' bay eb anima wajan ec' tu'. Max yalon axca ti': Ay jun anima max awon juntzan uva sat is tx'otx'. Max xew yawon canok, max yaon cantok is tx'otx' tu' majanil yetokc'al yawojal bay juntzan eb mulnajwom. Axa yel bay jun lugar tu'. Najatil tiempo max ayji bay junokxa lugar.

English: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenants beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ajapnok tiempoal wajlay aj an, max chekontok cham aj tx'otx' tu' jun is chekbej, max bet k'anon yuca' tx'otx' tx'otx' tu' yetokc'al yawojal tu', palta toc'al max bet yetnej ba, max uktelay meltzoj yuj eb. C'am jabok yuca' tx'otx' max yi'.

English: He sent another servant, but that one also they beat and treated shamefully and sent away empty-handed.
Kanjobal: Xan max chektok cham aj tx'otx' tu' junxa is chekbej, palta toc'al c'apax max bet yetnej ba. C'am watx'il max yut ba eb bay, max yukten pax eb. Ac'ala' c'am jabok tzet max ak'lay bay.

English: He sent still a third, and they wounded him and threw him out.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max chekontok junxa. Max apnic'al oc junxa tu' bay eb, max mak'on eb, max yasji, max bet k'okoncan el eb.

English: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love; perhaps they will respect him.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham aj tx'otx' tu' axca ti': ¿Tzetlaj watx' chi wutej? Ti chin chektok jun in c'ajol bay caw wal chi camil in c'ul yin ti'. Tekan ok xiw eb bay, ẍi cham.

English: “But when the tenants saw him, they talked the matter over. ‘This is the heir,’ they said. ‘Let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
Kanjobal: Axa max yilontok eb mulnajwom tol lanan yapni nak c'ajolej tu'. Max wajan alnen eb axca ti': Ilab tol a nak c'ajolej tu' chi jayi. A yet ok cam mam nak, a' ok ioncan tx'otx' tx'otx' ti' satakok. Co mak'ek camok, yet watx' ayonxa chi jiekcan is tx'otx' ti', ẍi eb.

English: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. “What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
Kanjobal: Xan maxc'al apni oc nak bay eb, max tzac'ontek eb. Max yiontok eb tiel tx'otx' tx'otx' tu'. Ata tu' max bet yak' cam eb. Xan chin k'anlej ayex, ¿tzettax ok utlay eb mulnajwom tu' yuj cham che na'?

English: He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” When the people heard this, they said, “May this never be!”
Kanjobal: A wal caw cham ok tok cax ok tok yak'on lajwok cham eb, axa yaoncantok is tx'otx' tu' majanil bay juntzanokxa mactxel, ẍi Jesús. Lajwi yaben eb max aben jun ti' axa yalon eb axca ti': —¡Ay! Matawal man cayok tu' chi uji, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus looked directly at them and asked, “Then what is the meaning of that which is written: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone ’?
Kanjobal: Palta max oc t'anan Jesús yin eb, max yalon axca ti': —Palta ¿tzettax chi yal elapnok yuj jun ch'en tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un che na', bay chi yal axca ti'? A ch'en ch'en max yintaknej el eb watx'nem na, a ch'en max oc yin jolom txiquin na, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi mak'ay ba yiban jun ch'en tu', coc'xac'al chi yun k'ajtok. Axa junok mactxel chi ayc'ay jun ch'en tu' yiban, coc'xac'al chi yuncan yuj ch'en, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The teachers of the law and the chief priests looked for a way to arrest him immediately, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajaw yayji xol eb sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, max yochej eb tol max mitx' eb Jesús yin aymanil, yujtol max nachaj el yuj eb, tol a eb max al-lay yin jun abix tu'. Palta max xiwaj eb bay eb conob.

English: Keeping a close watch on him, they sent spies, who pretended to be honest. They hoped to catch Jesus in something he said so that they might hand him over to the power and authority of the governor.
Kanjobal: Catatu' max chekontok eb jaywan is chekbej toj makon yila' ta c'uxan ay bay chi el q'uexnaj Jesús yin is k'anej. A yet max apni oc eb tu', watx'xac'al chi tz'ak yut ba eb, yet chi ayc'ay Cham yuj eb yin junok k'anej, yet watx' chi yitok eb satak yajaw.

English: So the spies questioned him: “Teacher, we know that you speak and teach what is right, and that you do not show partiality but teach the way of God in accordance with the truth.
Kanjobal: Axa tz'ak yalon eb bay axca ti': —Meẍtol, jojtak sic'libil tol tojolc'al chot alon junok tzet yetal, watx' pax a cuywaji. C'am junok mactxel bay chach xiwi, yujtol lajanc'al yelapnok junjun mactxel yul a sat. Jojtak c'apaxok, a jun beybalej chi cha c'ul Dios, a chak' cuylay wal yin yel.

English: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi co k'anlej ayach, a ch'en tumin chi k'anlay el jin yuj cham yajaw bay Roma, ¿ay mi leyalil chi jak' ch'en, ma c'amak? ẍi eb bay.

English: He saw through their duplicity and said to them,
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Jesús tol man watx'ok tzet lanan naon oc eb yin, yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti':

English: “Show me a denarius. Whose portrait and inscription are on it?”
Kanjobal: —Tx'oxek junok ch'en tumin tu' wila'. ¿Mactxel jun ayoc yechel sat yin ch'en ti'? ¿Mactxel jun tz'ibbil oc is bi ti'? ẍi bay eb. —A ton yechel sat cham yajaw bay Roma, yetokc'al is bi cham, ẍi eb.

English: “Caesar's,” they replied. He said to them, “Then give to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's.”
Kanjobal: —Ta axca tu xin, ak'ek tzet yetal yetc'alta' cham yajaw tu' bay. Axa tzet yetal yetc'alta' Dios, ak'ek c'apax bay, ẍi bay eb.

English: They were unable to trap him in what he had said there in public. And astonished by his answer, they became silent.
Kanjobal: Maj uj yuj eb yayc'ay yin junok is k'anej satak anima, xan caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb. Tz'inxac'al, ẍi eb.

English: Some of the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Jesus with a question.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', ay juntzan eb saduceo max jayoc bay Jesús, eb chi aloni tol c'am chi ictzoj aj eb camnak. Axa yalon eb bay Cham axca ti':

English: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and have children for his brother.
Kanjobal: —Meẍtol, a Moisés tz'ibnejcan axca ti': K'inalok ay junok winak chi cami, cax chi can yistzil, palta c'am junok yuninal max elcanok. Axa junok yuẍtak nak chi ioncan ix, yet watx', ta chi el yuninal junxa tu', axca tol yuninal nak camom tu' chi yun yoccanok. Caytu' max yut yaloncan Moisés.

English: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married a woman and died childless.
Kanjobal: A junel, ay ukwan winak max ec' co xol ti', yuẍtakc'al ba eb. Max oc yetbi nak babel winak, palta max camtok nak, c'amc'al junok yuninal nak max elcanok.

English: The second
Kanjobal: Axa nak tzunan yintak nak babel tu' max ioncan ix. Max cam c'apaxtok nak, ac'ala' c'am yuninal nak max elcanok.

English: and then the third married her, and in the same way the seven died, leaving no children.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max yioncan aj nak yet is yox ix ix tu'. Ac'ala'c'al max yun eb nak yukwanil. Max camc'altok eb nak, c'amc'al junok eb nak max elcan junok yuninal.

English: Finally, the woman died too.
Kanjobal: Lajwi camtok eb nak tu', max cam c'apax ix ix tu'.

English: Now then, at the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”
Kanjobal: A yet ok ictzonelay aj eb camnak tu', ¿mactxel nak ay yistzil ix sic'libil xin, yujtol max yilej eb nak yukwanil ix ix tu'? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb saduceo tu' axca ti': —A bay yulyibank'inal ti', chi ton yilej ba winak yetok ix.

English: But those who are considered worthy of taking part in that age and in the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage,
Kanjobal: Palta a eb ok ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, eb moj yayji ec' yet jun tiempo ok jay tu', c'amxa mac ok yilej ba bay tu'.

English: and they can no longer die; for they are like the angels. They are God's children, since they are children of the resurrection.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet jun tiempoal tu', c'amxa camich. Lajanxa ok yun eb axca eb ángel. Caw wal yuninalxa Dios eb, yujtol ok ak'lay ictzoj aj eb.

English: But in the account of the bush, even Moses showed that the dead rise, for he calls the Lord ‘the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
Kanjobal: Cayc'apax tu' max yak'can Moisés ojtaknelay elok, tol ok ictzonelay aj eb camnak, yet max tz'iben yabixal te q'uix lanan tz'a'i. A bay tu' max yal Moisés tol a Cham Jajawil, tol is Diosal Abraham, Isaac, c'al Jacob yayji.

English: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for to him all are alive.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan, caxc'al camnakxa eb, jojtak tol man junelnejok max c'ayil eb, yujtol max yalcanok tol is Diosal eb yayji. A yul sat Dios, iquis yayji eb anima masanil, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Some of the teachers of the law responded, “Well said, teacher!”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés bay: —Yel ton chal, Mamin, ẍi eb.

English: And no one dared to ask him any more questions.
Kanjobal: Xan majxa tec'baj ba eb k'anlen junokxa tzet yetal bay.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “How is it that they say the Christ is the Son of David?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb ayic' bay tu' axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan ay eb chi alon axca ti': A Cristo, yinatil David? ẍi eb.

English: David himself declares in the Book of Psalms: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand
Kanjobal: Palta a David max yalcan yul jun Salmo axca ti': Max yal Dios Jajawil bay Cham Wajawil axca ti': Ayan chotan bay in watx' k'ab ti',

English: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.” ’
Kanjobal: masantac'al ok wacan oc eb ajc'ul oc en batxlubok akan, ẍi Dios bay Cham Wajawil, ẍi David.

English: David calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?”
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yaloncan David, tol a Cristo, ayoc is Yajawilok. Yuj tu', txequel tol man asannejok tol yinatil David yayji Cham, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,
Kanjobal: A yet lananto yabxalwi eb anima masanil, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti':

English: “Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and love to be greeted in the marketplaces and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
Kanjobal: Che yilc'al e ba, yet watx' c'am chex etax el yuj beybal eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yujtol chi cha c'ul eb yec' yetok juntzan jokquiẍtak pichilej. Chi yochen eb tol toxac'al chi yiay ba eb anima bay, yet chi ec' eb txonbal. Chi yochen eb asan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak yul nail wajayil eb yin culto, a tu' chi ay chotan eb. Yetok yet chi watx'ji juntzan loj manxa watx'ilok, asan bay watx' chi yochej eb chi ay chotanok.

English: They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. Such men will be punished most severely.”
Kanjobal: Chi yion ec' eb yatut eb ix camnakxa yichamil. Chi lajwi tu', najat chi yut eb yakan is txaj, tzetbilokxac'al chi na' anima tol watx' eb. A wal eb tu', caw wal miman yailal ok jay yiban eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: As he looked up, Jesus saw the rich putting their gifts into the temple treasury.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ayic' Jesús bay yul templo Dios. Max yiloni, tzetbilc'al max yut yaon aytok eb beyom is tumin yul jun chabal ofrenda.

English: He also saw a poor widow put in two very small copper coins.
Kanjobal: Max yilon c'apax jayoc jun xal meba' ix, tol camnakxa yichamil. Max yaon aytok xal cab ch'en tumin caw wal yaliẍ yofrendaok.

English: “I tell you the truth,” he said, “this poor widow has put in more than all the others.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Jesús bay eb ajun yetok axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a jun xal camnakxa yichamil ti', caw wal meba' xal, palta a yofrenda xal max yak' tu', ec'ban yintak yet masanil eb max yak'c'al yet.

English: All these people gave their gifts out of their wealth; but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol junjun eb, a ch'en max yak'can sobra max yaytok eb yofrendaok. Palta pax jun xal ti xin, caw wal meba' ton xal, palta echc'al max yaytok xal is tumin yin ofrendail, ẍi bay eb.

English: Some of his disciples were remarking about how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and with gifts dedicated to God. But Jesus said,
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb lanan yalontek yuj templo Dios tu', tol manxa watx'ilok yili, caw wal watx' cawxi yuj ch'en ch'en ayoc yin, yetok yuj tzet sabil yuj anima ayoc yin, xan max yaltek Jesús bay eb axca ti':

English: “As for what you see here, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another; every one of them will be thrown down.”
Kanjobal: —A juntzan lanan e yilon ti', ok ec' bulnaj masanil yet jun tiempoal ok jayok. C'am junok juntzan ch'en latz'bil aj ti' ok can yiban yet ch'enal, ẍi bay eb.

English: “Teacher,” they asked, “when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen eb bay tu' axca ti': —Mamin, ¿bak'in ok jay jun chal tu'? ¿Tzet yechelej ok tx'ox Dios yet jabxanej yuji? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied: “Watch out that you are not deceived. For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb axca ti': Caw wal aj nabal che yut e ba, yet watx' c'am mac ok ex etk'anenenok, yujtol xiwil mac ok jayok, ok banoc in bi yiban. Ayin ton Cristo in, ẍi eb, ok tz'ak yalon eb. Mayal wal jay lajub tiempo, ẍi eb, ok yalon c'apax eb. Palta manchak e yaoc yin e c'ul tzet ok yal eb tu'.

English: When you hear of wars and revolutions, do not be frightened. These things must happen first, but the end will not come right away.”
Kanjobal: Ok e yab yabixal juntzan mimek owal, ok aj wan eb comon anima yin owal yin is yajawil. Manchak ex xiwajok, yujtol yowalil a juntzan ti' ok babjok yeq'uelok. Palta manto ok lajwok ec' yulyibank'inal ti' yet tu', ẍi bay eb. Max yalon c'apaxok:

English: Then he said to them: “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
Kanjobal: Ok mitx'lej aj ba mimek nación yin owal.

English: There will be great earthquakes, famines and pestilences in various places, and fearful events and great signs from heaven.
Kanjobal: Xiwil bay ow ok yun yec' mimek quixcab. Xiwil bay ok ec' mimek ilya', ok jay c'apax mimek wajil yiban anima. Ay juntzan tzet yetal ok uj satcan, caw wal ok xiw anima yuj. Axa tx'oxon aj ba juntzan yechelej bay satcan tol caw miman yelapnok tu'.

English: “But before all this, they will lay hands on you and persecute you. They will deliver you to synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors, and all on account of my name.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet c'amto chi jay juntzan tu', ay mac ok ex mitx'onok, cax ok yak'on eb yobc'ulalil e yin. Ok ex yitok eb yuj quex beyc'ulnej bay nail wajayil eb yin culto, cax ok ex yaon oc eb preso. Ok ex yitok eb satak eb rey, c'al satak juntzanxa eb yajaw, yujc'al che yaoc e c'ul win.

English: This will result in your being witnesses to them.
Kanjobal: Palta axca ton tu' ok yun jeon e yaloncan el wabixal bay eb.

English: But make up your mind not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.
Kanjobal: Yowalilokab che yojtaknej el yin babelal, tol maj je' e sayon tzet ok e yut e colon e ba yet ok ex apnok oc satak eb tu'.
