English: For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ayin ok ex wak' k'anjab octok, cax ok wak'on e jelanil. Yuj tu' xan c'am junok eb chi chichon oc c'ul e yin tu' ok ex ak'on ayc'ayok. C'am junok eb chi apni jelanil axca jun ok wak' ayex.

English: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives and friends, and they will put some of you to death.
Kanjobal: Ay ex, a e mam c'al e txutx, e yuẍtak, e yican, e yamigo, a eb ok meltzoj oc e yin. Toltax ay ex ok ex mak'lay cam yuj eb.

English: All men will hate you because of me.
Kanjobal: A pax masanil anima xin, ok chichon oc c'ul e yin, yujtol che yaoc e c'ul win.

English: But not a hair of your head will perish.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am junok ex ok ex c'ayilok, tamwal junok xil e jolom.

English: By standing firm you will gain life.
Kanjobal: Ta tec'anc'al ok e yut waay e ba, ok ex colchajok.

English: “When you see Jerusalem being surrounded by armies, you will know that its desolation is near.
Kanjobal: A yet ok e yiloni tol mayal oymanelay Jerusalén ti' yuj eb soldado, nachajokab el e yuj, tol axa lajwi el tu'.

English: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those in the city get out, and let those in the country not enter the city.
Kanjobal: A eb ayic' bay Judea ti', tokokab eb bay tzalanlak. Axa eb ayic' bay Jerusalén ti', elokab c'apax eb. Axa eb aytok ec'jab najatlak elok, manchakxaokab oc eb yul conob ti'.

English: For this is the time of punishment in fulfillment of all that has been written.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet jun tiempoal tu', ok jay jun miman yailal. A ton yet tu', ok yun jantak tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers! There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.
Kanjobal: A wal eb ix yobix yet jun tiempoal tu', c'al eb ix ayto yune' chi txutxwi, ok'bal wal c'ul eb. Yujtol caw wal miman yailal ok jay yiban eb anima bay juntzan lugar ti', yujtol ok tit yowal c'ul Dios yiban eb jet israelal.

English: They will fall by the sword and will be taken as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
Kanjobal: Nan eb ok cam xol owal tu'. Nan eb ok tokcan preso, ok saklemcantok eb bay conoblak. Ok etaxcan ay Jerusalén ti' yuj eb man israelok tu', masantac'al yet ok lajwok tiempoal yak'on eb yajawilal, axcatac'a naon Dios.

English: “There will be signs in the sun, moon and stars. On the earth, nations will be in anguish and perplexity at the roaring and tossing of the sea.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan yechelej ok tx'ox ba yin c'u, c'al yin xajaw, c'al yin waycan. A bay sat tx'otx' ti' xin, ok somchaj el c'ul anima bay junjun conob yuj xiwilal, yujtol ok aj wan a' mar cax ok awjok mak'on ay ba a'.

English: Men will faint from terror, apprehensive of what is coming on the world, for the heavenly bodies will be shaken.
Kanjobal: Ok pax yip eb anima yuj xiwilal, yet ok naontek eb tzetak yetal ok uj bay yulyibank'inal ti'. A juntzan tzet yetal ay is yipalil bay satcan, ok tzicobtanelayok.

English: At that time they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok tu', axa ok yilon aj eb anima, ok in ayol xol jun asun, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'. Ok in jay yetok miman wikbej c'al in miman tzekekial.

English: When these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa bey jay juntzan tzet yetal max wal ti', tzalojanek, che tec'baj e ba, yujtol toxa ok ex colchajok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: He told them this parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalontek jun abix ti' bay eb: Naektek, tzetbil chi yun tit xak te higo, c'al juntzanxa te te' chi puk xak.

English: When they sprout leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is near.
Kanjobal: A yet chi uninbi xak te', e yojtakxa tol toxa chi jay nabilk'inal.

English: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, a yet ok e yilon jay juntzan max wal ti', nachajokab el e yuj, tol a Dios toxa chi occan Yajawil cayti'.

English: “I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, man ok c'ayaj jun makan anima ti', masantac'al ok yun masanil juntzan max wal ti'.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok el satcan c'al yulyibank'inal ti', a pax in k'anej xin, man ok ec' tzet chi yala'.

English: “Be careful, or your hearts will be weighed down with dissipation, drunkenness and the anxieties of life, and that day will close on you unexpectedly like a trap.
Kanjobal: Che yilc'al e ba. Manchak e cha' pitbok e ba yuj pek'al, yuj uq'uem anil, ma yuj junokxa tzet yetal chex oc il yuj bay yulyibank'inal ti'. Ta c'amak, axa ok jay jun c'ual tu', cax man watx'ok e yayji.

English: For it will come upon all those who live on the face of the whole earth.
Kanjobal: Axca wal junok tx'an yal, cay wal tu' jun ok jay yiban masanil anima bay yulyibank'inal ti',

English: Be always on the watch, and pray that you may be able to escape all that is about to happen, and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man.”
Kanjobal: xan makwajanekc'al. Txajlanekc'al yet watx' tec'anokab ex, xan ok je' e yel bay juntzan tzet t'inan jayi, man ok ex q'uixwok e yoc in satak, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Each day Jesus was teaching at the temple, and each evening he went out to spend the night on the hill called the Mount of Olives,
Kanjobal: A yet c'ualil max cuywaj Jesús yul templo Dios. Axa yet ak'balil, chi betic' way bay tzalan Olivo.

English: and all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.
Kanjobal: Junjun c'u, chi pet jay eb anima yet k'inibalil bay templo Dios, yuj yulic' eb abxalwok bay.

English: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching,
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa jay tiempoal k'in Pascua, yet chi loon eb israel ixim pan c'am yich,

English: and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for some way to get rid of Jesus, for they were afraid of the people.
Kanjobal: max sayon eb sacerdote c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, tzet watx' ok yut yak'on cam eb Jesús yin ewantakil, yujtol chi xiw eb bay eb conob.

English: Then Satan entered Judas, called Iscariot, one of the Twelve.
Kanjobal: Ay jun cuywom Jesús chi yik Judas, chi yik c'apax Iscariote. Max aytok Satanás yul c'ul.

English: And Judas went to the chief priests and the officers of the temple guard and discussed with them how he might betray Jesus.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max toj k'anjab yetok eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al eb yajaw bay templo. Max bet yalon bay eb tzet ok yut yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb.

English: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.
Kanjobal: Axa tzaloj aj eb sic'libil tu'. Max yak'on eb trato, tol ok yak' eb tumin bay Judas tu'.

English: He consented, and watched for an opportunity to hand Jesus over to them when no crowd was present.
Kanjobal: Cax max chaon c'ul tzet max yal eb, axa sayon tzet ok yut yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb yin ewantakil tu', yet c'am anima ayic' yetok.

English: Then came the day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
Kanjobal: Axa max ajapnok tiempoal loon eb ixim pan c'am yich, yet chi yak'on cam eb no calnel yet Pascua.

English: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and make preparations for us to eat the Passover.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay Pedro yetok bay Juan axca ti': —Asek, watx'nejek tzet ok co lo' yet Pascua, ẍi bay eb.

English: “Where do you want us to prepare for it?” they asked.
Kanjobal: —¿Baytal chochej chi co watx'nej? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “As you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him to the house that he enters,
Kanjobal: —A yet ok ex apnok yul conob, ay jun winak ok ilchaj e yuj. Ibil oc jun moc aej yuj, lanan toj bay yatut. Chex tzakloj yintak, masantac'al chex apni yetok bay chi ca yapni.

English: and say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
Kanjobal: Cax ok e yalon bay cham aj na tu' axca ti': Tix max yut yalon co meẍtol on ti': ¿Baytal ay jun cuarto bay ok in low yetok eb in cuywom, yuj co naontek Pascua ti'? ẍi, quex chi bay.

English: He will show you a large upper room, all furnished. Make preparations there.”
Kanjobal: Cax ok tx'oxon jun cuarto ayex bay can, tol watx'xa yayji. A tu' che watx'nej tzet ok co lo' tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They left and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa toj eb tu'. A yet max apni oc eb, max yilon eb, caw wal yel ton max yal Jesús bay eb. Yuj tu xin, a tu' max watx'nej eb tzet ok lo' yet Pascua tu'.

English: When the hour came, Jesus and his apostles reclined at the table.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni oc Jesús yetok juntzanxa eb is cuywom, max oc oyan eb yin meẍa lowok.

English: And he said to them, “I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Caw wal max yochej in c'ul chin low yet jun Pascuail ti' e yetok, yak'ban c'amto chin cami.

English: For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it finds fulfillment in the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi wal ayex, c'amxa bak'in ok in low yet k'in Pascua ti' junelokxa, masantac'al ok oc junokxa Pascua bay ok occan Dios Yajawil, ẍi bay eb.

English: After taking the cup, he gave thanks and said, “Take this and divide it among you.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yion aj jun vaso, max yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios yuj, cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Chaek jun ti'. Wajan uc'nejek.

English: For I tell you I will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi wal ayex, c'amxa bak'in ok wuc' yal sat uva ti', masantac'al yet ok occan Dios Yajawil, ẍi bay eb.

English: And he took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body given for you; do this in remembrance of me.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yion aj jun pan, max yalon yuj diosalil yuj. Axa bijon ec' xol eb tu', max yalon bay eb: —A ton in mimanil ok ak'lay e yuj. Loek ixim, yuj quin e naontek, ẍi bay eb.

English: In the same way, after the supper he took the cup, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.
Kanjobal: Cay c'apax tu' max yut jun vaso, yet max lajwi loon eb ixim pan tu'. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —A tzet ayay yul jun vaso ti', tx'oxbanil jun is cab trato Dios. Yuj in chiq'uil, xan ok yun jun trato tu', cax e yuj xan ok elok.

English: But the hand of him who is going to betray me is with mine on the table.
Kanjobal: Axa tinani xin, a mac ok in aon oc yul k'abej tu', ayoc yin meẍa ti' jetok.

English: The Son of Man will go as it has been decreed, but woe to that man who betrays him.”
Kanjobal: Ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', yowalil ok in paxok, atac'ala' yayjicanok, palta a wal jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich tu', ok'bal wal c'ul, ẍi bay eb.

English: They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who would do this.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max k'anlej el eb xol yin junjunal, mac wal txel jun ok aon oc Cham yul k'ab camich tu'.

English: Also a dispute arose among them as to which of them was considered to be greatest.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' yet tu' max teyelen ba eb cuywom yuj mac wal txel junok caw miman yelapnok xol eb,

English: Jesus said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who exercise authority over them call themselves Benefactors.
Kanjobal: palta max yal Jesús bay eb axca ti': A eb rey bay junjun nación, caw wal yajaw chi yut ba eb, yetok eb yajaw, watx' eb yalon eb anima.

English: But you are not to be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the one who rules like the one who serves.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', manchak e yut e ba axca eb yajaw tu'. A mac miman yelapnok e xol, yiokab aytek ba axca junok unin. Yetok c'apaxok, a mac yajaw yayji e xol, yutokab ba yin mosejal.

English: For who is greater, the one who is at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
Kanjobal: K'inalok yet chi oc junok loj tinani', ¿mactxel caw miman yelapnok che na'? ¿A mi mac chi ay chotan lowok, ma a mac chi batxwi eltek loj? A mac chi batxlay low tu', caw miman yelapnok, palta ayin ti', axca mosejal wayji e xol, yin ex wak'on serbil.

English: You are those who have stood by me in my trials.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', max e tec'baj e ba e yayji ec' wetok yet max jay juntzan porobalil wiban.

English: And I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred one on me,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ok ex waoc yin yajawil, axca ok yun woc yajawilal yuj co Mam Dios.

English: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ok je' e low wetok yin in meẍa bay ayin oc Yajawilal tu'. Yetok c'apaxok, ok ex ay chotan bay junjunok e trono, cax ok e yak'on yajawilal yiban eb lajcaw makan jet israelal, ẍi Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: “Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to sift you as wheat.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Cham Jajawil axca ti': —Simón, ilabi a Satanás max k'an is permiso bay Dios yujtol chi yochej chex txayelay yuj, axca chi yun txayelay ixim trigo,

English: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”
Kanjobal: palta caw wal max in tewi bay Dios oj, yet watx' c'am cheil a c'ul yin Cham. A yet ok meltzoj pax oc a nabal win, aoc tec'anil nabal eb oẍtak, ẍi bay.

English: But he replied, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal c'apax Simón tu' bay axca ti': —Mamin, jichan in c'ul woc preso etok, caxc'al ok in cam etok, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus answered, “I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me.”
Kanjobal: —Pedro, chi wal ayach, oxelxa quin eon el en, cax ok ok'aj no caẍlan yet jun ak'bal ti', ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Then Jesus asked them, “When I sent you without purse, bag or sandals, did you lack anything?” “Nothing,” they answered.
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Che natek, yet max ex in chekontok junel, c'am jabok e moral max e yi', c'am e tz'um yet e tumin, c'am e xanab max e yi' max ex toji. ¿Ma ay tzet max majax ayex? ẍi bay eb. —C'am tzet max majax ayon, ẍi eb bay.

English: He said to them, “But now if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.
Kanjobal: Axa tinani xin, a mac ex ay e moral, c'al e tz'um yet e tumin, iektok e yetok. A mac ex c'am e yespada, txonek el e jokan pichil, cax che manon ch'en e yet.

English: It is written: ‘And he was numbered with the transgressors’; and I tell you that this must be fulfilled in me. Yes, what is written about me is reaching its fulfillment.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi wal ayex, yowalil ok yuncan el masanil tzet albilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, bay chi yal axca ti': Max utlay axca chi utlay eb yobtakwom, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'. Masanil wabixal tz'ib yayji yul tx'an Un tu', lanan yuneni, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The disciples said, “See, Lord, here are two swords.” “That is enough,” he replied.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb is cuywom tu' bay: —Mamin, tix cab espada ti', ẍi eb bay. —K'okbil, ẍi Cham bay eb.

English: Jesus went out as usual to the Mount of Olives, and his disciples followed him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max eltek Jesús yul na, axa toj bay tzalan Olivo tu', axcata' is beybal. Max tzakloj eb is cuywom yintak.

English: On reaching the place, he said to them, “Pray that you will not fall into temptation.”
Kanjobal: Max apnic'al ocok, max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Txajlanek, yet watx' c'am chex ayc'ay yet ay mac chi yak'lej ex yikban yin yobtakil, ẍi bay eb.

English: He withdrew about a stone's throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', axa beson el ba bay eb tu'. Axcatac'a najatil bay chi apni junok ch'en chi k'oklaytok, caytu' bay max besil ba. Max ay jajan bay tu', cax max txajli.

English: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.”
Kanjobal: Max yal yin is txaj axca ti': Mamin, ta chi el yin a c'ul, cha tenil jun yailal ti' wiban, cax c'am chi wab yail; palta man axcaok chi wochej, palta axcaokab chochej, ẍi yin is txaj.

English: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu', max ayol jun ángel bay satcan, max ul ak'lay is tec'anil yuj.

English: And being in anguish, he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max oc pitz'an cusc'ulal yin is c'ul. Yuj tu' xan max yiajtek c'ulok txajli sic'libil. Caw wal chi el yal, caw wal chi ay t'ujlabok axca mimek tz'uj, caytu' yel chiq'uil yalok, chi ayc'ay sat tx'otx'.

English: When he rose from prayer and went back to the disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from sorrow.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max lajwi txajli, max aj wan. Axa meltzoj bay max can eb is cuywom tu'. Axa yet max apni bay eb, max yiloni, waynak el eb. Max oc numnaj wayan eb yuj cusc'ulal.

English: “Why are you sleeping?” he asked them. “Get up and pray so that you will not fall into temptation.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chex wayi? Ajanek wan. Txajlanek, yet watx' c'am chex ikbelay yin yobtakil, ẍi bay eb.

English: While he was still speaking a crowd came up, and the man who was called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He approached Jesus to kiss him,
Kanjobal: Lananto yalon Jesús bay eb axca tu', cax max jay bulnaj jun miman bulan anima bay tu'. A Judas, nak ayoc bisilok eb lajcawan, a' babel satak eb, max jayoc lemnaj yin Jesús, yuj ul tz'ubon el is ti'.

English: but Jesus asked him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Judas, ¿tom axca ti' chin ot aon oc yul k'ab camich, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', xan cha tz'ubil in ti'? ẍi bay.

English: When Jesus' followers saw what was going to happen, they said, “Lord, should we strike with our swords?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb ajun yetok Jesús tzet yetal lanan jayoc yiban, max k'anlen eb bay axca ti': —Mamin, ¿chi mi je' co xikon eb yetok jespada ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.
Kanjobal: Yet jun bek tu', ay jun is cuywom tu' max xikon el is txiquin jun is moso cham sat sacerdote, c'uxanc'al a is watx' max michchaj yuj.

English: But Jesus answered, “No more of this!” And he touched the man's ear and healed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu' axca ti': —Bekek. Man e yut axca tu', ẍi bay eb. Max lajwi tu', axa toj matxan yin is txiquin nak tu', max occan yuj junelxa.

English: Then Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders, who had come for him, “Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come with swords and clubs?
Kanjobal: A eb sacerdote yetok eb yajawil templo Dios, c'al eb ichamtak winak ay yikbej, a eb max jayoc ul mitx'on Jesús. Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': —¿Tokwal ikbajwom in xol eb yob is nabal che yila', yuj tu' xan chex jay win yetok espada c'al te'?

English: Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your hour–when darkness reigns.”
Kanjobal: Ayinc'al ec' e yetok junjun c'u yul templo Dios, palta maj in e mitx' paxok; palta a ton yorail e yak'on e nabal ti', yetok c'apax nak yajawil k'ekk'inal, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then seizing him, they led him away and took him into the house of the high priest. Peter followed at a distance.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max oc mitx'naj eb yin Jesús. Max yiontok eb bay yatut cham sat sacerdote. A pax Pedro xin, najat tzakanxac'al chi yut ba.

English: But when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat down with them.
Kanjobal: Max yaoc eb taynem templo is k'ak' bay yamak'il ti na tu', max ay chotan eb, max oc oyan eb yin k'ak', cax max jayoc Pedro, max ay chotan xol eb.

English: A servant girl saw him seated there in the firelight. She looked closely at him and said, “This man was with him.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun ix criada max ilon oc Pedro yet chotanxa ay xol eb tu', max oc t'anan ix yin, max yalon ix axca ti': —A jun winak ti', yetbi ba yetok Jesús, ẍi ix.

English: But he denied it. “Woman, I don't know him,” he said.
Kanjobal: Palta maj tak'wejc'al oc Pedro yin. —Ach ix, man wojtakok jun mactxel chal tu', ẍi bay ix.

English: A little later someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them.” “Man, I am not!” Peter replied.
Kanjobal: Junixto bek tu', ay junokxa mac max ilon oc yin, max yalon c'apax axca ti': —Ach ti', et beyom a ba yetok eb, ẍi nak bay. —C'amak cha, man wet beyomok in ba yetok eb, ẍi bay nak.

English: About an hour later another asserted, “Certainly this fellow was with him, for he is a Galilean.”
Kanjobal: Junixtom wal hora yalon jun tu', max watx' alnenxac'al junxa axca ti': —A nak ti', wal yel yetbeyom ba yetok Cham max ilay jay ti', yujtol yet aj Galileail ba nak yetok eb, ẍi junxa tu'.

English: Peter replied, “Man, I don't know what you're talking about!” Just as he was speaking, the rooster crowed.
Kanjobal: Wal yel cha, caw wal man wojtakok tzet chal tu', ẍi Pedro tu' bay nak. Lananto wal yaloni, cax max ok'aj no caẍlan.

English: The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word the Lord had spoken to him: “Before the rooster crows today, you will disown me three times.”
Kanjobal: Axa meltzojtok acan Cham Jajawil yin Pedro tu', xan max natek tzet max yal Cham bay. Tix ton max yut yalon Cham bay ti': Oxelxa quin eon el en, ok aloni tol mayin ojtakok, cax ok ok'aj no caẍlan yet jun ak'bal ti', ẍi Cham bay.

English: And he went outside and wept bitterly.
Kanjobal: Axa yel besnaj xol eb tu', cax yeltok yok' sic'libil yina.

English: The men who were guarding Jesus began mocking and beating him.
Kanjobal: A eb chi taynen Jesús, max buchwaj eb yin, cax max mak'on c'apax eb.

English: They blindfolded him and demanded, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”
Kanjobal: Max makchen eb is sat, max c'oli tzak'ontok eb sat. Max lajwi tu', max tz'akon k'anlen eb bay axca ti': —Al ayon, mac chach mak'on chabej, ẍi eb bay.

English: And they said many other insulting things to him.
Kanjobal: Manxa wal jantakok tzet max yal eb bay yin buchwal k'anejal.

English: At daybreak the council of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and teachers of the law, met together, and Jesus was led before them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbi, max wajban ba eb icham winak ay yikbej xol eb yet israelal, yetok eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Max yiontok eb Jesús satak eb sat yajaw. Max k'anlen eb bay axca ti':

English: “If you are the Christ, ” they said, “tell us.” Jesus answered, “If I tell you, you will not believe me,
Kanjobal: —Al ayon, ¿tom yel ach Cristo ach? ẍi eb bay. —Nabac'al chi wal ayex, tok ok e yaoc yin e c'ul.

English: and if I asked you, you would not answer.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay tzet chin k'anlej el ayex, ¿tom ok e yal ayin?

English: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God.”
Kanjobal: Palta ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', a tinani' ok in apnok chotan bay is watx' k'ab Dios, Cham chic'al je' yuj masanil, ẍi bay eb.

English: They all asked, “Are you then the Son of God?” He replied, “You are right in saying I am.”
Kanjobal: —¿Tom C'ajol ach Dios chi yal tu'? ẍi eb bay. —Ayin ti', C'ajol in ton Dios, axca e yalon ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: Then they said, “Why do we need any more testimony? We have heard it from his own lips.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb axca ti': —A tinani' manxa yowalilok ay co testigo. Ilab a wal caw chi aloni, ẍi eb.

English: Then the whole assembly rose and led him off to Pilate.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan eb masanil tu', max yiontok eb Jesús satak Pilato.

English: And they began to accuse him, saying, “We have found this man subverting our nation. He opposes payment of taxes to Caesar and claims to be Christ, a king.”
Kanjobal: Max naon aj eb k'anej yiban, max yalon eb axca ti': —Max jila', tol a jun winak ti' lanan yak'on somchaj el c'ul eb jet conob. Max yala' tol c'am chi je' jak'on ch'en tumin chi k'anlay el yuj cham yajaw bay Roma, cax chi yalon c'apax oc ba Cristoal, chi yal elapnok rey, ẍi octok eb.

English: So Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” “Yes, it is as you say,” Jesus replied.
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Pilato tu' bay axca ti': —¿Tom ach ti' reyal ach eb israel ti'? ẍi bay. —Ja', ayin toni, ẍi bay.

English: Then Pilate announced to the chief priests and the crowd, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pilato tu' bay eb yajawil eb sacerdote axca ti': —A jun winak ti', c'am jabok mul chi wabej, ẍi bay eb.

English: But they insisted, “He stirs up the people all over Judea by his teaching. He started in Galilee and has come all the way here.”
Kanjobal: Palta caw wal max yiajtek eb c'ulok yalon junelxa axca ti': —A jun winak ti', masanil eb aj Judea ti' lanan somchaj el is c'ul yuj juntzan cuybanilej chi yak'a'. Atax bay Galilea max el yich yalon juntzan cuybanilej chi yak' ti', masantac'al chi jay cayti', ẍi eb bay.

English: On hearing this, Pilate asked if the man was a Galilean.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Pilato juntzan tu', max k'anlen bay eb tatol aj Galilea Jesús.

English: When he learned that Jesus was under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.
Kanjobal: Axa max yabeni tol aj Galilea toni, xan max yatok bay Herodes, yujtol a cham tu' yajaw yayji bay Galilea tu'. A yet tu', ayic' cham cab oxeb c'ual bay Jerusalén.

English: When Herod saw Jesus, he was greatly pleased, because for a long time he had been wanting to see him. From what he had heard about him, he hoped to see him perform some miracle.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon cham Herodes tu' jayoc Jesús satak, caw wal max tzaloji, yujtol ayxa tiempoal yaben k'umal, xan caw wal chi yochej chi k'anjab janic'ok yetok, cax chi yochen chi yil junok milagro chi yunej.

English: He plied him with many questions, but Jesus gave him no answer.
Kanjobal: Ayc'al tzet max k'anlej el bay Jesús, palta c'amc'al tzet max paktzej bay.

English: The chief priests and the teachers of the law were standing there, vehemently accusing him.
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajawil eb sacerdote max jayoc yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Yelc'ulal wal tol max naaj eb k'anej yiban Jesús.

English: Then Herod and his soldiers ridiculed and mocked him. Dressing him in an elegant robe, they sent him back to Pilate.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max bajwaj aj Herodes tu' yetok eb is soldado yin Jesús, cax max buchwaj eb yin Cham sic'libil. Max tz'ak yaon oc eb jun pichilej yin, tx'okxa watx'il axca yet eb rey. Max lajwi tu', axa yaon paxtok eb bay Pilato junelxa tu'.

English: That day Herod and Pilate became friends–before this they had been enemies.
Kanjobal: Ato yet jun c'ual tu' max yamigonej aj ba Pilato yetok Herodes, yujtol a yet yalantok, yajc'ul ba eb.

English: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers and the people,
Kanjobal: Max yak' Pilato wajbaj oc ba eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetok eb yajaw, c'al eb anima masanil.

English: and said to them, “You brought me this man as one who was inciting the people to rebellion. I have examined him in your presence and have found no basis for your charges against him.
Kanjobal: Cax max yalon xol eb axca ti': —A jun winak max e yi jay ayin ti', che yala' tol chi somchaj el eb anima yuj, palta ilab, tol e satak max in k'anlej bay, palta c'am jabok is mul chi txecloj el axca e yalon aj yiban tu'.

English: Neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us; as you can see, he has done nothing to deserve death.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' Herodes, c'am jabok mul max ilchaj el yin yuj. Yuj tu' xan max chek paxtek junelxa ayon, xan c'am jabok is mul tol moj cam yuj.

English: Therefore, I will punish him and then release him.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan toc'al ok wak' mak'layok, cax ok in bekon elok, ẍi bay eb.

English: At every Passover Festival Pilate had to set free one prisoner for them.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj yaw eb yin ipejal axca ti': —A jun winak ti', camokabi. Aokab Barrabás chi beklay elok, ẍi eb.

English: With one voice they cried out, “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!” With one voice they cried out, “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”
Kanjobal: A Barrabás tu', ayoc preso yujtol locan xol eb max yak'lej owal yetok eb yajaw yul conob tu', cax mak'om cam anima c'apaxok.

English: Wanting to release Jesus, Pilate appealed to them again.
Kanjobal: A Pilato, caw wal max yochej max bekil Jesús, yuj tu' xan aytoc'al tzet max yal bay eb anima tu' junelxa.

English: But they kept shouting, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yaben eb axca tu', caw max aj yaw eb yalon axca ti': —Curusnelayokabi, ẍixac'al eb.

English: For the third time he spoke to them: “Why? What crime has this man committed? I have found in him no grounds for the death penalty. Therefore I will have him punished and then release him.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon cham Pilato bay eb yin yoxelal axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xin? ¿Tzet max say mulnanej che yila'? Ayin ti' c'am jabok is mul tol moj cam yuj chi wila'. Yuj tu' xan toc'al ok wak' mak'layok, cax ok in bekon elok, ẍi bay eb.

English: But with loud shouts they insistently demanded that he be crucified, and their shouts prevailed.
Kanjobal: Palta tol caw max yiajtek eb c'ulok yaj yaw sic'libil, tol yowalil chi cam yin curus. Yujtol caw wal yip eb yaj yaw, xan max yunc'alta' yochwan eb.

English: So Pilate decided to grant their demand.
Kanjobal: Max yalon pax Pilato tu' axca ti': Yunokab axca che yochej tu', ẍi.

English: He released the man who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, the one they asked for, and surrendered Jesus to their will.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan a jun locan xol owal tu', jun mak'om cam anima ayoc preso tu', a' max beklay elok, axca max yut k'anon eb tu'. Axa Jesús max alaycantok yul k'ab jun tzet yetal max yochej eb tu'.

English: As they led him away, they seized Simon from Cyrene, who was on his way in from the country, and put the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yiontok eb Jesús bay ok cam tu', ay jun winak aj Cirene chi yik Simón, lanan jay bet ec'jab najat, max mitx'aj eb. Max yak'on eb yik te curus tu', cax max oc tzakan yintak Jesús.

English: A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.
Kanjobal: Xiwil c'apax eb anima max tzakloj yintak. Xiwil eb ix, caw wal chi el yaw yok' yuj cusc'ulal.

English: Jesus turned and said to them, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.
Kanjobal: Axa meltzojtok acan Jesús yin eb tu', cax max yalon axca ti': —Ex ix aj Jerusalén, manchak ex ok' wuj. Ok'anek e yuj, c'al yuj eb e yune'.

English: For the time will come when you will say, ‘Blessed are the barren women, the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!’
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay wal jun tiempoal ok jayok, cax ok e yalon axca ti': Caw wal watx' yet eb ix c'am yune', c'al eb man unewomixok, yetok eb c'am yune' max yak' txutxwok, watx' c'apax yet eb, quex chi, ok e yaloni.

English: Then “ ‘they will say to the mountains, “Fall on us!” and to the hills, “Cover us!” ’
Kanjobal: A wal yet jun tiempoal tu', ok yal eb anima yuj witzlak axca ti': Matawal chi je' chi tit weknaj juntzan witz tu' jiban, ẍi eb. Ok yalon c'apax eb yuj tzalanlak: Matawal chi je' chon mukaycan yalan juntzan tzalan ti', ẍi eb.

English: For if men do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', axca junok te te' yax, tol chi ch'ibi, palta ilek wal tzet chi yaoc eb wiban. Akxam wal yiban eb, tol lajan axca junok te te' caw wal takinxa, yelxac'al miman tzet ok yaoc eb yiban eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: Two other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed.
Kanjobal: Ay cawanxa mactxel ay is mul max ilaytok cam yetok Jesús.

English: When they came to the place called the Skull, there they crucified him, along with the criminals–one on his right, the other on his left.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni eb bay jun lugar chi yik Bakil Jolomej, a tu' max curusnelay Cham yuj eb. Cax max curusnelay c'apax cawan yobtakwom yuj eb, jun bay is watx' k'ab Cham, jun bay is q'uexan.

English: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan curusnelay Cham yuj eb, max yalon axca ti': —Mam, joc'ay is mul eb ti' yiban, yujtol man yojtakok eb tzet chi yun eb, ẍi bay Dios. Max c'oli yak'on eb soldado suerte yin is pichil Cham, cax max pojon ec' eb an yin.

English: The people stood watching, and the rulers even sneered at him. They said, “He saved others; let him save himself if he is the Christ of God, the Chosen One.”
Kanjobal: A eb anima, max oc bulan eb yilon juntzan tzet yetal chi uj tu'. Yak'ban tu' max c'oli buchwaj eb yajaw yin Cham, max yalon eb axca ti': —Max ab tz'ak col juntzan anima, axa tinani', tatol yel a Cristo ti', cax a' sic'bil el yuj Dios, colokab ba jila', ẍi eb.

English: The soldiers also came up and mocked him. They offered him wine vinegar
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' eb soldado c'apaxok, caw chi buchwaj ajtok eb yin. Max jayoc eb is cawilal. Max tz'akon yak' eb vinagre yuq'uej.

English: and said, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Tatol yel reyal ach eb israel, col a ba jila', ẍi eb bay.

English: There was a written notice above him, which read: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Kanjobal: Ay jayeb letra ayoc bay jolom curusal Cham, chi yal axca ti': A jun anima ti' is reyal eb israel, ẍi.

English: One of the criminals who hung there hurled insults at him: “Aren't you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
Kanjobal: Ay jun eb nak ay aj yin curus yetok tu', max buchwaj yin, max yalon axca ti': —Tatol yel ach Cristo ach, col a ba wila'. Chi lajwi tu', chon a colon pax etok, ẍi bay Cham.

English: But the other criminal rebuked him. “Don't you fear God,” he said, “since you are under the same sentence?
Kanjobal: Axa junxa nak yetbi tu' max tenchaneni, max yalon nak axca ti': —¿Tom c'am chach xiw jabok bay Dios? Ilab lajan jaben yail yetok.

English: We are punished justly, for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong.”
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', co moj wal jaben yail, yuj co tojlanen el co yobtakil, palta jun ti', c'am jabok tzet yob max el yuneni, ẍi nak.

English: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom. ”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon nak bay Jesús axca ti': —Jesús, matawal chin a natek yet ok ach jay ak'on Yajawilal, ẍi nak bay.

English: Jesus answered him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay nak axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayach, yet jun c'u ti' ok ach apnok wetok bay jun lugar chi yik paraíso, ẍi bay nak.

English: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,
Kanjobal: Axa yet chumanxa c'u, max k'ekbi masanil yulyibank'inal ti', masantac'al yet a las tres.

English: for the sun stopped shining. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.
Kanjobal: Max k'ekk'olil c'u, cax max ay tzilnaj nan an k'ap ayoc makilok yul nan templo Dios.

English: Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit.” When he had said this, he breathed his last.
Kanjobal: Cax max aj yaw Jesús yin ipejal axca ti': —Mamin, chi wak'can oc wanimail yul a k'ab, ẍi bay Dios. Max xew yalon axca tu', max cami.

English: The centurion, seeing what had happened, praised God and said, “Surely this was a righteous man.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon cham capitán tzet max uji, max yal cham is watx' k'anej bay Dios axca ti': —Wal yel, a jun winak ti', caw wal c'am is mul, ẍi.

English: When all the people who had gathered to witness this sight saw what took place, they beat their breasts and went away.
Kanjobal: A masanil eb anima chi matz'li, max yil eb masanil tzet max uji. Axa yet max pax eb, caw wal chi cus c'ul eb sic'libil.

English: But all those who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
Kanjobal: A masanil eb ojtaknej Jesús, c'al juntzan eb xal ix max tzakloj yintak yet max tit bay Galilea, najat max can lecjab eb, cax chi matz'litek eb najat tu'.

English: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and upright man,
Kanjobal: Ay jun cham anima chi yik José, aj conob Arimatea yul yet Judea. Watx' is c'ul, cax watx' c'apax is beybal; lanan yechbanen yoccan Dios Yajawilal. Caxc'al sat yajaw yayji xol eb yet yajawilal, palta maj yaoc ba yetok eb yin yak'on low camich yiban Jesús.

English: who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea and he was waiting for the kingdom of God. who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.
Kanjobal: Max octok José tu' bay Pilato, max bet k'anon aytek is mimanil Jesús.

English: Then he took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth and placed it in a tomb cut in the rock, one in which no one had yet been laid.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', axa bet yion aytek tu', max pichon oc yul jun sábana. Lajwi tu xin, axa bet yaoncan octok yul jun ch'en ch'en olbilxa. C'amto junok camnak max mukaylej yul jun olan tu'.

English: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.
Kanjobal: A jun c'ual tu', c'ual yet chi watx'nej eb israel yuj c'ual xewilal, lananxa jayi.

English: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
Kanjobal: A eb ix tzaklojnak yintak Jesús bay Galilea, max bet yil eb ch'en ch'en tu'. Max bet yilon eb tzetbil max yun yalaycan octok is mimanil Cham yul ch'en.

English: Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath in obedience to the commandment.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', axa pax eb tu'. Max bet watx'nen eb juntzan ambal suk'uk'i jab, yetok juntzan watx' jab chi jolay oc yin is mimanil tu'. Axa yet c'ualxa xewilal tu', max xew eb axcata' yalon leyalil.

English: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women took the spices they had prepared and went to the tomb.
Kanjobal: A yet lananto sakbi yet domingo, jun babel c'u yul semana, max toj eb xal bay max bet mukaycan octok mimanil Jesús tu'. Yetbi eb juntzan ambal suk'uk'i jab max watx'nej eb.

English: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
Kanjobal: Max apni oc eb, max yilon eb, elnakxa ch'en is makil jun ch'en bay max mukayi.

English: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
Kanjobal: Max octok eb yul ch'en, axa yilon eb, c'amxa mimanil Cham Jajawil Jesús ayic' bay tu'.

English: While they were wondering about this, suddenly two men in clothes that gleamed like lightning stood beside them.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb yiloni. Axa yilon eb, ayic' cawan ángel axca yili winak, waan oc eb bay is c'atan eb. Chi tzekeki yili is pichil eb ángel tu',

English: In their fright the women bowed down with their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you look for the living among the dead?
Kanjobal: xan caw wal max xiwaj eb xal cax yay t'anan eb sat tx'otx'. Axa yalon eb ángel tu' bay eb xal axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan a bay chi mukay eb camnak ti' che say Cham tol iquisxa?

English: He is not here; he has risen! Remember how he told you, while he was still with you in Galilee:
Kanjobal: C'amxa Cham ayic' cayti'. Mayal ictzonelay aj Cham. Naektek tzet max yalcan ayex, yet ayto ec' e yetok bay Galilea.

English: ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, be crucified and on the third day be raised again.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalcanok tol a' Chekbiltek yuj Dios xol eb e yet animail, palta yowalil ok alay oc yul k'ab eb yobtakwom, cax ok alay oc yin curus. Axa yet cabjial tu', cax ok ictzonelay ajok, ẍi, max yaloncan ayex, ẍi eb bay eb xal.

English: Then they remembered his words.
Kanjobal: Catatu' max naontek eb tzet albilcan bay eb yuj Jesús.

English: When they came back from the tomb, they told all these things to the Eleven and to all the others.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa pax eb tu'. Max toj yalon eb jun abix ti' bay eb is chekbej Jesús yusluc'wanil, c'al bay eb is cuywom masanil.

English: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them who told this to the apostles.
Kanjobal: A xal María aj Magdala, xal Juana, yetok xal María txutx Jacobo, a eb max bet alon juntzan abix tu'. Ay c'apax jun cawanxa eb xal ix ajun yetok eb.

English: But they did not believe the women, because their words seemed to them like nonsense.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb is cuywom Jesús tu', maj cha eb yabej; toc'al chi yal eb xal, wal naon eb.

English: Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan Pedro tu', max yak'on yanej toj bay ch'en ch'en tu'. Max apni, max ay nojan yilon octok yul ch'en tu'. Asanxanej an pichilej tx'ok tx'okxac'al lanan canok. Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul yin juntzan max yil tu'. Axa pax tu'.

English: Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual tu', ay cawan eb is cuywom Jesús lanan toj yul be chi apni Emaús. A jun conob tu', ay mi oxebok legua xol ba yetok Jerusalén.

English: They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan bey eb tu', chi yalon eb yuj tzet max uji.

English: As they talked and discussed these things with each other, Jesus himself came up and walked along with them;
Kanjobal: Yak'banc'al a jun tu' chi yalubtanejtek eb, max jayoc Jesús c'atan eb, cax junnejxac'al bey Cham yetok eb.

English: but they were kept from recognizing him.
Kanjobal: Chi moyi aj sat eb yuj, yet watx' c'am chi yojtaknej el eb tatol a Cham.

English: He asked them, “What are you discussing together as you walk along?” They stood still, their faces downcast.
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Jesús bay eb: —¿Tzet yetal che yala' chex bey ti'? ẍi bay eb. Max oc waan eb, cusiltakxac'al yili sat eb.

English: One of them, named Cleopas, asked him, “Are you only a visitor to Jerusalem and do not know the things that have happened there in these days?”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi jun chi yik Cleofas bay yin aymanil: —Toltax yojtak masanil anima tzet max uj bay Jerusalén yet cabji oxji ti'. Axa ach ti', ¿tom c'am chab jabok? Palta ilab max ach ec' pax bay tu', ẍi bay.

English: “What things?” he asked. “About Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “He was a prophet, powerful in word and deed before God and all the people.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet max uj bay tu xin? ẍi Jesús bay. —Ay jun aj Nazaret chi yik Jesús, caw wal chekbej Dios yayji. A tzet max el watx'neni c'al tzet max el yaloni, caw wal miman yelapnok yul sat Dios c'al yul sat eb anima masanil.

English: The chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him;
Kanjobal: Palta a eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetok eb yajaw yayji co xol, max aon oc yul k'ab camich. Yuj tu' max alay oc yin curus.

English: but we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. And what is more, it is the third day since all this took place.
Kanjobal: A ton Cham tu' max jaoc yipok co c'ul, tol ok on colchaj el ayon israel on ti' yuj. Palta tinani', cabjitaxxa yunen juntzan tu'.

English: In addition, some of our women amazed us. They went to the tomb early this morning
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb xal tol jetbeyom on, max c'ayaj co c'ul yuj, yet max jabeni, yujtol a yet max sakbi, max bet yilon eb ch'en ch'en bay max bet alay octok mimanil Cham,

English: but didn't find his body. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.
Kanjobal: palta c'amxa is mimanil tu'. Max toj eb yalon ayon tol max yilon eb juntzan ángel. Max yalon eb ángel tu' bay eb, tol iquis Cham.

English: Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but him they did not see.”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al lajwi tu', ay juntzan eb jetbeyom max bet ilonok. Axcac'al yalon eb xal ix tu', caytu' max yut yilon eb, palta maj yil eb yin Jesús, ẍi eb bay.

English: He said to them, “How foolish you are, and how slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Jesús bay eb; —Ayex ti', axca wal tol c'am jabok e nabal. Caw ya' puralil che yaoc yin e c'ul jantak tzet albilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios payxa.

English: Did not the Christ have to suffer these things and then enter his glory?”
Kanjobal: A Cham Cristo, yowalil tol t'inan yaben yail juntzan tu' yet manto oc Yajawilal, ẍi bay eb.

English: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max chaon el yich yalon bay eb, baytakc'al ayay yabixal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Max chaontek yich yalon tzetak tz'ibbilcan yuj Moisés. Max yalon c'apaxtek tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios yet payxa.

English: As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus acted as if he were going farther.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni eb bay jun conob bay lanan toj eb tu', ijan palanc'al yeq'uel Jesús.

English: But they urged him strongly, “Stay with us, for it is nearly evening; the day is almost over.” So he went in to stay with them.
Kanjobal: Palta max yak' pural eb mitx'on waayok. Max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Canan jetok, ilab lanan yay c'u, lananxa k'ekbi, ẍi eb bay. Axa yoc yul na tu', max can bay tu' yetok eb.

English: When he was at the table with them, he took bread, gave thanks, broke it and began to give it to them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max oc chotan yin meẍa yetok eb, max yion aj jun ixim pan, max yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios yuj. Lajwi tu', axa bijon ec' xol eb tu'.

English: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.
Kanjobal: A yet jun bek tu' axca wal tol max jakchaj sat eb. Catatu' bian max yilon oc eb, tol a Jesús. Lajwi tu', max yesnen c'ay ba. Axa yilontek eb, c'amxa mactxel.

English: They asked each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Yel toni, caw wal max jay co nabal, yet max yalon ayon yul be, yet max yak'on nachaj el juj tzetak chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, ẍi eb.

English: They got up and returned at once to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, assembled together
Kanjobal: Max meltzojxac'al eb bay Jerusalén yet jun bek tu', max yil eb yin eb chekbej Jesús yusluc'wanil bay tu', yetok juntzanxa eb yetbi eb. Wajan ec' eb bay tu'.

English: and saying, “It is true! The Lord has risen and has appeared to Simon.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb wajan ec' tu' bay eb cawan tu' axca ti': —Wal yel max ictzoj aj Cham Jajawil junelxa. Max tx'oxaj ba bay Simón ti', ẍi eb.

English: Then the two told what had happened on the way, and how Jesus was recognized by them when he broke the bread.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalontek eb cawan tu' tzet max yun eb yulak be. Max yalon c'apaxtek eb tzet max yun nachaj el Jesús yuj eb, yet max bijon ec' ixim pan.

English: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
Kanjobal: Lananto yalon eb juntzan tu', axa yilontek eb, ayxa ec' Jesús nan xol eb. Max yalon axca ti': —Junc'ulalokab ayex, ẍi bay eb.

English: They were startled and frightened, thinking they saw a ghost.
Kanjobal: Axa eb, toc'al max xiwaj eb, cax max c'ayaj c'ul eb. A naon eb tol lab jun chi yil eb tu'.

English: He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why do doubts rise in your minds?
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan toc'al chi somchaj el e c'ul yet chin e yiloni? ¿Tzet yuj xan cabtak e c'ul win?

English: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”
Kanjobal: Ilek in k'ab ti', c'al wakan ti'. Ayin toni; mitx'ek in wali. Chi cam e yoc t'anan win. A junok lab, tok ay is chibejal, tok ay is bakil bay watx' e yoc lacan axca wet ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon jun tu', axa tx'oxon k'ab bay eb tu', c'al yakan.

English: And while they still did not believe it because of joy and amazement, he asked them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
Kanjobal: Caxc'al max tzaloj aj eb, palta ac'ala' ijan maj yaoc eb yin c'ul, yujtol toc'al max c'ayaj c'ul eb, xan max yal pax bay eb axca ti': —¿C'am mi jabok tzet watx' chin lo' cayti'? ẍi bay eb.

English: They gave him a piece of broiled fish,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yak' eb jab bolbil txay bay.

English: and he took it and ate it in their presence.
Kanjobal: Axa chaon tu', max chion satak eb.

English: He said to them, “This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi chioni, max yalon pax bay eb axca ti': —A tinani', mayal wal yun axca walon ayex yet max quin ec' e yetok. Ilab max wal ayex tol yowalil ok yun jantak wabixal tz'ibbilcan yul ley Moisés, yetok tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios, yetok juntzan wabixal yul libro Salmo, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yak'on jakchaj nabal eb, yet watx' chi nachaj el yuj eb, tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: He told them, “This is what is written: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,
Kanjobal: Xan max yal bay eb junelxa: —A yul tx'an Un tz'ibbilcan wabixal ayin Cristo in ti', tol yowalil ok in camok, cax chin ictzoj pax aj xol eb camnak yet cabjial.

English: and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, yowalil tol yetok wikbej ok al-lay el k'anej Dios xol anima bay junjun nación. Ok al-lay el xol eb tol yowalil chi na ba eb yin is yobtakil, yet watx' chi jolay c'ay yobtakil eb tu' yiban. A bay Jerusalén ti' ok babjok yal-lay el wabixal; catatu' ok pukaxtok bay junjun conob.

English: You are witnesses of these things.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', ok e yak' e ba testigoal yin juntzan ti'.

English: I am going to send you what my Father has promised; but stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high.”
Kanjobal: Max yak'can Dios is ti' tol a Yespíritu ok ayol ayex. A ton Cham ok tok in chektek, palta echbanejek bay Jerusalén ti', masantac'al che cha' e yikbej ok alay aytek satcan, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When he had led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, he lifted up his hands and blessed them.
Kanjobal: Catatu' max yiontok eb is cuywom bay cawilal conob Betania. Max yiaj is k'ab can bay tu', max k'anon watx'c'ulalil Dios yiban eb.

English: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up into heaven.
Kanjobal: Lananto wal k'anon watx'c'ulal Dios tu', max ilay ajtok satcan, axa can eb yuj tu'.

English: Then they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
Kanjobal: Lajwi yion ay ba eb bay, max meltzoj eb yin tzalojc'ulalil bay Jerusalén.

English: And they stayed continually at the temple, praising God.
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al c'u chi bet eb bay templo Dios yuj bet yalon eb is watx' k'anej bay Cham.

English: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar–when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene–
Kanjobal: A yet olajonebxa abil yak'on cham Tiberio yajawil bay Roma, axa Poncio Pilato ayoc gobernadoral bay Judea. Axa Herodes ayoc gobernadoral bay Galilea. Axa jun yuẍtak chi yik Felipe ayoc gobernadoral bay Iturea c'al bay Traconite, axa cham Lisanias ayoc gobernadoral bay Abilinia.

English: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the desert.
Kanjobal: Axa cham Anás yetok cham Caifás ayoc sat sacerdoteal. A yet jun tiempoal tu', a bay tz'inan tx'otx', a tu' ayic' Juan c'ajol Zacarías. Ay wal ec' bay tu' max yalon Dios bay tzet ok yal bay eb anima.

English: He went into all the country around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max ec' bay masanil juntzan lugar bay cawilal a' Jordán. Max ec' yaloncan el xolak anima, tol yowalil chi na ba eb yin is yobtakil, yet watx' chi elcan is yobtakil eb yiban, cax chi yak'on bautizar ba eb.

English: As is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: “A voice of one calling in the desert, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max uji, yuj yunen el tzet albilcan yuj jun chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías: Ay jun mactxel bay tz'inan tx'otx' chi awji, chi yalon axca ti': Watx'nejek junok is be Cham Yajaw. T'inek junok be bay Cham.

English: Every valley shall be filled in, every mountain and hill made low. The crooked roads shall become straight, the rough ways smooth.
Kanjobal: Ak'ek noj masanil jobelak; masanil witzlak c'al tzalanlak ak'ek pananbok. Masanil be coxquiẍtak, jichlonelayokabi. Yetok juntzan amquiẍtak, muklayokab elok cax pananbokabi.

English: And all mankind will see God's salvation.’ ”
Kanjobal: Cax ok yilon eb masanil jay Cham Colwajwom chekbiltek yuj Dios, ẍi bay tz'inan tx'otx' tu', ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb anima max jayoc bay Juan, yuj ul yak'on bautizar ba eb, palta max yal bay eb axca ti': Ayex ti', caw wal jelan ex yin ioj aytek satej axca no labaj. ¿Mac max alon ayex tol chi je' e colon el e ba bay jun miman yailal ok jay e yiban yuj yowal c'ul Dios?

English: Produce fruit in keeping with repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.
Kanjobal: Ta chi na ba e c'ul yin e yobtakil, yowalil watx' che yut e beybal, yet watx' chi txecloj elok tol yel mayal e na e ba. Manchak e yal axca ti': C'am tzet chi co na', yinatil on Abraham, man quex chiok. Yujtol chi wal ayex, ta chi yal c'ul Dios, chi je' yuten oc juntzan ch'en ti' animail, cax chi oc yinatilok Abraham e q'uexelok.

English: The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
Kanjobal: A jun miman yailal ok jayok, lajan axca junok winak watx'xa yayji yetok yechej yich junok te' yet chi k'akon ajok. Masanil te' man watx'ok sat chi yak'a', chi tzoc'ajok, cax chi yak'on tz'a'ok, ẍi Juan bay eb.

English: “What should we do then?” the crowd asked.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet watx' chi jut co beybal xin? ẍi eb bay.

English: John answered, “The man with two tunics should share with him who has none, and the one who has food should do the same.”
Kanjobal: —Ta ay ex ay ca mojanok e pichil, che yak' junok yet junok mac c'am yet, yetok ex ay tzet che lo', che yak' jabok yet eb c'am yet, ẍi bay eb.

English: Tax collectors also came to be baptized. “Teacher,” they asked, “what should we do?”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jaywan eb tekom el tojlabal max jayoc bay Juan tu', yuj ul chaon eb is bautismo bay. Maxc'al jay eb, max k'anlen eb bay axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿tzet watx' chi jut watx'jok oc co beybal? ẍi eb bay.

English: “Don't collect any more than you are required to,” he told them.
Kanjobal: —A yet che tekon el tumin yin anima, atac'ala' jantak yalon ley che tekilok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then some soldiers asked him, “And what should we do?” He replied, “Don't extort money and don't accuse people falsely–be content with your pay.”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jaywan eb soldado max jayoc ul k'anlen bay axca ti'; —Axa ayon ti', ¿tzet watx' chi jut co beybal? ẍi eb bay. —Man e xibtej eb anima. Manchak e naaj k'anej yiban eb, yuj e yion ec' tzetak yetal bay eb. K'okbilokab e tojol che yi', ẍi bay eb.

English: The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might possibly be the Christ.
Kanjobal: A eb anima ayic' bay tu', chi yechbanej eb yabej, yujtol chi na eb, talaj a Juan tu' Cham Cristo.

English: John answered them all, “I baptize you with water. But one more powerful than I will come, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
Kanjobal: Palta max yal bay eb masanil axca ti': Ayin ti', wal yel chex wak' bautizar yetok aej, palta ay jun mactxel tolto ok jayok. A' ok ak'on Espíritu Santo ayex, ma xin a k'ak' ok yak' ayex, tol ok ex ak'lay bautizar yuj. A jun mactxel chi wal tu', yelxac'al miman yelapnok wintak. Yuj tu' xan man in mojok wak'on serbil jabok, caxc'al yin in xuyon el tx'anil xanab, man in mojok.

English: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
Kanjobal: A jun mactxel chi wal tu', lajan yetok junok winak chi txayej is trigo, yuj yioncan el ixim yakanej xol ixim bak'ej. Chi c'ubaj cantok ixim bak' trigo bay is c'una', axa ixim yakanej chi yak' tz'a xol jun k'ak' c'am oxlajon bak'in chi tani, ẍi Juan tu' bay eb.

English: And with many other words John exhorted the people and preached the good news to them.
Kanjobal: Xiwiltoc'al juntzanxa cuybanilej axca juntzan ti' max yal Juan bay eb anima tu', yuj yaben eb jun abix watx' yoqui.

English: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother's wife, and all the other evil things he had done,
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, max yak'lej tenchanen Herodes, cham yajaw, yujtol max montej el cham ix Herodías, yistzil yuẍtak. Man asannejok tu', palta aytoc'al juntzanxa yobtakil max el yuneni. Yuj tu' xan max yak'lej Juan tenchaneni.

English: Herod added this to them all: He locked John up in prison.
Kanjobal: Palta a Herodes tu', c'am wal jabok max yikej bay. A ti yet, tol max texac'al yiajtek c'ulok yunen juntzanxa yobtakil, ilab tol max alaytok Juan tu' preso yuj.

English: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened
Kanjobal: A yet junel, yet c'amto chi alay oc Juan tu' preso, lanan yak'on bautizar eb anima chi apni oc bay, max yak'on c'apax bautizar Jesús. A yet lanan txajli Jesús, cax max jakchaj satcan.

English: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”
Kanjobal: Axa yayol Cham Espíritu Santo yiban tu' axca junok paloma. Caw miman txequel yet max ayol tu'. Max ablay yoc k'anej max al-lay aytek satcan, max al-lay axca ti': —Ach ton ti', in C'ajol ach, cax camc'ulnebil ach wuj; caw chin tzaloj en, ẍi.

English: Now Jesus himself was about thirty years old when he began his ministry. He was the son, so it was thought, of Joseph, the son of Heli,
Kanjobal: 30 abilxam wal Jesús, max chaon el yich mulnaj yin yet Dios. A Jesús, c'ajol José naon eb anima. Tix yayji oc eb yichmam José tu': Elí,

English: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melki, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
Kanjobal: Matat, Leví, Melqui, Jana, José,

English: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
Kanjobal: Matatías, Amós, Nahum, Esli, Nagai,

English: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
Kanjobal: Maat, Matatías, Semei, José, Judá,

English: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
Kanjobal: Joana, Resa, Zorobabel, Salatiel, Neri,

English: the son of Melki, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
Kanjobal: Melqui, Adi, Cosam, Elmodam, Er,

English: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
Kanjobal: Josué, Eliezer, Jorim, Matat,

English: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
Kanjobal: Leví, Simeón, Judá, José, Jonam, Eliaquim,

English: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
Kanjobal: Melea, Mainán, Matata, Natán,

English: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
Kanjobal: David, Isaí, Obed, Booz, Salmón, Naasón,

English: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
Kanjobal: Aminadab, Admin, Aram, Esrom, Fares, Judá,

English: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
Kanjobal: Jacob, Isaac, Abraham, Taré, Nacor,

English: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
Kanjobal: Serug, Ragau, Peleg, Heber, Sala,

English: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
Kanjobal: Cainán, Arfaxad, Sem, Noé, Lamec,

English: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,
Kanjobal: Matusalén, Enoc, Jared, Mahalaleel, Cainán,

English: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
Kanjobal: Enós, Set, Adán. A Adán ti', a Dios max watx'neni.

English: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the desert,
Kanjobal: A Jesús, ay wal oc yalan yikbej Cham Espíritu Santo, max meltzojtek bay a' miman Jordán. Max ilaytok yuj Cham bay jun tz'inan tx'otx'.

English: where for forty days he was tempted by the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and at the end of them he was hungry.
Kanjobal: 40 c'ual max betic' bay tu'. Max yak'lej nak diablo yikban Cham yin yobtakil. C'am jabok tzet max lo' Cham yin juntzan c'ual tu'. Lajwi tu' max tit is wajil sic'libil.

English: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal nak diablo tu' bay axca ti': —Tutun tol C'ajol ach Dios, al bay jun ch'en ti', tol chi oc yin lojal, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus answered, “It is written: ‘Man does not live on bread alone.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay nak diablo tu': —Chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Man asannejok yuj loj chi je' jiquisbi, ẍi tx'an, ẍi Cham bay.

English: The devil led him up to a high place and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max ilaytok yuj nak diablo bay jun miman tzalan. Yin jun bek max tx'oxon masanil juntzan mimek conob yulyibank'inal ti' bay.

English: And he said to him, “I will give you all their authority and splendor, for it has been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I want to.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon nak diablo bay axca ti': —Ok ach waoc yajawilok masanil juntzan mimek conob ti', c'al yiban is beyomal. A juntzan ti', abil oc yul in k'ab. Yuj tu' xan chi je' wak'on bay tzanc'al mac bay chi yal in c'ul.

English: So if you worship me, it will all be yours.”
Kanjobal: Ta chach ay jajan ayin, cax chaon ay a ba ayin, ok wak' masanil juntzan ti' ayach, cax chi oc etok, ẍi nak bay.

English: Jesus answered, “It is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God and serve him only.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Chi yal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Iek ay e ba bay Cham Jajawil co Diosal. Asan Cham che yak' serbil, ẍi tx'an, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: The devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yion paxtok nak diablo bay Jerusalén. Max yion ajtok bay chon templo Dios. Max yalon nak bay axca ti': —Tutun tol C'ajol ach Dios, k'okaytok a ba sat tx'otx' tu'.

English: For it is written: “ ‘He will command his angels concerning you to guard you carefully;
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi yalcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Ok chektek Dios eb is yángel yet watx' chach taynelayi.

English: they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ok ach quetzlay aj yuj eb, yet watx' c'am cha chipil akan yin ch'en, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu', ẍi nak tu' bay Cham.

English: Jesus answered, “It says: ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalon pax Jesús bay: —Palta chi yal c'apax yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu' axca ti': Manchak e yak' porobal Cham Jajawil co Diosal, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu', ẍi Jesús bay.

English: When the devil had finished all this tempting, he left him until an opportune time.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', c'amxa junokxa tzet yetal max nachaj el yuj nak diablo tu' yuj yak'len yikban Cham yin yobtakil, yuj tu', max bekcan jun tiempoal.

English: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through the whole countryside.
Kanjobal: Max paxtok Jesús bay Galilea. Caw ayc'al oc yipal Cham Espíritu Santo yin. Pilan max abchaj is k'umal bay juntzan lugar tu'.

English: He taught in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.
Kanjobal: Max ec' cuywal bay jun nail wajayil eb yet israelal yin culto. Masanil anima max alon Cham watx'il.

English: He went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and on the Sabbath day he went into the synagogue, as was his custom. And he stood up to read.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max toj Jesús, max apni bay Nazaret bay max ch'ibi. Axa yet c'ual xewilal eb israel, max oc yul nail wajayil eb yin culto, axca ta' is beybal. Max aj lecanok, max yawten aj tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling it, he found the place where it is written:
Kanjobal: Max yak'on eb jun tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan bay, tx'an tz'ibbilcan yuj jun chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías. Max xuyontok, cax max sayon eltek bay chi yal axca ti':

English: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to release the oppressed,
Kanjobal: A Yespíritu Cham Dios Jajawil ayoc win, yujtol a Cham max in sic'on elok yuj walon el watx' abix bay eb meba'. A' cheknejintek, yuj walon c'apax bay eb axca tol preso yayji, tzetbil chi yun colchaj eb. Chi ul in jakon sat eb c'am chi je' yilwi. Axa eb caw chi etaxi, chi ul in colcan el eb.

English: to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor.”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, yuj ul waloncan elok tol mayal jay tiempoal jun colbanilej chi yak' Cham Dios Jajawil, ẍi tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu', max awtelay aj yuj Jesús.

English: Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa chulon pax aj Cham tx'an tu'. Axa yaon paxtok bay jun mactxel ay yopiso bay jun nail wajayil yin culto tu'. Max ay chotan Cham, cax max cuywaj bay eb. Masanil jantak eb ayoctok yul nail wajayil tu', max oc t'anan eb yin.

English: and he began by saying to them, “Today this scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”
Kanjobal: Max chaon el yich yalon bay eb axca ti': —A yet jun c'u ti', ti wal lanan yunen el e satak tzet chi yal tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: All spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his lips. “Isn't this Joseph's son?” they asked.
Kanjobal: Max al-lay Cham watx'il yuj masanil eb wajan ec' tu'. Max c'ayaj c'ul eb sic'libil, yujtol caw wal watx' juntzan tzet yetal max yal bay eb. Max c'oli yalubtanen eb axca ti': —A jun ti', a ton jun c'ajol José, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said to them, “Surely you will quote this proverb to me: ‘Physician, heal yourself! Do here in your hometown what we have heard that you did in Capernaum.’ ”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max yal Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Toxc'a ok e yal jun q'uexan k'anej ti' ayin: Ach antem anima, antejcan a ba jila', quex chi mi. Ok e yal c'apax axca ti': Chi jab yabixal xiwil tzet max el onen bay Capernaum. Un pax bay co conob ti' jila', quex chi mi ayin.

English: “I tell you the truth,” he continued, “no prophet is accepted in his hometown.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'am junok chekbej Dios ay yelapnok yul sat eb yet conob.

English: I assure you that there were many widows in Israel in Elijah's time, when the sky was shut for three and a half years and there was a severe famine throughout the land.
Kanjobal: Che natek yabixal Elías yet payxa, tzet max uj yet tu'. Nan is can abil majxa yak' nab. Max jay jun miman wajil yiban anima masanil. A yet jun tiempoal tu', xiwil eb ix jet israelal camnakxa yichamil;

English: Yet Elijah was not sent to any of them, but to a widow in Zarephath in the region of Sidon.
Kanjobal: palta manak bay eb ix tu' max cheklaytek Elías colwajok. Asan bay jun ix man israelok, ix aj Sarepta, bay cawilal Sidón, a bay ix tu' ulnak ec' colwajok.

English: And there were many in Israel with leprosy in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed–only Naaman the Syrian.”
Kanjobal: Naek c'apaxtek yabixal junxa chekbej Dios chi yik Eliseo. Xiwil eb jet israelal michchajnak aj yuj lepra. Palta c'am junok eb watx'jinakcan yuj Eliseo tu', asan jun cham man israelok chi yik Naamán, aj Siria, asan watx'jinakcan yuj, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: All the people in the synagogue were furious when they heard this.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben jantak eb ayoctok yul nail wajayil tu' juntzan ti', caw wal max tit yowal eb yin.

English: They got up, drove him out of the town, and took him to the brow of the hill on which the town was built, in order to throw him down the cliff.
Kanjobal: Xan max aj wan eb, axa yukten el eb Cham yul conob tu'. Max apni eb bay chon jun tzalan paq'uil conob, max yochej eb max ten aytok sat witz.

English: But he walked right through the crowd and went on his way.
Kanjobal: Palta max elcan besnaj Cham xol eb, axa toj tu'.

English: Then he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath began to teach the people.
Kanjobal: Max toj Jesús bay conob Capernaum, yul yet Galilea. Max c'oli cuylay eb anima yuj, yet c'ual xewilal eb israel.

English: They were amazed at his teaching, because his message had authority.
Kanjobal: Max c'ayaj c'ul eb yaben juntzan cuybanilej tu', yujtol a yet lanan k'anjabi, max txecloj elok, tol ay yikbej.

English: In the synagogue there was a man possessed by a demon, an evil spirit. He cried out at the top of his voice,
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak ayic' bay nail wajayil eb yin culto tu', ayoc espíritu yob yin. Max aj yaw jun espíritu yob tu' yin ipejal, max yalon axca ti':

English: “Ha! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are–the Holy One of God!”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet alon et jetok, ach Jesús aj Nazaret? ¿Ma yuj on ul ak'on c'ayilok xan max ach jayi? Wojtak mac ach txel. Ach ton ti', sic'bil ach el yuj Dios, ẍi bay Cham.

English: “Be quiet!” Jesus said sternly. “Come out of him!” Then the demon threw the man down before them all and came out without injuring him.
Kanjobal: Axa tzuwaj Cham yin jun espíritu yob tu': —Tz'in cachi. Elan yin jun winak ti', ẍi bay. Ayman max k'oklay ay nak sat tx'otx' yuj jun espíritu yob tu' satak masanil, axa yel yin nak tu'. C'am jabok bay max yasjican yuj.

English: All the people were amazed and said to each other, “What is this teaching? With authority and power he gives orders to evil spirits and they come out!”
Kanjobal: Max c'ayaj c'ul masanil eb max iloni, axa yalubtanen eb axca ti': —¿Tzet laj yayji juntzan k'anej max yal ti'? A jun winak ti', caw ay yikbej, toltax ay yikbej yin chekon el eb espíritu yob. Ilab tol chi el yuj, ẍi eb.

English: And the news about him spread throughout the surrounding area.
Kanjobal: Max abchaj aj k'umal Jesús xol masanil eb anima bay juntzan lugar is cawilal tu'.

English: Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Now Simon's mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
Kanjobal: Axa yeltek Jesús yul nail wajayil tu', max toj bay yatut Simón. Caw ya'ay xal ni' Simón tu' yuj k'ak'al ilya', xan max yal eb yailal bay Cham.

English: So he bent over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began to wait on them.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc lecan Cham c'atan xal tu'. Max tenon oc wanaj jun k'ak'al ilya' tu'. Ayman max sicbi yin xal. Axa yaj wan xal tu', max ak'lay serbil eb yuj xal.

English: When the sun was setting, the people brought to Jesus all who had various kinds of sickness, and laying his hands on each one, he healed them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet yayc'ualil, masanil eb mactaktxel ay is ya'ay yuj tzanc'al tzet ilyail, max yitek eb bay Jesús. Max batxbajtok Cham k'ab yiban junjun eb. Axa jaycan c'ul eb tu'.

English: Moreover, demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Christ.
Kanjobal: Xiwil mac max yican el espíritu yob yin. Chi aj yaw eb espíritu tu' chi yalon eb axca ti': —Ach ti', C'ajol ach Dios, ẍi eb bay. Palta max tenchanelay eb yuj Cham. Maj cha' k'anjab eb, yujtol yojtak eb tol a ton Cristo.

English: At daybreak Jesus went out to a solitary place. The people were looking for him and when they came to where he was, they tried to keep him from leaving them.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbi el xin, max toj Jesús tiel conob bay c'am anima. Palta max toj eb anima sayon ec'ok. Max apni oc eb bay ayic' tu', max c'oli yoc tean eb yin tol manchak toji.

English: But he said, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because that is why I was sent.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Yowalil chi ec' walcan el watx' abix bay juntzanxa conob, yet watx' chi yabcan oc eb tol toxa ok occan Dios yin Yajawil. A ton yuj jun ti' xan chekbilintek, ẍi bay eb.

English: And he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max ec'c'al Jesús yalon el k'anej Dios bay junjun nail wajayil eb yet israelal yin culto bay yulak yet Judea tu'.

English: One day as Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, with the people crowding around him and listening to the word of God,
Kanjobal: A yet junel, max toj Jesús ti a' mar Genesaret. Xiwil mac max waj ba yin Cham bay tu'. Caw wal chi witz' ba eb yin, yujtol chi yochej eb chi yab is k'anej Dios.

English: he saw at the water's edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets.
Kanjobal: Axa max yilon Jesús, ay cab barco ayic' ti' melemal a'. C'am yajaw te' ayoctok yul, yujtol lanan tx'ajon eb is txim mitx'bal txay.

English: He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' max octok Cham yul jun te' yet Simón. Max lajwi tu' max yalon bay tol chi jitztok ba eb jabokxa bay pimal a'. Max lajwi tu', max ay chotan Cham. Ata tu' max cuywajtek bay eb anima.

English: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi cuywaj bay eb xin, max yalon bay Simón tu' axca ti': —Co jitzektok co ba bay najat yich a'. Ata bay tu' ok e yaaytok e txim mitx'bal txay ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: Simon answered, “Master, we've worked hard all night and haven't caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.”
Kanjobal: —Mamin, masanilc'al ak'bal max jak'lej ma'i, palta c'am tzet max ji'. Palta yuj wal tol ach chala', xan ok tok waaytok txim ti' junelxa, ẍi Simón bay.

English: When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.
Kanjobal: Axa wal yet max yaon aytok eb is txim tu', manxa jantakok no' max michchaji. Max c'oli nic'chajtok yulak sat txim eb tu' yuj no'.

English: So they signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.
Kanjobal: Axa yak'on eb k'ab bay juntzanxa eb yetbi bay junxa te barco, yet watx' chi tit eb colwaj ul tok'on ajtek no' yetok eb. Max jayoc eb xin, max colwaj eb, max yak'on noj eb te barco tu' cabil yuj no'. Ijan chi paxay te' yich a' yuj yalil no'.

English: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus' knees and said, “Go away from me, Lord; I am a sinful man!”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Simón Pedro tu' jun tu', max ay jajnaj satak Jesús, max yalon bay: —Mamin, mata chach el in c'atan, yujtol ayin ti', caw yobtakwom in, ẍi bay Cham.

English: For he and all his companions were astonished at the catch of fish they had taken,
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yalon axca tu', yujtol caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul yetok eb ajun yetok yet max yilon oc eb no txay tu'.

English: and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon's partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Don't be afraid; from now on you will catch men.”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax Jacobo c'al Juan, eb nak c'ajol Zebedeo, ajun eb yetok Simón tu', caw wal max c'ay c'apax c'ul eb yiloni. Axa yalon Jesús bay Simón: —Manchak ach xiwi. Axca chot a mitx'on no txay ti', axca tu' ok ot eontek eb anima ayin, yet ok beytok ti', ẍi bay.

English: So they pulled their boats up on shore, left everything and followed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni oc eb ti a' yetok te barco tu xin, max bekoncan eb is tzetak yetal masanil, axa tzakloj eb yintak Jesús.

English: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
Kanjobal: A yet junel, yet ayic' Jesús bay jun conob, max jayoc jun winak bay. Caw ya'ay sic'libil yuj lepra. A yet max yilon nak yin Jesús, max ay jajanok cax max ay nojan sat tx'otx' satak Cham. Max oc tean nak yin, max yalon axca ti': —Mamin, ta chi yal a c'ul, chi je' in a watx'nencanok, ẍi nak bay Cham.

English: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!” And immediately the leprosy left him.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc matxan k'ab Cham yin nak tu'. —Chi yal in c'ul; ti chi wak'can watx'jok a c'ul, ẍi bay nak. Lajwic'al yalon jun tu', axa tak juntzan yabil tu' yin nak.

English: Then Jesus ordered him, “Don't tell anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max cam yalon Cham bay nak axca ti': —Ayta bay chal jun ti'. Asi', cha tx'oxon a ba bay junok sacerdote cax chak'on ofrenda bay Dios, axca yalon ley Moisés. Axca tu' ok yun a txecloj c'apax elok, tol mayal ach watx'ji, ẍi Jesús bay nak.
