English: Yet the news about him spread all the more, so that crowds of people came to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.
Kanjobal: Palta tol max texac'al el k'umal Jesús xol anima, xan xiwil max waj ba eb yin Cham. Chi yochej eb chi abxalwi bay Cham, cax chi yochen c'apax eb chi watx'jican c'ul yin tzetak ilyail chi on eb.

English: But Jesus often withdrew to lonely places and prayed.
Kanjobal: Axa Cham chi betc'al ec' bay c'am anima. A bay tu' chi bet txajlok.

English: One day as he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law, who had come from every village of Galilee and from Judea and Jerusalem, were sitting there. And the power of the Lord was present for him to heal the sick.
Kanjobal: Axa yet jun c'ual, max cuywaj Jesús bay eb anima. Ay juntzan eb fariseo chotan ec' bay tu', yetok juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. A bay junjun conob yul yet Galilea yetok yul yet Judea max tit eb. Ay c'apax eb max tit bay Jerusalén. Caw wal max txecloj el yipalil Dios yin Jesús bay tu' yuj yak'on watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay.

English: Some men came carrying a paralytic on a mat and tried to take him into the house to lay him before Jesus.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan cuywaj tu', max apni oc jaywan winak. Yetbi oc eb jun winak sicbinak el is mimanil. Batxbil oc yuj eb sat is wayub. Max yochej eb max octok yetok yul na, cax max telban ay eb satak Jesús yaloni.

English: When they could not find a way to do this because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him on his mat through the tiles into the middle of the crowd, right in front of Jesus.
Kanjobal: Palta maj je' yoctok eb yetok nak, yujtol caw wal nojnak yul na tu' yuj anima. Yuj tu', max ajtok eb yiban na. Cax max yion el eb jayeb tx'otx' teja, axa yaon aytok t'ununok eb nak yetok is wayub tu' xol anima, max ayapnok nak satak Jesús.

English: When Jesus saw their faith, he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús tol max yaoc eb nak c'ul yin, axa yalon Cham bay nak sicbinak el is mimanil tu': —Ach anima, max ak'lay tan a yobtakil, ẍi bay nak.

English: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law began thinking to themselves, “Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
Kanjobal: Axa eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés c'al eb fariseo, max na eb axca ti': ¿Mactxel jun winak ti', xan chi yal buchwal k'anej yin Dios? Tok ay junok mac chi je' yak'on tan yobtakilej, asannej Dios, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus knew what they were thinking and asked, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
Kanjobal: Palta yojtak Jesús tzet lanan naon eb, yuj tu' xan max yal axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che na' juntzan tu'?

English: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
Kanjobal: ¿Mactet junok yel suboj jaloni c'al yuneni xol cab k'anej ti' che na'? ¿Ta con chi axca ti': Max ak'lay tan a yobtakil, ma a': Ajan wanok, cax beyan, ta con chi?

English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins....” He said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”
Kanjobal: A tinani' ok in tx'ox ayex, tol a ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, chic'al je' wuj wak'on tan is yobtakil eb anima yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi bay eb. Max lajwi tu', axa yalon bay nak sicbinak el is mimanil tu', axca ti': —Ayin chi wal ayach, ajan wanok. Iaj a wayub ti'. Paxan bay atut, ẍi bay nak.

English: Immediately he stood up in front of them, took what he had been lying on and went home praising God.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max aj wan nak satak eb, axa yion aj nak is wayub bay telan ay tu'. Max pax nak bay yatut, lanan yalon watx' k'anej bay Dios.

English: Everyone was amazed and gave praise to God. They were filled with awe and said, “We have seen remarkable things today.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul masanil eb max ilon tu'. Max yalon c'apax eb watx' k'anej bay Dios. Caw wal chi xiw c'apax eb, xan max yal eb: —A juntzan tzet yetal lanan jilon yet jun c'u ti', chi c'ayaj co c'ul jiloni, ẍi eb.

English: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector by the name of Levi sitting at his tax booth. “Follow me,” Jesus said to him,
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max toj Jesús. Lanan wal beyi, max yilon yin jun tekom el tojlabal chi yik Leví. Chotan ay bay chi tekwi el tojlabal bay eb anima. —Tzaklojan cuywok wintak, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: and Levi got up, left everything and followed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan tu', max bekoncan masanil is tzetak yetal. Max chaon el yich yec'c'al cuywok yintak Jesús.

English: Then Levi held a great banquet for Jesus at his house, and a large crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.
Kanjobal: A Leví tu', max yak' watx'jok jun miman loj bay yatut, yet watx' chi low Jesús yetok. Xiwil eb tekom el tojlabal, yetok juntzanxa anima max oc chotan yin meẍa yetok eb.

English: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law who belonged to their sect complained to his disciples, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and ‘sinners’?”
Kanjobal: Palta eb fariseo xin, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yob tzet chi yal eb bay eb cuywom Jesús. Max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chex lowi c'al e yuq'uen a' yetok eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al yetok juntzanxa eb yob is beybal ti'? ẍi eb bay eb.

English: Jesus answered them, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —K'inalok ta ayic' junok antem anima tinani', tok ay yopiso yuj eb watx' c'ul. Asan eb ya'ay, a eb tu' ay yopiso yuj.

English: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
Kanjobal: Man yujok wawten eb watx' is beybal naoni, xan max in jayi, palta yuj ul wawten eb chi yojtaknej el ba tol yobtakwom, yet watx' chi na ba eb yin is yobtakil, ẍi bay eb.

English: They said to him, “John's disciples often fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours go on eating and drinking.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon eb bay Jesús axca ti': —A eb cuywom Juan, cham ak'om bautismo, yetok eb cuywom eb fariseo, xiwil el chi yak' eb c'ajbanc'ulal, cax chi txajli eb, palta a eb a cuywom ach ti', ¿tzet yuj xan asan loj chi yun eb? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “Can you make the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb axca ti': —K'inalok ay junok nupayil chi oc tinani'. A eb awtebil bay jun nupayil tu', ¿tom ok je' tol man ok low eb yet ayic' nak lanan nupay tu' yetok eb?

English: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; in those days they will fast.”
Kanjobal: Ato yet ok ajapnok tiempoal yilay el nak xol eb, catatu' bian ok oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal, ẍi bay eb.

English: He told them this parable: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old one. If he does, he will have torn the new garment, and the patch from the new will not match the old.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalontek junxa abix ti' bay eb: —C'am junok mactxel chi lot'il jabok nip yin an ac' pichilej, cax chi yaon oc nipilok junok an icham pichilej. Ta ay bay caytu' chi yut xin, chi yetnej el an ac' tu'. Yetok c'apaxok, man watx'ok chi yuncan an icham tu' yuj an ac' tu'.

English: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined.
Kanjobal: Cac'apax tu', c'am mac chi aon ay vino ato watx'ji yul junok icham tz'um netal vino, yujtol a yet chi sipc'oj aj jun vino tu', chi nic'chaj no tz'um netal vino tu' yuj, cax toc'al chi etax el vino tu', c'al no tz'um tu'.

English: No, new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan asan yul ac' tz'um netal vino chi ay juntzan vino ato watx'ji tu', yet watx' c'amc'al junok toc'al chi etax elok.

English: And no one after drinking old wine wants the new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, a mac mayal uq'uen vino ayxa c'ubay ec'ok, tok chito yochej jun ato watx'ji tu'. Chi yalon eb axca ti': A vino ayxa watx'ji ti', yelxac'al watx', ẍi eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to pick some heads of grain, rub them in their hands and eat the kernels.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual xewilal eb yet israelal, max ec' Jesús bay jun be xol juntzan ixim trigo yetok eb is cuywom. A eb cuywom tu', max yiel eb jayeb jolom ixim, max batzon el eb ixim c'uxu'.

English: Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why are you doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen el juntzan eb fariseo bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che yun mulnajil tol ay yowalil junen yet jun c'ual xewilal ti'? ẍi eb bay eb.

English: Jesus answered them, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —¿Tom c'amto bay che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok tzet max yun David junel, yet max tit is wajil yetok eb ajun yetok?

English: He entered the house of God, and taking the consecrated bread, he ate what is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”
Kanjobal: Max octok yul templo Dios, yion aj ixim pan yet Dios yayji. Max loon yetok eb ajun yetok tu'. A juntzan pan tu', asan eb sacerdote ay leyal looni.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
Kanjobal: —Ayin ti', chi je' walon tzet chi je' el junen yet c'ual xewilal, yujtol Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, ẍi Jesús bay eb fariseo tu'.

English: On another Sabbath he went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there whose right hand was shriveled.
Kanjobal: A yet junxa c'ual xewilal, max octok Jesús yul jun nail wajayil eb yet israelal yin culto. Max c'oli cuywaj nan xol eb. Ay jun winak sicbinak el is watx' k'ab ayic' bay tu'.

English: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath.
Kanjobal: Axa eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés yetok eb fariseo, max mak eb yila' ta ok watx'nejcan Jesús is k'ab nak tu' yul c'ual xewilal, yujtol max yochej eb max ilchaj junok tzet max oc is mulok Cham, cax chi yak'on queja eb.

English: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Get up and stand in front of everyone.” So he got up and stood there.
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Cham tzet lanan naon oc eb yin, yuj tu' xan max yal bay nak sicbinak el is k'ab tu' axca ti': —Ajan wanok, cax chach oc lecan co nan ti', ẍi bay nak. Axa yaj lecan nak tu'.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Ay jun tzet ok in k'anlej el ayex: ¿Baytet ay junok ay is leyal junen yet c'ual xewilal che na'? ¿A mi tzet watx' chi je' el juneni, ma a tzet yob? ¿Chi mi je' jak'on jaycan c'ul junok ya'ay, ma co bekon camok? ẍi bay eb.

English: He looked around at them all, and then said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did so, and his hand was completely restored.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu' max ec' t'ananok Cham xol eb oyan oc yin tu'. Max yalon bay nak axca ti': —Bitok a k'ab, ẍi bay nak. Max biontok nak k'ab, cax max watx'ji canok.

English: But they were furious and began to discuss with one another what they might do to Jesus.
Kanjobal: Palta caw max tit yowal juntzanxa eb, axa lajtinen el ba eb tu' yuj tzet ok yut eb Jesús.

English: One of those days Jesus went out to a mountainside to pray, and spent the night praying to God.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', max toj Jesús txajlok bay jun tzalan. Jun ak'bal txajc'al max yun bay Dios bay tu'.

English: When morning came, he called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he also designated apostles:
Kanjobal: Axa yet max k'inibi aj yet junxa c'ual, axa yawtentok eb is cuywom tu' c'atan, max sic'on el lajcawan xol eb, axa yaon oc yopiso eb tu' yuj yoc eb is chekbejok.

English: Simon (whom he named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
Kanjobal: Tixtak is bi eb ti': Simón, nak max yik c'apax Pedro yuj, yetok jun yuẍtak nak chi yik Andrés, yetok Jacobo, Juan, Felipe, Bartolomé,

English: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,
Kanjobal: Mateo, Tomás. Ay junxa chi yik Jacobo c'ajol Alfeo, ay junxa Simón c'apax bi, ayoc yin is partido eb cananista yet yalantok.

English: Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
Kanjobal: Ay jun chi yik Judas, yuẍtak Jacobo, yetok c'apax Judas Iscariote, nak max aon oc Jesús yul k'ab camich.

English: He went down with them and stood on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples was there and a great number of people from all over Judea, from Jerusalem, and from the coast of Tyre and Sidon,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yaytek Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay jun tzalan tu'. Palan yayol eb bay jun ac'al. Xiwil anima max tit bay juntzan conoblak yul yet Judea max jayoc eb bay Cham. Ay eb max tit bay conob Jerusalén. Ay c'apax eb max tit bay tilak a' mar, bay Tiro yetok bay Sidón. Max ulic' eb abxalwok bay Cham. Ay eb xin, yuj watx'jican yuj junok is yailal, xan chi ulic' eb.

English: who had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. Those troubled by evil spirits were cured,
Kanjobal: A eb ok'bal c'ul yayji yuj eb espíritu yob, max jaycan c'ul eb yuj.

English: and the people all tried to touch him, because power was coming from him and healing them all.
Kanjobal: Chi yochej eb masanil chi ec' oc matxan k'ab yin Jesús, yujtol chi watx'jican eb masanil yuj is yipalil Cham.

English: Looking at his disciples, he said: “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
Kanjobal: Axa yec' t'ananok Jesús xol eb is cuywom tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': A ayex meba ex ti', watx' e yet, yujtol ayex oc yul k'ab Dios.

English: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
Kanjobal: A ayex ay e wajil ti', watx' e yet, yujtol ok nojcan e c'ul. A ayex chex ok' ti', watx' e yet, yujtol ok ex tzewok.

English: Blessed are you when men hate you, when they exclude you and insult you and reject your name as evil, because of the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Wujc'al ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', xan ok chichon oc c'ul eb anima e yin, ok ex yuktej el eb xol, cax ok ex buchlay yuj eb. Wujc'al, xan caw yobc'al tzet ok yal eb e yin, palta a yet caytu' ok ex yut eb axca tu', caw watx' e yet.

English: “Rejoice in that day and leap for joy, because great is your reward in heaven. For that is how their fathers treated the prophets.
Kanjobal: Tzalojanek wal sic'libil, yujtol ay tzet ok e cha' paktzilok bay satcan. Axca chex utlay ti' tinani', cay c'apax tu' max utlay eb chekbej Dios yuj eb anima yet payxa.

English: “But woe to you who are rich, for you have already received your comfort.
Kanjobal: Palta a ayex beyom ex, caw ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol mayal e yil watx'takil cayti'.

English: Woe to you who are well fed now, for you will go hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
Kanjobal: A ayex nojnak e c'ul ti', caw ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol ok jay jun tiempoal ok e yak' wajil. Axa mac ex chex tzew tinani', caw ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol ok ex ok' yuj cusc'ulal.

English: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for that is how their fathers treated the false prophets.
Kanjobal: A yet watx' exxac'al yalon anima, caw ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol caytu' max al-lay yin eb chi yaloc ba chekbejok Dios yuj eb jichmam.

English: “But I tell you who hear me: Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex mac ex lanan e yacban e txiquin ayin ti', tol che ya'ilnej eb ajc'ulok e yin. Ak'ek watx'c'ulal bay eb chi chichon oc c'ul e yin.

English: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.
Kanjobal: A eb chi k'anontek yowal c'ul Dios e yiban, axaokabxa watx'c'ulal Dios che k'antek yiban eb. Chex txajli yuj eb chex buchoni.

English: If someone strikes you on one cheek, turn to him the other also. If someone takes your cloak, do not stop him from taking your tunic.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi mak'ontok jun pac'ok e sat, che yacbajtok jun pac'xa mak'a'. Ta ay mac chi tok'on ec' e jokan pichil, bekek c'apax tok e camiẍ yetok.

English: Give to everyone who asks you, and if anyone takes what belongs to you, do not demand it back.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi k'anon junok tzet yetal ayex, ak'ek bay. A eb chi ion ec' junok e tzet yetal, manchakxa e k'an meltzoj bay eb.

English: Do to others as you would have them do to you.
Kanjobal: Che yochej tol watx' chi yut ba eb e yet animail ayex, yuj tu' xan, watx'okab che yut e ba bay eb.

English: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even ‘sinners’ love those who love them.
Kanjobal: Ta asan eb chex camc'ulneni che camc'ulnej, ¿xin ta watx' axca tu'? A eb yobtakwom, cay c'apax tu' chi beybalnej eb.

English: And if you do good to those who are good to you, what credit is that to you? Even ‘sinners’ do that.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta asan bay eb watx' chi yut ba ayex, watx' che yut e ba, ¿xin ta watx' axca tu' che na'? A eb yobtakwom, cay c'apax tu' chi beybalnej eb.

English: And if you lend to those from whom you expect repayment, what credit is that to you? Even ‘sinners’ lend to ‘sinners,’ expecting to be repaid in full.
Kanjobal: Ta asan bay mac chi ak'on meltzoj e tumin, che yak' majanil, ¿xin ta watx' axca tu'? A eb yobtakwom chi yak' c'apax eb is tumin majanil bay eb yet yobtakwomal, yujtol chi na eb chaon pax junelxa.

English: But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without expecting to get anything back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti xin, camc'ulnejek eb ajc'ul oc e yin. Ak'ekc'al watx'c'ulal. A yet che yak'on e tumin majanil, man e na' e chaon q'uexel. Ta che beybalnej axca tu', caw miman tzet ok e cha' q'uexelok bay satcan, cax chi txecloj c'apax elok tol yuninal exxa c'apax Dios, Cham Axac'al Ocok. Ilab chi tx'ox Cham watx'c'ulal bay eb yobtakwom, eb tamwal chi yal yuj diosal jabok yuj tzet chi cha' bay.

English: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
Kanjobal: Ok'okab e c'ul yin e yet animail, axca chi yun yok' c'ul co Mam Dios e yin.

English: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
Kanjobal: Manchak e beyc'ulnej junokxa mactxel, yet watx' c'am chex beyc'ulnelay yuj Dios. Man comonok che yal tol ay mul junok mactxel, yet watx' c'am chi yal Dios tol ay e mul c'apaxok. Joek c'ay yowal e c'ul yin e yet animail, cax ok joon c'ay Dios yowal c'ul e yiban.

English: Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.”
Kanjobal: Ak'ek bay e yet animail; ta caytu' ok e yutej, ok yak' c'apax Dios ayex. Axca wal junok tzet yetal tz'akaki chi yun yechelay bay e net teq'ueq'ui chi yunej, bululi chi yunej, c'amxa chi je' pixlay ti' is netal, caytu' ok yut yak'on Dios tzetak yetal ayex. Axca che yut e yak'on bay e yet animail, caytu' ok yut yak'on c'apax Dios ayex.

English: He also told them this parable: “Can a blind man lead a blind man? Will they not both fall into a pit?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok mac c'am chi je' yilwi, ¿xin ta chi je' quetzon bey junokxa c'am chi je' yilwi? Chi tok'lejtok ba eb cawanil yul olan.

English: A student is not above his teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will be like his teacher.
Kanjobal: C'am junok cuywom ec'ban yelapnok yintak is meẍtol, palta a yet chi lajwi is cuyoj, lajanxa axca is meẍtol tu'.

English: “Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok e yet animail chi toj junok c'ajil k'alem yul sat. Ayexxa xin, k'inalok ay pax junok patzab ayoctok yul e sat, ta c'am che yiltek tol ay te' ayoctok yul e sat, ¿tom ato wal jab k'alem ayoctok yul sat e yet animail tu' ok e yiltek?

English: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when you yourself fail to see the plank in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok te patzab ayoctok yul a sat xin, tok ok je' alon bay et animail axca ti': Jilto wali, jiiltek jun c'ajil k'alem ayoctok yul a sat tu', tok quex chi. Palta tatol caytu' che yut e yaloni, cabsat ex chi yal tu'. Iek eltek jun te patzab ayoctok yul e sat tu' babelal, catatu bian, ok je' e yilon e yion eltek jun c'ajil k'alem yul sat e yet animail tu'.

English: “No good tree bears bad fruit, nor does a bad tree bear good fruit.
Kanjobal: A te te' watx', c'am junok te yob sat chi yak'a'. Ac'ala' c'apax te yob, c'am junok te watx' sat chi yak'a'.

English: Each tree is recognized by its own fruit. People do not pick figs from thornbushes, or grapes from briers.
Kanjobal: Yuj sat junjun te' chi yak'a', xan chi jojtaknej el te' tzet teal te'. K'inalok junok te q'uix tinani', tokwal sat higo chi yak'a'. K'inalok c'apax junok te cak q'uix tinani', tokwal sat uva chi yak'a'.

English: The good man brings good things out of the good stored up in his heart, and the evil man brings evil things out of the evil stored up in his heart. For out of the overflow of his heart his mouth speaks.
Kanjobal: A mac watx' is nabal, watx' tzet chi el yuneni, yujtol asan tzet yetal watx' ay yin is nabal. A pax eb yob is nabal xin, yob c'apax tzet chi el yunen eb, yujtol asan tzet yob ay yin is nabal eb, yujtol a tzet ay yin co nabal, a' chi jala'.

English: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuj xan, Mamin Wajaw quex chi ayin, palta c'am che yikej pax tzet chi wala'?

English: I will show you what he is like who comes to me and hears my words and puts them into practice.
Kanjobal: Ok waltek ayex tzet ok yun yeloc eb chi abxalwi ayin, ta chi yikej eb tzet chi wala'.

English: He is like a man building a house, who dug down deep and laid the foundation on rock. When a flood came, the torrent struck that house but could not shake it, because it was well built.
Kanjobal: Lajan ok yun yeloc eb axca junok winak chi watx'nej yatut. Chi jupanej tx'otx' masantac'al chi ayapnok bay tx'otx' caw sat, cax chi yaon ay yich. Chi lajwi watx'ji yuj xin, chi c'oli yeq'uel elom aej yinlak, chi aj can a', ow chi yun mak'on oc ba a' yichlak, palta c'amc'al jabok chi bili, yujtol caw wal watx' yay yich.

English: But the one who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. The moment the torrent struck that house, it collapsed and its destruction was complete.”
Kanjobal: Palta a eb c'am chi yikej pax tzet chi wal bay, yet chi xew yabxalwi ayin, lajan eb axca junok mactxel toc'al chi chotbaj ay yatut sat tx'otx'. C'am yich chi yatok yul tx'otx'. Chi lajwi watx'ji tu', chi c'oli yeq'uel elom aej yinlak jun na tu', chi aj can a'. Ow chi yun mak'on oc ba a' yichlak. Ayman chi telc'oj jun tu', cax chi etax ayok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When Jesus had finished saying all this in the hearing of the people, he entered Capernaum.
Kanjobal: A yet max xew k'anjab Jesús bay eb anima, max toj bay Capernaum.

English: There a centurion's servant, whom his master valued highly, was sick and about to die.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' ay jun cham capitán aj Roma. Ay jun is moso cham caw xajan yuj sic'libil, palta ya'ay, cax toxa chi cami.

English: The centurion heard of Jesus and sent some elders of the Jews to him, asking him to come and heal his servant.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham k'umal Jesús, max chekontok jaywan eb winak ay yopiso xol eb israel. Max bet oc tean eb yin Jesús yet chi toj yak' watx'jok nak is moso cham tu'.

English: When they came to Jesus, they pleaded earnestly with him, “This man deserves to have you do this,
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay Jesús, max oc tean eb yin, max yalon eb bay axca ti': —A jun cham capitán tu', moj wal chach colwaj bay cham,

English: because he loves our nation and has built our synagogue.”
Kanjobal: yujtol caw wal ay is camc'ulal cham jin ayon israel on ti'. Max yak' watx'jok cham jun nail bay chi co waj co ba yin culto, ẍi eb bay.

English: So Jesus went with them. He was not far from the house when the centurion sent friends to say to him: “Lord, don't trouble yourself, for I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max toj Jesús yetok eb, palta jabxanej wal yapni oc eb bay na tu', max chekon cham capitán tu' jaywan eb is yamigo bay Jesús. Max yalon eb axca ti' bay: —Chi yaltek cham ayach axca ti': Mamin, manchakxa etnej a ba a jay ayin, yujtol man in mojok chach jay yul watut.

English: That is why I did not even consider myself worthy to come to you. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan tamwal max in tec'baj in ba in toj ayin caw walon ayach yuj nak in moso ti'. Asannejokab tol chala' tol chi watx'jican nak, axa watx'jican nak oj tu'.

English: For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and that one, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
Kanjobal: Wojtak jun ti', yujtol ayin ti', ay eb wajawil chin chekoni, ac'ala' ay c'apax eb soldado chin cheka'. Ta ay junok mac chin cheka', chic'al yikej toji. Ta ay mac chi wawtej, chic'al yikej jayi. Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay tzet chin chek watx'nej junok in moso, chic'al yikej watx'neni, ẍitek cham capitán tu', ẍi eb bay Jesús.

English: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed at him, and turning to the crowd following him, he said, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith even in Israel.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús axca tu', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul yabeni. Axa yoc t'anan yin eb anima tzakan yintak tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'amto junok eb jet israelal maxax wil wal yaon oc c'ul win axca jun winak ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: Then the men who had been sent returned to the house and found the servant well.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max jay eb is chekbej bay na tu xin, max yilon eb tol mayal watx'jican nak mosejal tu'.

English: Soon afterward, Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went along with him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa toj Jesús bay jun conob chi yik Naín yetok eb is cuywom. Xiwil anima max tzakloj yintak eb.

English: As he approached the town gate, a dead person was being carried out–the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the town was with her.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yapni eb cawilal jun conob tu', ay jun camnak lanan toj muklay max yil eb. Xiwil eb aj conob bay tu' tzakan yintak. A nak max cam tu', jun ch'an c'otan nak yuj is txutx, camnakxa yichamil xal txutxej tu'.

English: When the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her and he said, “Don't cry.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon oc Cham Jajawil yin xal txutxej tu', max ok' c'ul Cham yin xal. —Manchak ach ok'i, ẍi Cham bay xal.

English: Then he went up and touched the coffin, and those carrying it stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa jitzontok ba Jesús cawilal batxlub nak camom tu'. Axa yoc matxan yin is batxlubal tu', max oc wanaj eb batxnej tu'. Axa yalon bay nak camnakxa tu' axca ti': —Ach ach'ej, chi wal ayach, ajan wanok, ẍi bay nak.

English: The dead man sat up and began to talk, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj chotan nak camnak tu', max c'oli k'anjab aj nak. Axa yak'oncan Jesús nak bay is txutx tu'.

English: They were all filled with awe and praised God. “A great prophet has appeared among us,” they said. “God has come to help his people.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb anima jun ti', caw max xiwaj eb masanil, max yalon eb is watx' k'anej bay Dios: —Caw miman yikbej is chekbej Dios max chektek co xol yuj on is coloni, ẍi eb.

English: This news about Jesus spread throughout Judea and the surrounding country.
Kanjobal: A jun tzet max el yunen Jesús yet tu', max abchaj bay masanil Judea, yetok bay juntzanxa conoblak is cawilal tu'.

English: John's disciples told him about all these things. Calling two of them,
Kanjobal: Axa eb cuywom Juan cham ak'om bautismo, a' max bet alon bay jantak tzet max el yunen Jesús, xan max yawtejtek Juan tu' cawan eb is cuywom.

English: he sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else?”
Kanjobal: Axa chekontok eb bay Jesús yuj toj k'anlen eb, ta a Jesús Cham Cristo, ta a' lanan yechbanen eb jayi, ma tx'ok junokxa chi yechbanej eb jay xin.

English: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else?’ ”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a yet max jayoc eb bay Jesús, max yalon eb axca ti' bay: —A Juan cham ak'om bautismo cheknejontek ayach. Chi ul co k'anlej ayach ta ach Cristo ach, a ton Cham lanan jechbanen jayi, ma tx'ok junokxa chi jechbanej jay xin, ẍi eb bay.

English: At that very time Jesus cured many who had diseases, sicknesses and evil spirits, and gave sight to many who were blind.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', xiwil eb ya'ay yuj tzanc'al tzet yailal, c'al eb ayoc espíritu yob yin max watx'jican eb yuj Jesús. Xiwil c'apax eb c'am chi je' yilwi max jakchajcan sat yuj.

English: So he replied to the messengers, “Go back and report to John what you have seen and heard: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those who have leprosy are cured, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is preached to the poor.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Jesús bay eb chekbej Juan tu' axca ti': —Paxanek bay Juan. Che yal bay, masanil tzetak max e yabej c'al tzetak max e yil cayti'. Che yal bay, tol ay eb c'amc'alta' chi je' beyi, chixa bey eb tinani'. A eb ayoc lepra yin, chi watx'jican eb. A eb c'am chi je' yabeni, chixa yab eb. Aylaj eb camnak lanan yictzojcan ajok. Lanan yal-laycan el k'anejal yet colbanilej bay eb meba'.

English: Blessed is the man who does not fall away on account of me.”
Kanjobal: Watx' yet eb c'am chi somchajcan el c'ul win. Caytu' che yut e yalon bay Juan tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: After John's messengers left, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: “What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed swayed by the wind?
Kanjobal: A yet mayal paxcantok eb chekbej tu', max yalontek Jesús yuj Juan tu' bay eb anima axca ti': Naektek, tzet max bet e yil bay tz'inan tx'otx'. ¿A mi junok te aj chi ec' meeok yuj cak'ek' max bet e yila'?

English: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear expensive clothes and indulge in luxury are in palaces.
Kanjobal: Ta man ajok, ¿tzet max bet e yil xin? ¿Ma a junok winak watx' pichay max bet e yila'? E yojtak tol a eb watx' pichay tu', c'al eb xiwil tzet ay, a bay yatut eb rey ay eb.

English: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
Kanjobal: Ta c'amak xin, ¿tzet max bet e yila'? ¿Ma a junok chekbej Dios max bet e yila'? Wal yel chekbej ton Dios jun max bet e yil tu'. Palta a Juan tu', man asannejok chekbej Dios tu' yopiso.

English: This is the one about whom it is written: “ ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’
Kanjobal: A ton yabixal Juan ti' yalnakcan Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Ok in chek babjok in chekbej a satak yet watx' chi toj watx'nej a be, ẍi.

English: I tell you, among those born of women there is no one greater than John; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex tol a xol eb anima yulyibank'inal ti', c'am junok mactxel ec'ban yelapnok yintak Juan tu', palta a xol eb ayxa oc yul k'ab Dios xin, ta ay junok yaynakil yayji, ec'banc'alta' watx'il yet yintak Juan tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: (All the people, even the tax collectors, when they heard Jesus' words, acknowledged that God's way was right, because they had been baptized by John.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb anima yetok eb tekom el tumin tzet max yala', max yalon eb tol caw wal watx' Dios, yujtol max yak' ba eb yak'lay bautizar yuj Juan tu'.

English: But the Pharisees and experts in the law rejected God's purpose for themselves, because they had not been baptized by John.)
Kanjobal: Palta eb fariseo yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, maj je' eb yak'lay bautizar. Axca ton ti', chi yut tx'oxk'abnen el eb tol a tzet chi yochej Dios yin eb, c'am jabok yelapnok yul sat eb.

English: “To what, then, can I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham Jajawil bay eb anima ayic' tu' axca ti': A wal eb anima yet jun tiempoal ti', ok waltek ayex tzetbil yayji nabal eb.

English: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling out to each other: “ ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not cry.’
Kanjobal: Lajan eb axca unin toc'al chi ec'jab txonbal. Aylaj eb chi yal bay juntzanokxa yet uninal axca ti': Nabac'al max jetnej co ba co xuon bit yin chirima e yuj, palta majc'al ex canalwok paxok. Yetok c'apaxok, nabac'al max co bitnej juntzan bit cusiltakxac'al yoqui, palta majc'al e tz'ak ok' pax e ba jetok, ẍi eb. Axca wal eb unin c'am chi sakchi ti', cay wal tu' eb anima chi wal ti'.

English: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
Kanjobal: Yujtol beybalnebil yuj Juan tu' tol c'am chi lowi, c'am chi yuc' vino. Yuj tu' xan ayex che yala' tol a espíritu yob junok chi etneni.

English: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and “sinners.” ’
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max in jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'. Ayin ti' chin lowi, chi wuc'a', palta ayex che yal axca ti' win: A Jesús tu', asanc'al loj c'al uq'uej vino chi yochej. Yamigo ba yetok eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al yetok juntzanxa eb yob is beybal, quex chi win.

English: But wisdom is proved right by all her children.”
Kanjobal: Palta a eb ayoc jelanil Dios yin, chi txecloj el is jelanil eb tu' yin tzet chi el yuneni, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Now one of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him, so he went to the Pharisee's house and reclined at the table.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ay jun fariseo max awten Jesús low bay yatut. Lajwi yapni, axa yay tz'eyan low yetok cham tu'.

English: When a woman who had lived a sinful life in that town learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee's house, she brought an alabaster jar of perfume,
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun ix aj conob bay tu' caw wal yob is beybal. Max yab ix k'umal tol max apni oc Jesús low bay yatut cham fariseo tu'. Axa toj ix bay tu'. Yetbi oc ix jun alabastro nojnak yuj jun ambal suk'uk'ixac'al yoc jab.

English: and as she stood behind him at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears. Then she wiped them with her hair, kissed them and poured perfume on them.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc jajan ix is cawilal Jesús, max c'oli yok' ix. Axa tx'ajon el ix yakan Cham yetok yal sat tu'. Lajwic'al tu xin, max joon tak ix yetok xil, cax max tz'ubon el ix. Axa tobon oc ix jun ambal suk'uk'i jab tu' yin yakan Cham.

English: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who is touching him and what kind of woman she is–that she is a sinner.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilon cham fariseo jun tu', max naon cham axca ti': Ta yel chekbej Dios jun winak ti', chi mi nachaj el yuj tzet ixal jun chi mitx'on yakan ti'. Chi mi nachaj c'apax el yuj tol yob beybal ix, ẍi cham yul is c'ul.

English: Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.” “Tell me, teacher,” he said.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay cham axca ti': —Simón, ay jabok tzet chi wochej chi wal ayach, ẍi Cham bay. —Al xin Mamin, ẍi bay Cham.

English: “Two men owed money to a certain moneylender. One owed him five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay cawanok winak ay jec bay is patrón tinani'; ta 500 denario jec junok, axa junokxa, 50 denario yet.

English: Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he canceled the debts of both. Now which of them will love him more?”
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta c'am bay chi yi' eb ch'en, cax toc'al chi joc'ay cham aj tumin tu' yiban eb. ¿Mactax junok yel chi camil yin cham aj tumin tu' cha na'? ẍi Jesús bay cham.

English: Simon replied, “I suppose the one who had the bigger debt canceled.” “You have judged correctly,” Jesus said.
Kanjobal: —A chin na' ayin ti', a nak yel miman jec chi jolayc'ay yiban yuj cham tu', a nak tu' yel miman chi camc'ulnen cham, ẍi Simón tu' bay. —Yel ton chala', a ton nak, ẍi Jesús.

English: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I came into your house. You did not give me any water for my feet, but she wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max oc t'anan Cham yin ix ix tu', axa yalon Cham bay Simón tu' axca ti': —A yet max quin jay yul atut ti', maj ak' jabok wa' tx'ajilok wakan, palta ilab jun ix ti', max tx'ajil wakan yetok yal sat. Max lajwi tu', max joon tak ix yetok is xil.

English: You did not give me a kiss, but this woman, from the time I entered, has not stopped kissing my feet.
Kanjobal: Maj a tz'ubil in ti ti' yuj a tx'oxk'abnen el a camc'ulal, palta jun ix ti', yecheltaxc'al in jay cayti', c'amc'al chi bek tz'ubon el wakan.

English: You did not put oil on my head, but she has poured perfume on my feet.
Kanjobal: C'am jabok yanil in jolom max aajtok. Palta jun ix ti', max tob oc ix jun ambal suk'uk'ixac'al jab yin wakan ti'.

English: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven–for she loved much. But he who has been forgiven little loves little.”
Kanjobal: Xan chi wal ayach, caw wal miman camc'ulal jun ix ti', yujtol caw wal miman is yobtakil max jolay c'ay yiban. A pax mac jab ch'an is yobtakil chi jolay c'ay yiban xin, jab ch'an is camc'ulal chi tx'oxo', ẍi bay Simón tu'.

English: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon Cham bay ix ix tu' axca ti': —Ti chi lajwican a yobtakil eban, ẍi bay ix.

English: The other guests began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli yalubtanen jaywanxa eb ayic' yetok tu' axca ti': —¿Maclajtxel jun winak ti'? Ilab chi je' jooncan c'ay yobtakilej yaloni, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yalon Jesús bay ix ix tu' axca ti': —Mayal ach colchaji, yujtol max quin aoc yin a c'ul. Yuj tu' paxan yin tzalojc'ulal, ẍi Jesús bay ix.

English: After this, Jesus traveled about from one town and village to another, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The Twelve were with him,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, xiwil juntzan conoblak c'al juntzan aldealak bay max ec'jab Jesús yaloncan el k'anej Dios; max ec' yalcan el watx' abix xolak eb, tol toxa ok occan Dios Yajawil. Ajun eb is chekbej lajcawanil yetok chi eq'ui.

English: and also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (called Magdalene) from whom seven demons had come out;
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb xal ix ibil el espíritu yob yin yuj Jesús, c'al juntzanxa eb xal ix jaynakcan c'ul yuj. Ajun eb xal yetok Cham. Ayic' xal chi yik María aj Magdala xol eb, a ton xal bay elnakcan ukwan espíritu yob yin yuj Jesús.

English: Joanna the wife of Cuza, the manager of Herod's household; Susanna; and many others. These women were helping to support them out of their own means.
Kanjobal: Ay jun xal chi yik Juana, xal yistzil Chuza is caporal cham Herodes. Ay c'apax jun xal chi yik Susana, yetok jaywanxa eb xal max colwaj yetok is tzetak yetal.

English: While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from town after town, he told this parable:
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max tit bay junjun conob ul yilon Jesús. Lajwic'al wajon ba eb, axa yalontek Cham jun abix ti' bay eb axca ti':

English: “A farmer went out to sow his seed. As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path; it was trampled on, and the birds of the air ate it up.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak max toj tzic is trigo. Lanan wal tziconi, ay ixim max ayc'ay yul be. A ixim tu', toc'al max tec'laytok ixim. Axa no tz'iquin max ec' sic'on ajok.

English: Some fell on rock, and when it came up, the plants withered because they had no moisture.
Kanjobal: Ay ixim xin, yibanlak ch'en max ayc'ay ixim. Axa yet max ajol ixim, ayman max takilok, yujtol man ch'acanok tx'otx' tx'otx' yiban ch'en ch'en tu'.

English: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up with it and choked the plants.
Kanjobal: Ay ixim max ayc'ay xol q'uix. Toc'al max c'ayaj ixim xol te' yet max ch'ibaj te'.

English: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up and yielded a crop, a hundred times more than was sown.” When he said this, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
Kanjobal: Palta a ixim max ayc'ay bay yax tx'otx' xin, a yet max ch'ibaj ixim, max satni elok. Ay ixim jolomej 100 wal bak' max yak'a', ẍi Jesús bay eb. Max lajwi yalontek jun abix ti', max yalon yin ipejal axca ti': A juntzan tzet che yab ti', naobtanejek sic'libil, ẍi bay eb.

English: His disciples asked him what this parable meant.
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen el eb is cuywom tu' bay, tzet wal yelapnok jun tx'oxom el cuybanilej tu'.

English: He said, “The knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of God has been given to you, but to others I speak in parables, so that, “ ‘though seeing, they may not see; though hearing, they may not understand.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': A ayex lanan tx'oxon Dios juntzan tzet c'amto mac ojtaknej ti', yet watx' chi nachaj el e yuj tzetbil wal chi yun e yoc yul k'ab. Axa bay juntzanokxa anima xin, asan juntzan abix yet tx'oxbanil chi waltek bay eb. Yuj tu' xan, caxc'al chi yilc'al eb, axca tol c'am tzet chi yil eb. Yetok c'apaxok, caxc'al chi yabc'al eb, palta c'am jabok chi nachaj el yuj eb.

English: “This is the meaning of the parable: The seed is the word of God.
Kanjobal: Ok in watx' alnej ayex tzet chi yal elapnok jun abix max wal ti'. A ixim inat tu', yenel k'anej Dios.

English: Those along the path are the ones who hear, and then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
Kanjobal: A ixim inat max apnican oc yul be, yenel eb anima chi lajwi yaben k'anej Dios, cax chi jayoc nak diablo yin. Chi ul yion el is k'anej Dios yin is nabal eb, yet watx' c'am chi yaoc eb c'ul yin, cax c'am chi colchaj eb yuj.

English: Those on the rock are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. They believe for a while, but in the time of testing they fall away.
Kanjobal: A ixim inat max apnican oc yiban ch'en ch'en, yenel eb anima chi chaon aben k'anej Dios yin tzalojc'ulalil, palta c'am is tec'anil eb, txennej tiempo chi yaoc eb yin c'ul. Yujtol a yet chi jay junok porobal yiban eb, jun bek chi meltzoj eb yintak junelxa.

English: The seed that fell among thorns stands for those who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by life's worries, riches and pleasures, and they do not mature.
Kanjobal: A ixim max apnican oc xol q'uix, yenel eb chi aben k'anej Dios, palta a yet chi beyc'altok tiempo, xiwil tzet chi na eb. Chi na eb is beyomal, chi na eb yet is mimanil. Yuj wal juntzan tu', chi etax el nabal eb. Lajan chi yun yeloc eb axca ixim trigo c'am chi can jolom.

English: But the seed on good soil stands for those with a noble and good heart, who hear the word, retain it, and by persevering produce a crop.
Kanjobal: Axa pax ixim max ayc'ay bay yax tx'otx' xin, yenel eb chi chaon aben k'anej Dios yin watx' nabalejal tol bekan c'ul yikeni. Junelnej chi yaoc eb yin c'ul. Tec'an chi yut ba eb, xan lajan eb axca ixim trigo xiwil chi satni elok.

English: “No one lights a lamp and hides it in a jar or puts it under a bed. Instead, he puts it on a stand, so that those who come in can see the light.
Kanjobal: A yet chi jaon oc co candil, c'am chi co nojbajtok junok tzet yetal yiban, tamwal chi ja c'apax octok yalan tx'at, palta a yiban junok tzet yetal can batxan ajok. A tu' chi co batxbaj ajtok, yet watx' chi yil jantak eb chi octok yul na, yakan jun candil tu'.

English: For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed, and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open.
Kanjobal: Jantak tzet ewanc'uan yayji tinani', ok txeclojc'alta' ajok. Yetok jantak tzet c'ubabil el tinani', ok ak'lay ojtaknelay elok, pilan ok abchajok.

English: Therefore consider carefully how you listen. Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken from him.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, chi cam wal e yaben tzet chi wala'. Yujtol a mac chi yochej chi nachaj el yuj, yelxac'al ok ak'lay nachaj el yuj. Axa eb c'am chi yochej chi nachaj el juntzan ti' yuj xin, a jabok tzet ijan chi nachaj el yuj eb, ok ilayxac'al ec' bay eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: Now Jesus' mother and brothers came to see him, but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd.
Kanjobal: Axa is txutx Jesús yetokc'al yuẍtak, max apni oc eb bay ayic'ok, palta maj je' yoctok eb bay ayic' tu', yujtol witz'an yuj anima.

English: Someone told him, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan ay jun max alon bay Cham axca ti': —Max jay a txutx yetok eb oẍtak bay ti na. Tolab chi yochej eb chi k'anjab etok, ẍi eb, ẍi bay.

English: He replied, “My mother and brothers are those who hear God's word and put it into practice.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb ayic' tu' axca ti': —Tzanc'al mac chi aben is k'anej Dios, ta chi yikej, a ton eb tu' axca in txutx yayji, axca wuẍtak yayji, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: One day Jesus said to his disciples, “Let's go over to the other side of the lake.” So they got into a boat and set out.
Kanjobal: A yet junel, max oc Jesús yul barco yetok eb is cuywom. Axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': —Tonek bay junxa k'axepal a' mar, ẍi bay eb. Axa toj eb tu'.

English: As they sailed, he fell asleep. A squall came down on the lake, so that the boat was being swamped, and they were in great danger.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan bey eb tu', max way Jesús. Palta yin ayman max jay jun cak'ek' caw wal ow sic'libil. Max c'oli xuon aj a' mar. Max oc a' yul te' yuj. Ijan wal max paxay te' yich a'.

English: The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Master, Master, we're going to drown!” He got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waters; the storm subsided, and all was calm.
Kanjobal: Max tenon el eb wayan Jesús. —Mamin, Mamin, ti wal chon paxay yich a', ẍi eb bay. Axa yaj wan Cham tu', max tenon oc wanaj jun cak'ek' tu' c'al a' mar. Axa yiken yoc wanaj tu', cax max numayi, cax tz'ininixac'al.

English: “Where is your faith?” he asked his disciples. In fear and amazement they asked one another, “Who is this? He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa yalon bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan c'am wal che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios? ẍi bay eb. Palta toc'al max xiw eb cax max c'ayaj c'ul eb yuj sic'libil. Axa yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzetlaj yayji jun winak ti'? Ilab chi tenoc wanaj cak'ek' yetok a' mar, cax chi ikelay bay, ẍi eb.

English: They sailed to the region of the Gerasenes, which is across the lake from Galilee.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max ec'apnok eb k'axepal ec' a', bay yul yet Gerasa, bay paq'uil yul yet Galilea.

English: When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town. For a long time this man had not worn clothes or lived in a house, but had lived in the tombs.
Kanjobal: A yet max jayoc Jesús ti a' mar, ay jun winak aj conob bay tu' max jayoc bay. Ayxa tiempo yoc juntzan espíritu yob yin. C'amxa chi yaoc nak is pichil. C'amxa chi yal c'ul chi ayji ec' bay junok na; asan bay mukbanil camnak ayic'ok.

English: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell at his feet, shouting at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torture me!”
Kanjobal: Xiwil el chi michchaj nak yuj espíritu yob tu'. Yuj tu' chi yak'lej anima pixon ay nak yetok cadena; chi oc ch'en yin yakan c'al yin k'ab. Chi pixay eb yet watx' chi mitx'lay tzakayok; palta tojolc'al nic'chajtok juntzan cadena tu' yuj nak. Chi ilay bey nak yuj espíritu yob tu' bay tz'inan tx'otx'lak. A yet max yilon nak yin Jesús, max ay jajan nak yakantak Cham. Axa yalon Cham bay juntzan espíritu yob ayoc yin nak tu' tol chi el eb yin. Axa yaj yaw nak yalon axca ti': —Ach Jesús, C'ajol ach Dios tol Axac'al Ocok, ¿tzet alon et win? Chin oc tean en, tol manchak in etnej, ẍi.

English: For Jesus had commanded the evil spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had seized him, and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard, he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places. For Jesus had commanded the evil spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had seized him, and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard, he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places.
Kanjobal: Max k'anlej Jesús bay nak axca ti': —¿Tzet a bi? ẍi bay nak. —Legión yoc in bi, ẍi nak. Tix yuj ti xan caytu' max yut yalon nak, yujtol xiwil eb espíritu yob tu' ayoc yin nak.

English: And they begged him repeatedly not to order them to go into the Abyss.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb espíritu yob tu' is yailal bay Jesús tol manchak alaytok eb bay xab olan yuj.

English: A large herd of pigs was feeding there on the hillside. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into them, and he gave them permission.
Kanjobal: A bay paq'uil jun witz bay ayic' eb tu', ay juntzan no txitam lanan lowi, xan max tewi oc eb espíritu yob tu' yin Jesús, tol chi beklaycantok eb yin no txitam tu'. Max chalaycantok eb yin no' yuj Cham.

English: When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
Kanjobal: Xan max elcan eb yin nak anima tu', axa yin no txitam tu' max tojcan eb. Yuj tu' xan max tojcan no' sat witz tu', cax yayapnok no' yul a' mar. Max jik'bi aytok no' masanil yul a' tu', cax max cam no'.

English: When those tending the pigs saw what had happened, they ran off and reported this in the town and countryside,
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb yilomal no' tzet max on no', max el eb cax max toj eb yalon el xol conob, c'al bay najatlak elok.

English: and the people went out to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus, they found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus' feet, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max ul eb anima yilon jun tzet max uj tu'. Axa yet max jayoc eb bay ayic' Jesús, max yilon eb, tol chotanxa ay nak bay max el eb espíritu yob tu'. Ayxa oc pichil nak, watx'xa c'ul nak; xan max xiwaj eb sic'libil.

English: Those who had seen it told the people how the demon-possessed man had been cured.
Kanjobal: A eb max ilon juntzan tzet max el yunen Jesús, max alon bay juntzanxa eb max ulic' yilon tu', tzet max yun watx'jican nak bay max el eb espíritu yob tu'.

English: Then all the people of the region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, because they were overcome with fear. So he got into the boat and left.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a masanil anima yul yet Gerasa tu', max oc tean eb yin Jesús, tol chi besil ba Cham yul lugar eb, yujtol caw chi xiw eb yuj. Axa yoc Cham yul barco tu', cax max toji.

English: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
Kanjobal: A nak anima bay max elcan eb espíritu yob tu', max oc tean nak yin Cham yuj k'anon tzakloj ba nak yintak, palta maj cha' tzakloj Cham yintak. Max yal Cham bay nak axca ti', tol chi can nak bay jun lugar tu'.

English: “Return home and tell how much God has done for you.” So the man went away and told all over town how much Jesus had done for him.
Kanjobal: —Paxan bay atut. Chala' jantak tzet max el yunen Dios en, ẍi bay nak. Axa tojcan nak tu'. Max yalil nak bay masanil jun conob tu' tzet max el yunen Jesús yin.

English: Now when Jesus returned, a crowd welcomed him, for they were all expecting him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max paxic' Jesús bay junxa k'axepal a' mar bay petojta'a. A yet max ec'apnok tu', max tzaloj aj eb anima masanil bay tu', yujtol caw wal echbanebilxac'al yuj eb.

English: Then a man named Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came and fell at Jesus' feet, pleading with him to come to his house
Kanjobal: Ay jun cham yajawil bay chi wajbaj ba eb israel yin culto bay tu', chi yik Jairo. Max jayoc bay Jesús, cax max ay jajnaj yakantak. Max tewi bay Jesús tol chi toj yetok bay is yatut.

English: because his only daughter, a girl of about twelve, was dying. As Jesus was on his way, the crowds almost crushed him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun c'otan is cutz'in, tol chi cami, cax janic'xanej iquis. Ay mi 12 abil is k'inal ix is cutz'in tu'. A yet max toj Jesús yetok cham bay na tu', xiwil anima max toj yetok. Chi witz'xac'al ba eb toj bululok yetok.

English: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years, but no one could heal her.
Kanjobal: A xol eb anima tu', ay jun xal ix ayxam lajcawebok abil ijanc'al chi cam xal yuj a' aej chi ayc'ay yin. Max lajwi el masanil is tzetak yetal xal yin eb aj an, palta maj jaycan c'ul xal yuj eb.

English: She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak, and immediately her bleeding stopped.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max jayoc xal yintak Jesús, max oc mitx'naj xal yin ti' pichil Cham. Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max oc wanaj a' yel yin xal.

English: “Who touched me?” Jesus asked. When they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the people are crowding and pressing against you.”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Jesús bay eb anima tu' axca ti': —¿Mactxel jun max oc mitx'naj k'ab win? ẍi. Palta max yal eb masanil, tol c'am mac max oc mitx'naj yin. Axa yalon Pedro bay axca ti': —Mamin, toch'okab xiwil chi witz' ba anima en, chon beyi. Xiwil mac chi ten oc ba en. Lajwi tu', cha k'anlen paxok: ¿Mac max oc mitx'naj win? cachitowal paxok, ẍi bay.

English: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me; I know that power has gone out from me.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham: —Ay jun mac max oc mitx'naj win. Wojtak max jaycan c'ul yuj wipalil, ẍi.

English: Then the woman, seeing that she could not go unnoticed, came trembling and fell at his feet. In the presence of all the people, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon xal ix tu' tol majxa je' c'uban el ba xol anima tu', caw wal max bilaj xal yuj xiwilal. Max jayoc xal bay Jesús, max ay jajan xal yakantak. Max yalon el xal satak eb anima tu' masanil, tzet wal yuj xan max oc mitx'naj xal yin Cham, c'al tzet max yun watx'jican yet wal jun bek tu'.

English: Then he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay xal axca ti': —Ach ix, ti max jaycan a c'ul wuj, yujtol max quin aoc yin a c'ul. Yuj tu xin, paxanxa yin tzalojc'ulal, ẍi bay.

English: While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue ruler. “Your daughter is dead,” he said. “Don't bother the teacher any more.”
Kanjobal: Lananto wal yalon Jesús bay xal axca tu', ay jun mactxel tol petoj bay yatut cham Jairo tu' ul yalon bay axca ti': —A ix a cutz'in tu', mayal cam ix. Toxac'al chak' toj yetnej ba Cham Meẍtol ti' toj yiloni, ẍi bay Jairo tu'.

English: Hearing this, Jesus said to Jairus, “Don't be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yaben Jesús jun tu', max yalon bay cham axca ti': —Manchak ach oc il. Asan tol chaoc a c'ul yin Dios, axa watx'jican ix a cutz'in tu', ẍi bay cham.

English: When he arrived at the house of Jairus, he did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John and James, and the child's father and mother.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay na, maj cha octok Jesús eb anima yul na tu' yetok. Asan Pedro, Jacobo c'al Juan, yetok is mam c'al is txutx ix unin tu', max cha octok yetok.

English: Meanwhile, all the people were wailing and mourning for her. “Stop wailing,” Jesus said. “She is not dead but asleep.”
Kanjobal: Chi ok' masanil eb anima yuj ix, cax chi el yaw eb. Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Manchak ex ok'i. A ix unin ti', man camnakok ix, toc'al chi way ix, ẍi bay eb.

English: They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
Kanjobal: Palta toc'al max tzeyelay Cham yuj eb, yujtol yojtakxa eb tol camnakxa ix.

English: But he took her by the hand and said, “My child, get up!”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa yoc mitx'an Cham yin k'ab ix tu', max yalon Cham yin ipejal axca ti': —Ach k'opoj ix unin, ajan wanok, ẍi.

English: Her spirit returned, and at once she stood up. Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat.
Kanjobal: Ayman max ictzoj aj ix yuj. Axa yaj wan ix tu', xan max yal Jesús tol chi ak'lay lobej ix.

English: Her parents were astonished, but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul is mam c'al is txutx ix yet max yilon eb. Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu', tol c'amokab junok mactxel bay chi yalil eb tzet max yun yictzoj aj ix.

English: When Jesus had called the Twelve together, he gave them power and authority to drive out all demons and to cure diseases,
Kanjobal: A yet junel, max yawtej oc oyan Jesús eb is cuywom lajcawanil is c'atan. Axa yak'on yipalil eb tu', max yak'on c'apax yikbej eb, yin iojcan el espíritu yob yin anima, c'al ak'ojcan watx'jok c'ul eb anima ya'ay.

English: and he sent them out to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
Kanjobal: Max chekontok eb, yuj ec' yaloncan el eb tol toxa ok occan Dios yin Yajawilal, c'al ec' yak'oncan eb watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay.

English: He told them: “Take nothing for the journey–no staff, no bag, no bread, no money, no extra tunic.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi toj eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti': —C'am tzet che yi'. Manchak e yi' e k'okoch, e moral, e lobej, ma e tumin. Yetok e pichil, asan junjun ayoc e yuj ti' che yi'.

English: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave that town.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al tzet nail bay chex apni, ac'al bay tu' che yak' e posada, masantac'al chex toj bay junokxa lugar.

English: If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave their town, as a testimony against them.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac c'am chex chaoni, chex el yul is conob eb tu'. Che tziccan el pokokal e yakan yuj e tx'oxk'abnen elok tol c'amxa e yalon e yet yin eb, cax chex toji, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: So they set out and went from village to village, preaching the gospel and healing people everywhere.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa toj eb tu'; max ec' eb bay junjun aldea. Max yalcan el eb k'anejal yet colbanilej. Max watx'ji c'apax can eb ya'ay bay junjun lugar yuj eb.

English: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about all that was going on. And he was perplexed, because some were saying that John had been raised from the dead,
Kanjobal: Axa Herodes, cham yajaw bay Galilea, max yab cham k'umal masanil tzetak yetal max el yunen Jesús. Toc'al chi c'ayaj c'ul, yujtol ay eb max alon axca ti': A jun chi el yunen juntzan tzet yetal tu', a Juan ictzojnak aj xol eb camnak, ẍi eb.

English: others that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the prophets of long ago had come back to life.
Kanjobal: Ay pax eb chi aloni: A Elías chi ul tx'oxic' ba, ẍi eb. Ay eb xin: A junok eb chekbej Dios ec'nak yet payxa, max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, ẍi eb.

English: But Herod said, “I beheaded John. Who, then, is this I hear such things about?” And he tried to see him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Herodes tu' axca ti': —Palta ayin ti', max in chek yilay el jolom Juan tu'. Yuj tu' xan ¿mac xam txel jun caw chi yal eb k'umal tu'? ẍi, xan max yak' Herodes yip yilon yin Jesús.

English: When the apostles returned, they reported to Jesus what they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew by themselves to a town called Bethsaida,
Kanjobal: A yet max jayoc eb chekbej Jesús yin is chekbejal, max c'oli yalon eb bay tzetakc'al max el yunen junjun eb. Lajwi tu', axa yiontok Cham eb yetok tu'. Max apni oc eb tx'oklil yetok, bay jun lugar cawilal conob Betsaida.

English: but the crowds learned about it and followed him. He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who needed healing.
Kanjobal: Palta max yojtaknejcan el eb anima tol chi betic' bay tu', yuj tu' xan tzakan toj eb yintak. Max chaon apnok Jesús eb bay max apni tu', axa yalon el xol eb tu' tzet ok yun yeloc eb chi oc yul k'ab Dios. Max yak'on c'apaxcan watx'jok c'ul eb ya'ay.

English: Late in the afternoon the Twelve came to him and said, “Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and countryside and find food and lodging, because we are in a remote place here.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet lananxa yay c'u, max jayoc eb is cuywom lajcawanil is c'atan. Max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Tekan watx' cha chektok eb anima ti' bay juntzan aldea, yetok bay juntzan lugar cawil ti', yet watx' chi man low ba eb, cax chi way eb bay tu'. Yujtol a bay ayon ec' ti', tz'inan tx'otx', ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “You give them something to eat.” They answered, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish–unless we go and buy food for all this crowd.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ak'ek low eb ayex ti', ẍi bay eb. —Palta asan wal ch'an oyeb co pan ibil, yetok cac'on co txay. ¿Tom chi toj co man yet eb anima ti' masanil chi yal tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: (About five thousand men were there.) But he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
Kanjobal: Ay mi oyebok mil bisil eb winak ayic' tu'. Axa yalon Jesús bay eb cuywom tu' axca ti': —Alek bay eb, ayokab chotjab eb yin bulquiltakil. 50takokab bisil junjun bulan, ẍi bay eb.

English: The disciples did so, and everybody sat down.
Kanjobal: Axca tu' max yut eb, axa yay chotjab eb anima tu' masanil.

English: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke them. Then he gave them to the disciples to set before the people.
Kanjobal: Max yion aj Jesús ixim oyeb pan tu', c'al no cac'on txay tu', axa yaj t'anan satcan tu', max yalon yuj diosalil yuj. Lajwi tu' max pojon ayok, axa yak'on bay eb is cuywom tu' yet chi pojic' eb xol eb anima tu'.

English: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.
Kanjobal: Max low eb masanil, max cam noj c'ul eb. A yet max xew low eb, lajcawebto motx max nojcan yuj ixim bijquiltakil max wajbaj aj eb.

English: Once when Jesus was praying in private and his disciples were with him, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say I am?”
Kanjobal: A yet junel, ayic' Jesús txajlok tx'oklil yetok eb is cuywom. Max k'anlen bay eb axca ti': —¿Mac in txel yal eb anima che yabej? ẍi bay eb.

English: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, that one of the prophets of long ago has come back to life.”
Kanjobal: —Ay eb chi aloni, tolab Juan, cham ak'om bautismo, ach yal eb. Ay pax eb chi aloni, tolab Elías ach yal eb. Ay eb xin, tolab a junok eb is chekbej Dios yet payxa, a, max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, ẍi eb, ẍi eb is cuywom tu' bay.

English: “But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
Kanjobal: —Axa ex paxok, ¿mac in txel e yaloni? ẍi bay eb. Axa tak'wi Pedro bay axca ti': —Ach ti', ach ton Cristo ach, Chekbilachtek yuj Dios, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus strictly warned them not to tell this to anyone.
Kanjobal: Palta max cam wal yalon Jesús bay eb, tol c'am junok mactxel bay chi yalil eb jun max yal Pedro tu'.

English: And he said, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests and teachers of the law, and he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ti', Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta yowalil ok wil yailal. Ok in intaknelaycan el yuj eb ichamtak winak ay yopiso, c'al yuj eb yajaw yayji xol eb sacerdote, yetok yuj eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Ok in yak' cam eb, palta a yet cabjial tu', ok in ictzoj pax ajok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he said to them all: “If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon bay eb masanil axca ti': —Ta ay mactxel chi yochej chi ec'c'al cuywok wintak, yowalilokab manxa yetok ba yul yet. Yabokab eb yail wuj junjun c'u, caxc'al chi alay oc eb yin curus. Ta bekan c'ul eb axca tu', ec'okabc'al eb cuywok wintak.

English: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will save it.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb c'am chi yochej chi cam bay yulyibank'inal ti', chi bekil eb jun k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A pax eb chi bek c'ulok cam wuj xin, a ton eb tu' ok chaon k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: What good is it for a man to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit his very self?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay mac chi uj yion masanil tzet ay yulyibank'inal ti', palta ta chi cami, ma chi etax elok, ¿tzet wal chi yi' yin axca tu'?

English: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi q'uixwi aj wuj, c'al yuj in k'anej, ok in q'uixwok c'apax aj yuj eb, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', yet ok in jay ul wak'on Reyal. A yet tu' ok in jay yetok mayk'ak'al in Mam, c'al yetok mayk'ak'al eb is yángel tol sic'bil el yuj.

English: I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, ay jaywan e xol, mac ex ayex ec' ti', manto ex camok okto e yil yoccan Dios yin yajawil, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: About eight days after Jesus said this, he took Peter, John and James with him and went up onto a mountain to pray.
Kanjobal: Yukubixial mi wal yalon Jesús juntzan tu', cax max toj txajlok bay jun tzalan. Max yiontok Pedro yetok Juan c'al Jacobo yetok.

English: As he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan txajli tu', max q'uexpoj yili, tx'okxa max yun yili sat. A is pichil, caw wal sak max yun yili, toxanej chi tzekeki.

English: Two men, Moses and Elijah,
Kanjobal: Ayman max tx'oxaj ba cawan winak, a ton Moisés yetok Elías.

English: appeared in glorious splendor, talking with Jesus. They spoke about his departure, which he was about to bring to fulfillment at Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Ay wal jun miman tzekekial oyan oc yin eb. Max k'anjab eb yetok Jesús yuj tzet ok yun cam bay Jerusalén.

English: Peter and his companions were very sleepy, but when they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
Kanjobal: Axa Pedro yetok eb yet cuywomal, caw wal ay is wayan eb, palta iquisc'al eb, maj way eb, yuj tu' xan max yil eb tzekeki aj Jesús. Max yilon c'apax eb cawan winak ayic' yetok Cham tu'.

English: As the men were leaving Jesus, Peter said to him, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters–one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.” (He did not know what he was saying.)
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa yel eb cawan tu' c'atan, axa yalon Pedro bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin Meẍtol, caw wal watx' jet yujtol ayon ec' cayti'. Tekan watx' chi co watx'nej oxebok lanchu: junok et, junok yet Moisés, yetok junok yet Elías, ẍi bay Cham. Palta man yojtakok tzet lanan yaloni.

English: While he was speaking, a cloud appeared and enveloped them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
Kanjobal: Lananto wal k'anjab Pedro tu', max ayc'ay boc'naj jun asun yiban eb. Caw wal max xiw eb cuywom Jesús tu' xol.

English: A voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I have chosen; listen to him.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, ay jay belan k'anej max oc xol jun asun tu', max yalon axca ti': A ton in C'ajol bay xiwil chi camel in c'ul ti'. Acbajek e txiquin bay, ẍi.

English: When the voice had spoken, they found that Jesus was alone. The disciples kept this to themselves, and told no one at that time what they had seen.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al yaben eb jun tu', axa yilontek eb, tx'oklilxa Jesús ayic'ok. C'am junok mac bay max yalil eb cuywom tu' tzet max yil eb tu'.

English: The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
Kanjobal: A yet junxa c'ual, yet max pax aytek eb bay jun tzalan tu', xiwil anima max apni oc bay Jesús.

English: A man in the crowd called out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.
Kanjobal: A xol eb anima tu', ay jun winak max aj yaw yin ipejal bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, chi wal in yailal ayach, c'am mi chel jun in c'ajol in k'ana', yujtol asan wal ch'an jun c'otan in c'ajol tu'.

English: A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth. It scarcely ever leaves him and is destroying him.
Kanjobal: Ay wal tiempo caw wal chi etnelay yuj jun espíritu yob ayoc yin. Chi el yaw, chi tit oynaj yin is jolom. Chi el sukuwal is ti' yuj. Caw wal chi etnelay wal yuj sic'libil. C'am chi beklay el yuj.

English: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they could not.”
Kanjobal: Mayal wak'lej walon bay eb a cuywom, tol chi yiel eb jun espíritu yob ti' yin nak, palta maj je' yuj eb, ẍi bay Cham.

English: “O unbelieving and perverse generation,” Jesus replied, “how long shall I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús axca ti': —¡A…, a wal ayex ti', caw wal c'am che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios, caw wal pit ex! Mimanxa tiempoc'al wayji ec' e yetok. ¿Bak'intoc'al ok nachaj el e yuj xin? Chi yab yail in c'ul e yuj. Asi', itek nak a c'ajol tu' ayin, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Even while the boy was coming, the demon threw him to the ground in a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the evil spirit, healed the boy and gave him back to his father.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet lanan jayoc jun unin tu', max k'oklay ay sat tx'otx' yuj jun espíritu yob tu'. Caw wal ow max yun tit is yailal nak tu'. Palta axa Jesús max tzuwaj yin jun espíritu yob tu', max watx'jican nak yuj, cax max yak'oncan Cham nak bay is mam.

English: And they were all amazed at the greatness of God. While everyone was marveling at all that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,
Kanjobal: Masanil eb anima tu', max c'ayaj c'ul eb yiloni, tol caw wal miman is mayk'ak'al Dios. A yet c'aynak wal aj c'ul eb anima tu' yilon tzet max el yunen Jesús, axa max yalon Cham bay eb is cuywom tu' axca ti':

English: “Listen carefully to what I am about to tell you: The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
Kanjobal: —Chi cam wal e yaben sic'libil tzet ok wal ayex. Manchak c'aytok yul e c'ul, yujtol caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb anima, ẍi bay eb.

English: But they did not understand what this meant. It was hidden from them, so that they did not grasp it, and they were afraid to ask him about it.
Kanjobal: Palta eb is cuywom tu', maj nachaj el yuj eb tzet max yal bay eb tu', yujtol maj ak'lay nachaj el yuj eb. Max xiw eb k'anlen c'apax el bay, tzet wal chi yal elapnok.

English: An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest.
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli teyelen ba eb cuywom tu' yuj mac wal junok eb caw miman yelapnok xol eb.

English: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, took a little child and had him stand beside him.
Kanjobal: Palta yojtak Jesús tzet lanan naon eb, yuj tu' xan max quetztek jun unin is c'atan.

English: Then he said to them, “Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. For he who is least among you all–he is the greatest.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb is cuywom tu' axca ti': —Tzanc'al mac chi chaon junok unin axca jun unin ti', yujtol wet, axca tol ayin chin is cha eb. Man asannejok in chin is cha eb. Chi cha c'apax eb Cham cheknejintek. A mac yelxac'al chi yiay ba e xol, a ton jun tu' yelxac'al miman yelapnok, ẍi bay eb.

English: “Master,” said John, “we saw a man driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him, because he is not one of us.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Juan bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin Meẍtol, ay jun winak max jila', tol lanan yion el espíritu yob yin anima yin ach yak'on binajok. Palta max co tencan oc wanajok, yujtol man junnejok chi ec' jetok, ẍi bay.

English: “Do not stop him,” Jesus said, “for whoever is not against you is for you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús axca ti': —C'am chi je' e tenon oc wanaj nak, yujtol a eb man ajc'ulok oc jin, a jetok ayoc eb, ẍi bay.

English: As the time approached for him to be taken up to heaven, Jesus resolutely set out for Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa yapni tiempoal paxaj Jesús satcan, max tec'baj ba toj bay Jerusalén.

English: And he sent messengers on ahead, who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him;
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb is chekbej max babji chekontok. Max apni oc eb bay jun aldea yul yet Samaria, yujtol chi yochej eb watx'xa yayji posada chi apni, xan max babji eb.

English: but the people there did not welcome him, because he was heading for Jerusalem.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb aj Samaria tu', maj yak' eb is posada tu', yujtol lanan toj Cham bay Jerusalén.

English: When the disciples James and John saw this, they asked, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?”
Kanjobal: A cawan eb is cuywom Jesús, a ton Jacobo yetok Juan, a yet max yilon eb axca tu', max yalon eb bay Cham: —Mamin, ¿chi mi yal a c'ul chi co k'antek k'ak' bay satcan yiban eb, cax chi lajwi el eb? ẍi eb.

English: But Jesus turned and rebuked them,
Kanjobal: Axa meltzojtek acan Cham bay eb tu', max oc t'anan yin eb. Max tenchanelay eb yuj.

English: and they went to another village.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa toj eb bay junxa aldea tu'.

English: As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan toj eb yul be, ay jun winak max alon bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin, tzanc'al bay ok ach tok, ok in tok etok, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus replied, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A no wax, ay is nach'en no', c'al no tz'iquin, ay is wayub no', palta ayin ti', caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta c'am jabok watut bay chin wayi, ẍi bay.

English: He said to another man, “Follow me.” But the man replied, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', axa yalon Cham bay junxa axca ti': —Ec'anc'al cuywok wintak, ẍi bay. Palta max yal bay axca ti': —Mamin, ok in tok etok, asan chin mukcantok in mam bel, ẍi nak bay Cham.

English: Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: —A eb camnakto el yul sat Dios, a eb chi je' mukoncan eb yet camnakil tu', palta ach ti', asi', cax chalon el tzet chi yun yoc eb anima yul k'ab Dios, ẍi bay nak.

English: Still another said, “I will follow you, Lord; but first let me go back and say good-by to my family.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', ay junxa max alon bay axca ti': —Mamin, chi wochej chin ec'c'al cuywok entak, palta cha in tok in tak'encan eb ay bay watut babelal, cax ok in tok etok tu' bian, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus replied, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Jesús bay axca ti': —K'inalok ay junok winak chi mulnaj yetok wacax tinani', chi oc mitx'an yin ch'en t'ocbal tx'otx', lajwi tu', chi tojc'al t'anan nak yintak. Ta ay mac caytu' yak'on is nabal yin yet Dios, man mojok chi oc yin is mulnajil Cham, ẍi Jesús.

English: A record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ the son of David, the son of Abraham:
Kanjobal: A jun libro ti' chi alontek yabixal Jesucristo yinatil David, tol yinatil c'apax Abraham. A ton is bi eb yichmam Jesucristo yin txolilal ti'.

English: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,
Kanjobal: A Abraham a ay c'ajol Isaac, axa Isaac a ay c'ajol Jacob. Axa Jacob, a ay c'ajol Judá yetok juntzanxa eb yuẍtak.

English: Judah the father of Perez and Zerah, whose mother was Tamar, Perez the father of Hezron, Hezron the father of Ram,
Kanjobal: Axa Judá, a ay c'ajol Fares c'al Zara bay Tamar. Axa Fares, a ay c'ajol Esrom, axa Esrom a ay c'ajol Aram.

English: Ram the father of Amminadab, Amminadab the father of Nahshon, Nahshon the father of Salmon,
Kanjobal: Axa Aram, a ay c'ajol Aminadab. Axa Aminadab, a ay c'ajol Naasón. Axa Naasón, a ay c'ajol Salmón.

English: Salmon the father of Boaz, whose mother was Rahab, Boaz the father of Obed, whose mother was Ruth, Obed the father of Jesse,
Kanjobal: Axa Salmón, a ay c'ajol Booz yune' Rahab. Axa Booz, a ay c'ajol Obed yune' Rut. Axa Obed, a ay c'ajol Isaí.

English: and Jesse the father of King David. David was the father of Solomon, whose mother had been Uriah's wife,
Kanjobal: Axa Isaí, a ay c'ajol cham rey David, axa cham rey David, a ay c'ajol Salomón yune' ix yistzilben Urías.

English: Solomon the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asa,
Kanjobal: Axa Salomón, a ay c'ajol Roboam. Axa Roboam, a ay c'ajol Abías, axa Abías, a ay c'ajol Asa.

English: Asa the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat the father of Jehoram, Jehoram the father of Uzziah,
Kanjobal: Axa Asa, a ay c'ajol Josafat. Axa Josafat, a ay c'ajol Joram, axa Joram, a ay c'ajol Uzías.

English: Uzziah the father of Jotham, Jotham the father of Ahaz, Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,
Kanjobal: Axa Uzías, a ay c'ajol Jotam. Axa Jotam, a ay c'ajol Acaz, axa Acaz, a ay c'ajol Ezequías.

English: Hezekiah the father of Manasseh, Manasseh the father of Amon, Amon the father of Josiah,
Kanjobal: Axa Ezequías, a ay c'ajol Manasés, axa Manasés, a ay c'ajol Amón. Axa Amón, a ay c'ajol Josías.

English: and Josiah the father of Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the exile to Babylon.
Kanjobal: Axa Josías, a ay c'ajol Jeconías yetok eb yuẍtak. A yul is tiempoal eb tu', max ilaytok eb Israel preso bay Babilonia.

English: After the exile to Babylon: Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel, Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel,
Kanjobal: A yet ayxa ec' eb bay Babilonia xin, max alji Salatiel c'ajol Jeconías. Axa Salatiel, a ay c'ajol Zorobabel.

English: Zerubbabel the father of Abiud, Abiud the father of Eliakim, Eliakim the father of Azor,
Kanjobal: Axa Zorobabel, a ay c'ajol Abiud, axa Abiud, a ay c'ajol Eliaquim. Axa Eliaquim, a ay c'ajol Azor.

English: Azor the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Akim, Akim the father of Eliud,
Kanjobal: Axa Azor, a ay c'ajol Sadoc. Axa Sadoc, a ay c'ajol Aquim. Axa Aquim, a ay c'ajol Eliud.

English: Eliud the father of Eleazar, Eleazar the father of Matthan, Matthan the father of Jacob,
Kanjobal: Axa Eliud, a ay c'ajol Eleazar. Axa Eleazar, a ay c'ajol Matán. Axa Matán, a ay c'ajol Jacob.

English: and Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
