Kanjobal: A yet max wak'on binaj yich pan eb fariseo, c'al eb saduceo ayex, maj nachaj el e yuj tzet chi yal elapnok. A max e yut e naoni tol a ixim acaw pan chi wala', ẍi bay eb.

English: Then they understood that he was not telling them to guard against the yeast used in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon Jesús axca tu' bay eb, catatu' max nachaj el yuj eb tol manak acaw yich pan chi yala', palta tol a cuybanil eb fariseo c'al eb saduceo max yal Cham yichpanil.

English: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say the Son of Man is?”
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay Cesarea yul yet Filipos, max k'anlen bay eb axca ti': —Ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ¿mac in txel yalon eb anima che yabej?

English: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
Kanjobal: —Ay eb chi aloni, ach ab Juan, cham ak'om bautismo ach. Ay eb chi aloni, ach ab Elías ach. Ay eb xin, ach ab Jeremías ach, ma xin junokxa chekbej Dios ec'nak payxa, ẍi juntzanokxa, ẍi eb bay.

English: “But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?”
Kanjobal: —Axa pax ex ayex ti', ¿mac in txel e yaloni? ẍi bay eb.

English: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
Kanjobal: Xan max tak'wi Pedro bay axca ti': —Ach ti', ach ton Cristo ach, C'ajol ach Cham Dios iquis, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus replied, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by man, but by my Father in heaven.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal pax Jesús bay Pedro tu' axca ti': —Simón, c'ajol Jonás, watx' et, yujtol a tzet max al ti', man yulok et max on nachaj el oj. A ton co Mam ayic' satcan max ak'on ojtaknej elok.

English: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overcome it.
Kanjobal: Ayin chi wak'can ek Pedro. (Pedro chi yal elapnok ch'en.) A yiban jun miman ch'en ti' ok in watx'nej ajtok wiglesia. A wiglesia tu', c'am oxlajon bak'in ok ak'lay lajwok yuj camich.

English: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.”
Kanjobal: A ayach ok wak' laweal yet chi oc anima yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. A tzet ok ak' yowalil bay yulyibank'inal ti', a ton tzet ayxac'alta' yowalil yuj Cham aj satcan. Axa tzet man ok ak' yowalil bay yulyibank'inal ti', a ton tzet c'amc'alta' yowalil yuj Cham aj satcan, ẍi bay.

English: Then he warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, cax max yalon bay eb is cuywom, tol manchakc'al yalil eb tatol Cristo ton Cham.

English: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, chief priests and teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.
Kanjobal: Atax yet jun tiempoal tu' max c'oli watx' alnen Jesús bay eb is cuywom, yuj tzet ok jay yiban. Max yalon axca ti': —Yowalil ok in tok bay Jerusalén. Ata bay tu' ok tok wil yailal yuj eb yicham winakil conob, c'al yuj eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al yuj eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Ok in yak' cam eb; palta a yet cabjial tu' ok in ictzonelay ajok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. “Never, Lord!” he said. “This shall never happen to you!”
Kanjobal: Axa yilay el Cham tx'oklil yuj Pedro tu', max tenchanelay Cham yuj. Max yalon bay axca ti': —Mamin, caw man cayok tu' naon Dios. A juntzan tzet max al ti', maj wal je' jay eban bian, ẍi Pedro tu' bay Cham.

English: Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me; you do not have in mind the things of God, but the things of men.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoc wal t'anan Jesús yin tu', max yalon bay: —Ach Satanás, elan in satak, yujtol chochej chi somchaj el in nabal. Manak tzet chi na Dios cha na'. Asan yin yet anima ayoc a nabal, ẍi bay.

English: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', cax max yalon bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Ta ay mac chi yochej chi ec'c'al cuywok wintak, yowalilokab manxa yetok ba yul yet. Yabokab eb yail wuj, caxc'al chi alay oc eb yin curus. Ta bekan c'ul eb axca tu', ec'okabc'al eb cuywok wintak.

English: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will find it.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb c'am chi yochej chi cam bay yulyibank'inal ti', chi bekil eb jun k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Axa pax eb chi bek c'ulok cam wuj xin, a ton eb tu' ok chaon k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: What good will it be for a man if he gains the whole world, yet forfeits his soul? Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta chon tzakay jion masanil tzet ay bay yulyibank'inal ti', palta chi c'ay pax el janimail, ¿tzet wal chi ji' axca tu'? ¿Tzet wal ok jak' manbanilok janimail?

English: For the Son of Man is going to come in his Father's glory with his angels, and then he will reward each person according to what he has done.
Kanjobal: A ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in jay yetok mayk'ak'al in Mam, yetokc'al eb wángel. Axa wak'on paktzebal bay junjun anima yin atac'ala' tzet max el yuneni.

English: I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, ay jaywan e xol ti', manto ex camok okto e yil in jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', axa woc yin Yajawilal tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James and John the brother of James, and led them up a high mountain by themselves.
Kanjobal: Obxitax tu', max yiontok Jesús Pedro yetok Jacobo c'al jun yuẍtak Jacobo tu' chi yik Juan. Asan eb max ilaytok yuj Cham. Max toj eb bay jun miman tzalan.

English: There he was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' max q'uexpoj yili Cham max yil eb. Max tzekeki aj sat Cham axca c'u. Axa is pichil, sak lubinakxac'al yili.

English: Just then there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, talking with Jesus.
Kanjobal: Junixto bek tu', max ul tx'oxon aytek ba Moisés yetok Elías, max k'anjab eb yetok Cham.

English: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters–one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, caw wal watx' jet, yujtol ayon ec' cayti'. Ta chi yal a c'ul, chi co watx'nej oxebok lanchu cayti': junok et, junok yet Moisés, c'al junok yet Elías, ẍi bay Cham.

English: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud enveloped them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!”
Kanjobal: Lananto wal k'anjab Pedro tu', cax max ay boc'naj jun asun chi tzekeki yiban eb. Ay jay belan k'anej max oc xol jun asun tu', max yalon axca ti': A ton in C'ajol bay xiwil chi camel in c'ul ti'. Caw chin tzaloj yetok. Acbajek e txiquin bay, ẍi.

English: When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown to the ground, terrified.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb cuywom jay belan k'anej tu', max ay paknaj eb sat tx'otx'. Caw wal max xiw eb sic'libil.

English: But Jesus came and touched them. “Get up,” he said. “Don't be afraid.”
Kanjobal: Max jayoc Jesús c'atan eb, max matxban oc k'ab yiban eb. —Ajanek wan, manchak ex xiwi, ẍi bay eb.

English: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilontek eb, c'amxa mac ayic'ok, asanxanej Jesús ayic' tx'oklil.

English: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them, “Don't tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan paxaytek eb bay jun tzalan tu', max yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Ayta bay e yal jun max e yil ti'. Ato yet mayal quin ictzoj aj xol eb camnak, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', catatu' che yalon elok, ẍi bay eb.

English: The disciples asked him, “Why then do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”
Kanjobal: Catatu bian max k'anlen eb is cuywom tu' bay: —A eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, chi yal eb axca ti': A Elías yowalil babel ok jay satak Cham Cristo, ẍi eb. ¿Tzet yuj xan chi yal eb axca tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “To be sure, Elijah comes and will restore all things.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': —Yel ton chi yal eb, tol yowalil chi jay Elías tu' yin babelal yuj watx'nen masanil.

English: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him everything they wished. In the same way the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”
Kanjobal: Palta chi wal ayex, tol ulnakxa ec'ok; palta maj nachaj el yuj eb anima tatol a'. Yuj tu' xan max yak' wal eb yochwan yin axca chi yochej. Caytu' ok wut c'apax waben yail yuj eb, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ẍi bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: Then the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian max nachaj el yuj eb, tol a Juan, cham ak'om bautismo chi yal Cham.

English: When they came to the crowd, a man approached Jesus and knelt before him.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni oc eb bay bulan ec' anima tu', max jayoc jun winak bay Jesús. Max bekon ay jajan ba bay yakantak Cham, cax max yalon bay axca ti':

English: “Lord, have mercy on my son,” he said. “He has seizures and is suffering greatly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.
Kanjobal: —Mamin, ok' a c'ul yin jun in c'ajol chi tit oybinak sat yin. Caw wal chi yetnej c'ul yuj. Ay bay chi toj xol k'ak', ma yulak aej yuj.

English: I brought him to your disciples, but they could not heal him.”
Kanjobal: Max witek bay eb a cuywom ti', palta maj watx'jok yuj eb, ẍi bay Jesús.

English: “O unbelieving and perverse generation,” Jesus replied, “how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Jesús axca ti': —¡A…, a wal ayex ti', caw wal c'am che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios, caw wal pit ex! Mimanxa tiempoal wayji ec' e yetok. ¿Bak'intoc'al ok nachaj el e yuj xin? Chi yab yail in c'ul e yuj. Asi', itek nak unin tu' ayin, ẍi.

English: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of the boy, and he was healed from that moment.
Kanjobal: A yet max jay nak unin tu' bay, max tzuwaj Cham yin jun espíritu yob ayoc yin nak unin tu', cax max yukten el yin nak. Axa yet jun bek tu' max jaycan c'ul nak yuj.

English: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked, “Why couldn't we drive it out?”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max can Jesús tx'oklil yetok eb is cuywom, max k'anlen eb bay: —¿Tzet yuj xan maj el jun espíritu yob tu' yin nak juj on? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “Because you have so little faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”
Kanjobal: —Yujtol c'am che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios. Wal yel chi wal ayex, tatol che ya wal oc e c'ul yin, caxc'al jab ch'an che yut e yaon oc e c'ul yin axca junok bak' mostaza, ok je' e yalon bay junok witz axca ti': Elan cayti', asi' bay junokxa lugar, ta quex chi bay, ok el e yuj. Masanilc'al tzet yetal ok je' e yuj, tatol yel wali che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios, ẍi bay eb.

English: When they came together in Galilee, he said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yec'jab Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay yul makbej Galilea, max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ayin ti' caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb anima.

English: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised to life.” And the disciples were filled with grief.
Kanjobal: Ok in yak' cam eb, axa yet cabjial ok in ictzonelay pax ajok, ẍi bay eb. A yet max yaben eb juntzan ti', caw wal max cus c'ul eb.

English: After Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two-drachma tax came to Peter and asked, “Doesn't your teacher pay the temple tax?”
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc eb bay conob Capernaum, max jayoc eb tekom el tumin yet templo Dios bay Pedro, max k'anlen eb axca ti' bay: —¿Chi mi yak' jun e cuyomal tu' ch'en waj tumin chi k'anlay yuj templo Dios, ma c'am chi yak'a'? ẍi eb.

English: “Yes, he does,” he replied. When Peter came into the house, Jesus was the first to speak. “What do you think, Simon?” he asked. “From whom do the kings of the earth collect duty and taxes–from their own sons or from others?”
Kanjobal: —Chi yak'a', ẍi bay eb. A yet max octok Pedro yul na, a Jesús max babji k'anlen bay: —Simón, ¿tzet cha na'? ¿mac bay chi tekil eb rey yulyibank'inal ti' ch'en tojlabal? ¿a mi bay eb yuninal eb, ma a bay eb tx'ok conobal? ẍi bay.

English: “From others,” Peter answered. “Then the sons are exempt,” Jesus said to him.
Kanjobal: —A eb tx'ok conobal chi ak'oni, ẍi Pedro. Yuj tu xan max yal Jesús bay: —Ta caytu xin, a eb uninalej man yowalilok chi yak' eb yet.

English: “But so that we may not offend them, go to the lake and throw out your line. Take the first fish you catch; open its mouth and you will find a four-drachma coin. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours.”
Kanjobal: Palta yet watx' man yobok chi yab eb, asi' bay ti a' mar, chaon aytok anzuelo yul a'; a no babel txay chi michchaji, che ajtek. A yul ti' jun txay tu' ok ilchaj jun tumin oj, k'okbil ok yab in tojlabalok, c'al yuj et. Asi', ak'can bay mac chi tekon el ch'en tu', ẍi Jesús bay.

English: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu' max k'anlej el eb is cuywom Jesús bay axca ti': —¿Mactxel yel miman yelapnok xol eb ayoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan? ẍi eb bay.

English: He called a little child and had him stand among them.
Kanjobal: Max yawtentek Jesús jun unin, max lecban oc nan xol eb.

English: And he said: “I tell you the truth, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Max yalon axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, ta c'am chi na ba e c'ul, ta c'am che yut e nabal axca eb unin, maj je' e yoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: Therefore, whoever humbles himself like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a eb yaynakil chi yut ba axca jun unin ti', a ton eb tu' caw miman yelapnok yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: “And whoever welcomes a little child like this in my name welcomes me.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi chaon junok unin axca jun ti', yuj wal tol wet, ayin chin is cha'.

English: But if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi ak'on etax el is nabal junok unin chi yaoc c'ul win, ok'bal wal c'ul. Yel mi watx' chi pixlay oc t'unan junok ch'en ch'en yet molino yin is nuk', cax chi k'oklaytok yul a', yet watx' manchak yetnej el is nabal jun unin tu'.

English: “Woe to the world because of the things that cause people to sin! Such things must come, but woe to the man through whom they come!
Kanjobal: Ok'bal c'ul wal eb anima yuj juntzan tzet chi ak'on etax el is nabal eb tu'. Masanil tiempo ayc'alta' juntzan tu', palta ¡ay…, a wal eb chi etnewi el nabalej tu', ok'bal wal c'ul eb!

English: If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life maimed or crippled than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into eternal fire.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ta a junok e k'ab, ma junok e yakan chi ak'on etax el e nabal, yel mi watx' che tzoq'uilok, cax che k'okon elok, yet watx' c'am chi etax el e nabal yuj junelnej. Yujtol yel mi watx' che cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, caxc'al man tz'akanok e mimanil, yintak tol tz'akanc'al e mimanil, chex toj pax can xol k'ak' c'am bak'in chi tani.

English: And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
Kanjobal: Ta a junok e bak' sat chi ak'on etax el e nabal xin, yel mi watx' che yiiltek, che k'okon elok yet watx' c'am chi etax e nabal junelnej. Yujtol yel mi watx' che cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, caxc'al jun ch'an e bak' sat, yintak tol tz'akanc'al e bak' sat cax chex toj pax can xol k'ak'ej bay infierno.

English: “See that you do not look down on one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father in heaven.
Kanjobal: Caw maj je' e yintaknen el junok eb unin ti'. Chi wal ayex, a eb ángel chi taynen junjun unin ti', ayic' eb yetok co Mam Dios masanil tiempo bay satcan.

English: “What do you think? If a man owns a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go to look for the one that wandered off?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok mactxel ay junok ciento is calnel, cax chi c'aytok junok no', ¿c'amtax mi chi bekcan no 99 etbiej tu' low bay junok tzalan, cax chi toj sayon ec' no' max c'aytok tu'?

English: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that did not wander off.
Kanjobal: Ta chi ilchaj no' yuj nak, caw chi tzaloj oc nak yin no', yintak pax no 99 ayc'alta' ec' tu'.

English: In the same way your Father in heaven is not willing that any of these little ones should be lost.
Kanjobal: Cayton tu' co Mam ayic' bay satcan xin, man yochwanok tol ay junok xol eb unin ti' chi c'aycan elok.

English: “If your brother sins against you, go and show him his fault, just between the two of you. If he listens to you, you have won your brother over.
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok oẍtak chi oc mul ayach, chach toj a tx'oklil bay, cax chalon bay tol max oc mul ayach. Ta chi cha' yab ayach, ti wal mayal monchaj oj chi yal tu'.

English: But if he will not listen, take one or two others along, so that ‘every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.’
Kanjobal: Palta ta c'am chi cha yab ayach, yel mi watx' chetok jun cawanokxa mac chi toj alon etok bay. Ayokab cawanok ma oxwanok testigo, yet watx' miman txequel yayji tzet chi ali, axca yalon yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, treat him as you would a pagan or a tax collector.
Kanjobal: Palta ta ac'ala' c'am chi cha yab bay eb xin, yel mi watx' chal bay iglesia. Ta c'amc'alta' chi cha yab bay iglesia tu', canokab axca junok man israelok, ma axca junok tekom el tojlabal yul a sat.

English: “I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a tzet ok e yak' yowalil yulyibank'inal ti', a ton tzet ayc'alta' yowalil yuj Cham aj satcan. Axa tzet man ok e yak' yowalil yulyibank'inal ti', a ton tzet c'amc'alta' yowalil yuj Cham aj satcan.

English: “Again, I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about anything you ask for, it will be done for you by my Father in heaven.
Kanjobal: Chi wal c'apax ayex, ta ay cawanok ex jun lajanc'al chaon e c'ul junok tzet yetal, cax che k'anon yin txajil, ok ak'lay ayex yuj co Mam ayic' bay satcan.

English: For where two or three come together in my name, there am I with them.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol tzanc'al bay ayic' cawanok ma oxwanok chi wajbaj ba yin yion ay ba eb ayin, ayin ec' yetok eb, ẍi Jesucristo.

English: Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, how many times shall I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?”
Kanjobal: Axa jitzontok ba Pedro tu' c'atan Cham, max k'anlen bay: —Mamin, ta ay junok wuẍtak cac'al ti' yoc mul ayin, ¿jayel mi chi wak' mimanc'ulal yin? ¿Yowalil mi ukel chi wak' mimanc'ulal yin? ẍi.

English: Jesus answered, “I tell you, not seven times, but seventy-seven times.
Kanjobal: —Chi wal ayach, manc'al ukelnejok, palta caxc'al 490 el chi oc is mul ayach, ak'c'al mimanc'ulal yin.

English: “Therefore, the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
Kanjobal: Ok waltek ayex tzet ok yun yeloc eb ayoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan: Lajan wal yayji axca junok rey max yi' is cuenta yin jec eb is mulnajwom.

English: As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal chaon el yich yion is cuenta tu', cax max ilay jay junok nak ay xiwilok milal quetzal is jec bay.

English: Since he was not able to pay, the master ordered that he and his wife and his children and all that he had be sold to repay the debt.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am ch'en yuj nak. C'amxa tzet watx' max yun yak'on pax is jec tu'. Yuj tu xan max yal cham rey tu', tol yowalil chi txonlay el nak yetokc'al yistzil c'al eb yuninal, c'al jantak tzet ay, cax chi pax jec nak tu'.

English: “The servant fell on his knees before him. ‘Be patient with me,’ he begged, ‘and I will pay back everything.’
Kanjobal: Axa bekon ay jajnaj ba nak satak jun rey tu', cax max yalon ba nak bay cham axca ti': Mamin, ta miman chot a c'ul win, ok wak' pax in jec tu' ayach, ẍi nak.

English: The servant's master took pity on him, canceled the debt and let him go.
Kanjobal: Axa yok' c'ul cham tu' yin nak, max joonc'ay cham jec nak yiban masanil, axa beklay el nak yuj cham tu'.

English: “But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii. He grabbed him and began to choke him. ‘Pay back what you owe me!’ he demanded.
Kanjobal: A yet mayal beklay el nak tu', max ilchaj el junok yet mulnajwomal nak yuj. Ay mi jayebok quetzal jec bay nak. Yuj tu' max oc mitx'naj nak yin, cax max oc pitz'naj nak yin nuk' jun winak tu'. Max yalon nak bay: Itek ch'en a majan tumin ayin wal tinani', ẍi bay.

English: “His fellow servant fell to his knees and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you back.’
Kanjobal: Axa bekon ay jajan ba nak ay majan tu' bay nak. Max yalon axca ti': Ta miman chot a c'ul win, ok wak' pax in majan tu' ayach, ẍi nak.

English: “But he refused. Instead, he went off and had the man thrown into prison until he could pay the debt.
Kanjobal: Palta majc'al yal c'ul nak max yak' mimanc'ulal. A ti yet tol max toj yacan oc preso, masantac'al max yak' pax nak is majan tumin tu'.

English: When the other servants saw what had happened, they were greatly distressed and went and told their master everything that had happened.
Kanjobal: Ay pax juntzanxa yet mulnajwomal nak max ilon tzet max yun nak, caw wal max cus c'ul eb yuj. Yuj tu' xan max toj yal eb bay cham patronej yuj tzet max uj tu'.

English: “Then the master called the servant in. ‘You wicked servant,’ he said, ‘I canceled all that debt of yours because you begged me to.
Kanjobal: Axa yawten cham tu' nak c'am is mimanc'ulal tu', max yalon cham bay nak axca ti': Caw yob a c'ul ach chekbej. Max wak' mimanc'ulal yin masanil a jec, yuj max ach oc tean win.

English: Shouldn't you have had mercy on your fellow servant just as I had on you?’
Kanjobal: Matawal tol max ak' mimanc'ulal yin nak et chekbejal tu', axca max ach wut wak'on mimanc'ulal, ẍi cham bay nak.

English: In anger his master turned him over to the jailers to be tortured, until he should pay back all he owed.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max tit yowal cham tu' sic'libil. Max yaontok cham nak preso. Max yalon cham tol chi alay oc yailal nak, masantac'al chi yal yak'on pax nak is jec bay cham.

English: “This is how my heavenly Father will treat each of you unless you forgive your brother from your heart.”
Kanjobal: Ta c'am che yak' c'apax mimanc'ulal yin masanil e c'ul yin yobtakil e yet animail chi oc ayex, man ok yak' c'apax mimanc'ulal co Mam Dios e yin, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went into the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan tu xin, max el bay Galilea tu', cax max toj yulak yet Judea, bay k'axepal ec' a' miman Jordán.

English: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max tzakloj yintak. Max jaycan c'ul jantak eb ya'ay yuj Cham.

English: Some Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?”
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb fariseo max apni oc bay Cham, yuj yak'len eb yikban c'aytok Cham. Max yak'on eb k'anlebal bay Cham. —¿Ay mi leyal chi je' pojlen ba nak winak yetok yistzil yuj tzanc'al tzet yetal? ẍi eb bay.

English: “Haven't you read,” he replied, “that at the beginning the Creator ‘made them male and female,’
Kanjobal: Max tak'welay eb yuj Cham: —¿Tom c'amto bay che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, tol atax yet max watx'nen Dios yulyibank'inal ti', max watx'nej nak winak c'al ix ix?

English: and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh’?
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apaxcan axca ti': Yuj tu xin, a nak winak, ok bekcan is mam c'al is txutx yuj junanen ba nak yetok yistzil, xan axca wal tol junxanej mimanilejal chi yuncan el eb cawanil, ẍi Dios.

English: So they are no longer two, but one. Therefore what God has joined together, let man not separate.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, manxa cawanok eb, palta tol junxanej chi yuncan el eb. Xan a eb junanebil yuj Dios, manchak pojlay ay eb yuj eb yet animail, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “Why then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen pax eb tu': —¿Palta tzet xan albil pax can yuj Moisés, tol chi je' yak'on junok winak tx'an yunal pojlejbail bay yistzil, cax chi pojlen ba eb? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard. But it was not this way from the beginning.
Kanjobal: —Yuj e pital xan max cha' Moisés e pojlen e ba yetok e yistzil; palta atax yet max watx'nej Dios yulyibank'inal ti', man cayok tu' max yutej.

English: I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, and marries another woman commits adultery.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi wal ayex, tol tzanc'al mactxel chi yuktej pax yistzil, palta c'am pax mul ix chi yaoc yul k'ab nak, cax chi yion nak junokxa ix, mul chi yun nak, ẍi bay eb.

English: The disciples said to him, “If this is the situation between a husband and wife, it is better not to marry.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb is cuywom tu' bay: —Ta junelnej wal c'am chi je' pojlen ba nak winak yetok yistzil xin, yel mi watx' c'am chi oc yistzil, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “Not everyone can accept this word, but only those to whom it has been given.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': —Palta man masanilok anima chi techaj yuj juntzan che yal ti'. Asannej eb chi oc Dios yetok chi techaj yuj.

English: For some are eunuchs because they were born that way; others were made that way by men; and others have renounced marriage because of the kingdom of heaven. The one who can accept this should accept it.”
Kanjobal: Ay mac palta wal yayji is mimanil yintax yaljubal, yuj tu' xan c'am chi oc yetbi eb. Ay mac, a yet animail chi uten yin tol c'amxa chi je' yoc yetbi. Ay mac xin, c'am chi oc yistzil, yujtol asannej Cham is Yajawil ay satcan chi yochej chi yak' serbil. A eb chi techaj yuj axca tu', techajokab yuj eb xin, ẍi Jesús.

English: Then little children were brought to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, ay juntzan unin max ilay jay bay Jesús yuj eb anima, yuj batxban oc Cham k'ab yiban eb, c'al yuj txajli Cham yuj eb. Palta max tenlay oc wanaj eb jay c'atan Cham yuj eb cuywom.

English: Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu' axca ti': —Chaek jay eb unin ayin. Man e tenoc wanaj eb, yujtol asan eb lajan nabal axca eb unin ti', asan eb ay yalon yet yoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan, ẍi bay eb.

English: When he had placed his hands on them, he went on from there.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian max yaon ajtok k'ab yiban jolom eb unin tu', axa toj tu'.

English: Now a man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?”
Kanjobal: A junel, ay jun ach'ej max apni oc bay Jesús. Max k'anlen bay Cham: —Ach in Meẍtol, chin k'anlej ayach, ¿tzet yetal watx' chi wunej, yet watx' chin cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal? ẍi bay Cham.

English: “Why do you ask me about what is good?” Jesus replied. “There is only One who is good. If you want to enter life, obey the commandments.”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yuj xan cha k'anlej ayin yuj tzet yetal watx'? Jun ch'an mactxel watx', asan Dios. Ta chochej cha cha' jun k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal tu', ikej chekbanil Dios, ẍi Cham bay.

English: “Which ones?” the man inquired. Jesus replied, “ ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony,
Kanjobal: —¿Mactet juntzan chekbanilej chal tu xin? ẍi bay Cham. Max yalon Cham: —Manchak a mak' cam anima. Manchak aoc a mul yul k'ab estzil. Manchak ach elk'ani. Manchak a naaj k'anej yin et animail.

English: honor your father and mother,’ and ‘love your neighbor as yourself.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ayokab yelapnok a mam c'al a txutx yul a sat. Ya'ilnej eb et animail axca chot a ya'ilnen a ba, ẍi Cham bay.

English: “All these I have kept,” the young man said. “What do I still lack?”
Kanjobal: —Chixa wikej masanil juntzan chekbanil tu' yet max in titoc yin uninal. ¿Tom ayto wal jabokxa chi wun chi yal tu'? ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus answered, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
Kanjobal: —Ta chochej wal tol chach tz'aknaj el eken masanil, txoncan el masanil tzet ay ayach, cax cha pojontok tojol tu' xol eb meba'; catatu bian ok a chaon a beyomal bay satcan. Chi lajwi tu xin, cax chach ec'c'al cuywok wintak, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: When the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben jun ach'ej axca tu xin, max paxtok nak yin cusc'ulalil, yujtol caw beyom.

English: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol a eb beyom, yatak yoc eb yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: Chi wal c'apax ayex, k'inalok junok no camello tinani', ¿tom ok je' yeq'uel no' yul yixal junok ch'en acuẍa? Cayton tu' eb beyom xin, ta ok oc eb yul k'ab Cham aj satcan, yin puralil ok oc eb, ẍi bay eb.

English: When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb is cuywom jun tu', caw max c'ayaj c'ul eb. Axa yalon eb tu' axca ti': —Ta caytu' axca tu xin, ¿mac wal txel ok je' colchaji? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max oc t'anan Jesús yin eb, axa yalon tu': —A jun ti', c'am ton junok anima chi je' yuj; palta a Dios chi je' yuj, yujtol masanil chic'al je' yuj Cham, ẍi bay eb.

English: Peter answered him, “We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro tu' bay Jesús: —Mamin, ilab ayon ti', max co bekcan masanil co tzetak yetal, cax chon ec'c'al cuywok entak. Yuj tu', ¿ay mi jabok watx'takil ok ji' q'uexelok? ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, at the renewal of all things, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a yet ok ac'bok masanil tzet yetal, cax ok e chaon paktzil e yet tu'. A' ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in ay chotan bay in despacho, bay ok txecloj el in mayk'ak'al. A ayex e lajcawanil max ex ec'c'al cuywok wintak ti', ok ex ay chotan junjun ex bay junjun e despacho. Ok e beyc'ulnen eb jet israelal lajcaw bulanil.

English: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields for my sake will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi bekcan yatut wujc'al, ma yuẍtak, ma yanab, ma xin is mam ma is txutx, ma yuninal, ma is tx'otx' chi bekcan wuj, a ton eb tu' caw miman q'uexel ok cha'. Yetok c'apaxok, ok cha' c'apax eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: But many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.
Kanjobal: Ay eb miman yelapnok co xol tinani', palta a yet jun tiempoal chi wal tu', xiwil eb c'amxa jabok yelapnok. Ay pax eb xin, c'am jabok yelapnok co xol tinani', palta a yet tu', xiwil eb mimanxa yelapnok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem
Kanjobal: A bay jun conob chi yik Belén yul yet Judea, a tu' max alji Jesús. A yet jun tiempoal tu', a cham Herodes ayoc reyal bay Judea tu'. A yet max alji Jesús, max tit juntzan eb mago bay yichcan. Max jayoc eb bay Jerusalén.

English: and asked, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlej eb: —¿Baytal ay jun winak unin max alji, jun tol ok oc e reyalok ayex Israel ex ti'? A bay chi ajol c'u, ata tu' max jil yajol jun waycan, jun max tx'oxon yaljubal jun unin tu' ayon. Yuj tu' xan max on tit ul jaon ay co ba bay, ẍi eb.

English: When King Herod heard this he was disturbed, and all Jerusalem with him.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham rey Herodes jun ti', toxac'al max somchaj aj c'ul yetok masanil eb aj Jerusalén tu'.

English: When he had called together all the people's chief priests and teachers of the law, he asked them where the Christ was to be born.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian max yawten oc wajan masanil eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, cax max k'anlen el bay eb, baytal t'inan chi alji Cham Cristo.

English: “In Bethlehem in Judea,” they replied, “for this is what the prophet has written:
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi eb bay axca ti': —A bay conob Belén, yul yet Judea, a tu' ok aljok, yujtol ay jun chekbej Dios caytu' max yut tz'ibencan axca ti':

English: “ ‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for out of you will come a ruler who will be the shepherd of my people Israel.’ ”
Kanjobal: A pax conob Belén, yul yet Judea ay, yaliẍ conob ch'an yintak juntzanxa conob yul yet Judea tu', palta miman yelapnok yintak juntzanxa tu', yujtol a bay tu' ok tit jun yajaw ok ak'on cuenta in conob Israel, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu', ẍi eb.

English: Then Herod called the Magi secretly and found out from them the exact time the star had appeared.
Kanjobal: Axa yawten el Herodes tu' eb mago yin ewantakil, cax max cam k'anlen wal yab bay eb, bak'ini wal max tx'oxaj ba jun waycan tu' bay eb.

English: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and make a careful search for the child. As soon as you find him, report to me, so that I too may go and worship him.”
Kanjobal: Max xew yaben oc xin, cax max cheklaytok eb bay conob Belén tu' yuj. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Asek bay tu'. Chi cam e k'anlen e yab yuj jun unin tu', baytal ayic'ok. Chi xew yilchaj e yuj xin, cax chi ec' e yalon wabej, baytal wal yetc'ulal ayic'ok, yet watx' chi toj c'apax wiay in ba bay, ẍi bay eb.

English: After they had heard the king, they went on their way, and the star they had seen in the east went ahead of them until it stopped over the place where the child was.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yaben eb juntzan k'anej tu xin, axa toj eb tu'. A jun waycan max yil eb yajol bay chi ajol c'u tu', babelc'al satak eb, masantac'al max apni oc batxnaj yiban bay ayic' jun unin tu'.

English: When they saw the star, they were overjoyed.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb jun waycan tu', caw wal max tzaloj aj eb.

English: On coming to the house, they saw the child with his mother Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts of gold and of incense and of myrrh.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc eb bay na bay ayic' nak unin tu'. Max yilon oc eb yin nak yetok is txutx, a ton María. Axa yay jajan eb bay jun unin tu', max yion ay ba eb bay. Max lajwi tu xin, axa jakon eb c'uanbalil is sabal tu'. Max sa' can eb oro bay jun unin tu'. Max saon c'apax can eb jun makan te' incienso, c'al jun makan yal te' suk'uk'i c'apax jab chi yik mirra.

English: And having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod, they returned to their country by another route.
Kanjobal: Catatu xin, max al-lay bay eb yin wayichejal tol manchak ec' yal eb bay Herodes baytal ayic' nak unin tu', xan tx'okxa beal max yi' eb yet max meltzoj eb bay is conob.

English: When they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up,” he said, “take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al pax eb mago xin, max tx'oxon aj ba jun yángel Cham Jajawil bay José yin wayichejal, max yalon bay axca ti': Lim, ajan wanok. Itok nak unin yetok is txutx, cax chex toj bay Egipto. Ayjanek ec' bay tu', masantac'al ok wal ayach, cax chex meltzoji, yujtol a Herodes ok ak'on saylay jun unin tu', yujtol chi yochej chi yak' camok, ẍi jun ángel tu' bay.

English: So he got up, took the child and his mother during the night and left for Egypt,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max aj wan José tu', cax max yion bey nak unin tu', yetokc'al is txutx yet ak'balil tu', cax max toj eb bay Egipto.

English: where he stayed until the death of Herod. And so was fulfilled what the Lord had said through the prophet: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
Kanjobal: Max ayji ec' eb bay tu', masantac'al max cam Herodes, catatu' max meltzoj eb junelxa. Axca ton ti' max yun yion ba tzet max yal Cham Jajawil, yet max yak'balnen jun is chekbej yalon axca ti': Max wawtejtek in C'ajol bay Egipto, ẍi.

English: When Herod realized that he had been outwitted by the Magi, he was furious, and he gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem and its vicinity who were two years old and under, in accordance with the time he had learned from the Magi.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilon Herodes tol majxa ec' eb mago tu' bay, toc'al max etnelay yuj eb, caw wal max tit yowal, xan max chek mak'lay cam masanil eb winak unin, eb cabcab abil is k'inal, c'al eb yaynakil, atac'ala' jantakxa tiempoal yal-lay bay yuj eb mago. Bay conob Belén yetokc'al bay masanil is makbej max mak'lay cam eb unin tu'.

English: Then what was said through the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled:
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun yion el ba tzet max tz'ibejcan cham chekbej Dios chi yik Jeremías, yet max yalon axca ti':

English: “A voice is heard in Ramah, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”
Kanjobal: Max ablay yoc aw bay conob Ramá. Ay mac max ok' yuj mimek yailal. A Raquel chi ok' yuj eb is yune'. C'amxa chi yochej chi mimanc'ulnelayi yujtol c'amxa eb, ẍi Jeremías.

English: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt
Kanjobal: Axa yet max cam Herodes tu xin, max tx'oxon aj ba jun yángel Cham Jajawil bay José yin wayichejal yet ayic' bay Egipto tu', cax max yalon bay axca ti':

English: and said, “Get up, take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, for those who were trying to take the child's life are dead.”
Kanjobal: —Ajan wanok. Itok nak unin ti' yetok is txutx. Meltzojanek bay is lugar eb e yet israelal, yujtol a eb max ochen max mak'on cam nak unin ti', mayal cam eb, ẍi jun ángel tu' bay José.

English: So he got up, took the child and his mother and went to the land of Israel.
Kanjobal: Catatu' max aj wan José cax max yion meltzoj nak unin tu' yetok is txutx junelxa bay is lugar eb yet israelal.

English: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Having been warned in a dream, he withdrew to the district of Galilee,
Kanjobal: Palta max yabaj José tol a Arquelao ayoc yajawil bay Judea, q'uexelok Herodes is mam, xan max xiw eb meltzoj bay tu' junelxa. Axa yalon Dios yin wayichejal bay, tzet watx' chi yunej, xan max toj eb cajay bay yulak yet Galilea.

English: and he went and lived in a town called Nazareth. So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
Kanjobal: Max apni eb bay tu xin, max cajay eb bay jun conob chi yik Nazaret. Axca ton tu' max yun yion ba tzet albilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios yet payxa, yet max tz'ibencan eb tol t'inan ok al-lay yin Jesús tol aj Nazaret.

English: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire men to work in his vineyard.
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': Ok waltek ayex, tzet chi yun yeloc eb anima chi oc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan: A junel ay jun cham patrón, ayto k'inibi max toj sayon jaywanok is mulnajwom yin yawoj uva.

English: He agreed to pay them a denarius for the day and sent them into his vineyard.
Kanjobal: Max ilchaj eb xin, cax max yak'on trato yetok eb. Max yalon cham bay eb tol jun denario ok tojlanej cham c'u junjun eb, cax max chekontok cham eb bay is mulnajil tu'.

English: “About the third hour he went out and saw others standing in the marketplace doing nothing.
Kanjobal: Axa yet yajc'ualil max eltok cham ec'jab txonbal, max yilon yin juntzan winak c'am is mulnajil.

English: He told them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham bay eb axca ti': Ta che yochej chex mulnaji, asek mulnaj ayin. Ok ex in tojlanej axca wal mojalil, ẍi bay eb. Axa toj eb mulnaj bay cham tu'.

English: So they went. “He went out again about the sixth hour and the ninth hour and did the same thing.
Kanjobal: Max eltok ec'jab junelxa yet chuman c'u, max yak'on trato yetok jaywanxa, axcac'al max yut yak'on trato yetok eb max oc yin mulnajil yet yajc'ualil tu'. Ac'ala' max yun yet a las tres.

English: About the eleventh hour he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, ‘Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?’
Kanjobal: Max toj cham ec'jab junelxa yet a las cinco bay txonbal. Ay juntzanxa winak c'am is mulnajil max yil bay tu', axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj toc'al ay ex ec' cayti' chi ec' c'u? ¿Tom c'am jabok e mulnajil? ẍi cham.

English: “ ‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. “He said to them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard.’
Kanjobal: C'am; yujtol c'am mac chon ochen on yin mulnajil, ẍi eb bay cham. Ta caytu xin, asek mulnajil ayin bay in tx'otx', ẍi cham bay eb.

English: “When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.’
Kanjobal: Axa yet max k'ekbi, max yalon cham bay jun is caporal axca ti': Awtejtek eb in majan, cax chak'on tojol c'u eb. A eb tzunanxac'al max oc yin mulnajil, cha tojlanej yin babelal. Axa eb babel max oqui, tzunan cha tojlanej eb, ẍi cham.

English: “The workers who were hired about the eleventh hour came and each received a denarius.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a eb yayc'ualilxa max oc yin mulnajil tu', a eb max babji jayi, jun denario tojol eb max cha'.

English: So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max jayoc eb max pet oc yin mulnajil tu'. A yet max jayoc eb tu', a naon eb tol miman tojol eb ok cha'. Palta titol ac'ala' jun denario ch'en max cha' eb.

English: When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi chaon eb tojol tu', max tit yowal eb yin cham aj mulnajil tu'.

English: ‘These men who were hired last worked only one hour,’ they said, ‘and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': A eb nak tzunanxa max jay mulnajil ti', junxanej hora max mulnaj eb nak; palta lajan pax tojol eb nak max yi' jetok on, ayon max techajc'al ec' c'u juj ti' xol k'ak', ẍi eb bay.

English: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am not being unfair to you. Didn't you agree to work for a denarius?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham bay junok eb nak tu' axca ti': Ach wamigo, man lananok wak'on tac in ti' ayach. ¿Tom man jun denariook max jut co trato xin?

English: Take your pay and go. I want to give the man who was hired last the same as I gave you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', cha' a tojol ti', paxan. Chi el yin in c'ul wak'on tojol eb tzunanilxac'al max oc yin mulnajil ti', axca a tojol chi wak' ti'.

English: Don't I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?’
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', ay walon wet wak'on in tumin axca bay chi el yin in c'ul. Maj je' tit owal win, yujtol watx' chi wut in c'ul yin junok mactxel, ẍi cham. Axca tu' yalon jun abix ti'.

English: “So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ay eb c'am jabok yelapnok tinani', caw miman ok yun yeloc eb. Ay c'apax eb miman yelapnok tinani', c'amxa yelapnok eb bay tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Now as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside and said to them,
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yajtok Jesús yetok eb anima yul beal conob Jerusalén, max yawten el eb is lajcawan cuywom xol eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti':

English: “We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death
Kanjobal: —Ilab lanan jajtok bay Jerusalén ti'. Ayin ti' caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb sat sacerdote, c'al yul k'ab eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, axa yaon oc eb camich wiban tu'.

English: and will turn him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!”
Kanjobal: Cax ok in yaon oc eb yul k'ab eb man israelok. Ok in is buchon eb, ok in is mak' eb, ok in is curusnej eb; palta a yet cabjial ok in ictzonelay ajok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then the mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc xal yistzil cham Zebedeo, yetok cawan yuninal eb bay Cham. Max bekon ay jajan ba xal txutxej tu' bay Jesús, yujtol ay tzet chi yochej c'ul chi k'an bay.

English: “What is it you want?” he asked. She said, “Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay xal tu': —¿Tzet chochej cha k'an ayin? ẍi Cham. —Mamin, a yet ok ach oc yajawilal, matawal cha cha' ay chotan eb wune' ti' a c'atan, junok bay a watx' k'ab, junokxa bay a q'uexan, ẍi xal bay.

English: “You don't know what you are asking,” Jesus said to them. “Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?” “We can,” they answered.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu': —Ayex ti', c'am chi nachaj el e yuj tzet che k'an ayin. ¿Ok mi techaj e yuj e yak'lay porobal, axca ok in utlayok? ẍi bay eb. —Ok techajok, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”
Kanjobal: —Yel toni axca yailal ok eq'uel wiban, caytu' yailal ok eq'uel e yiban. Palta c'am walon wet ex in chotban ay bay in watx' k'ab, ma bay in q'uexan, yujtol a co Mam Dios, watx'xa yayji yuj, mac eb ok ay chotan bay tu', a' ok ak'on bay eb, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb lajonwanxa cuywom jun ti', max tit yowal eb yin eb cawan tu'.

English: Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max wajbaj oc Jesús eb lajcawanil, cax max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ti wal e yojtakxa, a eb ayoc yajawil bay junjun mimek conob, tojolc'al chekwaj eb. Cay c'apax tu' eb mimek winak xol conob, yajawxac'al chi yut ba eb yiban anima.

English: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
Kanjobal: Palta a co xol ayon ti', man axcaok tu' ok yunej. Ta ay mac chi yochej caw miman yelapnok co xol, yowalil chi oc yak'omalok serbil eb yet cuywomal masanil.

English: and whoever wants to be first must be your slave–
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay mac co xol chi yochej tol chi oc aj babelal, yowalil chi oc mosejal bay eb yet cuywomal.

English: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
Kanjobal: Ilab in, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', man yujok wak'lay serbil, xan max in jayi, palta yuj wak'wi serbil. Max in jay yuj ul wak'on in ba camok, yet watx' xiwil mactxel chi colchajcan el wuj, ẍi bay eb.

English: As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.
Kanjobal: A yet max el eb bay Jericó bay ayic' eb tu', xiwil anima max oc tzakan yintak Jesús.

English: Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
Kanjobal: Ay cawan winak c'am chi je' yilwi, cax chotan ay ti be. A yet max yaben eb tol a Cham chi eq'uel tu', max aj yaw eb yin ipejal, max yalon eb: —Mamin, ach Yinatil David, ok' a c'ul jin on, ẍi eb bay.

English: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
Kanjobal: Axa tenchanelay eb yuj eb anima tu', yet watx' chi tz'inji eb; palta tol max aj can yel yaw eb: —Mamin, ach Yinatil David, ok' a c'ul jin on, ẍi eb bay junelxa.

English: Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
Kanjobal: Max oc wanaj Cham cax max yawtentek Cham eb is c'atan. —¿Tzet che yochej chex wutej? ẍi bay eb.

English: “Lord,” they answered, “we want our sight.”
Kanjobal: —Mamin, chi jochej chon ak'can ilwok, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yok'can c'ul Cham yin eb tu', max yaon oc k'ab yiban bak' sat eb. Max jakchaj sat eb yet jun bek tu' yuj; max lajwi tu xin, max tzakloj eb yintak.

English: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa yapni oc Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay cawilal Jerusalén, max apni oc eb bay conob Betfagé, bay cawilal jun tzalan chi yik Olivo. Cax max chekon babjok Cham cawan eb is cuywom.

English: saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Babjanek e toj bay jun aldea co sataktok ti'. A tu' ok e yil yin jun no txutx burro, pixan no' yetok jun no ach'ejtakxa. Che xuyil no', cax che yiontek no' cayti'.

English: If anyone says anything to you, tell him that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mactxel ay tzet chi alon ayex, che yal bay axca ti': Tol ok k'an Cham Jajawil no', quex chi bay. Axa beklaytek no' ayex tu' yin aymanil, ẍi bay eb.

English: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:
Kanjobal: Cayton tu' max yun yion ba tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj cham chekbej Dios yet payxa, yet max yaloncan axca ti':

English: “Say to the Daughter of Zion, ‘See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”
Kanjobal: Alek bay eb aj conob Sión axca ti': Ilab wal jay e Reyal e xol. Yaynakil ok yut ba. Ay aj Cham yiban jun no burro. Ay aj yiban no ach'ej burro, yune' jun no txutx burro, quex chi, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.
Kanjobal: Axa toj eb cawan cuywom tu'. Max yiken eb tzet max yal Jesús.

English: They brought the donkey and the colt, placed their cloaks on them, and Jesus sat on them.
Kanjobal: Max yiontek eb no txutx burro yetok no ach'ejtakxa tu' bay. Max yaon ajtok eb cuywom tu' juntzan is pichil tz'amok no', cax max aj Cham yiban no' tu'.

English: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan bey tu', xiwil anima chi litx'baj ay is pichil yul is be Cham. Ay mac xin, k'ablak te' chi bet tzoc'tek, cax chi yaon ay yul is be tu'.

English: The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Hosanna in the highest!”
Kanjobal: A jantak eb babel satak, c'al jantak eb tzakan yintak, max chaon el eb yich yel yaw axca ti': —Yuj wal dios bay jun Yinatil David ti'. Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil. Jalek yuj diosal bay Cham aj satcan, ẍi eb.

English: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, “Who is this?”
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc Jesús bay conob Jerusalén, max aj somnaj anima masanil. —¿Mac jun chi jay ti'? ẍi eb.

English: The crowds answered, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”
Kanjobal: Ay eb max alon axca ti': —A ton is chekbej Dios, Cham Jesús aj Nazaret, yul yet Galilea, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max octok Jesús yul templo Dios. Max yukten eltek eb chi txonji, c'al eb chi manji bay tu'. Max tenon aj pac'labok meẍa eb q'uexom tumin, c'al ẍila eb txonom paloma.

English: “It is written,” he said to them, “ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a ‘den of robbers.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Albilcan yuj Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': A in templo ti' ok al-lay yin tol nail txaj yayji, ẍi. Palta ayex ti', axcaxac'al junok nach'en bay chi c'ubaj el ba eb elk'om, caytu' che yutej, ẍi bay eb.

English: The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.
Kanjobal: A yet ayic' yul templo tu', ay juntzan eb c'am chi je' yilwi max jayoc bay, yetok juntzan eb c'am chi je' beyi. Max watx'jican eb yuj.

English: But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple area, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were indignant.
Kanjobal: Max yilon eb sat sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés juntzan milagro tu', cax max yaben pax eb yaj yaw juntzan unin tol chi yal axca ti': Yuj wal dios bay jun Yinatil David ti', ẍi eb. Yuj tu' xan max tit yowal eb sic'libil.

English: “Do you hear what these children are saying?” they asked him. “Yes,” replied Jesus, “have you never read, “ ‘From the lips of children and infants you have ordained praise’?”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb bay Jesús: —¿Chi mi ab tzet chi yal juntzan unin ti'? ẍi eb bay. —Chi ton wabej. ¿Tom c'amto che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan bay chi yal yuj juntzan chi yal eb ti'? A eb unin, c'al eb chi txutxwi, cha k'anbalnej eb yin yalon watx' k'anej ayach, ẍi tx'an, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max beklaycan eb yuj Jesús, axa toj tu'. Max el bay Jerusalén, cax max apni bay Betania. A tu' max ec' ak'bal yuj bay tu'.

English: Early in the morning, as he was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa k'inibalil, yet lanan pax Jesús bay Jerusalén, max tit is wajil.

English: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it, “May you never bear fruit again!” Immediately the tree withered.
Kanjobal: Axa max yiloni, ay jun te higo ti be. Max toj c'atan te', palta c'am junok sat te' max ilchaj yuj. Asan xak te' ay. Yuj tu xan max yal Cham yin te' axca ti': —C'amxaokab bak'in ok yak' jun te' ti' sat, ẍi Cham. Yet jun bek tu' max takxac'al aj te'.

English: When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?” they asked.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb cuywom jun tu', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb. —Max k'anlen eb bay ¿Tzetlaj max yun takaj jun te ti' yin jun bek? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and it will be done.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tatol che yaoc Dios yin e c'ul, cax c'am jabok che yak' cabc'ulal, tzanc'al tzet ok je' e yuj. Man asannejok axca tzet max wut jun te ti' ok je' e yuj. Palta caxc'al che yal yin jun witz ti': Elokab cayti', cax chi k'okonaytok ba yul a' mar, ta quex chi, ok je' e yuj.

English: If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”
Kanjobal: Cax tzanc'al tzet ok e k'an yet ok ex txajlok, ok ak'lay ayex, tatol che yaoc yin e c'ul, ẍi bay eb.

English: Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you this authority?”
Kanjobal: Cax max oc Jesús yul templo Dios. Max cuywaj bay eb anima yul tu'. Max jayoc eb sat sacerdote, yetok eb yicham winakil eb israel tu' bay, cax max k'anlen eb: —¿Tzet ekbej xan max on juntzan tu' ewi? ¿Mac wal ak'nej ekbej tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Ay c'apax jun tzet ok in k'anlej el ayex. Ta ok e yal ayin, cax ok walon ayex mac ak'nej wikbej, xan chi wun juntzan tu'.

English: John's baptism–where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or from men?” They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn't you believe him?’
Kanjobal: Alek ayin, ¿mac ak'nej yikbej Juan yin yak'on bautizar anima? ¿Dios mi ak'nej, ma a eb anima? ẍi bay eb. Axa c'oli yalubtanen eb is xol tu' yuj jun tzet max k'anlej tu', max c'oli yalon eb axca ti': ¿Tzet chi jut co paktzen bay? Yujtol ta chi jala' tol a Dios ak'nej yikbej Juan tu', ¿tzet xan maj e yaoc yin e c'ul xin? ẍi mi.

English: But if we say, ‘From men’–we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet.”
Kanjobal: Palta ta chi jala' tol anima ak'nej yikbej, caw ay is may yuj anima, yujtol a Juan tu', caw chekbej Dios naon anima masanil, ẍi eb.

English: So they answered Jesus, “We don't know.” Then he said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb: —Man jojtakok, ẍi eb bay Jesús. —Ta caytu xin, maj c'apax wal ayex mac max ak'on wikbej, xan chi wun juntzan tzet yetal tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: “What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet tax ẍi e c'ul yuj jun abix ok waltek ti'? ẍi Jesús bay eb. Ay jun winak ay cawan is c'ajol. Max yalon bay nak babel winak axca ti': C'ajol, asi' mulnajil bay co mulnajil tinani', ẍi bay nak.

English: “ ‘I will not,’ he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.
Kanjobal: C'amak, c'am chin toji, ẍi nak bay is mam tu'. Palta junixtowal bek tu', max naon ba c'ul, cax max toji.

English: “Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but he did not go.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yalon cham mamej tu' bay nak tzunan unin, axcac'al max yut yalon bay nak babel. Inye mam, ok in tok, ẍi nak. Palta tokwal max toj pax nak.

English: “Which of the two did what his father wanted?” “The first,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, chin k'anlej ayex, ¿mac junok eb nak c'ajolej tu' max iken tzet max yal is mam tu'? ẍi Jesús bay eb. —A nak babel unin max yikej tzet max yal is mam tu', ẍi eb. Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, ta ok ex oc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan, babel ok oc eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al eb ix ajmul ix e satak.

English: For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Juan, cham ak'om bautismo max yal ayex tzet watx' che yut e watx'nen e beybal, palta maj e yaoc yin e c'ul tzet max yala'. Axa laj eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al eb ix ajmul ix max yaoc yin c'ul tzet max yala'. Caxc'al max e yil tzet max yut naon ba eb max na ba c'ul yin is yobtakil, palta maj e na e ba yetok eb, cax maj e yaoc yin e c'ul tzet max yal Juan tu'.

English: “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and went away on a journey.
Kanjobal: Acbajek e txiquin yin junxa abix ok waltek ti' xin: Ay jun winak max yaw uva bay sat jun is tx'otx', cax max corralneni. Max watx'nen jun olan bay ok teq'uil yal uva tu'. Max tz'akon c'apax aj jun ilbal uva xol tu'. Max lajwi tu xin, max yaoncantok jun is tx'otx' tu' yetokc'al yawojal majanil bay juntzan eb mulnajwom, cax max toj ec'jab bay junxa lugar najat.

English: When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ajapnok tiempoal wajlay el an, max chekontok juntzan is chekbej yuj toj chaon eb jantak yet cham t'inan yion bay eb nak max majanencan tu'.

English: “The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max apni oc eb chekbej xin, max michchaj oc eb yuj eb. Ay jun, ya' max ec' mak'lay yuj eb. Ay junxa xin, max camxac'al yuj eb. Axa junxa xin, tol max k'okch'ennej eb.

English: Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.
Kanjobal: Max chekontok cham aj tx'otx' tu' juntzanxa is chekbej. Tx'ial bey eb yintak eb babelal tu'. Palta ac'ala' max utlay eb.

English: Last of all, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian, axa jun is c'ajol max chektok: Ok xiw eb bay jun in c'ajol ti', ẍinaji.

English: “But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him and take his inheritance.’
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yilon eb nak mulnajwom tu' tol a nak c'ajolej tu' chi apni, max lajtinen el ba eb, cax max yalon eb: A yet ok cam mam nak ti', a' ok ioncan jun tx'otx' ti' satakok. Co mak'ek camok, yet watx' ayonxa chi ji'can jun tx'otx' ti', ẍi eb.

English: So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
Kanjobal: Xan asannejc'al max apni oc bay eb, max tzac'ontek eb, max jutxon el eb ti' mulnajil tu', ata tu' max yak' cam eb.

English: “Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
Kanjobal: ¿Tzettax ok utlay eb mulnajwom tu' yuj cham aj tx'otx' tu', yet ok jay cham che na'? ẍi bay eb yicham winakil conob tu'.

English: “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,” they replied, “and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.”
Kanjobal: —Ok yak' cam masanil juntzan anima yob tu', yet ok jayok, cax ok yaoncantok is tx'otx' tu' majanil junelxa, bay juntzanokxa mulnajwom tol yel wali, ok yak' jantak yet cham t'inan chi yi' yinc'al tiempoal, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal pax Jesús bay eb axca ti': —¿Tom c'amto bay che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, bay chi yal axca ti'? A ch'en ch'en max yintaknej el eb watx'nem na, a ch'en max oc yin jolom txiquin na. A jun ti' max yun Cham Jajawil cax chi c'ayaj co c'ul yuj, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: “Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan chi wal ayex, tol c'amxa e yalon e yet e yoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. Tx'okxa animail ok oc e q'uexelok. A ton eb tu' lajan axca eb ok ak'on yuca' tx'otx' tx'otx' axca wal is mojalil.

English: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”
Kanjobal: A mac chi telc'oji, cax chi ayc'ay yiban ch'en ch'en chi binaj cayti', chi k'ajtok; palta ta a ch'en ch'en ti' chi ayc'ay yiban junok mactxel xin, pokokxac'al chi yuncantok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus' parables, they knew he was talking about them.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb sat sacerdote yetok eb fariseo jun abix ti', max nachaj el yuj eb tol a eb chi al-layi.

English: They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max yochej eb max mitx'a'; palta chi xiw eb bay yet animail, yujtol a Jesús, chekbej ton Dios yul sat anima tu'.

English: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:
Kanjobal: Max yaltek Jesús junxa abix ti' bay eb axca ti':

English: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.
Kanjobal: Ok waltek ayex tzet chi yun yeloc eb anima chi oc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. Ay jun rey max yaoc k'inal jun is c'ajol yet max nupayi.

English: He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the banquet to tell them to come, but they refused to come.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al chail yich jun k'in tu', cax max chekontok eb is chekbej toj yawten eb awtebilxata'a. Palta maj jay eb t'inanc'alta' jay bay jun k'in tu'.

English: “Then he sent some more servants and said, ‘Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner: My oxen and fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max yalon bay juntzanxa is chekbej axca ti': Asek, al bay eb awtebilxac'alta' wuj tu', tol watx'xa yayji loj ok lo eb cayti'. Mayal wak' ak'lay cam jayc'on wacax, caw bak'ech. Caw watx'xa yayji masanil, xan as alek bay eb, tol chi tit eb yin aymanil bay jun nupayil ti', ẍi cham rey tu' bay eb.

English: “But they paid no attention and went off–one to his field, another to his business.
Kanjobal: Max toj eb chekbej tu' toj yaloni, palta majc'alta' yikej eb awtebil tu' jayi. Ay jun tol max toj yilcan yawoj bay is tx'otx'. Ay junxa max toj yilcan is negocio.

English: The rest seized his servants, mistreated them and killed them.
Kanjobal: Axa juntzanxa eb xin, max mitx'laycan eb chekbej cham rey tu' yuj eb, ya' max ec' eb yuj eb, masantac'al max yal cam eb.

English: The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben aj cham rey tu', caw wal max tit yowal cham. Yuj tu' xan max chektok cham juntzan eb is soldado, yuj yak'lay cam juntzan anima tu', cax max nislaycan tz'a conob eb.

English: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited did not deserve to come.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon cham bay juntzanxa eb is chekbej axca ti': Watx'xa yayji masanil tzet t'inan chi k'anabax yuj jun nupayil; palta a eb awtebil tu', man mojok eb jayi.

English: Go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, asek yulak calle. Jantakc'al mac che yil yin, che chektek bay jun k'in ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, both good and bad, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
Kanjobal: Max toj juntzanxa eb chekbej tu' yulak calle xin. Xiwil mac bay max yal eb. Aylaj eb yob, aylaj eb watx' max jayocok. Jun bek max noj jun na bay ayoc k'in tu'.

English: “But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok cham rey tu' yul na, yuj yilon eb max jay tu'. Axa max yilon cham tol ay jun winak c'am oc pichilej yet nupayil tu' yuj.

English: ‘Friend,’ he asked, ‘how did you get in here without wedding clothes?’ The man was speechless.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal cham bay: Ach amigo, ¿tzet yuj xan comonc'al chach octek bay k'inal nupayil ti'? Ilab tol c'am oc a pichil yet nupayil, ẍi cham bay. C'amxac'al tzet max yal nak.

English: “Then the king told the attendants, ‘Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham rey tu' bay juntzan eb is moso ayic' yetok bay tu': C'alek yakan jun winak ti', c'al is k'ab, cax che yion ajok, chi toj e k'okoncan eltok xol k'ekk'inal yina. A bay tu' ok ok'ok, cax ok natx'atx'ok ye yuj yail, ẍi cham.

English: “For many are invited, but few are chosen.”
Kanjobal: Chi yal elapnok jun abix ti', tol xiwil mac awtebil yuj Dios, palta jaywannej mac sic'bil elok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then the Pharisees went out and laid plans to trap him in his words.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian, max beson el ba eb fariseo tu'. Max naobtanen eb yin Jesús, yuj yak'len eb yikban yayc'ay Cham yuj junok tzet yetal chi yala', cax chi yak'on queja eb yaloni.

English: They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know you are a man of integrity and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You aren't swayed by men, because you pay no attention to who they are.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max chektok eb jaywan is cuywom bay Jesús, yetok jaywan eb is partido Herodes. Max bet yalon eb axca ti': —Meẍtol, jojtak sic'libil tol yelc'al chala'. Jojtak c'apaxok, tol yelc'al chot c'apax cuywaj a ba yin jun beybalej chi yochej Dios. Cax jun lajanc'al chot pax a c'ul yin anima, yujtol lajanc'al yelapnok eb yul a sat.

English: Tell us then, what is your opinion? Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet cachi ach ti'? A ch'en tumin chi k'anlay el ayon yuj cham yajaw bay Roma, ¿ay mi leyal chi jak'a', ma c'amak cha na'? ẍi eb bay.

English: But Jesus, knowing their evil intent, said, “You hypocrites, why are you trying to trap me?
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Jesús tol man watx'ok tzet lanan naon oc eb yin. Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Ayex ti' caw wal cabsat ex. ¿Tzet yuj xan che yak'lej in e yikban ayc'ayok?

English: Show me the coin used for paying the tax.” They brought him a denarius,
Kanjobal: Tx'oxek ch'en tumin chi ak'lay bay cham yajaw tu' ayin, ẍi bay eb. Axa tx'oxon eb jun denario ch'en tumin tu' bay.

English: and he asked them, “Whose portrait is this? And whose inscription?”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen bay eb tu': —¿Mac ay yechel sat ayoc yin ch'en ti'? ¿Mac ayoc is bi yin ch'en? ẍi bay eb.

English: “Caesar's,” they replied. Then he said to them, “Give to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's.”
Kanjobal: —A ton yechel cham yajaw bay Roma, c'al is bi cham, ẍi eb. —Ak'ek tzet yetal yetc'alta' cham yajaw tu' bay xin, axa tzet yetal yetc'alta' Dios, ak'ek c'apax bay, ẍi bay eb.

English: When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb juntzan tu', toc'al max c'ayaj c'ul eb. Axa yel eb c'atan Cham tu' cax max toj eb.

English: That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.
Kanjobal: Ac'aloc yet jun c'u tu', ay juntzan eb saduceo max apni oc bay Jesús. A eb chi aloni tol c'am chi ictzoj aj eb camnak. Yuj tu' max k'anlej eb bay Cham axca ti':

English: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses told us that if a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and have children for him.
Kanjobal: —Meẍtol, max yalcan Moisés yul tx'an Un max tz'ibejcan axca ti': Ta ay junok winak c'amto yuninal chi eli, cax chi cami, yowalil a junokxa yuẍtak chi ioncan aj yistzil nak camnakxa tu', cax chi el yuninal yetok ix, axca tu xin, chi yiil nak yinatil yuẍtak tu', ẍican Moisés.

English: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.
Kanjobal: A junel, a co xol on ti', ay ukwan winak yuẍtakc'al ba. Max oc yetbi nak babel winak, palta max camtok nak. C'am junok yuninal nak max elcanok. Axa nak tzunan yintak nak tu', a' max ioncan yistzil.

English: The same thing happened to the second and third brother, right on down to the seventh.
Kanjobal: Palta max campax nak uẍtakejal tu', ac'ala' c'am junok yuninal nak max elcanok. Ac'ala' caytu' max yun nak yet is yox, masantac'al max yal yilen eb nak yukwanil ix ix tu', ac'ala' max yun eb nak.

English: Finally, the woman died.
Kanjobal: Lajwi camtok eb nak yukwanil xin, axa cam c'apaxtok ix ix tu'.

English: Now then, at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since all of them were married to her?”
Kanjobal: A yet ok ictzoj aj eb camnak tu xin, ¿mactet junok eb nak ukwan ti' ay yistzil ix ix tu' sic'libil? Yujtol max yilejc'al eb nak ix yukwanil, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus replied, “You are in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb saduceo tu' axca ti': —Ayex ti' che yak' c'aytok e ba, yujtol man e yojtakok tzet ẍi tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Tamwal e yojtak c'apax jantak yipal Dios.

English: At the resurrection people will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet ok ictzoj aj eb camnak, tok okto yilej ba eb. Tok ayto mac ok yatok cutz'in alibejal, yujtol axcaxac'al eb ángel bay satcan caytu' ok yun eb.

English: But about the resurrection of the dead–have you not read what God said to you,
Kanjobal: Mantoc'al e yojtakok paxok, tol ok ictzoj pax aj eb camnak. ¿Tom c'amto che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok yuj tzet albilcan yuj Dios, bay chi yal axca ti':

English: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' is Diosal in Abraham, Isaac, c'al Jacob, ẍi canok. Yuj tu' xan jojtak tol maj c'ayil eb, yujtol max yalcan Dios tol is Diosal eb yayji?

English: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb anima juntzan ti', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb.

English: Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yaben eb fariseo tol maj je' paktzen eb saduceo bay Jesús, max wajban oc bulan ba eb yin.

English: One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:
Kanjobal: Ay jun xol eb tu' caw meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Max yochen max yikbaj ayc'ay Jesús, cax max tz'akonnaj k'anlej bay Cham axca ti':

English: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?”
Kanjobal: —Meẍtol, ¿mactet junok chekbanil yul ley Moisés ec'ban yelapnok yintak masanil? ẍi bay.

English: Jesus replied: “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús: —Camc'ulnejek Cham Jajawil co Diosal yin masanil e c'ul, c'al yin masanil e yanimail, c'al yin masanil e nabal, ẍi.

English: This is the first and greatest commandment.
Kanjobal: A ton jun chekbanil ti' ec'ban yelapnok yintak masanil.

English: And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
Kanjobal: Ay junxa chekbanilej txenxanej man lajanok yelapnok axca jun ti', tol chi yal axca ti': Che ya'ilnej e yet animail, axca che yut e ya'ilnen e ba junjun ex, ẍi.

English: All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”
Kanjobal: Ta chi jikej cab chekbanil ti', axca wal tol lanan jiken masanil chekbanil Dios, c'al masanil jantak tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb is chekbej, ẍi bay.

English: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
Kanjobal: Wajanto ec' eb fariseo tu', cax max k'anlen Jesús bay eb:

English: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” “The son of David,” they replied.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet che na' yin Cham Cristo? ¿Mac ay yinatil che na'? ẍi bay eb. —Yinatil David, ẍi jun bay.

English: He said to them, “How is it then that David, speaking by the Spirit, calls him ‘Lord’? For he says,
Kanjobal: —Palta a David tu', ak'bil yal yuj Yespíritu Dios tol a jun Cristo tu', Yajawil David yayji. Chi yal axca ti':

English: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
Kanjobal: Max yal Dios Jajawil bay Cham Wajawil axca ti': Ayan chotan bay in watx' k'ab ti', masantac'al ok wacan oc eb ajc'ul oc en yalan akan, ẍi Dios bay Cham Wajawil, ẍi David.

English: If then David calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
Kanjobal: Xan caytu' max yut yaloncan David, tol a Cham Cristo is Yajawil yala'. Yuj tu' txequel tol man asannejok tol yinatil David yayji Cham, ẍi bay eb.

English: No one could say a word in reply, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.
Kanjobal: C'am junok eb max je' paktzen tzet max yal Jesús. Yuj tu' xan yettaxc'al tu', c'am junok mactxel chi tec'baj ba k'anlen junokxa tzet yetal bay.

English: Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús bay eb anima, c'al bay eb is cuywom axca ti':

English: “The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.
Kanjobal: A eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés yetok eb fariseo, ay ton yopiso eb cuywaj yin ley Moisés.

English: So you must obey them and do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ikejek tzanc'al tzet chi yal eb, cax che beybalneni. Palta a beybal eb xin, man e beybalnej, yujtol a tzet chi yal eb, tok chi beybalnej eb.

English: They tie up heavy loads and put them on men's shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.
Kanjobal: A juntzan chekbanil chi yak' eb, lajan axca junok ikatz c'am chi lacchaj juj. Chi wajbaj eb, cax chi yak'on eb jika'; palta a eb xin, tok chi yochej eb chi oc lacan yin jabok. Caytu' chi yun yak'on eb jik juntzan chekbanil caw ya'.

English: “Everything they do is done for men to see: They make their phylacteries wide and the tassels on their garments long;
Kanjobal: A masanil tzet chi yun eb, asan yuj yil-lay yuj anima xan chi yun eb. Caw mimek patxjab juntzan tz'um bay tz'ibbil oc jabok k'anej co Mam Dios, chi yaoc eb yin is k'ab, c'al yin is nan sat. Chi yaon oc eb jokquiẍtak pichilej, jokquiẍtak is tilak.

English: they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;
