Kanjobal: A bay chi oc mimek loj, asan bay puch watx' chi ay chotan eb. Yetok c'apax bay nail is culto eb, asan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak chi ay chotan eb.

English: they love to be greeted in the marketplaces and to have men call them ‘Rabbi.’
Kanjobal: A yet chi ec' eb yulak calle, caw chi tzaloj eb yet chi yion ay ba anima bay eb. Caw chi tzaloj eb yet chi al-lay oc eb meẍtolal.

English: “But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have only one Master and you are all brothers.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti xin, manchak e cha' e yal-lay oc meẍtolal, yujtol junnej e meẍtol, a ton Cristo, tol ayin toni. Axa ayex xin, e yuẍtak e ba, e yanab e ba e masanil.

English: And do not call anyone on earth ‘father,’ for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mactxel bay yulyibank'inal ti' chi je' comonc'al che yaloc e mamok. Yujtol junnej e Mam, a ton Cham ay bay satcan.

English: Nor are you to be called ‘teacher,’ for you have one Teacher, the Christ.
Kanjobal: Manchakokab ex al-lay yajawil, yujtol junnej e Yajawil, a ton Cristo, tol ayin toni.

English: The greatest among you will be your servant.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac bekanc'al c'ul yoc mosejal e xol, a ton jun tu' yelxac'al miman yelapnok.

English: For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi yiaj can ba, ok utlay yin yaynakilal, axa eb chi yi aytek ba, a ton eb tu' ok ilay can.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven in men's faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.
Kanjobal: Axa ayex meẍtol ex yin ley Moisés ti xin, yetok ex ayex fariseo ex ti', caw ok'bal ex c'ul. Cabsat ex. Ilab che tenoc wanaj anima yoc yul k'ab Dios. Maj ex oc ayex ti', tamwal che cha' c'apax oc eb chi yochej chi oqui.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are.
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al ex fariseo, caw ok'bal ex c'ul. Cabsat ex. Pilan che yoymanej yulyibank'inal yetoklaj a' mar, yuj ec' e monten oc junok mactxel e yetok yin e religión. A eb che yak' ganar yoc tu', toc'al chi etax el nabal eb e yuj. Yuj tu xin, moj ec'ban yailal eb chi yi' e yintak.

English: “Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gold of the temple, he is bound by his oath.’
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', lajan ex axca junok mactxel c'am chi je' yilwi, chito wal tz'ak quetz junokxa mactxel. Caw ok'bal ex c'ul, yujtol che yal axca ti': Ta ay junok mactxel chi loctek bi templo Dios yet chi yak'on is ti', man wal yowalilok chi yun is ti tu'. Palta ta a bi ch'en oro bay templo Dios chi loctek xin, yowalil chi yak' yun tzet max yal tu xin, quex chi.

English: You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, caw c'am e nabal. Axca wal tol c'am chi je' e yilwi jabok. ¿Baytet ay junok yel miman yelapnok che na'? ¿A mi ch'en oro tu' tx'oklil, ma a templo Dios tu'? A ch'en oro tu', asan yujtol yet is templo Dios ch'en, yuj tu' xan yet Dios ta' yayji.

English: You also say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but if anyone swears by the gift on it, he is bound by his oath.’
Kanjobal: Che yalon c'apax axca ti': Ta ay junok mac chi loctek bi altar, bay chi ajtok xajanbal yet chi yak'on is ti', man yowalilok chi yun is ti tu'. Palta ta a xajanbal batxan ajtok yiban tu' chi loctek is bi, yowalil chi yak' yun tzet max yal tu xin, quex chi.

English: You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, caw c'am e nabal. Axca wal tol c'am chi je' e yilwi jabok. ¿Baytet ay jun yel miman yelapnok che na'? ¿A mi xajanbal tu', ma a jun altar bay chi ajtok batxan tu'? A jun xajanbal tu', yujtol ayxa ajtok yiban altar tu', xan yet-xa Dios yayji.

English: Therefore, he who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ta ay mac chi loctek bi jun altar bay chi ajtok xajanbal tu', man asannejok jun tu' lanan locontek bi. Palta lanan locontek bi masanil tzet batxan ajtok yiban c'apaxok.

English: And he who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' mac chi loctek bi templo Dios, man asannejok templo tu' lanan locontek bi; palta lanan c'apax locontek bi Cham cajan bay tu'.

English: And he who swears by heaven swears by God's throne and by the one who sits on it.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi loctek bi satcan, chi yal elapnok tol lanan locontek bi is despacho co Mam Dios, lanan locontek c'apax bi Dios, yujtol a bay satcan tu' ayic'ok.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices–mint, dill and cummin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law–justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al ex fariseo, caw ok'bal ex c'ul. Cabsat ex. Che yak'naj is diezmoal an alawen, an aniẍ, c'al an comino, palta juntzan chekbanil Dios miman yelapnok, tok che yikej, a ton wal juntzan chekbanil chi aloni, tol yowalil watx'okab chi jut co ba, chi ok' co c'ul yin jet animail, cax chi jun tzet chi jala'. Palta ilab c'am yelapnok juntzan ti' yul e sat. Matawal tol che yikej juntzan ti', cax che yiken pax juntzanxa tu'.

English: You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', lajan ex axca junok mac c'am chi je' yilwi, cax chito wal tz'ak quetz junokxa mactxel. Lajan ex axca junok mactxel chi yi ajtek junok us chi tojc'ay xol yuc'a', axa junok camello chi turaytok.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés c'al ex fariseo, caw ok'bal ex c'ul. Cabsat ex. Ayex ti' lajan ex axca junok mactxel asan yin vaso, c'al yin plato chi tx'ajilok, palta yul, caw wal tz'iltak. Axca ton tu' ayex ti', caw wal watx'xac'al che yut e ba satak anima; palta axa yin ewantakil xin, toxac'al chex oc beyomal yuj e yetnen anima yuj e yak'on yochwan e pek'al.

English: Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.
Kanjobal: Ayex fariseo ex ti', axca wal tol c'am chi je' e yilon jabok. Watx'nejek oc e nabal yin babelal, catatu' watx' ex c'apax satak anima.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of dead men's bones and everything unclean.
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al ex fariseo, ok'bal ex c'ul. Caw cabsat ex. Lajan ex wal axca junok nichoal camnak watx' yili, sak tx'ijinakxac'al. Palta a yul, nojnak el yuj bakil camnak, c'al yuj tzet man watx'ok.

English: In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
Kanjobal: Cayex wal ton tu xin, yujtol a yul sat eb anima, watx'naj che yut e ba; palta caw cabsat ex yul e c'ul, cax caw ay e yobtakil.

English: “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.
Kanjobal: Ex meẍtol yin ley Moisés c'al ex fariseo, ok'bal ex c'ul. Caw wal cabsat ex. Ayex ti', che watx'nej aj mukbanil eb chekbej Dios, cax che watx'nen oc yelbubal is mukbanil eb watx' nabal tu'.

English: And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our forefathers, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
Kanjobal: Cax che yalon paxok: K'inalok ta ayonxa ec' yet max ec' eb jichmam yet payxa tu', maj on mi colwaj yetok eb, yin co mak'on cam juntzan eb chekbej Dios, quex chi.

English: So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet che yalon axca tu', che tx'oxk'abnej elok tol yinatil ex eb max mak'on cam eb chekbej Dios tu'.

English: Fill up, then, the measure of the sin of your forefathers!
Kanjobal: A tzet max chail yich eb e yichmam tu' yunen xin, a lanan e lajonxac'al canok.

English: “You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', caw jelan ex yin yobtakil axca junok labaj. ¿Tzet wal ok e yut e colon el e ba yul k'ab yailal bay infierno?

English: Therefore I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.
Kanjobal: Abek. Ok in chektok juntzan eb chekbej Dios ayex, c'al juntzan eb jelan yin yet Dios, yetok juntzan eb meẍtol. Ay eb ok e yak' camok, ok e curusnej eb. Ay eb, tol ok e mak' yulak nail bay che yak' culto. Ok e yuktej ec' eb bay conoblak.

English: And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a is camichal masanil eb anima watx'c'al max yut ba, tol mak'bil camok, a' ok alay oc e mulok, chi chail yich yin is camichal Abel, nak watx' is beybal, masantac'al yin is camichal Zacarías, c'ajol Berequías, a ton mak'bil cam bay yamak'il templo Dios, nan xol templo yetok altar.

English: I tell you the truth, all this will come upon this generation.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol a camichal masanil eb tu', a' ok oc e mulok mac ex ayex ec' ti' tinani'.

English: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing.
Kanjobal: ¡Ay…, a wal ayex ti' ex aj Jerusalén! ¡Che mak' wal cam eb chekbej Dios, axa juntzanxa eb chekbiltek yuj Cham e nan e xol, che k'okch'ennej eb! Xiwil el max wochej max quex wawtejtek ayin, axca junok no caẍlan chi k'uttejtek yune', cax chi mojoni, palta maj yal e c'ul.

English: Look, your house is left to you desolate.
Kanjobal: Abek, a jun e templo ti', ok tz'ink'oj canok.

English: For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”
Kanjobal: Chi wal ayex tol c'amxa bay ok e yil win, masantac'al yet ok e yalon axca ti': Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil, quex chi, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Jesus left the temple and was walking away when his disciples came up to him to call his attention to its buildings.
Kanjobal: Max eltek Jesús yul templo Dios xin. Lananxa wal toji, max jitzonxac'altek ba eb cuywom c'atan. Max c'oli tx'oxon oc eb nalakil templo Dios bay.

English: “Do you see all these things?” he asked. “I tell you the truth, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Cham bay eb axca ti': —Ayex ti' che yil juntzan na ti', palta wal yel chi wal ayex, a masanil juntzan ch'en latz'bil aj ti', c'amxa junok ok cancan yiban yet ch'enal. Pilan ok ec' bulnajok, ẍi bay eb.

English: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max toj bay jun tzalan chi yik Olivo, axa yay chotan tu'. Max apni oc eb is cuywom bay, cax max k'anlen eb bay: —Chi jochej chal ayon, ¿bak'in wal ok jay jun max al ayon tu'? ¿Tzet yechelej ok tx'ox Dios, yet jabxanej a jayi, yetok c'apax yet ok lajwok jun tiempoal ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered: “Watch out that no one deceives you.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Caw aj nabal che yut e ba, yet watx' c'am junok mactxel ok ion aytek e sat.

English: For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Christ, ’ and will deceive many.
Kanjobal: Yujtol xiwil mac ok banoc in bi yiban, cax ok yalon eb axca ti': Ayin ton Cristo in, ẍi eb, ok tz'ak yalon eb. Xiwil anima ok yiaytek eb sat.

English: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
Kanjobal: Ok e yab yoc mimek owal. Ok e yab k'umal juntzanxa owal ijan chi oqui. Palta manchak ex xiwi, yujtol yowalil ok yunc'alta' juntzan tu'; asan xin, mantonak lajubal tu'.

English: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
Kanjobal: Ay wal juntzan mimek conob ok yak'lej owal yetok yet mimek conobal. Ok yak'lej eb yajaw owal yetok yet yajawil. Ok jay mimek wajil. Xiwil bay ok ec' quixcab.

English: All these are the beginning of birth pains.
Kanjobal: Palta a juntzan tu', yichbanil yatakilixtoc'al. Ay wal juntzanxa ok jayok.

English: “Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', ok ex ilaytok satak eb yajaw, cax ok e yilon yailal yuj eb; ok ex yak' cam eb. Masanilxanej anima ok chichon oc c'ul e yin wujc'al.

English: At that time many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other,
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', xiwil mactxel ok meltzoj pax yintak junelxa. Ok yajc'ulnej ba eb, ok yak'lej cam ba eb.

English: and many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.
Kanjobal: Xiwil mac ok yaloc ba chekbejok Dios. Yuj tu' xan xiwil mac ok yetnej eb.

English: Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,
Kanjobal: Ok aj can anima yin yobtakil; yuj tu', tok okto camc'ulnelej ba eb.

English: but he who stands firm to the end will be saved.
Kanjobal: A mac tec'an ok yut ba masantac'al lajub, a ton eb tu' ok colchajok.

English: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.
Kanjobal: Axa jun watx' abix chi alon tzet ok yun yoc eb anima yul k'ab Cham aj satcan, yowalil ok al-laycan el bay masanil yulyibank'inal ti', yet watx' chi ablay bay junjun conob. Catatu' bian ok jay lajubal.

English: “So when you see standing in the holy place ‘the abomination that causes desolation,’ spoken of through the prophet Daniel–let the reader understand–
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun mac yajbil el yuj Dios, tol ok yetnej el juntzan tzet yetal. A cham Daniel, chekbej Dios yet payxa, a' alnejcan jun tu'. A mac chi ilon jun abix tu', nachajokab el yuj. A yet ok oc jun mactxel tu' yul templo Dios,

English: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
Kanjobal: a mac ayic' bay Judea, tokokab eb c'ubaj el ba bay tzalanlak.

English: Let no one on the roof of his house go down to take anything out of the house.
Kanjobal: Axa mac ayajtok yiban pananil is na, yet ok oc elilal tu', manchakxa aytek yuj ul yionto wal eltek jabokxa tzet yetal yul na.

English: Let no one in the field go back to get his cloak.
Kanjobal: Yetok eb ayic' xol is mulnajil, manchakxaokab meltzoj yintak toj yion is jokan pichil.

English: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ok'bal c'ul eb ix yob ix, yetok eb ayto yune' chi yak' txutxwok.

English: Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.
Kanjobal: Tewanek bay Dios tol manokab nabil k'inalok yet ok ex el tu', tamwal yet c'ual xewilalokab c'apaxok.

English: For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now–and never to be equaled again.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun miman yailal ok jay yet jun tiempoal tu', c'amto bay max ec' junelok axca tu' yecheltaxc'al max watx'nej Dios yulyibank'inal ti'. Tamwal ayto bay ok ec' junokxa axca tu'.

English: If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi c'otxbaj Cham tiempoal yailal tu', c'am junok mactxel ok colchajcan el yul k'ab camich. Palta yujc'al is camc'ulal Cham yin eb sic'bilxa el yuj, xan ok c'otxbanej.

English: At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘There he is!’ do not believe it.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi alon ayex axca ti': Ilek wali, tix Cham Cristo ayic' cayti', ma: Ilek wali, tix ayic' bay tu', ta ẍi e yutelayi, man e cha e yabej.

English: For false Christs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and miracles to deceive even the elect–if that were possible.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay juntzan eb ok tz'ak yaloc ba Cristoal ok tx'oxaj ba, c'al juntzan eb ok tz'ak yaloc ba chekbejok Dios. Ok tz'ak tx'ox eb yechelej, c'al milagro, yuj yion aytek sat eb anima. Toltax a eb sic'bilxa el yuj Dios ijanxac'al ok ayc'ay eb yuj eb.

English: See, I have told you ahead of time.
Kanjobal: Ayokto, cax chi waloncan juntzan ti' ayex.

English: “So if anyone tells you, ‘There he is, out in the desert,’ do not go out; or, ‘Here he is, in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ta ay eb ok alon axca ti' ayex: Ilabi, ayic' Cristo bay tz'inan tx'otx', ta ẍi eb, c'am chi toj e yila'. Ta ay eb chi alon pax axca ti': Ilabi, ayic' bay jun na tu', ta ẍi eb, man e cha e yabej.

English: For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Yujtol axq'uijan wal junok rayo pilan chi txecloj yuj bay masanil yulyibank'inal ti', chi txecloj bay chi ajol c'u, c'al bay chi tojcan c'u, caytu' ok yun txecloj in jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al bay telancan ay is mimanil junok camnak, a tu' chi waj ba no ostoc.

English: “Immediately after the distress of those days “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’
Kanjobal: A yet ok lajwok ec' jun miman yailal tu', ok k'ekk'olil yakan c'u, c'amxa c'apax sakk'inal xajaw. Axa waycan ok titc'ay satcan. Yetok juntzan tzet ay is yipalil bay satcan, ok tzicobtanelayok.

English: “At that time the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and all the nations of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky, with power and great glory.
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian, cax ok txecloj aj jun yechel bay satcan, yin tx'oxoni tol ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', in jayi. Axa anima bay junjun conob bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok ok' eb yet ok yilon eb in jay xol asun, yin miman wikbej c'al in mayk'ak'al.

English: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.
Kanjobal: Ok xulay ch'en trompeta yin caw ipejal, axa in chekon eb wángel tu' cax ok ec' wajon aj eb eb sic'bil el wuj bay masanil yulyibank'inal ti'. Ok ec' ilay aj eb, masantac'al bay chi lajwi yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
Kanjobal: Abek jun abix ok waltek yuj te higo. A yet chi uninbi k'ablak te', yet lananxa tit xak te', e yojtakxa tol toxa chi oc nabilk'inal.

English: Even so, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.
Kanjobal: Xan a yet ok e yilon yunen juntzan ti', nachajokab el e yuj, tol toxa chin jayi.

English: I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, mantoc'al cam anima ayic' yet jun tiempoal ti', cax ok yunen masanil juntzan chi wal ti'.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
Kanjobal: A satcan ti', c'al yulyibank'inal ti' ok lajwok; palta a in k'anej, maj ec' tzet chi yala'.

English: “No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am mac ojtaknej tzet c'ual, c'al jantak hora ok in jayok. Eb ángel bay satcan, man yojtakok eb. Ayin ti' C'ajol in Dios, palta man wojtakok, asan Cham Dios Mamej yojtak.

English: As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Axca tzet max uj yet jun tiempoal yet max ec' cham Noé, caytu' ok yun yet jun tiempoal yet ok in jay ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet c'amto chi jay jun miman aej mukwajwom tu', tok ay tzet chi na' anima; chi low eb, chi yuq'uen a' eb, laj yilen ba eb, c'al yaontok eb cutz'in alibejal, masantac'al yet jun c'u yet max octok cham Noé yul te arca.

English: and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
Kanjobal: Maj nachaj el jabok yuj eb, masantac'al max jay jun aej mukwajwom tu', cax max cam eb masanil. Axca wal max yun eb yet jun tiempoal tu', caytu' ok yun anima yet ok in jay tzac'naj ayin ti'.

English: Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay c'apax cawanok winak junej chi mulnaji, ay jun ok ilaytok, ay jun ok canok.

English: Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay cawanok ix lanan cawni, jun ok ilaytok, jun ok canok.

English: “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', makwajanek, yujtol man e yojtakok jantak hora ok in jay ayin Yajaw in ti'.

English: But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok cham aj na tinani', ta yojtak jantak ak'bal chi jay junok elk'om, caw wal makbil yuj, cax c'am chi cha oc elk'om yul yatut.

English: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, makwajanek, yujtol a yet man naanok el in jayubal e yuj, cax ok in jay lemnaj ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok patrón yetok is moso. Ay junok yikem, jun ay is nabal, a ton jun tu' ok yaoc yopiso yin yilomalok yatut, yetok masanil tzet ay bay; palta ¿mactxel jun yikem tu' che na'?

English: It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.
Kanjobal: A ton jun lanan mulnaj axca wal chi yochej cham patrón tu' yet ok jay junelxa. Caw watx' yet jun tu'.

English: I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, ok yaoc cham yin yajawil yiban masanil tzet ay cham.

English: But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’
Kanjobal: Palta ta a jun moso tu' yob is nabal, chi na' tol maj jay cham patronej tu' yin aymanil,

English: and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.
Kanjobal: yuj tu' chi c'oli michchaj oc yet mosejal mak'oni, chi ec' low yetok eb uq'uem an, cax chi uc'wi an yetok eb.

English: The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.
Kanjobal: A yet man naanok jay is patrón tu' yuj, a ton yet tu' ok jayok.

English: He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
Kanjobal: Axa yaon oc cham miman yailal yiban tu'. Ok yacantok cham yetok eb yet cabsatil. A bay tu' ok ok'ok, c'al natx'atx'i ye yuj yail.

English: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
Kanjobal: Ok wal ayex, tzet ok yun yeloc eb anima, yet ok yak'on Cham aj satcan Yajawilal: A junel, ay lajonwan k'opoj ix. Max toj eb bay jun nupayil yet ak'balil, max yiontok eb is candil. Max bet eb chaon jay nak ok nupay tu'.

English: Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
Kanjobal: Ay owan eb ix c'am wal is nabal, axa owanxa eb ix xin, aj nabal eb.

English: The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.
Kanjobal: A eb c'am wal nabal tu', c'amxa yaceite eb max yitok, asanc'al ch'an jab ayay yul is candil eb tu'.

English: The wise, however, took oil in jars along with their lamps.
Kanjobal: Axa pax eb ix jelan tu xin, maxto yi c'apaxtok eb ix yaceite yulak net.

English: The bridegroom was a long time in coming, and they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
Kanjobal: A nak ok nupay tu', caw max ec' hora jay nak. Yuj tu', max titaj wayan eb ix, axa wayaj eb ix masanil tu'.

English: “At midnight the cry rang out: ‘Here's the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’
Kanjobal: Palta chuman wal ak'bal, ay jun mac max awji bay eb: Ti wal chi jay nak ok nupayok. Asek chaek nak, ẍi bay eb ix.

English: “Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan eb ix tu', max yaon oc eb ix k'ak'al candil.

English: The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb ix c'am is nabal tu' bay eb ix jelan axca ti': Ak'ek jabok jaceite e yetok co k'ana'. Ti wal chi tan co candil ti', ẍi eb bay eb.

English: “ ‘No,’ they replied, ‘there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
Kanjobal: Maj jak'a'. Tatol chi jak' jabok e yet, maj mi yab jet, cax maj c'apax yab e yet. Asek e man jabok e yet bay chi txonlayi, ẍi pax eb ix.

English: “But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the bridegroom arrived. The virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max toj eb ix man jabok yet. Ay wal tok eb, max jaycan oc nak ok nupay tu'. A eb ix watx' yayji yetok is candil, max octok eb yetok nak bay nupayil tu', cax max makaycan puerta.

English: “Later the others also came. ‘Sir! Sir!’ they said. ‘Open the door for us!’
Kanjobal: Axa yet max jayoc eb ix c'am wal is nabal tu', maxto awji octok eb: ¡Mamin, Mamin, jakon octok! ẍitowal eb.

English: “But he replied, ‘I tell you the truth, I don't know you.’
Kanjobal: Palta max yalon eltek cham bay eb: C'amak. Wal yel chi wal ayex, man ex wojtakok, ẍi eltek cham bay eb.

English: “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', chi wal ayex, makwajanek yujtol man e yojtakok tzet c'ual, c'al jantak hora ok in jayok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: “Again, it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted his property to them.
Kanjobal: Ok wal ayex, tzet ok yun yeloc eb anima, yet ok yak'on Cham aj satcan Yajawil. A junel, ay jun winak max toj bay junxa conob caw najat. A yet toxa wal chi toji, max yawtentek eb is moso c'atan, max yak'oncan juntzan is tumin yul k'ab eb.

English: To one he gave five talents of money, to another two talents, and to another one talent, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.
Kanjobal: Ay jun nak bay max yak'can oyeb talento. Ay jun nak bay max yak'can cab talento. Ay jun nak bay max yak'can jun talento, atac'ala' bak'satil junjun max yilocok. Max lajwi tu xin, axa toj tu'.

English: The man who had received the five talents went at once and put his money to work and gained five more.
Kanjobal: A nak mosejal max chaoncan ch'en oyeb talento tu', max yak' nak negocio yetok ch'en. Max yion nak oyebxa talento yetok ch'en.

English: So also, the one with the two talents gained two more.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax nak max chaon ch'en cab talento, max yi c'apax nak cabxa talento yetok ch'en.

English: But the man who had received the one talent went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.
Kanjobal: Palta nak max chaon ch'en jun talento, max jot nak jun olan, cax max mukon nak ch'en.

English: “After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.
Kanjobal: Payxatax tu', catatu' max jay cham is patrón eb tu', axa yion cham cuenta yetok eb yin ch'en tumin tu' yin junjunal.

English: The man who had received the five talents brought the other five. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with five talents. See, I have gained five more.’
Kanjobal: A nak chanejcan ch'en oyeb talento tu', a nak babel max jay satak cham. Axa yak'oncan nak ch'en oyeb talento max yi yetok ch'en tu'. Max yalon nak bay is patrón tu' axca ti': Mamin, max ak'can oyeb talento ch'en tumin ti' ayin; palta tinani' xin, tix pax oyeb talento yune' ch'en max wi' ti', ẍi nak.

English: “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham patrón tu' bay nak axca ti': Watx' xin, caw watx' max ot mulnaj a ba ayin. Max ekej axca wal chi wochej. Yujtol yikem ach yin jab ti', yuj tu', xiwiltoc'al tzet ok wak' ayach, xan ak' tzaloj a c'ul wetok, ẍi cham bay nak mosejal tu'.

English: “The man with the two talents also came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with two talents; see, I have gained two more.’
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max jayoc nak chanejcan ch'en cab talento. Max yalon nak bay is patrón tu' axca ti': Mamin, max ak'can cab talento ch'en a tumin ti' ayin; palta tinani xin, tix pax cab talento yune' ch'en max wi' ti', ẍi nak.

English: “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham patronej tu' bay nak axca ti': Watx' xin, caw watx' max ot mulnaj a ba ayin. Max ekej axca wal chi wochej. Yujtol yikem ach yin jab ti', yuj tu', xiwiltoc'al tzet ok wak' ayach, xan ak' tzaloj a c'ul wetok, ẍi cham bay junxa is moso tu'.

English: “Then the man who had received the one talent came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max jayoc nak chanejcan ch'en jun talento satak cham xin, max yalon nak bay cham axca ti': Patrón, wojtak tol ch'aan ach. Cha jatx' tzet man awbilok oj. Toxac'al cha cha' tzet chi yi' junokxa anima yin is mulnajil.

English: So I was afraid and went out and hid your talent in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max in xiwaj ayach, max in mukon ch'en a tumin ti' yul tx'otx'. Tix ch'en a tumin ti' masanil xin, ẍi nak.

English: “His master replied, ‘You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham patrón tu' bay nak axca ti': Ach ti', mosejal achnaj yalbanil, palta c'am a watx'il. Caw isaj ach. Tutun tol ojtakxa tol chin jatx' bay tzet man awbilok wuj, cax chin chaon tzet chi yi' junokxa anima.

English: Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, matawal tol max atok ch'en in tumin ti' majanil, cax chin chaon pax ch'en yetok yune' yet chin jay ti', ẍi cham bay nak mosejal tu'.

English: “ ‘Take the talent from him and give it to the one who has the ten talents.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Cham bay juntzan eb ayic' bay tu': Iek ec' ch'en talento tu' bay nak. Ak'ek ch'en bay nak ay lajoneb talento yet tu'.

English: For everyone who has will be given more, and he will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a mac ay yet, ok ak'lay tz'akil bay, yet watx' chi aj can bay. Axa eb c'am wal yet, a jabok yet eb ayta'a, ok ilay ec' bay eb.

English: And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
Kanjobal: Axa nak mosejal c'am yopiso ti', chi toj e k'okcan eltok nak xol k'ekk'inal yina, bay ok ok'ok, c'al natx'atx'i ye yaben yail, ẍi Cham.

English: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his throne in heavenly glory.
Kanjobal: Ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in jay yetok eb wángel masanil, yetok in miman mayk'ak'al. Axa way chotan bay in despacho tu'. Catatu' ok txecloj elok tol caw miman welapnok.

English: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
Kanjobal: Masanil anima bay junjun conoblak ok jayoc eb in satak. Axca junok nak ilom calnel chi pojil no calnel xol no chiwo, caytu' ok wut in pojon nan eb.

English: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
Kanjobal: A eb axca tol in calnel yayji, ok can eb bay in watx' k'ab. Axa eb axca chiwo yayji, ok can eb bay in q'uexan.

English: “Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.
Kanjobal: Ayin rey in ti', ok wal bay eb ayic' bay in watx' k'ab axca ti': Ayex ti', albilcan ayex yuj in Mam, tol ok yak' is watx'c'ulal ayex. Ocanek wetok bay ok wak' yajawilal. Atax yet max watx'nen Dios yulyibank'inal ti', max watx'nencan jun ti' e yuj.

English: For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet max tit in wajil, max in e yak' lowok. Max tit in takintial, max e yak'on tzet max wuq'uej. Max in ec'lej k'anoj posada, max e yak'on in posada bay e na.

English: I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.’
Kanjobal: Yet c'am in pichil, max e yak'on in pichil; yet ya' in ay, max quin ec' e yiloni. A yet ayin oc preso, max quin bet e yiloctok, quin chi, ok walon bay eb.

English: “Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
Kanjobal: Axa eb watx' beybal satak Dios tu', ok tak'wok eb ayin axca ti': Mamin, ¿bak'ini wal ay a wajil max jila', c'al a takintial tu'? Tok ay tzet max jak' ayach.

English: When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?
Kanjobal: ¿Bak'ini wal max jilon ec' k'anoj posada tilak na, cax max jak'on a posada tu'? ¿Bak'ini wal c'amxa a pichil, cax max jak'on a pichil tu'?

English: When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?’
Kanjobal: ¿Bak'ini wal ya' ach ay, ma bak'ini wal ayach oc preso, cax max ach bet jiloni? ẍi eb ayin.

English: “The King will reply, ‘I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.’
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian, ok walon bay eb axca ti': Wal yel chi wal ayex, a yet max e yak'on juntzan watx'c'ulal ti' bay eb wuẍtak c'al bay eb wanab, caxc'al bay eb c'am yelapnok, palta chi yal elapnok tol a ayin max e yunej, quin chi, ok walon bay eb.

English: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok tu xin, cax ok walon bay eb ayic' bay in q'uexan: Elanek ayex ti' in c'atan, tol catabnebil ex. Asek can xol jun k'ak' c'am bak'in chi tani, bay jun lugar watx'nebilcan yuj Dios, bay ok tokcan nak diablo yetok eb yángel.

English: For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet max tit in wajil, maj in e yak' low jabok. Yet max tit in takintial, maj e yak' jabok tzet max wuq'uej.

English: I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.’
Kanjobal: Max in ec'lej k'anoj posada, maj e yak' in posada. A yet c'am in pichil, c'am jabok in pichil max e yak'a'. Yetok c'apax yet ya' in ay, c'al yet ayin oc preso, maj in bet e yil jabok, quin chi, ok walon bay eb.

English: “They also will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?’
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb ayin axca ti': Mamin, ¿bak'ini wal ay a wajil max jila' ma a takintial tu', yetok yet max ach ec' k'anoj posada, c'al yet c'am a pichil, c'al yet ya' ach ay tu', c'al yet preso ayji? ¿Tom ay bay maj on colwaj ayach xin? ẍi eb ayin.

English: “He will reply, ‘I tell you the truth, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.’
Kanjobal: Palta ok wal bay eb axca ti': Wal yel chi wal ayex, a yet maj ex colwaj bay eb wuẍtak tu', c'al bay eb wanab tu', caxc'al c'am yelapnok eb, palta chi yal elapnok tol a' ayin maj ex colwajok, quin chi, ok walon bay eb.

English: “Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.”
Kanjobal: A eb tu', ok tok eb bay yailal yin tojbalk'inal, axa eb watx' is beybal satak Dios xin, ok cha eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi yalon Jesús juntzan ti', max yalon axca ti' bay eb is cuywom:

English: “As you know, the Passover is two days away–and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
Kanjobal: —E yojtakxa tol cabejxac'al chi oc co Pascua. Ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', a ton yet tu' ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb ok in aon oc yin te curus, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajawil sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb yicham winakil conob, max wajbaj ba eb bay yamak'il yatut Caifás, cham sat sacerdote.

English: and they plotted to arrest Jesus in some sly way and kill him.
Kanjobal: Max lajtinej ba eb yin tzet ok yun mitx'on eb Jesús yin ewantakil, cax ok yak'on cam eb.

English: “But not during the Feast,” they said, “or there may be a riot among the people.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Maj je' co mitx'on yul k'in, yujtol ay is may ok tit yowal eb anima jin yuj, ẍi eb.

English: While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of a man known as Simon the Leper,
Kanjobal: Max apni Jesús bay conob Betania, cax max apni oc bay yatut Simón, cham ec'nak lepra yin.

English: a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.
Kanjobal: Chotan wal ay Jesús lowi, max jayoc jun ix ix bay. Yetbi oc ix jun ch'en net alabastro. Nojnak ch'en yetok jun ambal suk'uk'i jab caw can is tojol. Max secon ajtok ix yin jolom Jesús.

English: When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. “Why this waste?” they asked.
Kanjobal: Axa max yilon eb is cuywom jun tu', max tit yowal eb yin ix. Cax max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan nabac'al chi etax el jun ti'?

English: “This perfume could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor.”
Kanjobal: A jun ambal suk'uk'i jab ti', caw can tojol. Matawal tol max txonlay elok, cax max pojlaytok tojol xol eb meba', ẍi eb.

English: Aware of this, Jesus said to them, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús juntzan tu', max yalon bay eb: —¿Tzet yuj xan che tx'em cus c'ul jun ix ti'? A jun max yun ix ayin ti', caw watx'.

English: The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have me.
Kanjobal: A eb meba' che yal tu', ayc'al ec' eb e yetok; palta ayin ti', c'am inc'al ec' e yetok.

English: When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
Kanjobal: Ayokto max yaon oc ix jun suk'uk'i jab ti' yin in mimanil, yet watx' watx'xa wayji, cax ok in muklayok.

English: I tell you the truth, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tzanc'al bay ok al-lay el k'anejal yet colbanilej bay yulyibank'inal ti', ok al-lay c'apax el yabixal tzet max yun ix ix ti', cax ok nalaytek ix, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then one of the Twelve–the one called Judas Iscariot–went to the chief priests
Kanjobal: A nak chi yik Judas Iscariote, nak ayoc tz'akilok eb lajcawan cuywom Jesús, a' max bet k'anjab yetok eb yajawil eb sacerdote.

English: and asked, “What are you willing to give me if I hand him over to you?” So they counted out for him thirty silver coins.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ta chi waoc Jesús yul e k'ab, ¿jantak chin e tojlanej? ẍi bay eb. Max yak'on eb 30 tumin plata bay.

English: From then on Judas watched for an opportunity to hand him over.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a yet jun c'u tu', max chaxac'al el yich sayoni, tzetbil ok yun yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb.

English: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
Kanjobal: A yet babel c'ual jun k'in yet chi lolay ixim pan c'am yich, max apni oc eb cuywom bay Jesús, cax max k'anlen eb bay: —¿Baytal chochej chi co watx'nej bay ok on lowok, yuj co naontek k'in Pascua ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says: My appointed time is near. I am going to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.’ ”
Kanjobal: —Asek bay conob. Chex toj bay yatut jun winak, cax che yalon bay axca ti': Chi yal Cham co meẍtol on, tolab txenxanej tiempoal ayic'ok. Yuj tu' xan a ab bay atut ti' ok low jetok ayon is cuywom on ti', yuj co naontek k'in Pascua yetok. Caytu' che yut e yalon bay nak, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max toj eb cuywom tu', axca max yun yal-lay bay eb tu' yuj. Max watx'nen eb tzet ok chi eb yet Pascua tu'.

English: When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.
Kanjobal: Yet max k'ekbi ay xin, max ay chotan Jesús low yetok eb is cuywom tu'.

English: And while they were eating, he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan low yetok eb, max yalon axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, axc'a oc co xol ti' ay jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich, ẍi bay eb.

English: They were very sad and began to say to him one after the other, “Surely not I, Lord?”
Kanjobal: Caw wal max cusaj eb yet max yaben eb jun tu'; xan junjun eb max k'anlej yab bay: —Mamin, ¿mayin mi nak ayin ti'? ẍi eb yin junjunal bay.

English: Jesus replied, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —A junok mac junnej max yun yaon ay k'ab wetok yul plato ayay co nan ti', a ton jun tu' ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich.

English: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', palta yowalil ok in camok axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Palta ok'bal wal c'ul jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich tu'. Yel watx' yet jun winak tu' ta maj aljok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” Jesus answered, “Yes, it is you.”
Kanjobal: Axa Judas, nak t'inan yaon oc Cham yul k'ab camich tu', a' max alon axca ti': —Meẍtol, ¿mayin mi nak ayin ti'? ẍi bay. —Ach toni, ẍi bay nak.

English: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take and eat; this is my body.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan low Jesús yetok eb is cuywom tu', max yion aj ixim pan. Max yalon yuj diosal bay Dios yuj ixim. Max lajwi tu xin, max bijon ayok, cax max yak'on bay eb is cuywom tu': —Loek; a ton jun ti' in mimanil, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he took the cup, gave thanks and offered it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yion aj jun vaso. Max yalon yuj diosalil bay Dios yuj, max yak'on bay eb. —Wajan uc'nejek jun ti' e masanil,

English: This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
Kanjobal: yujtol in chiq'uil jun ti'. Yuj in chiq'uil ti', xan ok yun jun is trato Dios. Ok el in chiq'uil ti', yet watx' xiwil mac ok tancan el is yobtakil yuj.

English: I tell you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father's kingdom.”
Kanjobal: Chi walcan ayex tinani', tol c'amxa bay ok wuc' yal sat an uva ti'; atoc'al yet ok ocxac'al co Mam Dios Yajawil, catatu' ok wuq'uen jun ato watx'ji e yetok junelxa, ẍi bay eb.

English: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi bitnen eb jun bit chi bitnejc'alta' eb bay Dios, axa toj eb bay tzalan Olivo tu'.

English: Then Jesus told them, “This very night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —A yet jun ak'bal ti', ok cabax aj e c'ul win e masanil. Caytu' yaloncan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Ok wak' cam Cham ilom calnel, axa no calnel tu', ok saklemcantok no', ẍi.

English: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet mayal in ictzonelay pax ajok, ok babjok in toj e satak bay Galilea, ẍi Cham bay eb.

English: Peter replied, “Even if all fall away on account of you, I never will.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro tu' bay: —Caxc'al ok cabax aj c'ul eb masanil en; palta ayin ti', c'am bak'in ok cabax aj in c'ul, ẍi bay.

English: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus answered, “this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.”
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayach, a yet jun ak'bal ti', oxelxa quin eon el en yin aloni, tol mayin ojtakok, cax ok ok'aj no caẍlan, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: But Peter declared, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the other disciples said the same.
Kanjobal: —Caxc'al mi ok in cam etok, palta tutun maj ach wiel win, ẍi Pedro tu' bay. Ac'ala' yalon masanil eb cuywom tu'.

English: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max toj Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay jun lugar chi yik Getsemaní, max yalon bay eb: —Ayanekcan chotan cayti' yak'ban chin toj txajlok co sataktok ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.
Kanjobal: Max yion bey Pedro yetok, c'al eb cawan c'ajol Zebedeo. Axa c'oli cusaj tu', c'al yoc yin bilc'ulal.

English: Then he said to them, “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb: —Ijan chin cam yuj cusc'ulal chi wabej. Cananek can cayti', iquisokab ex wetok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.”
Kanjobal: Cax max jitzontok ba jabxa. Max ay jajanok, cax max ayxac'al nojan sat tx'otx'. Axa txajli tu' axca ti': Mamin, ta chi je' cha na', manchak jay jun yailal tu' wiban, palta manokab axcaok chi wochej ayin ti', palta axcaokab chochej ach ti', ẍi.

English: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. “Could you men not keep watch with me for one hour?” he asked Peter.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max jayoc bay max can eb oxwan tu'. Axa max yiloni, lanan way eb, xan max yal bay Pedro: —¿Tom c'am chi je' e tec'ban e ba bay wayan junok hora wetok?

English: “Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”
Kanjobal: Iek el e wayan. Txajlanek, yet watx' c'am chex ayc'ay yet ay mac chi yak'lej ex yikban yin yobtakil. A janimail tec'an ton waayi, palta a co mimanil, c'am chi techaj yuj, ẍi bay eb.

English: He went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done.”
Kanjobal: Max toj junelxa txajlok. Max yalon yin is txaj: Mamin, ta c'am chi je' tol c'am chi jay jun yailal ti' wiban, yunokab axca chochej, ẍi.

English: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc junelxa bay eb oxwan tu', max yiloni, waynak aj eb, yujtol caw c'am chi techaj wayan yuj eb.

English: So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.
Kanjobal: Max can eb yuj junelxa. Max toj txajlok yet yoxelal. Axcac'al max yut txajlok ba yet babelal, caytu' max yut txajlok ba.

English: Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc bay eb is cuywom tu xin, max yalon bay eb: —¿Tom ac'ala' e wayi? ¿Tom comon xewilal che yunej? A tinani', mayal ajapnok yorail walay oc yul k'ab eb yobtakwom, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: Rise, let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”
Kanjobal: Ajanek wan, tonek. Ilab chi jay nak ok in aon oc yul k'ab eb, ẍi.

English: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.
Kanjobal: Lananto wal yaloni, max jayoc Judas, nak yet cuywomal ba yetok eb usluc'wan. Xiwil anima ajun yetok. Ay eb yetbioc espada, ay eb yetbioc te'. Chekbiltek eb yuj eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al yuj eb icham winak ay yikbej xol eb israel tu'.

English: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.”
Kanjobal: A Judas tu', nak lanan yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb, mayal yal bay eb tzet ok yut tx'oxon ocok. Max yal bay eb axca ti': A jun ok in tz'ubil is ti', a ton jun tu' che mitx'a', ẍi bay eb.

English: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan a c'atan Jesús max jitztok ba yin ayman. Max yalon bay Cham: —¿Tzet ẍi Meẍtol? ẍi bay. Cax max oc tz'uban yin ti' Cham.

English: Jesus replied, “Friend, do what you came for.” Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.
Kanjobal: —Ach amigo, ak' yun tzet chi ul onej, ẍi Jesús bay. Max lajwi tu xin, max oc bulnaj eb yin Cham yin aymanil. Max mitx'on eb. C'anani wal max yut eb.

English: With that, one of Jesus' companions reached for his sword, drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun ajun yetok Jesús, max tzac'ajtek yespada yin aymanil. Max tzoc'on el is txiquin jun is moso cham sat sacerdote.

English: “Put your sword back in its place,” Jesus said to him, “for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay: —Ak' meltzoj ay espada tu' yul tz'umal, yujtol a mac chi yak'balnej espada, espada c'apax ok on cami.

English: Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?
Kanjobal: ¿Tom man ojtakok, ta chi wochej chin k'an ec'ban 70,000 ángel bay co Mam Dios, tix chin ul col-lay yin aymanil?

English: But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?”
Kanjobal: Palta k'inalok ta chin k'anta'a, maj eloc axca yaloncan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, tol yowalil axca tu' ok yun yeq'uel wiban, ẍi bay.

English: At that time Jesus said to the crowd, “Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', cax max yalon bay eb max jayoc c'apax tu': —¿Tom yajaw in xol eb yob nabal che yila', xan ibiloc e yespada c'al e te' chin ul e mitx'oni? Junjunc'al c'u max in ay chotan in cuywaj e nan e xol bay yul templo Dios, palta maj in e mitx' pax bay tu'.

English: But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' chi uj xin, yuj yunen el tzet tz'ib yayjican yuj eb chekbej Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, ẍi bay eb. Max bekcan eb cuywom tu' Cham tx'oklil, cax max toj eb elaj masanil.

English: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.
Kanjobal: A eb max mitx'on Jesús, max yitok eb satak Caifás, cham sat sacerdote. A ta bay tu' max wajbaj ba eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb icham winak ay yikbej.

English: But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.
Kanjobal: A Pedro, najat tzakanc'al chi yut ba, masantac'al max apni oc bay yamak'il yatut cham sat sacerdote tu'. Max ay chotan yetok eb policía, yet watx' chi yila' tzetc'al ok ujok.

English: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death.
Kanjobal: A eb yajawil sacerdote yetok eb icham winak, c'al masanil eb sat yajaw, max say eb juntzan lek'ti' testigo yuj naon aj k'anej yin Jesús, tzetbil chi yun cami.

English: But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb max oc testigoal tu', max naon aj eb k'anej yin. Palta c'am junok max oc yopiso tzet max yala'. Yintakilxa max jayoc cawanxa lek'ti' testigo.

English: and declared, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Ayon ti', max jab yalon jun winak ti': Ayin ti', chi je' wuchon ay templo Dios, palta a yet cabjial tu', chi aj pax q'uexel wuj, ẍi max jabej, ẍi eb.

English: Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”
Kanjobal: Axa cham sat sacerdote, max aj wan, max yalon bay Jesús: —¿Tom c'am chach tak'wi jabok? ¿Tom c'am chab juntzan chi yal eb ti' en? ẍi bay Cham.

English: But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
Kanjobal: Palta Jesús, tz'inc'al ẍi. Yuj tu', max yalon cham sat sacerdote bay junelxa: —Al ayon ta Cristo ach, ta C'ajol ach Dios. Yowalil chal satak Dios iquis, ta yel chala', ẍi.

English: “Yes, it is as you say,” Jesus replied. “But I say to all of you: In the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
Kanjobal: —Ayin ton ti' axca alon tu'. Chi wal c'apax ayex, a ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in e yil yet chotan in ay bay watx' k'ab Dios, Cham Miman Yikbej. Ok e yil c'apax wayol satcan xol asun, ẍi.

English: Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham jun tu', max nic'ontok cham janic' is pichil, max yalon cham bay eb yet yajawilal: —A jun winak ti', buchwal chi yun yin Dios. ¿Tzetto wal chi oc testigo juj tinani', yujtol ayon wal caw chi jabej tol chi buchwaj yin Dios?

English: What do you think?” “He is worthy of death,” they answered.
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet ẍi e c'ul yin tinani xin? ẍi. —¡Yob chi el yuneni! ¡Moj chi cami! ẍi eb.

English: Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him
Kanjobal: Max c'oli tzubli oc eb yin sat. Max mak'on eb. Ay eb max mak'ontok ti',

English: and said, “Prophesy to us, Christ. Who hit you?”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb bay: —Ach Cristo, nailok mac max ach mak'oni, ẍi eb bay.

English: Now Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came to him. “You also were with Jesus of Galilee,” she said.
Kanjobal: A Pedro chotan ec' bay yamak'il na tu'. Max jayoc jun ix criada, max yalon ix bay: —Ach ti', et beyom a ba yetok Jesús aj Galilea, ẍi ix bay.

English: But he denied it before them all. “I don't know what you're talking about,” he said.
Kanjobal: —Man wojtakok jun chal ayin tu', ẍi satak eb masanil, max yion el yin.

English: Then he went out to the gateway, where another girl saw him and said to the people there, “This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
Kanjobal: Lananxa wal yeltok Pedro bay puertail amak' tu', cax max il-lay yuj junxa ix, max yalon ix bay eb wajan ec'ok: —A ton jun winak ti' yetbeyom ba yetok Jesús aj Nazaret, ẍi ix.

English: He denied it again, with an oath: “I don't know the man!”
Kanjobal: Max yion el Pedro yin junelxa. —Chi yil Dios, caw man wojtakok jun winak tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: After a little while, those standing there went up to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of them, for your accent gives you away.”
Kanjobal: Junixtowal ch'an bek tu', max yalon eb ayic' tu' bay Pedro axca ti': —Wal yel, ach ti' et beyom a ba yetok eb cuywom Jesús, yujtol lajan wal a k'anjab yetok eb chi jabej, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then he began to call down curses on himself and he swore to them, “I don't know the man!” Immediately a rooster crowed.
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli k'anontek yowal c'ul Dios yiban tu'. —Chi yil Dios, a jun winak tu', caw man wojtakok, ẍi bay eb. Ato wal yalon tu', max ok' no caẍlan.

English: Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken: “Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.
Kanjobal: Max naontek Pedro tzet max yal Jesús bay, yet max yalon axca ti': Oxelxa quin eon el en yin aloni tol mayin ojtakok, cax ok ok'aj no caẍlan, ẍican Jesús bay. Yuj tu' xan max eltok Pedro yina, max jichchaj c'ul yok' sic'libil.

English: Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people came to the decision to put Jesus to death.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbi, max wajban oc ba eb yajawil sacerdote, yetok eb ichamtak winak ay yikbej xol conob, max c'oli lajtinen eb tzet ok yut yak'on cam eb Jesús.

English: They bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.
Kanjobal: Max c'alon eb, max yiontok eb satak Poncio Pilato, cham yajaw yet tu'.

English: When Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was seized with remorse and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and the elders.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Judas, a ton jun max aon oc Jesús yul k'ab camich, tol ok camxac'al Cham yuj eb, caw max na ba c'ul yuj tzet max yun tu'. Max toj bay eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al bay eb yicham winakil conob. Max yochej max yak' meltzoj ch'en 30 tumin plata max cha' bay eb,

English: “I have sinned,” he said, “for I have betrayed innocent blood.” “What is that to us?” they replied. “That's your responsibility.”
Kanjobal: xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Caw max oc in mul waon oc jun mac c'am jabok is mul yul k'ab camich, ẍi bay eb. Axa yalon eb tu' bay: —Aon ti' bian, c'amc'al jalon jet yin tzet max on tu'; ilc'al tzet chot a ba, ẍi eb bay.

English: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben axca tu', max k'okoncan octok ch'en tumin tu' yul templo Dios. Max lajwi tu xin, max toji, max t'unban aj ba, axa cam tu'.

English: The chief priests picked up the coins and said, “It is against the law to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money.”
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajawil sacerdote max sic'on aj ch'en tumin tu', max yalon eb: —Maj je' jaontok juntzan tumin ti' xol ch'en ofrenda, yujtol tojol camich yayji ch'en, ẍi eb.

English: So they decided to use the money to buy the potter's field as a burial place for foreigners.
Kanjobal: Axa max naon eb tzet ok oc ch'en. Max lajwi tu', max manon el eb jun is tx'otx' jun nak tz'aklom, cax chi occan camposantoal, yet watx' ay bay chi mukay eb tx'ok conobal chi cam bay tu'.

English: That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yikcan aj jun lugar tu', Tx'otx'al Chic'. Ac'ala' chi yik tinani'.

English: Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty silver coins, the price set on him by the people of Israel,
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun yion ba tzet max yal cham Jeremías is chekbej Dios yet payxa, yet max yaloncan axca ti': Max yiaj eb ch'en 30 tumin plata, ch'en tojol jun mactxel max manlay yuj eb yet israelal.

English: and they used them to buy the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me.”
Kanjobal: A yetok jun tumin tu' max manil eb is tx'otx' nak tz'aklom. Axca tu' max yut yaloncan Cham Jajawil ayin, ẍi Jeremías yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” “Yes, it is as you say,” Jesus replied.
Kanjobal: A yet max jayoc Jesús satak Pilato, cham yajawil conob, max k'anlen el cham bay Jesús: —¿Tom ach ti' reyal ach eb Israel? ẍi bay Cham. —Ja', ayin toni, ẍi bay.

English: When he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he gave no answer.
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al eb icham winak max naon aj k'anej yiban, palta c'am tzet max paktzej.

English: Then Pilate asked him, “Don't you hear the testimony they are bringing against you?”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Pilato bay junelxa: —¿Tom c'am chab juntzan chi yal eb ti' en? ẍi bay Cham.

English: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge–to the great amazement of the governor.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am junok belan k'anej max paktzej bay. Yuj tu' xan caw max c'ayaj c'ul Pilato yin Cham.

English: Now it was the governor's custom at the Feast to release a prisoner chosen by the crowd.
Kanjobal: A yet chi ec' k'in junjun abil, beybalnebil yuj cham yajaw bekon el junjun aj preso, atac'ala' mac chi k'an bekchaj conob.

English: At that time they had a notorious prisoner, called Barabbas.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu' ay jun winak chi yik Barrabás, ayoc preso. Ojtakbil nak yuj masanil anima.

English: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, “Which one do you want me to release to you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
Kanjobal: A yet max wajban ba conob tu', max k'anlen Pilato bay eb: —¿Mac junok che yochej chin bekilok, a mi Barrabás, ma a Jesús chi ali Cristoal? ẍi bay eb.

English: For he knew it was out of envy that they had handed Jesus over to him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max yojtaknej elok tol yuj chichonc'ulal eb yajawil sacerdote, xan max yitek eb bay, xan caytu' max yal bay eb.

English: While Pilate was sitting on the judge's seat, his wife sent him this message: “Don't have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him.”
Kanjobal: A yet chotan octok Pilato tu' yul is despacho, max jay is ti' yistzil bay, max yaltek xal axca ti': C'am jabok et chaltok xol tzet chi alay oc yiban Cham c'am jabok is yobtakil tu', yujtol max in wayichnej jun tu' ma'i ak'balil. Caw wal max in xiw yuj jun in wayich tu', ẍi xal.

English: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al eb ichamtak winak max ak'on c'ul anima, xan a Barrabás max k'an bekchaj eb. Axa Jesús max k'an cam eb.

English: “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” asked the governor. “Barabbas,” they answered.
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen el cham yajaw tu' junelxa bay conob: —¿Mac junok eb cawan ti' che yochej chin bekilok? ẍi bay eb. —A Barrabás chi jochej on cha bekilok, ẍi eb.

English: “What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called Christ?” Pilate asked. They all answered, “Crucify him!”
Kanjobal: —¿Palta tzet ok wut pax Jesús, jun chi ali Cristoal? ẍi. —Curusnelayokabi, ẍi eb masanil.

English: “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yetal junok yob max say yun max e yil xin? ẍi bay eb. Palta tol max te'xac'al aj yaw eb yaloni: —Curusnelayokabi, ẍixac'al eb.

English: When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. “I am innocent of this man's blood,” he said. “It is your responsibility!”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Pilato tu' tol majxa colchaj Jesús yuj; a ti yet eb, tol chi tx'emchaj eb yuj, yuj tu', max yak'on bet tit jab ya'. Max tx'ajon el k'ab satak eb masanil, yuj tx'oxk'abnen elok tol c'am locanil yetok eb, cax max yalon bay eb: —Ayin ti', c'am in mul yin camichal jun winak c'am jabok is yobtakil ti'. Ilekc'al e ba ayex ti' e tx'oklil, ẍi bay eb.

English: All the people answered, “Let his blood be on us and on our children!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb masanil tu' bay: —Titokab jiban, c'al yiban eb jinatil, ẍi eb.

English: Then he released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Pilato axca tu xin, max bekon el Barrabás, max chekon mak'lay Jesús, cax max bekon oc yul k'ab eb ok aon oc yin curus.

English: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.
Kanjobal: Axa eb soldado cham yajaw tu' max iontok bay yatut cham. A bay tu' max oc oyan masanil eb soldado yin.

English: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him,
Kanjobal: Max yion el eb pichil, max yaon oc eb jun cakyin pichilej yin.

English: and then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand and knelt in front of him and mocked him. “Hail, king of the Jews!” they said.
Kanjobal: Max paltx'onen seyay eb jun q'uix. Max yaon ajtok eb yin is jolom is coronaok. Max yaon oc eb jun te aj yul is watx' k'ab is k'okochok. Max lajwi tu', max tz'akon ay jajnaj ba eb satak, max c'oli buchon eb. Max tz'ak yalon eb bay axca ti': —Tzalojan ach Reyal eb Israel, ẍi eb bay.

English: They spit on him, and took the staff and struck him on the head again and again.
Kanjobal: Chi c'oli tzubli oc eb yin. Max yion ec' eb te aj bay, chi jabon oc eb te' yin is jolom.

English: After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi buchwajc'al eb yin, catatu' xin, max yion el eb an pichilej cak yili tu' yin, max yaonc'alta' oc eb is pichil. Catatu' bian, max yiontok eb bay ok yaoc eb yin curus.

English: As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal bey eb toj yetok Jesús, max chalen el ba eb yetok jun winak aj Cirene chi yik Simón. Max yak' pural eb toj yikon can curusal Jesús.

English: They came to a place called Golgotha (which means The Place of the Skull).
Kanjobal: Axca tu' max yun yapni eb bay jun lugar chi yik Gólgota. A Gólgota tu', chi yal elapnok, Lugaril Bakil Jolomej.

English: There they offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.
Kanjobal: Max yak' eb yuc' vino calan yetok c'ail jun ac'un. Palta a yet max yableni, maj cha c'ul max yuc' bay eb.

English: When they had crucified him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu, max yaon oc eb yin te curus, cax max yaon oc eb soldado suerte yin is pichil Cham, yuj pojoncan ec' eb xol.

English: And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa yay chotan eb taynen Jesús.

English: Above his head they placed the written charge against him: THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Kanjobal: Max tz'ibej oc eb jayeb letra bay jolomtak. A jayeb letra tu' chi aloni, tzet yuj xan chi cami. A ton Jesús ti', Reyal eb judío, ẍi.

English: Two robbers were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax cawan elk'om max curusnelay yetok Cham, jun bay is watx' k'ab, junxa bay is q'uexan.

English: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads
Kanjobal: A eb chi ec' bay tu', chi buchwaj can ajtok eb yin, cax chi aj tx'umnaj eb bay.

English: and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! Come down from the cross, if you are the Son of God!”
Kanjobal: Chi yalon eb axca ti': —Ach ton ti' chochay templo Dios ala', cax cha watx'nen aj is q'uexel yet cabjial. Col a ba tinani'. Tatol yel C'ajol ach Dios, ayantek yin te curus tu', ẍi ajtok eb bay.

English: In the same way the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders mocked him.
Kanjobal: A eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb fariseo, c'al eb ichamtak winak, maxc'al buchwaj ajtok eb yin. Chi yalon eb axca ti':

English: “He saved others,” they said, “but he can't save himself! He's the King of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.
Kanjobal: —Ay mac max colo'; palta c'am chi je' colon pax ba tinani'. Ta a co Reyal ayon Israel on ti', ayokabtek yin te curus ti' jila'. Axca tu xin, ok jaoc co c'ul yin.

English: He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ilab chi tz'ak yaoc Dios yipok c'ul. Colwajokab Dios, yet watx' ok jila', tatol yel ay camc'ulal Dios yin. Ilab tol C'ajol Dios in, ẍi ayon, ẍi eb.

English: In the same way the robbers who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
Kanjobal: Toltax eb elk'om locan aj yetok Cham tu', max buchwaj c'apax eb yin.

English: From the sixth hour until the ninth hour darkness came over all the land.
Kanjobal: Chuman wal c'u, max k'ekbi masanil yulyibank'inal, masantac'al yet a las tres.

English: About the ninth hour Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” –which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
Kanjobal: Ac'aloc yet a las tres tu', max aj yaw Jesús yin ipejal: Elí, Elí, ¿lama sabactani? ẍi. (Chi yal elapnok: Ach in Diosal, ach in Diosal, ¿tzet yuj xan chin a bekcanok?)

English: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “He's calling Elijah.”
Kanjobal: Ay jaywan eb ayic' bay tu' max aben tzet max yala', xan max yal eb: —A Elías, jun chekbej Dios yet payxa, a' chi yawtej jun ti', ẍi eb.

English: Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge. He filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a stick, and offered it to Jesus to drink.
Kanjobal: Ay jun yetbi eb max toj lemnaj yet jun bek tu'. Max bet laon aytok jun tzet chi pososi xol vinagre, max yaon oc chon jun te aj, max yaon ajtok yin ti' Jesús.

English: The rest said, “Now leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to save him.”
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzanxa eb max alon bay nak axca ti': —Yilxa ba. Ok tax jila' ta ok ul ilay aytek yuj Elías tu', ẍi eb.

English: And when Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.
Kanjobal: Max el yaw Jesús junelxa yin ipejal, cax max cami.

English: At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook and the rocks split.
Kanjobal: Yet wal jun bek tu', max ay nic'naj nan an k'ap ayoc makilok yul nan templo Dios. Max chaaytek tit nic'naj chon, masantac'al max ayol tilak. Ay c'apax jun miman quixcab max eq'ui. Ay juntzan ch'en mimek ch'en max jatcan aj yuj.

English: The tombs broke open and the bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax ch'en ch'en bay mukan octok eb camnak max jakchaji, xan xiwilxa eb creyente camnakxa max ictzoj ajok.

English: They came out of the tombs, and after Jesus' resurrection they went into the holy city and appeared to many people.
Kanjobal: Ato yet mayal ictzoj aj Jesús, cax max eltek eb yul ch'en bay mukan eb tu', max toj eb bay yul conob Jerusalén, a ton jun conob yettac'a Dios yayji. Xiwil anima max ilon yin eb.

English: When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified, and exclaimed, “Surely he was the Son of God!”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben cham capitán, c'al eb soldado chi taynen Jesús yec' jun quixcab tu', c'al juntzanxa tzet max uj tu', caw wal max xiwaj eb, max yalon eb axca ti': —A jun max cam ti', tita' tol yel caw C'ajol Dios, ẍi eb.

English: Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb xal ix t'anantek najat, a ton eb xal max ec'c'al yintak Cham yet ayic' Cham bay Galilea, yuj yak'lay serbil Cham yuj eb. Axa yet max tita', max tit eb xal yetok.

English: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.
Kanjobal: Ayoc María aj Magdala xol eb xal, yetok María txutx Jacobo yetok José, yetok c'apax is txutx eb c'ajol Zebedeo.

English: As evening approached, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak beyom chi yik José, aj conob Arimatea. A jun winak tu', cuywom c'apax Jesús. Yayc'ualilxa max jayi,

English: Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus' body, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
Kanjobal: max octok bay Pilato yuj k'anon aytek mimanil Jesús yin curus. Axa yalon Pilato bay eb is soldado tu', tol chi ak'lay bay.

English: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
Kanjobal: Axa toj yion aytek tu'; max pichon oc yul jun sábana sak yayji.

English: and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and went away.
Kanjobal: Ay jun ch'en ch'en olbilxa, tol yet José tu' yayji. C'amto junok camnak maxax mukaylej yul ch'en. A tu' max bet yaoctok mimanil Jesús. Maxc'al lajwi balon cantek jun ch'en miman ch'en makilejal, cax max toji.

English: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.
Kanjobal: Chotan ay María aj Magdala yetok junxa María cawilal ch'en ch'en tu'.

English: The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.
Kanjobal: Axa yet junxa c'ual, yet maxax lajwi c'ual watx'nen eb is tzetak yetal ok k'anbalnej yet c'ual xewilal, max wajbaj ba eb yajawil sacerdote c'al eb fariseo, max jayoc eb satak Pilato.

English: “Sir,” they said, “we remember that while he was still alive that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’
Kanjobal: Max ul yalon eb axca ti': —Mamin yajaw, chi co natek tol a yet c'amto chi cam jun lek'ti' tu', max yal axca ti': Cabjial wal in cami, cax ok in ictzoj pax ajok, ẍi.

English: So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may come and steal the body and tell the people that he has been raised from the dead. This last deception will be worse than the first.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, c'am mi chi el yin a c'ul cha chek toj taynelay bay max bet occantok is mimanil tu', masantac'al yet cabjial. Ta c'amak, toj talaj yelk'anej eltek eb is cuywom is mimanil. Axa ok yunajok, ok yalon el eb xol anima, tol max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak. Ta caytu' ok yut eb axca tu', a jun tzunan lek'tial eb tu', yelxac'al ay is may yintak jun babel lek'tial max yak' jun winak tu', ẍi eb bay Pilato tu'.

English: “Take a guard,” Pilate answered. “Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pilato tu' bay eb: —Iektok eb soldado xin, cax che taynen wal bay jantak chi je' e yuj, ẍi.

English: So they went and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and posting the guard.
Kanjobal: Axa toj eb tu', max yiontok eb eb soldado tu' yetok. Max taynen eb ch'en ch'en bay max octok, max yaon oc eb selloal ch'en makilej. A eb soldado tu' max can eb ti' ch'en tayneni.

English: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.
Kanjobal: A yet max ec'can c'ual xewilal, cax max sakbi aj yet domingo yet babel c'ual semana, max toj María aj Magdala, yetok junxa María bay max bet ak'laycan is mimanil Jesús.

English: There was a violent earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled back the stone and sat on it.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan toj eb tu', max ec' jun quixcab caw ow, max ayol jun yángel Cham Yajaw bay satcan, cax max apni oc bay mukan Jesús. Max balon el ch'en makilej, cax max ay chotan yiban ch'en.

English: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.
Kanjobal: Caw wal chi tzekeki yili axca rayo, cax sak is pichil axca sak bacom.

English: The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb soldado ayic' taynen ch'en ch'en tu', max luklun aj eb yuj xiwilal. Max telc'ojtok eb, axca tol max camil eb.

English: The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon jun ángel tu' bay eb ix axca ti': —Manchak ex xiwi. Wojtak tol a is mimanil Jesús, Cham max curusnelayi, a' chi ul e yila'.

English: He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.
Kanjobal: C'amxa ec' Cham cayti'. Mayal ictzonelay aj Cham, axca max yut yalon ayex. Titanek tonabi, cax che yilon bay max ec'lej Cham.

English: Then go quickly and tell his disciples: ‘He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him.’ Now I have told you.”
Kanjobal: Chi lajwi tu', chex toj yin ayman, chi toj e yalon bay eb max ec'lej cuywok yintak, tol mayal ictzonelay aj xol eb camnak. Ok babjok yapni Cham e satak bay Galilea. Ok e yil yin bay tu'. A juntzan ti' chi ul wal ayex, ẍi jun ángel tu' bay eb ix.

English: So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
Kanjobal: Axa yel eb ix bay ch'en mukbanil tu' yin aymanil; max toj yalon eb bay eb cuywom Jesús. Max xiw eb, palta caw max tzaloj c'apax eb.

English: Suddenly Jesus met them. “Greetings,” he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.
Kanjobal: Lananto toj wal eb, max tx'oxon aj ba Jesús bay eb, max yak'on cawil c'ul eb, cax max jitzonxac'altok ba eb c'atan. Max yion ay ba eb bay, cax max oc lak'naj eb yin yakan.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon Cham bay eb: —Manchak ex xiwi. Asek, alek bay eb in cuywom tol chi toj eb bay Galilea. A bay tu' ok yil eb win, ẍi bay eb.

English: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
Kanjobal: Lananto wal toj eb xal ix tu xin, max meltzoj jaywan eb soldado chi taynen ch'en ch'en tu', bay conob. Max apni eb bay eb yajawil sacerdote, pilan max bet yal eb tzet max uji.

English: When the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yaben eb masanil tzet max uj tu', max toj eb lajtinen ba yetok eb ichamtak winak ay yikbej, yuj yak'on eb mimanok tumin bay eb soldado tu'.

English: telling them, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.’
Kanjobal: Xan max yal eb bay eb: —Caytu' ok e yut e yalon axca ti': Lanan co way yet ak'balil, max ul yiontok eb cuywom is mimanil tu', quex chi.

English: If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”
