Kanjobal: Ta chi yabaj cham yajaw jun ti', c'am e pena, okxa co montej cham ayon ti', yet watx' c'am tzet chi elol e yiban, ẍi eb bay eb.

English: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.
Kanjobal: Axa chaon eb soldado ch'en tumin tu'. Max ec' yalon el eb axca max yun yal-lay bay eb tu', xan a jun lek'tial k'anej ti', chitoc'al yal eb israel tinani'.

English: Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
Kanjobal: Max toj eb cuywom Jesús yusluc'wanil bay Galilea. A bay jun tzalan max yalcan Cham bay eb, a tu' max apni eb.

English: When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' max yil eb yin Cham. Max yion ay ba eb bay; palta ay jun cawan eb maj yaoc yin c'ul.

English: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
Kanjobal: Max jitztek ba Jesús c'atan eb yusluc'wanil, max yalon bay eb: —Max ak'lay wikbej yiban masanil tzet ay bay satcan, c'al yiban masanil tzet ay bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, asek cuywaj xolak anima bay junjun conob, yet watx' ok oc eb in cuywomok. Che yak'can bautizar eb yin bi Dios Mamej, yin in bi ayin Dios C'ajolej in ti', c'al yin bi Dios Espíritu Santo.

English: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.”
Kanjobal: Che cuycan eb, yet watx' masanil tzet max walcan ayex, ok yikej eb. Ojtaknejek el sic'libil, tol ayinc'al ec' e yetok masantac'al ok jay lajubal, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: In those days John the Baptist came, preaching in the Desert of Judea
Kanjobal: A yet ayto ec' eb bay Galilea tu', max toj Juan cham ak'om bautismo, bay jun tz'inan tx'otx' yul yet Judea. Max c'oli yalon k'anej Dios bay eb anima max apni oc abxalwok bay.

English: and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
Kanjobal: Max yal bay eb axca ti': Naek e ba yin e yobtakil, yujtol a Cham Yajaw bay satcan, toxa ok txecloj wal aj is yikbej, ẍi.

English: This is he who was spoken of through the prophet Isaiah: “A voice of one calling in the desert, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.’ ”
Kanjobal: A ton Juan ti' max al-lay yin ayokto yuj cham chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías, yet max yaloncan axca ti' yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok: Ay jun mactxel bay tz'inan tx'otx' chi awji, chi yalon axca ti': Watx'nejek junok is be Cham Yajaw, t'inek junok be bay Cham, caytu' yaloni, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: John's clothes were made of camel's hair, and he had a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
Kanjobal: A pichil Juan tu' ayocok, xil camello chembil, cax tz'um ayoc is c'alilok. A jun makan no tzac' chi chiji chi chi', cax yichlakteal yalcab chi yuq'uej.

English: People went out to him from Jerusalem and all Judea and the whole region of the Jordan.
Kanjobal: Axa eb aj Jerusalén, yetok eb aj Judea, c'al jantak eb cajan tilak a' Jordán, chi bet eb abxalwok bay cham.

English: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
Kanjobal: Chi jakil eb is yobtakil bay Dios, cax chi ak'laycan bautizar eb yuj Juan bay yul a' Jordán tu'.

English: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to where he was baptizing, he said to them: “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb fariseo, yetok eb saduceo chi jayoc bay cham, yuj ul yak'lay bautizar eb yuj, palta max yal cham bay eb axca ti': Ayex ti' caw wal jelan ex yin ioj aytek satej, axca no labaj. ¿Mac max alon ayex tol chi je' e colon el e ba bay jun miman yailal ok jay e yiban yuj yowal c'ul Dios?

English: Produce fruit in keeping with repentance.
Kanjobal: Ta chi na ba e c'ul yin e yobtakil, yowalil watx' che yut e beybal, yet watx' chi txecloj elok tol yel, mayal e na e ba.

English: And do not think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.
Kanjobal: Man e yal axca ti': C'am tzet chi co na', yinatil on Abraham, man quex chiok. Yujtol chi wal ayex, k'inalok ta chi yal c'ul Dios, chi je' yuten oc juntzan ch'en ti' animail, cax chi oc yinatilok Abraham e q'uexelok.

English: The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
Kanjobal: A jun miman yailal ok jayok, lajan axca junok winak watx'xa yayji yetok yechej yich junok te' yet chi k'akon ajok. Masanil te te' man watx'ok sat chi yak'a', chi tzoc'ajok cax chi yak'on tz'a'ok.

English: “I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me will come one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not fit to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chex wak' bautizar yul a', yuj txecloj elok tol yel wali, mayal na ba e c'ul. Palta ay wal junxa mactxel tzakan jay wintak, a' ok ak'on Espíritu Santo ayex, ma k'ak' ok yak' ayex xin, axca tol ok ex ak'lay bautizar yuj. A jun mactxel chi wal tu', yelxac'al miman yelapnok wintak. Yuj tu' xan man in mojok wak'on serbil, tamwal wion oc is xanab, man in mojok.

English: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clear his threshing floor, gathering his wheat into the barn and burning up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
Kanjobal: A jun mactxel chi wal tu', lajan yetok junok winak chi txayej is trigo yuj yioncan el ixim yakanej xol ixim bak'ej. Chi c'ubajcantok ixim bak'ej bay is c'una', axa ixim yakanej, chi yak' tz'a xol jun k'ak' c'am oxlajon bak'in chi tani, ẍi Juan tu' bay eb.

English: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to be baptized by John.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', petoj Jesús bay Galilea, cax max jay bay Juan yet ayic' bay ti a' Jordán, yuj ul k'anon is bautismo bay.

English: But John tried to deter him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?”
Kanjobal: Yet babelal maj yal c'ul Juan max yak' bautizar. A ti yet, max yal bay Jesús axca ti': —In moj ayin ti' chin ak' bautizar, achxalaj chochej chach wak' bautizar, ẍi Juan tu' bay.

English: Jesus replied, “Let it be so now; it is proper for us to do this to fulfill all righteousness.” Then John consented.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Manchak a ten tinani', yujtol moj jiken masanil tzet chi yal Dios, ẍi bay. Axa yiken Juan tu'.

English: As soon as Jesus was baptized, he went up out of the water. At that moment heaven was opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and lighting on him.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al lajwi yak'lay bautizar Jesús cax max ajtek yul a'. Yet wal jun bek tu', max jakchaj satcan max yila'. Axa max yiloni, max ayol Yespíritu Dios yiban axca junok no paloma.

English: And a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.”
Kanjobal: Cax max ablay yoc jay belan k'anej ti' bay satcan: A ton jun in C'ajol ti' camc'ulnebil wuj, caw chin tzaloj yetok, ẍi.

English: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the desert to be tempted by the devil.
Kanjobal: Cax max ilaytok Jesús yuj Yespíritu Dios bay jun tz'inan tx'otx', yet chi yak'lej nak diablo yikban Cham yin yobtakil.

English: After fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.
Kanjobal: C'am tzet max lo' Cham yin cawinak c'ual, c'al cawinak ak'bal. Lajwi tu' max tit is wajil.

English: The tempter came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.”
Kanjobal: Axa yapni oc nak diablo tu' bay, yuj yak'len yikban Cham yin yobtakil, cax max yaloni: —Tutun tol C'ajol ach Dios, xan al bay juntzan ch'en ti', tol chi oc ch'en yin lojal, ẍi bay Jesús.

English: Jesus answered, “It is written: ‘Man does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi Jesús, max yaloni: —Chi yal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Man asannejok yuj loj chi je' jiquisbi; palta chi je' c'apax jiquisbi yuj masanil k'anej chi yal Dios, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu', ẍi Cham bay.

English: Then the devil took him to the holy city and had him stand on the highest point of the temple.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, cax max ilaytok yuj nak diablo bay jun conob tol asan Dios ay yet, a ton conob Jerusalén, cax max ilay ajtok yuj bay chon templo.

English: “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down. For it is written: “ ‘He will command his angels concerning you, and they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’ ”
Kanjobal: Max yalon nak bay axca ti': —Tutun tol C'ajol ach Dios, xan k'okto wal aytok a ba cayti', yujtol chi yalcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Ok chektek Dios eb is yángel yet watx' chach taynelayi. Ok ach quetzlay aj yuj eb, yet watx' c'am cha chipil akan yin ch'en, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu', ẍi nak tu' bay Cham.

English: Jesus answered him, “It is also written: ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi Jesús axca ti': —Palta chi yal c'apax yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu' axca ti': Manchak e yak' porobal, Cham Jajawil co Diosal, ẍi yul tx'an Un, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor.
Kanjobal: Axa yilaytok yuj nak diablo tu' bay chon jun tzalan caw wal can ayajok, cax max c'oli tx'oxontok nak bay Cham masanil mimek conoblak yulyibank'inal ti', c'al tzetak mimek yelapnok bay junjun conob tu'.

English: “All this I will give you,” he said, “if you will bow down and worship me.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon nak bay Cham axca ti': —Masanil juntzan chin tx'oxtok ayach ti', ok wak' ayach, ta chach ay jajan ayin, cax chalon a ba ayin, ẍi bay.

English: Jesus said to him, “Away from me, Satan! For it is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti bian: —Ach Satanás, elan in c'atan, yujtol chi yal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Iek ay e ba bay Cham Jajawil co Diosal. Asan Cham che yak' serbil, ẍi tx'an, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: Then the devil left him, and angels came and attended him.
Kanjobal: Axa yel Satanás tu' c'atan Jesús, cax max toji, cax max jayoc eb ángel ul yak'on serbil Cham.

English: When Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, he returned to Galilee.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús tol ayoc Juan yul preso, cax max toj bay Galilea.

English: Leaving Nazareth, he went and lived in Capernaum, which was by the lake in the area of Zebulun and Naphtali–
Kanjobal: Majxa cajay bay Nazaret, palta axa bay Capernaum max cajayi. A jun conob tu' a bay ti a' mar ay. Bay tilak tx'otx' yet Zabulón, c'al tx'otx' yet Neftalí, a tu' ay.

English: to fulfill what was said through the prophet Isaiah:
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max uji, yuj yunen el tzet max yal cham chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías, tol max yal axca ti':

English: “Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali, the way to the sea, along the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles–
Kanjobal: A ti a' mar ay tx'otx' yet Zabulón c'al tx'otx' yet Neftalí, bay k'axepal ec' a' miman Jordán: A bay tu' ay jun conob chi yik Galilea, junej ay yetok eb man israelok.

English: the people living in darkness have seen a great light; on those living in the land of the shadow of death a light has dawned.”
Kanjobal: A jun conob tu' cajan xol k'ekk'inal, ok yil jun miman sakk'inal; ok chaw jun sakk'inal tu' bay eb cajan ec' xol k'ekk'inal tol ay is may, ẍi tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok.

English: From that time on Jesus began to preach, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near.”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al apni oc Jesús bay jun lugar tu xin, cax max c'oli yalon el k'anej Dios bay eb anima, max yalon bay eb axca ti': Naek e ba yin e yobtakil, yujtol a Cham Yajaw bay satcan, toxa ok txecloj wal aj is yikbej, ẍi bay eb.

English: As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
Kanjobal: Lanan yec'jab Jesús ti a' mar bay Galilea, cax max yilon yin Simón, cham chi yik Pedro yetok jun yuẍtak chi yik Andrés. Lanan txaywi eb bay tu', yujtol txaywom eb.

English: “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will make you fishers of men.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Tzaklojanek cuywok wintak, cax ok wak'on e yopiso. Axca che yut e mitx'on no txay ti', caytu' ok e yut e yiontek eb anima ayin, ẍi Cham bay eb.

English: At once they left their nets and followed him.
Kanjobal: Max bekxac'al can eb is txim yet jun bek tu'. Yuj cuywi eb, xan max tzakloj eb yintak.

English: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James son of Zebedee and his brother John. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee, preparing their nets. Jesus called them,
Kanjobal: Max beytoj janic'xa, axa max yilon yin cawanxa yuẍtak c'apax ba, a ton Jacobo yetok Juan, eb c'ajol Zebedeo. Ayoc eb yul barco yetok is mam. Lanan sayon yil eb is txim, yet max awtelay eb yuj Jesús.

English: and immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al c'apax jun bek tu', max bekcan eb is barco c'al is mam eb tu', cax max oc eb cuywomok Jesús.

English: Jesus went throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness among the people.
Kanjobal: Bay masanil yulak yet Galilea max ec' Jesús yetok eb. Max ec' Cham cuywaj yulak nail bay chi wajbaj ba eb israel yin culto, cax chi yaloncan el watx' abix, tzetbil chi yun yoc eb yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. Max jaycan c'ul masanil mactxel ya'ay yuj tzanc'al tzet ilya'il yuj Cham.

English: News about him spread all over Syria, and people brought to him all who were ill with various diseases, those suffering severe pain, the demon-possessed, those having seizures, and the paralyzed, and he healed them.
Kanjobal: Masanil anima yul yet Siria max aben k'umal Jesús, xan max yi jay eb eb ya'ay yuj tzanc'al tzet ilya'il bay Cham. Yetok eb ayoc espíritu yob yin, yetok eb chabil oybinak sat yuj, c'al eb sicbinak el is mimanil, max ilaytek eb masanil bay, cax max jaycan c'ul eb masanil yuj.

English: Large crowds from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and the region across the Jordan followed him.
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima aj Galilea max tzakloj yintak Cham, c'al eb aj Decápolis, eb aj Jerusalén, c'al eb aj Judea, yetok eb aj k'axepaltok a' Jordán.

English: Now when he saw the crowds, he went up on a mountainside and sat down. His disciples came to him,
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilon Jesús jun miman bulan anima, max ajtok bay jun tzalan, cax max ay chotan bay tu', axa yapni oc eb is cuywom tu' is c'atan.

English: and he began to teach them saying:
Kanjobal: Max c'oli cuywaj bay eb axca ti':

English: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: A eb chi yojtaknej el ba tol man watx'ok eb yul yet satak Dios, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ayxa oc eb yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
Kanjobal: A eb chi cus is c'ul yuj yobtakil, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ok mimanc'ulnelay eb yuj Dios.

English: Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
Kanjobal: A eb yaynakil chi yut ba, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ok yi' eb jun lugar max yalcan Dios.

English: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.
Kanjobal: A eb chi yochej chi watx'nej oc is beybal wal yin masanil is c'ul, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ok oc Dios yetok eb yin watx'ji oc beybal eb.

English: Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
Kanjobal: A eb chi ok' c'ul yin yet animail, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol axa Dios ok ok' pax c'ul yin eb.

English: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
Kanjobal: A eb junxanej yayji is nabal yin yet Dios, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ok ayjok ec' eb yetok Cham.

English: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called sons of God.
Kanjobal: A eb ak'om tan owal, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ok al-lay eb yuninalok Dios.

English: Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: A eb chi yil yailal, yujc'al tol watx' is beybal, caw watx' yet eb, yujtol ayxa oc eb yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: “Blessed are you when people insult you, persecute you and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.
Kanjobal: Axa pax ex xin, ta wujc'al chex tx'emlayi, ta wujc'al chex bajlayi, cax chi nalay aj k'anej e yin, caw watx' e yet.

English: Rejoice and be glad, because great is your reward in heaven, for in the same way they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
Kanjobal: Tzalojanek sic'libil, yujtol caw miman watx'ilal ok e cha' is paktzilok bay satcan. Axca wal chi yun e yilon yailal ti', cay wal tu' max yun yilon eb chekbej Dios yailal yet payxa.

English: “You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled by men.
Kanjobal: Axca atz'am atz'am chi watx'nen oc tzet chi loji, cayex tu yulyibank'inal ti'. K'inalok ta chi c'ay c'achial jabok atz'am atz'am, ¿tzetto wal ok yun c'achibi junelxa? C'amxa yopiso. Toxac'al chi k'oklay elok, cax chi tec'laytok yuj anima.

English: “You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden.
Kanjobal: Axca junok tzektebal, cayex tu' bay yulyibank'inal ti'. K'inalok ta ay junok conob ayajtok chon junok tzalan, caw miman txequel sic'libil.

English: Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house.
Kanjobal: A yet chi co tzekon co tzektebal, tokwal a yalan junok cajón chi jaoctok, palta a yiban serbil chi jajtok, yet watx' chi tzektenelay masanil eb ayic' yul na yuj.

English: In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good deeds and praise your Father in heaven.
Kanjobal: Axca junok tzektebal, cayexokab tu xin, txeclojokab e sakk'inal satak anima, chi yal yelapnok, e watx' beybal, yet watx' chi yal eb watx' k'anej yin co Mam Dios ayic' bay satcan.

English: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.
Kanjobal: Xe na talaji tol yuj ul wuchon lajwok ley Moisés, c'al juntzan cuybanilej max yak' eb chekbej Dios yet payxa, xan max quin jayi. C'amak. Palta yuj ul in watx'nen ocok, xan chin jayi.

English: I tell you the truth, until heaven and earth disappear, not the smallest letter, not the least stroke of a pen, will by any means disappear from the Law until everything is accomplished.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol yowalil ok yun masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an ley tu'. Yet aytoc'al ec' yulyibank'inal ti', c'al satcan, tamwal jabok tzet yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu' tol man ok yunej. Tamwal junok letra, tamwal junok punto, tol ok ec' tzet chi yala', masantac'al ok yun masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: Anyone who breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever practices and teaches these commands will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan chekbanil yul tx'an ley tol txennej yelapnok chi jila'; palta a mactxel tol c'am chi iken masanil, cax chi yak'on c'apax yun anima, yet watx' c'am chi yikej c'apax eb, a ton jun mactxel tu', yaynakil yelapnok xol eb ayoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. A pax eb chi iken masanil tzet chi yal ley tu xin, cax chi yalon c'apax eb bay anima yet watx' chi yikej c'apax eb, a ton eb tu' miman yelapnok xol eb ayxa oc yul k'ab Cham.

English: For I tell you that unless your righteousness surpasses that of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan chi wal ayex, tol yowalil watx' che yut e beybal yintak beybal eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb fariseo. Ta c'amak, majc'alta' je' e yoc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan.

English: “You have heard that it was said to the people long ago, ‘Do not murder, and anyone who murders will be subject to judgment.’
Kanjobal: Ay bay max jab tzet albilcan bay eb jichmam yet payxa, bay chi yal axca ti': Man e mak' cam e yet animail. Tzanc'al mactxel chi mak' cam junok yet animail, yowalil chi ilaytok satak ley, cax chi beyc'ulnelayi, ẍi.

English: But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother will be subject to judgment. Again, anyone who says to his brother, ‘Raca, ’ is answerable to the Sanhedrin. But anyone who says, ‘You fool!’ will be in danger of the fire of hell.
Kanjobal: Palta ayinxa chi wal ayex, tzanc'al mactxel chi chichon oc c'ul yin junok yet animail, yowalil ok beyc'ulnelayok. Tzanc'al mactxel chi buchil junok yet animail, ok beyc'ulnelay yuj eb sat yajaw. Tzanc'al mactxel chi bajil junok yet animail, ay is may chi tojcan infierno, bay xol k'ak'ej.

English: “Therefore, if you are offering your gift at the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, ta lanan e toj e yak'on tz'a e yofrenda, cax chi tit yul e c'ul tol ay junok mactxel bay max oc e mul,

English: leave your gift there in front of the altar. First go and be reconciled to your brother; then come and offer your gift.
Kanjobal: batxbajekcan ay e yofrenda tu' yich altar, cax chi toj e watx'nen yayji e cusc'ulal yetok jun mactxel tu'. Chi lajwi tu xin, chex jayi, cax che yak'on e yofrenda.

English: “Settle matters quickly with your adversary who is taking you to court. Do it while you are still with him on the way, or he may hand you over to the judge, and the judge may hand you over to the officer, and you may be thrown into prison.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok mactxel chex awten satak juzgado yuj junok k'anej, ak'ek e yip e watx'nen jun k'anej tu' yulak be yetok, cax c'am chex ilaytok satak yajaw yuj. Yujtol ta mayal ex apni satak yajaw, axa cham yajaw tu' chex aon oc yul k'ab eb policía, axa e tojcan preso tu'.

English: I tell you the truth, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol maj ex bekchaj preso tu', ta man tz'akanok che tojlanej e multa.

English: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’
Kanjobal: Ay bay max jab tzet albilcan yul ley Dios, bay chi yal axca ti': Manchak e yaoc e mul yul k'ab e yetbi junjun ex, ẍi.

English: But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Kanjobal: Palta ayinxa chi wal ayex: Tzanc'al mac winakil chi ilon oc junok ix ix yuj yochen ocok, mayal mulji yul is c'ul yin ix.

English: If your right eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ayex chex ak'lay ayc'ay yin yobtakil yuj e bak' sat bay e watx', cax chi etax el e nabal, yelxac'al watx' tol che yiiltek jun e bak' sat tu', cax che k'okon elok. Yujtol yelxac'al watx' ta a junok yetbeyom e mimanil c'am, yintak pax tol masanil e mimanil chi k'oklaytok bay infierno.

English: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to go into hell.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ayex, a e watx' k'ab chex ak'on ayc'ayok, cax chi etax el e nabal, yelxac'al watx' tol che tzoq'uil jun e k'ab tu', cax che k'okon elok. Yujtol watx' e yet ta junnej yetbeyom e mimanil c'am, yintak pax tol masanil e mimanil chi k'oklaytok bay infierno.

English: “It has been said, ‘Anyone who divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce.’
Kanjobal: Albil c'apaxcan junxa ti' yet payxa tu': A mac chi pojlej ba yetok yistzil, yowalil chi watx'nej junok tx'an yunal pojlejbail, cax chi yak'oncan nak tx'an bay ix, ẍi.

English: But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, causes her to become an adulteress, and anyone who marries the divorced woman commits adultery.
Kanjobal: Palta ayin chi wal ayex: Ta ay junok mactxel chi pojlej ba yetok yistzil, palta c'am pax mul ix ix tu' chi yaoc yul k'ab yichamil tu', ti wal a yichamil tu' chi aontok ix yin mul bian. Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay junok mactxel chi ion ix max pojlej ba yetok yichamil tu', mul chi yunej.

English: “Again, you have heard that it was said to the people long ago, ‘Do not break your oath, but keep the oaths you have made to the Lord.’
Kanjobal: Ay bay max jab tzet max al-laycan bay eb jichmam yet payxa, bay chi yal axca ti': Ta che locbajtek bi Cham Jajawil yet che yak'on e ti' yin junok tzet yetal, yowalil che yak' yun tzet che yal tu', ẍi.

English: But I tell you, Do not swear at all: either by heaven, for it is God's throne;
Kanjobal: Palta ayin chi wal ayex: C'amokab bak'in che loctek junok tzanc'al tzet biejal. Maj je' e locontek bi satcan, yujtol a tu' chotan ay Dios yak'on yajawil.

English: or by the earth, for it is his footstool; or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the Great King.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apax sat tx'otx' ti', maj je' e locban bi, yujtol axca tol batxlub yakan Dios yayji. Yetok c'apax conob Jerusalén, maj je' e locban bi, yujtol is conob Cham Rey miman yelapnok.

English: And do not swear by your head, for you cannot make even one hair white or black.
Kanjobal: Tamwal e jolom, c'am chi je' che locbajtek. Iltax c'am chi je' e yuj e yak'on sakbok ma e yak'on k'ekbok junok xil e jolom.

English: Simply let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes,’ and your ‘No,’ ‘No’; anything beyond this comes from the evil one.
Kanjobal: A yet chex k'anjab xin, Ja', quex chi, ma C'amak, quex chi. Maj je' e locontek tzanc'al tzet biejal, yujtol a bay nak diablo chi tit juntzan ti'.

English: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.’
Kanjobal: Ay bay max jab tzet albilcan yet payxa, tol chi yal axca ti': Ta ay mac chi mak' poj bak' sat yet animail, mak'layokab c'apax poj yet. Ta ay mac chi mak'on eltek ye yet animail, mak'layokab c'apax eltek yet, ẍi.

English: But I tell you, Do not resist an evil person. If someone strikes you on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.
Kanjobal: Palta ayin chi wal ayex: Manchak e lajbaj yobc'ulal e yet animail. A ti e yet, ta ay mac chi mak'ontok jun pac'ok e sat, acbajektok jun pac'xa bay.

English: And if someone wants to sue you and take your tunic, let him have your cloak as well.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi yochej chi tok'on ec' e camiẍ satak ley, bekek c'apaxtok e jokan pichil bay.

English: If someone forces you to go one mile, go with him two miles.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay mactxel chex tenon oc yalan yikatz, yuj toj e yak'oncan yulak be nanok legua, as ak'ekcan junok legua bay.

English: Give to the one who asks you, and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mactxel chi k'anon majanej junok tzet yetal ayex, ak'ek bay, cax manchak e basnej.

English: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
Kanjobal: Ay bay max jab tzet albilcan yet payxa, tol chi yal axca ti': A eb watx' e yak'on yetok, camc'ulnejek eb. Axa eb yob e yak'on yetok xin, chichonokab oc e c'ul yin eb, ẍi.

English: But I tell you: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
Kanjobal: Palta ayin chi wal ayex: Yowalil che camc'ulnej eb ajc'ul oc e yin c'al e txajli yuj eb chex etneni.

English: that you may be sons of your Father in heaven. He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' ok e yut e tx'oxon elok tol yuninal ex co Mam ayic' satcan. Yujtol a co Mam tu', chi yak' ajol c'u yiban eb yob c'al yiban eb watx'. Yetok c'apaxok, chi yaay nab yiban eb yob is nabal, yetok c'apax yiban eb watx' is nabal.

English: If you love those who love you, what reward will you get? Are not even the tax collectors doing that?
Kanjobal: Ta asan ch'an eb chex camc'ulneni ok e camc'ulnej paxok, ¿xin ta ok e cha' is paktzil jun e camc'ulal tu' che na'? Toltax eb tekomel tojlabal, cayton tu' chi beybalnej eb.

English: And if you greet only your brothers, what are you doing more than others? Do not even pagans do that?
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta asannej yetok eb e watx'il anima bay watx' e k'anjabi, ¿xin ta watx' che na'? Toltax eb manto ojtaknenok Dios, cay c'apax tu' beybal eb.

English: Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
Kanjobal: Tz'akakiokab che beybalnej masanil tzet yetal watx' xin, axca co Mam ayic' bay satcan, tz'akan yin masanil tzet yetal watx'.

English: “Be careful not to do your ‘acts of righteousness’ before men, to be seen by them. If you do, you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.
Kanjobal: Xe yil c'al e ba, manokab asannejok satak eb anima, watx' che yut e ba. Ta asannej satak eb watx' che yut e ba, c'am jabok paktzil ok e cha' bay co Mam ayic' bay satcan.

English: “So when you give to the needy, do not announce it with trumpets, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets, to be honored by men. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a yet che yak'on jabok e sabal bay junok meba', manchak e yalil xol anima axca chi yut ba eb cabsat. Yujtol a eb tu', chi tx'oxxac'al el eb yulak nail wajayil yin culto, c'al yulak calle, yet watx' chi al-lay eb watx'il. Wal yel chi wal ayex, a watx' k'anej chi al-lay yin eb tu', a chi oc is paktzilok.

English: But when you give to the needy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
Kanjobal: A pax ex xin, aokab yet che yak'on jabok tzet yetal bay eb meba', maj je' e yalon bay anima. Caxc'al a bay mac yelxac'al watx' e yak'on yetok, maj je' e yalon bay.

English: so that your giving may be in secret. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.
Kanjobal: Ak'ek e sabal tu' yin ewantakil. Caxc'al yin ewantakil che yak'a', palta chi yil co Mam Dios, xan ok paktzej ayex.

English: “And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners to be seen by men. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.
Kanjobal: A yet chex txajli, manchak e yut e ba axca eb cabsat, yujtol a eb cabsat tu', caw chi cha' c'ul eb txajli yulak nail wajayil yin culto, c'al bay chi waj ba eb anima, yet watx' chi al-lay eb watx'il yuj anima. Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol a ton watx' k'anej chi al-lay yin eb tu' chi oc is paktzilok eb.

English: But when you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father, who is unseen. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti xin, a yet chex txajli, ocanektok yul e na, che makchej e puerta, cax chex txajli bay co Mam Dios, Cham ayic' e yetok. Caxc'al c'am mac chi ilon e txajli, ok yabc'alta' Cham, cax ok paktzen Cham e txaj tu'.

English: And when you pray, do not keep on babbling like pagans, for they think they will be heard because of their many words.
Kanjobal: A yet chex txajli tu', manokab ac'alokc'al tzet che yalubtanej, axca eb manto ojtaknenok Dios. Yujtol a eb tu', a naon eb tol yuj miman chi yut eb yakan is txaj, xan ok ablay eb yuj Dios.

English: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan manchak e yut e ba axca eb tu xin, yujtol yojtakxa co Mam Dios tzet caw yowalil chi oc e yuj, yet mantoc'al e k'an bay.

English: “This, then, is how you should pray: “ ‘Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, caytu' che yut txajlok e ba axca ti': Ach co Mam, tol ay ach ec' bay satcan, mimanokab yelapnok a bi.

English: your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
Kanjobal: Jayan ul ak'on yajawilal cayti'. Axcaokab yunen ochwan bay satcan tu', cayokab tu' yunen sat tx'otx' ti'.

English: Give us today our daily bread.
Kanjobal: Ak' co lobej ok co lo' junjun c'u co k'ana'.

English: Forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.
Kanjobal: Ak' tan co yobtakil, axca ayon ti' chi jak' mimanc'ulal yin eb ay tzet chon uteni.

English: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’
Kanjobal: Manchak on a cha' ikbelaytok yin yobtakil, cax chon a colon c'apax el yul k'ab jun yajawil yobtakil, quex chi.

English: For if you forgive men when they sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
Kanjobal: Ta che joc'ay yin e c'ul yobtakil eb ay tzet chex uteni, cax ok ak'lay tan e yobtakil yuj co Mam ayic' bay satcan.

English: But if you do not forgive men their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.
Kanjobal: Palta ta c'am che joc'ay xin, maj yak' c'apax tan co Mam Dios e yobtakil.

English: “When you fast, do not look somber as the hypocrites do, for they disfigure their faces to show men they are fasting. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.
Kanjobal: A yet chex oc yin c'ajbanc'ulal, manchak e yut e ba axca eb cabsat. Yujtol a eb tu', cusiltakxac'al chi yut eb sat, yet watx' chi txecloj el satak anima tol aynaj oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal. Wal yel chi wal ayex, tol a ton yuj chi il-lay eb yuj eb anima tu', a ton chi oc is paktzilok eb, xan c'amxa paktzil eb ok cha' bay Dios.

English: But when you fast, put oil on your head and wash your face,
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti xin, a yet chex oc yin c'ajbanc'ulal, mixnajanek, cax che ch'ichontok e xil,

English: so that it will not be obvious to men that you are fasting, but only to your Father, who is unseen; and your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.
Kanjobal: yet watx' c'am chi nachaj el yuj anima ta ayex oc yin c'ajbanc'ulal. Axca tu xin, asan co Mam Dios ojtaknej tol ay ex oc yin c'ajbanc'ulal, ok paktzej Cham e c'ajbanc'ulal tu'.

English: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.
Kanjobal: Manchak e wajbaj e beyomal yulyibank'inal ti', yujtol chi ijbitok, chi k'uxbitok, ma chi toj yuj elk'om.

English: But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and rust do not destroy, and where thieves do not break in and steal.
Kanjobal: Yelxac'al watx' tol a bay satcan che wajbaj e beyomal. A bay satcan tu', c'am chi oc yijal, c'am chi k'uxbitok, c'amxa c'apax elk'om chi elk'anentok.

English: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a bay chi co wajbaj co beyomal, a tu' chi ja c'apaxtok co nabal.

English: “The eye is the lamp of the body. If your eyes are good, your whole body will be full of light.
Kanjobal: A co bak' sat, axca tol is tzektebal co mimanil yayji ocok. Yuj tu xin, ta junnej tzet bay ayoc co sat, sakk'inal on chi yal tu', cax watx'c'al tzet chi el junun yetok co mimanil.

English: But if your eyes are bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light within you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
Kanjobal: Palta ta ay ex tx'ok tx'ok bay che yaoc e sat xin, chex cancan xol k'ekk'inal yuj. A e sakk'inalil tu', ta chi q'uexpoj oc yin k'ekk'inalil, ok ex canxac'al xol k'ekk'inal.

English: “No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mactxel chi je' jun lajanc'al yak'on serbil cawanok patrón, yujtol chi mi yajc'ulnej ba yetok junok, cax chi camc'ulnen ba yetok junokxa. Ay mi junok ay yelapnok yul sat, axa junokxa c'am mi yelapnok yul sat. Yuj tu' xan c'am chi je' tol jun lajan co camc'ulnen jak'on serbil Dios c'al co camc'ulnen ch'en tumin.

English: “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink; or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more important than food, and the body more important than clothes?
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan chi wal ayex, tol manchak ex oc il yuj e cawil cayti', yuj e lobej c'al yuj e pichil. Ta chi yak' Dios e cawil, ¿tom ato wal e lobej man ok yak'a'? Ta max yak' Dios e mimanil, ¿tom ato wal e pichil man ok yak'a'?

English: Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store away in barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more valuable than they?
Kanjobal: Ilab no tz'iquin, c'am yawoj no', c'am jatx'oj no'. Tok ay tzet chi wajbajcan no', palta a co Mam Dios ay bay satcan chi ak'on lobej no'. Iltax chi yak' lobej no tz'iquin tu', akxam wal ayex ti' tol miman e yelapnok yintak no' yul sat Cham.

English: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?
Kanjobal: Tok ay junok ex chi je' e yaon oc nanokxa vara tz'akil e tel yujc'al chex oc il.

English: “And why do you worry about clothes? See how the lilies of the field grow. They do not labor or spin.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ¿tzet xan chex oc il yuj e pichil? Iek e nabal yin an xumaquil ac'un tinani'. A an xumac tu', c'am chi mulnaj an, tamwal chi tx'alwi c'apax an.

English: Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.
Kanjobal: Palta chi wal ayex, tol caxc'al xiwil watx'il yili pichil cham rey Salomón max yaocok, palta majc'alta' apnok yili axca an xumac tu'.

English: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?
Kanjobal: Iltax wal xiwil watx'il yili an xumac tu' yuj Dios. Tol watx' yili an tinani'; axa yecal xin, chi takilok, axa yet taknakxa elok, cax chi tz'a'i, ¿tom ayexto wal, man ok ex pichlay yuj Cham? ex c'am wal che yaoc Dios yin e c'ul.

English: So do not worry, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, xan manchak ex oc il, cax chex alxi aj yuj e lobej e yuc'a', tamwal yuj e pichil.

English: For the pagans run after all these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them.
Kanjobal: A eb man ojtaknenok Dios, caw chi yiajtek eb c'ulok sayon ec' juntzan tzet yetal ti'. Axa ayon xin, a co Mam ay bay satcan, yojtakxa tol caw chi oc yopiso juntzan ti' juj.

English: But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
Kanjobal: Xan ak'ek e yip e yaon oc e ba yul k'ab Cham wal sic'libil, cax watx'c'al che yut e beybal axca wal chi yochej c'ul. Ta ok e yun axca chi wal ti', ok yak' Cham masanil juntzan tzet yetal ti' ayex.

English: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, manchak ex oc il yuj tzet ayex yecal, yujtol man e yojtakok tzet ibil oc yuj jun c'u yecal tu', xan maj je' e yoc il. K'okbilc'alnaj che naobtanej yin tzetak yetal ibil oc yuj junjun c'u.

English: “Do not judge, or you too will be judged.
Kanjobal: Manchak e beyc'ulnej junok mactxel, yet watx' manchak ex beyc'ulnelay yuj Dios.

English: For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ta che beyc'ulnej junok mactxel, axca wal che yut e beyc'ulnen tu', caywal tu' ok yun e beyc'ulnelayi. Yuj tu xin, xan a e yechbal che yak'balnej, a ok ak'balnelay pax ayex.

English: “Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok e yet animail chi toj junok c'ajil k'alem yul sat. Ayexxa xin, k'inalok ay pax junok patzab ayoctok yul e sat. Ta c'am che yiltek tol ay te' ayoctok yul e sat, ¿tom ato wal jab k'alem ayoctok yul sat e yet animail tu' ok e yiltek?

English: How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when all the time there is a plank in your own eye?
Kanjobal: Ta ay junok te patzab ayoctok yul e sat xin, tok ok je' e yalon bay e yet animail axca ti': Jilto wali, jieltek jun c'ajil k'alem ayoctok yul a sat tu', tok quex chi bay.

English: You hypocrite, first take the plank out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
Kanjobal: Palta tatol caytu' che yut e yaloni, cabsat ex. Iek eltek jun te patzab ayoctok yul e sat tu' babelal. Catatu bian, ok je' e yilon e yion eltek jun c'ajil k'alem yul sat e yet animail tu'.

English: “Do not give dogs what is sacred; do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they may trample them under their feet, and then turn and tear you to pieces.
Kanjobal: A juntzan tzet yetal yet Dios, lajan axca ch'en perla. Yuj tu xan maj je' jak'on bay eb tol c'am jabok yelapnok Dios yul sat, yujtol lajan eb axca no tx'i' caw ow, cax tojolc'al tit jin. Ay eb xin, lajan axca no txitam tol toc'al chi tec'tok tzet chi alay ay bay.

English: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.
Kanjobal: K'anek, cax ok yak'on Dios ayex. Sayek, cax ok ilchaj e yuj. Awjanek octok ti puerta, cax ok jaklay ayex.

English: For everyone who asks receives; he who seeks finds; and to him who knocks, the door will be opened.
Kanjobal: Yujtol tzanc'al mactxel chi k'anoni, chi cha'. A mac chi sayon ec'ok, chi ilchaj yuj, axa mac chi awji octok ti puerta, chi jaklay bay.

English: “Which of you, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
Kanjobal: Ilab tinani', a yet chi k'anon e yuninal lobej ayex, ¿xin ta a junok ch'en che yak' bay?

English: Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a snake?
Kanjobal: Ma xin, a junok txay chi k'an ayex, ¿xin ta a junok labaj che yak' bay?

English: If you, then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
Kanjobal: Ti pax wal yob ex, palta e yojtak che yak' tzet yetal watx' bay e yuninal. Akxam wal co Mam ayic' satcan, ok yak' tzet yetal watx' bay eb chi k'anon bay.

English: So in everything, do to others what you would have them do to you, for this sums up the Law and the Prophets.
Kanjobal: Che yochej tol watx' chi yut ba eb e yet animail ayex, yuj tu xan watx'okab che yut e ba bay eb, yujtol caytu' max yun cheklay co beybalnen yuj ley Moisés tz'ib yayjicanok, c'al yuj tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj eb chekbej Dios payxa.

English: “Enter through the narrow gate. For wide is the gate and broad is the road that leads to destruction, and many enter through it.
Kanjobal: A yul jun yaliẍ puerta chex oqui, yujtol ay junxa puerta miman sat, cax miman c'apax sat beal, palta a bay c'aybanilal chi apni jun be tu', cax xiwil anima chi toj yul.

English: But small is the gate and narrow the road that leads to life, and only a few find it.
Kanjobal: A pax jun puerta yaliẍ sat tu xin, yaliẍ c'apax sat beal, yuj tu' xan jaywannej eb chi toj yul, palta a ton jun tu' chi apni bay k'inalej.

English: “Watch out for false prophets. They come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ferocious wolves.
Kanjobal: Xe yilc'al e ba bay eb chi yaloc ba chekbejok Dios, yujtol a yet ok jay eb ayex, caw manso ch'an ok yut ba eb axca no calnel, palta ti tol yob tzet chi naoc eb e yin axca wal junok no ok caw ow.

English: By their fruit you will recognize them. Do people pick grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?
Kanjobal: Ok e yojtaknej el eb sic'libil yuj tzetak yetal chi el yunen eb, axca jojtaknen el junok te te' yuj sat. Ilab tinani', tokwal uva sat junok q'uix chi yak'a', ma higo sat junok q'uix chi yak'a'.

English: Likewise every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit.
Kanjobal: Masanil te te' watx', watx'c'al sat te' chi yak'a'. Axa masanil te te' yob, yobc'al sat te' chi yak'a'.

English: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.
Kanjobal: Xan a te te' watx', maj je' tol yob sat te' chi yak'a'. Tamwal te te' yob, maj je' tol watx' sat te' chi yak'a'.

English: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, a eb chi yaloc ba chekbejok Dios tu', ok e yojtaknej wal el eb sic'libil yuj tzetak yetal chi el yunen eb. Masanil te te' tol man watx'ok sat chi yak'a', chi k'aklay aj te', cax chi k'oklaytok te' xol k'ak'ej tz'a'ok, cayton tu' ok utlay eb man watx'ok beybal.

English: Thus, by their fruit you will recognize them. Thus, by their fruit you will recognize them.
Kanjobal: Man masanilok eb: Mamin Wajaw, ẍi ayin, ok oc yul k'ab Cham aj satcan. Asannej eb chi iken yochwan co Mam ayic' satcan tu', asannej eb tu', ok ocok.

English: Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name drive out demons and perform many miracles?’
Kanjobal: A wal yet ok jay jun c'ual tu', xiwil eb ok alon ayin axca ti': Mamin Wajaw, caw wal max on ec' jalon el a k'anej. Yetok ekbej max jion el espíritu yob yin eb anima. Yetok c'apax ekbej, xiwil milagro max el juneni, ẍi mi eb.

English: Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!’
Kanjobal: Palta jichan ok yun in tak'wi bay eb axca ti': C'amc'al bay max ex wojtaknej el junelok. Elanekc'al in c'atan, yujtol asannejc'al yobtakil max el e yuneni, quin chi, ok in tak'wok bay eb.

English: “Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mactxel chi aben in k'anej, cax chi yikeni, lajan axca junok winak jelan. A jun winak tu', a yiban ch'en max watx'nej yatut.

English: The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock.
Kanjobal: Max jay jun miman yax nab, cax max el sequecok elom aej. Max jay c'apax jun miman cak'ek', cax max low yin jun na tu, palta maj telc'ojok, yujtol c'anani toj xe' yiban ch'en.

English: But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
Kanjobal: Axa eb chi aben in k'anej, palta c'am chi yikej paxok, lajan eb axca junok winak c'am is nabal. A jun winak tu', a yiban pok max watx'nej yatut.

English: The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.”
Kanjobal: Max jay jun miman yax nab, cax max el sequecok elom aej. Max jay c'apax jun miman cak'ek', cax max low yin jun na tu', axa telc'oj tu', max etaxxac'al ayok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
Kanjobal: Axa yet max lajwi k'anjab Jesús bay eb anima tu xin, toxac'al chi c'aycan aj c'ul eb yuj jun cuybej ti'.

English: because he taught as one who had authority, and not as their teachers of the law.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet lanan k'anjab xol eb, max txecloj elok tol ay ton yikbej Cham man lajanok cuywaj axca eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés.

English: When he came down from the mountainside, large crowds followed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max paxaytek Jesús bay jun tzalan tu xin, xiwil anima max tzakloj yintak Cham.

English: A man with leprosy came and knelt before him and said, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak caw ya'ay sic'libil yuj jun ilya' chi yik lepra. A jun winak tu' max jayoc bay Jesús, cax max bekon ay jajnaj ba satak Cham cax max yaloni: —Mamin, ta chi yal a c'ul chi je' jaycan in c'ul oj, ẍi nak bay Cham.

English: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!” Immediately he was cured of his leprosy.
Kanjobal: Xan max matxbaj oc Cham k'ab yiban nak, max yaloni: —Chi yal in c'ul. Ti chi jaycan a c'ul, ẍi Cham. Yet-xac'al jun bek tu' max jaycan c'ul nak yuj Cham.

English: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you don't tell anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, cax max yalon Cham bay axca ti': —Ilabi, ayta bay alil jun ti'. Asi', cha tx'ox a ba bay junok eb sacerdote, cax chak'oncan a xajanbal bay Dios axca yalon ley Moisés, yet watx' chi il-lay yuj conob tol mayal jaycan a c'ul, ẍi Jesús bay nak.

English: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni oc Jesús bay conob Capernaum, max jayoc jun capitán bay Cham, cax max oc tean yin,

English: “Lord,” he said, “my servant lies at home paralyzed and in terrible suffering.”
Kanjobal: max yalon axca ti': —Mamin, a jun in chekbej ayic' wetok bay in na, max toj telan sat tx'at. Sicbinak el is mimanil, caw wal chi chiwaj yulak is mimanil chi yabej, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus said to him, “I will go and heal him.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay cham axca ti': —Ti ok in tok xin, cax ok tok wak'oncan jay c'ul nak, ẍi Cham bay.

English: The centurion replied, “Lord, I do not deserve to have you come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon cham capitán tu' bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin, man in mojok chach oc yul watut. Asannejokab tol chach k'anjabtok cayti', axa jaycan c'ul nak in chekbej tu'.

English: For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and that one, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
Kanjobal: Wojtak jun ti', yujtol ayin ti', ay eb wajawil chin chekoni. Ac'ala', ay c'apax eb soldado chin cheka'. Ta ay junok mac chin cheka', chic'al yikej toji. Ta ay mac chi wawtej, chic'al yikej jayi. Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay tzet chin chek watx'nej junok in soldado, chic'al yikej watx'neni, ẍi bay Cham.

English: When Jesus heard this, he was astonished and said to those following him, “I tell you the truth, I have not found anyone in Israel with such great faith.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús tzet max yal jun capitán tu', max c'ayaj c'ul, xan max yal bay eb tzakan oc yintak axca ti'; —Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'amto junok jet israelal maxax wil wal yaon oc c'ul yin Dios axca jun winak ti'.

English: I say to you that many will come from the east and the west, and will take their places at the feast with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
Kanjobal: Chi walon c'apax ayex, tol xiwil eb ok tit bay yichcan, c'al bay yayob c'u, cax ok ay chotan eb low yetok Abraham, yetok Isaac, c'al yetok Jacob bay meẍa Cham aj satcan.

English: But the subjects of the kingdom will be thrown outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
Kanjobal: A eb jet israelal moj yoc bay jun loj tu', palta ay eb ok k'oklay eltok xol k'ekk'inal yina, bay ok oc ok'il, c'al natx'atx'i ye eb yuj yail, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go! It will be done just as you believed it would.” And his servant was healed at that very hour.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, axa yalon Jesús bay cham capitán tu' axca ti': —A tinani', paxanxa bay atut. Ok yunc'alta' tzet max aoc yin a c'ul, ẍi bay. Yet wal jun bek tu', max jay c'ul jun is chekbej cham capitán tu'.

English: When Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw Peter's mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.
Kanjobal: Max toj Jesús bay yatut Pedro. Axa max yiloni, telantok xal ni' Pedro tu' yuj jun k'ak'al ilya'.

English: He touched her hand and the fever left her, and she got up and began to wait on him.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc mitx'an Jesús yin k'ab xal tu'. Cac'al tu' max yun yel jun k'ak'al ilya' tu' yin, axa yaj wan xal tu', cax max c'oli yak'lay serbil eb yuj xal.

English: When evening came, many who were demon-possessed were brought to him, and he drove out the spirits with a word and healed all the sick.
Kanjobal: Axa yet numumixac'al yay c'u, xiwil eb ayoc espíritu yob yin max ilaytek bay Cham, palta junnej k'anejal max yun yion el Cham eb espíritu yob tu'. Ac'ala' c'apax masanil eb anima ya'ay, max jaycan c'ul eb masanil yuj Cham.

English: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah: “He took up our infirmities and carried our diseases.”
Kanjobal: Tixton juntzan tzet max el yunen Jesús ti xin, yet watx' chi yuncan el tzet max yal cham chekbej Dios chi yik Isaías yet payxa, yet max yalon axca ti': A wal caw Cham max iontok jilya', lanan yaben yail co q'uexelok, ẍi.

English: When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max yilon Jesús tol manxa animaok oyanxac'al oc yin, max yikban ec'tok eb is cuywom bay junxa k'axepal a' mar.

English: Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet c'amto chi ec'tok eb tu', max apni oc jun meẍtol yin ley Moisés bay Cham, cax max yalon axca ti': —Ach in meẍtol, ok in tokc'al etok tzanc'al bay ok ach tok, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus replied, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —A no wax, ay is nach'en no', c'al no tz'iquin, ay is wayub no', palta ayin ti', caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, c'am jabok watut bay chin wayi, ẍi bay.

English: Another disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
Kanjobal: Max yal c'apax junxa ayoc tz'akilok eb is cuywom bay axca ti': —Mamin, ok in ec'c'al etok cuywok. Asan xin, in mukcantok in mam bel, ẍi bay Cham.

English: But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Tzaklojan cuywok wintak. A eb camnakto el yul sat Dios, a eb chi je' mukoncan eb yet camnakil tu', ẍi Cham bay.

English: Then he got into the boat and his disciples followed him.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max octok Jesús yul barco, cax max oc c'apaxtok eb is cuywom yetok, axa k'axpoj eb tu'.

English: Without warning, a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the waves swept over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.
Kanjobal: Palta lanan wal bey eb yiban a', cax max jay jun miman cak'ek' caw ow. Max c'oli bilaj sat a', cax chi toj a' yul te barco tu'. A pax Jesús xin, tol chi wayi.

English: The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We're going to drown!”
Kanjobal: Axa tenlay el wayan Cham yuj eb cuywom tu', max yalon eb bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, col on. Ti wal chon paxay yich a', ẍi eb bay.

English: He replied, “You of little faith, why are you so afraid?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the waves, and it was completely calm.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yuj xan xiwil chex xiwi? ¿Tzet xan c'am wal che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios? ẍi Cham bay eb. Max lajwi tu xin, max aj wan Cham, cax max tenon oc wanaj jun miman cak'ek' tu', c'al a' mar, axa numay masanil tu'.

English: The men were amazed and asked, “What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!”
Kanjobal: Toxac'al max c'aycan aj c'ul eb yuj Cham, max yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzetlaj yayji jun winak ti', xan tojolc'al yiken cak'ek' bay, c'al a' mar? ẍixac'al eb.

English: When he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ec'apnok Cham bay jun lugar chi yik Gadara, max jayoc cawan winak ayoc espíritu yob yin bay Cham, petoj eb bay chi muklay camnak. Yelxac'al ay is may eb, xan c'am mac chi ec' bay jun be tu'.

English: “What do you want with us, Son of God?” they shouted. “Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”
Kanjobal: Axa wek'on el eb yaw tu', max yalon eb bay Jesús axca ti': —Jesús, ach C'ajol Dios, ¿tzet alon et jin? ¿Tom yin ayoktoc'al cax chach jayoc on ul aon oc yin yatakil? ẍi eb.

English: Some distance from them a large herd of pigs was feeding.
Kanjobal: Axa cawilal tu' ay pax ec' jun miman bulan txitam chi tzuk yac'un,

English: The demons begged Jesus, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
Kanjobal: xan max yal eb espíritu yob tu' bay Jesús axca ti': —Ta chon oktej el yin eb anima ti', axa yin no txitam tu' chon a chaocok, ẍi eb bay Cham.

English: He said to them, “Go!” So they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and died in the water.
Kanjobal: —Ocanek yin no' xin, ẍi bay eb. Xan max el eb yin eb anima tu', axa yin no txitam tu' max occan eb. Yuj tu xin, ayman max toj no' el yuj eb. Max k'okon el ba no' sat witz masanil, masantac'al max ayapnok no' yul a' mar, cax max jik'bi aytok no' yul a'.

English: Those tending the pigs ran off, went into the town and reported all this, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
Kanjobal: Axa eb yilomal no txitam tu xin, max elaj eb, max toj eb yin aymanil bay conob, yuj toj yalon eb tzet max on no txitam tu', c'al yuj eb bay max elcan eb espíritu yob tu' yin.

English: Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan masanilxac'al conob max eltek ul yilon yin Jesús, cax max tewi eb bay Cham yet chi besil ba yul is conobal eb.

English: Jesus stepped into a boat, crossed over and came to his own town.
Kanjobal: Axa yoc Jesús yul junok barco, cax max k'axpoj ec' yiban a'. Max ec'apnok bay junxa k'axep bay ay is conob.

English: Some men brought to him a paralytic, lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Take heart, son; your sins are forgiven.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak sicbinak el is mimanil, batxbil sat is wayub. Max ilay jay bay Jesús. Max yilon oc Jesús xin, tol chi yaoc eb inen oc nak tu' yin c'ul tol ok jaycan c'ul nak yuj Cham, xan max yal Cham bay nak sicbinak el tu' axca ti': —Ach wet animail, ak' tzalojbok a c'ul. Max ak'lay mimanc'ulal yin a yobtakil, ẍi bay nak.

English: At this, some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”
Kanjobal: Axa jaywan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés ayic' bay tu xin, max na eb yul c'ul yin Jesús axca ti': A jun winak ti', buchwal k'anej chi yun yin Dios yuj tzet chi yal tu', ẍi eb.

English: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why do you entertain evil thoughts in your hearts?
Kanjobal: Palta Jesús xin, max yojtaknej el tzet chi naoc eb yin, xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet xan yob tzet chi ec' yul e c'ul win?

English: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
Kanjobal: ¿Baytet junok suboj yelapnok jalon xol cab k'anej ti': A mi jun, Chi wak' mimanc'ulal yin a yobtakil, ma jun Ajan wanok, cax beyan, ta con chi?

English: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins....” Then he said to the paralytic, “Get up, take your mat and go home.”
Kanjobal: A tinani' xin, ok in tx'ox e yila', tol a' ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', chic'al je' wuj wak'on tancan el mulej bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi bay eb. Lajwi tu xin, axa yalon bay nak sicbinak el is mimanil tu' axca ti': —Ajan wanok, iaj a wayub, paxan bay atut, ẍi bay nak.

English: And the man got up and went home.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan nak tu', max toj bay yatut.

English: When the crowd saw this, they were filled with awe; and they praised God, who had given such authority to men.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb bulan ec' tu' tzet max uj xin, max c'ayaj c'ul eb, cax max yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios, yujtol miman yikbej max yak' bay eb anima.

English: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector's booth. “Follow me,” he told him, and Matthew got up and followed him.
Kanjobal: Max el Jesús bay jun lugar tu', cax max yilontok yin jun winak chi yik Mateo. A jun winak tu', chotan ay tekon el tojlabal bay eb anima, cax max yalon Jesús bay axca ti': —Tzaklojan cuywok wintak, ẍi Cham bay. Cax max tojxac'al yetok Cham yet jun bek tu'.

English: While Jesus was having dinner at Matthew's house, many tax collectors and “sinners” came and ate with him and his disciples.
Kanjobal: Axa yay chotan Jesús low yetok eb is cuywom yul yatut Mateo tu'. Cax xiwil eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al eb yob is beybal max ulic' low yetok eb yin meẍa.

English: When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and ‘sinners’?”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al yil eb fariseo jun tu', max k'anlen eb bay eb is cuywom Jesús axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chi low e meẍtol tu' yetok eb tekom el tojlabal, c'al yetok eb yob is beybal? ẍi eb.

English: On hearing this, Jesus said, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al yab Cham axca tu xin, cax max tak'witok bay eb axca ti': —K'inalok ta ayic' junok antem anima tinani', tok ay yopiso yuj eb watx' c'ul. Asan eb ya'ay, a eb tu' ay yopiso yuj.

English: But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice.’ For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
Kanjobal: Asek xin, ojtaknejek el tzet chi yal elapnok jun k'anej yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, bay chi yal axca ti': Chi wochej tol chi ok' e c'ul yin e yet animail, yintak pax e yak'on tz'a xajanbal ayin, ẍi. Man yujok ul wawten eb watx' is beybal naoni, xan max in jayi, palta yuj ul wawten eb chi yojtaknej el ba tol yobtakwom, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then John's disciples came and asked him, “How is it that we and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”
Kanjobal: Max jayoc eb is cuywom Juan cham ak'om bautismo, bay Jesús, cax max k'anlen eb bay Cham axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan c'am chi yak' eb a cuywom c'ajbanc'ulal? A pax ayon ti', chi jak'on c'ajbanc'ulal. Cay c'apax tu' eb fariseo chi yak' eb c'ajbanc'ulal, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “How can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while he is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; then they will fast.
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi Jesús bay eb axca ti': —K'inalok ta ay junok nupayil chi oc tinani', ¿xin ta wal chi je' tol man ok low eb awtebil bay jun nupayil tu', ta ayto pax ec' nak anima lanan nupay tu'? Ok ajapnok tiempoal yel nak chi nupay tu' xol eb, catatu bian, ok oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal, ẍi Cham.

English: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch will pull away from the garment, making the tear worse.
Kanjobal: K'inalok c'apax junok icham pichilej chi olchaj tinani', tok ay mactxel chi aon oc an ac' nip manto labilok yul a' nipilok an. Yujtol a an ac' nip tu' chi utz' an, cax chi mimanbi nic'chajnakil an icham tu'.

English: Neither do men pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, tok ay mactxel chi aon ay vino tolto chi watx'ji, yulak icham tz'um netal vino. Yujtol a yet chi sipc'oj ajok, chi nic'chaj no tz'um tu' yuj. Nabac'al chi etax el vino c'al no tz'um tu', xan a yul no ac' tz'um chi ay vino ato watx'ji tu', yet watx' c'amc'al junok tzet chi etax elok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: While he was saying this, a ruler came and knelt before him and said, “My daughter has just died. But come and put your hand on her, and she will live.”
Kanjobal: Lananto wal yalon Jesús juntzan ti' bay eb, cax max jayoc jun yajawil eb israel bay Cham. Max bekon ay jajnaj ba satak Cham cax max yaloni: —Ato wal camil ix in cutz'in ti'. Ton wetok, cax chi toj a batxban oc a k'ab yiban ix, yet watx' chi ictzoj aj ix, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus got up and went with him, and so did his disciples.
Kanjobal: Axa toj Jesús yetok xin, max toj c'apax eb cuywom yetok eb.

English: Just then a woman who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak.
Kanjobal: Axa xol eb anima max tzakloj yintak Cham, ayoc jun ix ix caw ya'ay. Lajcawebxa abil c'al c'oli yay a' aej yin, xan max yak' ix yip jitzontok ba yintak Cham, cax max oc mitx'naj ix janic' yin ti' pichil Cham.

English: She said to herself, “If I only touch his cloak, I will be healed.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol max na' ix axca ti': Tix wal ok jaycan in c'ul, asan tanej wal chin mitx' ti' pichil Cham, ẍi ix.

English: Jesus turned and saw her. “Take heart, daughter,” he said, “your faith has healed you.” And the woman was healed from that moment.
Kanjobal: Axa meltzojtok acan Jesús yintak, max oc t'anan yin ix. Max yalon Cham bay ix axca ti': —Ach ix, tzalojanxa tinani'. Ti max jaycan a c'ul wuj, yuj max quin aoc yin a c'ul, ẍi bay ix. Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max jaycan c'ul ix yin junelnej.

English: When Jesus entered the ruler's house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni oc Jesús bay yatut cham yajaw tu xin, max yiloni tol lanan xulay juntzan axca yili chirima, cax xiwil chi wekeki anima yok'i.

English: he said, “Go away. The girl is not dead but asleep.” But they laughed at him.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal Cham bay eb anima axca ti': —Elanektok yina. A ix unin ti', man camnakok ix, toc'al chi way ix, ẍi Cham bay eb. Toc'al max tzeyelay Cham yuj eb.

English: After the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yuktelay eltok eb yina yuj Cham xin, cax max octok Cham bay ayic' ix unin tu'. Axa yoc mitx'an Cham yin is k'ab ix, cax max aj wan ix.

English: News of this spread through all that region.
Kanjobal: Masanil anima bay jun lugar tu' max aben k'umal jun tzet max uj tu'.

English: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
Kanjobal: Max el Jesús bay tu xin. Lananxa toj yul be, cax max tzakloj cawan anima c'am chi je' yilwi yintak Cham. Max awjitok eb bay Cham yin ipejal axca ti': —Ach Yinatil David, ¿c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul jin on? ẍi eb.

English: When he had gone indoors, the blind men came to him, and he asked them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” “Yes, Lord,” they replied.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max apni Cham bay na xin, max jitzonxac'altek ba eb bay Cham. Axa k'anlen Cham bay eb tu': —¿Chi mi e yaoc yin e c'ul tol chi je' wuj tzet che k'an ayin tu'? ẍi Cham. —A ton Mamin, chi jaoc yin co c'ul tol chi je' oj, ẍi eb.

English: Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith will it be done to you”;
Kanjobal: Axa matxban oc Cham k'ab yin bak' sat eb tu', cax max yalon bay eb: —Yunokab ayex atac'ala' e yaon oc yin e c'ul tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: and their sight was restored. Jesus warned them sternly, “See that no one knows about this.”
Kanjobal: Cax max jakchajcan sat eb. Yujtol chixa je' yilwi eb xin, xan max cam yalon bay eb axca ti': —Xe yilc'al xin, ayta bay che yalilok. Ayta wal mactxel ok aben aj jun ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: But they went out and spread the news about him all over that region.
Kanjobal: Palta atoc'al wal ch'an yeltok eb, cax max c'oli yalon el eb bay masanil jun lugar tu' yuj tzet max yun Cham.

English: While they were going out, a man who was demon-possessed and could not talk was brought to Jesus.
Kanjobal: Atoc'al wal ch'an yeltek eb xin, cax max ilay jay jun winak bay Jesús. A jun winak tu', c'am chi je' k'anjabi, yujtol ayoc espíritu yob yin.

English: And when the demon was driven out, the man who had been mute spoke. The crowd was amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al uktelay el jun espíritu yob tu' yin nak yuj Jesús xin, cax max k'anjab aj nak. Axa masanil eb anima max ilon jun ti', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb sic'libil, xan max yal eb axca ti': —C'amto bay chi jil junok tzet yetal axca jun ti' co xol ayon Israel on ti', ẍixac'al eb.

English: But the Pharisees said, “It is by the prince of demons that he drives out demons.”
Kanjobal: A pax eb fariseo xin, max yal eb axca ti': —A jun winak ti' chi ta' je' yion el espíritu yob yin anima, yujtol ac'al oc yajawil eb espíritu yob tu' ayoc yetok, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus went through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and sickness.
Kanjobal: Max ec' Jesús yulak masanil conob, c'al yulak masanil aldea, cax chi cuywajcan yulak nail wajayil eb israel yin culto. Chi yalon el watx' abix yuj tzet wal chi yun yoc anima yul k'ab Dios. Chi yak' c'apax jaycan c'ul eb anima yin tzanc'al tzet ilya'il chi oni.

English: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon oc Jesús eb anima, max cus oc c'ul yin eb, yujtol lajan yayji eb axca junok bulan calnel c'am yilomal. Ayoc eb yin somc'ulal, c'al yin yatakilal max yila'.

English: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few.
Kanjobal: Xan max yal bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —A eb anima ti', tiempoal wal yal-lay k'anej Dios bay eb tinani', axca ixim trigo tiempoalxa pol-layi. Wal yel, xiwil eb c'amtoc'al chi yabej, palta jaywannej pax mac lanan mulnaj xol eb.

English: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, txajlanek wal bay Cham aj mulnajil, yet watx' chi chektek eb is mulnajwom xol eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: The beginning of the gospel about Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
Kanjobal: Tix is watx' yabixal Jesucristo ti', is C'ajol Dios: Max el yich yabixal ti', axca max yun tz'ibencan Isaías is chekbej Dios yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Max yal Dios axca ti' yuj is C'ajol: Ok in chek in chekbej a satak, yet watx' chi toj watx'nej a be.

English: It is written in Isaiah the prophet: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way”– It is written in Isaiah the prophet: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way”–
Kanjobal: A jun in chekbej tu', a bay tz'inan tx'otx' ok awjok, ok yalon axca ti': Watx'nejek junok is be Cham Yajaw. T'inek junok be bay Cham, caytu' ok yut yaloni, ẍican yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'.

English: And so John came, baptizing in the desert region and preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak chi yik Juan max tx'oxaj ba bay tz'inan tx'otx' yuj yalon el bay eb anima tol yowalil chi na ba c'ul eb yin is yobtakil, yet watx' chi jolayc'ay is yobtakil eb tu' yuj Dios, cax chi yak'on bautizar ba eb.

English: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb anima yulak yet Judea, c'al eb aj Jerusalén max bet abenok. Chi xew yalon ajtek eb is yobtakil bay Dios, cax chi ak'lay bautizar eb yuj Juan yul a' miman Jordán.

English: John wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
Kanjobal: A Juan tu', xil camello chembil ayoc pichilok, axa is c'alil xin, tz'um c'alilej. A jun makan no tzac' chi chiji, a chi chi', cax chi yuq'uen yichlak teal yalcab.

English: And this was his message: “After me will come one more powerful than I, the thongs of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
Kanjobal: Cax chi yalon el xol anima axca ti': Ay jun Cham tzakan jay wintak, yelxac'al miman yelapnok wintak. Yuj tu xan man in mojok wak'on serbil jabok, caxc'al chin ay nojan satak in xuyon el tx'anil xanab, man in mojok.

English: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', wal yel chex wak' bautizar yetok aej, palta a jun chi wal ti', a' ok ex ak'on bautizar yetok Cham Espíritu Santo, ẍi Juan.

English: At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', max el Jesús bay Nazaret yul yet Galilea, yuj ul yak'lay bautizar yuj Juan bay a' Jordán.

English: As Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
Kanjobal: A wal yajtek yul a' tu', max yilon jakchaj satcan, cax max ayol Cham Espíritu yiban axca junok paloma.

English: And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max ablay yal-lay aytek jay belan k'anej bay satcan, axca ti': Ach ton ti' in C'ajol ach, camc'ulnebil ach wuj. Caw chin tzaloj oc en, ẍi.

English: At once the Spirit sent him out into the desert,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max ilaytok Jesús yuj Yespíritu Dios bay tz'inan tx'otx'.

English: and he was in the desert forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.
Kanjobal: Cawinak c'u max betic' bay tu', xol no no' ay is may. Max yak'lej Satanás yikban Cham yin yobtakil. Max lajwi tu', max ul ak'lay serbil Cham yuj eb ángel.

English: After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.
Kanjobal: A yet max alay oc Juan yul preso, max toj Jesús bay Galilea. Max yaloncan el watx' abix yuj tzet chi yun yoc eb anima yul k'ab Dios.

English: “The time has come,” he said. “The kingdom of God is near. Repent and believe the good news!”
Kanjobal: Max yalon axca ti': Mayal jay tiempoal, tol toxa ok txecloj wal ay is yikbej Dios. Yuj tu' xan naek e ba yin e yobtakil. Chaek e yab jun k'anejal yet colbanilej, ẍi.

English: As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal yec' Jesús ti a' mar bay Galilea, max yilon cawan txaywom, jun chi yik Simón, yetok jun yuẍtak chi yik Andrés. Lanan yaon aytok eb is txim yul a'.

English: “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will make you fishers of men.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Tzaklojanek cuywok wintak, ok wak' e yopiso. Axca che yut e mitx'on no txay ti', caytu' ok e yut e yiontek eb anima ayin, ẍi bay eb.

English: At once they left their nets and followed him.
Kanjobal: Max bekxac'al can eb is txim yet jun bek tu'. Yuj cuywi eb, xan max tzakloj eb yintak Cham.

English: When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.
Kanjobal: Max beytoj janic'xa, axa max yilontok yin eb c'ajol Zebedeo, a ton Jacobo yetok Juan. Ayajtok eb yul jun barco, lanan nipentok eb is txim.

English: Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
Kanjobal: Axa yawtentek Cham eb tu'. Max tit eb xin, max bekoncan eb is mam yul te barco tu' yetok eb majan, cax max tzakloj eb yintak Jesús.

English: They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
Kanjobal: Max apni eb bay conob Capernaum. Axa yet c'ual xewilal, max octok Jesús cuywaj yul nail culto eb yet israelal.

English: The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.
Kanjobal: Caw max c'ayaj c'ul eb anima yet max yaben eb juntzan cuybanilej max yak'a'; yujtol a yet max cuywaj nan xol eb tu', max txecloj elok tol ay yikbej yuj Dios, man axcaok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés.

English: Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an evil spirit cried out,
Kanjobal: A bay nail culto tu' ayic' jun winak ayoc espíritu yob yin. Max aj yaw yin ipejal, max yalon axca ti':

English: “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are–the Holy One of God!”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet alon et jetok ach Jesús aj Nazaret? ¿Ma yuj on ul ak'on c'ayilok, xan max ach jayi? Wojtak mac ach txel. Ach ton ti' sic'bil ach el yuj Dios, ẍi nak bay.

English: “Be quiet!” said Jesus sternly. “Come out of him!”
Kanjobal: Axa tzulay jun espíritu tu' yuj Jesús, max yalon bay axca ti': —Tz'in cachi. Elan yin jun winak ti', ẍi bay.

English: The evil spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.
Kanjobal: Max tzicobtanelay wal jun winak tu' yuj jun espíritu yob tu', max el yaw nak yuj, cax max el yin nak.

English: The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching–and with authority! He even gives orders to evil spirits and they obey him.”
Kanjobal: Max c'ayaj c'ul masanil anima max iloni. Yuj tu' xan max c'oli yalubtanen eb: —¿Tzetlaj yayji jun ti'? ¿Tzetlaj cuybejal jun chi jay ti'? A jun winak ti', chic'al je' yuj chekon eb espíritu yob. Ilab tol chi yikej eb bay, ẍi eb.

English: News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.
Kanjobal: Ayman max abchaj k'umal Jesús xol masanil eb aj lugar bay Galilea tu'.

English: As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max eltek eb yul nail culto tu', axa toj Jesús yetok Jacobo c'al Juan bay yatut Simón yetok Andrés tu'.

English: Simon's mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they told Jesus about her.
Kanjobal: Telan aj xal ni' Simón; caw ya'ay xal yuj k'ak'al ilya', xan max yal eb bay Jesús tol ya'ay xal.

English: So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.
Kanjobal: Axa jitzontok ba c'atan xal tu', max oc mitx'an yin is k'ab xal, max yion aj wan. Yet jun bek tu', ayman max jaycan c'ul xal, axa c'oli yak'lay serbil eb yuj xal.

English: That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.
Kanjobal: Axa yet mayal toj c'u, yet numumixac'al yayi, max ilay jay masanil eb ya'ay bay Jesús, c'al eb ayoc espíritu yob yin.

English: The whole town gathered at the door,
Kanjobal: Xiwil anima max wajnaj ti na.

English: and Jesus healed many who had various diseases. He also drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb tzanc'al tzet ilyail chi oni, max jaycan c'ul eb yuj Jesús. Xiwil espíritu yob max yican el yin anima. Maj cha' k'anjab Cham eb espíritu yob tu', yujtol yojtakxa eb mactxel Cham.

English: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.
Kanjobal: A yet ayto sakbi, yet k'ekk'olinakto, max aj wan Jesús, cax max toj txajlok bay jun lugar tz'inini, bay tiel conob.

English: Simon and his companions went to look for him,
Kanjobal: Axa toj Simón yetok eb ajun yetok tu', max toj eb sayon ec'ok.

English: and when they found him, they exclaimed: “Everyone is looking for you!”
Kanjobal: A yet max ilchaj yuj eb, max yalon eb bay axca ti': —Masanil anima chach sayoni, ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “Let us go somewhere else–to the nearby villages–so I can preach there also. That is why I have come.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Tonek bay juntzan aldea cawil-lak ti', tol ok tok walcan el k'anej Dios xolak anima, yujtol yuj jun ti', xan max quin jayi, ẍi bay eb.

English: So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
Kanjobal: Max ec' bay masanil yulak yet Galilea, cax max ec' yaloncan el k'anej Dios bay junjun nail bay chi wajbaj ba eb israel yin culto. Max yion c'apax can el espíritu yob yin anima.

English: A man with leprosy came to him and begged him on his knees, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak max jayoc bay Jesús, ya'ay yuj lepra. Max ay jajan jun winak tu', max yaloni: —Ta chi yal a c'ul, chi je' ak'on jaycan in c'ul, ẍi nak bay.

English: Filled with compassion, Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!”
Kanjobal: Axa Jesús, max ok' c'ul yin nak, cax max oc matxan Cham yin. —Chi yal in c'ul. Ti chi wak' jaycan a c'ul, ẍi bay nak.

English: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cured.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al yal axca tu xin, max watx'jican lepra tu'.

English: Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max cheklaycan pax nak yuj Jesús, cax max camc'ul Cham yalon bay nak axca ti':
