English: “See that you don't tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
Kanjobal: —Ab xin. Ayta bay al jun ti'. Asi', cha tx'ox a ba bay junok eb sacerdote, cax chak'on a xajanbal bay Dios, axca yalon ley Moisés. Axca tu' ok yun a txecloj elok tol mayal ach watx'ji, ẍi bay nak.

English: Instead he went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet the people still came to him from everywhere.
Kanjobal: Palta axa yet max toj nak, max c'oli yalon elok tzet max yun jaycan c'ul. Pilan max yalil masanil. Yuj tu xin, majxa je' yoc Jesús yul junjun conob, yujtol xiwil mac chi yochej chi jayoc bay Cham, xan a bay c'am anima max ec'c'al. Palta chi jayc'al oc eb petoj bay junjun lugar bay Cham.

English: Jesus then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.
Kanjobal: Max el Jesús bay Capernaum tu xin, max ec' yulak yet Judea. Max apni bay jun lugar bay k'axepal a' Jordán, cax max wajon pax ba eb anima bay tu' junelxa yin Cham, axa cuywaj bay eb tu' axcac'alta' is beybal.

English: Some Pharisees came and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb fariseo max jayoc bay, yujtol max yochej eb max ul yak'lej eb yikban ayc'ay Cham; xan max k'anlej eb bay Cham, ta ay leyal chi pojlej ba junok winak yetok yistzil.

English: “What did Moses command you?” he replied.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu': —¿Tzetbil yalon chekbanilej aycan yuj Moisés yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok? ẍi bay eb.

English: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb tu': —A Moisés tu', albilcan yuj, tol chi je' yak'on junok winak yunal pojlejbail bay yistzil, cax chi pojlen ba eb, ẍi eb bay.

English: “It was because your hearts were hard that Moses wrote you this law,” Jesus replied.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Yuj e pital, xan yalnakcan Moisés tu' jun chekbanil tu'.

English: “But at the beginning of creation God ‘made them male and female.’
Kanjobal: Palta yettaxc'al max watx'nej Dios yulyibank'inal ti', max watx'nej c'apax nak winak, yetok ix ix.

English: ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,
Kanjobal: Cax max yaloncan axca ti': A nak winak ok bekcan is mam c'al is txutx yuj junanen ba nak yetok yistzil,

English: and the two will become one flesh.’ So they are no longer two, but one.
Kanjobal: xan axca wal tol junxanej mimanilejal chi yuncan el eb cawanil, ẍi Dios. Xan manxa cawanok bey eb, palta tol junxanej chi yuncan el eb.

English: Therefore what God has joined together, let man not separate.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a eb junanebil yuj Dios, manchak pojlay ay eb yuj anima, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yoctok Jesús yul na yetok eb is cuywom xin, max k'anlen el eb bay, tzet chi yal elapnok jun tzet max yal tu'.

English: He answered, “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Tzanc'al mac chi pojlej ba yetok yistzil, cax chi yion junokxa ix, mul chi yunej, cax lanan yaon oc mul yul k'ab ix.

English: And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, tzanc'al mac ixal chi pojlej ba yetok yichamil, cax chi yion junokxa winak, mul c'apax chi yunej, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: People were bringing little children to Jesus to have him touch them, but the disciples rebuked them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, ay juntzan unin max ilay jay bay Jesús yuj eb anima, yuj yaontok Cham k'ab yiban eb; palta axa eb cuywom max tenon oc wanaj eb anima chi ion jay eb tu'.

English: When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon Jesús axca tu', max tit yowal yin eb, max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Chaek jay eb unin ayin. Man e tenoc wanaj eb, yujtol asan eb lajan nabal axca eb unin tu', asan eb ay yalon yet yoc yul k'ab Dios.

English: I tell you the truth, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, a mac man ok chaon Dios is yajawilok axca chi yut chaon junok unin, maj oc eb yul k'ab Cham, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: And he took the children in his arms, put his hands on them and blessed them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max c'oli lacon aj Cham eb unin tu'. Max yaon ajtok k'ab yiban eb, cax max k'anon watx'c'ulal Dios yiban eb.

English: As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
Kanjobal: Lananxa toj Jesús yul be, ay jun winak yanejxac'al max jay bay, max bekon ay jajnaj ba satak Cham, max yaloni: —Mamin Meẍtol watx', chin k'anlej ayach, ¿tzet yetal yowalil chi wunej, cax chin chaon k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal? ẍi bay Jesús.

English: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus answered. “No one is good–except God alone.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet yuj xan chin al watx'il? Jun ch'an mactxel watx', asan Dios.

English: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder, do not commit adultery, do not steal, do not give false testimony, do not defraud, honor your father and mother.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ojtak juntzan chekbanil Dios chi alon axca ti': Manchak a mak' cam et animail. Manchak ach elk'ani. Manchak a naaj k'anej yin et animail. Manchak aoc a mul yul k'ab estzil. Manchak et k'anenej et animail. Ayokab yelapnok a mam c'al a txutx yul a sat, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: “Teacher,” he declared, “all these I have kept since I was a boy.”
Kanjobal: —Mamin, chixa wikej masanil juntzan chekbanil tu' yet max in titoc yin uninal, ẍi bay Cham.

English: Jesus looked at him and loved him. “One thing you lack,” he said. “Go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoc t'anan Cham yin jun beyom tu', max cam c'ul Cham yin, cax yalon bay: —Juntowal a tz'aknaji. Asi', txoncan el masanil tzet ay ayach, cax cha pojontok tojol tu' xol eb meba'; catatu' bian ok a chaon a beyomal bay satcan. Lajwi tu xin, chach jay pax ayin junelxa, cax chach ec'c'al cuywok wintak, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: At this the man's face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben jun beyom axca tu', max cusaj c'ul sic'libil. Cusiltakxac'al c'ul yet max paxtok, yujtol xiwil tzet ay bay.

English: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
Kanjobal: Maxc'al pax xin, axa meltzojtek acan Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'. Max c'oli yalon axca ti': —A wal eb beyom ti', ta ok oc eb yul k'ab Dios, ya' puralil ok oc eb, ẍi bay eb.

English: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
Kanjobal: Max c'ayaj c'ul eb cuywom tu' yet max yaben eb axca tu'. Axa yalon Cham junelxa bay eb tu' axca ti': —Ex in cuywom, ta ok oc eb beyom yul k'ab Dios, yin ya' puralil ok oc eb.

English: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok no camello tinani', ¿xin ta chi eq'uel no' yul yixal junok acuẍa? Caytu' eb beyom, ta ok oc eb yul k'ab Dios, caw wal ya' puralil ok oc eb, ẍi bay eb.

English: The disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, “Who then can be saved?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb jun tu', tol max c'ayaj c'ul eb sic'libil, axa yalubtanen eb is xol tu': —Ta caytu' axca tu', ¿mac wal txel ok je' colchaji? ẍi eb.

English: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoc t'anan Jesús yin eb tu', max yaloni: —A jun ti', c'am junok anima chi je' yuj, palta a Dios chi je' yuj, yujtol masanil tzet yetal chic'al je' yuj Cham, ẍi.

English: Peter said to him, “We have left everything to follow you!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro tu' bay: —Mamin, ayon ti', max co bekcan masanil co tzetak yetal oj, cax max on ec'c'al cuywok entak, ẍi bay.

English: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus replied, “no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, tzanc'al mac chi bekcan yatut wujc'al, ma yuẍtak, ma yanab, ma is mam ma is txutx, ma yuninal, ma xin, is tx'otx' chi bekcan wujc'al, c'al yuj jun k'anejal yet colbanilej,

English: will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age (homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields–and with them, persecutions) and in the age to come, eternal life.
Kanjobal: caw mimanxa ok yut chaon is paktzil yet jun tiempoal ti'. Axca tol ok cha' cienok q'uexel yatut tu', yuẍtak, c'al yanab, is mam c'al is txutx, yuninal, c'al is tx'otx' tu'. Ok yab ton eb yail yuj eb anima, palta axa yet jun tiempoal ok jay yet yajtok tu', ok cha' eb k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
Kanjobal: Ay eb miman yelapnok co xol tinani', palta a yet yajtok tu', xiwil eb c'amxa jabok yelapnok. Ay pax eb xin, c'am jabok yelapnok co xol tinani', palta a yet tu', xiwil eb mimanxa yelapnok, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.
Kanjobal: Babel Jesús satak eb is cuywom yet lanan yajtok eb yul jun be chi ajapnok bay Jerusalén. A eb cuywom tu', toc'al chi c'ayaj c'ul eb. Axa juntzanxa anima ajun yetok eb xin, caw chi xiw eb. Axa yawten eltek Cham eb is cuywom tu' lajcawanil xol anima tu', max c'oli yalontek bay eb masanil tzet ok jay yiban.

English: “We are going up to Jerusalem,” he said, “and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles,
Kanjobal: Ilab lanan jajektok bay Jerusalén ti'. Ayin ti', caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta ok in alay oc yul k'ab eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al yul k'ab eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Axa yak'on low eb camich wiban tu', cax ok in yaon oc eb yul k'ab eb man israelok.

English: who will mock him and spit on him, flog him and kill him. Three days later he will rise.”
Kanjobal: Ok in is buch eb, ok tzublok oc eb win, ok in is mak' eb. Catatu' ok in yak'on cam eb, palta a yet yox c'ual tu', ok in ictzoj ajok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
Kanjobal: Max jayoc Jacobo yetok Juan, eb c'ajol Zebedeo c'atan Jesús, cax max yalon eb bay Cham axca ti': —Mamin, a tzet ok co k'an ayach, chi jochej chak' ayon, ẍi eb bay.

English: “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet chi yochej e c'ul chi wak' ayex? ẍi bay eb.

English: They replied, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”
Kanjobal: —A yet ok ach oc Yajawil, matawal chon a cha ay chotan on a c'atan, junok on bay a watx' k'ab, junok onxa bay a q'uexan, ẍi eb bay.

English: “You don't know what you are asking,” Jesus said. “Can you drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?”
Kanjobal: —Ayex ti', c'am chi nachaj el e yuj tzet che k'an ayin. ¿Ok mi techaj e yuj e yak'lay porobal, axca ok in utlayok? A wal tzet ok jay wiban, axca tol ok in ak'lay bautizar yuj, ¿xin ta ok techaj e yuj? ẍi bay eb.

English: “We can,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink and be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with,
Kanjobal: —Ok techajok, ẍi eb. —Yel toni, ok ex ak'lay porobal axca ok yun wak'lay porobal. Axca yailal ok eq'uel wiban, caytu' yailal ok eq'uel e yiban.

English: but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
Kanjobal: Palta ayin ti', c'am walon wet ex in chotban ay bay in watx' k'ab ma bay in q'uexan. Yujtol watx'xa yayji yuj co Mam Dios yuj mac eb t'inan ok ay chotan bay tu', ẍi bay eb.

English: When the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben lajonwanxa eb cuywom jun k'anej tu', max tit yowal eb yin Jacobo c'al yin Juan tu'.

English: Jesus called them together and said, “You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.
Kanjobal: Axa yawtentek Jesús eb lajcawanil tu' is c'atan. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Ti wal e yojtakxa, a eb ayoc yajawil bay junjun mimek conob, tojolc'al chekwaj eb. Cay c'apax tu' eb mimek winak xol conob, yajawxac'al chi yut ba eb yiban anima.

English: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
Kanjobal: Palta a co xol ayon ti', man axcaok tu' ok yunej. Ta ay mac chi yochej caw miman yikbej co xol, yowalil chi oc yak'omalok serbil eb yet cuywomal, catatu' bian, miman ton yikbej.

English: and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, ta ay mac co xol chi yochej tol miman yelapnok, yowalil chi oc mosejal bay eb yet cuywomal.

English: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol ayin ti', caxc'al Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, man yujok wak'lay serbil, xan max in jayi, palta yuj wak'wi serbil. Max in jay yuj ul wak'on in ba camok, yet watx' xiwil mactxel chi colchajcan el wuj, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (that is, the Son of Timaeus), was sitting by the roadside begging.
Kanjobal: Max apni Jesús bay conob Jericó yetok eb is cuywom. Axa yet max el eb bay tu', xiwil anima max toj yetok eb. A bay ti' be, ay jun winak chotan ayok, chi yik Bartimeo, chi yal elapnok c'ajol Timeo. A jun winak tu' c'am chi je' yilwi, xan chi k'anwi limosna bay anima.

English: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Kanjobal: Axa max yabeni, tol a Jesús aj Nazaret chi jay tu', max aj yaw yin ipejal, max yaloni: —Jesús, ach yinatil David, ¿c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul win? ẍi nak bay.

English: Many rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Kanjobal: Xiwil mac max tenchanen Bartimeo tu', yet watx' chi tz'inji nak, palta tol max ajc'al can yel yaw nak: —Ach yinatil David, ¿c'am mi chi ok' a c'ul win? ẍi nak bay.

English: Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” So they called to the blind man, “Cheer up! On your feet! He's calling you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoc wanaj Jesús, max yaloni: —Awtejektek nak ayin, ẍi bay eb tzakan oc yintak. Axa yawtelaytek nak tu': —Tzalojan, ajan wanok, chach yawtej Cham, ẍi eb bay.

English: Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.
Kanjobal: Max k'okoncan el nak is k'util bac'an oc yin tu'. Max aj lemnajok, max toj yin aymanil bay Cham.

English: “What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him. The blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to see.”
Kanjobal: Max k'anlen el Cham bay: —¿Tzet chi yochej a c'ul? ẍi bay nak. —Mamin Meẍtol, chi wochej chin ilwi, ẍi nak bay.

English: “Go,” said Jesus, “your faith has healed you.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.
Kanjobal: —Ilwancanok, yujtol max aoc Dios yin a c'ul. Chixa je' a paxi, ẍi bay nak. Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max ilwican nak yuj. Axa tzakloj nak yintak Jesús bay lanan toji.

English: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples,
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa yapni Jesús yetok eb is cuywom cawilal conob Jerusalén, bay tz'eyil Betfagé yetok Betania, bay cawilal tzalan Olivo, max chek babjok Jesús cawan eb is cuywom.

English: saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and just as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
Kanjobal: Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Babjanektok bay jun aldea co sataktok ti'. A yet ok ex apnok ocok, ay jun no ach'ej burro pixan ocok, ok ilchaj e yuj. C'amto junok mac chi aj junelok yiban no'. Che xuyilok cax che yiontek.

English: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ tell him, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here shortly.’ ”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi alon axca ti' ayex: ¿Tzet xan che xuyil no'? ta ẍi, tix che yut e yalon ti': Tol ok k'anabax no' yuj Cham Jajawil. Ayman ok ul jak'can no', quex chi, ẍi bay eb.

English: They went and found a colt outside in the street, tied at a doorway. As they untied it,
Kanjobal: Axa babji eb tu', max ilchaj no ach'ej burro tu' yuj eb. Pixan oc no' ti' jun na bay ti' be, axa xuyon el eb tu'.

English: some people standing there asked, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
Kanjobal: Ay mac ayic' bay tu', max k'anlen el eb bay eb cuywom tu' axca ti': —¿Tzet che yunej? ¿Tzet xan che xuyil no burro ti'? ẍi yutelay eb.

English: They answered as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them go.
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca max yun cuylay eb yuj Jesús, cax max beklaytek no' bay eb.

English: When they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, he sat on it.
Kanjobal: Max yiontek eb no' bay Cham. Max yaon ajtok eb is pichil tz'amok no', axa yaj Jesús yiban no' tu'.

English: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread branches they had cut in the fields.
Kanjobal: Yak'ban chi beyi, xiwil anima chi litx'baj ay is pichil satak yul be. Ay mac xin, k'ablak te' chi bet pak'tek cax chi yaon ay yul be tu'.

English: Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted, “Hosanna! ” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!”
Kanjobal: A eb babel satak, c'al eb tzakan oc yintak, chi aj yaw eb yuj tzalojc'ulal yin ipejal, chi yalon eb: —Yuj wal dios. Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Cham chekbiltek yuj Cham Jajawil.

English: “Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!” “Hosanna in the highest!”
Kanjobal: Jalek watx' k'anej yin Cham ok oc co yajawilok ti', axca max yun yoc jichmam David yin yajawilal payxa. Jak'ek yuj diosal bay Dios, ẍi eb.

English: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went to the temple. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni Jesús yul conob Jerusalén, max octok yul templo Dios. Max ec' t'ananok yin masanil tzetak yetal ay yul tu', palta yelc'ulalxac'al yay c'u, xan max meltzoj pax bay conob Betania yetok eb is cuywom lajcawanil.

English: The next day as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
Kanjobal: A yet max k'inibi aj yet junxa c'ual, yet petoj eb bay Betania, max tit is wajil Jesús yulak be.

English: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to find out if it had any fruit. When he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.
Kanjobal: Axa max yilontok najat, ay jun te higo, cax ay xak te'. Axa toj yilon tu'; tokc'al ay junok sat te' ayocok. Asanc'al xak te' ay, yujtol man tiempoalok yak'on te' sat.

English: Then he said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard him say it.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal yin te higo tu' axca ti': —C'amxa mactxel ok loon sat te', ẍi. Max yab eb cuywom yalon axca tu'.

English: On reaching Jerusalem, Jesus entered the temple area and began driving out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves,
Kanjobal: Catatu' bian max apni eb bay Jerusalén, cax max octok Jesús yul templo Dios. Max c'oli yukten eltek jantak eb chi txonji yul tu', c'al eb chi manji. Max tenon aj pac'labok meẍa eb q'uexom tumin, c'al ẍila eb txonom paloma.

English: and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.
Kanjobal: Majxa chaic' etxetxok junok mactxel yetok is tzetak yetal yul templo tu'.

English: And as he taught them, he said, “Is it not written: “ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli cuywaj nan xol eb tu' axca ti': —Albilcan yuj Dios axca ti' yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok: A in templo ti', ok al-lay yin tol nail txaj yayji yuj masanil conoblak, ẍi. Palta ayex ti', axcaxac'al junok nach'en bay chi c'ubaj el ba eb elk'om, caytu' che yutej, ẍi bay eb.

English: The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.
Kanjobal: A juntzan tzet max yun Jesús ti', max yab eb yajawil eb sacerdote, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Max xiwaj eb yuj, yujtol miman yelapnok juntzan is cuybej yul sat anima masanil, xan max say eb tzetbil chi yut yak'on camok.

English: When evening came, they went out of the city.
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max k'ekbican ayok, max el Cham yul conob tu' yetok eb is cuywom.

English: In the morning, as they went along, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ec' eb yet k'inibalil yet junxa c'ual cawilal te higo max catabnej Jesús ewi, mayal takaj te' yetokc'al is xe'.

English: Peter remembered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered!”
Kanjobal: Axa naontek Pedro tu', max yalon bay Jesús axca ti': —Mamin Meẍtol, ilab te higo a catabnejcan ewi, mayal takaj te', ẍi bay.

English: “Have faith in God,” Jesus answered.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Jesús bay: —Aek oc e c'ul yin Dios.

English: “I tell you the truth, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok ex che yal bay jun witz ti' axca ti': Elan cayti'. K'okaytok a ba yul a' mar, ta quex chi. Ta c'am che yak' cabc'ulal, ta che yaoc yin e c'ul tol ok yun axca che yal tu', wal yel ok yunej.

English: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
Kanjobal: Xan chi wal ayex, a yet chex txajli, che yaoc yin e c'ul tol ok e cha' tzet che k'an tu'. Ta che yaoc yin e c'ul, ok ak'lay ayex.

English: And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive him, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi oc is mul ayex, a yet chex txajli, joek c'ay is yobtakil tu' yin e c'ul. Ta caytu' che yutej, ok jolay c'apax c'ay e yobtakil yuj co Mam Dios, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They arrived again in Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders came to him.
Kanjobal: Axa yapni pax eb bay Jerusalén junelxa tu', max octok Jesús yul templo Dios, c'oli yec'jabc'al yul. Max oc c'apaxtok eb yajawil sacerdote yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, c'al eb ichamtak winak.

English: “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you authority to do this?”
Kanjobal: Cax max k'anlen eb bay Cham axca ti': —¿Tzet ekbej yuj tu xan max on juntzan ti ewi? ¿Mactxel ak'nej ekbej tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus replied, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Ay c'apax jun tzet yetal ok in k'anlej el ayex. Ta ok e tak'wej ayin, cax ok walon ayex mac ak'nej wikbej wunen juntzan ti'.

English: John's baptism–was it from heaven, or from men? Tell me!”
Kanjobal: ¿Mac ak'nej yikbej Juan xan max ak'wi bautizar anima, Dios mi, ma anima? Alek ayin, ẍi bay eb.

English: They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn't you believe him?’
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli yalubtanen eb is xol tu', cax max yalon eb axca ti': ¿Tzet wal chi jut jalon bay? Ta chi jala' tol a Dios ak'nej yikbej, a xam yalon ayon tu': ¿Tzet yuj xan maj e yapax oc yin e c'ul xin? ẍi mi.

English: But if we say, ‘From men’. . . .” (They feared the people, for everyone held that John really was a prophet.)
Kanjobal: Palta maj c'apax je' jaloni tol anima ak'nej yikbej, ẍi eb. Caytu' chi yut yalubtanen eb, yujtol chi xiw eb bay eb anima; yujtol a pax Juan tu', caw chekbej Dios yayji yul sat eb anima masanil.

English: So they answered Jesus, “We don't know.” Jesus said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal eb bay Jesús axca ti': —Man jojtakok mac ak'nej yikbej Juan tu', ẍi eb. —Ta caytu xin, maj wal c'apax ayex mac ak'nej wikbej wunen juntzan ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: He then began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and went away on a journey.
Kanjobal: Axa yalontek Jesús jun abix tx'oxom el cuybanilej. Max yalon axca ti': Ay jun winak max yaw juntzan uva sat jun is tx'otx'. Max coralneni, max watx'nen jun olan bay ok teq'uil yal yuva tu'. Max tz'akon c'apax aj jun ilbal uva xol tu'. Max lajwi tu', max yaoncantok is tx'otx' tu' majanil, yetokc'al yawojal bay juntzan mulnajwom. Max toj ec'jab bay junxa lugar najat.

English: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ajapnok tiempoal wajlay el an uva tu xin, max chekontok jun is chekbej bay eb mulnajwom tu', yuj toj chaon nak jantak yet cham t'inan yioni.

English: But they seized him, beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc nak xin, max tzac'ontek eb, max mak'on eb. Lajwic'al tu' cax max chekon pax eb, c'am jabok tzet max yi' nak.

English: Then he sent another servant to them; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully.
Kanjobal: Max chekontok cham aj tx'otx' tu' junxa is chekbej bay eb junelxa, palta max mak' yasjok eb jolom nak, caw yob max yut ba eb yin.

English: He sent still another, and that one they killed. He sent many others; some of them they beat, others they killed.
Kanjobal: Maxto wal chektok cham junxa. Axa junxa tu xin, max camxac'al yuj eb. Xiwiltoc'al juntzanxa eb max chektok. Ay eb toc'al max yasji mak'layi; ay eb xin, max camxac'al eb.

English: “He had one left to send, a son, whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
Kanjobal: Ay jun c'otan is c'ajol cham aj tx'otx' tu', caw chi camil c'ul cham yin. Yinxac'al tzunanil max chekon c'apaxtok cham is c'ajol tu'. Ok xiw eb bay in c'ajol ti', ẍi cham yul is c'ul.

English: “But the tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
Kanjobal: Palta a yet lanan yapni nak, max wajan alnen eb majan tx'otx'wom tu' axca ti': Ti chi jay is c'ajol cham aj tx'otx'. A yet ok cam is mam nak, a ok ioncan tx'otx' ti' satakok. Co mak'ek camok, ayonxa ok jican tx'otx' ti', ẍi eb.

English: So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
Kanjobal: Xan a yet max apni nak max mitx'on eb, cax max mak'on cam eb, cax max bet k'okoncan el eb tilak el tx'otx' tx'otx' tu'.

English: “What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.
Kanjobal: Chin k'anlej ayex xin, ¿tzettax ok utlay eb majan tx'otx'wom tu' yuj cham aj tx'otx' tu' che na'? Ok yak' cam cham eb, yet ok jayok, cax ok yaoncantok is tx'otx' tu' majanil bay juntzanokxa mactxel.

English: Haven't you read this scripture: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone;
Kanjobal: ¿Tom c'amto bay che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok bay chi yal axca ti': A ch'en ch'en max yintaknej el eb watx'nem na, a ch'en max oc yin jolom txiquin na.

English: the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
Kanjobal: A jun ti' max yun Cham Jajawil, cax chi c'ayaj co c'ul yuj, ẍi yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan tu'? ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Then they looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them. But they were afraid of the crowd; so they left him and went away.
Kanjobal: Max yak'lej eb mitx'on Jesús, yujtol max nachaj el yuj eb, tol a eb chi al-lay yuj jun abix tu'; palta chi xiw eb bay anima, xan max bekil eb Cham, axa paxtok eb tu'.

English: Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max cheklaytek jaywan eb fariseo yetok jaywan eb is partido Herodes bay Jesús yuj yak'len eb yikban ayc'ay Cham yuj junok tzet yetal chi yala', cax chi yak'on queja eb yaloni.

English: They came to him and said, “Teacher, we know you are a man of integrity. You aren't swayed by men, because you pay no attention to who they are; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?
Kanjobal: Maxc'al jay eb xin, max yalon eb bay: —Mamin Meẍtol, jojtak tol yel tzet chala'. Jojtak c'apaxok, tol jun lajanc'al chot a c'ul yin anima masanil, yujtol lajanc'al yelapnok eb yul a sat, cax chach cuywaj wal yin yel yin jun beybalej chi cha c'ul Dios. ¿Tzet cachi ach ti'? A ch'en tumin chi k'anlay el ayon yuj cham yajaw bay Roma, ¿ay mi leyal chi jak'a', ma c'amak? ¿Watx' mi chi jak' ch'en, ma c'amak cha na'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Should we pay or shouldn't we?” But Jesus knew their hypocrisy. “Why are you trying to trap me?” he asked. “Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
Kanjobal: Palta yojtakxa Cham tol cabsatil eb chi oni, xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che yak'lej in e yikban ayc'ayok? Iektek junok ch'en tumin tu' wila', ẍi bay eb.

English: They brought the coin, and he asked them, “Whose portrait is this? And whose inscription?” “Caesar's,” they replied.
Kanjobal: Axa yiontek eb jun tumin tu'; max k'anlen Jesús bay eb: —¿Mactxel jun ayoc yechel sat yin jun tumin ti'? ¿Mactxel jun ayoc is bi yin ch'en ti'? ẍi bay eb. —Yechel sat cham yajaw bay Roma yetokc'al is bi cham, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar what is Caesar's and to God what is God's.” And they were amazed at him.
Kanjobal: —Ak'ek tzet yetal yetc'alta' cham yajaw tu' bay cham xin. Axa tzet yetal yetc'alta' Dios, ak'ek c'apax bay, ẍi bay eb. A yet max yaben eb juntzan tu', toc'al max c'ayaj c'ul eb.

English: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max jay juntzan eb saduceo bay Jesús, a ton eb chi aloni tol c'am chi ictzoj aj eb camnak. Max yalon eb bay Cham axca ti':

English: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and have children for his brother.
Kanjobal: —Mamin Meẍtol, a Moisés tz'ibnejcan axca ti': K'inalok ay junok mac chi cami, cax chi can yistzil, palta c'am junok yuninal max elcanok. Axa junok nak uẍtakejal yowalil chi ion ix, yet watx' ta chi el yuninal junxa tu', axca tol yuninal nak max cam tu' chi yun yoqui. Caytu' max yut yaloncan Moisés.

English: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died without leaving any children.
Kanjobal: A junel, ay ukwan winak yuẍtakc'al ba. Max oc yistzil nak babel winak, palta max camtok nak, c'amc'al yuninal nak max elcanok.

English: The second one married the widow, but he also died, leaving no child. It was the same with the third.
Kanjobal: Axa junxa nak uẍtakejal max ioncan ix. Max cam c'apaxtok junxa nak tu', ac'ala' c'am c'apax yuninal max elcanok. Ac'ala' max yun nak yet is yox uẍtakejal.

English: In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.
Kanjobal: Yukwanil eb nak max yilejc'al ix. C'amc'al eb max elcan junok yuninal. Lajwi camtok eb nak yukwanil xin, cax max cam c'apax ix.

English: At the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”
Kanjobal: A yet ok ictzoj aj eb camnak tu xin, ¿mac wal junok yel wali ay yalon yet yin ix? Yujtol maxc'al yilej eb nak ix yukwanil, ẍi eb saduceo tu'.

English: Jesus replied, “Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Caw wal che yak' c'aytok e ba, yujtol man e yojtakok tzet ẍi tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok. Man e yojtakok c'apaxok jantak wal mayk'ak'al Dios.

English: When the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.
Kanjobal: A yet ok ictzoj aj eb camnak tu', tok okto yilej ba eb anima, yujtol axcaxa eb ángel bay satcan ok yuncan el eb.

English: Now about the dead rising–have you not read in the book of Moses, in the account of the bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
Kanjobal: Palta toc'alta' txequelxa yayji tol ok ictzoj aj eb camnak. ¿Tom c'am bay che yil tzet tz'ibbilcan yuj Moisés yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan xin, yuj tzet max yal Dios yet max k'anjab eltek xol k'ak' k'ak' yin te q'uix? Max yalon Dios bay Moisés axca ti': Ayin ti' is Diosal in Abraham, Isaac, c'al Jacob, ẍi.

English: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan jojtak tol maj c'ayil eb, yujtol max yalcanok tol is Diosal eb yayji. Yuj tu xin, caw che yak' c'aytok e ba, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating. Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer, he asked him, “Of all the commandments, which is the most important?”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jun meẍtol yin ley Moisés max jay bay Cham, tol max yab teyelen ba eb saduceo tu' yetok Jesús. Max yabej tol watx' max yut paktzen Cham is k'anlebal eb, xan max yak' c'apax jun is k'anlebal bay Cham axca ti': —¿Mactet junok chekbanilej yel miman yelapnok yintak masanil? ẍi nak bay.

English: “The most important one,” answered Jesus, “is this: ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Cham bay: —Tix ton jun chekbanilej ec'ban yintak masanil ti': Abek xin ex wet israelal, a Cham Jajawil co Diosal, junnej ton Cham.

English: Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
Kanjobal: Camc'ulnejek Cham Jajawil co Diosal yin masanil e c'ul, c'al yin masanil e yanimail, c'al yin masanil e nabal, c'al yetok masanil e yip, ẍi.

English: The second is this: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no commandment greater than these.”
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' junxa ok wal ti', txenxa man lajanok yetok jun babel tu': Che ya'ilnej e yet animail axca chi yut e ya'ilnen e ba junjun ex, ẍi. C'am junokxa chekbanilej yel miman yelapnok yintak cab ti', ẍi Jesús.

English: “Well said, teacher,” the man replied. “You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon nak cuywom yin ley tu' bay: —Watx' ton Mamin, yel ton chala'. Junnej ton Dios, cax c'am junokxa.

English: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
Kanjobal: Yowalil ton chi co camc'ulnej Dios yin masanil co c'ul, yin masanil co nabal, yin masanil janimail, c'al yin masanil jip. Yetok c'apaxok, yowalil chi co ya'ilnej eb jet animail axca chi jut co ya'ilnen co ba junjun on ti'. A cab ti', ec'ban yelapnok yintak masanil xajanbal chi ak'lay tz'a satak Dios c'al masanil sabalej chi ak'lay bay, ẍi nak.

English: When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús tol watx' max yut tak'wok ba nak bay, max yalon bay axca ti': —Jabxanej wal oc yul k'ab Dios, ẍi bay. Yuj tu xin, c'am junokxa mac max tec'baj ba k'anlen junokxa tzet yetal bay Cham.

English: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he asked, “How is it that the teachers of the law say that the Christ is the son of David?
Kanjobal: A yet max cuywaj Jesús yul templo Dios junel, max yal axca ti': —¿Tzet xan chi yal eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés tol a Cristo yinatil David? ẍi eb.

English: David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
Kanjobal: Yujtol a David tu', ak'bil yal yuj Cham Espíritu Santo axca ti': Max yal Dios Jajawil bay Cham Wajawil: Ayan chotan bay in watx' k'ab ti', masantac'al ok wacan oc eb ajc'ul oc en yalan akan, ẍi Dios bay Cham Wajawil, ẍi David.

English: David himself calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?” The large crowd listened to him with delight.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yalon David tu', tol a Cristo, is Yajawil yayji. Yuj tu', txequel tol man asannejok tol yinatil David yayji Cham, ẍi Jesús bay eb. Xiwil anima max aben cuywaj Cham, cax max tzalojxac'al aj eb yabeni.

English: As he taught, Jesus said, “Watch out for the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted in the marketplaces,
Kanjobal: A yet lanan cuywaj Jesús xol anima tu', max yal bay eb axca ti': Che yilc'al e ba, yujtol a eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, caw ay is may beybal eb. Chi cha c'ul eb yec' tok'ok'ok yetok is jokan pichil chi yaocok. A yet chi yion ay ba anima bay eb yulak calle, watx'xac'al chi yab eb.

English: and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
Kanjobal: A bay nail wajayil eb yin culto, asan bay chi ay chotan eb mimek winak chi yochej eb chi ay chotanok. A yet chi oc pax mimek loj, asan bay chi ay eb mimek winak chi ay eb.

English: They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. Such men will be punished most severely.”
Kanjobal: Chi yion ec' eb yatut eb ix camnakxa yichamil. Chi lajwinaj tu', najat chi yut eb yakan is txaj, yet watx' chi na eb anima tol watx' eb. Yuj tu', yel miman yailal ok cha eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts.
Kanjobal: Chotan ay Jesús yul templo junel, bay cawilal chabal ofrenda, max yilonc'al yaon aytok anima is yofrenda. Xiwil eb beyom mimantak chi yut yaon aytok yet.

English: But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a fraction of a penny.
Kanjobal: Lanantoc'al wal tu', max jay jun xal ix camnakxa yichamil, cax meba' ch'an xal. Max yaon aytok xal cab melyu centavo yet, caw jab wal ch'an yet xal tu'.

English: Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others.
Kanjobal: Axa yawtentek Jesús eb is cuywom tu', max yalon bay eb: —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a jun xal meba' ix camnakxa yichamil ti', ec'ban yofrenda xal max ec' yaytok yintakc'al masanil eb max ec' yaytok yet yul chabal ofrenda ti'.

English: They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything–all she had to live on.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol junjunc'al mactxel, sobrailxac'al tumin eb max ec' yaytok. Axa jun xal ti xin, caw wal meba' ton xal; palta echc'al max yaytok xal is tumin yin ofrendail, ẍi bay eb.

English: As he was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher! What massive stones! What magnificent buildings!”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yeltek Jesús yul templo Dios, max yalon jun is cuywom bay axca ti': —Meẍtol, ila wal junjun juntzan ch'en ti', yetok juntzan na ti', caw mimek, ẍi bay.

English: “Do you see all these great buildings?” replied Jesus. “Not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay tu': —Chi wal ayach tol a juntzan mimek na chel ti', c'al juntzan ch'en latz'bil aj ti', c'amxa junok ok cancan yiban yet ch'enal. Pilan ok ec' bulnajok, ẍi bay.

English: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John and Andrew asked him privately,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max toj eb bay jun tzalan Olivo, a is paq'uil tu', a tu' ay templo Dios. Max ay chotan Jesús bay tzalan tu xin, axa Pedro yetok Jacobo, Juan c'al Andrés, max k'anlej el eb bay yet ayic' eb tx'oklil yetok, axca ti':

English: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled?”
Kanjobal: —Chi jochej chal ayon, ¿bak'in wal ok jay jun max al ayon tu'? ¿Tzet yechelej ok tx'ox Dios, yet toxaxac'al ok yun juntzan tu'? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus said to them: “Watch out that no one deceives you.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu': Aj nabalc'al che yut e ba, yet watx' c'am junok mactxel ok ion aytek e sat,

English: Many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and will deceive many.
Kanjobal: yujtol xiwil mac ok banoc in bi yiban: Ayin ton Cristo in, ẍi eb, ok tz'ak yalon eb. Xiwil anima ok yiaytek eb sat.

English: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
Kanjobal: Ok e yab yoc mimek owal. Ok e yaben k'umal juntzanxa ijan chi oqui, palta manchak ex xiwi, yujtol yowalil caytu' ok ujok. Manto lajubok yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay juntzan mimek conob ok yak'lej owal yetok yet mimek conobal. Ok yak'len aj eb yajaw owal yetok yet yajawilal. Xiwil bay ok ec' quixcab. Ok jay mimek wajil yiban anima. A juntzan tu', yichbanil yatakilalixtoc'al yayji. Ay wal juntzanxa ok jayok.

English: “You must be on your guard. You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues. On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.
Kanjobal: Ayex ti xin, tec'anc'al che yut e ba, yujtol ok ex alay oc yul k'ab eb k'umbalbawom. Ok ex mak' eb yul nail bay chi wajbaj ba eb jet israelal yin culto. Ok ex yitok eb satak eb yajaw, c'al satak eb rey, yujtol max e yaoc e c'ul win. Caytu' ok yun jay e yiban xin, yet watx' ok je' e yaloncan el wabixal bay eb.

English: And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.
Kanjobal: Yowalil babel ok alchajcan el k'anejal yet colbanilej bay junjun conob, catatu' ok jay lajubal.

English: Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
Kanjobal: A yet ok ex ilaytok satak eb yajaw tu', manchak e na' yin ayokto yuj tzet ok e yala', tamwal chex oc il yuj. A tzet ok ak'lay e yal yuj Dios yet jun bek tu', a che yala'. Yujtol mayexnak ok ex k'anjabok, palta a Cham Espíritu Santo ok k'anjab el e yin.

English: “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.
Kanjobal: Ay eb uẍtakejal, ok yaoc yuẍtak yul k'ab camich. Ay c'apax eb mamej, caytu' ok yut ba yin is yuninal. Ay eb uninalej ok yak'lej owal yetok is mam, c'al is txutx, cax ok yaon oc eb yul k'ab camich.

English: All men will hate you because of me, but he who stands firm to the end will be saved.
Kanjobal: Masanilxac'al anima ok chichonbok oc c'ul e yin, yujtol max e yaoc e c'ul win, palta a mac tec'anc'al waayi masantac'al chi yal cami, a ton eb tu' ok colchajok.

English: “When you see ‘the abomination that causes desolation’ standing where it does not belong–let the reader understand–then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
Kanjobal: Palta ok jay jun etnewom yajbil el yuj Dios. A mac chi ilon aj jun abix ti', nachajokab el yuj. A yet ok il-layok tol ayic' jun tu' bay tol man is mojok yayji ec'ok, tokokab eb ayic' bay Judea bay tzalanlak.

English: Let no one on the roof of his house go down or enter the house to take anything out.
Kanjobal: Axa mac ayajtok yiban pananil yatut yet jun c'ual tu', manchakxa aytek, cax manchakxa octok yul yatut tu' yiontowal eltek jabokxa is tzetak yetal, cax chi toj elok.

English: Let no one in the field go back to get his cloak.
Kanjobal: Yetok eb ayic' xol is mulnajil, manchakxaokab meltzoj yintak toj yion is pichil.

English: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ok'bal c'ul eb ix yobix, yetok eb ayto yune' chi yak' txutxwok.

English: Pray that this will not take place in winter,
Kanjobal: Tewanek bay Dios, tol manokab nabil k'inalok yet ok ex el tu'.

English: because those will be days of distress unequaled from the beginning, when God created the world, until now–and never to be equaled again.
Kanjobal: Yujtol axca jun miman yailal ok jay yet jun tiempoal tu', c'amto bay maxax uj junelok, yecheltaxc'al max watx'nej Dios yulyibank'inal ti'. Asan ch'an junel tu', c'amxa bak'in ok uj junelxa axca tu'.

English: If the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened them.
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi c'otxbaj Dios jun tiempoal yailal tu', c'am junok mac ok colchajcan el yul k'ab camich, palta yuj is camc'ulal yin eb sic'bilxa el yuj, xan ok c'otxbanej.

English: At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac ok alon ayex axca ti': Ilekto wali, tix Cham Cristo ayic' cayti', ta ẍi; ma Ilekto wali, tix ayic' bay tu', ta ẍi e yutelayi, manchak e cha' e yabej.

English: For false Christs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and miracles to deceive the elect–if that were possible.
Kanjobal: Yujtol ay juntzan eb ok tz'ak yaloc ba Cristoal, ok tx'oxaj ba, c'al juntzan eb ok tz'ak yaloc ba chekbejok Dios. Ok tz'ak tx'ox eb yechelej, c'al milagro, yuj yion aytek sat eb anima. Toltax a eb sic'bilxa el yuj Dios, ijanxac'al ok ayc'ay eb yuj eb.

English: So be on your guard; I have told you everything ahead of time.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti', tec'anc'al che yut e ba. Ayokto chi waloncan masanil juntzan ti' ayex.

English: “But in those days, following that distress, “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light;
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', a yet ok lajwok ec' jun miman yailal tu', ok k'ekk'olil yakan c'u, c'amxa c'apax sakk'inal xajaw.

English: the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’
Kanjobal: Cax ok titc'ay waycan satcan; yetokc'al juntzan tzet yetal ay is yipalil bay satcan, ok tzicobtanelayok.

English: “At that time men will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
Kanjobal: Ok lajwok tu xin, axa yilon eb anima tu' wayol xol asun, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'. Ok in jay yetok masanil wikbej, c'al in mayk'ak'al.

English: And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens.
Kanjobal: Ok in chek eb wángel, cax ok ec' wajon aj eb eb sic'bil el wuj bay masanil yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
Kanjobal: Abek jun abix ok waltek yuj te higo. A yet chi uninbi k'ablak te', yet lananxa tit xak te', e yojtakxa tol toxa chi oc nabil k'inal.

English: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that it is near, right at the door.
Kanjobal: Cayton tu', a yet ok e yilon jay juntzan ti', nachajokab el e yuj, tol toxa chin jayi.

English: I tell you the truth, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, mantoc'al cam anima ayic' yet jun tiempoal ti', cax ok yunen masanil juntzan max wal ti'.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
Kanjobal: A satcan c'al yulyibank'inal ti' ok lajwok, palta a in k'anej man ok ec' tzet chi yala'.

English: “No one knows about that day or hour, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
Kanjobal: Palta c'am mac ojtaknej tzet c'ual, c'al jantak hora ok in jayok. A eb ángel bay satcan, man yojtakok eb. Ayin ti', ti pax wal C'ajol in Dios, palta man wojtakok. Asan Cham Dios Mamej yojtak.

English: Be on guard! Be alert! You do not know when that time will come.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', caw aj nabal che yut e ba, makwajanek, yujtol man e yojtakok bak'in ok jay tiempoal jun tu'.

English: It's like a man going away: He leaves his house and puts his servants in charge, each with his assigned task, and tells the one at the door to keep watch.
Kanjobal: Axca ton junok winak chi toj ec'jab najat, chi can yatut. Chi yaloncan bay eb is moso tzet chi yuncan junjun eb, cax chi yalon c'apax can bay nak taynem puerta, tol chi taynej nak puerta tu' sic'libil.

English: “Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back–whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or at dawn.
Kanjobal: Axca eb mosejal tu' cayex tu', man e yojtakok bak'in ok in jayok, ma tol k'ekbintakil, ma chuman ak'bal, ma yet lananxa yok' no caẍlan, ma a wal sakbi el xin. Yuj tu', makwajanekc'al,

English: If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.
Kanjobal: yet watx' manokab axcaok tol waynak ex elok, cax ok in jay tzac'najok.

English: What I say to you, I say to everyone: ‘Watch!’ ”
Kanjobal: A juntzan chi wal ayex ti', chi wal bay masanil anima c'apaxok: Makwajanekc'al, ẍi Jesús.

English: Now the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread were only two days away, and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for some sly way to arrest Jesus and kill him.
Kanjobal: Cabejokxac'al yoc k'in Pascua eb israel, yet chi loon eb ixim pan c'am yich, axa wajban oc ba eb yajawil sacerdote tu', yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés. Max c'oli lajtinen eb tzetbil chi yut mitx'on eb Jesús yin ewantakil, cax chi yak'on cam eb yaloni:

English: “But not during the Feast,” they said, “or the people may riot.”
Kanjobal: Max yalon eb axca ti': —Maj je' co mitx'on yul k'in, yujtol ay is may ok tit yowal eb anima jin yuj, ẍi eb.

English: While he was in Bethany, reclining at the table in the home of a man known as Simon the Leper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head.
Kanjobal: Ayic' Jesús bay Betania, bay yatut Simón, jun ya'ay yet yalantok yuj lepra. Chotan ay Jesús lowi, max jayoc jun ix ix bay. Yetbi oc ix jun ch'en alabastro, nojnak yuj jun ambal suk'uk'i jab chi yik nardo, caw can is tojol. Max jayc'al ix, max bijon el ix nuk' ch'en, max tobon ajtok ix yiban jolom Jesús.

English: Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another, “Why this waste of perfume?
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun cawan eb ayic' xol eb ayic' bay tu' max tit yowal; axa yalon eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan toc'al chi etnelay el jun ambal suk'uk'i jab ti'?

English: It could have been sold for more than a year's wages and the money given to the poor.” And they rebuked her harshly.
Kanjobal: Aktam tol max txonlay elok, cax max pojlay ec' tojol xol eb meba', yujtol a jun ti' ec'ban mi junok 300 denario is tojol, ẍi eb. Caw wal max tzulay ix yuj eb.

English: “Leave her alone,” said Jesus. “Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Bekek e yalon jun ti' axca tu', ¿tzet yuj xan yob che yal bay ix? A jun max yun ix win ti', caw watx'.

English: The poor you will always have with you, and you can help them any time you want. But you will not always have me.
Kanjobal: A eb meba' che yal tu', ayc'al ec' eb e yetok. A yet ok e yochen e yak'on junok tzet yetal bay eb, ok je' e yak'oni; palta ayin ti', man tojbalk'inalok ayin ec' e yetok.

English: She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial.
Kanjobal: Atac'ala' tzet max je' yuj ix yak'on ayin, a max yak' ix. Ayokto chi yaon oc ix jun suk'uk'i jab ti' yin in mimanil ti', yet watx' watx'xa wayji cax chin toj muklayok.

English: I tell you the truth, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tzanc'al tzet lugaril yulyibank'inal ti' bay ok al-lay el k'anejal yet colbanilej, ok al-lay c'apax el yabixal jun tzet max yun ix ix ti', yuj nalaytek ix, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.
Kanjobal: A Judas Iscariote, nak ayoc tz'akilok eb lajcawan cuywom Jesús, a' max betic' k'anjab yetok eb yajawil sacerdote yuj bet lajtinen yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb.

English: They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money. So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb, caw wal max tzaloj aj eb, xan max yak' eb ti' yak'on tumin bay Judas tu'. Axa c'oli sayon nak tzet ok yut yaon oc Jesús yul k'ab eb tu'.

English: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb, Jesus' disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
Kanjobal: A yet babel c'ual jun k'in yet chi lolay ixim pan c'am yich, yet chi ak'lay cam no calnel yet Pascua, max yak' eb cuywom Jesús tu' jun k'anlebal ti' bay: —¿Baytal chochej chi toj co watx'nej junok lugar bay ok on lowok, yuj co naontek Pascua ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: So he sent two of his disciples, telling them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
Kanjobal: Axa chekontok cawan is cuywom tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Asek bay conob. Ay jun winak ok e yil yin bay tu', ibil oc jun moc aej yuj. Chex tzaklojc'al yintak.

English: Say to the owner of the house he enters, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
Kanjobal: A bay chi apni ocok, che yal bay cham aj na tu' axca ti': Tix max yut yalon Cham co Meẍtol ti ayon: ¿Baytal ay jun cuarto bay ok in low yetok eb in cuywom, yuj co naontek Pascua ti'? ẍi, quex chi bay.

English: He will show you a large upper room, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
Kanjobal: Axa tx'oxon jun mimantak cuarto can ayex, tol watx'nebilxa elok. A tu' che watx'nej tzet ok co lo' tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: The disciples left, went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
Kanjobal: Axa toj eb cuywom tu', max apni eb xol conob. Max ilchaj yuj eb axcac'al max yut yalon Jesús bay eb. Axa watx'nen eb tzet ok lo' eb yuj Pascua tu'.

English: When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.
Kanjobal: Axa yet k'ekbintakil xin, max apni Cham yetok eb is cuywom lajcawanil tu'.

English: While they were reclining at the table eating, he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me–one who is eating with me.”
Kanjobal: A yet lanan low eb yin meẍa tu', max yalon Jesús bay eb axca ti': —Wal yel chi wal ayex, a jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich, ayic' co xol ti', lanan low jetok, ẍi bay eb.

English: They were saddened, and one by one they said to him, “Surely not I?”
Kanjobal: Axa cusaj eb yet max yaben eb jun k'anej tu', xan junjunal max yut k'anlen el eb bay: —¿Mayin mi nak ayin ti'? ẍi eb yin junjunal.

English: “It is one of the Twelve,” he replied, “one who dips bread into the bowl with me.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —A e xol e lajcawanil ay. Lanan low wetok yul jun plato ayay co nan ti'.

English: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, palta yowalil ok in cam axca yal-laycan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, palta ok'bal wal c'ul jun ok in aon oc yul k'ab camich tu'. Yel watx' yet, k'inalok ta majc'alta' aljok, ẍi bay eb.

English: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take it; this is my body.”
Kanjobal: Lanan wal low eb, max yion aj Jesús ixim pan. Max yalon yuj diosal yuj ixim. Max lajwi tu', max bijon ayok, max yak'on bay eb. —Loek, a ton in mimanil ti', ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he took the cup, gave thanks and offered it to them, and they all drank from it.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yion c'apax aj jun vaso. A yet max lajwi yalon yuj diosalil yuj, max yaontok bay eb. Masanil eb, max wajan uc'nej eltek eb tzet ayay yul tu'. Max yal Jesús axca ti':

English: “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many,” he said to them.
Kanjobal: A ton jun ti' in chiq'uil. A yuj, xan ok yun jun is cab trato Dios. Ok el in chiq'uil ti', yet watx' xiwil mac ok colchaj yuj.

English: “I tell you the truth, I will not drink again of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it anew in the kingdom of God.”
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'amxa bay ok wuc' yal uva, atoc'al yet ok oc Dios Yajawilal, cax ok wuq'uen jun ato watx'ji, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Kanjobal: Max xew bitnen eb jun bit chi bitnej ta' eb bay Dios, axa toj eb bay tzalan Olivo tu'.

English: “You will all fall away,” Jesus told them, “for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
Kanjobal: A tu' max yal Jesús bay eb axca ti': —A yet jun ak'bal ti', ok cabax aj e c'ul win e masanil. Caytu' yaloncan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Ok wak' cam Cham ilom calnel, axa no calnel tu', ok saklemcantok no', ẍi.

English: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet mayal in ictzoj pax ajok, ok babjok in toj e satak bay Galilea, ẍi bay eb.

English: Peter declared, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Pedro tu' bay: —Caxc'al mi chi cabax aj c'ul eb masanil ti' en, palta ayin ti', majc'al cabax aj in c'ul en, ẍi.

English: “I tell you the truth,” Jesus answered, “today–yes, tonight–before the rooster crows twice you yourself will disown me three times.”
Kanjobal: —Wal yel chi wal ayach, a yet jun ak'bal ti', oxelxa quin eon el en yin aloni, tol mayin ojtakok, cax ok ok' no caẍlan yet cayelal, ẍi bay.

English: But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the others said the same.
Kanjobal: Palta a Pedro tu xin, max tec'bajc'al ba yaloni, tol man ok cabax aj c'ul. —Caxc'al ok in cam etok, palta tutun maj ach wiel win, ẍi bay. Jun lajanc'al yalon eb cuywom tu' masanil axca tu'.

English: They went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa jayoc Jesús yetok eb is cuywom tu' bay jun lugar chi yik Getsemaní. Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Ayanekcan chotan cayti', yak'ban chin toj txajlok, ẍi bay eb.

English: He took Peter, James and John along with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.
Kanjobal: Asan Pedro yetok Jacobo c'al Juan max yitok yetok. Axa c'oli cusaj tu', c'al yoc yin bilc'ulal.

English: “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death,” he said to them. “Stay here and keep watch.”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —Ijan chin cam yuj cusc'ulal chi wabej. Cananek cayti', iquisokab ex wetok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him.
Kanjobal: Max jitzontok ba janic'xa sataktok, cax max ay nojan sat tx'otx'. Max txajli yuj k'anoni, ta chi je' c'am chi jay jun yailal tu' yiban.

English: “Abba, Father,” he said, “everything is possible for you. Take this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
Kanjobal: Max yal yin is txaj axca ti': Ach in Mam, masanilc'al tzet yetal chic'al je' oj. Mata chi je' c'am chi jay jun yailal tu' wiban, palta manchak yun wochwan ayin ti', aokab ochwan chi yunej, ẍi.

English: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. “Simon,” he said to Peter, “are you asleep? Could you not keep watch for one hour?
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa jayoc bay eb oxwan tu', palta axa max yiloni, lanan way eb, xan max yal bay Pedro axca ti': —Simón, ¿tom lanan a wayi? ¿Tom maj je' a tec'ban a ba bay wayan junok hora wetok?

English: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the body is weak.”
Kanjobal: Iek el e wayan. Txajlanek, yet watx' c'am chex ayc'ayi, yet ay mac chi yak'lej ex yikban yin yobtakil. A janimail tec'an ton waayi, palta co mimanil, c'am chi techaj yuj, ẍi bay eb.

English: Once more he went away and prayed the same thing.
Kanjobal: Axa toj Cham txajlok junelxa tu'. Axcac'al max yut txajlok ba babelal, caytu' max bet yut txajlok ba junelxa.

English: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to him.
Kanjobal: Axa max jay junelxa, ac'ala' chi way eb, yujtol caw c'am chi techaj wayan yuj eb. Majxa nachaj tzet chi yut tak'wok ba eb bay.

English: Returning the third time, he said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
Kanjobal: Axa yet mayal betic' txajlok yet yoxelal, max yalon bay eb axca ti': —¿Tom ac'ala' e wayi? ¿Tom comon xewilal che yunej? K'okbilxa, mayal ajapnok yorail walay oc yul k'ab eb yobtakwom, ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti'.

English: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”
Kanjobal: Ajanek wan, tonek. Chi jay nak ok in aon oc yul k'ab eb wajc'ul, ẍi bay eb.

English: Just as he was speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, appeared. With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders.
Kanjobal: Lananto wal yalon tu', max jayoc Judas, nak max oclej tz'akilok eb lajcawan. Xiwil anima max jayoc yetok. Ay eb yetbi oc yespada, ay eb yetbi te'. Chekbiltek eb yuj eb yajawil sacerdote, eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yetok eb icham winak ay yikbej.

English: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.”
Kanjobal: A Judas tu', albilxa yuj, tzet ok yut tx'oxon ocok; max yal bay eb axca ti': —A jun ok in tz'ubil is ti', a ton jun tu' che mitx'a'. C'anani che yutej che yiontok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan palanc'al jay yin Jesús. —Meẍtol, ẍi bay Cham. Axa toj tz'ubnaj yin ti' Cham tu'.

English: The men seized Jesus and arrested him.
Kanjobal: Max oc bulnaj eb yin, max mitx'on eb, axa yiontok eb preso tu'.

English: Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
Kanjobal: Axa eb ajun yetok, ay jun max tzac'ajtek yespada. Max tzoc'on el txiquin jun is moso cham sat sacerdote.

English: “Am I leading a rebellion,” said Jesus, “that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb anima max apni oc bulnaj yin tu' axca ti': —¿Tom yajaw in xol eb yob nabal che yila', xan ibil oc e yespada c'al e te' chin ul e mitx'oni?

English: Every day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
Kanjobal: Junjunc'al c'u max in cuywaj e xol yul templo Dios, palta maj in e mitx' pax bay tu'. Axca ton ti' chi uj xin, yuj yunen tzet tz'ibbilcan yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then everyone deserted him and fled.
Kanjobal: Max bekcan eb cuywom tu' Cham tx'oklil, max toj eb el masanil.

English: A young man, wearing nothing but a linen garment, was following Jesus. When they seized him,
Kanjobal: Palta ay jun nak ach'ej tzakanc'al yintak Cham. T'eban octok yul jun sábana chulan oc yin, max oc mitx'naj eb yin nak.

English: he fled naked, leaving his garment behind.
Kanjobal: Palta max bekcan nak an sábana tu' yul k'ab eb, axa yel t'irt'on nak tu'.

English: They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, elders and teachers of the law came together.
Kanjobal: Axa yiontok eb Jesús bay cham sat sacerdote tu'. Ata bay tu' max waj ba masanil eb yajawil sacerdote, yetok eb icham winak, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés.

English: Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire.
Kanjobal: Axa pax Pedro xin, najat tzakan yintak Jesús, masantac'al max yal yapni oc bay yamak'il yatut cham sat sacerdote tu'. Axa yay chotan k'aẍnok yetok eb policía yina tu'.

English: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find any.
Kanjobal: A eb yajawil sacerdote, c'al masanil eb sat yajaw, max say eb juntzanok k'anej chi naaj yin Jesús, yet watx' chi low camich yiban yuj eb, palta c'amc'al tzet max ilchaj el yin.

English: Many testified falsely against him, but their statements did not agree.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb max yak'lej naon aj k'anej yiban Cham, palta tx'ok tx'okc'al tzet chi yal junjun, xan maj chalej ba yalon eb.

English: Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
Kanjobal: Ay jun cawan eb max yak'lej yaj wan yuj naon aj eb k'anej yin Cham, max yalon eb axca ti':

English: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this man-made temple and in three days will build another, not made by man.’ ”
Kanjobal: —Ayon ti', max jab yalon axca ti': Ayin ti', ok wuchay jun templo Dios watx'nebil yuj anima ti'. A yet cabjial tu' ok watx'jok aj q'uexel wuj, man animaok ok watx'nenok, ẍi, max jabej, ẍi eb.

English: Yet even then their testimony did not agree.
Kanjobal: Palta tokc'al yuj tu' chi chalej ba yalon eb.

English: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan cham sat sacerdote tu' nan xol eb, max yalon bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Tom c'am chach tak'wi jabok? ¿Tom c'am chab juntzan chi yal eb ti' en? ẍi bay.

English: But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
Kanjobal: Palta tz'inc'al ẍi, majc'al tak'wok. Axa yalon cham bay junelxa tu': —¿Tom ach Cristo ach? ¿Tom ach C'ajol ach Dios, Cham chi al-lay watx' k'anej yin? ẍi bay.

English: “I am,” said Jesus. “And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
Kanjobal: —Ja', ayin toni. Ayin ton Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', ok in e yil yet chotan in ay bay watx' k'ab Dios, Cham Miman yikbej. Ok e yil c'apax wayol satcan xol asun, ẍi.

English: The high priest tore his clothes. “Why do we need any more witnesses?” he asked.
Kanjobal: Axa nic'ontok cham janic' is pichil tu', cax max yalon cham axca ti': —¿Tzetto wal chi oc testigo juj tinani'?

English: “You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?” They all condemned him as worthy of death.
Kanjobal: Mayal jabej tol caw chi buchwaj yin Dios. ¿Tzet quex chi yuj tinani'? ẍi. —Moj chi cami, ẍi eb masanil.

English: Then some began to spit at him; they blindfolded him, struck him with their fists, and said, “Prophesy!” And the guards took him and beat him.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu', ay eb max tzubli oc yin, cax max makchen eb sat, max c'oli mak'on eb, cax chi yalon eb bay: —Nailok mac max ach mak'oni, ẍi eb bay. Max lajwi tu', axa eb policía max mak'on wal sic'libil.

English: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came by.
Kanjobal: Ayic' Pedro bay yamak'il jun na tu', cax max jay jun ix criada cham sat sacerdote.

English: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him. “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus,” she said.
Kanjobal: Max yilon ix yin Pedro yet lanan k'aẍni. Max camxac'al yoc t'anan ix yin, max yalon ix bay: —Ach ti', etbi a ba yetok Jesús aj Nazaret, ẍi ix bay.

English: But he denied it. “I don't know or understand what you're talking about,” he said, and went out into the entryway.
Kanjobal: Palta max yiil yin: —A jun mactxel chal tu', man wojtakok. Caw c'am jabok chi nachaj el wuj juntzan tzet chal ayin tu', ẍi bay ix. Max lajwi tu' axa jitzon el ba bay amak' tu'. Axa yok'aj no caẍlan tu' bian.

English: When the servant girl saw him there, she said again to those standing around, “This fellow is one of them.”
Kanjobal: Max yilon ix criada tu' yin junelxa. Max yalon ix bay eb wajan ec' tu': —A ton jun winak tu' yetbi ba yetok eb is cuywom Jesús, ẍi ix.

English: Again he denied it. After a little while, those standing near said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yi pax el yin junelxa. Junixto bek tu', max yalon c'apax eb ayic' tu' bay: —Wal yel, ach ti' etbi a ba yetok eb. Aj Galilea ach c'apaxok, ẍi eb bay.

English: He began to call down curses on himself, and he swore to them, “I don't know this man you're talking about.”
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli k'anontek Pedro tu' yowal c'ul Dios yiban. Max locban bi Dios, max yaloni: —A jun winak che yal tu', caw wal man wojtakok, ẍi bay eb.

English: Immediately the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him: “Before the rooster crows twice you will disown me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max ok'aj no caẍlan yet is cayelal. Axa naontek tzet max yal Jesús tu' bay yet max yalon axca ti': C'amto chi ok' no caẍlan yet cayelal, cax ok in eon el en yin yoxelal, yin aloni tol mayin ojtakok, ẍi Jesús bay. A yet max naontek jun tu', cax max jichchaj c'ul yok'i.

English: Very early in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin, reached a decision. They bound Jesus, led him away and handed him over to Pilate.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbiajok, max wajban oc ba eb yajawil eb sacerdote yin k'umbalba yetok eb icham winak, c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, yetok masanil juntzanxa eb sat yajaw. Max lajwi tu', max c'alon eb Jesús, cax max bet yak'on eb bay Pilato, cham yajaw.

English: “Are you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate. “Yes, it is as you say,” Jesus replied.
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen el Pilato tu' bay: —¿Tom ach ti' Reyal ach eb israel? ẍi bay. —Ja', ayin toni, ẍi Jesús.

English: The chief priests accused him of many things.
Kanjobal: Axa eb yajawil eb sacerdote, xiwil tzet chi yalaj eb yiban Jesús.

English: So again Pilate asked him, “Aren't you going to answer? See how many things they are accusing you of.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Pilato tu' bay axca ti': —¿Tom c'am chach tak'wi jabok? Ab wal jantak tzet chi yal eb en, ẍi bay.

English: But Jesus still made no reply, and Pilate was amazed.
Kanjobal: Palta Jesús xin, c'am jabok max tak'wi. Yuj tu' xan toxac'al chi c'ayaj c'ul Pilato yin.

English: Now it was the custom at the Feast to release a prisoner whom the people requested.
Kanjobal: Beybalnebilc'alta' yuj Pilato tol chi bekil junok eb aj preso yet k'in junjun abil, atac'ala' mac chi k'an bekchaj conob.

English: A man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the uprising.
Kanjobal: Ay jun nak anima chi yik Barrabás, preso yayji yetok jaywanxa yetbi. Yak'lejnak eb owal yetok eb yajaw. Ay juntzan anima camnak yuj eb, yet max yak'len eb owal tu'.

English: The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did.
Kanjobal: Axa jayoc bulnaj anima tu', max k'anlen eb bay Pilato, ta chi bekil junok eb aj preso axcac'alta' is beybal junjun k'in.

English: “Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate,
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu' axca ti': —¿A mi Cham e Reyal ayex israel ex ti', che yochej chin bekilok? ẍi bay eb.

English: knowing it was out of envy that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yaloni, yujtol yojtakxa tol yuj chichonc'ulal eb yajawil eb sacerdote yin, xan max yitek eb satak.

English: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have Pilate release Barabbas instead.
Kanjobal: Axa yak'on eb yajaw tu' c'ul eb anima, yet watx' a Barrabás chi k'an bekchaj eb.

English: “What shall I do, then, with the one you call the king of the Jews?” Pilate asked them.
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen Pilato tu' bay eb anima tu' junelxa: —¿Tzet che yochej chi wut pax Cham che yaloc e Reyalok tu xin? ẍi bay eb.

English: “Crucify him!” they shouted.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj bulnaj eb yalon yin ipejal axca ti': —Curusnelayokabi, ẍixac'al eb.

English: “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
Kanjobal: —Palta, ¿tzet yetal junok yob max say yun max e yil xin? ẍi bay eb. Tol max te' ajc'al yaw eb yaloni: —Curusnelayokabi, ẍixac'al eb.

English: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max yochej aj Pilato tol watx' chi can yul sat conob, xan a Barrabás max bekilok. Max lajwi tu', axa Jesús max yak' mak'layok. Catatu' bian, max yaon oc yul k'ab eb ok aon oc yin curus.

English: The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium) and called together the whole company of soldiers.
Kanjobal: Axa eb soldado max iontok Jesús bay yamak'il yatut cham yajaw. A bay tu', max wajbelaytek eb soldado masanil.

English: They put a purple robe on him, then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him.
Kanjobal: Max yaoc eb jun moradotak pichilej yin Jesús. Max jalon seyay eb jun q'uix, axa yaon ajtok eb yin is jolom coronaok.

English: And they began to call out to him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max tz'akon yal eb bay axca ti': —Tzalojan ach Reyal eb israel, ẍixac'al eb bay.

English: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Falling on their knees, they paid homage to him.
Kanjobal: Chi c'oli mak'on oc eb jun aj yin is jolom. Chi tzubli oc eb yin, cax chi tz'akon ay jajan ba eb satak.

English: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yetnen eb axca tu xin, max yion el eb an moradotak pichilej tu' yin, cax max yaonc'alta' can oc eb is pichil. Catatu' bian max yiontok eb bay ok yaoc eb yin curus.

English: A certain man from Cyrene, Simon, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was passing by on his way in from the country, and they forced him to carry the cross.
Kanjobal: Ay jun winak aj Cirene chi yik Simón, is mam Alejandro yetok Rufo. Lananto jay bay max bet ec'jabok. Max ak'lay pural yuj eb soldado yikon bey is curusal Jesús.

English: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means The Place of the Skull).
Kanjobal: A bay jun lugar chi yik Gólgota, a tu' max yitok eb Jesús. (Gólgota chi yal elapnok: Lugaril Bakil Jolomej.)

English: Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
Kanjobal: Max yak' eb yal uva calan yetok junxa makan chi yik mirra yuq'uej. Palta maj cha yuc' bay eb.

English: And they crucified him. Dividing up his clothes, they cast lots to see what each would get.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max yaon oc eb yin te curus, cax max yak'on eb soldado suerte yin is pichil Cham, yuj yilon eb tzetak yetal chi yican junjun eb.

English: It was the third hour when they crucified him.
Kanjobal: A las nueve mi yet k'inibalil, max yaon oc eb yin curus tu'.

English: The written notice of the charge against him read: THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Kanjobal: Ay jayeb letra tz'ibbil ocok. A chi aloni, tzet yuj xan max low camich yiban. A Cham Reyal eb Israel, ẍi jayeb letra tu'.

English: They crucified two robbers with him, one on his right and one on his left.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax cawan elk'om max curusnelay yetok Cham, jun bay is watx' k'ab, junxa bay is q'uexan.

English: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, “So! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days,
Kanjobal: Axa eb chi ec' cawilal tu', chi buchwajcan ajtok eb yin, cax chi aj tx'umnaj eb bay, chi yalon eb: —A… ach ton ti' chochay templo Dios ala', cax cha watx'nen aj is q'uexel yin cabjial.

English: come down from the cross and save yourself!”
Kanjobal: Col a ba. Ayantek yin te curus tu', ẍi eb bay.

English: In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves. “He saved others,” they said, “but he can't save himself!
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' eb yajawil eb sacerdote, yetok eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés, max buchwaj c'apax ajtok eb yin, cax chi yalubtanen eb axca ti': —Ay mac max colo', palta a', c'am chi je' colon pax ba tinani', ẍi eb.

English: Let this Christ, this King of Israel, come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
Kanjobal: Ta chi yi aytek ba yin curus jun chi yaloc ba Cristoal, chi yaloc ba co reyalok ayon israel on ti', chi jaoc co c'ul yin, ẍi eb. Toltax eb locan aj yin curus tu' yetok, max buchwaj c'apax eb yin.

English: At the sixth hour darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max chumay c'u, max k'ekbi masanil yulyibank'inal, masantac'al yet a las tres.

English: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” –which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
Kanjobal: Yet-xac'al jun bek tu', max aj yaw Jesús yin ipejal: Eloí, Eloí, ¿lama sabactani? ẍi. (Chi yal elapnok: Ach in Diosal, ach in Diosal, ¿tzet yuj xan chin a bekcanok?)

English: When some of those standing near heard this, they said, “Listen, he's calling Elijah.”
Kanjobal: A eb ayic' cawilal tu', max yab eb yoc jun k'anej tu', xan max yal eb axca ti': —Abek, a jun chekbej Dios chi yik Elías chi yawtej, ẍi eb.

English: One man ran, filled a sponge with wine vinegar, put it on a stick, and offered it to Jesus to drink. “Now leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to take him down,” he said.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', ay jun winak yanej toji, maxc'al apni ocok, max laon aytok jun tzet chi pososi xol vinagre. Max yaon oc chon jun te', cax max yaon ajtok yin ti' Jesús, max yaloni: —Yilxa ba, oktax jila' ta ok ul ilay aytek yuj Elías tu', ẍi.

English: With a loud cry, Jesus breathed his last.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj yaw Jesús junelxa yin ipejal tu'. Ti tol axa yel c'ul tu'.

English: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
Kanjobal: Axa yay nic'naj nan an k'ap ayoc makilok yul nan templo Dios tu'. Max chaaytek tit nic'naj chon, masantac'al max ayol tilak.

English: And when the centurion, who stood there in front of Jesus, heard his cry and saw how he died, he said, “Surely this man was the Son of God!”
Kanjobal: Max yab cham yajawil eb soldado lecan oc satak Jesús yel yaw tu', max yil wal tzet max yun cami, xan max yal axca ti': —A jun max cam ti', tita' tol yel caw C'ajol Dios, ẍi cham.

English: Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax juntzan eb xal ix t'anantek najat. Ajun María aj Magdala yetok eb, c'al xal Salomé, c'al María is txutx José yetok Jacobo, nak tzunan unin.

English: In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there.
