Kanjobal: A juntzan eb xal ix ti', max ec'jabc'al yintak Cham yet ayic' Cham bay Galilea. Max ak'lay serbil Cham yuj eb. Xiwiltoc'al juntzan eb xal ix junej toj yetok Cham bay Jerusalén.

English: It was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath). So as evening approached,
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'u tu', c'ual watx'nen eb is tzetak yetal ok k'anbalnej, yujtol yecalokxac'al c'ual xewilal. Axa yet lananxa k'ekbi xin,

English: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.
Kanjobal: max jay jun mimek winak xol eb yet yajawilal chi yik José aj Arimatea. Echbanebil yoc Dios Yajawil yuj. C'am jabok chi xiwi, max octok satak Pilato, bet k'anon mimanil Jesús bay.

English: Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him if Jesus had already died.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul Pilato yet max yabeni tol mayal cam Jesús. Yuj tu' xan max bet yak' tit cham yajawil eb soldado, max k'anlen el bay, ta mayal cam Cham.

English: When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he gave the body to Joseph.
Kanjobal: A yet max yabeni tol mayal cami, axa yalon tu' tol chi je' toj yion aytek José tu' is mimanil Cham.

English: So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
Kanjobal: A José tu', max man jun sábana caw wal watx'. Catatu' max bet yion aytek is mimanil Cham. Max chulon oc jun sábana tu' yin, max bet yaoncan octok yul jun ch'en ch'en olbilxa, cax max makchencan yetok jun ch'en.

English: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where he was laid.
Kanjobal: A María aj Magdala yetok María txutx José, max yil eb bay max occantok is mimanil Cham.

English: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus' body.
Kanjobal: A yet max aycan c'u yet c'ual xewilal, max man María aj Magdala, yetok xal Salomé, c'al María txutx Jacobo juntzan suk'uk'i jab, yuj toj yaon oc eb yin mimanil Jesús.

English: Very early on the first day of the week, just after sunrise, they were on their way to the tomb
Kanjobal: Axa yet max sakbi aj yet domingo, max toj eb bay ch'en ch'en bay max mukay octok tu'. A wal yajol c'u, max apni eb.

English: and they asked each other, “Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb axca ti': —¿Mac ok ion el ch'en makilej bay mukan octok tu' ayon? ẍi eb.

English: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.
Kanjobal: A ch'en makilej tu' caw miman ch'en, palta axa yilontok eb, elnakxa ch'en.

English: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max ocapnok eb yul ch'en ch'en bay mukan tu', max yilon eb tol chotan ay jun ángel bay yetc'ulal watx' k'ab eb, axca wal yili junok ach'ej. Ayoc jun jokan sak pichilej yuj. Caw wal max xiw eb ix sic'libil.

English: “Don't be alarmed,” he said. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —Manchak ex xiwi. Ayex ti', a Jesús aj Nazaret che sayic'ok, jun max alay oc yin curus. Mayal ictzoj ajok. C'amxa mac ayic' yul ch'en ti'. Ilekto wali bay max ul yacan octek eb ti'.

English: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’ ”
Kanjobal: Asek, alek bay juntzan eb is cuywom, c'al yetok bay Pedro, tol mayal babjitoj e satak bay Galilea. Ok e yil yin bay tu', axca max yut yaloncan ayex, ẍi bay eb.

English: Trembling and bewildered, the women went out and fled from the tomb. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
Kanjobal: Max lajwic'al tu xin, axa yeltek eb yul ch'en ch'en tu'. Axa toj eb tu'. Caw wal chi luklon eb yuj xiwilal. C'am junok mac bay max yalil eb, yujtol chi xiw eb. [

English: When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.
Kanjobal: A yet domingo yet ayto sakbi, max ictzoj aj Jesús. A bay María aj Magdala max babji tx'oxon aj ba. A ton yin jun ix tu' ibil el ukwan espíritu yob yuj Jesús.

English: She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping.
Kanjobal: Max bet yal ix bay juntzan eb ec'jablejnak yetok Cham yet yalantok, tol lanan yok' eb yuj cusilal.

English: When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they did not believe it.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon ix bay eb tol mayal ictzoj aj Jesús, cax tol mayal wal yil ix yin, maj wal cha yab eb.

English: Afterward Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu xin, max tx'oxon aj ba Jesús bay cawan eb cuywom najat bay tiel conob, yet lanan bey eb. Tx'ok yili max yil eb.

English: These returned and reported it to the rest; but they did not believe them either.
Kanjobal: Axa meltzoj eb yuj bet yalon eb bay juntzanxa yet cuywomal eb tu'. Palta maj c'apax cha eb yabej.

English: Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
Kanjobal: Axa junelxa, yet lanan low eb cuywom yusluc'wanil, max tx'oxon aj ba Jesús bay eb. Max tzulay eb yuj, yujtol max yak' eb cabc'ulal, cax pit max yut ba eb; ilab maj cha eb yab bay eb maxax ilon yet mayal ictzoj ajok.

English: He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the good news to all creation.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max yalon bay eb axca ti': Asek bay masanil yulyibank'inal. Alek el k'anejal yet colbanilej xol masanil anima.

English: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
Kanjobal: A mac ok in yaoc yin c'ul, cax ok yak'on bautizar ba, ok colchajok, palta a mac c'am chin yaoc yin c'ul xin, ok jay yailal yiban.

English: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new tongues;
Kanjobal: A eb ok yaoc yin c'ul, ok je' tx'oxon eb juntzan milagro ti': Ok je' yioncan el eb espíritu yob yin anima yuj wikbej; ok k'anjab aj eb yin tx'ok tiejal;

English: they will pick up snakes with their hands; and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them at all; they will place their hands on sick people, and they will get well.”
Kanjobal: ta chi mitx' eb labaj, ta chi yuc'tok eb junok tzet yetal chi cam anima yuj, c'am tzet ok on eb; ta chi batxbaj oc eb k'ab yiban eb ya'ay, ok watx'jokcan c'ul eb yuj eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God.
Kanjobal: A yet max lajwi yalon Cham Jajawil Jesús jun ti' bay eb is cuywom tu', max ilay paxaj Cham satcan, cax max ay chotan bay watx' k'ab Dios.

English: Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere, and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' bian, axa toj eb yalon el k'anej Dios bay junjun lugar. Max occ'al Cham Jajawil yetok eb. Ayc'al oc is milagro Cham yetok eb, yet watx' chi txecloj elok tol yel jun k'anej chi ec' yalil eb tu'.]

English: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.
Kanjobal: Jayebixto c'u tu', max jay pax Jesús junelxa bay conob Capernaum. Axa max abchaji, tol ayic' bay yatut bayc'alta' chi ayji.

English: So many gathered that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan xiwil anima max wajnaj oc bay yatut yet jun bek tu'. Max witz'ay el ti na. Axa c'oli yalon Jesús k'anej Dios bay eb tu'.

English: Some men came, bringing to him a paralytic, carried by four of them.
Kanjobal: Ay jun anima sicbinak el is mimanil, max ilay jay yuj canwan winak.

English: Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus and, after digging through it, lowered the mat the paralyzed man was lying on.
Kanjobal: Palta maj je' yoctok eb bay ayic' Jesús, yujtol xiwil anima. Yuj tu' xan max ajtok eb yiban pananil te na tu', cax max yolon eb jun olan yetc'ulal bay ayic' Cham axa yaon aytok t'ununok eb jun winak tu' yul is wayub, cax max ayapnok sat tx'otx'.

English: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon oc Cham tol chi yaoc eb c'ul yin, max yalon bay nak winak sicbinak el is mimanil tu': —Ach ti', max ak'lay tan a yobtakil, ẍi bay nak.

English: Now some teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,
Kanjobal: Palta ay juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés chotan ec' bay tu'. Max naon eb axca ti':

English: “Why does this fellow talk like that? He's blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' chi yal jun winak ti' axca ti'? Buchwal k'anej chi yal yin Dios. C'am junok anima chi je' yak'on tan yobtakil; asannej Dios, ẍi eb.

English: Immediately Jesus knew in his spirit that this was what they were thinking in their hearts, and he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?
Kanjobal: Yojtakxa pax Jesús tzet chi na eb, yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb: —¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' che na' axca tu'?

English: Which is easier: to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your mat and walk’?
Kanjobal: ¿Mactet junok yel suboj yelapnok jalon bay nak sicbinak el is mimanil ti', che na': Ti max ak'lay tan a yobtakil, con chi mi, ma a': Ajan wanok, iaj a wayub cax beyan, con chi?

English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins . . . .” He said to the paralytic,
Kanjobal: A tinani xin, ok in tx'ox ayex, tol a' ayin Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail ti', chic'al je' wuj wak'on tan is yobtakil eb anima bay yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi bay eb. Axa yalon bay nak sicbinak el is mimanil tu':

English: “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”
Kanjobal: —Ayin chi wal ayach, ajan wanok; iaj a wayub ti', cax paxan bay atut, ẍi bay nak.

English: He got up, took his mat and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
Kanjobal: Max ajxac'al wan nak yet jun bek tu'. Max yion aj nak is wayub. T'anan oc eb, max pax nak. Toxac'al max c'aycan aj c'ul eb masanil. Max yalon eb watx' k'anej bay Dios axca ti': —Caw c'am bay max jil junok tzet yetal axca ti', ẍixac'al eb.

English: Once again Jesus went out beside the lake. A large crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max toj Jesús ti a' mar Galilea junelxa. Max jay pax oc eb anima masanil bay Cham, axa cuywaj bay eb tu'.

English: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector's booth. “Follow me,” Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal bey Cham, max yilon yin jun winak chi yik Leví, c'ajol Alfeo, chotan ay bay chi tekwi el tojlabal bay eb anima. —Tzaklojan cuywok wintak, ẍi Jesús bay. Axa yaj wan tu', max tzakloj yintak Cham cuywok.

English: While Jesus was having dinner at Levi's house, many tax collectors and “sinners” were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max toj Jesús bay yatut Leví tu', max low yetok eb is cuywom bay tu'. Palta ay c'apax juntzan eb tekom el tojlabal max low yetok eb yin meẍa, c'al juntzanxa eb yob c'apax is beybal; yujtol xiwil mac max tzakloj yintak.

English: When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the “sinners” and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: “Why does he eat with tax collectors and ‘sinners’?”
Kanjobal: A yet max yilon eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés c'al eb fariseo, tol max low Cham yetok eb yob beybal c'al eb tekom el tojlabal tu', max yalon eb bay eb is cuywom Cham axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chi low e Meẍtol yetok eb tekom el tojlabal c'al yetok eb yob is beybal ti'? ẍi eb.

English: On hearing this, Jesus said to them, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Jesús axca tu', max yalon bay eb: —K'inalok ta ayic' junok antem anima tinani', tok ay yopiso yuj eb watx' c'ul. Asan eb ya'ay, a eb tu' ay yopiso yuj. Man yujok ul wawten eb watx' is beybal naoni, xan max in jayi, palta yuj ul wawten eb chi yojtaknen el ba tol yobtakwom, ẍi Jesús.

English: Now John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and asked Jesus, “How is it that John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees are fasting, but yours are not?”
Kanjobal: A yet junel, max oc eb cuywom Juan yin c'ajbanc'ulal, c'al yetok eb cuywom eb fariseo, xan ay juntzan mac max jayoc bay Jesús cax max k'anlen eb bay: —A eb cuywom Juan c'al eb cuywom eb fariseo, chi oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal. ¿Tzet yuj xan c'am chi oc pax eb a cuywom ach ti' yin c'ajbanc'ulal? ẍi eb bay.

English: Jesus answered, “How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —K'inalok ay junok nupayil chi oc tinani'. A eb awtebil, ¿tom ok je' man ok low eb yet ayto ec' nak lanan nupay tu' yetok eb?

English: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.
Kanjobal: Ato yet ok ajapnok tiempoal yilay el nak xol eb, catatu bian ok oc eb yin c'ajbanc'ulal.

English: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. If he does, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok an icham pichilej chi olchaj tinani', tok ay mactxel chi aon oc an ac' nip manto labilok yul a' nipilok an. Yujtol a' an ac' nip tu', chi utz' an, cax chi mimanbi nic'chajnakil an icham tu'.

English: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, he pours new wine into new wineskins.”
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, c'am junok mactxel chi aon ay vino tolto chi watx'ji yul junok icham tz'um netal vino, yujtol a yet chi sipc'oj aj jun vino tu', chi nic'chaj jun tz'um tu' yuj, toc'al chi etax el vino tu' yetok jun tz'um tu'. Yuj tu' xan asan yul no' ac' tz'um netal vino, a tu' chi ay vino ato watx'ji tu', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual xewilal, max ec' Jesús yetok eb is cuywom yul jun be nan xol juntzan ixim trigo. Max yion el eb is cuywom tu' jayeb jolom ixim, yet lanan bey eb tu'.

English: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal eb fariseo bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan chi yun eb a cuywom ti' mulnajil tol ay yowalil junen yet c'ual xewilal? Man leyalok chi batzil eb jolom trigo tu', ẍi eb.

English: He answered, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Jesús bay eb: —¿Tom c'amto bay che yil yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok, tzet max yun David junel, yet max tit is wajil yetok eb ajun yetok?

English: In the days of Abiathar the high priest, he entered the house of God and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”
Kanjobal: Max octok yul templo Dios, yet ayoc Abiatar sat sacerdoteal. Max loon aytok ixim pan yet Dios yayji, tol asan eb sacerdote ay leyal looni, max yak' c'apax bay eb ajun yetok tu'.

English: Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
Kanjobal: A Dios max aloncanok xan max el yich c'ual xewilal yuj yoc co watx'ilok; man yujok jiken c'ual xewilal, xan max on watx'nelay yuj Dios.

English: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
Kanjobal: Ayin ti' chi je' waloni tzet chi je' el junen yet c'ual xewilal, yujtol Chekbilintek yuj Dios xol eb jet animail, ẍi bay eb.

English: Another time he went into the synagogue, and a man with a shriveled hand was there.
Kanjobal: A yet junelxa max oc Jesús yul jun nail culto eb yet israelal. Ayic' jun nak winak sicbinak el jun is k'ab bay tu'.

English: Some of them were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath.
Kanjobal: Ay eb max mak yila' ta chi yak'can watx'jok Jesús is k'ab nak yet c'ual xewilal tu', cax chi yak'on queja eb.

English: Jesus said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Stand up in front of everyone.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay nak sicbinak el k'ab tu' axca ti': —Ajan wan, ocan lecan co nan ti', ẍi bay nak.

English: Then Jesus asked them, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they remained silent.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon bay eb anima tu': —¿Baytet ay junok ay is leyal junen yet c'ual xewilal che na'? ¿A mi tzet watx' chi je' el juneni, ma a tzet yob? ¿Chi mi je' jak'oncan watx'jok c'ul junok ya'ay, ma a co bekon camok? ẍi. —Tz'inxac'al, ẍi eb.

English: He looked around at them in anger and, deeply distressed at their stubborn hearts, said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was completely restored.
Kanjobal: Axa yec' t'ananok Cham xol eb tu', max tit yowal. Max cus c'ul yujtol caw pit eb. Axa yalon bay nak winak tu': —Bitok a k'ab, ẍi. Max biontok nak is k'ab, axa watx'jican tu'.

English: Then the Pharisees went out and began to plot with the Herodians how they might kill Jesus.
Kanjobal: Axa yeltek eb fariseo tu' yina, max lajtinen el ba eb yetok eb partido Herodes, yuj tzet chi yut yak'on cam eb Jesús.

English: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed.
Kanjobal: Palta max toj Jesús ti a' mar Galilea yetok eb is cuywom. Xiwil juntzanxa anima max tit yulak is makbej Galilea tu' max toj yetok eb.

English: When they heard all he was doing, many people came to him from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, and the regions across the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon.
Kanjobal: Yujtol max yab eb k'umal tol xiwil milagro max yun Jesús, xan xiwil eb max jayoc bay. Ay eb aj Judea, c'al eb aj Jerusalén, yetok eb aj Idumea, c'al eb aj k'axepaltok a' Jordán. Ay c'apax eb max tit cawilal Tiro c'al Sidón.

English: Because of the crowd he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him, to keep the people from crowding him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Jesús bay eb is cuywom, tol ayxac'al ec' junok barco yuj eb, yet watx' c'am chi witz' ba anima yin Cham.

English: For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol xiwil eb maxax jaycan c'ul yuj, yuj tu' xan xiwiltoc'al eb ya'ay max jitzoc ba c'atan Cham yuj mitx'on eb.

English: Whenever the evil spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
Kanjobal: A pax eb espíritu yob xin, a yet max yilon eb yin Cham, max ay jajan eb satak, cax max yalon eb yin ipejal axca ti': —Ach ti' C'ajol ach Dios, ẍi eb.

English: But he gave them strict orders not to tell who he was.
Kanjobal: Palta max yak' Jesús yowalil bay eb, yet watx' manchak yal eb mactxel.

English: Jesus went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max toj Jesús bay jun tzalan. Max yawten eb max cha c'ul yawteni, axa yapni oc eb bay tu'.

English: He appointed twelve–designating them apostles–that they might be with him and that he might send them out to preach
Kanjobal: Lajcawan eb max yaoc yopiso is chekbejok, yet watx' chi ec' eb yetok, c'al yuj chekontok eb toj yalon el k'anejal yet colbanilej.

English: and to have authority to drive out demons.
Kanjobal: Max yak'on yopiso eb yioncan el eb espíritu yob yin anima.

English: These are the twelve he appointed: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);
Kanjobal: Tixtak is bi eb lajcawanil ti': Simón, nak max yikcan aj Pedro yuj Cham,

English: James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the name Boanerges, which means Sons of Thunder);
Kanjobal: yetok Jacobo c'al jun yuẍtak chi yik Juan. A cawan eb ti', c'ajol Zebedeo eb. Max yikcan aj eb Boanerges yuj Jesús. A jun biej tu', chi yal elapnok yuninal C'u chi bili.

English: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot
Kanjobal: Ay jun chi yik Andrés, ay jun chi yik Felipe, ay jun chi yik Bartolomé, ay jun chi yik Mateo, ay jun chi yik Tomás, ay jun chi yik Jacobo, nak c'ajol Alfeo, ay jun chi yik Tadeo, ay junxa chi yik Simón. A junxa Simón ti', ayoc yin is partido eb cananista yet yalantok.

English: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
Kanjobal: Ay junxa xin, a ton Judas Iscariote, nak max aon oc Jesús yul k'ab camich.

English: Then Jesus entered a house, and again a crowd gathered, so that he and his disciples were not even able to eat.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max toj Jesús bay jun na yetok eb is cuywom. Xiwil anima max waj pax ba junelxa yin eb, xan majxa je' low Cham, tamwal eb is cuywom tu'.

English: When his family heard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb yuẍtak Jesús, c'al is txutx, max tit eb; t'inanxa chi ul yitok eb, yujtol mayal oc Cham locoal yalon eb.

English: And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebub! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons.”
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés max tit bay conob Jerusalén, max yal eb axca ti': A Beelzebú, yajawil eb espíritu yob ayoc yin Jesús ti'. Yuj tu' xan chi je' yion el espíritu yob tu', ẍi eb.

English: So Jesus called them and spoke to them in parables: “How can Satan drive out Satan?
Kanjobal: Axa yawtelaytek eb yuj Jesús, max yalontek Cham juntzan abix bay eb: A Satanás tu', ¿tom wal ok yuktej el eb yet espíritual yob tu'?

English: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
Kanjobal: K'inalok chi yak'lej aj eb anima owal bay junok mimek conob; a jun conob tu', chi lajwi ayok.

English: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok nail anima chi pojchaj yuj owal, chi etax el jun nail anima tu'.

English: And if Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.
Kanjobal: Cay c'apax ton tu' Satanás xin. K'inalok ta chi pojchaj yetok eb yet espíritual yob, cax chi yak'len owal yetok eb, chi uchchajtok eb, cax chi lajwi yopiso.

English: In fact, no one can enter a strong man's house and carry off his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he can rob his house.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta ay junok winak xiwil yip, c'am junok mac comonc'al ok oc yul yatut, cax chi yelk'anentok is tzetak yetal. Asan ta ay junok chi tzakay pixoncan ay nak xiwil yip tu' bian, catam tu', chi je' yelk'anentok is tzetak yetal nak tu'.

English: I tell you the truth, all the sins and blasphemies of men will be forgiven them.
Kanjobal: Wal yel chi wal ayex, tzanc'al tzet yobtakil anima chi oqui, c'al jantak yobtakil chi yal eb yin Dios, ok ak'lay tan yuj Cham.

English: But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; he is guilty of an eternal sin.”
Kanjobal: Palta tzanc'al mac yob chi yal yin Cham Espíritu Santo, man ok ak'lay tan is yobtakil tu'. Chi oc is mulok yin junelnej, ẍi Jesús.

English: He said this because they were saying, “He has an evil spirit.”
Kanjobal: Caytu' max yut yalon axca tu', yujtol max yal eb tol espíritu yob ayoc yin.

English: Then Jesus' mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max jayoc is txutx Jesús yetok eb yuẍtak. Asan ti na max oc lecan eb. Max yak'on eb awtelay eltek Jesús.

English: A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, “Your mother and brothers are outside looking for you.”
Kanjobal: Axa eb chotan ay cawilal Cham max alon bay axca ti': —Ayic' a txutx yina, yetok eb oẍtak. Ach ab chach saylay ec' yuj eb, ẍi eb.

English: “Who are my mother and my brothers?” he asked.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —¿Mactxel in txutx che na', mactxel eb wuẍtak? ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
Kanjobal: Cax max ec' t'ananok xolak eb chotan ay is cawilal tu', max yaloni: —A ton eb ti', axca in txutx yayji, a ton eb ti' axca wuẍtak yayji.

English: Whoever does God's will is my brother and sister and mother.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol tzanc'al mac chi iken axca wal chi yochej c'ul Dios, a ton eb tu' axca tol wuẍtak, axca tol wanab, axca tol in txutx, ẍi Jesús.

English: Again Jesus began to teach by the lake. The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the lake, while all the people were along the shore at the water's edge.
Kanjobal: A yet junelxa max cuywaj Jesús ti a' mar. Xiwil anima max wajnaji. Yuj tu' xan max ajtok Cham yul jun barco ayic' ti a' tu', max ay chotan yul. Axa eb anima tu xin, max can eb ti a' masanil.

English: He taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said:
Kanjobal: Xiwil tzet max yak' cuy eb bay tu'. Max yalontek juntzan abix bay eb axca ti':

English: “Listen! A farmer went out to sow his seed.
Kanjobal: Abek juntzan ok wal ti'. Ay jun winak max toj tzicoj trigo.

English: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.
Kanjobal: Ay janic' ixim max apnican tz'itlajbok yulak be, palta max ec' sic'aj no tz'iquin ixim.

English: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.
Kanjobal: Ay janic'xa ixim max ayc'ay yiban juntzan ch'en, bay xaxoj tx'otx'. Jun bek max ajolok yujtol xaxoj tx'otx'al.

English: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
Kanjobal: Palta maxc'al ajol c'u, max takil ixim, yujtol man mimanok xe' ixim aytok yul tx'otx'.

English: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so that they did not bear grain.
Kanjobal: Ay janic'xa ixim, max ayc'ay xol q'uix, palta max ch'ibaj te q'uix tu', axa makay el ixim yuj te tu', xan maj can jolom ixim.

English: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up, grew and produced a crop, multiplying thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times.”
Kanjobal: Palta a ixim max ayc'ay bay yax sat tx'otx', max ch'ibaj ixim, max can jolom ixim. Ay ixim jolomej 30 bak' max yak'a', ay ixim 60, ay ixim xin, 100 max yak'a'.

English: Then Jesus said, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
Kanjobal: A juntzan che yab ti', naobtanejek sic'libil, ẍi bay eb.

English: When he was alone, the Twelve and the others around him asked him about the parables.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amxa ec' eb anima tu' bay Jesús, max k'anlen el eb cuywom lajcawanil bay, c'al eb anima ayic' is cawilal: —¿Tzet wal chi yal elapnok jun abix max al ti'? ẍi eb bay Cham.

English: He told them, “The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside everything is said in parables
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': Asan ayex chi tx'ox Dios juntzan tzet yetal tol c'amto mac ojtaknej, yet watx' chi nachaj el e yuj tzet chi yun e yoc yul is k'ab Cham. Palta a bay eb comon anima, asan juntzan abix tx'oxom el cuybanilej chi wal bay eb,

English: so that, “ ‘they may be ever seeing but never perceiving, and ever hearing but never understanding; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!’ ”
Kanjobal: yet watx' c'am chi nachaj el yuj eb. Caxc'al chi yilc'al eb, palta chi can eb axca tol c'am tzet chi yil eb. Yetok c'apaxok, caxc'al chi yab eb, palta c'am jabok chi nachaj el yuj eb. Yuj tu' xan c'am chi meltzojtek eb ayin, tamwal chi ak'lay tan is yobtakil eb, ẍi Cham.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Don't you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús bay eb: Ta c'am chi nachaj el e yuj tzet chi yal elapnok jun abix tx'oxom el cuybanilej max wal ti', ¿tzet wal ok yun nachaj el e yuj juntzanxa abix masanil?

English: The farmer sows the word.
Kanjobal: A nak tzicom trigo tu', yenel eb chi alon el k'anej Dios.

English: Some people are like seed along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
Kanjobal: A ixim inat max ayc'ay ti' be, yenel eb anima chi xew yaben k'anej Dios, cax chi jay Satanás, chi yak'on c'aytok yul c'ul eb.

English: Others, like seed sown on rocky places, hear the word and at once receive it with joy.
Kanjobal: A ixim max ayc'ay yiban ch'en, yenel eb anima chi cha yab k'anej Dios ayman, yin tzalojc'ulal.

English: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.
Kanjobal: Palta man tec'anok waay eb, axca ixim man mimanok xe' aytok yul tx'otx', xan axa yet chi jay junok yailal, ma yet chi ajc'ulnelay eb yujc'al k'anej Dios, jun bek chi somchaj c'ul eb.

English: Still others, like seed sown among thorns, hear the word;
Kanjobal: A ixim max ayc'ay xol q'uix, yenel c'apax junxa makan eb chi aben k'anej Dios.

English: but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.
Kanjobal: Palta asan wal tzet yetal ay yulyibank'inal ti' chi yochej eb. Chi etax el is nabal eb yuj chi yochej eb chi oc beyomal. Asan yin tzet yetal chi yochej oc eb, chi yaoc eb is nabal. Yuj tu' xan toc'al chi yetnej el ba k'anej Dios yin eb. Lajan wal eb axca ixim trigo c'am watx'il jolom chi yak'a'.

English: Others, like seed sown on good soil, hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop–thirty, sixty or even a hundred times what was sown.”
Kanjobal: Axa ixim max ayc'ay bay yax tx'otx' tu xin, yenel c'apax eb chi aben k'anej Dios, cax chi yaon oc yin c'ul. A ton eb tu' lajan axca ixim 30 bak' chi yak'a'. Ay pax eb lajan axca ixim 60 bak' chi yak'a', ay pax eb lajan axca ixim 100 bak' chi yak'a', ẍi Jesús.

English: He said to them, “Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a bowl or a bed? Instead, don't you put it on its stand?
Kanjobal: Max yal c'apaxtek Jesús axca ti': A yet chi jaon oc co tzektebal, tokwal chi jaoctok yalan junok cajón, tamwal yalan junok tx'at. A yiban junok tzet yetal can batxan ajok, a tu' chi jaajtok, yet watx' chi tzektanej masanil yul na tu'.

English: For whatever is hidden is meant to be disclosed, and whatever is concealed is meant to be brought out into the open.
Kanjobal: A jantak tzet ewanc'uan yayji tinani', ok txeclojc'alta' ajok, c'al jantak tzet c'ubabil el tinani', ok ak'lay ojtaknelay elok.

English: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
Kanjobal: Naobtanejek wal juntzan che yab ti' sic'libil.

English: “Consider carefully what you hear,” he continued. “With the measure you use, it will be measured to you–and even more.
Kanjobal: Acbajek wal e txiquin yin tzet che yabej, yujtol axca wal che yut e yacban e txiquin tu', axca tu' ok yut yak'on Dios nachaj el e yuj. Toltax ok ajc'al can nachaj el e yuj.

English: Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a mac chi yochej chi nachaj el yuj, yelc'al ok ak'lay nachaj el yuj eb. Axa eb c'am chi yochej chi nachaj el yuj xin, a jabok tzet ijan chi nachaj el yuj eb, ok ilay ec' bay eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: He also said, “This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.
Kanjobal: Max yal c'apaxtek Jesús axca ti' bay eb: Ok waltek ayex tzet ok yun yeloc eb chi oc yul k'ab Dios. K'inalok a junok winak chi tzicay inat sat is tx'otx'.

English: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
Kanjobal: Chi lajwi tu' chi way junjun ak'bal, cax chi aj wan junjun k'inibalil. Yak'ban chi ec' tiempo, chi ajol yawoj nak tu', cax chi ch'ibi, palta man yojtakok nak tzet wal chi yun ch'ibi,

English: All by itself the soil produces grain–first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.
Kanjobal: yujtol asan yuj yaxil tx'otx' chi ch'ibi. Yin babelal, xakilejixtoc'al. Catatu' chi can jolom, cax chi yak'on sat.

English: As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.”
Kanjobal: Axa yet chi takilok, cax chi polon ajok, yujtol chi ajapnok tiempoal yaji, ẍi Jesús.

English: Again he said, “What shall we say the kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?
Kanjobal: Max yal Jesús: ¿Tzet chi yun yaj can bisil eb anima chi oc yul k'ab Dios che na'? Ok waltek jun abix e yabej, tzet chi yun ch'ib is bisil eb.

English: It is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest seed you plant in the ground.
Kanjobal: Lajan eb axca junok bak' mostaza chi awlay bay junok tx'otx'. A jun an inat tu', caw yaliẍ ch'an an yintak masanil juntzanokxa inat bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds of the air can perch in its shade.”
Kanjobal: Palta asan yawchaji, cax chi ch'ibi, miman chi yun tinay yintak masanil juntzanokxa itaj. Mimek chi yun lujab k'ablak, toltax a no tz'iquin chi oc no' ewan yalan yenel, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: With many similar parables Jesus spoke the word to them, as much as they could understand.
Kanjobal: A yet max yalon el Jesús k'anej Dios bay eb anima, xiwil juntzan abix axca juntzan ti' max yaltek. Asan juntzan chi nachaj el yuj eb max yaltek.

English: He did not say anything to them without using a parable. But when he was alone with his own disciples, he explained everything.
Kanjobal: Asanc'al juntzan abix ti' max yak'balnej yet max k'anjab xol eb, axa bay eb is cuywom xin, chi watx' alnej elok.

English: That day when evening came, he said to his disciples, “Let us go over to the other side.”
Kanjobal: A yet jun c'ual tu', yet yayc'ualil, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom axca ti': —Tonek bay junxa k'axepal a', ẍi.

English: Leaving the crowd behind, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xin, max bekcan eb eb anima ayic' ti a' tu', cax max octok eb yul te barco bay ayoc Jesús, axa toj eb tu'. Ay juntzanxa barco max toj c'apax yetok eb.

English: A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.
Kanjobal: Palta ay wal jun miman cak'ek' ow max jay yiban a'. Toltax max octok a' yul te' yuj jun cak'ek' tu'. Ijan max nojil te' yuj a'.

English: Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, “Teacher, don't you care if we drown?”
Kanjobal: Axa Jesús xin, tol chi way chopiltok te barco tu', ayoc is k'an. Axa tenon el eb is cuywom tu' is wayan Cham: —Mamin, ¿tom c'am chach oc il jabok? Ilab lanan co lajwi elok, ẍi eb bay.

English: He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.
Kanjobal: Axa yaj wan Jesús, max tenon oc waan jun cak'ek' tu'. Max yalon c'apax bay a' mar: —Numayan, ẍi bay a'. Catatu' max oc wanaj jun cak'ek' tu', cax max numay masanil.

English: He said to his disciples, “Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb is cuywom tu': —¿Tzet yuj xan xiwil chex xiwi? ¿Tzet yuj xan c'amto wal che yaoc e c'ul yin Dios? ẍi bay eb.

English: They were terrified and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
Kanjobal: Toc'al max c'ayaj c'ul eb yuj sic'libil, cax chi yalubtanen eb, chi yalon eb: —¿Tzet laj yayji jun winak ti'? Ilab chi yikej cak'ek' c'al a' mar tzet chi yala', ẍi eb.

English: They went across the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.
Kanjobal: Max ec'apnok Jesús yetok eb is cuywom bay junxa k'axepal a' mar, bay jun lugar chi yik Gerasa.

English: When Jesus got out of the boat, a man with an evil spirit came from the tombs to meet him.
Kanjobal: Lanan wal yeltek Cham yul barco, max jayoc jun winak bay, petoj bay mukbanil camnak. A jun winak tu', ayoc espíritu yob yin.

English: This man lived in the tombs, and no one could bind him any more, not even with a chain.
Kanjobal: Asan bay mukan eb camnak cajan nak. C'am mac chi tzakay c'alon ay nak yetok cadena.

English: For he had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
Kanjobal: Tx'ial elxac'al c'al-lay ay nak yetok cadena chi oc yin is k'ab c'al yin yakan, palta coc'xac'al chi yun ch'en tukon cojok. C'am junok mac chi tzakay bay.

English: Night and day among the tombs and in the hills he would cry out and cut himself with stones.
Kanjobal: Masanil tiempo, c'ualil c'al ak'balil chi ec'jab bay tzalanlak c'al bay mukbanil camnak. Chi el yaw, chi mak'on yasjok ba yetok ch'en.

English: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell on his knees in front of him.
Kanjobal: Axa max yilontek yin Jesús najat, max yak'on nak yip tit bay. Max bekon ay jajnaj ba nak satak Cham yet max jay ocok.

English: He shouted at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? Swear to God that you won't torture me!”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay: —Ach espíritu yob, elan yin nak anima ti', ẍi bay. Max lajwi tu', max aj yaw yin ipejal max yaloni: —¿Tzet alon et win ach Jesús? Ach ti' C'ajol ach Dios Cham Axac'al Ocok. Yuj wal Dios chin otej, manchak quin etnej, ẍi bay Cham.

English: For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you evil spirit!” For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you evil spirit!”
Kanjobal: Axa k'anlen el Cham bay nak winak tu': —¿Tzet a bi? ẍi bay nak. —Legión in bi, yujtol xiwil co bey on, ẍi nak.

English: And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.
Kanjobal: Xiwil max oc tean yin Cham yet watx' manchak chekil Cham eb espíritu yob tu' bay jun lugar tu'.

English: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.
Kanjobal: C'uxan ay pax jun miman bulan no txitam lanan tzukon yac'un bay jun tzalan.

English: The demons begged Jesus, “Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them.”
Kanjobal: Max oc tean eb espíritu yob tu' yin Cham, max yalon eb: —Chekoncantok on xol no txitam tu', yet watx' axa yin no' chon occanok, ẍi eb bay.

English: He gave them permission, and the evil spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.
Kanjobal: Axa chalaytok eb yuj Cham yin no' tu'. Cax max el eb yin nak anima tu', axa yin no txitam tu' max tojcan eb. Ay mi cabok mil no txitam tu'. Max k'okon el ba no' sat witz bay chi low tu', max ayapnok no' yul a' mar. Pilan wal max jik'bi no' bay tu'.

English: Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
Kanjobal: A eb nak ilom txitam, caw max xiw eb nak sic'libil, axa toj eb elaj tu'. Max ec' yaloncan el eb yul conob, c'al bay najatlak elok, xan xiwil anima max bet ilon tzet max uj tu'.

English: When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
Kanjobal: Max jayoc eb anima bay ayic' Cham xin, max yilon oc eb yin nak anima bay max el eb espíritu yob tu', chotan ec' nak bay tu'. Ayxa oc pichil nak, watx'xa c'ul nak. Yuj tu', caw max xiwaj eb anima tu'.

English: Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man–and told about the pigs as well.
Kanjobal: A eb max ilon juntzan tzet yetal max el yunen Cham, a eb max alon yab juntzanxa eb maxto apni ocok. Max yal eb masanil tzet max uj yin nak bay max el eb espíritu yob tu', c'al tzet max on no txitam tu'.

English: Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.
Kanjobal: Yujc'al tu', max oc tean eb anima yin Cham, tol chi el Cham yul is tx'otx'al eb.

English: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.
Kanjobal: A yet lanan yoctok Cham yul barco, a nak bay max el eb espíritu yob tu', max oc tean bay Cham, tol chi toj nak yetok.

English: Jesus did not let him, but said, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”
Kanjobal: Palta maj cha' ajtok Cham nak yetok, max yalon bay nak axca ti': —Paxan bay atut, cax chalon bay a mam c'al bay eb ecan yuj jantakxa tzet max el yunen Dios en, yujtol max ok' c'ul Cham en, ẍi Jesús bay.

English: So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.
Kanjobal: Axa toj nak tu', max ec' yalon el nak bay juntzan conob yul yet Decápolis. Max yalil nak jantak tzet max el yunen Jesús yin, xan toxac'al max c'ayaj c'ul anima masanil.

English: When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max paxic' Jesús bay junxa k'axepal a' mar bay petojta'a. A yet max ec'apnok tu', xiwil anima max waj pax ba yin junelxa.

English: Then one of the synagogue rulers, named Jairus, came there. Seeing Jesus, he fell at his feet
Kanjobal: Max jayoc jun yajawil nail culto eb yet israelal chi yik Jairo. Maxc'al yil yin Jesús, max bekon ay jajnaj ba satak.

English: and pleaded earnestly with him, “My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.”
Kanjobal: Max oc tean yin Cham, max yalon bay: —Caw toxa chi cam jun in cutz'in. Ton wal wetok, cax chi toj a matxban oc a k'ab yiban ix, yet watx' chi jaycan c'ul ix, cax c'am chi cami, ẍi bay.

English: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around him.
Kanjobal: Axa toj Jesús yetok tu'. Xiwil anima max toj yintak, toxc'a chi witz'xac'al ba eb yin.

English: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.
Kanjobal: A xol anima tu', ay jun ix ix caw ya'ay sic'libil, lajcawebxa abil c'al c'oli yay a' aej yin.

English: She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.
Kanjobal: Xiwil eb aj an bay max bet yetnej ba ix. Pilan max lajwican el tzet ay ix yin eb, palta c'am wal jabok max watx'ji c'ul ix yuj eb. A ti yet, tol chi te'c'al aj can.

English: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
Kanjobal: Palta max yab ix k'umal Jesús, xan max jitztok ba ix yintak Cham xol anima tu'. Max mitx'on ix ti' pichil Cham,

English: because she thought, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
Kanjobal: yujtol max na' ix: Asannejc'al in mitx'on jabok ti' pichil Cham, ok jaycan in c'ul, ẍi ix.

English: Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.
Kanjobal: Yet jun bek tu' max oc wanaj a' yel yin ix. Max yab ix watx'jican is yailal tu'.

English: At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
Kanjobal: Max yojtaknej el Jesús tol ay mac max watx'jican yuj is yipalil, xan max meltzojtok acan yintak yilon xol anima tu', max k'anlen bay eb: —¿Mactxel jun max mitx'on in pichil ti'? ẍi bay eb.

English: “You see the people crowding against you,” his disciples answered, “and yet you can ask, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb cuywom tu' bay axca ti': —¿Tom c'am chela' tol chi witz' ba anima en, cax lajwi tu' chito wal a k'anlen paxok mac max mitx'on a pichil? ẍi eb bay.

English: But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.
Kanjobal: Palta Jesús xin, chi ec'c'al t'ananok xol eb, yin sayoni mac jun max mitx'on is pichil tu'.

English: Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.
Kanjobal: Axa ix ix tu xin, caw chi luklon ix yuj xiwilal. Yojtak ix tol max jaycan c'ul ix yuj, xan max toj ix c'atan, max bekon ay jajan ba ix satak. Max yalon ix masanil bay Cham.

English: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay ix axca ti': —Ach ix, max jaycan a c'ul, yujtol max aoc a c'ul win. Paxan yin tzalojc'ulal. Ti mayal watx'ji a c'ul yin jun a yailal ti', ẍi bay ix.

English: While Jesus was still speaking, some men came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue ruler. “Your daughter is dead,” they said. “Why bother the teacher any more?”
Kanjobal: Lananto wal yalon Jesús xin, max jay juntzan eb max tit bay yatut cham yajawil nail culto tu'. Max yalon eb bay: —A ix a cutz'in, mayal cam ix. Nabaxac'al mi chi toj yetnej ba Cham Meẍtol ti' toj yiloni, ẍi eb bay.

English: Ignoring what they said, Jesus told the synagogue ruler, “Don't be afraid; just believe.”
Kanjobal: Palta a yet max yaben Jesús tzet max yal eb tu', max yalon bay cham yajawil nail culto tu': —Manchak ach oc il. Asan tol chaoc Dios yin a c'ul, ẍi bay.

English: He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', c'am mac max cha' tzakloj yintak. Asan Pedro yetok Jacobo, yetok Juan yuẍtak Jacobo tu', asannej eb max chatok yetok.

English: When they came to the home of the synagogue ruler, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.
Kanjobal: Max apni oc bay yatut cham yajaw tu xin, axa max yiloni, xiwil yok' anima. Xiwilxa chi el wek'ek'ok yaw eb yok'i.

English: He went in and said to them, “Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok yul na tu', max yalon bay eb: —¿Tzet yuj xan xiwil chex ok'i? A ix unin ti', man camnakok ix, toc'al chi way ix, ẍi bay eb.

English: But they laughed at him. After he put them all out, he took the child's father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.
Kanjobal: Palta toc'al max tzeyelay Cham yuj eb. Axa yuktelay eltek eb yina yuj Cham, cax max yion octok is mam c'al is txutx ix, yetok eb ajun yetok. Axa yoctok eb bay ayic' ix unin tu'.

English: He took her by the hand and said to her, “Talitha koum!” (which means, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!” ).
Kanjobal: Max oc mitx'an yin k'ab ix, cax max yalon bay ix axca ti': —Talita Cumi, ẍi. Chi yal elapnok: Ach unin, ayin chi wal ayach, ajan wanok, ẍi.

English: Immediately the girl stood up and walked around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.
Kanjobal: Max ajxac'al wan ix yet jun bek tu', axa yec'jab ix tu'. Lajcaweb abilxa k'inal ix. A jantak eb ayic' tu', caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb.

English: He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.
Kanjobal: Max cam c'ul Jesús yalon bay eb tol manchak yalil eb jun ti', axa chekon Cham yak'lay low ix tu'.

English: Jesus left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.
Kanjobal: Max paxtek Jesús bay jun lugar bay ayic' tu', axa jayoc bay is conob. Ac'al jun eb is cuywom yetok.

English: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. “Where did this man get these things?” they asked. “What's this wisdom that has been given him, that he even does miracles!
Kanjobal: Axa yet c'ual xewilal, max cuywaj yul nail culto. Xiwil mac max abxalwi bay; palta toc'al max c'aycan aj c'ul eb yuj, axa yalon eb tu': —¿Baytal-laj max cuy jun winak ti' juntzan ti'? ¿Baytal-laj max yi' is jelanil? ¿Tzetlaj chi yun jeon milagro tu yuj?

English: Isn't this the carpenter? Isn't this Mary's son and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas and Simon? Aren't his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun ti', a ton jun josom te', yune' ix María. Yuẍtak ba yetok Jacobo, José, Judas, yetok Simón. Ayic' eb yanab co xol ti', ẍi eb. Yuj tu' xan c'am yelapnok Cham yul sat eb.

English: Jesus said to them, “Only in his hometown, among his relatives and in his own house is a prophet without honor.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Ayc'alta' yelapnok eb chekbej Dios yul sat anima masanil. Asan yul sat eb yet conob eb, c'al yul sat eb yican eb, c'al yul sat eb junnej nail yayji yetok eb, c'am yelapnok eb, ẍi Jesús.

English: He could not do any miracles there, except lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
Kanjobal: Maj je' yunen junok milagro bay tu', asan jaywan ya'ay max matxbaj oc k'ab yiban, cax max jaycan c'ul eb.

English: And he was amazed at their lack of faith. Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.
Kanjobal: Max c'ayaj c'ul Cham, yujtol maj yaoc eb c'ul yin. Max lajwi tu xin, max ec' cuywaj bay juntzan aldealak cawilal is conob tu'.

English: Calling the Twelve to him, he sent them out two by two and gave them authority over evil spirits.
Kanjobal: Max yawtentek Jesús eb is lajcawan cuywom c'atan. Max lajwi tu', catakwan max yut chekontok eb. Max yak'on yikbej eb ioj el espíritu yob.

English: These were his instructions: “Take nothing for the journey except a staff–no bread, no bag, no money in your belts.
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi toj eb, max yalon bay eb: —A yet chex toji, c'amc'al tzet che yi'. Manchak e yi' e pa, tamwal e lobej, tamwal tumin. Asan e k'okoch che yi'.

English: Wear sandals but not an extra tunic.
Kanjobal: Asanokab e pichil ayocok yetok e xanab.

English: Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al tzet nail bay chex apni, ac'al bay tu' che yak' e posada masantac'al chex toj bay junokxa lugar.

English: And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave, as a testimony against them.”
Kanjobal: Ta ay bay c'am chex chalay yuj anima, cax c'am chi yal c'ul eb chi cha yabej, c'am chex ayji bay jun lugar tu'; che tziccan el pokokal e yakan, yuj e tx'oxoncan elok tol c'amxa e yalon e yet yin eb, ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: They went out and preached that people should repent.
Kanjobal: Max toj eb cuywom tu xin. Max ec' yalon el eb, tol yowalil chi na ba eb anima yin is yobtakil.

English: They drove out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.
Kanjobal: Xiwil espíritu yob max yican el eb yin anima. Xiwil eb ya'ay max ec' yacan oc eb aceite yin, cax max jayc'alcan c'ul eb.

English: King Herod heard about this, for Jesus' name had become well known. Some were saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”
Kanjobal: Max yabaj cham rey Herodes juntzan tzet chi el yunen Jesús yet jun tiempoal tu', yujtol max pukil yabixal xol masanil anima, yuj tu', max yal axca ti': —A jun tu', a Juan nak ak'om bautismo max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak. Yuj tu' xan ay is yikbej yunen juntzan tu', ẍi.

English: Others said, “He is Elijah.” And still others claimed, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of long ago.”
Kanjobal: Ay juntzanxa eb max alon axca ti': —A jun tu', a Elías, ẍi eb. Ay juntzanxa max aloni: —A junok eb chekbej Dios, axca eb yet payxa, ẍi eb.

English: But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, the man I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!”
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben Herodes juntzan ti', max yaloni: —A jun chi yal eb tu', a Juan, jun max wak' ilay el jolom. A ton max ictzonelay aj xol eb camnak, ẍi cham.

English: For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom he had married.
Kanjobal: Tix yuj ti' xan max cam Juan tu' yuj. Ay jun yuẍtak Herodes tu' chi yik Felipe. Herodías bi yistzil. Montebil el yistzil Felipe tu' yuj Herodes tu', axa Juan alnej bay Herodes tu' axca ti': —Caw c'am leyal cha montej el yistzil oẍtak, ẍi bay. Yuj tu', max tit yowal ix Herodías tu'. Axa c'oli yak'on ix c'ul Herodes tu', xan max yak' mitx'lay Juan, max yaoc preso, max pixay yetok cadena. A ix Herodías caw chi chichon oc c'ul ix yin. Chi yochej ix chi yak' camok, palta c'amc'al chi je'.

English: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.” For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.” So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to,
Kanjobal: Yujtol yojtak Herodes tu', tol a Juan, caw watx' is beybal, cax tol yet wal Dios yayji. Yuj tu', max xiwaj yuj. Axa yaon oc taynemal tu', yet watx' manchak ak'lay cam yuj ix Herodías tu'. Ay bay chi yaltek Juan tu' abix bay Herodes. Caxc'al c'am chi nachaj el yuj sic'libil, palta caw chi tzaloj yabxalwi bay.

English: Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.
Kanjobal: A yet max chaon Herodes k'inal yabilal, max sayon ix tzetbil chi yut yak'on cam Juan tu'. Ay jun miman loj max oc yuj Herodes. Max yak' low eb yet yajawilal, yetok eb yajawil eb soldado, c'al eb mimek winak yul yet Galilea.

English: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I'll give it to you.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok ix yune' ix Herodías tu' bay lanan yoc loj, axa canalwi ix tu'. Watx'xac'al yec' ix max yil Herodes, yetok eb ayic' low yetok. Yuj tu' xan max yal Herodes bay ix axca ti': —K'an tzet chi yochej a c'ul ayin, ok wak' ayach, ẍi bay ix.

English: And he promised her with an oath, “Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
Kanjobal: Max loctek bi Dios, max yak'on ti' bay ix, max yaloni: —Tzanc'al junok tzet yetal cha k'an ayin, ok wak' ayach. Caxc'al a nanok bay ayin oc yajawilal ti', ok wak'a', ẍi.

English: She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?” “The head of John the Baptist,” she answered.
Kanjobal: A yet max eltek ix xin, max k'anlen ix bay is txutx: —¿Tzet chochej chin k'ana'? ẍi ix bay is txutx tu'. Axa tak'wi xal txutxej tu': —A jolom Juan, jun ak'om bautismo tu', cha k'ana', ẍi xal.

English: At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok ix bay cham rey tu', cax yalon ix bay, axca ti': —Chi wochej a jolom Juan jun ak'om bautismo tu' chak' ayin yul junok plato wal tinani', ẍi ix.

English: The king was greatly distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max cusaj cham rey tu' yet max yaben cham, palta majxa je' yak'on tac cham ti', yujtol max loctek cham bi Dios, cax max yaben c'apax eb ayic' yetok cham tu'.

English: So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,
Kanjobal: Axa chekontok cham jun soldado, max bet tit jolom Juan tu' yuj.

English: and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.
Kanjobal: Max toj jun soldado tu' bay preso xin, cax max bet yion el jolom Juan tu', axa yiontek yul jun plato, max yak'on bay ix, axa yak'on ix bay is txutx tu'.

English: On hearing of this, John's disciples came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
Kanjobal: A yet max yaben eb cuywom Juan tu', max jayoc eb, max bet mukoncan eb is mimanil.

English: The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.
Kanjobal: Max meltzoj eb chekbej Jesús bay, max yalontek eb jantakc'al tzet max yun eb, c'al tzet max yak' eb cuylaycanok.

English: Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them, “Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest.”
Kanjobal: Lajwitoc'al yalontek eb xin, axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Tonek xew jabok co tx'oklil bay c'am anima, ẍi. Max yal axca tu', yujtol c'am jabok colil eb yuj anima. Ay chi jayi, ay chi toji. Toltax low eb, tutun c'am colil eb.

English: So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.
Kanjobal: Axa yoctok Jesús yul jun barco yetok eb is chekbej tu', max toj eb tx'oklil bay c'am anima.

English: But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.
Kanjobal: Palta xiwil anima max ilon toj eb; toxa max yojtaknej pax el eb Jesús. Yuj tu' xiwil eb aj conob bay juntzan conoblak cawilal tu', max toj eb tilak a', babel max apni oc eb satak Cham.

English: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.
Kanjobal: Axa yeltek Jesús yul barco tu', max yiloni xiwil anima ayxa ec'ok. Axa cusoc c'ul yin eb tu', yujtol lajan eb axca juntzanok no calnel c'am yilomal, xan xiwil tzet yetal max yak' cuy eb.

English: By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. “This is a remote place,” they said, “and it's already very late.
Kanjobal: A yet lananxa toj c'u, max jayoc eb is cuywom bay, max yalon eb axca ti': —Lananxa toj c'u. A bay jun lugar bay ayon ec' ti', c'am anima cajan.

English: Send the people away so they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
Kanjobal: Xan tekan watx' cha chektok eb anima ti' bay ay anima, yetok bay juntzan aldea cawil-lak ti', cax chi manon low ba eb bay tu', yujtol c'am lobej eb, ẍi eb.

English: But he answered, “You give them something to eat.” They said to him, “That would take eight months of a man's wages! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?”
Kanjobal: —Ak'ek low eb ayex ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb is cuywom tu'. Axa yalon eb bay: —¿Chi mi toj co man 200 denario pan, chi yal tu', cax chi jak'on low eb? ẍi eb.

English: “How many loaves do you have?” he asked. “Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five–and two fish.”
Kanjobal: —¿Jayeb ixim pan ibil oc e yuj? Sayek ila', ẍi bay eb. A yet max lajwi yilon eb, max yalon eb bay: —Asan oyeb ixim jetbi ocok, yetok cac'on no txay, ẍi eb bay.

English: Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús tol chi ay chotan eb anima masanil yin bulquiẍtakil bay jun ac'al tu'.

English: So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
Kanjobal: Axa yay chotan eb tu'. Ay junjun bulan yin 50, ay eb yin 100.

English: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to set before the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.
Kanjobal: Axa yion aj Cham ixim oyeb pan tu' yetok no cac'on txay. Max aj t'anan satcan, cax max yalon yuj diosalil yuj. Max c'oli bijontok ixim. Max lajwi tu' max yak'on bay eb is cuywom, cax max pojon ec' eb xol anima. Max poj c'apax ec' no cac'on txay tu' xol anima masanil.

English: They all ate and were satisfied,
Kanjobal: Masanil anima watx' max yun low sic'libil.

English: and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.
Kanjobal: A yet max xew low eb, maxto wajcan aj eb cuywom lajcawebxa motx nojnak yuj ixim bijquiltakil, c'al yetok no txay maxto cani.

English: The number of the men who had eaten was five thousand.
Kanjobal: A eb winak max low tu', oyeb mil eb.

English: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yalon Jesús bay eb is cuywom tol chi oc eb yul barco, cax chi babji k'axpoj ec' eb satak Cham, chi ec'apnok eb bay conob Betsaida. Axa Jesús xin, maxto can yuj yalon toj ba bay eb anima.

English: After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi yalon toj ba bay eb xin, max toj bay jun tzalan txajlok.

English: When evening came, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.
Kanjobal: Ayxa ec' te barco tu' nan a', cax max k'ekbi, axa Jesús xin, aytocan ec' sat tx'otx' tx'oklil.

English: He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. About the fourth watch of the night he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,
Kanjobal: Axa max yilontok, caw chi el yip eb is cuywom tu' mak'on a', yujtol ow jay cak'ek' satak eb. Axa yet toxa chi sakbi, max beytok Jesús yiban a'. Yochej palanc'al k'okon babjok ba satak eb.

English: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
Kanjobal: A yet max yilontok eb tol chi bey yiban a', max na eb tol lab jun chi jayoc c'atan eb tu', xan caw max el yaw eb.

English: because they all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke to them and said, “Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.”
Kanjobal: Max xiw eb masanil, yujtol masanil eb max iloni. Axa yalon Cham bay eb axca ti': —Manchak ex oc il. Ayin Jesús in. Manchak ex xiwi, ẍi bay eb.

English: Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu' max ajtok yetok eb yul barco tu', axa yoc wanaj cak'ek' tu' yuj. Toxac'al max c'aycan aj c'ul eb masanil.

English: for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al toxa max yil eb milagro Jesús yin ixim oyeb pan, palta c'amtoc'al chi nachaj el is yikbej yuj eb, yujtol c'amto chi jakchaj nabal eb.

English: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.
Kanjobal: Max k'axpoj ec' eb xin, max ec' apnok eb bay conob Genesaret. Max pixbancan oc eb is barco bay ti a'.

English: As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.
Kanjobal: Maxc'al eltek eb yul barco tu', max yilon oc eb anima tol a Jesús.

English: They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.
Kanjobal: Xan max ec' eb batxontek masanil eb ya'ay bay jun lugar tu', max ilay jay eb bay Jesús.

English: And wherever he went–into villages, towns or countryside–they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched him were healed.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al bay max eq'ui, yulak aldea ma yulak conob, ma bay cajan anima najatlak elok, max ilay eltek eb ya'ay yulak calle. Max k'anon eb mitx' jabok ti' pichil Cham, xan a masanil eb max mitx'oni, max jaycan c'ul eb.

English: The Pharisees and some of the teachers of the law who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus and
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb fariseo, c'al juntzan eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés max tit bay Jerusalén, max wajbaj oc bulan ba eb yin Jesús.

English: saw some of his disciples eating food with hands that were “unclean,” that is, unwashed.
Kanjobal: Max yil eb tol ay jaywan eb cuywom Jesús, tol c'am chi tx'aj eb k'ab yet chi low eb, axca yalon leyalil eb, xan yob max can eb yul sat eb, yuj maj tx'aj eb k'ab. Yuj tu xin, max al-lay eb cuywom tu' yobal yuj eb.

English: (The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.
Kanjobal: A eb fariseo tu', c'al masanil eb yet israelal, beybalnebilc'al beybal yichmam eb yuj, xan ta c'am chi cam tx'ajon eb k'ab axca yalon beybal eb tu', tutun wal c'am chi low eb.

English: When they come from the marketplace they do not eat unless they wash. And they observe many other traditions, such as the washing of cups, pitchers and kettles. )
Kanjobal: A yet chi jay eb yet chi bet eb txonbal, masantac'al chi cam tx'ajon eb k'ab, catatu chi low eb, axca yalon ley eb tu'. Xiwiltoc'al juntzanxa tzet yetal chi beybalnej eb, axca tx'ajon eb is vaso, c'al ẍalu, c'al masanil mitx'k'ab eb yet loj, c'al bay chi ay chotan eb lowok.

English: So the Pharisees and teachers of the law asked Jesus, “Why don't your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders instead of eating their food with ‘unclean’ hands?”
Kanjobal: Xan max yal eb fariseo tu', c'al eb meẍtol yin ley Moisés bay Jesús axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan c'am chi beybalnej eb a cuywom juntzan beybal eb jichmam? Yob chi can eb, yujtol c'am chi tx'aj eb k'ab chi low eb, ẍi eb.

English: He replied, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: “ ‘These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Jesús bay eb tu': —Ayex ti' caw wal cabsat ex. Yel ton ta' tzet albilcan yuj Isaías e yin, yet max tz'ibencan axca ti' yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcanok: A jun conob ti', yinc'al k'anejal ay is watx' k'anej chi yal ayin, palta a wal yanimail eb, najat tx'uman el win.

English: They worship me in vain; their teachings are but rules taught by men.’
Kanjobal: Nabac'al chi tz'ak yiay ba eb ayin, yujtol asan juntzan chekbanil anima chi yak' eb cuylayok, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to the traditions of men.”
Kanjobal: Ayex ti', max e bekcan chekbanil Dios, axa cuybej eb jichmam che beybalnej.

English: And he said to them: “You have a fine way of setting aside the commands of God in order to observe your own traditions!
Kanjobal: Yujc'al e beybalnen juntzan beybal eb tu', xan che bekcan e beybalnen chekbanil Dios.

English: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Anyone who curses his father or mother must be put to death.’
Kanjobal: Max yalcan Moisés axca ti': Ayokab yelapnok e mam c'al e txutx yul e sat, ẍi. A mac chi baj is mam ma is txutx, ak'layokab camok, ẍi c'apaxok.

English: But you say that if a man says to his father or mother: ‘Whatever help you might otherwise have received from me is Corban’ (that is, a gift devoted to God),
Kanjobal: Palta a e yalon ayex ti', tol man yowalilok chi colwaj junok mactxel bay is mam, ma bay is txutx. Ilab ta ay junok mac chi alon bay eb axca ti': C'am chi je' in colwaj ayex, yujtol masanil tzet ay ayin, yet-xa Dios yayji, ta ẍi, xiwil watx'il che yabej.

English: then you no longer let him do anything for his father or mother.
Kanjobal: Ta ay mac chi alon axca tu', manxa yowalilok chi colwaj bay is mam c'al bay is txutx, e yaloni.

English: Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that.”
Kanjobal: Cac'al ton tu' che yut e yintaknen el chekbanil Dios, axa beybal eb jichmam che yak' cuylayok. Cax xiwiltoc'al juntzanxa che beybalnej axca juntzan ti', ẍi Jesús bay eb.

English: Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand this.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max yawtenpaxtek Jesús eb anima tu' junelxa. Max yalon bay eb axca ti': —Abek e masanil tzet ok wala'. Nachajokab el e yuj.

English: Nothing outside a man can make him ‘unclean’ by going into him. Rather, it is what comes out of a man that makes him ‘unclean.’ ”
Kanjobal: A tzet chi octok yul co ti', c'am chi je' jetax el yuj yul sat Dios. A juntzan tzet chi tit yin co nabal, a' chon etnen el yul sat Cham, ẍi bay eb.

English: After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, max el Jesús xol eb anima tu', max octok yul na yetok eb is cuywom. Max k'anlen el eb bay: —¿Tzet chi yal elapnok jun cuybanil max al ti'? ẍi eb bay.

English: “Are you so dull?” he asked. “Don't you see that nothing that enters a man from the outside can make him ‘unclean’?
Kanjobal: Axa yalon bay eb tu': —¿Tom c'am chi nachaj c'apax el e yuj ayex ti'? ¿Tom man e yojtakok, tol a tzet chi toj yul co ti', c'am chi je' jetax el yul sat Dios yuj?

English: For it doesn't go into his heart but into his stomach, and then out of his body.” (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods “clean.”)
Kanjobal: Yujtol manak bay co nabal chi apni. A yul co c'ul chi ayapnok, lajwi tu xin chi eli, ẍi bay eb. Caytu' max yut yalon axca tu', tol a jantakc'al tzet chi lojic'alta'a, c'am yowalil yuj Dios.

English: He went on: “What comes out of a man is what makes him ‘unclean.’
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax junxa ti' bay eb: —A juntzan tzet chi tit yin co nabal, a' chon etnen el yul sat Dios.

English: For from within, out of men's hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery,
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yin co nabal chi pitzc'oj aj juntzan yob nabalej ti'. Ay mac ayxa yetbi, cax chi yunen mul yetok junokxa mactxel. Ay eb man yetbiok ba, cax chi yunen mul. Ay eb chi mak' cam yet animail.

English: greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.
Kanjobal: Ay eb chi elk'ani. Ay eb chi ochen oc tzet ay junokxa. Ay eb c'am watx'il chi yut ba. Ay eb chi yak' lek'tial. Ay eb c'am chi q'uixwi yunen junok tzet yetal q'uixwiltak. Ay eb chi chichon oc c'ul yin junok mactxel yuj tzet ay. Ay eb comonc'al chi buchboni. Ay eb chi maynej ba, ay c'apax mac c'am is nabal.

English: All these evils come from inside and make a man ‘unclean.’ ”
Kanjobal: A juntzan yobtakil ti', a yin co nabal chi pitzc'oj ajok. A' chon etnen el yul sat Dios, ẍi Jesús.

English: Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu xin, axa toj Jesús bay yul makbej Tiro. Max apni bay jun na, maj yochej max abchaj ajok ta ayic' bay tu', palta max abchaj ajok.

English: In fact, as soon as she heard about him, a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an evil spirit came and fell at his feet.
Kanjobal: A bay tu' ay jun ix ix ay jun yune' ix unin, ayoc espíritu yob yin. Max yab ix txutxej tu' k'umal, tol max apni oc Jesús bay tu', axa toj ix bay Cham, max bet ay jajan ix bay.

English: The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.
Kanjobal: A jun ix ix tu', man israelok ix, aj Sirofenicia ix. Max tewi ix bay Jesús, tol chi yiil espíritu yob ayoc yin ix yune' tu'.

English: “First let the children eat all they want,” he told her, “for it is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to their dogs.”
Kanjobal: Palta max yal Cham bay ix axca ti': —Nojokab c'ul eb uninalej yin babelal. Man watx'ok ta chi tok'lay ec' lobej eb, cax chi ak'lay bay no yune yal tx'i, ẍi.

English: “Yes, Lord,” she replied, “but even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.”
Kanjobal: Axa tak'wi ix bay Cham: —Yel ton Mamin, palta a no yal tx'i', chi sic'aj no' c'ajil lobej eb uninalej chi ayc'ay yalan meẍa, ẍi ix bay.

English: Then he told her, “For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max yal Cham bay ix axca ti': —A yuj tzet max al ayin tu', chi je' chach pax bay atut, yujtol mayal el espíritu yob yin ix one' tu', ẍi bay ix.

English: She went home and found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.
Kanjobal: A yet max apni ix bay yatut, max yilon ix, telan aj yune' ix tu' sat tx'at, mayal el jun espíritu yob tu' yin ix.

English: Then Jesus left the vicinity of Tyre and went through Sidon, down to the Sea of Galilee and into the region of the Decapolis.
Kanjobal: Max el Jesús bay Tiro bay ayic' tu xin, max ec' bay conob Sidón, c'al bay juntzan conob ay yul yet Decápolis. Max lajwi tu', max jay bay ti a' mar Galilea.

English: There some people brought to him a man who was deaf and could hardly talk, and they begged him to place his hand on the man.
Kanjobal: Axa yet ayic' bay tu', max yion jay juntzan anima jun winak c'am chi je' yabeni bay Jesús, c'am wal chi je' c'apax k'anjab jun winak tu'. Max tewi eb bay Cham yuj yaon oc k'ab yiban nak.

English: After he took him aside, away from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers into the man's ears. Then he spit and touched the man's tongue.
Kanjobal: Axa yion el Cham nak tx'oklil xol anima tu'. Max yaon octok Cham jun yiximal k'ab yul txiquin nak, max tzubeni. Max lajwi tu xin, max oc matxan yin yak' nak.

English: He looked up to heaven and with a deep sigh said to him, “Ephphatha!” (which means, “Be opened!” ).
Kanjobal: Axa yaj t'anan Jesús satcan, max c'oli jay is c'ul. ¡Efata! ẍi, (chi yal elapnok ¡Jakchajokabcanok!)

English: At this, the man's ears were opened, his tongue was loosened and he began to speak plainly.
Kanjobal: A wal yet jun bek tu', max jakchajcan txiquin nak anima tu', max watx'ji c'apaxcan yak' nak, axa k'anjab aj yin tx'ijanil tu'.

English: Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more they kept talking about it.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max cam c'ul Jesús yalon bay eb anima tu' axca ti': —Ayta wal bay che yal jun ti', ẍi bay eb. Palta a yet max yalon bay eb axca tu', yelxac'al max yalil eb.

English: People were overwhelmed with amazement. “He has done everything well,” they said. “He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”
Kanjobal: Caw wal max c'ayaj c'ul eb anima max abeni, max yalon eb axca ti': Caw watx' chi yun watx'nen masanil tzet yetal. Chi jakchaj txiquin eb c'amc'alta' chi je' yaben yuj, cax chi k'anjabcan aj eb c'amc'alta' chi je' k'anjabi, ẍi eb.

English: During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', xiwil anima max waj ba yin Jesús, palta c'am jabok lobej eb. Yuj tu' xan max yawtejtek eb is cuywom c'atan, axa yalon bay eb tu':

English: “I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat.
Kanjobal: —Caw chi ok' in c'ul yin juntzan anima ti', yujtol oxebxa c'u yayji ec' eb jetok; a tinani' c'amxa tzet chi lo eb.

English: If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, because some of them have come a long distance.”
Kanjobal: Ta c'am chi low eb cax chin chekon pax eb bay yatut, chi mi telc'oj eb yulak be yuj wajil, yujtol ay eb najat cajan, ẍi bay eb is cuywom tu'.

English: His disciples answered, “But where in this remote place can anyone get enough bread to feed them?”
Kanjobal: —Palta, ¿tzet wal ok jak' lo eb bay jun tz'inan tx'otx' ti'? ẍi eb cuywom tu' bay.

English: “How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked. “Seven,” they replied.
Kanjobal: —¿Jayeb ixim pan ibil oc e yuj? ẍi bay eb. —Ukeb ixim, ẍi eb bay.

English: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. When he had taken the seven loaves and given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to set before the people, and they did so.
Kanjobal: Axa chekon ay chotan Jesús eb anima tu' sat tx'otx'. Max yion aj ixim pan tu' yukebal, axa yalon yuj diosalil yuj ixim tu'. Max bijon ec'ok, max yak'on bay eb is cuywom. Axa eb max pojontok xol anima tu'.

English: They had a few small fish as well; he gave thanks for them also and told the disciples to distribute them.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jun cac'on no txay yetbi eb. Max yalon c'apax Cham yuj diosalil bay Dios, cax max yalon bay eb is cuywom tu', tol chi pojic' eb no' xol eb anima tu'.

English: The people ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.
Kanjobal: Max low eb masanil, watx' max yun noj c'ul eb. A yet max lajwi low eb tu', ukebto motx max nojcan yuj ixim bijquiltakil maxto cani.

English: About four thousand men were present. And having sent them away,
Kanjobal: Ay mi pax canebok mil eb max lowi. Lajwi tu xin, axa yalon toj ba Jesús bay eb tu'.

English: he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
Kanjobal: Max octok yul barco yetok eb is cuywom, axa toj bay yulak yet jun lugar chi yik Dalmanuta.

English: The Pharisees came and began to question Jesus. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.
Kanjobal: Ay juntzan eb fariseo max jayoc bay Jesús. Max c'oli teyelen ba eb yetok, yuj yak'on porobal eb, xan max k'an eb yil junok milagro chi tit bay Dios.

English: He sighed deeply and said, “Why does this generation ask for a miraculous sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to it.”
Kanjobal: Axa c'oli jay c'ul Jesús, max yalon axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che k'an e yil junok milagro ayin? Wal yel chi wal ayex, c'am junok milagro ok tx'oxlay e yila', ẍi Cham.

English: Then he left them, got back into the boat and crossed to the other side.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max el c'atan eb fariseo tu', cax max octok yul te barco tu' junelxa yetok eb is cuywom. Axa k'axpoj ec' eb bay jun pac'xa a' mar tu'.

English: The disciples had forgotten to bring bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.
Kanjobal: Majc'al na' eb cuywom Jesús tu' yi' is pan yul te barco. Asan ch'an jun jenan ixim yetbi eb.

English: “Be careful,” Jesus warned them. “Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and that of Herod.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalon Cham bay eb tu' axca ti': —Abek, che yilc'al e ba yuj yich pan eb fariseo, c'al yuj yich pan Herodes, ẍi bay eb.

English: They discussed this with one another and said, “It is because we have no bread.”
Kanjobal: Axa yalubtanen eb cuywom tu' yuj tzet max yal tu': —Ax pax yuj c'am co pan ibil, xan caytu' chi yala', ẍi eb.

English: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked them: “Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your hearts hardened?
Kanjobal: Yojtak Jesús tzet chi yal eb, yuj tu' xan max yal bay eb axca ti': —¿Tzet yuj xan che yalubtanej tol c'am e pan ibil e yala'? ¿Tom c'amto chi nachaj el e yuj? ¿Tom manto e yojtakok, tzet chi yal elapnok jun ti'? C'amtoc'al chi jay e nabal.

English: Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear? And don't you remember?
Kanjobal: ¿Tom c'am che yil xin, tom c'am che yabej? ¿Tom c'amxa che natek?

English: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” “Twelve,” they replied.
Kanjobal: A yet max in pojon ec' ixim oyeb pan xol anima, ¿jayebto motx maxto nojcan yuj ixim maxto cani? ẍi bay eb. —Lajcawebto motx, ẍi eb.

English: “And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” They answered, “Seven.”
Kanjobal: —Axa pax yet max in pojon ec' ixim ukeb pan xol eb caneb mil anima, ¿jayebto motx maxto nojcan yuj ixim maxto cani? ẍi. —Ukebto motx, ẍi eb.

English: He said to them, “Do you still not understand?”
Kanjobal: —¿Tzet xan c'amtoc'al chi nachaj el jabok e yuj xin? ẍi bay eb.

English: They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max jay eb bay conob Betsaida. Axa yilay jay jun winak c'am chi je' yilwi bay Jesús yuj anima. Max k'anon eb bay, tol chi yaoc k'ab yiban nak.

English: He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. When he had spit on the man's eyes and put his hands on him, Jesus asked, “Do you see anything?”
Kanjobal: Axa yoc mitx'an Cham yin k'ab nak tu', max quetzon el Cham ti' conob. Max yaon oc Cham jab tzub yin sat nak tu'. Max yaon oc Cham k'ab yiban nak. Max lajwi tu', max k'anlen Cham bay, ta chixa je' yilon jabok.

English: He looked up and said, “I see people; they look like trees walking around.”
Kanjobal: Axa yak'len nak yilon tu', max yalon nak bay Cham: —Chixa wil yec'jab anima, asan tol axca te te' chi wila', ẍi nak.

English: Once more Jesus put his hands on the man's eyes. Then his eyes were opened, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
Kanjobal: Xan max yaoc Cham k'ab yiban sat nak junelxa. Axa watx'jixac'al yilon nak tu' sic'libil.
