Kanjobal: Ta ay mac ok ion el junok tzet tz'ib yayji yul jun libro Dios ti', ok yiel Dios is satak eb yin te te' yet k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, c'al yin is conob Cham tol chi binaj yul jun libro ti'.

English: He who testifies to these things says, “Yes, I am coming soon.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus.
Kanjobal: A Cham max alon juntzan ti', ac'al oc chi alon c'apax axca ti': Wal yel ok in jay yin aymanil, ẍi Cham. Yunokabi, sebach ach Jajawil Jesús.

English: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with God's people. Amen.
Kanjobal: Yak'okab Cham Jajawil Jesús is watx'c'ulal ayon co masanil.

English: “To the angel of the church in Sardis write: These are the words of him who holds the seven spirits of God and the seven stars. I know your deeds; you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Cham ayin: Tix chot a tz'ibentok ti' bay jun in chekbej ayic' nan xol iglesia bay conob Sardis: A Cham ayoc ukwan Yespíritu Dios yin, Cham ibil aj ukeb waycan yuj, a Cham chi alon ayex axca ti': Wojtak masanil tzet chi el e yuneni. Wojtak tol a yul sat eb e yet animail, caw iquis ex sic'libil. Palta a yul in sat, camnak ex elok.

English: Wake up! Strengthen what remains and is about to die, for I have not found your deeds complete in the sight of my God.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', naek e ba. Caxc'al ayto wal jabokxa e watx' beybal chi wila', palta ijan wal ok lajwokxac'al ayok. Yuj tu', ak'ek wal e yip e yunen juntzan tu', yet watx' c'am chi texac'al lajwi ayok. Chi waltok juntzan ti' ayex, yujtol a juntzan tzet lanan el e yuneni, man watx'ok yul sat in Diosal.

English: Remember, therefore, what you have received and heard; obey it, and repent. But if you do not wake up, I will come like a thief, and you will not know at what time I will come to you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', naektek juntzan cuybanilej max e yaoc yin e c'ul yet yalan. Naek e ba, aek oc e nabal yin junelxa. Ta c'am chex makwaji, ok in jay ayex. Axca chi yun jay junok elk'om, tol c'am mac ojtakneni janic' chi jayi, axca tu' ok yun in jay ayex.

English: Yet you have a few people in Sardis who have not soiled their clothes. They will walk with me, dressed in white, for they are worthy.
Kanjobal: Palta ay jaywan ex bay Sardis tu', tol maj ex etax elok. Axca junok mac c'am jabok bay chi tz'ilnejtok is pichil, cayex tu'. Yuj tu', ok oc e pichil caw sak sic'libil, cax ok ex ec' wetok, yujtol e moj toni.

English: He who overcomes will, like them, be dressed in white. I will never blot out his name from the book of life, but will acknowledge his name before my Father and his angels.
Kanjobal: A eb ok yak' techajok, ok alay oc junjun is pichil eb caw wal sak. Man ok in joc'ay bi eb yul tx'an libro yet k'inalej, tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. Ok walaj satak in Mam, c'al satak eb is yángel, tol wet eb.

English: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
Kanjobal: ¡Masanilc'al mac chi aben juntzan ti', yacbajokab eb txiquin bay tzet chi yal Cham Espíritu bay junjun iglesia! cha tz'ibejtok, ẍi Jesús.

English: “To the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: These are the words of him who is holy and true, who holds the key of David. What he opens no one can shut, and what he shuts no one can open.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Cham ayin: Tix chot a tz'ibentok ti' bay jun in chekbej ayic' nan xol iglesia bay conob Filadelfia: A Cham caw watx'c'al, Cham caw yel, Cham inej aj is lawe cham rey David, Cham a yet chi jakoni, c'am mac comonc'al chi je' makcheni, axa yet chi makcheni, c'am mac comon chi je' jakoni, a Cham chi alon ayex axca ti':

English: I know your deeds. See, I have placed before you an open door that no one can shut. I know that you have little strength, yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.
Kanjobal: Wojtak masanil tzet chi el e yuneni. Ay jun puerta max in jak e satak. C'am mac comon chi je' makcheni. Wojtak, caxc'al txennej e tec'anil, palta yikem ex bay in k'anej. C'am bay max e yala' tol mayin e yojtakok.

English: I will make those who are of the synagogue of Satan, who claim to be Jews though they are not, but are liars–I will make them come and fall down at your feet and acknowledge that I have loved you.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a eb ayoc yin wajayil yet Satanás, eb chi yaloc ba israelal, ok watok eb ayex, cax ok ay jajan eb e satak. Ok wut eb axca tu', yet watx' chi nachaj el yuj eb, tol camc'ulnebil ex wuj.

English: Since you have kept my command to endure patiently, I will also keep you from the hour of trial that is going to come upon the whole world to test those who live on the earth.
Kanjobal: Max e yikej in chekbanil, yet max walon ayex tol caw che tec'baj e ba. Yuj tu', ok ex in taynej yul k'ab jun miman yailal ok jay yuj yak'on porobal masanil anima bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have, so that no one will take your crown.
Kanjobal: Toxa ok in jayok. Yuj tu', ac'ala'okabc'al watx' che yut e beybal, axcac'alta' che beybalnej, yet watx' c'am mac ok je' yion ec' e paktzebal.

English: Him who overcomes I will make a pillar in the temple of my God. Never again will he leave it. I will write on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which is coming down out of heaven from my God; and I will also write on him my new name.
Kanjobal: A eb ok yak' techajok, axca juntzan yoyal yul yatut in Diosal, axca tu' ok yun yeloc eb wuj, yujtol c'am bak'in ok eltek bay tu'. Ok in tz'ibej oc bi in Diosal yin eb, c'al bi is conob Cham, a ton jun ac' Jerusalén ok ayol satcan, bay ayic' in Diosal tu', cax ok in tz'iben c'apax oc in ac' bi yin eb.

English: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
Kanjobal: ¡Masanilc'al mac chi aben juntzan ti', yacbajokab eb txiquin bay tzet chi yal Cham Espíritu bay junjun iglesia! cha tz'ibejtok, ẍi Jesús.

English: “To the angel of the church in Laodicea write: These are the words of the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the ruler of God's creation.
Kanjobal: Max yalon c'apax Cham ayin: Tix chot a tz'ibentok ti' bay jun in chekbej ayic' nan xol iglesia bay conob Laodicea: A Cham caw yel, Cham caw watx' chi yut yak'on ba testigoal, tol asan yel chi yala', asannej Cham watx'nenej masanil tzetak yetal yet Dios. A Cham chi alon ayex axca ti':

English: I know your deeds, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were either one or the other!
Kanjobal: Wojtak masanil tzet chi el e yuneni. Lajan ex axca junok tzet chi loji man sicok, tamwal k'axan. Matawal sic ex; ta c'amak xin, matawal k'axan ex.

English: So, because you are lukewarm–neither hot nor cold–I am about to spit you out of my mouth.
Kanjobal: Akxa tinani' lajan ex axca junok tzet yetal tol sic labinak; yuj tu', axca wal tol ok ex in xayej elok.

English: You say, ‘I am rich; I have acquired wealth and do not need a thing.’ But you do not realize that you are wretched, pitiful, poor, blind and naked.
Kanjobal: Yujtol lanan e yalon axca ti': Ayon ti', caw beyom on. Caw watx' on. C'am tzet chi majax ayon, quex chi, che yaloni. Palta c'am jabok chi nachaj el e yuj, tol axca wal junok mac c'am jabok tzet ay, c'am chi je' yilwi, cax t'iran elok, cayex wal tu'.

English: I counsel you to buy from me gold refined in the fire, so you can become rich; and white clothes to wear, so you can cover your shameful nakedness; and salve to put on your eyes, so you can see.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', chi wal ayex, watx'nejek wal e ba. Ta che watx'nej e ba, axca wal tol ok e man oro txicbilxa el is tz'ilal ayin, yet watx' ok e cha' e beyomal wal yin yel. Axca tol ok e man c'apax jun e pichil caw wal sak ayin, yet watx' c'amxa chex q'uixwi, ilab tol axca tol t'iran ex elok. Yetok c'apaxok, axcaok tol ok e man yanil e sat ayin, yet watx' chex ilwi.

English: Those whom I love I rebuke and discipline. So be earnest, and repent.
Kanjobal: A masanil mac chi cam in c'ul yin, chin tenchanej eb, cax chi waon c'apax oc yailal eb. Yuj tu', naek wal e ba, cax che yaon oc e nabal win.

English: Here I am! I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in and eat with him, and he with me.
Kanjobal: Abek. Axca wal tol lanan wawji octok ti' puerta. Ta ay mac chi aben wawji octok, cax chi jakon is puerta tu' ayin, ok in octok yetok. Ok in low yetok, cax ok low c'apax wetok.

English: To him who overcomes, I will give the right to sit with me on my throne, just as I overcame and sat down with my Father on his throne.
Kanjobal: A eb ok yak' techajok, ok in chotbaj ay eb bay in despacho wetok, axca c'apax max yun wak'on techajok, xan max in ay chotan yetok in Mam bay is despacho.

English: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.”
Kanjobal: ¡Masanilc'al mac chi aben juntzan ti', yacbajokab eb txiquin bay tzet chi yal Cham Espíritu bay junjun iglesia! cha tz'ibejtok, ẍi Jesús ayin.

English: After this I looked, and there before me was a door standing open in heaven. And the voice I had first heard speaking to me like a trumpet said, “Come up here, and I will show you what must take place after this.”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max wiloni tol ay jun puerta bay satcan jakan in satak. A jun babel max k'anjab aj ayin, tol lajan wal yoc yul nuk' axca yul nuk' trompeta, a' max alon aytek ayin axca ti': Ajantek cayti'. Ok in tx'ox ayach juntzan tzet tolto ok ujok, ẍi ayin.

English: At once I was in the Spirit, and there before me was a throne in heaven with someone sitting on it.
Kanjobal: Ay tzet max yak' Cham Espíritu wil yin aymanil. Max wilon jun trono bay satcan tol ay mac chotan ay yul.

English: And the one who sat there had the appearance of jasper and carnelian. A rainbow, resembling an emerald, encircled the throne.
Kanjobal: A Cham chotan ay max wil tu', lajan yili axca junok ch'en jaspe, ma junok ch'en cornalina, tol caw wal chi tzekeki yili. Xoyan oc jun mak'bal nabich chi tzekeki yin jun trono tu' max wila', axca junok ch'en esmeralda.

English: Surrounding the throne were twenty-four other thrones, and seated on them were twenty-four elders. They were dressed in white and had crowns of gold on their heads.
Kanjobal: A is cawilal tu', a tu' oyan oc 24 ẍila. A tu' chotan ay 24 icham winak max wila'. Caw sak is pichil eb. Ayaj junjun is corona oro eb yin is jolom.

English: From the throne came flashes of lightning, rumblings and peals of thunder. Before the throne, seven lamps were blazing. These are the seven spirits of God.
Kanjobal: Chi el joplajbok rayo yin jun trono tu'. Caw chi nilili axca yet chi nilili bil c'u. Ay ukeb mimek tzektebal chi chaw k'ak'al satak, a ton Yespíritu Dios yukwanil.

English: Also before the throne there was what looked like a sea of glass, clear as crystal. In the center, around the throne, were four living creatures, and they were covered with eyes, in front and in back.
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax junxa tzet ayic' satak, lajan axca junok najab chi jil tzet ay yul axca ch'en vidrio. A nan yul jun trono tu', c'al yinlak, ay canwan querubín ayic'ok, nojnak el satak eb, c'al yintak eb yuj is bak' sat.

English: The first living creature was like a lion, the second was like an ox, the third had a face like a man, the fourth was like a flying eagle.
Kanjobal: A jun babel, lajan yili axca yili junok no coj. A jun yet is cab, lajan yili axca junok ach'ej wacax. A jun yet is yox, lajan yili sat axca yili sat anima. Axa jun yet is can xin, lajan yili axca junok no águila chi ec' jenenok.

English: Each of the four living creatures had six wings and was covered with eyes all around, even under his wings. Day and night they never stop saying: “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty, who was, and is, and is to come.”
Kanjobal: A canwan querubín tu', wakeb is xic' junjun. Nojnak el yin c'al yul is mimanil eb yetok bak' satej. C'ualil c'al ak'balil, chic'al yal eb axca ti':

English: Whenever the living creatures give glory, honor and thanks to him who sits on the throne and who lives for ever and ever,
Kanjobal: Junjuntakc'al el chi yal eb querubín tu' canwanil tol caw miman yelapnok, cax mimanbil jun Cham chotan ay yul jun trono tu', cax chi yalon c'apax eb yuj diosalil bay Cham tol ayc'al ec' yin tojbalk'inal tu'. Junjunc'al el chi yal eb axca tu',

English: the twenty-four elders fall down before him who sits on the throne, and worship him who lives for ever and ever. They lay their crowns before the throne and say:
Kanjobal: cax chi ay nojan eb 24 icham winak tu' satak cham. Chi yion ay ba eb bay Cham ayc'alta' ec' yin tojbalk'inal tu'. Chi batxban ay eb is corona satak, cax chi yalon eb axca ti':

English: “You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they were created and have their being.”
Kanjobal: Ach Jajawil, ach co Diosal, a moj ton yal-lay en tol caw miman elapnok, tol mimanbil ach, cax tol miman ekbej. Yujtol ach watx'nenej masanil tzet yetal. Ay masanil tzet yetal, yujtol axca ti' chi yun yel yin a c'ul, yuj tu' xan watx'nebil oj, ẍi eb.

English: Then I saw in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a scroll with writing on both sides and sealed with seven seals.
Kanjobal: A yet max wilon yin Cham chotan ay yul jun trono tu', ay jun un chulbil, ibil aj yul is watx' k'ab. Tz'ibbil yul jun un tu', c'al yin. Ayoc ukeb is selloal, yuj tu' c'am chi je' xuylaytok.

English: And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming in a loud voice, “Who is worthy to break the seals and open the scroll?”
Kanjobal: Ay c'apax jun ángel caw ay is yikbej max wil yin. Caw yip k'anlen axca ti': ¿Mac junok moj nic'ontok juntzan sello tu', cax chi jakon aj tx'an un tu'? ẍi.

English: But no one in heaven or on earth or under the earth could open the scroll or even look inside it.
Kanjobal: Palta tamwal bay satcan, tamwal bay sat tx'otx', tamwal yalan tx'otx', c'am junok mac chi je' xuyon ajok, yuj yilon tzet chi yala'.

English: I wept and wept because no one was found who was worthy to open the scroll or look inside.
Kanjobal: Caw wal max in ok' sic'libil, yujtol c'am junok chi je' yuj xuyon aj jun un tu', yuj yilon tzet chi yala'.

English: Then one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep! See, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and its seven seals.”
Kanjobal: Palta ay junok eb icham winak max alon ayin axca ti': Manchak ach ok'i. A nan xol eb yinatil Judá ay jun chi yik Coj, a ton jun yinatil cham rey David, a' max yi yikbej xan a' ok je' yuj nic'ontok ukeb sello tu', cax ok xuyon aj tx'an un tu', ẍi ayin.

English: Then I saw a Lamb, looking as if it had been slain, standing in the center of the throne, encircled by the four living creatures and the elders. He had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God sent out into all the earth.
Kanjobal: Axa nan yul jun trono tu', yetok nan xol canwan eb querubín tu' yetok eb icham winak, a tu' max wil yin Cham chi yik Calnel, tol lecan ocok; txequel tol mak'bil camok, palta iquis. Ukeb yuc'a', ukeb c'apax bak' sat. A ukeb bak' sat tu', a ton Yespíritu Dios yukwanil chekbiltok bay masanil yulyibank'inal.

English: He came and took the scroll from the right hand of him who sat on the throne.
Kanjobal: A Cham chi yik Calnel tu', a max bet chaon ec' jun un tu' yul is watx' k'ab Cham chotan ay yul jun trono tu'.

English: And when he had taken it, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb. Each one had a harp and they were holding golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.
Kanjobal: Max chaon ec' jun un tu', axa yay jajan eb querubín tu' canwanil, yetok eb 24 icham winak tu' satak Cham chi yik Calnel tu'. Ay yarpa eb junjun, c'al junjun is oro sec' eb, nojnak yuj suk'uk'i jab chi tz'a'i. A juntzan suk'uk'i jab tu', a ton yechel is txaj eb yet-xa Dios.

English: And they sang a new song: “You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals, because you were slain, and with your blood you purchased men for God from every tribe and language and people and nation.
Kanjobal: Max bitnej eb tu' jun ac' bit ti':

English: You have made them to be a kingdom and priests to serve our God, and they will reign on the earth.”
Kanjobal: Ach max aoc eb yin jun conobal c'al yin sacerdoteal yin yak'on serbil eb Dios. Ach max aoc eb yajawilalok yulyibank'inal, ẍi eb yin bit tu'.

English: Then I looked and heard the voice of many angels, numbering thousands upon thousands, and ten thousand times ten thousand. They encircled the throne and the living creatures and the elders.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max wiloni, xiwil ángel oyan oc yin jun trono tu', yetok eb querubín, c'al eb icham winak tu'. Max wab yoc yul nuk' eb masanil. Xiwil milal, c'al millonal bisil eb.

English: In a loud voice they sang: “Worthy is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and praise!”
Kanjobal: Caw yip eb yalon axca ti':

English: Then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and all that is in them, singing: “To him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be praise and honor and glory and power, for ever and ever!”
Kanjobal: Max wab c'apax yoc yul nuk' jantak tzet watx'nebil yuj Dios bay satcan, c'al bay yulyibank'inal, juntzan ay yul tx'otx', c'al yulak a' mar. Masanil watx'nebil yuj Dios bay juntzan lugar ti', max aj yaw masanil, cax max yalon axca ti':

English: The four living creatures said, “Amen,” and the elders fell down and worshiped.
Kanjobal: Axa yalon eb querubín tu' canwanil axca ti': Yunokab axca tu', ẍi eb. Axa yay jajnaj eb icham winak tu', cax max yalon ba eb bay Cham.

English: I watched as the Lamb opened the first of the seven seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures say in a voice like thunder, “Come!”
Kanjobal: Cax max wilon nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun babel sello. Max lajwi tu', max waben yalon junok eb querubín tu', axca wal nilili bil c'u, caytu' yoc yul nuk', yet max yalon axca ti': Sebach, ẍi.

English: I looked, and there before me was a white horse! Its rider held a bow, and he was given a crown, and he rode out as a conqueror bent on conquest.
Kanjobal: Cax max wiloni, tol ay jun sakyin chej, cax ayaj jun mactxel yiban, ay jun julbal ibil aj yuj. Max ak'lay jun is corona. Lajwi tu', max toj yak'on owal, yuj yak'on ayc'ayok.

English: When the Lamb opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come!”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet is cab sello xin, cax max waben yalon jun yet is cab querubín axca ti': Sebach, ẍi.

English: Then another horse came out, a fiery red one. Its rider was given power to take peace from the earth and to make men slay each other. To him was given a large sword.
Kanjobal: Ay junxa chej, cakyin yili max wila'. A jun mac ayaj yiban jun chej tu', max cha' is yikbej yin yion el junc'ulal bay masanil yulyibank'inal, cax chi yak'len cam ba anima. Ay jun miman espada max ak'lay bay.

English: When the Lamb opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come!” I looked, and there before me was a black horse! Its rider was holding a pair of scales in his hand.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet is yox sello, max waben yalon jun yet is yox querubín axca ti': Sebach, ẍi. Cax max wiloni, ay junxa chej k'ekyin yili max wila'. A jun mac ayaj yiban jun chej tu', ay jun libra ibil aj yuj.

English: Then I heard what sounded like a voice among the four living creatures, saying, “A quart of wheat for a day's wages, and three quarts of barley for a day's wages, and do not damage the oil and the wine!”
Kanjobal: Max waben yoc jun aw nan xol eb querubín tu' canwanil axca ti': K'okbil cab libra trigo yin jun denario, c'al wakebok libra cebada yin jun denario. Manchak etnej aceite yetok vino, ẍi bay.

English: When the Lamb opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Come!”
Kanjobal: Axa yet max nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet is can sello, cax max waben yalon jun yet is can querubín axca ti': Sebach, ẍi.

English: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him. They were given power over a fourth of the earth to kill by sword, famine and plague, and by the wild beasts of the earth.
Kanjobal: Cax max wiloni, ay junxa chej k'anyin yili max wila'. A jun chi yik Camich, a ayaj yiban jun chej tu'. Tzakan oc jun lugar bay ayic' pixan eb camnak yintak. A jun mactxel tu', max ak'lay yikbej yiban jun can makanil anima bay yulyibank'inal. Can makan ok yun eb. Ay jun makan ok mak'lay camok. Ok cam eb yuj owal, yuj wajil, ma yuj ilya', ma xin, yuj no no' ay is may.

English: When he opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain because of the word of God and the testimony they had maintained.
Kanjobal: Axa yet max nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet so' sello, cax max wilon jun altar. A yalan, a tu' ayoctok pixan eb mak'bil cam yujc'al k'anej Dios, yujtol yak'nak ba eb testigoal yin.

English: They called out in a loud voice, “How long, Sovereign Lord, holy and true, until you judge the inhabitants of the earth and avenge our blood?”
Kanjobal: Yin ipejal max yalon eb axca ti': Ach Jajawil, watx' ach tonc'alta'a. Chic'al yun tzet chala'. ¿Bak'in ok a beyc'ulnej eb aj yulyibank'inal yuj co camichal on, cax ok eon ec' co pak bay eb? ẍi eb.

English: Then each of them was given a white robe, and they were told to wait a little longer, until the number of their fellow servants and brothers who were to be killed as they had been was completed.
Kanjobal: Catatu' max ak'lay junjun sak pichil eb. Max al-lay bay eb tol chi xew eb jabokxa, masantac'al chi tz'aknaj bisil eb yet creyenteal eb t'inan mak'lay cam axca eb tu', eb yak'omal serbil Cristo yetok eb.

English: I watched as he opened the sixth seal. There was a great earthquake. The sun turned black like sackcloth made of goat hair, the whole moon turned blood red,
Kanjobal: Axa yet max wilon nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet is wak sello, max ec' jun miman quixcab caw ow. Max k'ekk'olil c'u, axca junok k'ek k'apej. Axa xajaw, max cakbi el sic'libil axca chic'.

English: and the stars in the sky fell to earth, as late figs drop from a fig tree when shaken by a strong wind.
Kanjobal: Cax max titc'ay c'otlajbok waycan satcan, max ayc'ay bay yulyibank'inal, axca chi yun titc'ay c'otlajbok sat te higo tzunanxa chi k'inbi yuj mimek cak'ek'.

English: The sky receded like a scroll, rolling up, and every mountain and island was removed from its place.
Kanjobal: Axca chul-lay aj junok un, axca tu' max yun c'aylay el satcan. Masanil tzalanlak, c'al tx'otx' tx'otx' oyquiẍtak can nanlak a' aej, maxc'al bili, max el tx'otx' bay ayic'ok.

English: Then the kings of the earth, the princes, the generals, the rich, the mighty, and every slave and every free man hid in caves and among the rocks of the mountains.
Kanjobal: A eb rey bay yulyibank'inal, max c'ubaj el ba eb yulak mimek nach'en, yetok xolak ch'en bay tzalanlak. Cay c'apax tu' max yut ba masanil eb mimek winak, eb beyom, eb yajaw, c'al eb ay yelapnok. Caxc'al eb mosejal yayji, c'al eb yet ba, max toj eb elaj masanil.

English: They called to the mountains and the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb!
Kanjobal: Max c'oli yalon eb yuj tzalanlak c'al yuj ch'en mimek nach'en tu' axca ti': Matawal chi titcan jiban, cax chon is c'uban el satak Cham chotan ay yul is trono, yujtol a yowal c'ul Cham chi yik Calnel, caw c'am chi jochej chi jay jiban.

English: For the great day of their wrath has come, and who can stand?”
Kanjobal: Yujtol max jay jun c'ual caw miman yelapnok, yet chi yatek Dios yowal c'ul jiban. ¿Mac ok techaj jun c'ual tu' yuj? ẍi eb.

English: After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth to prevent any wind from blowing on the land or on the sea or on any tree.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max wilon canwan ángel tol leclom ba oc junjun bay junjun txiquinlak tx'otx' tx'otx'. Chi tenoc waan eb canebal cak'ek'al yulyibank'inal. Yuj tu', c'amxa jabok cak'ek' chi ec' sat tx'otx', c'al yiban a' mar. C'amxa junok te te' chi bil jabok.

English: Then I saw another angel coming up from the east, having the seal of the living God. He called out in a loud voice to the four angels who had been given power to harm the land and the sea:
Kanjobal: Cax max wilon yajol junxa ángel bay chi ajol c'u. Ibil oc is sello Cham Dios iquis yuj. Caw wal yip max yun yawji bay eb ángel canwanil, a ton eb ak'bil yikbej yetnentok tzetak yetal sat tx'otx', c'al yetok tzetak yetal yulak a' mar. Max yalon bay eb axca ti':

English: “Do not harm the land or the sea or the trees until we put a seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God.”
Kanjobal: ¡Manchakto e yetnejtok tzetak yetal ay sat tx'otx', c'al tzetak yetal yulak a' mar, c'al te te', masantac'al ok jaoc selloal nan sat junjun eb yak'omal serbil co Diosal! ẍi bay eb.

English: Then I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000 from all the tribes of Israel.
Kanjobal: Axa max waben bisil eb max sellonelayi, tol 144 mil eb. A eb tu', wet israelal eb. Ayc'al yet junjun tribual.

English: From the tribe of Judah 12,000 were sealed, from the tribe of Reuben 12,000, from the tribe of Gad 12,000,
Kanjobal: 12 mil eb yinatil Judá max oc is selloal. 12 mil eb yinatil Rubén; 12 mil eb yinatil Gad.

English: from the tribe of Asher 12,000, from the tribe of Naphtali 12,000, from the tribe of Manasseh 12,000,
Kanjobal: 12 mil eb yinatil Aser, 12 mil eb yinatil Neftalí, 12 mil eb yinatil Manasés.

English: from the tribe of Simeon 12,000, from the tribe of Levi 12,000, from the tribe of Issachar 12,000,
Kanjobal: 12 mil eb yinatil Simeón, 12 mil eb yinatil Leví, 12 mil eb yinatil Isacar.

English: from the tribe of Zebulun 12,000, from the tribe of Joseph 12,000, from the tribe of Benjamin 12,000.
Kanjobal: 12 mil eb yinatil Zabulón, 12 mil eb yinatil José, 12 mil c'apax eb yinatil Benjamín.

English: After this I looked and there before me was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people and language, standing before the throne and in front of the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and were holding palm branches in their hands.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu', max wiloni, tol xiwil anima ayic' satak jun trono tu', yetok satak Cham chi yik Calnel. A xol eb tu', ay eb aj junjun nación, junjun yinatil, junjun tiejal, c'al junjun conobal. C'amxa chi alchaj el jantak bisil eb. Saklubinakxac'al yili is jokan pichil junjun eb. Ibil aj is xak palma junjun eb.

English: And they cried out in a loud voice: “Salvation belongs to our God, who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb.”
Kanjobal: Max aj yaw eb masanil, max yalon eb axca ti':

English: All the angels were standing around the throne and around the elders and the four living creatures. They fell down on their faces before the throne and worshiped God,
Kanjobal: Lecan aj masanil eb ángel, cax oyan oc eb yin jun trono tu', yetok eb icham winak, c'al eb querubín canwanil. Max ay nojan eb sat tx'otx' satak jun trono tu'. Max c'oli yalon eb axca ti':

English: saying: “Amen! Praise and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and power and strength be to our God for ever and ever. Amen!”
Kanjobal: ¡Yunokabi! ¡Al-layokab watx' k'anej bay Dios! ¡Al-layokabi, tol miman yelapnok, c'al jelan Cham! Moj tol chi al-lay yuj diosalil bay, tol mimanbil Cham, xiwil is yikbej, cax xiwil yip Cham yin tojbalk'inal. ¡Yunokabi! ẍi eb.

English: Then one of the elders asked me, “These in white robes–who are they, and where did they come from?”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max k'anlen jun eb icham winak ayin axca ti': ¿Mactxel eb sak pichil ti' cha na'? ¿Baytal tax titnak eb cha na'? ẍi ayin.

English: I answered, “Sir, you know.” And he said, “These are they who have come out of the great tribulation; they have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Kanjobal: Mamin, ach ojtak. Ayin ti' man wojtakok, quin chi bay. Yuj tu xin, xan max yal ayin axca ti': A eb ti', a ton eb petoj xol jun miman yailal. Max ilay el is yobtakil eb yuj is chiq'uil Cham chi yik Calnel. Axca tol max tx'ajil eb is pichil, caw sak max yuncan el yuj is chiq'uil tu'.

English: Therefore, “they are before the throne of God and serve him day and night in his temple; and he who sits on the throne will spread his tent over them.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', ayic' eb satak is trono Dios bay is templo. Cac'al ti' yak'wi serbil eb bay tu' yet c'ualil c'al yet ak'balil. Axa Cham chotan ay yul is trono tu' chi taynen eb, yujtol ayc'al ec' yetok eb.

English: Never again will they hunger; never again will they thirst. The sun will not beat upon them, nor any scorching heat.
Kanjobal: Majxa yak' eb wajil, c'al takintial. Majxa tz'a eb yuj yakan c'u. C'amxa k'ak' ok yab eb.

English: For the Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd; he will lead them to springs of living water. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol a Cham chi yik Calnel tu', a' ayic' yul nan is despacho, xan a' chi ilon eb axca junok ilom calnel. A' chi iontok eb bay a' aej yet k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, cax ok jolay el masanil yal sat eb yuj Dios, ẍi ayin.

English: When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
Kanjobal: A yet max nic'on el Cham chi yik Calnel tu' jun yet is suk sello, nan mi hora tz'ininixac'al max yun bay satcan.

English: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and to them were given seven trumpets.
Kanjobal: Axa max wiloni, lecan ec' ukwan ángel satak Dios. Max ak'lay is trompeta junjun eb.

English: Another angel, who had a golden censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given much incense to offer, with the prayers of all the saints, on the golden altar before the throne.
Kanjobal: Lajwic'al tu', max jay junxa ángel, yetbi oc jun oro txayib bay chi tz'a sumumi jab. Max jayoc lecan yetok satak jun altar naba oro. Caw miman suk'uk'i jab max ak'lay bay, yet chi yak' tz'a yiban jun altar tu'. A tu' ayic' satak jun trono. A yet max toj woyoyok mubal jun suk'uk'i jab tu', max toj c'apax txaj eb yuninalxa Dios yetok.

English: The smoke of the incense, together with the prayers of the saints, went up before God from the angel's hand.
Kanjobal: A yul k'ab jun ángel tu' max aj woyoyok mubal suk'uk'i jab tu' yetok txaj eb yet-xa Dios tu', satak Cham.

English: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and hurled it on the earth; and there came peals of thunder, rumblings, flashes of lightning and an earthquake.
Kanjobal: Lajwi tu' max yak'on noj jun ángel tu' is txayib yetok tzak'ak' max yi aytek yiban jun altar tu'. Lajwi tu', cax max k'okon aytok sat tx'otx'. Max lajwi tu xin, max c'oli nilili bil c'u, c'al juntzanxa tzet chi nilili. Chi aj jopnaj rayo, cax chi ec' jun quixcab.

English: Then the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared to sound them.
Kanjobal: Axa watx'nen ba eb ukwan ángel tu', yuj xuon eb is trompeta.

English: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was hurled down upon the earth. A third of the earth was burned up, a third of the trees were burned up, and all the green grass was burned up.
Kanjobal: Max xu' jun babel ángel is trompeta, cax ayman max jay sakbat, yetok k'ak'ej, calan yetok chic'. Max ayc'ay juntzan tu' sat tx'otx'. Yuj tu', txenxanej man nanok tx'otx' tx'otx' max tz'a'i. Yetok c'apax te te' masanil, jabxanej man nanok te' max tz'a'i. Axa an ac'un xin, pilan max tz'a an masanil.

English: The second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain, all ablaze, was thrown into the sea. A third of the sea turned into blood,
Kanjobal: A yet max xuon jun yet is cab ángel is trompeta, ay jun tzet yetal axca junok miman witz ayoc k'ak'al, max k'oklay aytok yul a' mar. Yuj tu', txenxanej man nanok a' mar tu' max chic'bitok.

English: a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.
Kanjobal: Xan a no no' yulak a' mar tu', txenxanej man nanok no' max cami. Yetok c'apax juntzan barco, txenxanej man nanok max lajwi elok.

English: The third angel sounded his trumpet, and a great star, blazing like a torch, fell from the sky on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water–
Kanjobal: A yet max xuon jun yet is yox ángel is trompeta, max titc'ay jun miman waycan bay satcan, chi yik Ixaj. Caw chi jopxi k'ak' yin tz'a'i, axca tz'a taj. Txenxanej man nanok a' mimek aej chi beyi, yetokc'al a' nuk'lak aej bay max ayc'ayi. A a' aej bay max ayc'ay tu', lajan max yuncan el a' axca yal ixaj. Xiwil anima max cam yuj a' aej tu', yujtol caw c'a' max yuncantok a'.

English: the name of the star is Wormwood. A third of the waters turned bitter, and many people died from the waters that had become bitter. the name of the star is Wormwood. A third of the waters turned bitter, and many people died from the waters that had become bitter.
Kanjobal: A yet max xuon jun yet is can ángel is trompeta, txenxanej man nanok c'u max etax elok, c'al xajaw, yetok waycan, txenxanej man nanok max k'ekbi elok. Yuj tu', junjun c'u yetok junjun ak'bal, txenxanej man nanok max te k'ekbi elok.

English: As I watched, I heard an eagle that was flying in midair call out in a loud voice: “Woe! Woe! Woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the trumpet blasts about to be sounded by the other three angels!”
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', max wiloni, ay jun ángel chi jeneni ec' nan satcan. Axa max wabeni, caw yip yaj yaw axca ti': ¡Ay, ay, ay, ok'bal wal c'ul eb anima bay yulyibank'inal, yuj oxebto mimek yailal ok ujok yet ok xuon oxwanxa eb ángel is trompeta! ẍi.

English: The fifth angel sounded his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from the sky to the earth. The star was given the key to the shaft of the Abyss.
Kanjobal: Max lajwi tu', axa xuon jun yet is so' ángel is trompeta. Axa max wiloni, ayxa ec' jun waycan titnakcan satcan yiban tx'otx'. Max ak'lay laweal jun xab olan bay jun waycan tu',

English: When he opened the Abyss, smoke rose from it like the smoke from a gigantic furnace. The sun and sky were darkened by the smoke from the Abyss.
Kanjobal: cax ayman max jak jun xab olan tu'. Max c'oli yajol wacacok mub yul jun olan tu', axca yaj wacacok mubal junok miman horno. Max k'ekk'olil c'u yuj jun mub tu'.

English: And out of the smoke locusts came down upon the earth and were given power like that of scorpions of the earth.
Kanjobal: Xiwil juntzan no no' axca no tzac' max eltek xol mub tu'. Max saklem no' bay yulyibank'inal. Max ak'lay yikbej juntzan no' tu' chiwaji, axca chiwaj no alacrán.

English: They were told not to harm the grass of the earth or any plant or tree, but only those people who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
Kanjobal: Max al-lay bay no' tol manchak yetnejtok no' an ac'un, yetok tzetak yetal yaxculinak ch'ibi, c'al te te'. Asan eb anima c'amoc sello Dios yin is nan sat, asan eb chi je' chilay yuj no'.

English: They were not given power to kill them, but only to torture them for five months. And the agony they suffered was like that of the sting of a scorpion when it strikes a man.
Kanjobal: Maj beklay yak' cam no' junok anima, palta max beklay yaoc no' yailal eb yin oyeb xajaw. A wal yail bay chi chi' no' tu', caw lajan axca bay chi chi' no alacrán.

English: During those days men will seek death, but will not find it; they will long to die, but death will elude them.
Kanjobal: A yet jun tiempoal tu', ok sayic' anima tzet chi yun cami, palta man ok ilchaj yuj eb. Caxc'al caw ok yochej eb ok camok, palta man ok je' cam eb.

English: The locusts looked like horses prepared for battle. On their heads they wore something like crowns of gold, and their faces resembled human faces.
Kanjobal: A juntzan no' axca no tzac' tu', watx'xa yayji no' axca no chej watx'xa yayji toj yin owal. Ayaj jun tzet yetal axca oro corona yin is jolom no'. Lajan yili sat no' axca sat anima.

English: Their hair was like women's hair, and their teeth were like lions' teeth.
Kanjobal: Axa xil no', lajan axca xil ix. Axa ye no', lajan axca ye no coj.

English: They had breastplates like breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the thundering of many horses and chariots rushing into battle.
Kanjobal: Ay jun tzet yetal ayoc yin is mimanil no' axca ch'en ch'en pichilej chi yaoc eb soldado. Lajan wal nilili bil xic' no' axca nilili bil carruaje tokbil yuj xiwilok chej chi yak' yanej toj yin owal.

English: They had tails and stings like scorpions, and in their tails they had power to torment people for five months.
Kanjobal: Ay quisbal no' yin txam ne, axca no alacrán. A quisbal no' tu' chi etnen anima yin oyeb xajaw.

English: They had as king over them the angel of the Abyss, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek, Apollyon.
Kanjobal: A yul jun xab olan, a tu' max ajol jun ángel ayoc yajawilok no no' tu'. A is yajawil no tu', chi yik Abadón yin hebreo, axa yin griego xin, chi yik Apolión. Chi yal elapnok, C'aywajwom.

English: The first woe is past; two other woes are yet to come.
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun yec' jun babel yailal. Palta ayto wal cabxa tolto ok jayok.

English: The sixth angel sounded his trumpet, and I heard a voice coming from the horns of the golden altar that is before God.
Kanjobal: A yet max xuon jun yet is wak ángel is trompeta, max wab yoc jun aw nan xol caneb is txiquin jun altar oro ayic' satak Dios.

English: It said to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.”
Kanjobal: A yin jun aw tu', max al-lay axca ti' bay jun yet is wak ángel tu': —Xuyil eb canwan ángel pixan bay ti a' miman Éufrates, ẍi bay.

English: And the four angels who had been kept ready for this very hour and day and month and year were released to kill a third of mankind.
Kanjobal: Axa toj xuyon el eb canwan ángel tu', yet chi toj eb mak'oj cam anima. Txenxa maj nanjok cam anima yuj eb bay sat tx'otx'. Txequelxa is yorail, is c'ual, is xajawil c'al is yabilal yet chi oc eb yin mak'oj cam anima.

English: The number of the mounted troops was two hundred million. I heard their number.
Kanjobal: Max waben bisil eb soldado ayaj yiban chej chi colwaj yetok eb ángel tu', tol cab ciento millón eb.

English: The horses and riders I saw in my vision looked like this: Their breastplates were fiery red, dark blue, and yellow as sulfur. The heads of the horses resembled the heads of lions, and out of their mouths came fire, smoke and sulfur.
Kanjobal: A no chej max ak'i wil tu' yetok eb ayaj yiban chej tu', ayoc ch'en makil txamc'ulej yin junjun eb, cak, yax, c'al k'an yili ch'en. Lajan jolom chej eb tu' axca jolom no coj, chi eltek k'ak' yetok mub c'al azufre yul ti' chej eb tu'.

English: A third of mankind was killed by the three plagues of fire, smoke and sulfur that came out of their mouths.
Kanjobal: Txenxa man nanok anima max cam bay yulyibank'inal ti' yuj oxeb tzet chi eltek yul ti' chej eb tu', a ton k'ak' k'ak' tu', mub tu', yetok azufre tu'.

English: The power of the horses was in their mouths and in their tails; for their tails were like snakes, having heads with which they inflict injury.
Kanjobal: A juntzan no' tu', a yin is ti' ayoc is yikbej, yetok yin ne. A ne tu', ay jolom axca labaj. Caw chi yetnej no' eb anima yetok ne tu'.

English: The rest of mankind that were not killed by these plagues still did not repent of the work of their hands; they did not stop worshiping demons, and idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone and wood–idols that cannot see or hear or walk.
Kanjobal: Axa eb anima maj cam yuj juntzan yailal tu', c'am wal jabok max na ba c'ul eb yin is yobtakil chi el yuneni. Maj bek eb yalon ba bay eb espíritu yob. Tamwal max bek c'apax eb yalon ba bay tzet chi al-lay oc diosal, juntzan chi watx'nej eb yetok oro, yetok plata, c'al yetok bronce, ch'en dios c'al te dios, c'am chi ilwi, tamwal yabeni, tamwal chi je' beyi.

English: Nor did they repent of their murders, their magic arts, their sexual immorality or their thefts.
Kanjobal: A xol eb anima tu', ay eb mak'om cam anima, ay eb ajtxum. Ay eb mulwom, ay c'apax eb elk'om, palta c'am wal jabok max na ba eb yin is yobtakil tu'.

English: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle and set apart for the gospel of God–
Kanjobal: Ayin ton Pablo in, yak'omal in serbil Jesucristo. Yawtejnak in oc is chekbejok, sic'bil in el yuj, yuj walon el watx' abix yet Dios.

English: the gospel he promised beforehand through his prophets in the Holy Scriptures
Kanjobal: Payxatax yak'nakcan Dios is ti' yuj jun watx' abix ti'. A eb is chekbej yet payxa tu', tz'ibnejcan yul tx'an Un asan Dios ay yet.

English: regarding his Son, who as to his human nature was a descendant of David,
Kanjobal: A jun watx' abix ti', a ton yabixal Cham Jajawil Jesucristo, Cham C'ajol Dios. A Jesucristo, yin yinatil cham rey David titnak is mimanil, xan anima toni.

English: and who through the Spirit of holiness was declared with power to be the Son of God by his resurrection from the dead: Jesus Christ our Lord.
Kanjobal: Palta a yespíritu ayoc yin tol yet Dios yayji, max tx'oxon elok tol yel C'ajol Dios, tol caw ay is mayk'ak'al, yujtol max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak.

English: Through him and for his name's sake, we received grace and apostleship to call people from among all the Gentiles to the obedience that comes from faith.
Kanjobal: A Jesucristo max yak'balnej Dios yin tx'oxon el is watx'c'ulal ayon, yet max on yaon oc chekbejok Jesucristo, yet watx' ayc'al mac chi yaoc c'ul yin bay junjun conob, cax chi yiken c'apax eb tzet chi yal Cham.

English: And you also are among those who are called to belong to Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Cayex c'apax tu' yetok eb. Awtebil ex oc yuj Dios jetok, yuj e yoccan yetok Jesucristo c'apaxok.

English: To all in Rome who are loved by God and called to be saints: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Ti chin tz'ibejtok jun in carta ti' ayex, e masanil ex aj Roma, ex camc'ulnebilxa yuj Dios. A' awtenej ex, yet watx' asan Cham ayex yet. Tx'oxokab co Mam Dios yetok Cham Jajawil Jesucristo is watx'c'ulal ayex, cax chi yak'on c'apax Cham is junc'ulal ayex bay tu'.

English: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, because your faith is being reported all over the world.
Kanjobal: Tix jun chi babji walontok ayex ti': A yuj Jesucristo chi walon yuj diosal bay co Dios e yuj. Yujtol chi ali bay junjun conob, tol caw wal che yaoc e c'ul yin Cristo.

English: God, whom I serve with my whole heart in preaching the gospel of his Son, is my witness how constantly I remember you
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chi wak' serbil Dios yin masanil in c'ul yin walon el yabixal is C'ajol. In testigo yayji Dios, tol a yet chin txajli junjuntak el, chin txajli c'apax e yuj.

English: in my prayers at all times; and I pray that now at last by God's will the way may be opened for me to come to you.
Kanjobal: Lananxa in k'anon bay Cham, ta ok el yin is c'ul, ok je' ex toj wiloni.

English: I long to see you so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to make you strong–
Kanjobal: Payxataxc'al chi wochej chex toj wila', yujtol chi wochej chin colwaj jabok ayex tu' yin yet Dios, cax chi texac'al e yion e yip.

English: that is, that you and I may be mutually encouraged by each other's faith.
Kanjobal: Chi wochej tol a yet ok in apnok oc e yetok tu', chi jiptzelej co ba junjun on, yujtol jun lajanc'al chi jut jaon oc Cristo yin co c'ul.

English: I do not want you to be unaware, brothers, that I planned many times to come to you (but have been prevented from doing so until now) in order that I might have a harvest among you, just as I have had among the other Gentiles.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, chi wochej che yojtaknej elok, tol tx'ial elxa chi wochej chin toj ayex tu', palta c'amtoc'al chi je' in toji. Chi wochej chin apni oc e yetok bay tu', yet watx' ay eb chi oc yin creyenteal e xol tu' wuj, axca max yun yoc eb yin creyenteal bay conoblak.

English: I am obligated both to Greeks and non-Greeks, both to the wise and the foolish.
Kanjobal: Yujtol masanil anima, caxc'al griego, caxc'al c'amak, in cuenta yayji eb. In cuenta yayji eb jelan c'al eb man jelanok.

English: That is why I am so eager to preach the gospel also to you who are at Rome.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' bekanxa in c'ul in toj walon k'anejal yet colbanilej e xol ayex aj Roma ex tu'.

English: I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God for the salvation of everyone who believes: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', c'am chin q'uixwi yuj walon el jun evangelio ti', a ton k'anejal yet colbanilej, yujtol yipalil Dios yayji, yet watx' chi colchaj el masanil eb chi yaoc c'ul yin. A eb wet israelal ay yalon yet babelal yin jun colbanilej ti', palta ay c'apax yalon yet eb man israelok yin.

English: For in the gospel a righteousness from God is revealed, a righteousness that is by faith from first to last, just as it is written: “The righteous will live by faith.”
Kanjobal: A jun k'anejal yet colbanilej ti', a' chi ak'on nachaj el juj, tol watx' on yul sat Dios, yujc'al tol chi jaoc co c'ul yin. Yuj tu', chi ja wal oc yin co c'ul sic'libil. Axca tz'ibelaycan yul tx'an Un: A eb watx' yul in sat, ok ayjokc'al ec' eb, yujtol chin yac'al oc eb yin c'ul, ẍi Dios yul tx'an.

English: The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of men who suppress the truth by their wickedness,
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol chi bektek Dios yowal c'ul bay satcan, yiban masanil eb c'am chi yaoc nabal yin, a ton eb yob tzet chi el beybalneni. Yuj yob tzet chi yun eb tu', xan c'am chi cha eb al-lay el jun cuybanilej caw yel.

English: since what may be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it plain to them.
Kanjobal: Ayxa yabixal Dios yojtakxa eb sic'libil, yujtol a Cham max ak'on yojtaknej el eb.

English: For since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities–his eternal power and divine nature–have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that men are without excuse.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al c'am chi je' yil-lay oc yin Cham, palta axca wal tol a' chi il-lay oc yin yet chi il-lay oc juntzan tzet watx'nebil yuj. Yujtol atax yet max yesnen aj yulyibank'inal ti', max txeclonen elok tol Dios toni, tol ay is mayk'ak'al masanil tiempo. Yuj tu', maj je' colon ba eb bay.

English: For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened.
Kanjobal: Yujtol caxc'al yojtak eb tol ay Dios, palta c'am chi yaloc eb is Diosalok, c'am yelapnok yul sat eb. C'am chi yal eb yuj diosalil bay. A ti yet eb, asanc'al tzet c'am yelapnok chi na eb. Caw wal c'am nabal eb, yujtol k'ekk'inal yayji is nabal eb.

English: Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools
Kanjobal: Caxc'al chi yal ba eb jelanil, palta max oc pax eb yin c'am nabalil.

English: and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like mortal man and birds and animals and reptiles.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' xan max bekcan eb Dios, a ton Cham miman yelapnok, tol c'am bak'in chi cami, axa yechel anima tol cambejal yayji, axa chi yaloc eb is diosalok. Yetok yechel tz'iquin, c'al yechel labaj, c'al yechel no no' caneb yakan, a' chi yaloc eb is diosalok.

English: Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max beklaycan eb yuj Dios tx'oklil, yuj tojcan eb yin juntzan tzet man watx'ok chi yochej oc eb tu'. Yuj tu' xan a wal juntzan tzet caw wal q'uixwiltak chi el yunen eb yetok is mimanil.

English: They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served created things rather than the Creator–who is forever praised. Amen.
Kanjobal: Yujtol maj yaoc eb is c'ul yin k'anej Dios tol yel. A tinani', axa lek'tial chi yaoc eb yin c'ul. A bay tzet watx'nebil yuj Dios chi yal ba eb, cax a tu' chi yiay ba eb. Axa bay Dios c'am chi yal ba eb. Palta masanil tiempo moj wal tol a bay Cham chi jal watx' k'anej. Yunokabi.

English: Because of this, God gave them over to shameful lusts. Even their women exchanged natural relations for unnatural ones.
Kanjobal: Yuj is beybal eb tu', xan max beklaycan eb yuj Dios, yuj yunenxac'al eb juntzan tzet caw q'uixwiltak chi yochej oc eb tu'. Ay eb ix chi bekoncan winak, axa yetok yet ixal chi yetnelej ba. Palta caw man mojok caytu' chi yut ba eb.

English: In the same way the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed with lust for one another. Men committed indecent acts with other men, and received in themselves the due penalty for their perversion.
Kanjobal: Cay c'apax tu' xol eb winak, ay eb chi bekcan ix, axa yetok yet winakil chi yetnelej ba. Winak yetok yet winakil chi mitx'lej oc ba, yin yunen tzet yetal caw wal q'uixwiltak. Yuj tu' ac'al oc yin is mimanil eb chi cha' pak juntzan tzet man mojok yunen eb tu'.

English: Furthermore, since they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, he gave them over to a depraved mind, to do what ought not to be done.
Kanjobal: C'am chi yochej eb ay yelapnok Dios bay. Yuj tu xan chi beklaycan eb yuj Cham yet watx' chi texac'al etax el nabal eb, cax chi tojcan eb yin juntzan tzet man mojok tu'.

English: They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil, greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit and malice. They are gossips,
Kanjobal: K'aynak eb yetok masanil is yob nabal yetok ajmulal, xan ac'ala' naon eb tzet man watx'ok. Pek' eb yin tzet man watx'ok. Caw yob eb. Chi yochej oc eb tzet ay bay junokxa mactxel. Mak'om cam anima c'apax eb. Ak'om owal eb. Etnem anima eb. Caw wal yob is beybal eb. Alom k'umal eb.

English: slanderers, God-haters, insolent, arrogant and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey their parents;
Kanjobal: Chi yal eb yobtakil yin yet animail. Chi chichon oc c'ul eb yin Dios. Buchwajwom eb. Chi yiaj can ba eb, chi mimannej ba eb chi ec' eb. Caw wal jelan eb tz'unon yich junok yobtakil. Pit eb bay is mam c'al bay is txutx.

English: they are senseless, faithless, heartless, ruthless.
Kanjobal: Succ'al chi yut ba eb. C'am chi yun is trato eb chi yak' yetok junok mactxel. C'am chi ok' c'ul eb yin junokxa.

English: Although they know God's righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them.
Kanjobal: Yojtak eb jun ley Dios chi aloni, tol a eb chi unen juntzan max in txoltek ti', moj ok tokcan eb bay camich yin junelnej, palta ac'ala' yunen eb. Chi tzaloj eb yetok eb anima chi unen juntzan yobtakil tu'.

English: Brothers, my heart's desire and prayer to God for the Israelites is that they may be saved.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, caw chi wochej tol chi colchaj eb wet israelal. Chin k'an jun ti' bay Dios.

English: For I can testify about them that they are zealous for God, but their zeal is not based on knowledge.
Kanjobal: Yel toni caw chi yiajtek eb c'ulok yak'on serbil Dios, palta man yojtakok eb tzetbil chi yun yak'lay serbil Cham axca chi yochej tu'.

English: Since they did not know the righteousness that comes from God and sought to establish their own, they did not submit to God's righteousness.
Kanjobal: Man yojtakok eb tzetbil chi yun yoc eb watx'il yul sat Cham. Chi yochej eb tol munil chi yaoc ba eb watx'il yul sat Dios yul yet. Yuj tu' c'am chi oc eb watx'il yul sat Cham, axcata' wal chi yochej Cham.

English: Christ is the end of the law so that there may be righteousness for everyone who believes.
Kanjobal: Yuj Cristo xan c'amxa yalon yet ley Moisés yin yak'on watx'jok anima satak Dios, yujtol tzanc'al mac chi yaoc c'ul yin Cristo chi watx'ji eb satak Dios.

English: Moses describes in this way the righteousness that is by the law: “The man who does these things will live by them.”
Kanjobal: Albilcan yuj Moisés tzetbil chi jut co ba, ta chi jochej chon oc watx'il yul sat Dios yuj jun ley tu'. Chi yal axca ti': A mactxel ok iken tzet chi yal ley, ok iquisbokc'al yuj, ẍi.

English: But the righteousness that is by faith says: “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ down)
Kanjobal: Palta ay pax junxa chi aloni, tol asan chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios, cax chi yalon Dios tol watx' onxa yul sat. Chi yala': C'am che yal axca ti': ¿mactxel chi je' yajtok bay satcan? man quex chiok. Chi yal elapnok tol manchak e na' mac chi toj ion aytek Cristo.

English: “or ‘Who will descend into the deep?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).
Kanjobal: Chi yalon c'apax axca ti': Tamwal che yala': ¿mac wal junok ok aytok yul tx'otx'? man quex chiok. Chi yal elapnok tol manchak e na' mac chi aytok toj yion ajtek Cristo xol eb camnak.

English: But what does it say? “The word is near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart,” that is, the word of faith we are proclaiming:
Kanjobal: Chi yal c'apax axca ti': A jun k'anej ti', ayic' co xol, ayxa oc yin co nabal, chi je' e yaloni, ẍi. A jun k'anej chi binaj ti', a ton jun abix chi jalilok. Jun chi aloni tol yowalil chi jaoc co c'ul yin Cristo.

English: That if you confess with your mouth, “Jesus is Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
Kanjobal: Ta chi jala' tol a Jesús Jajawil, cax chi jaon oc yin co c'ul tol a Dios max ictzonen aj Cham xol eb camnak, ok on colchajok.

English: For it is with your heart that you believe and are justified, and it is with your mouth that you confess and are saved.
Kanjobal: Watx' on yul sat Dios asan yuj chi jaoc co c'ul yin Jesús. Chon colchaji, yujtol chi jala' tol a Cham Jesucristo Jajawil.

English: As the Scripture says, “Anyone who trusts in him will never be put to shame.”
Kanjobal: Chi yal yul tx'an Un axca ti': A mactxel ok yaoc Cham yipok c'ul, man ok somchaj el c'ul yuj, ẍi.

English: For there is no difference between Jew and Gentile–the same Lord is Lord of all and richly blesses all who call on him,
Kanjobal: Caxc'al israel on, caxc'al mayon israelok, lajan on yul sat Dios co masanil. Yujtol a Cham Jajawil, Yajaw yayji jiban co masanil. Tzanc'al mac on txel chi jal co ba bay, xiwil is watx'c'ulal chi yak' ayon.

English: for, “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.”
Kanjobal: Axcata' chi yal yul tx'an Un: Masanil mac chi yal ba bay Cham Jajawil xin, ok colchaj el eb, ẍi.

English: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?
Kanjobal: Palta a eb manchak yaoc c'ul yin Cham Jajawil, ¿tzet ok yut yalon ba eb bay? ¿tzet ok yut yaon oc eb c'ul yin, ta manchak yab eb yabixal? Yetok c'apaxok, ¿tzet ok yut yaben eb yabixal, ta c'am mac chi alon yabixal bay eb?

English: And how can they preach unless they are sent? As it is written, “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tzet ok yun toj eb aloj abix, ta c'am mac chi chekontok eb? Yuj tu' xan chi yal c'apax tx'an Un tu' axca ti': Xiwil watx'il yili yet chi jayoc eb chi alon watx' abix, ẍi.

English: But not all the Israelites accepted the good news. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our message?”
Kanjobal: Palta man masanilok eb chi iken jun k'anejal yet colbanilej ti'. Axcata' yaloncan Isaías: Mamin, ¿mactxel max yaoc c'ul yin k'anej max al-lay can elok? ẍi.

English: Consequently, faith comes from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word of Christ.
Kanjobal: Asan tzet chi jabej chi jaoc yin co c'ul. A jun abix tol yowalil chi al-laycan elok, a ton yabixal Cristo.

English: But I ask: Did they not hear? Of course they did: “Their voice has gone out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world.”
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tzet quex chi? A eb israel, ¿xin ta maj yab eb jun k'anejal yet colbanilej ti' che na'? C'amak, max yab eb masanil, yujtol caytu' yalaycan yul tx'an Un axca ti': Chi beytok yabixal yiban tx'otx' masanil, cax chi apni oc masantac'al bay lajub yulyibank'inal ti', ẍi.

English: Again I ask: Did Israel not understand? First, Moses says, “I will make you envious by those who are not a nation; I will make you angry by a nation that has no understanding.”
Kanjobal: Palta majc'alta' yaoc eb yin c'ul. ¿Tzet quex chi yin eb? ¿Xin ta maj nachaj el jun abix tu' yuj eb israel che na'? Max nachaji. Ilab a Moisés alnejcan tzet max yal Dios bay eb: Ok in tx'emtek e yowal yuj jun conob che yala' tol man conobok yayji. Ok wak' pax tit e yowal yuj jun conob c'am is nabal, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: And Isaiah boldly says, “I was found by those who did not seek me; I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me.”
Kanjobal: Ilab c'apax Isaías, max tec'baj ba yalon tzet max yal Dios yin eb man israelok. A eb c'am chin k'anlen ec'ok, max quin ilchaj yuj eb. Yetok c'apax bay eb c'am chi yal ba ayin, max in tx'ox in ba bay eb, ẍi Dios.

English: But concerning Israel he says, “All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and obstinate people.”
Kanjobal: A Isaías tu', max yal c'apaxcanok, tzet max yal Dios yin eb yet israelal: Masanil tiempo batxanc'altok in k'ab yin wawten jun conob c'am jabok chi yikej, yelxac'al pit, ẍi Dios.

English: You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgment on someone else, for at whatever point you judge the other, you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment do the same things.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al junok on chi co beyc'ulnej junokxa mactxel, maj je' jaloni, tol c'am co mul. Yujtol a yet chi co beyc'ulnen junokxa mactxel, lanan jiontek yailal jiban. Yujtol lanan co beyc'ulnen junok mactxel lajan tzet chi el junen yetok.

English: Now we know that God's judgment against those who do such things is based on truth.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, ta ayon axca tu' chi jut co ba, a Dios ok on beyc'ulnen yin bayc'al ijanilal, cax ok yak'on low jin.

English: So when you, a mere man, pass judgment on them and yet do the same things, do you think you will escape God's judgment?
Kanjobal: Xan a ayex che beyc'ulnej eb chi unen tzet man watx'ok tu', ¿tom ok je' e colon el e ba yalan yowal c'ul Dios ok jay e yiban e naoni? Palta cay tu' che yut c'apax e ba axca eb tu'.

English: Or do you show contempt for the riches of his kindness, tolerance and patience, not realizing that God's kindness leads you toward repentance?
Kanjobal: A Dios caw wal miman is watx'c'ulal. Caw wal ay is mimanc'ulal. Man comonok chi tit yowal. Palta tekan ayex c'am yelapnok juntzan ti' yul e sat. ¿Tom man e yojtakok, tol chi tx'ox is watx'c'ulal ayon yet watx' chi yak' na ba co c'ul?

English: But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart, you are storing up wrath against yourself for the day of God's wrath, when his righteous judgment will be revealed.
Kanjobal: Palta ayex ti' pit ex. C'am che na e ba jabok. Yuj tu', lanan e wajbanc'al yowal c'ul Dios e yiban. Axa yet ok jayoc jun c'ual yailal, e yetc'al ocok. A yet jun c'ual tu', ok txecloj el beyc'ulal Dios yin bayc'al ijanil.

English: God “will give to each person according to what he has done.”
Kanjobal: A yet tu' junjun on ok co cha paktzil, atac'ala' tzet max el juneni.

English: To those who by persistence in doing good seek glory, honor and immortality, he will give eternal life.
Kanjobal: Ok yak' Dios k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal ayon, tatol tec'an chi jut co ba junen watx'ilal, yujtol chi jochej ay jalon jet yin is watx'ilal Dios. Chi jochej tol ay jelapnok yul sat Cham. Chi jochej tol chi co cha co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: But for those who are self-seeking and who reject the truth and follow evil, there will be wrath and anger.
Kanjobal: Palta ay eb, a yowal c'ul Dios ok yak' bay, cax ok yak'on yailal eb. A ton bay eb chi yochej tol asannej oc miman yelapnok. C'am chi yikej cuybanilej caw yel. Asan yin tzet c'am watx'il ayoc is nabal eb.

English: There will be trouble and distress for every human being who does evil: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile;
Kanjobal: Masanilc'al eb chi unen tzet man watx'ok, caw ok yab eb yail sic'libil. Caw cusc'ulal ok yun yeloc eb. Babel ok yab eb wet israelal yailal, palta ok yab c'apax yailal eb man israelok.

English: but glory, honor and peace for everyone who does good: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.
Kanjobal: A masanil eb watx' max yut ba, a watx'ilal Dios ok yak' bay eb, cax miman yelapnok eb yul sat. Junc'ulalxac'al ok yun yayji ec' eb yetok. A eb wet israelal watx' max yut ba, babel ok yun juntzan ti' bay eb, cax ok yunen c'apax bay eb man israelok.

English: For God does not show favoritism.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yul sat Dios, lajanc'al jelapnok co masanil.

English: All who sin apart from the law will also perish apart from the law, and all who sin under the law will be judged by the law.
Kanjobal: Masanil eb man ojtaknenok ley Moisés, tatol c'am watx'il beybal eb, ok alaycantok eb bay camich yin junelnej; caxc'al man yujok jun ley tu', xan ok alaycantok eb. Palta masanil eb ojtaknen jun ley tu', cax max oc pax yobtakil eb, ac'al oc jun ley tu' ok ak'balnelayok, cax ok beyc'ulnelay eb.

English: For it is not those who hear the law who are righteous in God's sight, but it is those who obey the law who will be declared righteous.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb toc'al chi aben ec' tzet chi yal jun ley tu', man watx'ok eb yul sat Dios. A eb chi iken tzet chi yala', a ton eb tu' watx' yul sat Cham.

English: (Indeed, when Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature things required by the law, they are a law for themselves, even though they do not have the law,
Kanjobal: A eb man israelok, man yojtakok eb is ley Moisés, palta ay bay munilc'al chi beybalnej eb axca wal yalon jun ley tu'. Caxc'al man yojtakok eb jun ley tu', munilc'al ayoc yin is nabal eb.

English: since they show that the requirements of the law are written on their hearts, their consciences also bearing witness, and their thoughts now accusing, now even defending them.)
Kanjobal: A is beybal eb chi tx'oxon elok, tol ayoc jun ley tu' yin is nabal eb. A yikbomal is nabal eb chi tenchaneni. Axca tu' chi yut tx'oxon el ba eb, tol ayoc jun ley tu' yin is nabal eb. Munilc'al chi ak'lay yojtaknej el eb yuj yikbomal is nabal, ta watx' tzet chi el yunen eb, ma yob.

English: This will take place on the day when God will judge men's secrets through Jesus Christ, as my gospel declares.
Kanjobal: A yet ok jay jun c'ual, ok on beyc'ulnej Dios co masanil yuj tzetak ewanc'uan yayji juj, a Jesucristo ok on beyc'ulnenok axca yalon jun k'anejal yet colbanilej chi wal ti'.

English: Now you, if you call yourself a Jew; if you rely on the law and brag about your relationship to God;
Kanjobal: Palta ayex che maynej e ba yujtol israel ex, cax asan ley Moisés che yaoc yipok e c'ul, caw wal che yi' aj can e ba yujtol conob ex Dios.

English: if you know his will and approve of what is superior because you are instructed by the law;
Kanjobal: E yojtakxa, tzet chi yochej Dios. E yojtak c'apaxok baytet ay watx' tzet chi el juneni, yujtol cuywinak ex yin ley Moisés.

English: if you are convinced that you are a guide for the blind, a light for those who are in the dark,
Kanjobal: Ay eb man ojtakbilok Dios yuj, axca tol c'am chi je' yilwi eb. Cax ay exxa chi je' e tx'oxon Dios bay eb e naoni. Yetok bay eb axca tol k'ekk'inalto ay yanimail, chi je' e yak'on sakk'inal bay eb e naoni.

English: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of infants, because you have in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth–
Kanjobal: A e naoni tol chi je' e cuyon eb c'am tzet yojtak, cax chi je' e yak'on nachaj el yuj eb c'am chi nachaj el yuj, e naoni. Yuj ley Moisés, xan caw chi nachaj el juntzan cuybej tu' e yuj. E yojtakxa baytet ay cuybanilej yel.

English: you, then, who teach others, do you not teach yourself? You who preach against stealing, do you steal?
Kanjobal: Caw cuywajwom ex bay juntzanok mactxel, palta ¿tzet xan c'am che cuy pax wal e ba? Che yala' tol c'am chi je' jelk'ani, palta elk'om ex paxok.

English: You who say that people should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
Kanjobal: Che yala' tol c'am chi je' co beybalnen ajmulal, palta che beybalnej pax ajmulal. Caw wal che yajil juntzan tzet chi al-lay oc diosal, palta elk'om ex pax bay templo.

English: You who brag about the law, do you dishonor God by breaking the law?
Kanjobal: Yujtol e yojtak ley Moisés, xan caw che maynej e ba. Palta c'am che yikej pax tzet chi yal jun ley tu'. Yuj tu' caw wal chi buchlay el Dios e yuj.

English: As it is written: “God's name is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”
Kanjobal: A yul tx'an Un chi yalcan axca ti': Yuj e beybal xan chi buchwaj eb man israelok yin Dios, ẍi tx'an.

English: Circumcision has value if you observe the law, but if you break the law, you have become as though you had not been circumcised.
Kanjobal: Yel toni, ay yopiso jun yechel trato chi yik circuncisión ta che yikej masanil tzet chi yal ley Moisés. Palta ta c'am che yikej jun ley tu', axca wal tol c'amoc circuncisión tu' e yin yul sat Dios.

English: If those who are not circumcised keep the law's requirements, will they not be regarded as though they were circumcised?
Kanjobal: A pax eb c'amoc yechel yin xin, ta caw chi yikej eb tzet chi yal jun ley tu', axca wal tol ocnak jun yechel eb tu' yin yul sat Dios.

English: The one who is not circumcised physically and yet obeys the law will condemn you who, even though you have the written code and circumcision, are a lawbreaker.
Kanjobal: Ay ton eb axca tu'. C'am jun yechelej tu' ocnak yin, palta caw chi yikej eb jun ley tu'. A eb ok ex beyc'ulnenok. Caxc'al ocnak e yechel, caxc'al ay jun ley tu' tz'ibbilcan ayex, palta tutun c'am che yikej.

English: A man is not a Jew if he is only one outwardly, nor is circumcision merely outward and physical.
Kanjobal: Manak eb chi yik judío yujc'al yinatil, manak eb tu' yel wali judío yul sat Dios. Manak eb ayoc jun circuncisión tu' yin, manak eb tu' yel wali ayoc yechel yul sat Dios.

English: No, a man is a Jew if he is one inwardly; and circumcision is circumcision of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the written code. Such a man's praise is not from men, but from God.
Kanjobal: Palta a eb caw yel ayoc nabal yin Dios, a ton eb tu' caw wal yel judío yul sat. Yujtol a jun acaw circuncisión yul sat Dios, a ton jun ayoc yin co nabal. Man leyok tz'ibbilcan chi aloni, xan chi oc jin, palta a Cham Espíritu chi ak'on ayon. Yuj tu', man animaok chon alon watx'il, palta a Dios chon alon watx'il.

English: What advantage, then, is there in being a Jew, or what value is there in circumcision?
Kanjobal: Palta ¿xin ta man watx'ok yet eb wet israelal che na' tinani'? Yetok c'apax jun circuncisión tu', ¿xin ta c'am yopiso che na'?

English: Much in every way! First of all, they have been entrusted with the very words of God.
Kanjobal: C'amak. Ok waltek ayex, tzet yuj xan miman yelapnok. A ayon israel on ti' yak'nakcan Dios is k'anej.

English: What if some did not have faith? Will their lack of faith nullify God's faithfulness?
Kanjobal: Ay ton eb man yanakok oc c'ul yin, palta ¿tom yuj tu' man ok yun tzet yalnakcan Dios?

English: Not at all! Let God be true, and every man a liar. As it is written: “So that you may be proved right when you speak and prevail when you judge.”
Kanjobal: C'amak, caw wal ok yunej. Caxc'al c'am chi yun tzet chi yal junjun anima, palta chic'al yun Dios tzet chi yala'. A tx'an Un chi alon axca ti': A xan watx' ach yin in ak'on cuenta. C'am chi je' yal-lay yob en yet chach beyc'ulnelayi, ẍi tx'an.

English: But if our unrighteousness brings out God's righteousness more clearly, what shall we say? That God is unjust in bringing his wrath on us? (I am using a human argument.)
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', man tojolok on, xan a co c'am tojolal tu', chi ak'on txecloj elok, tol asan Dios tojol. Palta ¿tzet quex chi? ¿Tom man tojolok Dios, xan ok yak' yailal ayon yuj co c'am tojolal tu'? (Ay anima caytu' naon axca tu'.)

English: Certainly not! If that were so, how could God judge the world?
Kanjobal: ¡Palta caw wal man axcaok tu'! K'inalok ta man tojolok Dios tinani', maj mi je' con beyc'ulnen Cham ayon aj yulyibank'inal on ti'.

English: Someone might argue, “If my falsehood enhances God's truthfulness and so increases his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?”
Kanjobal: Ay eb chi naon axca ti': A yet chi wak'on lek'tial, lanan in tx'oxon elok, tol asan Dios yel chi yala'. Tatol chi ilay can Dios yuj lek'tial chi wak' tu xin, ¿tzet xan a yet chin beyc'ulnelayi, chin al-lay yobtakwomal? ẍi eb.

English: Why not say–as we are being slanderously reported as saying and as some claim that we say–“Let us do evil that good may result”? Their condemnation is deserved.
Kanjobal: Ay eb chi tz'ak alon win, tolab chi wal axca ti': Watx' chi jun yobtakil, yet watx' chi aj can watx'ilal, quin chi ab yal eb. A eb chi alon juntzan tu', caw moj ok tokcan eb bay yailal.

English: What shall we conclude then? Are we any better? Not at all! We have already made the charge that Jews and Gentiles alike are all under sin.
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet quex chi xin? ¿tom yel watx' on ayon israel on ti' yintak eb man israelok? C'amak, lajan onc'al el yetok eb. Yujtol toxa max wala', tol co masanil, caxc'al israel on, caxc'al c'amak, yobtakwom on.

English: As it is written: “There is no one righteous, not even one;
Kanjobal: A tx'an Un chi alon axca ti': C'am junok mactxel watx', tamwal junok.

English: there is no one who understands, no one who seeks God.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mactxel chi nachaj el yuj. C'am junok mactxel chi naon Dios.

English: All have turned away, they have together become worthless; there is no one who does good, not even one.”
Kanjobal: Masanil eb, max bekcan watx' beybalej, jun lajan max yun yetnentok ba eb. Tok aytowal mactxel chi unen watx' beybalej, tutun c'am mactxel, tamwal junok.

English: “Their throats are open graves; their tongues practice deceit.” “The poison of vipers is on their lips.”
Kanjobal: Yuj tzet chi yal eb tu', xan chi toj anima bay cambal. Toc'al chi yet k'anenej eb yet animail. A is k'anej eb, axca wal venenoal no txutx labaj.

English: “Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”
Kanjobal: Asan catab k'anej yin sawenal chi yal eb.

English: “Their feet are swift to shed blood;
Kanjobal: Ayman chi toj mak' cam eb junok yet animail.

English: ruin and misery mark their ways,
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al bay chi ec' eb, chi etax el masanil yuj eb. Chi occan cusc'ulal yuj eb.

English: and the way of peace they do not know.”
Kanjobal: Man yojtakok eb beybalej yet junc'ulal.

English: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
Kanjobal: C'am jabok yelapnok Dios yul sat eb, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world held accountable to God.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol a masanil tzet tz'ibbilcan yul ley, a' chi alon bay eb ayoc yalan ley tu', yet watx' c'am junok mactxel ok je' colon ba; chi nachaj el juj co masanil tol ay co yobtakil satak Dios.

English: Therefore no one will be declared righteous in his sight by observing the law; rather, through the law we become conscious of sin.
Kanjobal: C'am junok mac watx' yul sat Cham asan yuj chi yikej tzet chi yal jun ley tu'. Yujtol a yopiso ley tu', tol chi tx'ox ayon tol yobtakwom on co masanil.

English: But now a righteousness from God, apart from law, has been made known, to which the Law and the Prophets testify.
Kanjobal: A tinani', mayal txecloj elok, tzetbil chi yun joc watx'il yul sat Dios. Man yujok jiken ley Moisés, xan chon oc watx'il yul sat Cham, palta a yul tx'an Un bay tz'ibbilcan ley tu', a tu' chi yala', tzet chi yun joc watx'il. Yalnak c'apaxcan eb chekbej Dios payxa yin jun ti'.

English: This righteousness from God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe. There is no difference,
Kanjobal: Asan yuj chi jaoc co c'ul yin Jesucristo, xan watx' on yul sat Dios, yujtol tzanc'al mac chi yaoc Cham yin c'ul, chi oc eb watx'il yul sat. Lajan onc'al co masanil ayon anima on ti' yul sat Dios.

English: for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
Kanjobal: Yujtol max oc co yobtakil co masanil bay Cham, xan c'am jalon jet yin is watx'ilal.

English: and are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Palta asan yuj watx'c'ulal Cham, xan watx' onxa yul sat tinani', yujtol colchajnak onxa yuj Cristo Jesús.

English: God presented him as a sacrifice of atonement, through faith in his blood. He did this to demonstrate his justice, because in his forbearance he had left the sins committed beforehand unpunished–
Kanjobal: A Cristo ocnak xajanbalil yuj Dios. Elnak is chiq'uil, yuj yion el co yobtakil, ta chi jaoc co c'ul yin is camichal Cham. Caytu' chi yun txecloji, tol caw wal tojol Dios yin yak'on mimanc'ulal yin eb ocnak yobtakil bay yet payxa.

English: he did it to demonstrate his justice at the present time, so as to be just and the one who justifies those who have faith in Jesus.
Kanjobal: Chi txecloj c'apaxok, tol ac'ala' tojol Cham tinani', yin yaloni, tol watx' on yul sat, mac on chi jaoc co c'ul yin Jesús.

English: Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded. On what principle? On that of observing the law? No, but on that of faith.
Kanjobal: A tinani', ¿xin ta chi je' co maynen co ba che na'? Tutun wal c'am chi je', yujtol man yujok chi jikej ley Moisés xan chon colchaji, palta asan wal yuj chi jaoc co c'ul yin Jesús, xan chon colchaji. Yuj tu xin, maj je' co maynen co ba.

English: For we maintain that a man is justified by faith apart from observing the law.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', jojtak tol asan yuj chi jaoc co c'ul yin Cham, xan watx' on yul sat Dios, man yujok jiken tzet chi yal jun ley tu'.

English: Is God the God of Jews only? Is he not the God of Gentiles too? Yes, of Gentiles too,
Kanjobal: A Dios, tokwal co Diosal ayon israel on ti' co tx'oklil; is Diosal c'apax eb man israelok. Wal yel co Diosal co masanil.

English: since there is only one God, who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through that same faith.
Kanjobal: Yujtol junnej Dios ay. Tzanc'al mactxel, caxc'al israel, caxc'al c'amak, tatol chi jaoc co c'ul yin Jesús, watx' on yul sat Dios.

English: Do we, then, nullify the law by this faith? Not at all! Rather, we uphold the law.
Kanjobal: Yel toni, asan yuj chi jaoc yin co c'ul, xan chon colchaji, palta ¿tom yuj tu' chi je' jaloni tol c'amxa yopiso ley Moisés tu'? C'amak, maj je' jalon axca tu'. A ti' jet, tol chi co tx'oxo' tol ay yopiso jun ley tu'.

English: What then shall we say that Abraham, our forefather, discovered in this matter?
Kanjobal: A cham jichmam Abraham, ¿tzet max yun yeloc cham yul sat Dios che na'?

English: If, in fact, Abraham was justified by works, he had something to boast about–but not before God.
Kanjobal: Watx' cham yul sat Dios, palta man yujok tzet watx' max el yunen yul yet, xan watx' cham yul sat Dios. K'inalok ta yuj tu', tekan chi je' maynen ba cham. Palta tinani' maj je' maynen ba satak Dios.

English: What does the Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol chi yal yul tx'an Un Tz'ibbilcan axca ti': Axa yaon oc Abraham yin c'ul tzet max yal Dios bay, xan watx' max yun cancan yul sat Cham, ẍi yul tx'an.

English: Now when a man works, his wages are not credited to him as a gift, but as an obligation.
Kanjobal: A tinani', k'inalok ta chon mulnaj bay junok anima, cax chi co chaon co tojol, a co tojol tu', man sabalok, palta tol jecxa nak aj mulnajil tu'.

English: However, to the man who does not work but trusts God who justifies the wicked, his faith is credited as righteousness.
Kanjobal: Palta a Dios, caxc'al c'am tzet chi jun bay, tatol chi jaoc yin co c'ul, watx' on yul sat. Caytu' chi yun junjun yobtakwom yul sat Dios, tatol chi ya wal oc eb yin c'ul.

English: David says the same thing when he speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:
Kanjobal: A cham rey David, max yalcan elok, tol watx' yet eb mac bay chi al-lay yuj Dios tol watx' eb yul sat. Man yujok tzet watx' chi el yunen eb, xan chi yal Dios axca tu'.

English: “Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.
Kanjobal: Max yalcan cham David tu' axca ti': Tzalojc'ulal yet mactxel max jolayc'ay is yec'nakilal cax max tancan el is mul yiban.

English: Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will never count against him.”
Kanjobal: Tzalojc'ulal yet mactxel c'am chi oc is yobtakil mulok yuj Cham Jajawil, ẍican cham David tu'.

English: Is this blessedness only for the circumcised, or also for the uncircumcised? We have been saying that Abraham's faith was credited to him as righteousness.
Kanjobal: A jun tzalojc'ulal chi yal ti', man asannejok eb ayoc circuncisión yin ay yet. A jun tzalojc'ulal tu' yet c'apax eb man ocnakok jun yechelej tu' yin. Mayal wal ayex, tol a Abraham max yaoc Dios yin c'ul. Asan yuj tu' xan yalnak Dios tol watx' yul sat.

English: Under what circumstances was it credited? Was it after he was circumcised, or before? It was not after, but before!
Kanjobal: Palta naektek, ¿bak'ini yalnak Dios axca tu'? ¿Tom ak'bilxa circuncidar Abraham tu' yet tu'? C'amak, manto ak'lay circuncidar yet tu'.

English: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised. So then, he is the father of all who believe but have not been circumcised, in order that righteousness might be credited to them.
Kanjobal: Palta c'ojanc'ulalto ocnak jun circuncisión tu' yin. A jun tu' chi tx'oxon tol watx' cham yul sat Dios yet manto ak'lay circuncidar, asan yuj max yaoc Dios yin c'ul. Yuj tu', mamej yayji cham bay jantak eb man ak'bilok circuncidar, tatol chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Dios. A ton eb tu', watx' eb yul sat Dios axca Abraham tu'.

English: And he is also the father of the circumcised who not only are circumcised but who also walk in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham had before he was circumcised.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok mamej yayji cham bay eb ak'bil circuncidar. Chi yal elapnok, eb c'am chi yaoc jun circuncisión tu' yipok c'ul. Palta chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Dios, axca max yun Abraham tu' yet manto ak'lay circuncidar.

English: It was not through law that Abraham and his offspring received the promise that he would be heir of the world, but through the righteousness that comes by faith.
Kanjobal: Yak'nakcan Dios ti' bay Abraham, yetok bay eb yinatil, tol ok yak' yulyibank'inal ti' bay eb. Man yujok max yikej cham ley Dios, xan max yak' ti' bay, palta asannej yuj max yaoc Dios yin c'ul, xan watx' cham yul sat.

English: For if those who live by law are heirs, faith has no value and the promise is worthless,
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta asan bay eb ayoc yin ley tu' ok yak' Dios yulyibank'inal ti', nabac'al mi chi jaoc co c'ul yin chi yal tu', cax mi chi tancan el tzet albil yuj tu'.

English: because law brings wrath. And where there is no law there is no transgression.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun ley tu', chi awi oc yailal yiban anima. K'inalok ta c'am jun ley tu' tinani', c'am mac chi oc yobtakil bay ley tu'.
