English: Therefore, the promise comes by faith, so that it may be by grace and may be guaranteed to all Abraham's offspring–not only to those who are of the law but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham. He is the father of us all.
Kanjobal: Yak'nakcan Dios ti' bay Abraham, yujtol max yaoc Dios yin c'ul. Axca ton tu' chi yun txecloj elok, tol asan yuj is watx'c'ulal Dios, xan yak'nakcan is ti'. Yuj tu', a ayon yinatil on Abraham on ti', ay c'apax jalon jet co masanil yin yetok. Man asannejok eb chi yikej jun ley tu' ay yalon yet yin, palta ay c'apax jalon jet yin co masanil ayon chi jaoc co c'ul yin Dios axca Abraham tu'. Yujtol axca tol co mam yayji Abraham tu' yul sat Dios, yujtol a yin Dios max yaoc c'ul.

English: As it is written: “I have made you a father of many nations.” He is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed–the God who gives life to the dead and calls things that are not as though they were.
Kanjobal: Axca yaloncan Dios yul tx'an Un: Ok ach wacan oc is yichmamok xiwil nacionlak, ẍi Cham bay Abraham. A Dios chi ak'on ictzoj aj eb camnak. Asan tol chi yala' cax chi pitzc'oj juntzan tzet yetal tol c'amtac'a.

English: Against all hope, Abraham in hope believed and so became the father of many nations, just as it had been said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
Kanjobal: A yunnak Abraham junel, c'am junok tzet yetal max je' yak'on yip is c'ul, palta max yaoc Dios yin c'ul. A tzet yalnak Dios bay, a' max yaoc yipok c'ul. Yuj tu', max oc yichmamok xiwil nacionlak axca max yut yaloncan Dios bay, yet max yalon axca ti': Axca ton waycan tu' ok yun bisil eb enatil, ẍi bay.

English: Without weakening in his faith, he faced the fact that his body was as good as dead–since he was about a hundred years old–and that Sarah's womb was also dead.
Kanjobal: A Abraham tu', janic'xanej man 100 abilok max yila'. Yojtak tol caw wal ichamxa. Yojtak c'apaxok tol caw wal ixnamxa xal Sara. Axca wal tol c'amxa bak'in ok aljok junok yuninal eb, palta ac'ala' yaon oc cham yin is c'ul tzet max yal Dios bay.

English: Yet he did not waver through unbelief regarding the promise of God, but was strengthened in his faith and gave glory to God,
Kanjobal: A yet max yak'on Dios ti' bay, cax man cabc'ulaltakok max yut yabeni. Caw wal tol max yaoc yin c'ul. Caw wal tec'an is nabal. Max yal watx' k'anej bay Dios,

English: being fully persuaded that God had power to do what he had promised.
Kanjobal: yujtol yojtak cham sic'libil, tol chic'al je' yuj Dios yunen axca yalon bay.

English: This is why “it was credited to him as righteousness.”
Kanjobal: Yuj wal tu' xan watx' max yun cancan Abraham tu' yul sat Cham.

English: The words “it was credited to him” were written not for him alone,
Kanjobal: Tz'ibbilcan yabixal yul tx'an Un, tol watx' cham yul sat Dios, yujtol max yaoc cham yin is c'ul. Palta man asannejok yuj cham xan max tz'ibelaycanok.

English: but also for us, to whom God will credit righteousness–for us who believe in him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead.
Kanjobal: Palta tol ayon jun chon al-lay c'apaxok. Yuj tu' xan chi yal Dios tol watx' on yul sat, tatol chi jaoc co c'ul yin. A Cham ak'nej pax ictzoj aj Cham Jajawil Jesús xol eb camnak.

English: He was delivered over to death for our sins and was raised to life for our justification.
Kanjobal: Max alay oc Jesús yul k'ab camich yuj co yobtakil. Lajwi tu', max ictzoj pax ajok, yuj joccan watx'il satak Dios yuj.

English: Therefore, since we have been justified through faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
Kanjobal: A tinani', toxa mayal yal Dios, tol watx' on yul sat, yujtol chi jaoc co c'ul yin. Yuj tu', junc'ulalxa ayon yetok, yujc'al Cham Jajawil Jesucristo.

English: through whom we have gained access by faith into this grace in which we now stand. And we rejoice in the hope of the glory of God.
Kanjobal: Yuj Cristo xan ay jalon jet co chaon watx'c'ulalil Dios, yujtol chi jaoc co c'ul yin. Yuj tu', xiwil is watx'c'ulalil chi tx'ox ayon tinani'. Caw wal chon tzaloji, yujtol chi jaoc yipok co c'ul, tol ay jalon jet yin is watx'ilal Cham.

English: Not only so, but we also rejoice in our sufferings, because we know that suffering produces perseverance;
Kanjobal: Man asannejok yuj tu' xan chon tzaloji, palta tzalojokonek c'apax yet chi jaben yail yuj. Yujtol jojtak, tol a juntzan yailal tu', a chi texac'al ak'on co tec'anil.

English: perseverance, character; and character, hope.
Kanjobal: Yuj co tec'anil tu' xan chi tzaloj Dios jetok. Yuj tu', chi je' jaon oc Cham yipok co c'ul.

English: And hope does not disappoint us, because God has poured out his love into our hearts by the Holy Spirit, whom he has given us.
Kanjobal: Maj el co q'uixwil yet chi jaon oc Cham yipok co c'ul, yujtol tz'akaki max yut yak'on Cham is camc'ulal yin janimail yet max yak'on Cham Espíritu Santo ayon.

English: You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly.
Kanjobal: Maj je' juj yul jet jak'on tzalojbok c'ul Dios, axa yet max ajapnok tiempoal xin, max cam Cristo juj, ayon c'am Dios yul co sat ti'.

English: Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous man, though for a good man someone might possibly dare to die.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ay junok mac watx' is beybal tinani', tekan c'am mac chi yak' ba cam yuj. Asan ta ay junok mac caw wal watx' is nabal, ay mi junok ayman chi tec'baj ba cam yuj.

English: But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
Kanjobal: Palta tx'oxnak Dios camc'ulal ayon, yujtol a Cristo max yak' cam ba juj yet caw wal yobtakwom onto.

English: Since we have now been justified by his blood, how much more shall we be saved from God's wrath through him!
Kanjobal: Axa tinani', watx' onxa yul sat, yujtol jujc'al max cam Cristo. Yuj tu' xan ok on colchaj el bay jun miman yailal tolto ok jay yuj yowal c'ul Dios.

English: For if, when we were God's enemies, we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son, how much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved through his life!
Kanjobal: A yet yalan, caxc'al ajc'ul on oc yin Cham palta max on oc yin watx'c'ulalil yetok, yujtol jujc'al xan max cam is C'ajol. A pax tinani', watx'xa jak'on yetok, yuj tu' xan ok on colchaj yuj yiquisal is C'ajol tu'.

English: Not only is this so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.
Kanjobal: Man asannejok yuj juntzan ti' chon tzaloji, palta caw chon tzaloj c'apax yin Dios yuj Cham Jajawil Jesucristo. Yujtol yuj Cham xan watx'xa jak'on yetok Dios tinani'.

English: Therefore, just as sin entered the world through one man, and death through sin, and in this way death came to all men, because all sinned–
Kanjobal: Yuj ch'an jun winak a ton Adán, xan max el yich yobtakil yulyibank'inal ti'. Yuj yobtakil tu', xan elnak yich camich, xan ayoc camich jiban co masanil, yujtol max oc co mul co masanil.

English: for before the law was given, sin was in the world. But sin is not taken into account when there is no law.
Kanjobal: A yet manto ak'lay ley Moisés, ayxac'alta' yobtakil anima chi oqui. Palta a is yobtakil eb tu', maj oc is mulok eb, yujtol c'amto ley.

English: Nevertheless, death reigned from the time of Adam to the time of Moses, even over those who did not sin by breaking a command, as did Adam, who was a pattern of the one to come.
Kanjobal: Palta yecheltaxc'al yul is tiempoal Adán, masantac'al max eltek is ley Moisés, ayc'alta' oc camich jiban co masanil, caxc'al man lajanok co yobtakil axca yet Adán tu' tol maj yikej tzet max al-lay bay. A Adán tu', yenel Cham t'inan jayi.

English: But the gift is not like the trespass. For if the many died by the trespass of the one man, how much more did God's grace and the gift that came by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, overflow to the many!
Kanjobal: A jun is yobtakil Adán tu', caw wal man lajanok axca co colbanil chi yak' Dios. Yuj is yobtakil jun winak tu', xan max ijbelaycan oc camich jiban co masanil, palta jun colbanilej, toc'al wal chi el yin c'ul Dios yak'oni, yelxac'al miman yelapnok, yujtol yuj ch'an jun mactxel, a ton Jesucristo, xan xiwil on chi co cha' watx'c'ulalil Dios.

English: Again, the gift of God is not like the result of the one man's sin: The judgment followed one sin and brought condemnation, but the gift followed many trespasses and brought justification.
Kanjobal: A is yobtakil jun winak tu', caw wal man lajanok axca jun co colbanil chi yak' Cham ayon. Yuj wal ch'an jun is yobtakil jun winak tu', xan max jaycan yowal c'ul Dios jiban co masanil. Palta caxc'al xiwil co yobtakil max oc bay Cham, palta chi yak' Cham co colbanil yin toc'al chi el yin is c'ul, xan watx' on yul sat tinani'.

English: For if, by the trespass of the one man, death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who receive God's abundant provision of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man, Jesus Christ.
Kanjobal: Asan yuj is yobtakil ch'an jun winak, xan max ijaycan camich jiban co masanil. Palta yuj ch'an junokxa mactxel, a ton Jesucristo, xan ok co cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, c'al joc yajawilal yetok, yujtol caw miman is watx'c'ulal Dios tx'oxnak ayon, xan max yala' tol watx' on yul sat.

English: Consequently, just as the result of one trespass was condemnation for all men, so also the result of one act of righteousness was justification that brings life for all men.
Kanjobal: Yuj is yobtakil Adán, xan ijancan oc yailal jiban co masanil, palta ay wal jun tzet caw wal watx' yunnak Jesucristo. Yuj wal jun tu', xan chi yal Dios, tol watx' on yul sat, cax chi yak'on co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one man the many will be made righteous.
Kanjobal: Yuj wal tenomtakil jun winak maj iken tu', xan ocnak on can yin yobtakwomal co masanil. Palta ay pax jun mac max ikeni. Yuj yikemal jun tu', xan xiwil on chon oc watx'il yul sat Dios.

English: The law was added so that the trespass might increase. But where sin increased, grace increased all the more,
Kanjobal: Jaynak ley Moisés, yet chi txecloj el yobtakil sic'libil. Caxc'al max texac'al aj can yobtakil tu', palta yelxac'al max aj can watx'c'ulalil Dios yintak jun tu'.

English: so that, just as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to bring eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Kanjobal: Ayon oc co masanil yul k'ab yobtakil. Yuj yipalil yobtakil, xan chon cami, palta a is watx'c'ulalil Dios, ay c'apax is yipalil. Yuj xan, watx' on yul sat tinani'. Axca tu' max yut yak'on co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal yin Cham Jajawil Jesucristo.

English: What shall we say, then? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may increase?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet con chi che na' xin? ¿Tom mi watx', ta ac'ala' junen yobtakil, yet watx' chi yak'c'al Dios mimanc'ulal jin, cax chi texac'al txecloj el is watx'c'ulalil axca tu'?

English: By no means! We died to sin; how can we live in it any longer?
Kanjobal: C'amak, caw wal maj je'. A yul sat Dios, camnak onxa, c'amxa yalon yet yobtakil jin. Yuj tu', ¿tom ac'ala' chi je' co beybalnen yobtakil?

English: Or don't you know that all of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
Kanjobal: E yojtakxa, tol a yet max on ak'lay bautizar junjun on, max txecloj elok, tol junxanej max juncan el yetok Cristo Jesús. A tu' max txecloj elok, tol a yet max cam Cham, max on cam c'apax yetok.

English: We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
Kanjobal: A yuj co bautismo tu' max txecloj elok, tol max on cami, cax junxanej max yun co mukay yetok Cristo. Yuj tu' xan axca c'apax max yun yictzoj aj Cristo xol eb camnak yuj is miman mayk'ak'al co Mam Dios, axca c'apax tu' max yun jictzoj aj c'apaxok. Chi yal elapnok, a wal junok ac' beybalej chi co beybalnej tinani'.

English: If we have been united with him like this in his death, we will certainly also be united with him in his resurrection.
Kanjobal: Junnej max yun co cam yetok Cristo yet max cami. Yuj tu' xan axca max yun yictzoji, axca tu' ok yun jictzoj c'apaxok, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok.

English: For we know that our old self was crucified with him so that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves to sin–
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol a tzet jayji yet yalan, a yul sat Dios, max curusnelay yetok Cristo yet watx' chi ilaycan el yikbej co yob nabal. Axca tu' max juncan elok, yet watx' manchakxa jak' serbil yobtakil tinani'.

English: because anyone who has died has been freed from sin.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a mac camnakxa, c'amxa oc yul k'ab yobtakil.

English: Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.
Kanjobal: Ayon ti', camnak onxa yetok Cristo yul sat Dios. Yuj tu', chi jaoc yin co c'ul, tol ok on iquisbok yetok yin junelnej.

English: For we know that since Christ was raised from the dead, he cannot die again; death no longer has mastery over him.
Kanjobal: Yujtol jojtak, tol yecheltaxc'al max ictzonelay aj Cristo xol eb camnak, c'amxa bak'in ok cam junelxa, yujtol c'amxa yalon yet camich yin.

English: The death he died, he died to sin once for all; but the life he lives, he lives to God.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet max cami, max cam yuj tojolok yobtakilal yin junelnej. Axa tinani', iquis yin junelnej, yuj yak'on serbil Dios.

English: In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus.
Kanjobal: Cayokab on tu', nachajokab el juj, tol camnak onxa, c'amxa yalon yet yobtakil jin. Co naek c'apaxok, tol iquis on, yuj jak'on serbil Dios, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús.

English: Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its evil desires.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', manchakxa co cha' yajawbok yobtakil yin co mimanil tol cambejal yayji. Caw manchakxa jikejek junen juntzan yobtakil chi jochej ocok.

English: Do not offer the parts of your body to sin, as instruments of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God, as those who have been brought from death to life; and offer the parts of your body to him as instruments of righteousness.
Kanjobal: Manchakxa co bek co mimanil yul k'ab tzet man watx'ok, cax chi junen yobtakil. Yowalil asan yul k'ab Dios chi jaoc co ba, yujtol camnak onxa yul sat, cax max on ictzonelay pax ajok. Yuj tu', jak'ek co mimanil bay Dios, yet watx' asan tzet watx' chi el junen yetok.

English: For sin shall not be your master, because you are not under law, but under grace.
Kanjobal: A yobtakil c'amxaokab yalon yet jin, yujtol c'am onxa oc yalan yikbej ley Moisés. A yalan yikbej watx'c'ulalil Dios ayon oc tinani'.

English: What then? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace? By no means!
Kanjobal: A tinani', ayon oc yalan watx'c'ulalil Dios, manxanak yalan ley Moisés ayon ocok. Palta, ¿tzet ẍi e c'ul? ¿Tom yuj tu', xan chi je' tol ac'ala' junen yobtakil? C'amak, caw wal c'amxa chi je'.

English: Don't you know that when you offer yourselves to someone to obey him as slaves, you are slaves to the one whom you obey–whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness?
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tatol ay junok mactxel chi yak' ba yak'omalok serbil junokxa mactxel, asan jun tu' ay yalon yet yin yin junelnej. Yowalil chi yikej tzet chi yal is patrón tu'. Cayon ton tu xin. Tatol chi jak' serbil yobtakil, chi jikej tzet chi yochej, tutun tol asannej ayon yet. Axa co cam yuj tu' yin junelnej. Palta tatol a Dios chi jak' serbil, chi jikej tzet chi yochej; tatol axca tu', asannej ayon yet. Axa watx'ji oc co nabal yuj tu'.

English: But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin, you wholeheartedly obeyed the form of teaching to which you were entrusted.
Kanjobal: Palta chi wal yuj diosalil bay Dios e yuj. Yujtol caxc'al max e yak' serbil yobtakil yet yalan, palta axa tinani', lanan e yiken yin masanil e c'ul juntzan cuybanilej bay max ex alaycan ocok.

English: You have been set free from sin and have become slaves to righteousness.
Kanjobal: Max ex colchaj el yul k'ab yobtakil, manxa yak'omalok serbil e yayji tinani', palta tol yak'omalxa serbil watx'ilal e yayji.

English: I put this in human terms because you are weak in your natural selves. Just as you used to offer the parts of your body in slavery to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer them in slavery to righteousness leading to holiness.
Kanjobal: A juntzan chi waltok ayex ti', axca tol comon abixc'al chi wut walontok, yujtol c'am wal chi nachaj el juntzan cuybanilej ti' e yuj. A yet yalan, max jak' co mimanil yak'omalok serbil tzet man watx'ok, c'al jaj can yin yobtakil. Axa tinani', yowalil axcaokab tu' chi jut jak'on co mimanil ti' yak'omalok serbil watx'il, yet watx' asan yin Dios chi jaoc co nabal.

English: When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of righteousness.
Kanjobal: A yet max jak' serbil tzet man watx'ok yet yalan, c'am yalon yet watx'il jin yet tu'.

English: What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are now ashamed of? Those things result in death!
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿ay mi jabok tzet max ji' yin juntzan max jun tu'? Caw chon q'uixwi yuj juntzan tu' tinani'. Yujc'al juntzan tu', xan chi tojcan eb anima bay camich yin junelnej.

English: But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves to God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life.
Kanjobal: Axa tinani', colbil onxa el yul k'ab juntzan tzet man watx'ok tu'. C'amxa yalon yet jin. Max on oc yak'omalok serbil Dios. Yuj tu' caw wal ay tzet chi ji' tinani', yujtol a' chi ak'on jaoc co nabal yin. Cax ok co chaon pax co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Kanjobal: Tatol a yobtakil chi junej, ok co cha is tojol, a ton camich yin junelnej. Palta a jun is sabal Dios chi yak' ayon, a ton co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús, Cham Jajawil.

English: Do you not know, brothers–for I am speaking to men who know the law–that the law has authority over a man only as long as he lives?
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, e yojtakxa ley Moisés, tol a jun ley tu', ay yalon yet yin junok mactxel yet iquisto ec'ok.

English: For example, by law a married woman is bound to her husband as long as he is alive, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law of marriage.
Kanjobal: K'inalok junok ix ay yichamil. A yet iquis ec' yichamil tu', mojan ix yetok yuj jun ley tu'. Tatol chi cam yichamil ix tu', cax bekanxa ix yuj jun ley tu'.

English: So then, if she marries another man while her husband is still alive, she is called an adulteress. But if her husband dies, she is released from that law and is not an adulteress, even though she marries another man.
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta iquisto yichamil ix tu', cax chi toj ix bay junokxa winak, chi toj ix yin ajmul ixal axca tu'. Palta tatol chi cam yichamil ix xin, chi bekchaj el ix yalan jun ley tu'. Caxc'al chi yi ix junokxa winak, man ajmulok chi yun ix axca tu'.

English: So, my brothers, you also died to the law through the body of Christ, that you might belong to another, to him who was raised from the dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God.
Kanjobal: Ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, a tinani', junxanej jayji yetok is mimanil Cristo yet max cami. Yuj tu', a yul sat Dios, camnak onxa el bay ley Moisés. Yuj tu', ay junxa mac axca tol jajawil yayji, a ton Cham max ictzoj aj xol eb camnak. Axca ton tu' jak'on yetok, yet watx' ay jopiso yul sat Dios.

English: For when we were controlled by the sinful nature, the sinful passions aroused by the law were at work in our bodies, so that we bore fruit for death.
Kanjobal: A yet yalan, asan co yob ochwanilal chi co beybalnej. A ley Moisés max pitzc'onej aj juntzan tzet man watx'ok chi yochej oc co mimanil ti'. A juntzan tu' chon iontok bay camich yin junelnej.

English: But now, by dying to what once bound us, we have been released from the law so that we serve in the new way of the Spirit, and not in the old way of the written code.
Kanjobal: A yet yalan tu', a jun ley tu' ay yalon yet jin. Axa tinani xin, camnak onxa el bay yul sat Dios. Yuj tu', bekan on tinani', yet watx' asan Dios chi jak' serbil. Yuj tu', lanan co beybalnen jun ac' beybalej max yak' Cham Espíritu ayon. Axa jun icham ley tz'ibbilcan tu', c'amxa yalon yet jin tinani'.

English: What shall we say, then? Is the law sin? Certainly not! Indeed I would not have known what sin was except through the law. For I would not have known what coveting really was if the law had not said, “Do not covet.”
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tzet quex chi? A ley Moisés tu', ¿tom yob che na'? C'amak toni. Yuj jun ley tu' xan max wojtaknej elok, tol yob tzet max el wuneni. A yet max wochen oc junok tzet yetal, max wojtaknej elok, tol man watx'ok tzet chi el wuneni, yujtol chi yal ley axca ti': Manchak e yochej oc junok tzet yetal, ẍi. K'inalok ta c'am tzet chi yala', man wojtakok ta yob jun tu'.

English: But sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, produced in me every kind of covetous desire. For apart from law, sin is dead.
Kanjobal: Palta yuj juntzan chekbanilej tu', xan max texac'al pitzc'oj aj tzet man watx'ok win. Yuj tu', xiwil tzet man watx'ok max wochej ocok. K'inalok ta c'am jun ley tu', c'am mi yelapnok yobtakil.

English: Once I was alive apart from law; but when the commandment came, sin sprang to life and I died.
Kanjobal: A yet manto wojtakok jun ley tu', iquis in yul sat Dios in naoni. Axa yet max wojtaknej el jun ley tu', max nachaj el wuj, tol c'am jabok in watx'il. Catatu bian, max wojtaknen elok, tol camnak in yul sat Dios yuj.

English: I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life actually brought death.
Kanjobal: A ley tu', ay yopiso yak'on k'inalej, palta a' max iontek camich wiban.

English: For sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, deceived me, and through the commandment put me to death.
Kanjobal: Yuj jun ley tu', xan max texac'al pitzc'oj aj yobtakil win. Caw wal max in etax yuj juntzan tu'. A yobtakil tu' max iontek camich wiban yuj jun ley tu'.

English: So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous and good.
Kanjobal: A jun ley tu', c'am jabok is paltail. Cac'apax tu' masanil is chekbanil tu', caw wal tojol, caw watx'.

English: Did that which is good, then, become death to me? By no means! But in order that sin might be recognized as sin, it produced death in me through what was good, so that through the commandment sin might become utterly sinful.
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tzet quex chi? ¿Tom a jun tzet watx' tu' max iontek camich wiban? C'amak, manak. A yobtakil ayoc win, a' max iontek wiban. Xan tix wal max yun txecloj el tu', tol c'am ton watx'il juntzan tu'. A juntzan tu' max iontek camich wiban yuj jun ley watx' tu'. Axca ton tu' max yut tx'oxon el jun ley tu', tol a tzet man watx'ok tu', caw wal yob.

English: We know that the law is spiritual; but I am unspiritual, sold as a slave to sin.
Kanjobal: Jojtak tol a Cham Yespíritu Dios anejtek jun ley tu'. Palta ayin ti', ac'ala' ibilc'al oc jun in yob ochwanilal ti'. Axca tol txonbil in oc yak'omalok serbil yobtakil.

English: I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a tzet chi el wuneni, man watx'ok chi wila'. Ay tzet watx' chi wochej chi wunej, palta c'am chi wun paxok. Axa juntzan tzet man watx'ok yul in sat, axa chi wunej.

English: And if I do what I do not want to do, I agree that the law is good.
Kanjobal: Ta chi wabej tol yobtak tzet chi wun tu', caytu' chi yun nachaj el wuj tol a ley watx' toni.

English: As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin living in me.
Kanjobal: Yujtol mayin wal nak acaw chi el wunen juntzan tu'. A yobtakil toc'alta' ayoc win, a' chi uneni.

English: I know that nothing good lives in me, that is, in my sinful nature. For I have the desire to do what is good, but I cannot carry it out.
Kanjobal: Wojtak, tol c'am jabok tzet watx' win, a ton yin jun in yob nabal ti'. Yujtol a tzet yetal watx' chi wochej chi wunej, palta c'am chi je' wuj.

English: For what I do is not the good I want to do; no, the evil I do not want to do–this I keep on doing.
Kanjobal: C'am chi wun tzet watx' axca wal chi wochej tu'. A tzet man watx'ok, c'am chi wochej tu', a chi wunc'al.

English: Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it.
Kanjobal: Palta ta chi wun tzet c'am chi wochej tu', chi yal elapnok, tol mayinnak lanan wuneni. A yobtakil toc'alta' ayoc win tu', a' chi uneni.

English: So I find this law at work: When I want to do good, evil is right there with me.
Kanjobal: Xan tix ton wal chin on ti'. Tol a yet chi wochej chi wun junok tzet yetal watx', axa chi wiloni, a tzet man watx'ok lananxa wuneni.

English: For in my inner being I delight in God's law;
Kanjobal: A in nabal, caw wal chi tzaloj yetok ley Dios.

English: but I see another law at work in the members of my body, waging war against the law of my mind and making me a prisoner of the law of sin at work within my members.
Kanjobal: Palta wojtak, tol ay junxa chi yajawbi yin in mimanil ti', a ton yobtakil. A chi yak'lej owal yetok tzet chi yochej in nabal tu'. Yuj tu', axca wal tol preso wayji yuj yobtakil chi yajawbi yin in mimanil ti'.

English: What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death?
Kanjobal: Caw ok'bal c'ul chi wun yuj. A jun in mimanil ti' chin iontok bay camich yin junelnej. Palta, ¿mac chi je' yuj on colon el yul k'ab co mimanil ti'?

English: Thanks be to God–through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God's law, but in the sinful nature a slave to the law of sin.
Kanjobal: Asan Dios, yin yak'balnen Cham Jajawil Jesucristo. Yuj tu', caw wal chi wal yuj diosalil bay Dios tinani'. Ti pax yetok wal in nabal chi wak' serbil Dios, palta axa in yob ochwanilal ti', ayoc yak'omalok serbil jun chi yajawbi yin in mimanil ti', a ton yobtakil.

English: Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus,
Kanjobal: A tinani', junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús, xan c'amxa yowal c'ul Dios jiban.

English: because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit of life set me free from the law of sin and death.
Kanjobal: A Yespíritu Dios chi ak'on co k'inal yin junelnej, yujtol junxanej jayji yetok Cristo Jesús. Yuj yipalil Yespíritu tu', xan max on colchaj el yul k'ab yobtakil, c'al yul k'ab camich.

English: For what the law was powerless to do in that it was weakened by the sinful nature, God did by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful man to be a sin offering. And so he condemned sin in sinful man,
Kanjobal: Yuj co yob ochwanilal ti', xan c'am chi je' jiken tzet chi yal ley Moisés. Yuj tu', c'am yopiso jun ley tu' on is coloni. Palta a Dios chon coloni, yuj yanaktek is C'ajol yuj ul yuten ba yin animail. Lajan is mimanil Cristo axca jet ayon anima on ti', yuj tu' max je' cam yuj co mul. A yet max cami, tz'akan max yi' lowbanilej yailal mulej yin is mimanil, tol lajan axca jet.

English: in order that the righteous requirements of the law might be fully met in us, who do not live according to the sinful nature but according to the Spirit.
Kanjobal: Axca tu' yutnak ba, yet watx' tojolxac'al chi jut co ba axca chi yal ley. Yujtol ayon ti', c'amxa chi co beybalnej axca chi yochej co yob ochwanilal. Lanan co beybalnen axca chi yochej Yespíritu Dios.

English: Those who live according to the sinful nature have their minds set on what that nature desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.
Kanjobal: A eb chi beybalnen yob ochwanilal, ac'al yin chi yaoc eb is nabal. Asan yin tzet man watx'ok chi yaoc eb nabal tu'. Yuj wal tu', chi tojcan eb bay camich yin tojbalk'inal. Ayon tol lanan co beybalnen axca chi yochej Yespíritu Dios, asan yin chi jaoc co nabal. Yuj wal tu', xan ok co cha' co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, cax chon oc yin junc'ulalil yetok Dios.

English: The mind of sinful man is death, but the mind controlled by the Spirit is life and peace; The mind of sinful man is death, but the mind controlled by the Spirit is life and peace;
Kanjobal: Palta a eb chi beybalnen yob ochwanilal xin, toc'al chi yajc'ulnej aj ba eb yetok Cham. C'am chi yochej eb chi yikej ley Cham, tamwal chi je' yuj eb.

English: Those controlled by the sinful nature cannot please God.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', a eb chi beybalnen yob ochwanilal, caw c'am chi je' yunen eb axca chi yochej Cham, xan c'am chi tzaloj Cham yetok eb.

English: You, however, are controlled not by the sinful nature but by the Spirit, if the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Christ.
Kanjobal: Palta ayon ti', manchakxa co beybalnej co yob ochwanilal. Asannejokab tzet chi yochej Yespíritu Dios chi co beybalnej, yujtol a' ayoc jin. A eb c'am oc Yespíritu Cristo yin, man yetok Cristo eb.

English: But if Christ is in you, your body is dead because of sin, yet your spirit is alive because of righteousness.
Kanjobal: Palta ayon ti', ayxa oc Cristo jin. Yuj tu', caxc'al camnak co mimanil ti' yuj yobtakil, palta iquisc'al janimail, yujtol watx' on yul sat Dios tinani'.

English: And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit, who lives in you.
Kanjobal: A Dios ak'nej ictzoj aj Jesucristo xol eb camnak. Tatol ayoc Yespíritu Cham jin, ok yictzonej pax aj Cham co mimanil cambejal yayji yuj Yespíritu ayoc jin.

English: Therefore, brothers, we have an obligation–but it is not to the sinful nature, to live according to it.
Kanjobal: Yuj wal tu', ex wuẍtak, ex wanab, ayoc jiban co beybalnen axca tzet chi yochej Yespíritu Dios. C'amxa oc jiban co beybalnen axca chi yochej co yob ochwanilal.

English: For if you live according to the sinful nature, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, you will live,
Kanjobal: Ta ac'ala' co beybalnen tzet chi yochej co yob ochwanilal, ok on cam yuj yin junelnej. Palta ta yetok yipalil Yespíritu Dios chi co bekoncan junen yob ochwanilal ti', ok co cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal.

English: because those who are led by the Spirit of God are sons of God.
Kanjobal: Tzanc'al mac chi beybalnej tzet chi tx'ox Yespíritu Dios bay, a ton eb tu' yel yuninal Dios.

English: For you did not receive a spirit that makes you a slave again to fear, but you received the Spirit of sonship. And by him we cry, “Abba, Father.”
Kanjobal: A Cham Espíritu chabilxa juj, maj on yaoc Cham yak'omalok serbil yin xiwc'ulal, palta max on yaoc Cham yuninalok Dios. Yuj Cham Espíritu ti', xan chi je' yaj jaw bay Dios axca ti': Mamin, con chi bay.

English: The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are God's children.
Kanjobal: Jojtak junjun on yin janimail, tol yel yuninal onxa Dios. Yetok c'apaxok, acaw Espíritu chi ak'on jojtaknej elok.

English: Now if we are children, then we are heirs–heirs of God and co-heirs with Christ, if indeed we share in his sufferings in order that we may also share in his glory.
Kanjobal: Yujtol yuninal onxa Dios, yuj tu' ok co cha' co satak ok yak'a'. Ac'al oc jet ok co cha' yetok Cristo. Tatol chi jab yail yetok Cham, junnej ok on ayjok yetok xol is watx'ilal.

English: I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.
Kanjobal: Ayin ti', chin na', tol a juntzan yailal lanan jaben ti' tinani', caw wal c'am chi apni yintak watx'il Dios ok txecloj el jin yet yajtok tu'.

English: The creation waits in eager expectation for the sons of God to be revealed.
Kanjobal: Masanil tzetak yetal watx'nebil yuj Cham, caw chi maka' bak'in ok on txeclonelay aj ayon yuninal on Cham ti'.

English: For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope
Kanjobal: Yujtol a juntzan tzet watx'nebil yuj Cham, majxa eloc axca naon Cham yin. Man yulok yet juntzan tzet yetal tu' xan axca tu' max yunej; palta a Cham max uteni. Palta ay jun tiempoal makbil jayi.

English: that the creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the glorious freedom of the children of God.
Kanjobal: Yujtol masanil juntzan tu', ok colchaj elok, yet watx' c'amxa tzet chi oni. Axca tu' ok yun co colchaj el ayon yuninal onxa Dios ti', axa joc yin watx'il tu'. Axca tu' ok yun colchaj c'apax el juntzan tu' jetok.

English: We know that the whole creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time.
Kanjobal: Jojtak, tol masanil juntzan tzet watx'nebil yuj Cham yettax payxa, ayoc yalan yailal. Axca junok ix ix lanan yaben yail unin, axca tu' yaben yail juntzan tzetak yetal tu' tinani'.

English: Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption as sons, the redemption of our bodies.
Kanjobal: Man asannejok juntzan tu' lanan yaben yail. Palta cayon c'apax tu'. Ayxa oc Cham Espíritu jin, yet watx' txequel, tol ay tzet ok yak' Dios ayon. Caxc'al mi axca tu', palta lanan jaben yail tinani'. Lanan co makon bak'in ok on oc yuninalok Cham sic'libil. Cax a yet tu' ok colchajcan el co mimanil ti'.

English: For in this hope we were saved. But hope that is seen is no hope at all. Who hopes for what he already has?
Kanjobal: Yettax max on colchaji, max jaon oc yipok co c'ul, tol ok co cha co colbanil sic'libil. K'inalok ta mayal co cha' jun tu' tinani', manxa yowalilok chi co mak jayi, yujtol a tzet mayal jilocok, c'amxa chi co mak jayi.

English: But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently.
Kanjobal: Palta ta chi jaoc yipok co c'ul tzet c'am chi jiloc yin, yowalil tec'an chi jut co ba co makon jayi.

English: In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with groans that words cannot express.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax Cham Yespíritu Dios, caw wal chi oc Cham jetok bay man tz'akanok co nabal. Yujtol man jojtakok tzet chi jut txajlok co ba axca chi yochej Dios. Ay bay toc'al chon sik'son aj jay co c'ul, yujtol c'am chi nachaj juj tzet chi jut jalon co ba bay Dios. Palta axa Cham Espíritu chi txajli juj yin co k'akawil tu'.

English: And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for the saints in accordance with God's will.
Kanjobal: Axa Dios chi ilon tzet ay bay janimail junjun on. Chi nachaj c'apax el yuj, tzet chi yal Yespíritu, yujtol axca wal chi yochej Dios, caytu' chi yun txajli Yespíritu tu' juj ayon yet onxa ti'.

English: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
Kanjobal: Jojtak tol a Dios chi yak'balnej masanilc'al tzet chi jay jiban, yuj co watx'ilok, ayon ay co camc'ulal yin ti', ayon awtebil on yuj ti', yuj jelapnok axcatac'a naoni.

English: For those God foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the likeness of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.
Kanjobal: Yojtakxa Dios yet payxa, tol yet on. Atax yet tu' sic'nej on can elok, yet watx' lajan chi juncan el axca is C'ajol. Max con yut Dios axca tu', yet watx' a is C'ajol tu' chi oc babel winakil co xol ayon yuninal on Dios ti'.

English: And those he predestined, he also called; those he called, he also justified; those he justified, he also glorified.
Kanjobal: A mac on sic'bil on el yuj, awtebil on c'apax yuj. A' c'apax chi alon juj ayon awtebil on yuj ti', tol watx' on yul sat, cax chi yak'oni tol ay jalon jet yin is watx'il.

English: What, then, shall we say in response to this? If God is for us, who can be against us?
Kanjobal: Yuj juntzan chi wal ti', xan caw c'amxa tzet chi co na' tinani'. Caw wal ayoc Dios jetok. Yuj tu', ¿xin ta ay mac chi tzakay on yaoncan yalan?

English: He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all–how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?
Kanjobal: A Dios max yacan oc is C'ajol yul k'ab camich jujc'al co masanil. Caxc'al is C'ajol, palta maj colo'. Yujtol yanaktek is C'ajol tu', xan jojtak, tol ok yak' masanil tzet watx' ayon.

English: Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen? It is God who justifies.
Kanjobal: A mac on sic'bil on el yuj Dios, ¿xin ta ay junok mac chi je' con yak'on queja bay? A Cham chi aloni tol watx' on bay.

English: Who is he that condemns? Christ Jesus, who died–more than that, who was raised to life–is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' ¿xin ta ay junok mac ok je' yaon oc jiban? Yujtol a Cristo max cami, max ak'lay ictzoj pax ajok. Axa tinani' ayic' bay is watx' k'ab Dios, lanan tewi juj.

English: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword?
Kanjobal: C'am junok tzet yetal chi tx'oxo' tol man camc'ulnebilok on yuj Cristo. Caxc'al yailal, caxc'al junok miman cusc'ulal, caxc'al ay mac chi aon oc junok tzet yetal jiban, caxc'al chi jay wajil jiban, caxc'al c'am co pichil, caxc'al mi ay junok tzet yetal ayxamay, caxc'al chon mak'lay camok, ac'ala' con camc'ulnen Cristo.

English: As it is written: “For your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.”
Kanjobal: Axca yaloncan tx'an Un: Oj wali, xan chon yak' cam eb yin junjun txolan axca calnel chi ilaytok yet chi cami, caytu' chon yut eb, ẍi yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al ok jay juntzan ti' jiban, palta yelxac'al chi uj juj yuj is yipal Cham chon camc'ulneni.

English: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu' wojtakxa, caxc'al ay tzet yetal, ac'ala' caw camc'ulnebil on yuj Dios. Caxc'al camich, caxc'al co k'inal, caxc'al junok ángel, caxc'al junok ay yikbej, caxc'al junok tzet yetal ayic' tinani', caxc'al tzet toxa ok jayok,

English: neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Kanjobal: caxc'al junok ayic' bay satcan, caxc'al junok ay yalan tx'otx' ti', tzanc'al junok tzet yetal watx'nebil yuj Cham, tutun c'am chi je' chi yiay co nan yetok co Mam Dios, ac'ala' caw camc'ulnebil on yuj Cham yuj Cristo Jesús, a ton Cham Jajawil.

English: I speak the truth in Christ–I am not lying, my conscience confirms it in the Holy Spirit–
Kanjobal: Tutun ayoc Cristo yin in c'ul e yetok, xan a juntzan ok waltok ayex ti', caw yel, man lek'tialok. A yikbomal in nabal chi ak'on wojtaknej elok, tol yel juntzan ok waltok ayex ti', yujtol a Cham Espíritu Santo chi ak'on in na'.

English: I have great sorrow and unceasing anguish in my heart.
Kanjobal: Caw chi cus in c'ul. Pitz'anc'al oc eb wet israelal yin in c'ul, yujtol caw wal chi wochej chi colchaj eb.

English: For I could wish that I myself were cursed and cut off from Christ for the sake of my brothers, those of my own race,
Kanjobal: K'inalok ta chi colchaj eb wet conob tu' yuj chin k'antek yowal c'ul Dios wiban, c'al wel yin Cristo, chin k'antek, cax chin el yin, yujc'al eb.

English: the people of Israel. Theirs is the adoption as sons; theirs the divine glory, the covenants, the receiving of the law, the temple worship and the promises.
Kanjobal: Yinatil israel eb wetok. A Dios max on ion oc yuninalok on. Max tx'ox is tzekekial ayon on. Ay juntzan is trato max yak' jetok on. Max yak' c'apax is ley ayon. Yalnak c'apax ayon tzet chi jut jion ay co ba bay. Ay juntzan tzet yetal max yak' Dios is ti' yak'on ayon.

English: Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of Christ, who is God over all, forever praised! Amen.
Kanjobal: A eb jichmam, a ton eb mimek yelapnok yul sat Dios yet payxa. Ocnak Cristo jet conobok on yet max oc animail. A Cristo Dios toni, Yajaw yayji yiban masanil tzetak yetal. Al-layokab watx' k'anej yin Cham yin tojbalk'inal. Yunokabi.

English: It is not as though God's word had failed. For not all who are descended from Israel are Israel.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al maj colchaj eb wet israelal masanil, palta maj je' jaloni, tol maj yun juntzan tzet bay max yak'can Dios ti' ayon on. Yujtol a eb wet israelal tu', man masanilok eb yel israel yul sat Dios.

English: Nor because they are his descendants are they all Abraham's children. On the contrary, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”
Kanjobal: A ayon yinatil on Abraham ti', man co masanilok yel yuninal on Abraham yul sat Dios. Yujtol yalnak Dios bay Abraham tu' axca ti': A yin nak Isaac, a tu' ok beyc'altoj enatil, ẍi Dios bay.

English: In other words, it is not the natural children who are God's children, but it is the children of the promise who are regarded as Abraham's offspring.
Kanjobal: A jun ti', chi yal elapnok tol c'am junok mac tol yujc'al yichmam chi je' yoc yuninalok Dios. Ayon yinatil on Abraham ti', pitzc'ojnak on el yuj yak'oncan Dios ti' bay, asan on tu' caw yel yinatil Abraham on tu' yul sat Dios.

English: For this was how the promise was stated: “At the appointed time I will return, and Sarah will have a son.”
Kanjobal: Tix tzet yalnak Dios bay Abraham tu' yet max yak'on is ti' bay: Ok in jay yet jun tiempoal txequel yayjicanok. A yet tu' ok jay junok yune' Sara, tol winak unin, ẍi Dios bay.

English: Not only that, but Rebekah's children had one and the same father, our father Isaac.
Kanjobal: Chi wal c'apaxtok ayex yabixal Isaac jichmam on. A Rebeca ocnak yetbiok. Ay cawan yune xal junnejc'al max yun yalji. Yet Isaac tu' eb cawanil.

English: Yet, before the twins were born or had done anything good or bad–in order that God's purpose in election might stand:
Kanjobal: A yet c'amto chi alji cawan unin tu', c'amto junok tzet watx', ma junok tzet yob chi el yunen eb, max yal Dios bay Rebeca tu' axca ti': A nak babel, ok can nak yalan is chekbanil nak tzunan, ẍi bay. A jun ti' chi chalej ba yalon yetok juntzanxa tzet tz'ibbil c'apax can yul tx'an Un bay chi yal axca ti': Max in camc'ulnej Jacob, axa Esaú max in cabc'ulnejcan elok, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'. A ton juntzan k'anej ti' chi tx'oxk'abnen elok, tol ay yalon yet Dios sic'on el junok mac chi yochej. Man yujok tzet chi el juneni, xan chon yawtej oc Dios yetok.

English: not by works but by him who calls–she was told, “The older will serve the younger.” not by works but by him who calls–she was told, “The older will serve the younger.” Just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”
Kanjobal: Palta, ¿tzet con chi che na'? ¿Xin ta man tojolok chi yut Dios axca tu'? C'amak, tojol toni.

English: For he says to Moses, “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol yalnak axca ti' bay Moisés: Ok wak' in yabenc'ulal bay mac chi yal in c'ul, cax ok ok' in c'ul yin mac bay chi yal in c'ul, ẍi Dios.

English: It does not, therefore, depend on man's desire or effort, but on God's mercy.
Kanjobal: Caxc'al chi jochej chon colchaji, caxc'al caw chi jak' jip, man yujok tu' chon colchaji, palta asan yuj chi ok' c'ul Dios jin.

English: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh: “I raised you up for this very purpose, that I might display my power in you and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”
Kanjobal: Tz'ibbilcan ay yul tx'an Un tzet yalnak Dios bay faraón, cham yajaw bay Egipto. Max yal axca ti': Max ach waoc reyal bay jun conob ti', yujtol wochwan chin tx'ox in mayk'ak'al en, cax ay is may in binaj bay masanil yulyibank'inal, ẍi Dios bay.

English: Therefore God has mercy on whom he wants to have mercy, and he hardens whom he wants to harden.
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan a Dios chi ok' is c'ul yin mac bay chi yal is c'ul, chi yak' c'apax pitbok c'ul mac bay chi yal c'ul.

English: One of you will say to me: “Then why does God still blame us? For who resists his will?”
Kanjobal: Palta tekan ayex ok e yal axca ti' ayin: Ta axca tu xin, ¿tzet yuj xan chi yal pax Dios tol ayon yobtakwom on xin? ¿Mac junok chi je' tenon oc wanaj tzet chi yochej Dios? tekan quex chi.

English: But who are you, O man, to talk back to God? “Shall what is formed say to him who formed it, ‘Why did you make me like this?’ ”
Kanjobal: Palta c'am chi je' jalon axca tu'. C'am junok mac chi je' teyelen ba yetok Dios. A junok tx'otx' tol tz'akbil, xin ta chi je' yalon tx'otx' bay is tz'akomal axca ti': ¿Tzet yuj xan caytu' chin otej? ¿xin ta ẍi tx'otx'?

English: Does not the potter have the right to make out of the same lump of clay some pottery for noble purposes and some for common use?
Kanjobal: Yujtol a jun tz'aklom tu', chi je' tz'akon junok tx'otx' axca chi yochej c'ul. Caxc'al junnej bay chi tit is tx'otx' chi k'ana', palta chi je' watx'nen junok tx'otx' yuj k'anlay yin watx'il, c'al junokxa yuj k'anlay yin comonc'al.

English: What if God, choosing to show his wrath and make his power known, bore with great patience the objects of his wrath–prepared for destruction?
Kanjobal: Xan caytu' Dios yetok eb anima. Ay eb moj chaon yowal c'ul Dios, moj eb tojcan bay yailal yin junelnej. Caxc'al chi yochej Dios chi tx'oxk'abnej el yowal c'ul yin eb, yuj tx'oxon el eb is mayk'ak'al Cham, palta caw miman chi yut c'ul, chi yak'c'al techaj yobtakil eb.

English: What if he did this to make the riches of his glory known to the objects of his mercy, whom he prepared in advance for glory–
Kanjobal: Axca ton ti' max yun tx'oxon el Dios tol caw miman yelapnok is watx'c'ulal ayon, yet max ok' c'ul jin. Yujtol payxatax max on yacan oc yetok, yet watx' ay jalon jet yin is watx'il.

English: even us, whom he also called, not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles?
Kanjobal: Caxc'al ayon israel on, caxc'al ayon mayon israelok, awtebil onxa yuj joc yetok.

English: As he says in Hosea: “I will call them ‘my people’ who are not my people; and I will call her ‘my loved one’ who is not my loved one,”
Kanjobal: Yuj tu xan max yal Dios yul libro Oseas axca ti': A juntzan eb man in conobok yet yalantok, ok wak' yik eb tol in conob eb. A eb c'am in yabenc'ulal yin yet yalantok, axa tinani', ok in yabenc'ulnej eb.

English: and, “It will happen that in the very place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’ they will be called ‘sons of the living God.’ ”
Kanjobal: A bay max wal bay eb axca ti': Man in conobok ex, quin chi, a bay tu' ok al-lay e yin: Tol yuninal ex Cham Dios iquis, ẍi, ẍi tx'an Un tu'.

English: Isaiah cries out concerning Israel: “Though the number of the Israelites be like the sand by the sea, only the remnant will be saved.
Kanjobal: Albilcan yuj Isaías yabixal eb jet israelal, max yalcan axca ti': Caxc'al tol c'amxa chi bischaj eb conob axca yarenail ti' a' mar, palta jaywannej eb ok colchajcanok.

English: For the Lord will carry out his sentence on earth with speed and finality.”
Kanjobal: Yujtol majxa mayjok tiempo beyc'ulnen Cham Yajaw yulyibank'inal ti' yin tz'akanil, ẍi.

English: It is just as Isaiah said previously: “Unless the Lord Almighty had left us descendants, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah.”
Kanjobal: Ac'al ton oc Isaías tu' alnej c'apaxcan axca ti': Tolok wal maj el yin c'ul Cham Jajawil, Yajaw yin masanil, max yak'can jaywanokxa jinatil, axca mi wal max yun c'aylay el conob Sodoma, c'al Gomorra max juncanok, ẍi.

English: What then shall we say? That the Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have obtained it, a righteousness that is by faith;
Kanjobal: Ti chi waltok tzet chi yal elapnok juntzan chi wal ti' ayex. A eb man israelok, c'am chi ec' nanon c'ul eb tzet chi yun yoc eb watx'il yul sat Dios, palta chi yal Dios tol ay eb watx' yul sat. Chi yal Dios yin eb axca tu', yujtol chi yaoc eb c'ul yin.

English: but Israel, who pursued a law of righteousness, has not attained it.
Kanjobal: Yak'ban pax eb wet israelal, caw chi yaoc eb nabal yin ley Moisés, yet watx' chi oc eb watx'il yul sat Dios yuj, naoni. Palta maj yun axca tu'.

English: Why not? Because they pursued it not by faith but as if it were by works. They stumbled over the “stumbling stone.”
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuj xan axca tu' chi elol yiban eb? Yujtol c'am chi yaoc eb c'ul yin Cristo. A naon eb tol chi je' yoc eb watx'il yul sat Dios yuj juntzan chi el yunen eb tu'. Yuj tu', axca junok ch'en ch'en bay chi chipil eb yakan, caytu' Cristo yul sat eb.

English: As it is written: “See, I lay in Zion a stone that causes men to stumble and a rock that makes them fall, and the one who trusts in him will never be put to shame.”
Kanjobal: Yalnak Dios yabixal Cristo yul tx'an Un axca ti': Ayin wal max wacan oc jun ch'en ch'en bay conob Sión, jun ch'en bay chi chipil eb yakan, cax chi telc'ojtok eb yuj. Palta a mactxel ok yaoc c'ul yin, c'am bak'in ok somchaj el c'ul eb yuj, ẍi Dios yul tx'an Un tu'.

English: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ for the faith of God's elect and the knowledge of the truth that leads to godliness–
Kanjobal: Ayin Pablo in ti', yak'omal in serbil Dios, chekbej in c'apax Jesucristo, yuj wiontek eb sic'bilxa el yuj Dios, yin yaon oc eb c'ul yin. Ay wopiso in cuyon eb yin jun cuybej acaw yel, tol chon cuy yin watx'il.

English: a faith and knowledge resting on the hope of eternal life, which God, who does not lie, promised before the beginning of time,
Kanjobal: Cayton tu' wopiso axca tu', yet watx' chi yaoc eb yipok c'ul, tol ok co cha' k'inalej tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal. A Dios c'am bay chi yak' lek'tial junelok. A yet manto watx'nej yulyibank'inal ti', max yak'on is ti' tol ok yak' co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal tu'.

English: and at his appointed season he brought his word to light through the preaching entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior,
Kanjobal: Mayal jay tiempoal tinani', yak'on ojtaknelay el is k'anej. Yuj tu', a Cham co Colomal Dios, a Cham max ak'on walil is k'anej ti'.

English: To Titus, my true son in our common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
Kanjobal: Ti chi watok jun in carta ti' ayach Tito. Wal yel axca tol in c'ajol ach, yujtol ayin max wal abej, xan max a cha' Cristo wetok. Yak'okabc'al co Mam Dios c'al Jajawil Jesucristo co Colomal is watx'c'ulal c'al is junc'ulal ayach.

English: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might straighten out what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.
Kanjobal: Max ach wak'can bay Creta tu', yuj a watx'nen oc juntzan tzet ayto watx'ji, c'al yuj a sic'on oc mac chi oc ancianoal xol eb creyente bay junjun conob. Cha sic'oc eb axca max wut waloncan ayach.

English: An elder must be blameless, the husband of but one wife, a man whose children believe and are not open to the charge of being wild and disobedient.
Kanjobal: Ti ok waltok beybal eb moj yoc ancianoal abej. A junok anciano, c'amokab bay chi say junok tzet yetal yobtak, yet watx' c'amc'al queja chi aj yin. Junnejokab yistzil. Creyenteokab yuninal masanil, cax man comonok chi say yun eb junok yobtakil. Manokab tenomtakok chi yut ba eb, palta tol yikemokab chi yut ba eb yuninal eb tu'.

English: Since an overseer is entrusted with God's work, he must be blameless–not overbearing, not quick-tempered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not pursuing dishonest gain.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a eb chi oc yilomalok eb jet creyenteal tu', yowalil caw wal watx' chi yut eb is beybal, yujtol yak'omal cuenta mulnajil Dios yayji eb. Maj je' tol asanxanej eb chi yochej chi yal yet. Maj je' tol c'un chichon aj c'ul eb. Manokab uq'uemanok eb. Maj je' tol mak'wajwom c'apax eb. Yetok c'apaxok, maj je' yion tumin yin yobal.

English: Rather he must be hospitable, one who loves what is good, who is self-controlled, upright, holy and disciplined.
Kanjobal: A eb ay yopiso tu', ak'om posadaokab eb. Yowalilokab a tzet watx' chi yun eb, c'amokab chi ec' eb yiban. Tojolokab chi yut eb is beybal. Asannejokab yin Dios chi yaoc eb nabal. Yowalilokab chi mitx'oc wanaj eb mimanil yin tzet man watx'ok.

English: He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it has been taught, so that he can encourage others by sound doctrine and refute those who oppose it.
Kanjobal: Yowalilokab chi yaoc eb nabal yin cuybej acaw yel, jun cuybej ak'bilxa cuy eb, yet watx' chi je' yiptzen eb juntzanokxa mactxel yetok jun cuybej yel tu', cax chi je' c'apax yak'on eb yojtaknej el eb anima chi tenton ec' bay co cuybej.

English: For there are many rebellious people, mere talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision group.
Kanjobal: Yujtol xiwiltoc'al anima tenomtak chi yut ba. Toc'al chi comon alnej junok tzet yetal c'am yelapnok, caw iom aytek satej eb. Mawal axca eb ayoc nabal yin circuncisión, xiwil eb caytu' chi yut ba.

English: They must be silenced, because they are ruining whole households by teaching things they ought not to teach–and that for the sake of dishonest gain.
Kanjobal: Yowalil chi tenlay oc wanaj eb, cax c'amxa chi yal eb, yujtol tzanc'al nail bay chi ec' eb, chi ec' yak' somchaj eb c'ul eb creyente tu'. Chi ec' yak' eb cuylay tzet man watx'ok, yet watx' chi yi' eb is tumin yin eb.

English: Even one of their own prophets has said, “Cretans are always liars, evil brutes, lazy gluttons.”
Kanjobal: Ay jun nak aj Creta tu', aj nabal yayji xol eb, max yal nak axca ti': A eb wet aj conobal bay Creta ti'; toc'alta' lek'ti' eb. Caw wal lajan eb axca junok no no' caw wal ow. Isaj eb, toc'al chi yochej eb chi lowi, ẍi nak.

English: This testimony is true. Therefore, rebuke them sharply, so that they will be sound in the faith
Kanjobal: Yel ton chi yal nak. Yuj tu' xan yowalil cha tenchanej eb sic'libil, yet watx' chi yaoc eb jun cuybanilej acaw yel yin is c'ul.

English: and will pay no attention to Jewish myths or to the commands of those who reject the truth.
Kanjobal: Chal bay eb, tol manchak yacbaj eb txiquin bay juntzan comon abix chi yal eb wet israelal. Chalon c'apax bay eb, tol manchak yikej eb tzet chi yal eb c'am yelapnok cuybej yel yul sat.

English: To the pure, all things are pure, but to those who are corrupted and do not believe, nothing is pure. In fact, both their minds and consciences are corrupted.
Kanjobal: A yul co sat ayon watx'xa co nabal ti', watx' masanil tzet yetal; palta a eb c'am chi yaoc c'ul yin Dios, eb yob is nabal, c'am junok tzet yetal watx' yul sat eb, yujtol a is nabal eb man watx'ok. C'am jabok chi mitx' waay ba eb yetok is nabal tu'.

English: They claim to know God, but by their actions they deny him. They are detestable, disobedient and unfit for doing anything good.
Kanjobal: Chi tz'ak yal eb tol yojtak eb Dios, palta a is beybal eb chi tx'oxk'abnen elok tol man yojtakok eb Cham. Man watx'ok eb yul sat Dios, yujtol c'am chi yikej eb jabok tzet chi yala'. Yuj tu' xan c'am junok tzet watx' chi je' el yunen eb.

English: You must teach what is in accord with sound doctrine.
Kanjobal: Axa ach ti', aokab tzet moj cuylayi, aokab chak' cuylayok, wal juntzan cuybanilej caw wal yel.

English: Teach the older men to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love and in endurance.
Kanjobal: Chal bay eb ichamtak winak, tol bayc'al ijan chi yut eb is nabal. Watx'okab chi yut ba eb, yet watx' ayokab yelapnok eb yul sat yet animail. Aj nabalokab chi yut ba eb. Cawokab chi yaoc eb c'ul yin juntzan cuybanilej yel. Ayokab camc'ulal eb yin yet animail. Tec'anokab chi yut ba eb yet chi yilon eb yailal.

English: Likewise, teach the older women to be reverent in the way they live, not to be slanderers or addicted to much wine, but to teach what is good.
Kanjobal: Ac'ala' c'apax eb xal ixnamil ix, chal bay eb, tol watx' chi yut eb is beybal, axca wal chi yochej c'ul Dios. Man comonok chi yal eb k'umal yet animail. Manokab uq'uemanok eb. Meẍtolokab eb xal yin tzet watx',

English: Then they can train the younger women to love their husbands and children,
Kanjobal: cax chi cuywaj eb xal xol eb ix k'opoj ixto yin tzet chi yut camc'ulnen ba eb ix yetok yichamil, c'al tzet chi yut camc'ulnen eb ix yune'.

English: to be self-controlled and pure, to be busy at home, to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, so that no one will malign the word of God.
Kanjobal: Cax aj nabalokab chi yut ba eb ix, tojolokab beybal eb ix. Ya'ilnejokab eb ix yatut. Watx'okab chi yut eb ix c'ul bay yet animail. Yikemokab eb ix bay yichamil, yet watx' c'amokab buchwal k'anej chi al-lay yin k'anej Dios.

English: Similarly, encourage the young men to be self-controlled.
Kanjobal: Yetok c'apaxok, chi cam alon bay eb ach'ejtak winak, tol aj nabalokab chi yut ba eb.

English: In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness
Kanjobal: Watx' chot a beybal yin masanil yil eb. Aokab yet chach cuywaj xol eb, chach cuywaj yin masanil a c'ul, c'al yin c'am ejmach'il.

English: and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us.
Kanjobal: Tojolc'al chot cuywaj a ba bay eb, yet watx' c'amokab mac chi alon tol man watx'ok juntzan chak' cuy eb tu'. Yuj tu xin, caxc'al ay eb chi tit yowal en, palta ok q'uixwok aj eb, yujtol c'am junok tzet yob ok je' yalon eb jin.

English: Teach slaves to be subject to their masters in everything, to try to please them, not to talk back to them,
Kanjobal: Chal bay eb creyente ayoc yin mosejal, tol yikemokab chi yut ba eb bay is patrón. Watx'okab chi yut ba eb axca chi yochej c'ul patrón eb tu'. Manchak tak'wej eb is ti',

English: and not to steal from them, but to show that they can be fully trusted, so that in every way they will make the teaching about God our Savior attractive.
Kanjobal: tamwal chi elk'an eb bay. Tojolokab chi yut ba eb tx'oxon el is watx' beybal. Axca ton tu' ok yut tx'oxk'abnen el eb bay eb anima, tol caw watx' cuybej co Colomal Dios.

English: For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men.
Kanjobal: A Dios, max tx'ox is watx'c'ulalil ayon, a' inej oc colbanil masanil eb anima bay yulyibank'inal ti'.

English: It teaches us to say “No” to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,
Kanjobal: Yuj is watx'c'ulal tu', xan chi nachaj el juj, tol yowalil chi co bekcan masanil tzet man watx'ok chi jochej oc bay yulyibank'inal ti', cax tol aj nabal chi jut co ba, c'al watx' chi jut co beybal. Asan yin Dios chi jaoc co nabal.

English: while we wait for the blessed hope–the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ,
Kanjobal: Jechbanejek jay jun c'ual tzalojc'ulal, yet ok jay Cham co Diosal caw miman yelapnok, a ton Cham co Colomal Jesucristo.

English: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all wickedness and to purify for himself a people that are his very own, eager to do what is good.
Kanjobal: Max yak' cam ba Cham juj, yuj on is colon el yul k'ab yobtakil. Max yiel Cham masanil co mul, yet watx' asan Cham ay yalon yet jin, cax asanokab tzet watx' chi jochej chi junej.

English: These, then, are the things you should teach. Encourage and rebuke with all authority. Do not let anyone despise you.
Kanjobal: Al juntzan ti' xol eb creyente bay tu'. Cheptzej eb, cax cha tenchanen eb yob is beybal, yujtol opiso yayji. Watx'c'al chot a ba, yet watx' c'amokab mac chi aloni tol c'am opiso.

English: Remind the people to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready to do whatever is good,
Kanjobal: Cha jek na eb creyente tu', tol yikem chi yut ba eb bay masanil eb yajaw. Yowalil chi yikej eb bay chi yal eb. Tzanc'al tzet mulnajilal tol watx', bekanokab chi yut eb c'ul watx'neni.

English: to slander no one, to be peaceable and considerate, and to show true humility toward all men.
Kanjobal: Manokab comonok chi buchwaj eb yin yet animail. Manokab comonok chi yak'lej eb owal yetok junok mactxel. Watx'okab chi yut eb is nabal, mansookab chi yut ba eb bay masanil anima.

English: At one time we too were foolish, disobedient, deceived and enslaved by all kinds of passions and pleasures. We lived in malice and envy, being hated and hating one another.
Kanjobal: Yujtol a yet yalantok, c'am c'apax co nabal ayon ti'. Pit on bay Dios. C'aynak on tok yet tu'. Max jak' serbil tzanc'al tzet yobtakil max jochej ocok. Caw wal yob co beybal yet tu'. Chi jak' sawenal yin eb jet animail watx' ay. Yajbejtak jili yul sat eb jet animail, yetok c'apaxok, ayonxac'al oc max co yajlej aj co ba.

English: But when the kindness and love of God our Savior appeared,
Kanjobal: Palta max tx'oxaj Cham co Colomal Dios is watx'c'ulal, c'al is camc'ulal bay masanil anima.

English: he saved us, not because of righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He saved us through the washing of rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
Kanjobal: Yuj tu', max on colchaj el yuj. Man yujok junok tzet watx' max el juneni, xan max on is colo'; palta asan yuj max ok' c'ul Cham jin. A yet max tx'ajon el co yobtakil jin, axca wal tol max on alji yet cayelal. A Yespíritu max q'uexon co nabal.

English: whom he poured out on us generously through Jesus Christ our Savior,
Kanjobal: Yuj co Colomal Jesucristo xan max yatek Dios Yespíritu ayon yin masanil is c'ul.

English: so that, having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs having the hope of eternal life.
Kanjobal: Xan watx' on yul sat, yujc'al is watx'c'ulal. Yuj tu' xan ok yak' c'apax co k'inal tol ayc'al yin tojbalk'inal, jun ayc'al oc yipok co c'ul.

English: This is a trustworthy saying. And I want you to stress these things, so that those who have trusted in God may be careful to devote themselves to doing what is good. These things are excellent and profitable for everyone.
Kanjobal: A juntzan chi wal ti', yel. Xan chi wochej tol yayjic'al alubtanen sic'libil juntzan cuybanilej ti', yet watx' a eb chi yaoc c'ul yin Dios, chi yaoc eb yin c'ul yunen tzet watx'. Caw watx' juntzan cuybanilej ti'. Caw chi oc yopiso juj co masanil.

English: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels about the law, because these are unprofitable and useless.
Kanjobal: Manchak aoc a ba yetok eb comonc'al chi teyelej ba yin tzet nabac'al, c'al xol eb asan yabixal eb ichmamej chi yaltek. Manchak a c'apax oc a ba yetok eb comonc'al chi yak'lej owal, c'al yetok eb chi teyelej ba yin ley Moisés. C'am tzet chi yi' eb yin juntzan chi yalubtanej tu'. Nabac'al chi yetnej ba eb.

English: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn him a second time. After that, have nothing to do with him.
Kanjobal: Ta ay eb chi ochen chi pojchaj eb creyente, cha tenchanej eb junel cayelok. Ta c'am chi yikej eb, che yiel eb e xol.

English: You may be sure that such a man is warped and sinful; he is self-condemned.
Kanjobal: A eb caytu' chi beybalnej, ojtaknej elok tol etaxnakxa el eb. Munilc'al yojtakxa eb tol lownakxa yin eb yuj is yobtakil.

English: As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, because I have decided to winter there.
Kanjobal: Ok in chektok juẍtak Artemas ayach, ma xin, a juẍtak Tíquico ok tok. A yet chi apni ocok, chak' ep a toj bay conob Nicópolis. Ata bay tu' ok on k'anjabok, yujtol chi wochej a tu' ayin ec'ok yet chi ec' nabil k'inal.

English: Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way and see that they have everything they need.
Kanjobal: A yet chi toj nak juẍtak licenciado Zenas yin is viaje yetok juẍtak Apolos, colwajan yin yet mimanil eb. Jantakc'al tzet chi k'anabax yuj eb yulak be, ak' bay eb, majaxta' aj eb.

English: Our people must learn to devote themselves to doing what is good, in order that they may provide for daily necessities and not live unproductive lives.
Kanjobal: Cha cuy eb jet creyenteal bay tu', tol chi yun eb tzet watx', cax chi colwaj eb bay eb ay is majilal, yet watx' ay yopiso eb yul sat Dios.

English: Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all.
Kanjobal: Chi yatok masanil eb ayic' wetok cayti' cawil a c'ul. Chak' cawil c'ul masanil eb creyente chon camc'ulnen bay tu'. Yak'okabc'al Dios is watx'c'ulal ayex e masanil bay tu'.

English: THE RABBIT AND THE COYOTE
Kanjobal: NAJ TXITX YETOJ NAJ OOJ

English: This is a story of uncle rabbit and the coyote.
Kanjobal: Haxka yet q'o gikan txitx yetoj naj ooj.

English: The rabbit came to a big rock, and there he deceived the coyote.
Kanjobal: Apni naj txitx b'ey hun ch'en miman naa ch'een, ha'tu' etax naj ooj yuu naj txitx.

English: He was leaning on the rock when the coyote came by.
Kanjobal: Q'eyanoj naj yin ch'en ch'centu' yapni naj ooj.

English: "What are you doing, brother?" the coyote asked the rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chawun cha wuxhtaj? -- xhi naj ooj tet naj txitx.

English: "Come here quickly, brother, the sky is falling down on top of us," said the rabbit to the coyote.
Kanjobal: -- Kaw cha wuxhtaj, cyman, lalan stit satkan qib'an -- xhi naj txitx tet naj ooj.

English: "Lean against the rock and hold it up while I go for a stick. We'll prop it up with that," said the rabbit to the coyote.
Kanjobal: Okan q'eyanoj ij kan aj, toj wi' hunoj kote' kak yuloj, xhiab' naj txitx tet naj ooj.

English: "All right," said the coyote and began holding it up with all his might.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj ooj, yok naj ya'on naj yip yijon aa naj.

English: Since the coyote was stupid, he just did what the rabbit told him to.
Kanjobal: Naj ooj suk naj tuk'al sije naj tzet chi yal naj txitx.

English: The rabbit had said that he was going to get a stick, but he went and left the coyote holding up the rock.
Kanjobal: Too naj txitx yion te' te' tuk'al chi yal pax. Too naj yokan naj ooj yijon aa k'amk'al chul naj txitx.

English: When the rabbit didn’t return the coyote shouted: “Come back, brother!
Kanjobal: -- ¡Kaw cha wuxhtaj! -- xhi naj ooj -- xtib'i eloj yalil hun ch'eenti' wuuan.

English: The weight of the rock has made me tired.
Kanjobal: K'amk al chul naj txitx.

English: The rabbit still didn’t come.
Kanjobal: Yilxa eloj hintojan, titoj hawi' satkan qib'an.

English: "No matter, I’m going to leave even though the sky may fall down on top of us," said the coyote.
Kanjobal: X'eltoj naj ooj xin, x'eltoj hininoj.

English: But when he ran away he fell into a ravine.
Kanjobal: Too naj sat ch'een naj ooj.

English: The rabbit never came back to the rock and the coyote was lost.
Kanjobal: Max too naj txitx xin, max k'eytoj naj ooj, max too naj seyon naj txitx huncl xa.

English: The coyote went looking for the rabbit again and came to where he found him eating a prickly pear.
Kanjobal: X'apni naj b'cy naj txitx, lalan naj txitx slo'oni hun te' pechaj.

English: "What are you eating, brother?"
Kanjobal: —- ¿Tzet chalo? cha wikan?

English: "Can’t you see, brother, how tasty our testicles are?
Kanjobal: -- Kewaach cha wuxh -- xhi naj txitx -- Ha' kob'a' hantaj wal sloi kob'a'ti'.

English: I took out one of my testicles to taste it," said the rabbit, "and yours are even larger."
Kanjobal: Hinxwi' cltejan, ab'to hasloi hinb'a'ti'an -- xhi naj txitx, haxa hawet mimej hawettu'.

English: "How can we get them out?"
Kanjobal: -- Haa, ¿tzet chi qute eltej?

English: We get them out by smashing them with a rock.
Kanjobal: -- Chi kochak eltej yuu ch'een, hinseyon hunoj koch'ecnan.

English: I'll go look for a rock.
Kanjobal: B'et naj txitx seyon ch'een.

English: The rabbit went to look for a rock and came back with one:
Kanjobal: Hul naj xin yetoj hun ch'cen:

English: "Hit your testicles with this. I'm going to leave now."
Kanjobal: -- Ha' hunti' ha' chaokoj yib'an hab'a'tu', hitzintojan -- xhi naj txitx.

English: "Why?" asked the coyote.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet yuu? -- xhi naj ooj.

English: "Because they re going to go flying quite a distance," said the rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- Tol naat chi too hiriroj, xhi pax naj txitx.

English: The rabbit got under the shade of a tree:
Kanjobal: Yapni naj txitx yich hun te'.

English: "Go ahead, hit them, I'm going to see where they land."
Kanjobal: -- Ak xin, hoj wilan b'ey chi toi.

English: The coyote hit his testicles with the rock.
Kanjobal: Xyakoj naj hun ch'cen yib'an sb'a'.

English: He cried from the pain in his testicles, and it killed him.
Kanjobal: Yaa, yaw naj ooj yuu sya'il sb'a', kam el naj yuu sb'a'.

English: The rabbit came to a water well and saw the reflection of the moon in the water.
Kanjobal: Too naj txitx, yapni naj txitx bey hun ha' k'oa', yilon eytoj naj yechel ix kotxitx yul ha' ha'tu'.

English: As the rabbit was very tricky, he was always deceiving the coyote.
Kanjobal: Naj txitx xin peena naj ek'al ok naj yetne naj ooj.

English: The dumb coyote always followed him and didn’t know that the rabbit was deceiving him.
Kanjobal: Naj kewa ooj tz'ajank'al pax naj, k'am chi sna' naj tatol chi ctax naj yuu naj txitx.

English: The rabbit came to the well where the rabbit was.
Kanjobal: Yapni pax naj ooj b'ey naj txitx b'ey ha' koa'.

English: When he saw the coyote coming he began to drink the water from the well.
Kanjobal: Yil naj txitx chi apni naj ooj yok naj txitx yuk'en aatcj ha' k'oa'.

English: When he arrived asked him:
Kanjobal: Yapni naj ooj:

English: "What are you doing, brother?
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chawun cha wuxh? -- xhi pax naj ooj.

English: The rabbit answered:
Kanjobal: Ta'wi naj txitx:

English: "Look, brother, there’s a lot of food."
Kanjobal: -- Kaw cha wuxh, xhi pax naj txitx. Eywal hun lo'b'e.

English: "What kind of food?"
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet lob cal?

English: "Look," the rabbit said to the coyote.
Kanjobal: —-Il to ab'i la -- xhi naj txitx tet naj ooj.

English: The coyote looked in the water.
Kanjobal: Yeytoj t'anan naj ooj yib'an ha' ha'.

English: "I see it. What is it?" asked the coyote.
Kanjobal: -- Tita'a, ¿tzet yetal? -- xhi naj ooj.

English: "There’s a cheese in the water," the rabbit said to the coyote.
Kanjobal: -- Késo eytoj yul ha'ti' -- xhi naj txitx tet naj ooj.

English: If we drink all the water we can get the cheese.
Kanjobal: Ta chi laawi aatej hun ha'ti' chi gi' késoti'.

English: Drink it, you're big and you can finish all the water."
Kanjobal: Uk' hachti', Mimanach hoj laaoj aatej hun ha'ti' hawuu.

English: "All right, brother," he said, and began to drink the water.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin cha wuxh -- xhi naj ooj, yok naj yuk'cn ha' ha'.

English: "I'm going for a walk," said the rabbit, and left.
Kanjobal: -- Toj hin paxhalan -- xhi naj txitx, xtoo naj xin.

English: The coyote continued to drink the water, but the rabbit was gone.
Kanjobal: Max uk' ha' ha' naj ooj, haxa xtoi naj txitx.

English: The coyote’s stomach began to hurt him, and he got diarrhea.
Kanjobal: Naj ooj xin tit sya'il sk'ul naj ooj, ok ck'ul yin naj ooj.

English: He wasn’t able to finish the water, so the coyote abandoned the effort and left.
Kanjobal: K'amk'al chi laawi ha' ha', sb'ejon kan naj ooj ha' ha'tu', xtoo naj.

English: PEDRO RIMARES AND THE PIGS
Kanjobal: PEDRO RIMARES YETOJ NO' TXITAM

English: Rimares was herding pigs at the house of a rich man.
Kanjobal: Naj Rimares max apni naj ilo txitam b'ey hun naj ey stumin.

English: It was his job to feed the pigs.
Kanjobal: Ha' naj chi ya'on low no' txitamtu'.

English: He would go to take care of them on a plain where the ground was muddy.
Kanjobal: Chi b'et naj staynen no' b'eyhun ak'al b'ey ey ha' ha' b'ey yax tx'otx'laj.

English: He planned to play a trick on his boss there.
Kanjobal: Wal ha'tu' max yutenaa naj peenail yin spatróntu'.

English: His boss was pleased with him, he boss was no longer afraid of him.
Kanjobal: Haxka naj spatrón naj chi tzala najyetoj naj k'amxa chi xiw naj spatrón najtu'.

English: He sent Rimares to take care of the pigs.
Kanjobal: Ya'ontoj naj ilotxitamtu' naj Rimarestu'.

English: When some hog merchants came by where Rimares was he sold the pigs to them.
Kanjobal: Ha tu' xin max apni wan eb' naj manomtxitam. Max xonon el naj no' txitamtu' tet eb' naj manom txitamtu'.

English: "I’ll sell them to you, and if it’s all right with you, I'll cut off the ends of their tails and show them to my boss," Pedro told the hog merchants.
Kanjobal: -- Chi wa' no' exan, asan xin ta chi yal hek'ul chi wi' kan elsnee no'an. Ha' hoj hintx'ox yil naj hinpatréntu'an -- xhi naj Rimarestu' tet eb' naj manom txitamtu'.

English: Then the hog merchants went off with the pigs, and Rimares kept all the tails.
Kanjobal: Max laawitu' xin, max too eb' naj manom txitamtu' yetoj no'txitam. Maasanil ha' snee no' xin ib'il kan aa yuu naj Rimarestu'.

English: As Rimares was a real scoundrel he stuck the pig tails into the muddy ground and shouted to his boss:
Kanjobal: Tol naj Rimarestu' kaw tx'itaj naj max sejon eytoj snee no'txitamtu' naj yul tx'otx'. Max eytoj snee no' yul tx'otx'tu' yuu najxin. Max awi naj tet spatrén, max el yaw naj:

English: "Boss!" he said.
Kanjobal: -- ¡Patrón! -- xhi naj.

English: "Boss!" he said.
Kanjobal: -- ¡Patrón! -- xhi naj.

English: The boss didn’t hear him.
Kanjobal: K'am chi yab' najpatrón.

English: "Boss!" he said, and shouted several more times.
Kanjobal: -- Patrón! -- xhik'al naj, ek'al clk'al max el yaw naj.

English: Rimares set out for his boss’ house and when he arrived he said to him:
Kanjobal: Max toonaj xin, naj Rimares x'apni naj b'ey snaa naj patron, max yalon naj:

English: Boss, I was shouting.
Kanjobal: Patrón, chin el waw.

English: Didn’t you hear the pigs squealing over and over again?
Kanjobal: ¿Tumi k'am chawab'e hantaj wal elmax el waw no' txitam?

English: They have sunk into the ground, only their tails can be seen.
Kanjobal: Max too no' yul tx'otx', haxak al snee no'txekel.

English: What can we do?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chi qute chana'?

English: Come with me to see where they sunk into the ground.
Kanjobal: Chi too hawil wetoj b'ey max tooyul trotx'tu'.

English: "All right, let’s go right away," he said and went with Rimares to the pig sty, where their tails were stuck in the ground.
Kanjobal: -- Toj hin xin, toon eyman -- xhi naj -- max too naj. Max apnieb' naj xin b'ey skolal no' txitamtu' b'ey snce no'tu'. X'apni eb'naj b'ey snee no'tu'.

English: Look at the tails, boss.
Kanjobal: Ti ha' snee no'ti' txckel patrón.

English: How are we going to get them out?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chi qute aatej no'?

English: "Pull on them," said the boss, "pull them out by the tail."
Kanjobal: Too aatej no' -- xhi naj patróntu' -- too aatej no' yin sneetu'.

English: Grab them by the tail.
Kanjobal: Okan mitxan yin snee no'tu'.

English: Go ahead and pull them.
Kanjobal: Cha to'on aatej no' xin.

English: "All right, boss, I’m going to try, watch."
Kanjobal: -- Patrón, wa'le to hawil xin.

English: Rimares began to grab the pigs’ tails.
Kanjobal: Max ok mitxan Rimarestu' yinsnee no' txitamtu'.

English: He pulled and one pig tail broke off.
Kanjobal: Max sto'on aatej xin, max aatej snee no'txitamtu',

English: "Look, one of the tails has broken of," Rimares told his boss.
Kanjobal: -- Ee -- xhi Rimarestu' -- max el Vin aa naj snee no' -- xhi Rimarestu' tet spatróntu'.

English: "Go ahead and try another one."
Kanjobal: -- As a'le yin hunxatu' yin sneetu'.

English: Rimares went and pulled once more.
Kanjobal: Max too Rimarestu' xin.

English: He did the same thing, he pulled another tail out.
Kanjobal: Sto'on aatej hunxatu' xin. Hak' ala max yun xin, x'el xin aaoj sneehunxatu',

English: "Go ahead and pull on another one," the boss said to him.
Kanjobal: -- Eyman chi too aa to'tej hunxatu' -- xhi patréntu' tet.

English: He went on doing this successively one after the other.
Kanjobal: Max tooyin hunxa hak'ala keyk'altu' max yune.

English: But he was just pulling out the tails of the pigs.
Kanjobal: Tuk'al chi el xin aa sneewan txitamtu'.

English: Well now, boss, the pigs don’t come out that way.
Kanjobal: Nani' xin patrón, k'am chi aatej no' haxkati'.

English: We better get them out with spades.
Kanjobal: Tol chikohotatej no' yetoj piocha.

English: Do you have any spades in your house?
Kanjobal: ¿Ey mi ch'en piocha b'ey hanaatu'?

English: "Yes, go and bring them right away," the boss said to Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- Ey ch'en, asi' i' ch'en eyman -- xhi patróntu' tet Rimarestu', max yalon.

English: Rimares came to the boss’ house like the mischievous and ill-bred person that he was
Kanjobal: X'apni Rimarestu' bey snaa patrón xin. Tol Rimarestx'itaj xin, max apni kan b'ey snaa spatrón.

English: The boss remained standing where the pigs had sunk in the ground. Rimares came to where the boss’ wife and two daughters were.
Kanjobal: Ha' patrón xin tekankan okoj b'ey max too no' txitamtu' yul tx'otx'tu'. Ha'tu' max apni Rimarestu' bey yistil patróntu'. Ey kaawan skutzin patróntu'.

English: Rimares said:
Kanjobal: Maxyalon Rimares xin:

English: All the pigs have sunk into the ground, so my boss said I should sleep with the three of you.
Kanjobal: Ha' no' txitamtu' max laawitoj no' yul tx 'otx' maasanil, xantol max yal hinpatrón tol chin wey heyetoj heyoxwanil.

English: What are you saying?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chawala?

English: "Are you crazy?" asked the boss’ wife.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tumi ey haya'b'il? -- xhi ix patrona.

English: Why would my husband say that you're going to sleep with me?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzetxanoj yal wichamil tol chach wey wetoj?

English: "You really are crazy," the boss’ wife said to him.
Kanjobal: -- Haachti' tol eyhaya'b'il -- utele Rimares yuu ix patróna.

English: "No, it’s because he’s going to get the pigs out," said Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- K'amaj, tol keytu' yuuxanoj aatej no' txitam yul -- xhi Rimarestu'.

English: The boss kept shouting to Rimares:
Kanjobal: Hakala patrón xin chi awi'toj patrón tet Rimares:

English: "Hurry, hurry!" the boss told Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- ¡Eyman! ¡Eyman! -- xhi patróntu' tet Rimarestu'.

English: The boss' wife heard him and said:
Kanjobal: Chi yab'enix patrona xin:

English: Can that be what the boss is saying?
Kanjobal: ¿Ab' chi yal patrón xin?

English: Hurry, the boss said I should sleep with you.
Kanjobal: Eyman, tol chin wey heyetoj xhi patréntu'.

English: "Don’t the three of you hear him?" Rimares asked the three women.
Kanjobal: ¿Chim heyab'eheyoxwanil? -- xhi Rimares tet eb' ix ixtu' yoxwanil.

English: But they didn’t want to sleep with Rimares. Rimares shouted to his boss:
Kanjobal: Ha' yet k'amchi sqe' eb' ix wey yetoj Rimarestu', max hawi'tcj Rimarestu' b'eyspatrón:

English: "The three of them?" asked Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Yoxwanil mi? -- xhi pax Rimarestu'.

English: “Yes, the three of them," answered the boss.
Kanjobal: -- Haa', yoxwanil -- xhi pax patróntu'.

English: "Listen, the boss said three," said Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- Ab' xin, heyoxwanil xhi patróntu' -- xhi pax Rimarestu'.

English: "All right," said the boss’ wife.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi patronatu'.

English: She was angry because Rimares slept with her and her two daughters.
Kanjobal: Chi howi tol yuu max wey hun Rimarestu' yetoj hun ixnamtu', yctoj kaawan yune'.

English: That’s not what the boss had said, he had said three spades, not three women.
Kanjobal: Ha' pax yalonpatróntu' man keyojtu' yaloni tol max yal oxeb' piocha, manajoxwan ixtu', chi yal patróntu'.

English: Rimares had deceived the boss by sleeping with the three women.
Kanjobal: Tuk'al max yetne patróntu' hun Rimarestu'. Xlaawi xin, max wey yetoj oxwan ixtu'.
