English: He brought the spades to his boss.
Kanjobal: Max yi'ontej piochatu'.

English: Wait for me, I’m going to defecate, I'll be right back.
Kanjobal: Echmanein, tol chin too tz'aoj, ti chin huli yet hun txolanti'.

English: But the boss was left standing there with the three spades.
Kanjobal: Ha'tu' xin max kan kan patróntu' yetoj oxeb' piochatu'.

English: And so Rimares went away.
Kanjobal: Max xlaawi xin, max too Rimarestu'.

English: Since the boss didn’t know how to dig in the ground, he was just left standing there waiting for Rimares.
Kanjobal: Tol patrón xin manyootajoj tzet chi yun sq'uletoj hun tx'otx'tu', tuk'al max okan tekanoj, xyechmaneni Rimarestu'.

English: Rimares didn’t come back, he was gone for good. At nightfall the boss came home and said to his wife:
Kanjobal: Maaxa apni Rimares xin maxtooi. Max q'cjb'i eyoj max paxtoj patróntu' b'ey snaa. Max apnib'ey snaa xin, max yaloni:

English: That Rimares deceived me, he just left me standing there where the pigs sank into the ground.
Kanjobal: Ha' hun Rimarestu' kaw chin yetne, tuk'al max hinxhej kanok tekan b'ey max too no' txitamtu' yul tx'otx'tu'.

English: I’ll be right back, I’m just going to defecate, he said, and I believed him.
Kanjobal: Ti chin huli tolchin too tz'aoj xhi, tolta yel chin na'a.

English: But he’s gone off again and hasn’t returned.
Kanjobal: Max too paxoj k'amk'al chihuli.

English: "That’s why I came back," the boss said.
Kanjobal: -- Yuuxan max hinmeltzutej -- xhik al patróntu'.

English: His wife didn’t answer him.
Kanjobal: K'am chi ta'wiyistiltu' tet.

English: She was angry.
Kanjobal: Chi howi, max yalon xin.

English: "Why are you angry?" the boss asked his wife.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet xan chach howi? -- xhi patróntu' tet yistiltu'.

English: Why shouldn’t I be angry?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan man hinhowoj?

English: You sent that shameless fellow to me and my daughters.
Kanjobal: Texan chachejtej hun txitajtu'win yetoj wune'.

English: See here, he slept with me and with our daughters.
Kanjobal: Ila tinani', max wey wetoj yetoj eb' ix qune'ti'.

English: You're the one who took in that scoundrel, you took him in.
Kanjobal: Haxhton chacha' txitaj hun winajti'.

English: The boss answered:
Kanjobal: Max ta'wi patron xin:

English: Could it have been that shameless fellow I sent that slept with you?
Kanjobal: ¿Tumi ey hun tx'itajtu' chin chejtej wey hawetoj xin?

English: What did he do to you?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzetmax hach yute?

English: He took advantage of me and did the same thing to the two girls.
Kanjobal: Max hinlaawi el yuu, keytu' max yun pax eb' ix q'opoti'yuu oxwanil.

English: "He abused us and that’s why I’m angry," the boss’ wife told her husband.
Kanjobal: Max kolaawi el yuu on, yuuxan chin howi -- xhi ixpatrona tet yichamil.

English: "Oh," said the boss.
Kanjobal: -- Aja -- xhi naj patrón.

English: Could it have been because I sent him to bring me something?
Kanjobal: ¿Tumi ey tzet chin chejtej e in xin?

English: I sent him to bring three of my spades to dig out the pigs.
Kanjobal: Tolha' oxeb' ch'en piocha max hinchej hul yi' naj, tol ha' chi kohotatejno' txitamtu' yetoj.

English: I tell you in my heart I didn’t know he was going to lie to you that way.
Kanjobal: Walon yul hink'ul man wootajoj ta keytu' chiyun xijon pax aa naj.

English: I ask you for forgiveness.
Kanjobal: A' hex miman k'ulal xin.

English: What are we going to do?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chi qute?

English: It’s not my fault.
Kanjobal: Manajin e in mul.

English: PEDRO RIMARES AND THE MULETEERS
Kanjobal: PEDRO RIMARES YETOJ NAJ ILOM CHEE

English: Here's another story about Rimares.
Kanjobal: Hata naj Rimarestu' ha' naj ey kan hun sq'aneti'.

English: It’s a story of how Rimares was a great scoundrel a long time ago.
Kanjobal: Haxka ta historia tol naj Rimares puch tx'itaj max yute sb'aa yet peyxatu'.

English: In this story I am going to tell a little about what Pedro Rimares did then.
Kanjobal: Haton yet hun q'aneti'oj wal nioj tinani'an xin haxka max yute sb'aa Pedro Rimarestu' yet peyxatu'.

English: He was taking care of some mules and feeding them.
Kanjobal: Ey wan no' chee mula chi stayne, chi ya' lowoj.

English: It occurred to him to do something mischievous and he cut off the mules’ lips with a knife.
Kanjobal: Max sna'on aa tx'itajal, max spol el xaj sti' no' mulatu' yetoj nawax.

English: Then he said to the boss:
Kanjobal: Max yalon b'ey patróntu' b'ey naj peyxatu':

English: Boss, I don't know what's the matter with the animals, they're just laughing at me.
Kanjobal: Patrón, tzimi ye no' cheeti', tuk'al chi see ok no' winan.

English: "Look, they're laughing a lot," said to the boss.
Kanjobal: Il to ab' no' kaw chi sce no' -- xhi Rimarestu' tet spatrón.

English: Later he sent him out again to bring grass for the animals.
Kanjobal: Kakaltu' xin max chejletoj yuu yan cheetu' hunelxa.

English: Since the boss knew that it was he who had cut off the animals’ lips, he ran away and didn’t return.
Kanjobal: Max sna'on el xin tol ha' max kupon el xaj sti' no' cheetu', max el aa xin, maaxa huloj.

English: The muleteers went on a trip and came to the sea shore.
Kanjobal: Wan ilom cheetu' xin wan cb' xhectu' max too eb' b'ecl, max apni eb' b'ey sti' ha? miman paam ha'.

English: While they were cating Rimares came and deceived them once more.
Kanjobal: Lalan slow cb' max apni pax Rimarestu' xin yetnen cb' hunclxa.

English: He asked for lodging from the muleteers.
Kanjobal: Max q'anon wey sb'aa tet wan ilom cheetu' wan ey smulatu'.

English: "I’m going to spend the night here with you," said Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- Weyoj hin hek'atan -- xhi Rimares.

English: "Go ahead and sleep, don’t worry, if you don’t have a blanket you can get into this sack," the muleteers told Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- Ab'tuc weyan, weyan, k'am chatak hak'ul, ta k'am hatxow haach cytoj yul koxhtalti' la -- xhi wan ilom cheetu' tet Rimarestu'.

English: "Alright, I'll get in," said Rimares.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin, hoj hin eytoj -- xhi Rimarestu'.

English: He got into the sack, and by cleven o'clock that night he was sleeping soundly.
Kanjobal: Max eytoj yul koxhtal xin, xyetzen wey aa sb'aa yet huslujeb' ora yet a'balil.

English: When it was almost midnight the muleteers said:
Kanjobal: Tuxa chi ok chuman a'b'al max yalon wan ilom cheetu' xin:

English: "Now we can kill this Rimares once and for all, because he’s fallen asleep.” They heard him snoring loudly:
Kanjobal: -- Ha' hun Rimaresti' haxa ian chi qa' kan tan el tinani' -- xhi wan ilom cheetu', ti max wey aaoj -- xhi cb'. Chi yab'en eb' yel yaw xaam:

English: "He's asleep, we're going to teach this rascal a lesson. We're going to tie up the sack and throw him into the sea."
Kanjobal: -- Max wey aa cha, qi' el yisail -- xhi wan ilom cheetu'. Kopix ey sti' hun koxhtalti' katu' chi koq'ojontoj yib an ha' miman paam ha'ti' -- xhiab' wan ilom cheetu'.

English: They tied up the sack, lifted it up and threw it into the sea.
Kanjobal: Max spixon ey eb' sti' hun koxhtaltu' max slakon aa eb' sq'ojontoj cb' yib'an ha' miman paam ha'tu'.

English: Here is Pedro:
Kanjobal: T'ey xin, Pedro:

English: Goodbye, Pedro.
Kanjobal: Xawil hab'aa, Pedro.

English: Why did you cut off our animals’ lips?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan max hakup el xaj sti' kochee?

English: Now you're going to be finished, well see you later," said the muleteers.
Kanjobal: Ha' tinani' chawa' tan hawet, tinani'xa qil kob'aa -- xhi wan ilom cheetu'.

English: They thought they had thrown Pedro into the sea in the sack.
Kanjobal: Chi sna' eb' tol ha' Pedrotu' max sq'ojtoj eb' yul koxhtaltu' yib'an miman paam ha'tu'.

English: Goodbye, Pedro!
Kanjobal: Qil xin Pedro.

English: And Rimares answered:
Kanjobal: Max ta'wi Rimares xin:

English: "Goodbye to everything, to your tamales and ropes," said Pedro from the other side of the sea.
Kanjobal: -- Qil wej xin maasanil yetoj hetx'ix yetoj hesojb'al -- xhi paxtej Pedro skaxeb'al ha'.

English: They heard that the voice that answered them was his.
Kanjobal: Xyab'tej eb' yul snuq'tu' tol a max ta'wi paxtu'.

English: The muleteers were frightened and looked for their food.
Kanjobal: Max xiw aa eb' xin wan ilom cheetu' max seyon yil eb' slo'b'ctu'.

English: They couldn’t find it where they had left it, nor the ropes with which they tied up the merchandise on the animals.
Kanjobal: K'amxa xyil eb' eytoj yul slugar b'ey kugan yuu eb' slobe' eb'tu' yetoj sojb'al eb'tu' chik'alon ok yijatz yib'an cheetu'.

English: They had thrown everything into the sea and they were frightened.
Kanjobal: Maasanil max q'oj kantoj cb' yul ha' miman paam ha'tu', max xiw aa eb' xin.

English: Pedro was just laughing from the other side of the sea.
Kanjobal: Pedro xin tuk'al chi sce eb' ej pakantu'.

English: Ay, we’ve been tricked.
Kanjobal: ¡Ay horiros!

English: It was our food that we threw in the sea.
Kanjobal: Ha' kolo'b'e ha' max koq'oj toj yul ha'tu'.

English: We can’t do anything about that Rimares, we couldn’t kill him.
Kanjobal: Hun Rimaresti', k'amxa yanil, maaxa kam quu.

English: See here, we're going to go hungry on his account.
Kanjobal: Ila tinani' hon ok kan yin wail yuu.

English: Rimares had tricked them.
Kanjobal: Max see el eb' xin yuu Rimarestu'.

English: PEDRO RIMARES AND THE FLYING HORSE
Kanjobal: PEDRO YETOJ NO' CHEE CHI EK' SATKAN

English: Once Pedro Rimares resuscitated a dead horse of which only the skin remained.
Kanjobal: Ey hun no' kamom chee ok spixan yuu Rimarestu', haxak'al s'umal no' hotxan kan eyoj.

English: Buzzards had entered into the skin and he sewed it up. He prayed over it and was able to revive the dead horse.
Kanjobal: Ey oktoj no' mij yul s'umal no' cheetu' smajchen ey xin tz'ison eyoj katu' xhaali ok yin, yok spixan no' kamnaj cheetu' yuu.

English: The buzzards stayed inside the skin of the dead horse and flew into the air, as if it were an airplane.
Kanjobal: Ey kan oktoj no' mijtu' yul s'umal no' kamnaj cheetu'. Chi ek' satkan yetoj no' cheetu', haxka ta awyon ye yuu.

English: He met a merchant with a lot of money and merchandise.
Kanjobal: Yilontej sb'aa yctoj hun txonwomtu', miman stumin hun txonwomtu' yetoj yijatz.

English: The merchant took a liking to the horse.
Kanjobal: Tew ok hun txonwomtu' yin hun xheetu' xin.

English: Your horse is very nice, Pedro.
Kanjobal: Sa'al ch'an hun hacheeti' cha Pedro.

English: "Why don’t you sell it tome?" the merchant asked Pedro.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet xan k'am chatxonel e inan? -- xhi hun txonwomtu' tet Pedrotu'.

English: Do you think you can afford to buy my horse? It’s too expensive for you.
Kanjobal: Tumi hoj teecha stool hinchec, hawuu miman stool.

English: But if you want to give me all your money, all your cloth, and all your merchandise, I'll give you the horse.
Kanjobal: Ta chawoche a' hatumin maasanil yetoj haq'ap maasaniltu', chi wa' kantoj e ach hun cheeti'.

English: "But how do you get it to fly through the air?" asked the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Asan tzet chi yun gaa pax satkan? -- xhi pax txonwomtu'.

English: "I'll show you how to do it," he replied.
Kanjobal: -- Kotx'ox hawila keyti' -- xhi hun kaxkati'.

English: "What you do is give him a kick in the belly and then you pull his tail over your shoulder," Rimares told the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Tol hoj hatek ok hawajan yin sk'ulti' katu' chamitxontej snee b'ey solom haxik'ti' -- xhi Rimaristu' tet tronwomtu'.

English: "All right, said the merchant.”
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi tkonwom.

English: So Pedro went with the money and the load of merchandise.
Kanjobal: Max laawi xin, max too kan Pedrotu' yetoj stumin yetoj ijatz.

English: The merchant was real happy.
Kanjobal: Chi tzala tkonwom xin.

English: “Now I have my airplane and I’m going to fly in the sky," said the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Ti eyxa hinawyon tol hoj hinek' satkan -- xhi txonwomtu'.

English: So he went flying real high in the air. It occurred to him:
Kanjobal: Xlaawi xin, max too hururoj satkantu' kaw naat xyaa eytoj. Max tit yul sk'ul xin kawxa sb'ey hun hincheeti':

English: "My horse has flown a lot. I’m going to try to do as Pedro told me. I'm going to pull the tail so that it will go faster," thought the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Wa'le haxka max yal Pedro e inan. Hinto' sneeti', yuuxanoj slak s'beyi -- xhi txonwom.

English: So the merchant pulled the horse’s tail hard and he fell down from the sky and was killed.
Kanjobal: Haxka txonwom xin yelk'al sk'ul ip, max yun sikon snee hun cheetu'. Max eltej tuknaj snee cheetu' yuu txonwomtu' xin.

English: The poor merchant died with his airplane.
Kanjobal: Max tit huyuyoj satkantu' xin. Max kam xin.

English: The buzzards came out flying and that was the end of the horse.
Kanjobal: Max kam txonwomtu' yetoj hun awyontu'. Max eltej hururoj no' mij, xlaawi eltej no' xin.

English: It fell from the sky. The merchant fell from the sky to the earth.
Kanjobal: Keytu' max yun stit kan huyujoj satkantu'. Max b'ej chi aatoj txonwomtu' yey key sat tx'otx'tu'.

English: And so ends another funny story of Pedro Rimares.
Kanjobal: Keytu' yun stan kan hunxa smaxil q'ane yet naj Pedro Rimaristu'.

English: THE RABBIT AND THE SHEEP
Kanjobal: NAJ TXITX YETOJ NAJ ME'

English: Uncle rabbit had a sheep, it was an old sheep, and he went for a walk in the mountains with him. He rode him as if he were his horse. So he set out and came to a corn merchant's.
Kanjobal: Ha' q'o qikan txitx cy hun smc' q'o cy hun naj icham me'. Max too naj paxhal xol yaxk'ultaj yetoj hun sme'tu'. Ha' yib'an hun sme' najtu' max oki, ha' ey ok xhecoj naj. Max too naj xin, max apni naj b'cy hun naj txonom ixim. B'ey naj txonom ixim xin max apni q'o qikan txitx yetoj hun sme'tu', ha'tu' max wey naj.

English: He came with his sheep to the corn merchant's and slept there.
Kanjobal: Max sajb'i xin, max too pax naj xin, x'apni naj xin b'ey hun miman naa ch'cen.

English: When dawn came he set off again and came to a large cave.
Kanjobal: Ha"tu' max sq'an wey sb'aa naj tet hun naj icham b'alam.

English: He asked a lion for lodging there and went up into the loft to sleep.
Kanjobal: Max aatoj naj yul kaan max wey aa naj xin.

English: All night long the sheep was waking him up saying:
Kanjobal: Yet hantaj aab'al xin max cl sweyan naj sme' najtu', max yalon naj sme' naj xin:

English: "Uncle, I feel like urinating," said the sheep.
Kanjobal: -- Cha wikan, chi yab' hintxulan -- xhi naj me'tu'.

English: How can I urinate?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chi yun intxulan?

English: Look, there are people in the house and if I go down there they'll eat me up."
Kanjobal: Ila wan winaj ey ok yul hun naa. Ta chin eytojan chin xhi' eyloj cb an.

English: "Oh," said the rabbit, "don't worry. Just lie on your back and urinate so that your wool will soak up the urine.”
Kanjobal: -- Aa -- xhi naj txitx, k'am chaxh xiw xin -- xhi q'o qikan txitx, tol chach aa pakanoj katu' chach txuli yuuxanoj k'ey aa hatxultu' xol haxil.

English: Is it true what you say?
Kanjobal: ¿Yelton chawala?

English: I think they're going to eat us.
Kanjobal: Chi koxhi' eytoj eb'.

English: Urinate.
Kanjobal: Txulan.

English: "All right," said the old sheep.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj icham me'.

English: He lay on his back and urinated.
Kanjobal: Max aa pakan naj max txuli naj.

English: But when he was through urinating he fell off the edge of the loft. He had not been lying in his bed the way he thought he was.
Kanjobal: Ha' yet max xcw xuli naj haxka sti' hun yul kaantu' eltej naj. Maa swa'ne ey sb'aa naj xin yul sweyub' chi yute yalon xin. Max tit k'cy sanna najme'tu', max cyol naj xol cb' naj icham b'alam.

English: The sheep fell on top of the old lions.
Kanjobal: Max xiw aa cb' naj icham b'alam.

English: They were frightened and they ran away crying: "The sky has fallen on top of us."
Kanjobal: Max too cb' naj, max el aa eb' naj b'alam: -- Max tit satkan qiban -- xhi naj icham b'alam.

English: As the sheep had made a noise when he fell among them, the lions were frightened and abandoned their house.
Kanjobal: Haxka ha' naj me' xin, ha' naj x'awi yeyol sanna naj xol eb' naj, max xiw kantoj cb' naj b'alam xin, max sb'ej kan eb' naj snaa.

English: As soon as he came down to where the old sheep was uncle asked him: "Brother, did you hurt yourself anywhere?"
Kanjobal: Max yalon q'o qikan xin cyman max eyol q'o sk'atan naj icham me': -- Cha wuxhtaj ¿k'am b'eyxawab' sya'il -- xhi q'o qikan tet naj icham me'.

English: "No, brother, but my buttocks hurt me," the sheep said to the uncle.
Kanjobal: -- K'amaj, cha wuxhtaj, asan yib'an hinchopti' ya' walan -- xhi naj me'tu' tet q'o qikan.

English: "Don't worry, brother, because this is where we are going to live.
Kanjobal: -- K'am chi tak hak'ul xin, cha wuxhtaj tol ha'ti' hoj kokaeyoj.

English: This house is ours now.
Kanjobal: Qetxa hun naati'.

English: "We're not going away any more," the uncle said to the old sheep.
Kanjobal: K'amxa chon toi -- xhi q'o gikan tet naj icham me'.

English: "Anyway, if your buttocks hurt, I'm going to make them well. To me those lions are nothing but crap. I'm going to give you this remedy, and it'll cure you.
Kanjobal: Ye xin -- xhinaj, tatol ya' yib'an hachopti' ti chi wantean. Asan wan b'alam ha' hintza'an. Ha' hoj wa' yanilojan, yuuxan hoj wa"xoj.

English: This house is ours now.
Kanjobal: Xal hun naati' qet xaon.

English: "But," said the sheep, "won't the owners of this house come back to eat me?" the sheep asked the uncle.
Kanjobal: -- K'amaj cha -- xhi naj me' -- ¿tumi man hinhul xhi' eytoj eb' wan icham eb' snaati' -- xhi naj me' tet q'o qikan.

English: "No, they're not going to come back any more, because they were frightened. Now we have some work to do."
Kanjobal: -- K'amxa chi hul eb', xiwtoj kan eb', tol chon mulnai tinani'

English: "What are we going to do?" asked the sheep.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chi qun xin? -- xhi naj me'.

English: "We're going to hang the skulls of the animals in the corners of the house, so that when they come looking for us, we can kill them right here.
Kanjobal: -- Ha' wan sb'ajil solom no'ti' ha' eb' chi kolokb'a ok yinlaj xikin hun naati', tol chi kosey qute chi koma' oktoj yulaj hun naati'.

English: So let's hang up the animal bones."
Kanjobal: Ha'ti' chi kolokb'a ok sb'ajil wan noq'ti'.

English: "All right, uncle," said the sheep, "as long as they don't come to eat us up."
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin cha wikan -- xhi naj me' -- ta k'am chi hul eb' koxhi'.

English: "They won't come." They hung the skeletons of the big animals around the house.
Kanjobal: -- K'am chul eb'. Max ok lokan sb'ajil wan mimej noq' yinlaj hun naatu' xin.

English: When the old lions went to see their house they saw the skeletons the rabbit had hung up and they were afraid of them.
Kanjobal: Ha' wan icham b'alam xin chi b'et eb' t'anle ek' snaatu', haxa chi yilon eb' xin wan b'ajtu' wan lokan ok yuu naj txitxtu', ha'tu' chi xiwte sb'aa eb' tet wan bajtu'.

English: "Brothers," said an old lion to his companions, "I went to see our house a while ago."
Kanjobal: -- Cha wuxhtaj -- xhi wan icham b'alamtu' tet yetb'i -- Max b'et wil ek' konaa ma'iti'an -- xhi naj icham b'alamtu'. Yapni naj b'ey yistil.

English: Many of our comrades died when something fell on top of us.
Kanjobal: Hantaj eb' naj qetb'i max slaawi el kanoj yet max tita' hun tzetaltu' qib'an.

English: Now the skeletons of our comrades are hung in our house, and so let's not go back there again, because if we do we're going to die.
Kanjobal: Haxak'al sb'ajil eb' naj qetb'i loklom wakan ok yin konaa. Yuuxan tinani' k'amxa chon toi, ta chon too hunelxa chi kokam paxoj.

English: The uncle deceived us, for he brought a vam pire to cat us.
Kanjobal: Tol ha' q'o qikan ha' max koetneni, tol ha' hun stiltik ib'il ok yuu, ha' chon chi'on eytoj.

English: Didn't you notice that the uncle's companion had horns?
Kanjobal: ¿Tumi maa heyila ey yuk'a hun ib'il yuu q'o gikantu'?

English: It was he who attacked us and perhaps it was he who came to our house and ate our companions.
Kanjobal: Ha' max ok smul qin, ha' tejan tol ha' max apni kan yul konaatu' hunelne, ha' max xhi'on eytoj eb' naj getb'itu'.

English: That's why we're not going there.
Kanjobal: Yuuxan k'amxa chon too xin.

English: When he came home to his wife he told her: "I myself am going to match my strength against the vampire.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi yistil naj icham b'alam. -- Hain kaw chi wa'le wapni b'ey konaatu'an.

English: I'm going to go and sleep in our bed, and we'll see if he can do anything to me.
Kanjobal: Chin lamb'ane wip yetoj hun tiltiktu'an. Chin too oktoj weyan bey sat kotx'attu', chi wilon walan xin tzet chin yutean.

English: I'll match my strength against his.
Kanjobal: Chin lamb'ane wip yetojan.

English: "Don't go," his wife said to him.
Kanjobal: -- K'am chaxh toi -- xhi yistil naj tet.

English: "No, I'm going, I'm going to see our house any way," he said.
Kanjobal: -- K'amaj, chin toi, chin took'al wil konaatu' -- xhi naj.

English: When he came to his house he went in and went to sleep in his bed. As uncle rabbit was clever, as soon as he saw the lion returning to the house he went back up into the loft with the sheep.
Kanjobal: Max apni naj xin katu' x'aaton naj wey sat tx'at. Haxka q'o qikan txitx kaw ha'yan sna'b'al qo, max yil naj yapni naj b'alam yul snaa hunel xa, max too q' qikan yul kaan xin yetoj sme' hunel xa.

English: When he was up there he was figuring out how the sheep should fall down again.
Kanjobal: Max apni naj yul kaan max seyon naj tzet chi yute naj hunel xa.

English: "Now, brother, go and sleep on the edge of the loft.
Kanjobal: -- Xal tinani' cha wuxh haach eltoj wey sti' yul kaanti'.

English: We're going to do as we did before, although this time you may not feel like urinating. When you fall on top of the old lion I'm going to shout. That way the old lion will be frightened. Be sure and fall right on top of him.
Kanjobal: Keytu' hoj qute haxka qute hunel, taxak'al k'am chi yab' hatxul. Ha' b'ey eytoj hab'aa yib'an hun icham b'alamti', hain hoj el wawan yuuxan no' xiwtoj hun icham b'alamtu'. Chawila kaw yib'an chach ey apnoj hululoj.

English: I'll let you know when he's asleep.
Kanjobal: Yet kaw lalanxa sweyi hoj wal e achan hanik'.

English: Only if they catch me don't be afraid, for we've already won our house. Look, last time they all left, and only the old lion is left.
Kanjobal: Asan ta chin smitxan cha, k'am chach xiwi, qetxa okoj hun naati'. Ila max eltoj eb' maasanil eb' yet huneltu', xal tinani' la hunxane chan hun icham b'alamti'.

English: You'll see that they're going to be frightened again right away.
Kanjobal: Hawila eyman hoj xiwtoj.

English: As soon as I push you down I'm going to shout in a loud voice so that they'll be frightened.
Kanjobal: Ha' yet hoj hach hintenon eytojtu'an kat wa' yawan kaw miman hoj wute yul hinnugq'ti'an yuuxan no' xiwtoj.

English: "All right," the sheep said to uncle rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj me' tet q'o qikan txitx.

English: The lion was awake all night. "Now I'm going to kill that vampire," he said. He was waiting, and it struck ten o'clock, and then it struck eleven o'clock. "Even though there's still nothing in my house that has confronted me I'm afraid."
Kanjobal: Max okk'al aab'al xin ikisk'al hun icham b'alamtu': -- Hawal tinani' hoj hinchi' eytoj hun tiltiktu' -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu'. Chi smajk'al yet chi ok laoneb' óra i huslujeb' ora. -- Tuk'al chin xiwi k'am maj ek' b'ey hinnaati' man to hul ok win. Toj hinweyan.

English: The uncle was waiting for the old lion to fall asleep and he did go to sleep about eleven o'clock that night.
Kanjobal: Max wey aa naj icham b'alam yet chi ok huslujeb' óra majb'il yuu q'o qikan xin hanik' chi wey aaoj.

English: The uncle noticed when he fell asleep.
Kanjobal: Max yil q'o qikan xin hanik' chi wey aaoj.

English: "Now, brother, the old lion has fallen asleep. Be on guard. Do you feel like urinating?" he asked the sheep.
Kanjobal: -- Hal tinani' cha wuxh, max wey aa hun icham b'alam; ha' wa'ne hab'aa. ¿K'am mi wal chi yab' hatxul?

English: "No, I don't feel like urinating," the sheep answered.
Kanjobal: -- K'am chi yab' hintxul -- xhi naj me'tu'.

English: "All right, so now he has fallen asleep. Throw yourself right on top of him, so as to make him feel the pain." Then the old sheep fell on top of the old lion's testicles, and the old lion let out a cry:
Kanjobal: -- Tinani' xin ti max wey aaoj; eyantoj hululoj yib'an, kaw yib'an chach tekanoj yuuxan no' yab' sya'il -- Haxa max ey b'ejontoj sb'aa xin hun icham me'w', ha' yib'an sb'a' icham b'alamtu'. X'ey apnoj tckan hun icham me'tu', max aa yaw icham b'alam xin.

English: "Don't eat my testicles! Let me go!"
Kanjobal: -- ¡Man hachi'toj hinb'a'an! ¡Hajin elan!

English: The uncle said: "Now I'm going to get down fast, now that my companion has grabbed the lion.
Kanjobal: Ha' pax q'o gikan xin: -- Eyman chon ey wejtoj, ti max micha yuu naj getb'i.

English: The sheep cried:
Kanjobal: Ya' yaw naj me':

English: "Ba-a-a-a-a," said the sheep.
Kanjobal: -- Me-e-e-e-e -- xhi naj me'.

English: The old lion was frightened and came out of the house running.
Kanjobal: Max xiwtoj naj icham b'alam xin max eltoj hininoj naj yul snaa.

English: By shouting in a deep voice the uncle made him believe that they were many, but there were just two of them, the uncle and the sheep.
Kanjobal: Ha' q'o qikan yetoj naj me' ck'al xa'al chi yute yul snug' eb' naj. Chi yab'en naj icham b'alamtu' tol kaw ek'al eb' naj, hak'al ch'an eb' naj kaawantu' q'o gikantu' yetoj naj me'tu'.

English: When the old lion came back to his wife he cried.
Kanjobal: Haxa max apni naj icham b'alam b'ey yistil, max o' aa naj tet yistil.

English: "They practically finished me off," he told his wife.
Kanjobal: -- Kaw ian ix hinlaawi elan -- xhi naj tet yistil.

English: "Did you hurt yourself?" his wife asked him.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tumixa wab' sya'il? -- xhi yistil naj.

English: "My testicles hurt a lot, let's see if you can make them well," he answered.
Kanjobal: -- Ha' wal hinb'a'ti'an kaw ya'an, ta chawante hinb'a'ti'an -- xhi naj tet yistil.

English: The uncle and the sheep stayed in the house and had a big party.
Kanjobal: Max kan q'o qikan b'ey naa xin. X'ok hun q'in b'ey snaa q'o qikan yetoj naj me'.

English: They invited the cow, the horse and the deer. They invited them because the uncle and the sheep had won a house when the lion left it.
Kanjobal: Max yawten eb' naj naj wakax yetoj naj chee yetoj naj k'ultajil chee. Max yawte naj tol chi ok hun q'in. Max yion eb' naj snaa naj me' yetoj naj txitx, tzub'il tol max eltej naj b'alam yul snaa.

English: The uncle and the sheep had chased them away.
Kanjobal: Yujten q'o qikan yetoj sme'.

English: Those two had defeated those big animals all by themselves and they were very happy.
Kanjobal: Asan ch'an eb' naj kaawan ya' yetoj eb' naj mimej noq'tu'. Kaw chi tzala sk'ul eb' naj yet xtan kantoj hun q'ane'ti'.

English: THE RABBIT AND THE WATERMELON
Kanjobal: NAJ TXITX YETOJ AN SANDÍA

English: There was a woman who was a friend of the priest's.
Kanjobal: Ey hun ix ixnamil ix kaw sa'al chil-le sb' aa yctoj naj pale.

English: Every day she would go take him a watermelon and the priest would be very pleased. But the rabbit was the woman's enemy.
Kanjobal: Yet hunun k'u chi b'et ix ya' sandía naj pale, chi tzala naj. Haxa pax yok naj txitx yetnen ix o nawal yin ix ixnamil ix.

English: He was eating the watermelons and leaving his excrement in them.
Kanjobal: Max slo' eltej yul an sandía naj txitx max ya'on oktoj naj sa' yul an sandía.

English: One day at dawn the woman went to her watermelon patch.
Kanjobal: Max q'inib'i xin max too ix ixnam b'ey awb'il sandía.

English: And since she didn't know what was inside the watermelons, she went to give one to the priest.
Kanjobal: Haxka ix ixnam man yootaj ix tzet yc an sandía max b'et ix ya'on hun an sandía bey naj pale.

English: He took it from her and the woman went home.
Kanjobal: Max xha' naj pale an sandía, meltzu ix ixnam.

English: Later when the priest felt like having some of the watermelon he split it open and saw the rabbit excrement inside.
Kanjobal: Max laawitu' xin, max yochen an sandía naj pale, max pol naj sandía, haxamax yil naj pale sa' naj txitx ey oktoj yul an sandía.

English: He was angry with the woman, and sent for her.
Kanjobal: Max howi naj yin ix ixnam. Max yalon naj pale tet ix ixnam:

English: "Why have you deceived me?" asked the priest.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet xan chin hawetnean? -- xhi naj pale.

English: "What?" asked the woman.
Kanjobal: —- ¿Tzet yuu? -- xhi ix ixnam.

English: He showed her the problem:
Kanjobal: Max tx'oxle:

English: Look what you brought me.
Kanjobal: Ila chin hawute.

English: "There's rabbit excrement in your watermelon," the priest said to the woman.
Kanjobal: -- Sa' txitx ey oktoj yul an hasandía -- xhi naj pale tet ix ixnam.

English: "Oh, my goodness! The rabbit deceived me!" said the woman.
Kanjobal: -- ¡Chikab' sat! chin yetne naj txitx -- xhi ix ixnam.

English: THE RABBIT AND ALL THE ANIMALS
Kanjobal: NAJ TXITX YETOJ MAASANIL WAN NOQ'

English: The rabbit was in the cave where all the animals slept: the snake, the turkey vulture, the buzzard, the deer, the lion, the skunk and the coyote.
Kanjobal: Max ilchab'ey ey hun ch'een bey chi weyi yuu maasanil wan noq'tu': hun laab'atu' yetoj hun xulem, hun mij yetoj hun k'ultajil chee yetoj hun b'alam yetoj hun pay yetoj hun ooj.

English: They began to get together there to discuss how they could kill the rabbit mayor.
Kanjobal: Ha'tu' max ok eb' syamb'aey sb'aaeb' sma'on kam alkal txitxtu' chi yute yaloni.

English: But the rabbit mayor was very clever and was looking for a way to escape.
Kanjobal: Ha' paxoj hun alkal txitxtu' xin tz'ajan b'aa sk'ul, max sey pax tzet max yun yel paxoj.

English: They began to keep watch on him in that house because they intended to kill him, but they were not able to kill him as they had planned.
Kanjobal: Max ok eb' staynen b'ey ey snaatu' tol hoj sma' kam eb' chi yute yaloni. Maa kam pax yuu eb'.

English: They had wanted to smash him to pieces.
Kanjobal: Max yochele ta eb' sk'ok tin eytoj.

English: Make him come out so that he will die right now.
Kanjobal: Tz'il wej eltej cha tol chi kam tinani'.

English: Let's not let him go, that good-for-nothing mayor has deceived us too many times.
Kanjobal: K'amxa chi kohaj eloj, puchk'al chon yetne hun isa alkalti'.

English: Well, now he's surely going to be finished, we're going to finish him off.
Kanjobal: Xal tinani' xin tol kaw chi tani, chi ga' tan kan hunelne.

English: Be on your guard and don't let him get away.
Kanjobal: Tinani' wa'ne wej ok heb'aa chael ta toj heyuu.

English: When he comes out of the cave we're going to smash him to pieces, for there's a lot of us.
Kanjobal: Tinani' xin cha hoj eltej sti' xh'eenti' hoj k'ok ok Vinentoj, ila ck'alon.

English: Pity him, to us he's nothing, but there's a lot of us.
Kanjobal: Nixhtej ye qin kolon ch'an, tzetoj ok qin mimanon tet.

English: I hope now he's going to pay for all the crimes he has committed against us.
Kanjobal: Ha'ti' hoj stoolane eloj tinani', hantaj smul max ya' qin hununon komaasanil.

English: That's why he must to die now.
Kanjobal: Yuuxan tinani' tol chi kam kanoj.

English: You, turkey vulture, go and watch for him to come out, and you deer, go right after him.
Kanjobal: Hawil yeltej cha xulem ta chi eltej, cha k'ultajil chee eyman chach too lemna yin.

English: Since you can run as fast as the mayor, you'll be able to catch up with him.
Kanjobal: Haxka haachti' jelan hab'eyi kaj hun alkaltu' chi tz'ajlo hab'eyi yintaj.

English: Be on guard, all of you.
Kanjobal: Wa'ne wej ok heb'aa.

English: "All right," they said. "Snake, you look to see when he comes out, and we'll pile on top of him. You snake, call him."
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi cb'. Hawil yelol cha laab'a, chi kook wej nilna yin. Awte eltej cha laab'a.

English: "Come on out, hurry," said the townspeople.
Kanjobal: -- Elantej cha. Eyman -- xhi eb' naj konob'ti'.

English: "Wait," said the rabbit, "I'm taking off my sandal."
Kanjobal: -- Echmane wej -- xhi naj txitx -- tol chi wi' eltej hinxanab'.

English: "But hurry," said the snake.
Kanjobal: -- Eyman xin -- xhi naj laab'a.

English: "Wait, I'm coming out, wait for me there, I'm coming out."
Kanjobal: -- Echmane, hoj hinelk'al toj, echmanein titu', hoj hineltoj.

English: "Well, hurry," said the townspeople.
Kanjobal: -- Eyman xin -- xhi eb' naj konob'ti'.

English: "Come on out," the snake said to the rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- Elantej -- xhi naj laab'a tet naj txitxtu'

English: "I'm coming out, wait," said the rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- Oj hineltoj, echmane -- xhi naj txitx.

English: "Well, hurry," said the townspeople.
Kanjobal: -- Eyman xin -- xhi eb' naj konob'.

English: "All right," said the rabbit.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin, xta'wi naj txitx.

English: I'm coming out now. Please catch my sandal, I beg you.
Kanjobal: Ti chin eltoj xin, hachi o' hek'ul cha' wej eltoj hun hinxanab'ti' hinq'ana.

English: The townspeople answered:
Kanjobal: Xta'wi eb' naj konob':

English: “Catch his sandal, throw it over there. That's not your father so that you ought to be carrying his sandal."
Kanjobal: -- Cha' wej eltej hun xanab'tu' cha, q'oj wej toj keytu'. ¿Tumi hemam naj ho hex ek' pacha choj yalan xanab' naj?

English: All right, mayor. Throw out your sandal.
Kanjobal: Ye xin cha alkal, eltej haxanab'tu'.

English: And the turkey vulture caught the sandal. He gave it to the deer and the deer threw it away, as they thought that it was the rabbit's sandal. They were all shouting in the cave.
Kanjobal: Max ya'on eltej naj xulem hun xanab'etu', max ya'on toj b'ey hun k'ultajil chee, haxa hun k'ultajil chee haxa max q'ojontoj. Keytu' tol chi sna' eb' xin tol ha' xhanab'tu' chi hawi' aatoj eb' yul hun ch'centu'.

English: They didn't know it was the mayor they had thrown away.
Kanjobal: Man yootaj eb' ta ha' pax hun alkaltu' max q'oj kantoj eb'tu'.

English: "Come on out," shouted the snake into the cave, "come out right away."
Kanjobal: -- Elantej cha -- xhi pax hun laab'atu' b'ey yul hun ch'eentu' xin -- eyman chaxh eltej cha.

English: When they realized that he wasn't answering them they were sad.
Kanjobal: Haxa max yab'en eb' xin k'am maj chi ta'wi tet eb', max kus aa sk'ul eb' xin.

English: They sent the snake into the cave and the snake shouted:
Kanjobal: Max xhejtoj eb' hun laab'atu' yul hun ch'eentu', haxa max awi eltej hun laab'atu':

English: He's not here, he's not here.
Kanjobal: K'am naj cha, k'am naj.

English: Throw it far away.
Kanjobal: Q'oj eltej naat cha.

English: "He's not here, he's not here. He came out," said the snake.
Kanjobal: -- K'am naj cha, k'am naj. Tejan x'eltoj naj xin -- xhi naj laab'atu'.

English: He's not here. Maybe it was he we threw.
Kanjobal: K'am naj keyti' la, tejan ha' naj xq'oj eltojtu'.

English: "Did you notice if it was his sandal that you threw away?" the lion asked the deer.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet xan ma hawila tatol xhanab' najxa q'oj eltu'? -- xhi naj b'alamtu' tet naj k'ultajil cheetu'.

English: Come on out, snake.
Kanjobal: Elantej cha laab'a.

English: All right.
Kanjobal: Ye xin.

English: The snake came out.
Kanjobal: Max eltej naj laab'a xin.

English: Afterwards they began to kill each other on account of the mayor rabbit.
Kanjobal: Haxak'al ok eb' naj sma'le kam sb'aa sya'iloj naj alkal txitx.

English: He managed to go free, and when he was far away he laughed at them:
Kanjobal: Max too naj xin, k'amxa maj chi seyon ek' naj. Naatxa eytoj naj, chi tzcewitej naj:

English: "Some day you'll pay for the crimes you committed against me, the mayor.
Kanjobal: -- Oj heyaq' toolanc el hemultu' b'a'in e in, hain alkalinti'an.

English: You wanted to kill me, but you weren't able to. Just wait and see what's going to happen to you later on.
Kanjobal: Che yoche chin hema' kamoj, ti maa hinkam heyuu. Yuuxan echmanc heyet b'eel.

English: THE JAGUAR AND THE LITTLE SKUNK
Kanjobal: NO' B'ALAM YETOJ NO' PAY

English: Once there was a gentleman jaguar and a lady skunk.
Kanjobal: Ha' hun icham b'alamtu' yetoj hun ixnam pay.

English: Mrs. Skunk had a son, who was baptized by Mr. Jaguar, so Mrs. Skunk became his comadre.
Kanjobal: Ey hun yune' hun ixnam paytu' xin, max yion el sb'i icham b'alamtu' xin. Ha' x'ok skumale hun ixnam paytu'.

English: And as Mr. Jaguar had baptized the little skunk, he was Mrs. Skunk’s compadre.
Kanjobal: Ha' hun icham b'alamtu' ha' max yion el sb'i hun yalixh paytu', skumpare sb'aa yet hun ixnam paytu' xin.

English: Mr. Jaguar decided to go looking for food and came to Mrs. Skunk’s house.
Kanjobal: Max yalon hun icham b'alamtu' xin tol chi too sey hunoj slo'b'e. Max hul b'ey snaa hun ixnam paytu'.

English: Well, compadre.
Kanjobal: Nanik' kumpare.

English: What are you looking for?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet cha sey ek'ooj?

English: "What have you come here for?" the skunk asked the jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chul hawune? -- xhi hun paytu' tet hun b'alamtu'.

English: "Comadre, what I have come to do is to look for some food," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Kumale, tol ey chi hul wune tol chin toi sey hunoj hinlo'b'e -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu'.

English: "Oh," said Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ah -- xhi hun ixnam paytu' xin

English: "I want my godson to come with me so that he can learn to hunt," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Haxka hinxaan unin tol chi too naj wetoj tol chi Key naj -- xhi naj icham b'alamtu'.

English: "I don’t think your godson ought to go; he's still very small and something could happen to him. He better not go, compadre.” said Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Tejan k'am chi too naj xaan uninaltu', yalixh to naj, ta ey chi yion naj -- xhi hun ixnam paytu' -- K'am chi too naj, kumpare -- xhi hun ixnam paytu'.

English: But the little skunk protested:
Kanjobal: Max ta'wi naj yalixh pay xin:

English: No, mother, I had better go.
Kanjobal: K'amaj, chikay, tol chin toj.

English: "What my godfather says is true. I need to get some practice, if I'm going to learn to hunt," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Yel chi yal naj hinxaan mamtu', tol hink'ey paxoj hinkuy hinb'aa b'eki -- xhi naj paytu'.

English: "But if you go, you’ll be so far away," said Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ta chaxh too xin, haachk'al naat tak'al haach toi -- xhi ix ixnam paytu'.

English: "I'm going, I’m going. Come on, let’s go."
Kanjobal: -- Toj hin, toj hin, toon xin -- Xtoo eb' xin.

English: So they set off on a long walk.
Kanjobal: Max b'eytoj eb' xin, xb'eytoj eb'.

English: We're going to where there’s a river.
Kanjobal: Nanik' xin chon toi yata to b'ey hun ha'.

English: "That's where we’re going," Mr. Jaguar explained to the little skunk, his godson.
Kanjobal: -- Ha' tatu' apnoj -- xhi naj icham b'alamtu' tet hun yalixh paytu', b'ey xhaan uninaltu'.

English: "When are we going to get there?" asked the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Hanik' wal hoj hon apnoj? -- xhi hun yalixh paytu'.

English: "We're getting close, follow me so you don’t get lost," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Kawilxa xin, tz'ajan haxhk'al haxh k'ey ta kantoj -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu'.

English: "Allright," answered the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi hun yalixh paytu', xtoo eb'.

English: They finally came to the river.
Kanjobal: Xlaawi xin, x'apni cb' b'ey hun ha'tu'.

English: “This is where we’re going to eat," said Mr. Jaguar to the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Haton titi' xin la ha'ti' hoj hon low titi' -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu' tet hun yalixh paytu'.

English: "All right," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi hun yalixh paytu'. Max xlaawi xin.

English: "Come on over here, I’m going to sharpen my knife," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Ha'ti' hoj kooktoj, chi wi' aatej ye hinnawax -- xhi pax hun icham b'alamtu'.

English: "All right," said the little skunk, looking at his godfather.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi hun yalixh paytu', t'anan ok yin hun xhaan mamtu' xin.

English: Mr. Jaguar sharpened his claws, which he called his knife.
Kanjobal: Max yion aatej ye snawax, ha' pax yisk aj hun icham b'alamtu'. Ha' max chi yal snawax xin, max yaatej ye hun nawaxtu'.

English: "I sharpened my knife, and now, be on guard, because I am going to sleep," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Xyaatej ch'en nawaxti', tinani' xin hoj hach hatayne tol chin weyi -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu'.

English: "When you see them come, wake me up," said Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Hach hoj hawil sul eb', weyoj hin, hatenele weyan hanik' hul eb' -- xhi hun icham b'alamtu'.

English: "All right," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi hun yalixh paytu'.

English: All right, godfather.
Kanjobal: Ye xin xaan mam.

English: Then Mr. Jaguar said:
Kanjobal: Max laawi xin, max yalon hun icham b'alamtu':

English: "Don’t shout. Just scratch my belly when they come. Scratch my belly, so I won’t alarm them," said Mr. Jaguar to the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Manchaj el hawaw, tuk'al chapultoj hink'ulti' yetoj ul eb'tu'. Hain k'ulti' chapultoj, ta k'amaj, hoj xiw paxtoj eb' -- xhi pax hun icham b'alamtu' tet hun yalixh paytu'.

English: Don’t wake me up if just any little old animals without horns come, only when the one with big horns comes. That’s when you'll wake me up.
Kanjobal: Manchaj haten el hinweyan yet chi hul wan komon k'am yuk'a, asan hun kaw miman yuk'a ta ha' hoj uloj, kat hatenon el hinweyan xin.

English: "All right," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi hun yalixh pay.

English: Then the one with the big horns came and he awakened Mr. Jaguar.
Kanjobal: Max apni hun miman yuk'a xin, max ten el sweyan naj icham b'alam.

English: He scratched his belly, and pointed out the deer to Mr. Jaguar, who attacked the animal with big hos.
Kanjobal: Max pul-letoj sk'ul naj icham b'alam, max x'oxon ok naj yuu sq'ab' xin. Max too naj icham yin hun miman yuk'a xin, xb'ct naj syachontej.

English: He went after him and seized him.
Kanjobal: Max laawi xin, max michai.

English: All right, my godson, let’s eat.
Kanjobal: Tinani' xin cha xaan, lowoj hon.

English: "We’re going to eat meat," said the jaguar
Kanjobal: -- Chi kochi' kochib'e -- xhi naj b'alam.

English: "All right," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj yalixh pay.

English: And so they ate and ate.
Kanjobal: Max xlow eb' naj xin, xlow eb' naj.

English: "Now we’re going to take whatever leftovers there are to your mother. Since we are full, we can take something to your mother. Your mother will have meat to eat, just as we did We will take some to your mother," said the jaguar.
Kanjobal: -- Tinani' xin hoj qi' hantaj wan ek'b'anti'. Ta chi noo kok ul hoj kotoj qitoj yet ix hatxutx. Chi xhi' pax ix xhib'c kaj chi yun kochi'on getti', chi qi'toj tet ix hatxutx -- xhi naj b'alam Max tit eb' xin.

English: And so they left and came to the mother’s house.
Kanjobal: Xlaawi, max hul cb' b'ey ix pay xin max hul eb' xin.

English: They told the lady.
Kanjobal: Max a'le tet ix ixnam.

English: Look at the food here.
Kanjobal: Nani' xin, t'ey halo'b'e la.

English: Look, we've brought you some food, the food that we hunted.
Kanjobal: Ila chi walan max hul helo'b'e komitxon on.

English: "Eat your fill of the meat comadre," the Jaguar said to Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Chi' hachib'c kumale -- xhi icham b'alam tet ix ixnam pay.

English: "All right," said the skunk, and ate the meat.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhiix pay, max low ix. Max xhi'on xhib'c ix. Xlaawi xin.

English: "I’m full," she said.
Kanjobal: -- Max noo hink'ul -- xhi ix.

English: "It's good that you're satisfied, I’ve seen that you are, so I'll be leaving now," said Mr. Jaguar to Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin ta xnoo hak 'ul -- xhi naj icham b'alam -- Hin toj paxoj, xa xwil, hunelxa hintooti' -- xhi naj b'alam tet ix ixnam pay -- Oj hintoj -- xhi naj b'alam.

English: And so he left.
Kanjobal: Xtoo naj xin.

English: After the jaguar left the little skunk stayed with his mother.
Kanjobal: Max too naj b'alam xin, max kan naj yalixh pay yetoj xutxtu'.

English: When their meat was all gone, Mrs. Skunk said to her son:
Kanjobal: Yet max laawi el xhib'e ix paytu', max yalon ix paytu' tet naj yuné'tu':

English: Son, our meat is all gone.
Kanjobal: Cha wune', max laawi kochib'eti'.

English: "Yes, the meat is all gone." he said.
Kanjobal: -- Ah, xlaawi chib'etu' -- xhi naj.

English: "I better go and get us some more food," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Hainxa chin too wi' hunojxa kochib'etwan hainti'an chikay -- xhi naj yalixh paytu'.

English: How can you, son? Do you think you’re big enough?
Kanjobal: Le'tiach, cha wune ¿tumi puchach hun xin?

English: You're very small.
Kanjobal: Yalixh ch'anach.

English: "Don’t you think you’ll be killed?" asked Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tumi manoj hach kam yuu eb'? -- xhi ix ixnam paytu'.

English: "No, mother, I already know how to hunt, my godfather taught me how," replied the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- K'amaj chikay, wootaj xaan, x'ox naj hinxaan mam wilan -- xhi naj yalixh paytu'.

English: I'm going to go.
Kanjobal: Toj hinan.

English: He went and Mrs. Skunk was very worried.
Kanjobal: Xtoo naj xin, chi tak sk'ul ix ixnam pay.

English: He came once more to the river, the place to which he had come with his godfather to get the meat.
Kanjobal: Xtoo naj, yapni naj b'ey ha' ha'tu' xin, b'ey tab'etyi' xhib'etu' yetoj xhaan mamtu'. Ha'tu' apni hunel xa.

English: This is how my godfather did it.
Kanjobal: Key tati' yute naj hinxaan mamtu'an.

English: "Why shouldn’t I be able to do the same thing?" said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet man sge' wuuan? -- xhi naj yalixh pay.

English: "This is how you sharpen a knife," said the little skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Keyti' chi yun yaatej ye ch'en nawaxti' -- xhi naj yalixhtu'.

English: He sharpened his knife.
Kanjobal: Yion aatej naj ye snawax.

English: This is the way my godfather did it.
Kanjobal: Ha' tinani' haxka yute naj hinxaan maman.

English: I’m not going to hunt the little animals, I’m just going to hunt the one with the great big hors. I’m going to hunt one for myself just like the one I ate with my godfather.
Kanjobal: Mantu' ha'oj hinmitx wan koqtu'an, hawal hunoj kaw miman yuk'atu' chin mitxan. Haxka hun hinchi' yctoj naj hinxaan maman, keytu' hunoj wet mitxan.

English: I have my knife here and I’m going to sleep for a little while.
Kanjobal: Ti ey hinnawaxan, weyoj hinhunoj txolan. Max ey naj wey xin.

English: The little skunk lay down to sleep, but then he awakened.
Kanjobal: Xlaawi xin, max el swevan naj valixh paytu'. Max smajon naj xin, max apni xin hun miman yuk at'.

English: He was waiting for the one with the big horns, and when he came he attacked him, thinking he was as strong as his godfather. But he just hung from the neck of the one with big horns. His claws were dug into his skin.
Kanjobal: Max likwo naj yin xin, chim sna' naj keytu' vip naj kaj yip naj xaan mamtu'. Max too ok lokan naj yin snuq' hun miman yuk'a tu' xin. Tuk'al max kan Vunan yisk'a naj yin s'umal hun miman yuk'a tu'.

English: He was hanging from his neck and was carried far away and fell on his back. He was left with his mouth wide open.
Kanjobal: Max too naj xin Cunan ok naj yin snuq' hun miman yuk'a. Naat max too naj max el kan t'cbna naj pakan yekan aa naj. Nisan kan eltej ye naj.

English: Since he had not come home to his mother, she wondered:
Kanjobal: K'amk'al chi hul naj b'ey xutx tu', max yalon ix txutxe pay:

English: What could have happened to my son?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chi yun naj wune'?

English: Why hasn’t he come back yet?
Kanjobal: ¿K'amk'al chi hul naj?

English: Something must have happened to him.
Kanjobal: B'ey ta tzet yion naj.

English: I better go and look for him.
Kanjobal: Tejanoj hintoj wil najan.

English: And so Mrs. Skunk went as far as the bank of the river.
Kanjobal: Max too ix ixnam pay xin, max apni ix b'ey sti' hun ha'tu' xin.

English: She was looking everywhere for her son, but couldn’t him.
Kanjobal: Max seyon yil ix b'ey ey yune'tu', k'am chi chax yune' ix yuu xin.

English: She began to cry when she found the tracks where the one with the big horns had come by running.
Kanjobal: Lalanxa yo' ix, max chax sb'ob'en b'ey max ek'toj hininoj hun miman yuk atu'.

English: "They must have come by here," said Mrs. Skunk.
Kanjobal: -- Ha'ti' max ek'toj cb' keyti' la -- xhi ix ixnam paytu'.

English: She began to follow tracks.
Kanjobal: Max took'al tz'ajan ix yintaj sb'ob'en eb'tu'.

English: She came to the place where her son had been left lying on his back.
Kanjobal: Max apni ix bey ey kan eyoj hun yune'tu' pakan kanoj.

English: When the mother caught sight of him she noticed that his tecth were showing and shouted to him.
Kanjobal: Max yilontoj ix xin, max yil ix xin tol txekel eltej ye, max awitoj ix tet.

English: "Son," she said.
Kanjobal: -- Cha wune' -- xhi ix tet.

English: What are you laughing at?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet chatzee?

English: "All your teeth are showing," she said to him before she had gotten very close to him.
Kanjobal: Tuk al nisan eltej hawe -- xhi ix yet k'am to chi apni ix kaw sk'atan.

English: When she did get close she told him:
Kanjobal: Haxa max apni sk'atan xin:

English: "Give me your hand. I've come to get you, but you're just laughing in my face."
Kanjobal: -- Ptej haq'ab' tol ha' haach chahul wi', tuk'al chatzee yin hinsat.

English: She put her hand on him, thinking that he was still alive, but when then she noticed that he was already dead, and so she cried.
Kanjobal: Max ya'on ey sq'ab' ix yin xin. Chi sna' ix tol ikis. Haxa max ya'on ey skab' ix. Xyilontej ix xin, xyilontej ix tol kamnajxa naj yalixh. Max o' aa ix xin.

English: THE CRAB AND THE TOAD
Kanjobal: NO' CHAP YETOJ NO' PEJEY

English: "Where are you going to sell those boards, uncle crab?" the toad asked.
Kanjobal: -- ¿B'ey chaxh too ok hatxon te' chem te', cha wuxhtaj chap? -- xhi naj pejey.

English: I'm going to sell them in town, in a city with a big mouth.
Kanjobal: Tol chin too hintxon b'ey hun konob'an, hun konob' kaw miman sti'.

English: Do you know where that city with the big mouth is?
Kanjobal: ¿Hawootaj mi b'ey chi kan hun konob' miman sti'tu'?

English: No, I don't know. Could it be me you are referring to?
Kanjobal: Aa, man wootajan. ¿Man mi ha' hincha walin paxan xin?

English: Why do you say I am referring to you?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuuxan ha' chach wal paxan?

English: Because you're asking me where I'm going to sell my boards.
Kanjobal: Tol yuu chaq'anle e inan xin b'ey chi too ok hintxon te' hinchem te'ti'an.

English: Well, it's in a city with a very large mouth, uncle toad.
Kanjobal: Haton b'ey hun konob' miman sti'tu' xin cha wuxhtaj pejey.

English: "Why does that city have a large mouth?" asked the toad.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet yuuxan miman sti' hun konob'tu'? -- xhi naj pejeytu'.

English: That city has a large mouth, so my boards will fit right in its mouth.
Kanjobal: Man tzetoj yuuxan miman sti' hun konob'tu', tol k'uxan chi laawi kan eytoj wan hinchem te'ti' yul sti'an.

English: Oh! You're telling me that because I have a large mouth, uncle.
Kanjobal: ¡Aja! Hain chawal e inan xin hainti' miman hinti'an cha wuxhtaj.

English: I beg your pardon.
Kanjobal: Hawa' miman kulal.

English: You beat me because I thought you weren't going to be able to defend yourself.
Kanjobal: Max hiney k'cy hawuuan, tol tam an hasqe' aa pajtzen hab'aa.

English: Well, I do have a large mouth and I was just talking to you about wooden boards.
Kanjobal: Tinani' xin hain miman hinti'an i haachti' xin, man tzetoj yuuxan chi wal chem te'an.

English: Do you actually sell boards with all those extremities you have?
Kanjobal: ¿Tumi ey chem te' chatxon xin, ha' yuu wan haq'ab' tuxak'al wejan oktu'?

English: So now I say let's forgive each other.
Kanjobal: Yuuxan chi walan, tinani' xin chi qa' miman k'ulal.

English: You forgive me and I'll forgive you.
Kanjobal: Chawa' miman k'ulal, chi wa' pax miman k'ulalan.

English: You've won.
Kanjobal: Max hiney k'ey hawuuan.

English: I wasn't really saying that you were carrying boards; I was just telling you that on account of the limbs on your forehead, that's why I was talking about boards.
Kanjobal: Tuk'al chi walan k'am chem te' chawij ck'oj, asan tol ha' yuu haq'ab' wejan ok yin hapalantu', yuuxan chi wal chem te'alan.

English: So now let's stop talking about this.
Kanjobal: Tinani' xin kob'cj qalon kan hun g'ancti'.

English: "Never more will we say we are friends," said the toad jesting. "No, you know we are still friends."
Kanjobal: K'amxa b'a'in chi gala tol quxhtaj kob'aa -- xhi naj pejeytu', tatol hawootaj xin tol ha'tu' hinan.

English: Why did you say I am was a wood merchant?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet yuuxan chawal tol txonomin chem te'an xin?

English: I was just joking with you.
Kanjobal: Tuk'al chin maxli e achan.

English: Don't worry, now we'll be brothers, and we'll live in I peace.
Kanjobal: Manchaj tak el hak'ul, tinani' quxhtaj kob'aa, chi ga' kan miman k'ulal.

English: PEDRO RIMARES AND THE MERCHANT
Kanjobal: PEDRO RIMARES YETOJ NAJ TXONWOM

English: Pedro Rimares was sitting in the shade of a trec when a merchant came by.
Kanjobal: Ha' naj Pedro Rimarestu' chotan ey naj yich hun te' te' yapni naj txonwom.

English: "What are you doing?" asked the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chawun cha Pedro? -- xhi naj txonwom.

English: "I’m taking care of my tree here."
Kanjobal: -- Ha' hun hinte'ti'an chin taynean.

English: "Why?" asked the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet yuu? -- xhi naj txonwom.

English: "Stay here with me and you’ll see," Pedro told the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Okan tukanoj wetojan hawiloni -- xhi naj Pedro tet naj txonwom.

English: He sat down near Pedro.
Kanjobal: Max ey chotan naj sk'atan naj Pedro.

English: The merchant noticed that some coins fell down from the tree.
Kanjobal: Max tit kotlab'oj ch'en tumin, xyilon naj txonwom xin.

English: "Sell me your tree," said the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Txon eloj hun hate'ti' e inan -- xhi naj txonwom.

English: "I don’t want to sell it," said Pedro Rimares, "because this tree is my sustenance," said Pedro.
Kanjobal: -- K'am chi wa'an -- xhi naj Pedro Rimares -- tol ha' hun hinte'ti' ha' chin lotzeni -- xhi naj Pedro.

English: “If you sell it to me," said the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Txono -- xhi naj txonwom.

English: "I’ll give you all my merchandise as the price of the tree," said the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Chi wa' kan wijatzti' maasanil e ach stooloj hun hate'ti' -- xhi naj txonwom.

English: "All right," said Pedro, "wait for the money to fall down from the tree."
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj Pedro -- Ha maj yeoloj hatumin, hoj ycol kotlab'oj yich te'.

English: "All right," said the merchant, and sat down to wait. He waited along time but there was no money.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj txonwom, x'ey chotan naj smaja. Xyechmane naj satk'al k'am ch'en tumin.

English: Why did Pedro deceive me?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan chin yetne naj Pedro?

English: "I'm going to go up into the branches of the tree," said the merchant.
Kanjobal: -- Toj hinaa hintoj sq'ab' te' -- xhi naj tkonwom.

English: He climbed up into the tree and realized that what he had believed was not true.
Kanjobal: Max aatoj naj xin sq'ab' te' max yilon naj xin tol yel chi sna' naj man yeloj paxoj.

English: When he shook the branches of the tree he saw that there wasn’t any money.
Kanjobal: Sikotene naj sq'ab' te'tu' Xyilontej naj k'am ch'en tumin.

English: The tree had no fruit, there was just a beehive there on the tree to which Pedro Rimares had stuck a few coins.
Kanjobal: K'am sat tc' te' ha' no' ixkab' la kan okoj sq' ab' te' te'; ha'tu' la kan ok ch'en tumin yuu naj Pedro Rimares.

English: The merchant cried and came down from the tree.
Kanjobal: Max o' aa naj txonwom xeylej naj yich te' te'.

English: He was sad.
Kanjobal: Max kus aa naj.

English: PEDRO AND THE PRIEST
Kanjobal: NAJ PEDRO YETOJ NAJ PALE

English: Pedro was selling the clothes he got. He was laughing because he had deceived the merchant. Pedro left town and set off down the road.
Kanjobal: Naj Pedro xin lalanxa xonwi naj yetoj sq'ap naj anima maxsa'atoj tet naj Pedro. Naj Pedro chi seye naj max yetne naj txonwomnaj. Max el naj Pedro b'cy hun konob' xin max too naj yul hun b'e.

English: When he came to a plain he sat down to rest.
Kanjobal: Max apni naj b'ey hun ak'al max ey chotan naj Pedro, xew naj.

English: Pedro felt like defecating.
Kanjobal: Xyab'tej sa' naj Pedro.

English: Pedro defecated on the ground, and put his hat on top of the excrement, scoundrel that he was, because he saw a priest coming on horseback.
Kanjobal: Max tza'i naj b'ey hun panan xyaksq'oxq'om naj yib'an sa'tu' tol naj Pedro xin tx'itaj naj. Max hulnaj pale sk'atan naj yetoj yijomal.

English: "What are you doing?" asked the priest.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet chawun Pedro? -- xhi naj pale.

English: "I’m taking care of a canary,” he told the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Tol ey hun no' canario chin tayne -- xhi naj tet naj pale.

English: "What kind of canary? asked the priest.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet yeno' canario? -- xhi naj pale.

English: Pedro told him it was made of pure gold.
Kanjobal: Xta'wi naj Pedro tol kaworo no.

English: "What?" the priest asked Pedro.
Kanjobal: —- ¿Tzet? -- xhi naj pale tet naj Pedro.

English: "Take care of the canary and I'll ride your horse," Pedro said to the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Tayne no' canario okoj hin yib'an hawijomal -- xhi naj Pedrotet naj pale.

English: "All right," said the priest, and Pedro mounted the horse.
Kanjobal: -- Ye xin -- xhi naj pale. Max ok naj Pedro yib'an no' chee.

English: "Father, I don’t think he wants to go, because he’s used to you," Pedro said to the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Pale, k'am chi too no' walan tol q'eynaj no' hawetoj -- xhinaj Pedro tet naj pale.

English: Give me your cassock to put on, so that the horse will go.
Kanjobal: A'tej hasotana wa' okoj yuuxanoj toj no'cheeti' walan.

English: "All right," said the priest and gave him the cossack.
Kanjobal: -- Ye -- xhi naj pale, xya' an sotana.

English: Pedro put on the cossack and got back on the horse. He rode for a while and then came back.
Kanjobal: Ya' ok naj Pedro sotanamax ok yib'an chee. Max too xin hanik' ch'an max toi max meltzupaxoj.

English: "The missal is lacking," said Pedro.
Kanjobal: Max yalon Pedro xin: -- Tol k'am an huun yet misa.

English: "I'll take the missal so my horse will go farther," Pedro said to the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Wi'toj an huun yetmisa yuuxanoj toj hinchce naat walan -- xhi Pedro tet naj pale.

English: He took the book and got back on the horse.
Kanjobal: Maxtoo an huun xin, max ok naj yib'an no' chee.

English: "All right, now I’m going to ride far away and I'll be back later. I'm going far. Take good care of our bird," Pedro told the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Ti wal chin too paxhal naat, b'cel toj hinhuloj, naat hintojck'oj. Kaw chawila kotz'ikin -- xhi Pedro tet naj pale.

English: The priest was left taking care of the bird under Pedro’s hat.
Kanjobal: Max kan najpale stayne no' tz'ikin yetoj sq'oxq'om naj Pedro.

English: "Don’t let go of it because it is very pretty and it is made of gold," Pedro said to the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Ha' haj ta eltej no' tol sa'al ch'an yok no', oro il-li no' -- xhi Pedro b'ey naj pale.

English: Pedro rode off on the horse.
Kanjobal: Xtoo Pedro xin max yok yib'an chee.

English: The priest was left sitting and taking care of the bird.
Kanjobal: Xkan chotan pale stayneno' tz'ikin.

English: He sat there a long time, the priest waited a long time.
Kanjobal: Xkani, xkani, xkani sat max kani pale xin.

English: But he got tired of watching Pedro Rimares’ hat.
Kanjobal: Xtib'i elstayneni sq'oxq'om naj Pedro Rimares.

English: "What’s happened to Pedro? He hasn’t come. Could something have happened to him?" asked the priest.
Kanjobal: -- ¿Tzet ye naj Pedro? K'am chi hul najtu'. vB'i tx'oj taj ey chiyi'on naj Pedrotu'? -- xhi naj pale.

English: He's not here, he’s not, he’s not.
Kanjobal: K'am naj, i k'am naj, i k'am naj.

English: "I had better take out this bird." said the priest.
Kanjobal: -- Tejan chi wi' eltej no'tz'ikinti' -- xhi naj pale.

English: Because Pedro said it was golden.
Kanjobal: Ab' oro no' yal naj Pedrotu'.

English: He put his hand under Pedro’s hat in order to get out the bird.
Kanjobal: Max yaonoktoj sq'ab' naj yalan an sq'oxq'om naj Pedro xmitxon cltej no'tz'ikin naj.

English: He thought that it was a real bird, but it wasn’t a bird at all.
Kanjobal: Chi sna' tol yel tz'ikin no' chi sna' naj, man paxtz'ikinoj no'.

English: When the priest put his hand under the hat he stuck it into the excrement.
Kanjobal: Xyoan oktoj sq'ab' naj palctu' yalan anq'oxq'ometu', max xyaton to naj xin tza'e.

English: He was startled because he had Pedro’s excrement on his hand, the excrement that had been left under the hat.
Kanjobal: Max xiwa a naj palechi ok sa' naj Pedro yin sq'ab' naj pale tol tza'c ey kan oktoj yalanhun q'oxq'ometu'.

English: Pedro said that it was a golden bird, but he lied.
Kanjobal: Ha' chi yal naj Pedro tz'ikinal tol oro yal naj Pedro i tuk'al chi yal pax naj.

English: Pedro had deceived the priest.
Kanjobal: X'etax naj pale yuu naj Pedro.

English: As Pedro rode on to the next town, the priest stayed there on the plain.
Kanjobal: Naj Pedro x'apni naj yetoj no' chee yul hun konob', xal najpale xkan naj b'ey sat ak'al.

English: He was crying because he no longer had his horse, he no longer had his cassock, he no longer had his missal, and he no longer had his shoes.
Kanjobal: Chi o' naj pale k'amxa xhee naj, k'amxa sotana naj, k'amxa yuun yet misa, k'amxa xhanab' naj.

English: When Pedro came to town he immediately celebrated Mass.
Kanjobal: Ha' naj Pedro xin b'ey max yapni yul hun konob' eyman maxya' misa naj.

English: The people were happy with him.
Kanjobal: Max tzala eb' naj konob' yetoj naj.

English: When the townspeople came he prayed with them.
Kanjobal: Max txaali najx'apni naj eb' naj konob' xin.

English: But they thought it was strange that he didn’t look like the regular priest.
Kanjobal: Max k'ey aa sk'ul eb' naj kichan walmanaj naj pale.

English: It was three o’clock in the afternoon when he celebrated mass.
Kanjobal: Max ya'on naj mísa yet oxcb' ora yet yey k'ualil.

English: "So now," said Pedro, "all of the girls are going to meet in the convent at four o’clock this afternoon, but only the girls over eighteen who still don’t have a husband."
Kanjobal: -- Tinani' xin -- xhi naj Pedro -- yet kaneb' ora yet yey k'ualil, maasanil cb' ix q'opo chi syamb'asb'aaceb' ix b'cy convento, asaneb' ix q'opo cb' ix waxaj laoneb' aab'il k'am to yichamil.

English: Only they are going to study in the convent.
Kanjobal: Asaneb' toj kuywoj b'ey convento.

English: The girls arrived at the convent at four o’clock in the afternoon.
Kanjobal: Max apni cb' ix q'opo b'ey convento yet kaneb' ora yet yeyk'ualil.

English: As they arrived the priest began to kiss them one by one.
Kanjobal: Yet chi apni hunun eb' ix chi s'ub'le sti' eb' ix yuu naj pale.

English: What's the matter with this priest?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet ye naj paleti'?

English: "He's bad, maybe he’s not the priest at all," they said.
Kanjobal: —- Peena naj, tejan manaj paleti' -- xhi eb' ix.

English: Why is he kissing us?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzet xan chi s'ub' koti' naj?

English: The priest isn’t like that.
Kanjobal: Man keyojtu' naj pale.

English: It’s not right for him to kiss us.
Kanjobal: Peena najchi s'ub' koti' naj.

English: The priest said to the girls:
Kanjobal: Max yalon naj pale tet eb' ix q'opo:

English: Now, I’m telling you that cach night one of you is going to come and sleep with me.
Kanjobal: Tinani' xin chi wal q'ane e ex, hoj hex wey hunun a'b'alwetoj hununex.

English: Then at four o’clock all the girls went home and told their mothers:
Kanjobal: Xlaawi, yet kancb' ora yet yey k'ualil xmeltzu cb' ix q'opohunun eb' ix b'ey snaa, Max yal eb' ix tet xutx:

English: "Mother, the priest,", they said.
Kanjobal: -- Ha' naj pale chikay -- xhi eb' ix.

English: What’s the matter with the priest?
Kanjobal: ¿Tzimi yc naj pale?

English: "He was kissing us and told us that each night one of us would go and sleep with him," one of the girls said to her mother.
Kanjobal: -- Chis'ub'koti' naj on katu' hunun a'b'al hoj hex wey wetoj hununex -- xhi ixq'opo b'ey xutx.

English: "Oh," said the mother getting angry.
Kanjobal: -- Aja -- xhi ix txutxe, xowi ix txutxe.

English: "It’s not the priest, maybe it’s Rimares. Your father said he didn’t recognize this priest.
Kanjobal: Man paleoj naj, tejan ha'naj Rimares -- xhi ix txutxc -- tol xhi naj hamam k'am chi na'cha najpaleti'.

English: He's of a different sort, your father said.
Kanjobal: Tx oj naj, xhi naj hamam ta'a.

English: They went looking for the priest in the convent at six o'clock in the evening, but he was no longer there.
Kanjobal: Max too yil-le naj pale b'eyconvento yet wajeb' ora yet sq ejbin tajilxa, k'amxa naj ek'oj.

English: He had ridden off on his horse.
Kanjobal: Xtoonaj yib'an xhee.

English: The priest had left a note in his bedroom:
Kanjobal: Max ya' kan hun an huun b'ey chi wey naj pale:

English: "Now I say to you," he said in the note.
Kanjobal: -- Tinani' chi wal kanoj -- xhi naj yin an huun.

English: I am Pedro Rimares, who passed through this town.
Kanjobal: Hayla Pedro Rimares max hinek'i b'ey hun konob'ti'.

English: I will never return even once.
Kanjobal: K'amxa b'a'in chin hulhunelxa.

English: I am Pedro Rimares.
Kanjobal: Hayla Pedro Rimares.
